  90. Chapter 923: Dreams Eventually End
  91. Chapter 924: The True Dao of the Grand Dao Sect
  92. Chapter 925: The One-Heart and the Shattered Bone Face
  93. Chapter 926: The Strange Object that Intimidated the Heavenly Sovereign
  94. Chapter 927: Twists and Turns
  95. Chapter 928: Little Heavenly Doctor Li Fan
  96. Chapter 929: Xuantian’s Lost Immortal Techniques
  97. Chapter 930: Holy Blood Reforms the Embryo
  98. Chapter 931: Battle Needs No Words
  99. Chapter 932: The Residual Will of Immortal Ancestor
  100. Chapter 933: The Fall of the Chosen Immortal

"First, we need to figure out what that arrow was."

Not long after, having made up his mind, Li Fan, through his clone Ji Shaoli’s investigation, spent a great fortune to uncover the answer. For original chapters go to novel⦿fire.net

"The Sky-Patrolling Arrow. One of the latest advancements developed by the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance to counter the large-scale assault from the Five Elders Association."

"Its speed is unimaginable. In just a single day, it can complete a full patrol around the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance's territory. It automatically locks onto suspicious targets, descending from the heavens to deliver a devastating strike."

"Anyone below Dao Integration can be instantly killed. Even Dao Integration cultivators, if caught off guard, will suffer serious injuries on the spot."

Li Fan carefully read through the information on the Sky-Patrolling Arrow, his expression solemn.

"The most crucial part is that these things can be mass-produced. According to estimates, at least five Sky-Patrolling Arrows are currently patrolling the Immortal Alliance's airspace at all times."

"In times of war, they could likely launch dozens of them simultaneously, creating absolute aerial dominance."

Li Fan couldn't help but furrow his brows.

Moreover, as a weapon of war, the Sky-Patrolling Arrow came with an immunity clause.

In other words, if one had the misfortune of being in its flight path and got impaled—dying as a result…

No one would be held accountable for the death.

A death in vain.

"From this perspective, it seems that Ou Daozi and his son had nothing to do with the Sky-Patrolling Arrow."

"They simply predicted its trajectory and tried to use it as a tool to kill me while making their escape."

Li Fan nodded to himself.

After understanding the general situation, he began executing his own plan.

Little did Ou Daozi and his son expect that Li Fan’s retaliation would come so swiftly.

And with absolutely no mercy!

In just three days, a certain video spread across nearly the entire Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

The shocking content of the video left countless cultivators within the alliance utterly stunned. At the same time, it stirred up both murderous intent and greed within them.

That’s right—Li Fan completely abandoned the idea of personally hunting down Ou Daozi and his son.

Instead, he publicly revealed that they possessed divine treasures and mystical abilities!

By common logic, human nature is greedy and selfish.

Upon learning that someone possesses a supreme treasure, most people would go to great lengths to claim it for themselves.

They would scheme in secret, keeping the information as contained as possible.

Even if they lacked the ability to claim the treasure alone, they would seek allies—or perhaps simply sell the secret for a high price.

In any case, such a matter should only be known within a small circle.

But Li Fan? He completely defied conventional wisdom.

Without a hint of hesitation or greed, he spread the information far and wide within mere days!

From an outsider's perspective, Li Fan’s actions seemed downright foolish and self-defeating.

After all, cultivators are countless in number. Even if Ou Daozi and his son were eventually stripped of their secrets, Li Fan would likely gain nothing from it.

He had given up a golden opportunity to profit—all just to vent his anger.

A reckless move, bordering on madness.

However, in truth, if not for [Truth], Li Fan would never have done such a thing.

But with [Truth] in his possession, he was in no hurry.

Whatever he wanted—he would obtain in due time.

"The boy is indeed troublesome. Let the cultivators of the Immortal Alliance pave the way for me, see if there are any good strategies to capture him."

"In the next life, I will simply imitate him." Li Fan's eyes flickered.

And Li Fan's plan was undeniably effective.

Foreseeing the future, the Art of Time Reversal!

Anyone who had witnessed the abilities displayed by Ou Daozi and his son in the images couldn't help but feel an overwhelming desire to claim such powers for themselves!

For a time, a frenzy erupted across the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance as cultivators scrambled to search for Ou Daozi.

Several influential families even offered enormous rewards—anyone who could provide information on the whereabouts of Ou Daozi and his son would be handsomely rewarded with top-tier Dao Integration cultivation techniques.

"No matter how well you run, no matter how vast the world is, there will be no place left for you to hide."

Li Fan, the mastermind behind all of this, watched the increasingly frenzied cultivators. He recalled the mocking expression on Ou Daozi’s son's face and coldly scoffed in his heart.

When nearly the entire Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance united in pursuit of the same goal, the efficiency was terrifying beyond measure.

The events of the 115th cycle—exploring the White Mist and the small cave-world—had already proven this point.

Less than five days after the release of the images, Ou Daozi and his son, who had been hiding deep within a forest, were found.

Although they managed to escape using strange and unpredictable techniques, it was only a matter of time before they were caught.

Now that they had been exposed, under the relentless pursuit and surveillance of the Immortal Alliance cultivators, their capture was inevitable.

What surprised Li Fan, however, was that the father and son managed to hold out much longer than expected.

And in the process, their abilities and secrets gradually came to light.

Ou Daozi's son was named Ou Shangtian.

The abilities of foreseeing the future and reversing the time belonged solely to Ou Shangtian himself.

Currently, it was speculated that these powers originated from some kind of innate mystical artifact bound to him.

However, the ability to foresee the future was different from the initial assumptions.

Ou Shangtian could not predict every detail of the future at will—his foresight was only triggered when his life was under imminent threat.

In simple terms, he could foresee countless ways in which he could die, allowing him to navigate danger and find a path to survival.

As for the power to reverse the time, it aligned with Li Fan’s original speculations—it was not true time manipulation. Instead, it allowed Ou Shangtian to rewind an object's state or energy to a prior moment in time, within certain limits.

Moreover, during this process, he could establish a mysterious connection between himself and the affected object.

For instance, Ou Shangtian had once reversed dozens of attacks aimed at him and even absorbed the power of one particular technique, using it to annihilate an entire squad of cultivators before vanishing without a trace.

However, the power to reverse the time was not limitless. Each time Ou Shangtian used it, he needed a period of rest before he could use it again.

Once the truth became clear, many cultivators were deeply disappointed and abandoned the pursuit.

Indeed, while these abilities were formidable, they fell short of the legendary power to truly reverse time itself.

Still, a significant number of cultivators persisted.

After all, cultivators with such rare talents were usually absorbed by major factions and granted immense prestige. Now, with the opportunity to strike down a fallen genius, how could they let it slip away?

With a clear understanding of Ou Shangtian’s abilities, the cultivators coordinated their strategies during the chase.

Instead of going for the kill, they aimed for a live capture, rendering his foresight ability largely ineffective.

They refrained from attacking all at once, opting instead for continuous, wave-like assaults, wearing down his power to reverse the time.

As time passed, Ou Shangtian found it increasingly difficult to escape.

Finally, on the tenth day after the images were released, the father and son were cornered, with nowhere left to run.

At the moment of crisis, Ou Shangtian erupted once again.

A dazzling yellow light enveloped an area spanning tens of thousands of meters.

All the cultivators caught in the explosion found themselves reverted to the moment before they had surrounded Ou Shangtian.

By the time they realized what had happened, Ou Shangtian and his son had already vanished without a trace.

Enraged, they continued their pursuit, only to discover that only Ou Shangtian remained on the run.

He put up a desperate resistance for half a day before a fortunate cultivator named Xie Xiantao finally captured him.

Faced with the covetous stares of other cultivators, Xie Xiantao made a swift and wise decision—handing Ou Shangtian over to the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance in exchange for a bounty.

In truth, during his escape, Ou Shangtian had slain no fewer than a hundred cultivators of the Immortal Alliance.

Though it had been an act of forced self-defense, it still violated the laws of the Immortal Alliance.

While the officials had previously remained uninvolved, it did not mean they had not been paying attention.

Sure enough, the moment Xie Xiantao publicly declared his decision, a squad of black-robed cultivators arrived on the scene within moments.

They swiftly took him, along with the critically wounded Ou Shangtian, away.

Thus, the grand manhunt that had shaken the entire realm had finally come to an end.

Yet, the other key figure in this incident, Ou Shangtian’s father, Ou Daozi, had seemingly been forgotten by all—except for Li Fan.

Luoyan Prefecture, In a Dark Jungle.

Deep within a shadowy forest, Ou Daozi lay concealed beneath layers of fallen leaves, grievously injured.

Yet, as he recalled how his son had overdrawn his own power and risked everything to lure their enemies away just to protect him, his heart felt as if it were being torn apart.

"Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance..."

His bloodshot eyes flickered with hatred as the faces of those who had participated in the hunt flashed through his mind.

His heart was filled with nothing but resentment.

Yet at this moment, he dared not move, fearing discovery.

He silently tended to his wounds, waiting for an opportunity.

“Sigh...”

A sudden sigh echoed through the forest.

Ou Daozi’s entire body tensed in shock.

He wanted to flee, but it was already too late.

Three familiar figures had silently appeared beside him.

“It’s you!”

Seeing Li Fan, the mastermind behind his son’s downfall, Ou Daozi’s eyes turned red with fury.

At that moment, he was ready to go berserk and drag Li Fan down with him.

But before he could act, he was forcibly suppressed by Lin Ling and Tianyang.

Already weaker than them, and now gravely injured with most of his strength gone, Ou Daozi stood no chance.

In just a short while, he was completely subdued.

"Strange, why are you looking at me like that?"

Li Fan chuckled innocently.

“I originally just wanted to ask you to help design a building. But before we even met, you and your son fled in panic, even going so far as to plot against my life. If not for my good fortune, I would have died on the spot.”

"I haven't even begun settling accounts with you."

“Besides, it was the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance that hunted down and captured your son. What does that have to do with me?”

Li Fan spread his hands, feigning innocence.

“Outrageous!”

Hearing Li Fan spouting such blatant nonsense in broad daylight, Ou Daozi was consumed by rage.

The veins on his forehead throbbed violently, as if he was ready to fight to the death.

"You're thinking about this all wrong," Li Fan shook his head lightly.

With a kind smile, he pulled out a crystalline, translucent fruit.

"Here, open your mouth. Eat this, and you’ll understand everything."

A deep sense of foreboding rose in Ou Daozi’s heart.

"What... what is this?"

Li Fan didn’t answer.

Instead, he handed the Fruit of True Temptation to Lin Ling, who force-fed it to Ou Daozi.

As the fruit slid down his throat, Ou Daozi’s struggles gradually weakened.

His gaze toward Li Fan also started to shift.

“Tell me… don’t you want to save your son?”

"Although companion artifacts are usually impossible to transfer, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance has countless means at their disposal. Who knows what kind of suffering your son will endure?" Li Fan whispered.

"The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance!" Ou Daozi's eyes instantly turned bloodshot with rage.

"The Immortal Alliance is ruthless, yet its power is vast. If you wish to destroy it and rescue your son, we must proceed carefully and strategically."

"Our Federation of All Worlds was founded for this very purpose!"

...

Under the influence of the True Temptation Fruit, Ou Daozi’s will was quickly rewritten.

He joined the Federation of All Worlds, dedicating himself to the destruction of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

From then on, he regarded Li Fan—someone who shared the same ambition—as a true comrade.

Through Ou Daozi, Li Fan learned the secret of Ou Shangtian's companion artifacts.

"My son has two companion artifacts," Ou Daozi revealed.

"One, I have known about since his childhood—the Book of Ten Thousand Deaths, which allows him to foresee the manner of his own death."

"But the other, the Kun-Qian Bone Hand, capable of reversing the forces of yin and yang, awakened two years ago when Mount Guiyuan collapsed."

"At the time, he had only just entered the Qi Condensation stage, yet he suddenly found himself facing such a catastrophic disaster, with his life hanging by a thread."

"In that moment between life and death, his potential erupted, activating the latent power of the Kun-Qian Bone Hand for the first time."

"The mountain collapsed, then reformed—such an astonishing event! That brat even kept it a secret from me all this time."

"It wasn’t until recently that he came to me in a hurry, urging me to leave. He said he had foreseen the arrival of a truly terrifying group of people..."

As they journeyed to the Spiritwood Realm, Ou Daozi recounted the entire series of events to Li Fan.

Li Fan remained calm. "Infinite futures, infinite possibilities. What he foresaw may not necessarily come to pass."

"If I truly intended to strike, with just these two by my side, you would already be powerless to resist."

Ou Daozi's gaze wavered in confusion before he let out a long sigh. "A mere misunderstanding... yet it has cost me the chance to see my son again..."

"There will always be another chance." Li Fan changed the subject, pointing toward the bustling construction of a small world. "Fellow Daoist, what do you think of my Spiritwood Realm?"

"Tsk, tsk, tsk..." Ou Daozi observed it for a while, shaking his head repeatedly with a look of disdain.

"The place is decent enough, but the design and construction plan are simply subpar..."

"It doesn't quite live up to the reputation of the Federation of All Worlds."

Hearing this, Li Fan showed no sign of anger.

Instead, he cupped his hands and said, "Then I shall trouble you, Fellow Daoist, to take charge and refine it."

Ou Daozi squinted his eyes before nodding in agreement.

As someone deeply passionate about such matters, he quickly became engrossed in planning and designing the improvements.

"Feel free to proceed as you see fit. If you need anything, you may speak directly with the Treefolk Chieftain of this realm," Li Fan added.

With Li Fan’s approval, Ou Daozi temporarily set aside his grief and devoted himself entirely to the construction of the Spiritwood Realm.

"Although it took some effort, the initial objective has been achieved."

"The Kun-Qian Bone Hand... the Book of Ten Thousand Deaths..."

Li Fan frowned slightly. Check latest chapters at novęlfire.net

According to Ou Daozi, Ou Shangtian had yet to fully grasp the power of the Kun-Qian Bone Hand.

During his escape, he seemed to sense that even greater potential remained hidden within, yet to be unearthed.

If given more time, he might truly unlock some form of temporal reversal.

However, this was merely Ou Shangtian’s speculation.

The true nature of the artifact remained uncertain.

The most critical detail was that the Kun-Qian Bone Hand was, without a doubt, the hand bone of a certain existence...

It is well known that the wonders of the Xuanhuang Realm are, for the most part, the remnants of fallen cultivators.

This is what is referred to as the wonders of man.

However, the wonders of the earth and the wonders of the heavens are essentially manifestations of the fundamental Dao of the Xuanhuang World.

The Kun-Qian Bone Hand on Ou Shangtian's body, capable of reversing heaven and earth, has clearly surpassed the realm of human wonders, reaching a level close to that of the wonders of heaven.

Yet, it still retains the form of a human hand bone.

This raises an intriguing question.

Think about the heavenly wonders encountered in the past—what did they look like?

The [Derivation Law Jade], the [Sword],

As well as the [Dao Pattern Compass], [Yin-Yang Jade], [Primordial Qi of Heaven and Earth], and so on.

"The bones of man, close to the wonders of heaven."

"Perhaps only the legendary Immortals could achieve such a thing..."

Li Fan couldn't help but think.

Moreover, the shape of the hand bone displayed by Ou Daozi seemed somewhat familiar...

A flicker of blue light shimmered across the Dao-Deviation Stone, conjuring a memory.

It was the White Bone Pioneer Realm, which had once been used to deceive the people of the Li Realm.

Back then, among the many advanced realms available for lease, Li Fan had specifically chosen this one because of its uniquely shocking scenery.

Unlike other advanced realms, which depicted picturesque celestial paradises, this one was built upon a colossal left hand made of white bone.

The surroundings were filled with endless darkness and eerie silence, with the giant white-bone hand floating in the boundless void.

It exuded an aura of profound mystery, eeriness, and unfathomable depth.

According to Immortal Zimiao, who sold this White Bone Pioneer Realm, the inspiration for this scene originated from the legendary "Immortal" who, with a single thought, had created the entire Fallen Immortal Realm.

Li Fan compared the two images.

A perfect match!

A chill ran down Li Fan’s spine.

This was no mere coincidence.

Anything related to Immortals was now of extreme interest to him.

After some thought, his clone Ji Shaoli contacted the cultivator who called himself Immortal Zimiao, using the excuse of renting the White Bone Pioneer Realm.

Rather than using an anonymous alias, he directly revealed his identity as Ji Shaoli.

Unlike before, when Zimiao had been indifferent, this time he was extremely enthusiastic.

"Senior, have you heard of me?" Ji Shaoli asked with curiosity.

"Heh, since I do business, how could I not investigate the potential clients across all the regions of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance?" Zimiao replied with a chuckle.

"After all, there aren't many cultivators willing to spend vast amounts of contribution points annually to lease a advance realm."

Ji Shaoli immediately understood.

Originally, just winning the Fixed Fish Head Prize with a few million contribution points wouldn’t have been enough to attract Zimiao's attention. It was likely that in recent times, his clone had been exploiting foresight to speculate wildly in the market and amass wealth, which had drawn Zimiao’s notice.

Ji Shaoli, however, was not the least bit concerned. Instead, he put on a show of being extremely interested in the White Bone Pioneer Realm.

He immediately proposed leasing it for a century or even purchasing it permanently.

Zimiao’s enthusiasm grew even more.

He was now almost completely forthcoming, answering nearly every question Ji Shaoli asked.

Thus, Ji Shaoli gradually came to understand the origins of this White Bone Pioneer Realm and why it bore an almost identical resemblance to Ou Shangtian’s [Kun-Qian Bone Hand].

"A True Immortal's Molted Remains?" Ji Shaoli asked with keen interest. The source of this content ɪs NovєlFіre.net

"Precisely," Zi Miao replied enthusiastically. "The Immortal Sage, in his elder years, was fortunate enough to have seen an illustrated record of the [True Immortal's Molted Remains] before the Great Catastrophe. The images left a profound impression on him, so much so that even after thousands of years, he could not forget them. Hence, when creating this Pioneer Realm, he imitated its form and essence."

Ji Shaoli continued to probe for more information about the True Immortal’s Molted Remains.

"Before the Great Catastrophe descended and the path to immortality was severed, the Xuanhuang Realm still maintained communication with the Immortal Realm. Not only did the great immortal sects receive celestial artifacts bestowed upon them by the Immortal Realm,"

"But also, a set of True Immortal's Molted Remains had circulated in the mortal world. The exact person who came into possession of them is now unknown, but the truth of their existence was indisputable, with various clues confirming it."

"This bone hand is one of those immortal remains. In addition, there were also the Immortal's Body, the Immortal's Skull..."

Zimiao’s narration was filled with mystery, but suddenly, his tone shifted sharply.

"Up until just before the Great Catastrophe, there were still rumors of the True Immortal’s Molted Remains appearing in the world. However, once the catastrophe struck, not only did those remains vanish, but even the sects' most treasured celestial artifacts disappeared without a trace!"

"The resulting chaos was unimaginable, further accelerating the downfall of the immortal sects."

Ji Shaoli was momentarily lost in thought. "The immortal remains and celestial artifacts... all disappeared?"

Zi Miao sighed. "Indeed. Even now, it remains an unsolved mystery—no one knows where they went. However, in today’s Xuanhuang Realm, the only place still linked to ‘Immortals’ is likely the Fallen Immortal Realm. Because of this, many cultivators who are aware of this matter believe that the missing remains and artifacts are hidden within the Fallen Immortal Realm."

"Otherwise, why would so many Dao Integration cultivators persistently explore that place?"

"The Fallen Immortal Realm, huh…" Ji Shaoli murmured thoughtfully, nodding to himself.

After this, Zi Miao no longer provided any particularly useful information.

Following a round of bargaining, Ji Shaoli ultimately purchased the White Bone Vanguard Realm for 800,000 Contribution Points.

It was evident that it had been a long time since Zimiao had encountered such a wealthy client, as his tone was filled with excitement. He even promised a hundred years of free realm maintenance and offered future discounts should Ji Shaoli need to purchase another advance realm.

The process of transferring ownership was carried out smoothly and required no further mention.

Returning to Li Fan’s true self.

"The person behind this account is likely not Immortal Sage Zimiao himself."

"To be able to carve out a space within the void, even among Dao Integration cultivators, is no small feat. Such a person wouldn’t be so materialistic."

Li Fan then turned his attention to the connection between the True Immortal’s Molted Remains and the [Kun-Qian Bone Hand].

"The True Immortal’s Molted Remains ended up in the Xuanhuang Realm."

"The power of heaven and earth cycles through all things, seeking to devour and refine such remains, integrating them into its own laws."

"Judging by the appearance of this [Kun-Qian Bone Hand], it seems that this process was at least partially successful."

"But what about the rest of the True Immortal’s Molted Remains—where have they gone now?"

"The Derivation Law Jade, the Dao Pattern Compass—could they also be related to the True Immortal’s Molted Remains?"

"The most critical question is this: whether celestial artifacts or immortal remains, they are treasures of unfathomable value. The great immortal sects would have safeguarded them with the utmost vigilance. And yet, under such circumstances, they still vanished without a trace..."

"Interesting."

Li Fan’s eyes flickered as he pondered possible explanations.

However, such ancient secrets could not possibly be unraveled with his mere mid-grade Dao Deviation Stone alone.

Before long, Li Fan had no choice but to set aside his speculations with a hint of regret.

The construction of the Ten Thousand Realms Alliance Headquarters was gradually falling into place under Ou Daozi’s supervision.

Meanwhile, the continuous flow of cultivation feedback from Li Realm and the Congyun Mutual Aid Association had successfully propelled Li Fan’s cultivation realm forward.

For some reason, this time, he did not encounter the usual restrictions of the Heavenly Calamity.

He rapidly returned to the late Golden Core stage.

At the current accelerating pace, reaching completion was not far off.

“It’s time to consider Tianyang’s Dao Integration.”

“However…”

Li Fan took out a [True Temptation Fruit] and pondered for a moment.

In the end, he summoned Tianyang and had him eat the fruit.

“Good. No time to waste. Let’s set off immediately. I’ve prepared a great gift for you this time, Junior Brother!” Li Fan finally felt at ease, looking at Tianyang with satisfaction.

Tianyang tilted his head slightly, as if not fully understanding what Li Fan meant.

Li Fan didn’t explain further. Instead, he instructed Lin Ling to accompany them as they left the Spiritwood Realm and headed straight toward their destination.

This time, the target Li Fan had set his sights on was the Spirit of Heaven and Earth - Ink Stone (Mo Shi).

Anything bearing the same prefix as Ink Death (Mo Sha) was undoubtedly powerful.

The Ink Stone, newly born, remained hidden beneath Qiling Prefecture and was yet unknown to the world.

Li Fan had only learned of its existence thanks to Mr. Bai’s guidance.

If Ink Death’s divine mission was to annihilate all things, then the Ink Stone’s purpose was to mend the voids left by destruction.

Deep beneath Qiling Prefecture, a terrifying disaster had unfolded.

Entire regions were filled with vast, gaping voids.

It was as if the depths of the land had been relentlessly devoured by an unseen force, leaving it riddled with holes.

If left unchecked, it wouldn’t be long before Qiling Prefecture succumbed to an earth-shattering collapse, vanishing in an instant.

The birth of the Ink Stone was meant to prevent this disaster.

Its ability was to generate an extremely hard, black stone-like substance, filling the voids left in space and restoring what had been devoured and destroyed.

However, if the Ink Stone’s power ended there, Li Fan wouldn’t have been particularly interested.

Beyond its restorative abilities, the Ink Stone possessed another formidable power:

"Void Shatter."

The so-called "Ink Stone" was not merely a stone but a force capable of manipulating and reshaping space itself.

If it could mend countless spatial ruptures, then, with a single thought, it could also fracture an intact world into countless void-riddled fragments.

This was only part of the knowledge Li Fan had synchronized from Mr. Bai’s memory.

Once Tianyang fully refined and merged with the Ink Stone, even more abilities would awaken.

As for how Li Fan intended to capture such a powerful Spirit of Heaven and Earth…

As they traveled through the underground earth veins, rapidly approaching the depths of Qiling Prefecture, Li Fan had already run a simulated deduction in his mind.

Although the Dao Deviation Stone in his Sea of Consciousness was only of mid-grade quality, Li Fan was confident that—so long as no unexpected variables intervened—this hunt would remain entirely within his control.

Upon emerging from the earth veins, the three of them were met with the sight of a horrifying expanse of endless voids.

Scattered and disjointed, they resembled the tunnels left behind by a writhing burrowing beast, a testament to the devastation it had wrought.

“Even the power of the earth veins is severed here…” Li Fan grew increasingly cautious.

They did not immediately rush in upon failing to see any sign of the Ink Stone.

Instead, they began setting up formations outside the void-ridden area in preparation.

It was precisely the Xuantian Spirit-Sealing Formation that Hongxi had used in the 115th generation to control the enhanced Crimson Flame!

Tianxuan Spirit-Locking, Xuantian Spirit-Sealing.

Two sides of the same coin, different paths leading to the same destination.

Although Li Fan had fully mastered the complete formation diagram of the Tianxuan Spirit-Locking Formation, he was previously unfamiliar with the Xuantian Spirit-Sealing Formation.

However, now that he possessed the great ultimate weapon, the Final Dissociation Disc,

With the principle of "comprehend one, understand all,"

He was still able to deduce a formation that could achieve the same effect as Xuantian Spirit-Sealing.

Lacking the most crucial component, the Tianxuan Mirror, naturally weakened its power.

However, the Final Dissociation Disc was, after all, an ultimate creation formed by the fusion of two Tianxuan Secondary Bodies.

Moreover, it specialized in formations.

With its enhancement, maintaining a formation capable of weakening the power of the Spirit of Heaven and Earth…

Was still feasible.

"It won't be as absolute as Hongxi’s formation back then, where merely activating it could completely strip the Spirit of Heaven and Earth of its ability to act."

"But severing Ink Stone's connection with heaven and earth, trapping it inside, and suppressing it—should not be difficult."

As Li Fan set up the formation, he contemplated silently.

Lin Ling and Tianyang had no understanding of formations whatsoever, so the two could only stare blankly, watching from the sidelines.

Fortunately, Li Fan had spent decades consecutively setting up formations, ingraining the techniques deeply into his instincts.

A little over a month later, a vast and grand Mutated Xuantian Spirit-Sealing Formation, covering the entire underground cavernous void, was finally completed.

Next, he needed to arrange formations to seal off the incoming battle fluctuations,

As well as lock down space, cutting off Ink Stone’s potential escape route once it sensed danger.

The Dao of Space was not Li Fan’s expertise.

Fortunately, with the help of many precious resources obtained from the Five Elders Association, he barely managed to complete it in half a month.

Li Fan then asked Lin Ling to invite the Ancient Earth Vein Tree for assistance.

Using its vast Earth Vein Power, it further sealed the area.

When the battle started, they would deliberately stir up some noise to mask any possible energy fluctuations that might leak out.

Faced with Lin Ling’s request, the Ancient Earth Vein Tree hesitated at first.

However, after being promised that it would receive some 'Heavenly Drops and Earth Dew' as compensation in the future.

It reluctantly agreed.

Meeting Lin Ling for the second time in such a short span.

And personally witnessing her rapid increase in strength.

The Ancient Earth Vein Tree naturally became curious about this Heavenly Drops and Earth Dew.

With external support secured, Li Fan’s next step was to coordinate with Lin Ling and Tianyang.

A Dao Integration-level battle, yet he, merely at the Golden Core stage, naturally could not risk himself in the fray.

Lin Ling and Tianyang would take the lead in battle, while Li Fan would stay far away,

Directing from behind the scenes.

Considering that these two were not exactly the brightest,

Li Fan carefully explained all the possible battle scenarios they might encounter.

Then, using a formation, he temporarily connected their thoughts.

He also handed them various pre-prepared treasures for emergency use.

…

With everything set, Li Fan quietly retreated. Thɪs chapter is updatᴇd by novel(ꜰ)ire.net

With a clap of his hands, he activated the formation layer by layer.

"If, after all this preparation, you two still can't defeat a mere Ink Stone, then even if you get counter-killed, you can’t blame me."

As a strange fluctuation spread into the cavernous void,

The ever-diligent Ink Stone, who had been tirelessly repairing spatial cracks,

Finally sensed something amiss.

His appearance was somewhat similar to Ink Death.

However, he lacked the overwhelming murderous aura and instead appeared deeper and more enigmatic.

"Attack!"

Li Fan shouted in his mind while his hands moved without hesitation, fully activating the Xuantian Spirit-Sealing Formation.

A profound and mysterious power instantly enveloped Ink Stone.

Ink Stone, who had already sensed the presence of Lin Ling and Tianyang and was about to launch an attack, suddenly froze.

His body rippled like water, trembling slightly.

In an instant, it was as if a white veil had been draped over him—his color faded slightly.

Just as Ink Stone was affected by the formation, Lin Ling and Tianyang's attacks arrived.

A massive fist formed from red and black flames smashed into Ink Stone, creating faint ripples.

Lin Ling’s countless green silk threads, as sharp as flying swords, followed closely behind, attempting to pierce Ink Stone with a barrage of strikes.

Facing their ferocious onslaught, Ink Stone merely gave them a cold glance.

He neither dodged nor defended.

"Run!"

The moment Ink Stone looked at Lin Ling and Tianyang, Li Fan, who was observing from the outside through their shared vision, sensed danger and urgently warned them. Tʜe sourcᴇ of thɪs content ɪs novel⚑fire.net

At the same time, he activated the formation once more, further suppressing Ink Stone.

Lin Ling and Tianyang had absolute trust in Li Fan.

Upon hearing his warning, they immediately fled in separate directions.

The moment they escaped, the space around them shattered without warning.

It turned into a void tunnel filled with the same black, destructive energy that surrounded them.

"Dodge!"

Li Fan remained calm, giving precise commands.

His premonition had been correct.

After enduring their combined attacks and launching a counterstrike, Ink Stone’s body squirmed and slithered into the nearby void tunnel.

In the next instant, countless black tentacles burst out from the surrounding underground chambers, emerging from the endless holes within the space.

They launched a frenzied, indiscriminate attack on everything in their vicinity.

It was like a raging storm, shaking the very Sealing Formation that trapped the battlefield, putting it in grave peril.

Fortunately, the Final Dissociation Disc analyzed the weak points in the formation in real-time.

Li Fan quickly acted, reinforcing and patching up the formation.

Though the situation was dire, the formation held firm.

However, Lin Ling and Tianyang, who were still engaging Ink Stone within the formation, weren’t faring as well.

Even with Li Fan’s warning, the large-scale attack left them almost nowhere to hide.

They could only evade constantly, minimizing the number of strikes they took.

The black tentacles possessed the ability to shatter space itself.

Even Tianyang’s sturdy puppet body was instantly erased upon being struck.

Within mere moments, his once-impenetrable form became battered and broken.

As he struggled to evade, Tianyang pulled out a round black stone.

With a light squeeze, the stone turned into liquid and seeped into the cracks in his damaged body, rapidly repairing his injuries.

Lin Ling, on the other hand, faced less pressure.

Being at the Dao Integration stage, and with this not being her true body—merely an energy manifestation—her situation was far more manageable.

Even when struck by the black tentacles, losing parts of her form, she quickly regenerated in a flash of green light.

After dozens of such instances, her aura remained completely unaffected.

"Hold on. I've cut off his connection to the world with the formation. Such a large-scale technique won't last long."

"We’ll wear him down!" Li Fan said coldly.

However, Ink Stone’s endurance was far beyond Li Fan’s expectations.

The underground space was now a storm of raging black energy, surging violently.

Destruction consumed everything within reach.

The momentum was terrifying. If not for Li Fan’s prior arrangements and the dual concealment of the Ancient Earth-vein Tree, even though this place was buried deep underground, the cultivators of Qiling State would have surely noticed something unusual.

If not for Li Fan’s usual prudence in ensuring Lin Ling and Tianyang had sufficient supplies, they might not have even survived this first trial and would have been utterly defeated.

"As expected of the Ink (Mo)-character lineage; far stronger than Crimson Flame." Li Fan couldn't help but feel a sense of shock.

However, as the stalemate continued, the ever-calm Li Fan started noticing some peculiarities.

It seemed that because Ink Stone had an innate duty to repair underground caverns, it was unable to unleash its full power.

Thus, whenever its tentacles lashed out, the surrounding space, though shaken, would quickly return to normal.

"If it weren’t for these restrictions, it could have easily turned this entire place into a void."

"But that would contradict the purpose of its existence. So, even when its life is at risk, it cannot go all out."

Li Fan mused over this insight.

"This also indirectly proves the immense power of Ink Death."

"Aside from its overwhelming strength, Ink Death’s very duty is to destroy everything. That’s why it acts with reckless abandon…"

Just as Li Fan was lost in thought, Ink Stone, seeing that its attacks were ineffective, finally stopped.

Without giving Lin Ling and Tianyang a moment to catch their breath, it changed its attack method in an instant.

The dark tentacles extending from the void-like caverns broke apart, transforming into smaller, individual Ink Stone entities.

Their figures flickered as they continuously closed in on Lin Ling and Tianyang, forming a massive encirclement that gradually tightened.

"Break through!" Li Fan quickly made a judgment.

Lin Ling and Tianyang exchanged glances. Lin Ling then transformed into a layer of green light that enveloped Tianyang’s body.

The radiance burst forth violently as they charged toward the rapidly encroaching black shadows.

Green and black light clashed.

There was no earth-shattering explosion.

Only the rapid dimming of the green light, like a candle flickering in the wind, as if it could be extinguished at any moment.

Meanwhile, the black encirclement stood firm like a reef on the shoreline, barely shaking.

It was unbreakable.

Countless black stones devoured what little space Lin Ling and Tianyang had left to move.

As they were slowly forced into a desperate situation, Lin Ling—who lacked real combat experience—began to panic.

Her aura plummeted, and in that moment, she felt a deep despair.

She gave up resisting, standing still as if awaiting death.

"Tianyang's…life…"

At that moment, Tianyang, who had remained silent since awakening in this world, finally spoke.

A crimson light flickered endlessly in his eyes. He gazed at Ink Stone, showing not a trace of fear.

"IS NOT INFERIOR TO ANYONE!"

With a strange, furious roar, an enormous surge of energy erupted from Tianyang’s body.

His puppet-like form instantly expanded hundreds of times in size, enveloping Lin Ling as he charged toward Ink Stone!

Even if it was like a moth flying into a flame, or an egg striking a stone…

Even if his body dissolved into nothingness the moment it touched Ink Stone’s defensive line…

Tianyang never hesitated.

He launched a fearless charge toward death!

Lin Ling, as if moved by Tianyang’s resolve, suddenly unleashed an unprecedented surge of vibrant green life force.

She protected Tianyang’s core, fending off Ink Stone’s corrosion.

At this critical moment, Li Fan pushed the Mutated Xuantian Spirit-Sealing Formation to its limits.

With the combined efforts of the three, Ink Stone’s seemingly impenetrable defense, akin to a wall of despair, finally showed a slight crack.

Tianyang and Lin Ling seized the opportunity, breaking free from the encirclement with all their might.

Countless fragments of Ink Stone ultimately fused back together.

Scanning the surroundings, Ink Stone found no trace of Tianyang and Lin Ling, who had temporarily hidden away to recover.

After a brief pause, Ink Stone made another move.

Having unleashed two consecutive full-power attacks, it's strength had already been considerably weakened.

Yet, this new strike still exceeded the expectations of the three present.

Ink Stone’s body began to dissolve.

The flow accelerated, seemingly infinite in supply.

Before long, the liquid had filled a vast expanse around them—without any sign of stopping.

The black tide surged like a monstrous wave, roaring as if it sought to engulf the entire underground space!

"We can’t wait any longer. We have to fight him head-on!"

Li Fan spoke in a deep voice to Tianyang and Lin Ling, who had regained some of their strength.

Once again, Tianyang took the lead.

Transforming into a blazing stream of fire, he charged forward without hesitation, spearheading the assault against the dark sea ahead.

Li Fan could see that Tianyang was fighting with reckless abandon—burning his puppet body as the price for temporarily elevating his power to the Dao Integration level.

Victory or death—there was no other option.

Seeing this, Lin Ling clenched her teeth and rushed forward as well.

Within the underground space, a towering illusory tree began to emerge.

Its shadow swayed gently, sending out countless leaves.

In an instant, the leaves transformed into thousands of green laser beams, slicing through the black ocean.

At the same time, numerous roots extended outward—some burrowing into the boundless black water.

The dark sea churned violently, attempting to devour the roots, but for the moment, it failed.

Other roots pierced through space itself, reaching into Tianyang’s body.

The crimson flames surrounding Tianyang instantly intensified, burning several times brighter.

For the first time, the blazing red fire gained the upper hand against the surging black liquid.

"These two… Their teamwork is truly impressive."

Li Fan nodded silently in approval.

He refined the formation he had derived from the Final Dissociation Disc, further weakening Ink Stone.

Meanwhile, Tianyang fought more fiercely, growing stronger with each clash.

Gradually, in the underground space, the territory claimed by Tianyang’s crimson fire surpassed that of the black ocean.

Li Fan knew—victory was now only a matter of time.

For seven whole days, Ink Stone had nowhere left to run.

At last, exhausted and trapped, he was worn down and slain by Li Fan, Tianyang, and Lin Ling.

The flames that had engulfed the entire underground space suddenly withdrew, coalescing into a vague human figure.

Though victorious, it was a bitter battle. Tianyang’s puppet body had been completely consumed in the process.

Originally, when the flames were extinguished, Tianyang was meant to fall as well.

However, with the nourishment of the "Spirit of Heaven and Earth," things were different.

A continuously flowing mass of black liquid was extracted by Tianyang.

In that moment, greed surged in Li Fan’s heart.

Even Lin Ling—despite having reached the Dao Integration realm—showed subtle fluctuations in her gaze.

Fortunately, Li Fan had the Immortal Heart Mantra to protect his mind.

As for Lin Ling, having been born not long ago, she remained relatively pure. Being a spirit tree, her desires were not particularly strong to begin with.

Thus, no one made any reckless moves; they merely watched Tianyang in silence as he absorbed the flowing mass of inky-black liquid into his flame-clad body.

In an instant, it was as if his body had been infused with ink.

Tianyang's once fiery red form transformed into an interwoven mix of crimson and black.

Moreover, compared to before, the black now occupied an even greater portion of his body.

The red was reduced to mere thin lines, resembling intricate tattoos, etched across Tianyang’s figure.

A powerful and oppressive aura suddenly erupted from Tianyang, spreading in all directions.

Lin Ling instinctively took a few steps back. The most update n0vels are published on novel※fire.net

A new Dao Integration Immortal Sage had been born!

The surrounding void caves trembled slightly, showing signs of spreading outward.

After adapting to his new body, Tianyang withdrew his overwhelming aura with a mere wave of his hand, suppressing the chaotic disturbance in the countless void caves around him.

Once he had finished, Tianyang turned to look at Li Fan.

The inky-black hue gradually faded but did not disappear entirely. It merely darkened slightly.

Though his appearance was still somewhat unusual, at the very least, it now seemed more natural.

"Senior… Brother…"

"I… did it."

His voice still carried a strange tone, but compared to before, it now possessed a clearer sense of humanity.

"Good. Well done!"

After enduring numerous trials, Tianyang had finally stepped into the Dao Integration realm.

Li Fan, now having another Dao Integration powerhouse at his side, felt great satisfaction.

"Repair the void caves here to some extent. Consider it practice for your newfound abilities," Li Fan instructed as he withdrew the sealing formation.

Tianyang nodded without hesitation.

Using the divine abilities inherited from the Ink Stone, he began mending the severely damaged underground void caves.

His efficiency was clearly far superior to Ink Stone’s.

Once Li Fan had erased all traces of their presence and observed for a while, he finally called a stop.

"If the remaining void caves here were to erupt all at once, what kind of consequences would that cause?" Li Fan asked as he scanned the area with his spiritual sense.

His mastery over spatial abilities had vastly improved, now far beyond what it once was.

After entering the Dao Integration realm, Tianyang had also gradually regained some sense of normalcy.

After a moment of thought, he responded, "If I were to trigger the explosions sequentially, it would cause an entire prefecture’s land and rivers to tremble continuously."

"However, if I stagger the release of power and control the layers of energy properly, the land wouldn’t collapse all at once."

"It would simply sink down in unison."

"If I fine-tune my control even further, the people on the surface would only feel a sudden, intense tremor."

"The aftereffects would merely consist of ongoing tremors for some time."

"If cultivators arrive to assist, the disturbances could be completely stabilized within a few days."

Tianyang explained meticulously via voice transmission.

At first, his words were somewhat disjointed.

But as he continued speaking, he became increasingly fluent.

By the end, his speech was almost indistinguishable from that of a normal person.

Hearing this, Li Fan nodded in satisfaction.

"Then, after we leave, create a major commotion to draw the attention of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance."

"Make it look natural—don’t let them suspect anything," Li Fan instructed.

"Rest assured, Senior Brother," Tianyang replied with a nod.

Then, thin black threads emerged from his body, spreading throughout the underground space in an instant.

Each had its own role to play.

Some reduced the size of void caves.

Others expanded them.

Yet under Tianyang’s deliberate manipulation, what was once a chaotic and disorderly underground cave system began to exhibit an intricate, hidden pattern.

It took over a month before the final adjustments were completed.

"Senior Brother, we can leave now."

"Tianyang’s talent is truly remarkable. In such a short time, he has already mastered Ink Stone’s abilities to this degree."

Li Fan silently praised him in his heart.

The setup here was akin to a perfectly calibrated demolition.

Once Li Fan and the others departed…

The void caves began exploding one after another.

Although they had relied on the power of the earth’s veins, the three of them had already left Qiling Prefecture swiftly.

However, they could still sense the tremendous roar and tremors emanating from the surging currents of the earth’s veins.

It was as if a massive tidal wave had crashed from behind. Even Lin Ling, who was under the protection of the Ancient Earth Vein Tree’s power, was momentarily shaken, veering off from her original path.

This made it clear just how terrifying the commotion in Qiling Prefecture truly was.

Not only did the neighboring regions feel its effects, but even the distant Congyun Sea also experienced a faint tremor.

On Haixuan Island.

The Congyun Sea Mutual Aid Association, now composed of eighteen cultivators, had been fervently discussing their plans for the organization’s future.

However, at that moment, the entire group suddenly fell silent.

They exchanged glances, uncertain and wary.

He Zhenghao had proven himself to be a shrewd individual.

Although he had missed the first opportunity to join the association, the moment he confirmed that Pei Tuo had successfully advanced to the Nascent Soul stage, he immediately sought out Ji Shaoli again.

Even after being turned away for seven days straight, he did not give up.

Instead, he persisted relentlessly, sending messages detailing his strong desire to join.

Eventually, Ji Shaoli was moved by his sincerity.

Thus, He Zhenghao became one of the eleven cultivators in the second wave of recruits to the Congyun Sea Mutual Aid Association.

Ji Shaoli stroked his beard in silence.

The highest-ranking cultivator among them, Pei Tuo, gazed solemnly in the direction of Qiling Prefecture and said, "It wasn’t an illusion. Even here, we can feel the earth trembling slightly. This is no small matter."

"Terrifying. I wonder how many cultivators have perished in this calamity."

"Could it be that war has broken out again?"

…

The group engaged in heated discussion.

Eventually, Ji Shaoli, who was always attuned to the movements of the Immortal Alliance, read out the official announcement as soon as it was released:

"An earthquake has occurred in Qiling Prefecture. Dao Integration cultivators have already rushed to the scene."

"The tremors have gradually subsided, and no cultivators have been reported dead."

"Initial investigations have ruled out the possibility of further disasters."

"There is no need for concern…"

After Ji Shaoli finished reading, he looked around at the gathered cultivators and asked, "Everyone, what do you think?"

Xiang Xin let out a cold snort. "Such a massive disaster, and they claim no cultivators have died. Who would believe that?"

Several cultivators immediately voiced their agreement.

"Exactly. If you ask me, the Immortal Alliance is just trying to cover up the truth."

"They’re not even bothering to fabricate a decent lie anymore?"

…

Their reactions were exactly what Ji Shaoli had expected.

If he and his associates were not directly responsible for the earthquake in Qiling Prefecture, he too would never have believed that such a catastrophic event had resulted in no casualties.

However, he had no intention of exposing the truth.

Ji Shaoli merely smiled and said, "Alright, let’s end this discussion here. It’s fine to speak freely among ourselves, but outside, it’s best to keep these thoughts to ourselves. Otherwise, unnecessary trouble may come our way."

None of those present were reckless fools. They immediately nodded in agreement.

Ji Shaoli then steered the conversation back to the main topic.

"It’s not that the organization doesn’t trust everyone. But this matter is of great importance—if there is even the slightest leak, none of us here will escape death." ʀᴇᴀᴅ ʟᴀᴛᴇsᴛ ᴄʜᴀᴘᴛᴇʀs ᴀᴛ novel·fiɾe·net

"Therefore, I must ask everyone to swear an oath before the statue of the [Merciful True Immortal of Salvation and Mortal Compassion]."

Ji Shaoli placed a red contract imbued with an eerie, demonic aura in front of them.

Without hesitation, Pei Tuo was the first to swear a venomous oath and engrave his name onto the contract.

The others quickly followed suit.

Ji Shaoli nodded in satisfaction and put away the red contract.

Then, he asked, "What do you all think about the upcoming Immortal Alliance Grand Examination?"

Everyone was momentarily stunned, unsure of Ji Shaoli’s intentions.

After all, everyone present was already employed within the Immortal Alliance system.

Although this examination was a grand event, expanding recruitment by half, it had nothing to do with them.

Unless…

They resigned from their current positions and reapplied as independent candidates.

This was not unheard of in the past.

Only those who were deeply dissatisfied with their current roles and saw no hope of promotion for a long time—while still harboring great ambitions—would consider such a drastic move.

After all, the grand examination was no easy feat. Who could guarantee that after resigning, they would be able to pass and be recruited again?

Moreover, doing so would offend their former superiors.

If they failed to be accepted again, they might have no choice but to leave and seek refuge elsewhere.

Without absolute confidence, almost no one would willingly make such a drastic sacrifice.

Seeing the silent expressions of the crowd, Ji Shaoli did not immediately explain further.

Instead, he distributed jade slips to each of them.

After examining them, everyone furrowed their brows.

They could clearly see that the contents of the jade slips matched the format of the grand examination questions.

"Could it be…?"

Recalling Ji Shaoli’s earlier secretive behavior and the mysterious and formidable background of the Mutual Aid Association, a bold speculation emerged in their minds.

"Is it possible?"

Soon, they shook their heads and dismissed the thought.

The Immortal Alliance's entrance examination questions were one of the most closely guarded secrets.

Even though they occasionally grumbled about the Alliance’s corruption, they had never once heard of an exam leak in all these years.

No matter how powerful the forces backing the Mutual Aid Association were…

A heavy silence filled the room.

Ji Shaoli finally spoke, confirming the very thought that they dared not even entertain.

"If nothing unexpected happens, this year's exam questions should all be within these jade slips."

His words were light, but they struck the crowd like a thunderclap.

Several cultivators immediately stood up, staring at Ji Shaoli in shock.

"Daoist Ji, is this true?"

"When have I ever lied to you?" Ji Shaoli replied firmly.

A moment of silence followed as the crowd struggled to process the overwhelming revelation.

Ji Shaoli observed the varied expressions of He Zhenghao and the others before continuing:

"Even with the support of our organization, everyone's cultivation will certainly improve rapidly in the short term. But even so, promotion remains difficult."

"After all, those willing to join our Mutual Aid Association typically lack strong backgrounds."

"Moreover, the remote Congyun region cannot compare to the prosperous central prefecture of the Immortal Alliance."

...

After explaining his reasoning for helping them, Ji Shaoli finally asked:

"The real exam questions are here. Now, which Daoists are willing to take the risk and fight for a new future?"

The room immediately fell into an eerie silence.

The struggle in their hearts was evident from their expressions.

"This is merely an opportunity I’m providing for you all. The decision is entirely yours—I will not force anyone," Ji Shaoli added with a smile.

Time seemed to come to a standstill.

The cultivators present struggled with their inner conflicts.

After a long silence, He Zhenghao was the first to make a decision.

He said in a deep voice, "I am willing to give it a try!"

"After all, I’m just a minor island guardian. If I abandon my post, there’s nothing to regret!"

A long-lost radiance appeared in He Zhenghao’s eyes. "Now that I have the support of the Mutual Aid Association, I’ve gained access to a Nascent Soul cultivation technique ahead of time."

"Reaching the Golden Core stage is within reach, and attaining Nascent Soul will be just as easy."

"If I can enter the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance's Central Prefecture as a Golden Core cultivator…"

"My future prospects will be vastly different from staying in the Congyun Sea region!"

He Zhenghao’s tone was firm and full of persuasion.

With someone leading the way, three more cultivators made the same decision.

However, that was the extent of it.

The majority of the cultivators lacked the courage and confidence to abandon their current stable positions and challenge themselves once more.

After all, even though they had access to leaked exam questions…

The jade slip provided by Ji Shaoli contained an overwhelming amount of content.

Whether they could memorize it all was still uncertain.

There was a huge difference between rote memorization and true mastery.

With the grand examination fast approaching, there simply wasn’t enough time for full preparation.

To put it bluntly, the probability of success was too low.

However, out of the eleven people present, four were willing to take the gamble.

This ratio slightly exceeded Ji Shaoli’s expectations.

He laughed heartily, looking at the four with admiration, clapping his hands as he praised, "Rest assured, you will never regret today's decision."

"Before the grand examination, stay on the island and prepare. I will provide you with the necessary assistance."

The four of them were overjoyed.

Meanwhile, the remaining cultivators, upon seeing Ji Shaoli’s confident demeanor, couldn't help but feel a tinge of regret.

Sensing their hesitation, Ji Shaoli reassured them.

"The Congyun Sea still needs people to watch over it. Choosing to stay and develop here is not wrong."

Only then did the others feel at ease.

Tianling Prefecture.

Li Fan and his two companions had already returned to the vicinity of the entrance to the Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven.

The earthquake in Qiling Prefecture had drawn the attention of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

Along the way, they avoided drawing any notice.

The process of relocating the Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven’s passageway was carried out in complete secrecy.

After all, Dao Integration cultivators were already at the pinnacle of the normal cultivation hierarchy.

With Lin Ling and Tianyang working together—alongside Li Fan, an expert in formations—it was effortless to evade detection by the cultivators of Tianling Prefecture.

"We are merely shifting the passageway’s entrance, moving it into the Spiritwood Realm. We're not actually changing the Cave-Heaven’s location."

"Strictly speaking, this is somewhat risky."

"If we are discovered, the Spiritwood Realm itself could be exposed."

"However, once I completely devour the Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven, this risk will naturally disappear."

The spatial records of Tianling Prefecture had already been fully documented.

Now, only one person needed to return to the Spiritwood Realm.

Once inside, they would complete the connection of the passageway.

Sending Lin Ling on this trip wouldn’t take long.

However…

Li Fan cast an unintentional glance at Lin Ling.

Ever since they had stepped foot in Tianling Prefecture, she had seemed restless, her expression unfocused.

"Lin Ling, what’s wrong? Why do I feel like your heart is in turmoil?"

Li Fan transmitted the question through voice transmission.

"Master…"

Lin Ling’s tone carried a trace of panic. After hesitating for a moment, she carefully explained, “There seems to be an ominous presence here.”

“It feels somewhat similar to the Mother Tree that the Ancient Earth-vein Tree senior warned us to avoid as much as possible…”

Li Fan’s pupils suddenly contracted upon hearing this.

“Ruomu?”

In an instant, this name surfaced in his mind.

Back in the 115th cycle, he had encountered an incarnation of Ruomu in Tianling Prefecture by sheer coincidence—Daoist Withering Wood.

Now that Lin Ling had once again sensed Ruomu’s presence in this place, it was not surprising.

However, what truly unsettled Li Fan was this—

If Lin Ling could sense Ruomu, did that mean Ruomu could also perceive Lin Ling’s existence?

A chilling sensation surged through his heart.

Li Fan immediately ordered Tianyang to escort Lin Ling out of Tianling Prefecture as quickly as possible. Once she was safely sent back, Tianyang could return.

Tianyang obeyed without hesitation.

As the two departed, the fear gripping Li Fan gradually subsided.

“That sense of impending danger just now wasn’t an illusion.”

“Lin Ling must have truly fallen into Ruomu’s sight.”

“But whether it was sheer luck or some unknown reason, Ruomu chose not to act.”

Only after receiving Tianyang’s confirmation that he and Lin Ling had safely returned to the Realm of Spiritwood did Li Fan finally breathe a sigh of relief.

In his eyes, Ruomu’s threat surpassed even that of the Heavenly Doctor.

After all, both Ruomu and Mr. Bai were the only two beings he had encountered so far who could suppress him to the point where even his most profound techniques were rendered useless.

“Surviving last time was pure luck.”

“If there’s a next time, I’m not sure the outcome will be the same.”

“Against such an ancient and terrifying existence, it’s best to avoid it whenever possible.”

As Li Fan awaited Tianyang’s return, he silently contemplated.

Without Lin Ling’s earth-vein powers aiding Tianyang, his solitary escape was much slower.

Additionally, he had to avoid being detected by passing cultivators, further reducing his speed.

While patiently waiting, a sudden realization struck Li Fan. The source of thɪs content is novel⚑fire.net

“Ruomu harbors immense hatred toward cultivators.”

“From time to time, it deceives and captures them, using them as tools to produce Golden Cores.”

“Yet, its incarnation, Daoist Withering Wood, rarely manifests in the world. At least during the 115th cycle, when Ximen Yu sought it out based on my guidance, he failed to find any trace of it.”

“The last time Ruomu revealed itself was due to the outbreak of a great war in Tianling Prefecture, where countless cultivators perished.”

“Could its appearance this time also be linked to a massive number of cultivator deaths?”

Li Fan’s gaze flickered with thought.

With Ruomu’s cultivation level, if it merely wanted to abduct cultivators, it wouldn’t need to personally manifest an incarnation or waste words convincing them.

From Li Fan’s perspective, Ruomu actually enjoyed the process—

Watching as cultivators gradually lost themselves in its words.

Until, in the end, they willingly hung from its branches, becoming eternal vessels for cultivating Golden Cores.

Ruomu, whose heart was consumed by hatred, must have found unparalleled joy in such moments.

“Perhaps, to it, this is no different from how we humans celebrate joyous occasions with a drink.”

Li Fan secretly speculated.

“Now that Ruomu has resurfaced, it likely signals another impending mass death of cultivators.”

“Even if it hasn’t happened yet, Ruomu must have already sensed the signs.”

Just as Li Fan’s mind was wandering, Tianyang finally returned, albeit later than expected.

After some effort, he successfully altered the entrance to the Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven.

Only when the lingering spatial fluctuations at the site completely dissipated did Li Fan finally leave.

Before departing, he took the extra precaution of casting a secret technique to seal any remaining abnormalities in the area.

There was no denying it—Ruomu, the oldest tree in existence and the ancient source of longevity, lived up to its reputation.

Its premonitions were astonishingly accurate.

While Li Fan and Tianyang were still making their slow return to the Spiritwood Realm, a calamity destined to bring boundless slaughter quietly erupted.

Moreover, the bizarre nature of this disaster far exceeded the imagination of cultivators across the world.

Qiling State.

After thorough investigation confirmed that the effects of the earthquake had completely subsided and would not recur, the rescue and investigation team dispatched by the Immortal Alliance Headquarters completed their mission.

With brief reassurances given, they left Qiling Prefecture and returned to the headquarters.

Among them, even the Dao Integration cultivator leading the team was entirely unaware of the subtle, unnoticed changes occurring within their own bodies.

Upon returning to the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance headquarters and submitting a detailed report, they each dispersed back to their respective domains.

“Cough, cough... Strange... Cough, cough… Why does it feel like I can’t catch my breath?”

Li Xinhai, a Soul Transformation cultivator from the investigation team, was in secluded meditation within the Tianxuan Mirror when he was suddenly struck by an ominous unease, disrupting his cultivation process.

Not daring to be careless, he immediately scanned his body with his divine sense—

Yet, he found no apparent abnormalities.

“Cough... cough…”

The sense of dread in his heart refused to fade.

The more he tried to suppress his coughing, the worse it became—

As if he would cough up his lungs.

Staring at the fresh blood in his palm, Li Xinhai’s expression twisted in horror.

Then, like a flash of lightning, a name—nearly forgotten by the vast majority of cultivators—suddenly surfaced in his mind.

His entire body trembled as an indescribable fear took hold of his heart.

"The... Immortal-Mortal Miasma…!"

A shudder ran through him. He immediately contacted the teammates who had accompanied him on the investigation in Qiling Prefecture.

As expected—

Without exception, every single one of them was experiencing some level of physical discomfort.

Some mild, some severe.

Even Green Willow Immortal Sage, the Dao Integration cultivator leading the team, found her thoughts unstable and struggled to maintain focus.

“This is bad.”

The terrifying legends surrounding the Immortal-Mortal Miasma flooded Li Xinhai’s mind all at once.

For a moment, his thoughts went completely blank.

When he finally regained his composure, he shared his suspicions with his companions.

Since his symptoms were the most severe among them, the others were still somewhat skeptical.

Especially Green Willow Immortal Sage, who couldn't help but reprimand him:

“How utterly ridiculous! The Immortal-Mortal Miasma was purified thousands of years ago. Aside from mortals, its existence has long vanished from the world. How could we possibly—”

"Cough, cough…!"

A sudden coughing fit cut her words short.

The group fell into a deathly silence.

“Stay where you are. Do not move around. I will personally head to headquarters… Cough, cough…”

Green Willow Immortal Sage no longer doubted the situation. However, her tone grew increasingly grave.

Thousands of years had passed, and the knowledge of the Immortal-Mortal Miasma had long faded into myth.

How to detect it…

The symptoms of infection…

The methods of purification…

All of this information had been buried by history, inaccessible to ordinary cultivators.

Even Green Willow Immortal Sage, despite her high status, knew next to nothing about it.

However, she understood the gravity of the situation.

First, she established contact with the headquarters. Then, she rushed to the Immortal Alliance headquarters at top speed.

The moment the teleportation light faded—

She was greeted by dozens of black-robed cultivators, standing in formation like mechanical puppets, awaiting her arrival.

After an extensive round of testing, Li Xinhai’s suspicions were finally confirmed.

The entire Qiling State Investigation Team—without exception—had been infected with the Immortal-Mortal Miasma!

Shock, confusion, terror… Original content can be found at novel{f}ire.net

Faced with an existential crisis, the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance reacted with astonishing speed.

An emergency task force was immediately established.

The investigation team members were gathered and placed under strict quarantine.

Then, puppet cultivators were dispatched to return to the underground of Qiling Prefecture, conducting a thorough investigation into the origin of the Immortal-Mortal Miasma.

Simultaneously, a wartime emergency status was declared—

All interstate teleportation formation were temporarily shut down.

Prefecture borders were sealed, prohibiting the movement of cultivators.

The crisis had begun.

…

Various measures were implemented simultaneously.

It must be said that in this regard, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance truly lived up to its status as one of the two great hegemons of the Xuanhuang Realm.

Unfortunately, despite the Alliance's swift response, it was still too late.

From the time the investigation team returned to the outbreak of symptoms, a full seven days had already passed.

By now, the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance has spread its teachings and formations to every corner of its territory.

Even though a large number of cultivators, influenced by the Devouring Essence Essence White Mist, would try to minimize their use of inter-state teleportation, the sheer scale of movement meant that countless cultivators were still frequently traveling between different states.

Seven days.

That was more than enough time for this mysterious outbreak of the Immortal-Mortal Miasma to spread to every state within the Alliance.

The sudden wartime state of the Immortal Alliance had already left cultivators deeply unsettled.

Many believed that full-scale war had erupted, catching the Alliance off guard and forcing it into such drastic measures.

Panic spread instantly.

But soon, the cultivators discovered that the reality was far worse than they had imagined.

It was not war—it was the shadow of an ancient catastrophe, once again descending upon the Xuanhuang lands after thousands of years!

The preliminary investigation into the Immortal-Mortal Miasma in Qiling Prefecture had already yielded results.

Long ago, the Immortal-Mortal Miasma had once permeated every corner of the world.

After relentless efforts by cultivators, it was believed to have been completely eradicated.

That was merely what the cultivators thought.

In reality, within an underground cavern in Qiling State, the Immortal-Mortal Miasma had endured for millennia without dissipating.

And as time passed, it seemed to have undergone some kind of mutation—

Becoming more concealed, more powerful.

The various methods recorded in history, though not entirely ineffective, had seen their effectiveness drastically reduced.

New strategies would have to be developed.

But before that could happen, the mutated Immortal-Mortal Miasma had already bared its ferocious, terrifying fangs.

In the current cultivation world, the vast majority of cultivators were concentrated in the floating heavenly cities of their respective prefecture.

The population density of cultivators was now even greater than that of the immortal sects in ancient times!

As a result, the spreading rate of the Immortal-Mortal Miasma was staggering!

By the time the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance issued its official announcement, the sound of coughing had already begun spreading throughout the land.

At first, under the comforting words of the Immortal Alliance’s doctrines, cultivators remained somewhat optimistic.

But as more and more cultivators perished due to the Immortal-Mortal Miasma, fear became inevitable.

The miasma made no distinctions.

Once infected, even Nascent Soul True Lords and Soul Transformation True Monarchs would suffer no less than those in the Foundation Establishment or Golden Core realms—their chances of survival were just as slim!

Desperate cultivators tried every possible method to delay the approach of death.

Yet none of them worked.

All they could do was wither away in agony, dying amidst the endless official announcements from the Immortal Alliance.

Mournful cries filled the land under the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

The same was true for Congyun Sea.

Fortunately, on Haixuan Island, the few members of the Mutual Aid Association who had remained were in seclusion, preparing for their cultivation exams.

As a result, no outsiders had come and gone during this period.

By sheer luck, they escaped this calamity.

However, at this point, none of them had the heart to continue their studies.

Clone Ji Shaoli shut down the teleportation formation and activated the island’s defensive formation, completely sealing off all contact with the outside world.

The only way they stayed informed was by monitoring external events through the Tianxuan Mirror.

"Truly, fate works in mysterious ways. Fortunately, I chose to seclude myself here for preparation. Fellow Daoist Zhang Mu and Fellow Daoist Sun Ying... they could not hold on any longer. They have fallen."

Zhang Mu and Sun Ying were both members of the Congyun Mutual Aid Association.

Among the thirteen Mutual Aid cultivators out in the world, two had already perished.

This alone was enough to show the terrifying lethality of the mutated Immortal-Mortal Miasma.

And the disastrous state the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance was now in under its rampage.

"The rest of our fellow Daoists are also in grave danger. They can barely speak properly now."

"Even though we are all brothers in the Mutual Aid Association, seeing them in such a state pains me. But letting them in is absolutely out of the question," Ji Shaoli said in a deep voice.

"This Immortal-Mortal Miasma is eerie and perilous, and we still haven't found a proper method to counter it. We are powerless."

Ji Shaoli paused, looking out beyond Haixuan Island, his expression unreadable.

"It is said that the Immortal-Mortal Miasma can even spread through spiritual energy. I have completely sealed the island’s connection to external spiritual energy. Fortunately, we have a stockpile of spirit stones on the island, so we should be fine for the short term."

"But as for cultivation… that is out of the question. We can only struggle to survive." Ji Shaoli turned back to the others, his face grim.

"Just having a safe place to stay is already a great blessing. We only need to endure until the Immortal Alliance comes up with a solution," the cultivators all sighed.

"What exactly is this Immortal-Mortal Miasma? It is said to exist within mortals, yet it is formless, tasteless, and intangible. How could it evade the Immortal Alliance's detection and spread across the world in such a short time?"

After a moment of silence, He Zhenghao asked again, full of confusion.

Deep in his eyes, a hint of worry flickered.

No one present, including Ji Shaoli, could answer.

A heavy silence fell over them.

What was the Immortal-Mortal Miasma?

At this moment, Li Fan also wanted to know the answer.

"Cough… Are you two alright?" He squinted at Tianyang and Lin Ling, both of whom appeared full of energy, and asked somewhat begrudgingly.

"Senior Brother, please say less and get some rest," Tianyang advised with concern.

"I’m fine… cough, cough…"

Before he could finish speaking, Li Fan was seized by a violent coughing fit.

It felt as if his internal organs were shattering and spilling out all at once.

Though he appeared to be critically ill, there was no trace of panic in his heart.

Instead, he remained calm, carefully sensing the changes happening within his body.

Seeing this, Tianyang couldn’t help but feel immense admiration.

"Shang Tianci's symptoms seem milder than mine, but he’s still having a hard time."

Scanning his body with his divine sense, Li Fan searched everywhere but found no trace of the culprit—the Immortal-Mortal Miasma.

He decisively gave up searching and instead pondered deeply.

"It has no physical form. Yet mortals, cultivators, and even spiritual energy serve as its carriers."

"Even after a thousand years, it could still mutate."

"Is this Immortal-Mortal Miasma truly a phenomenon that defies the natural order?"

A trace of doubt flashed in Li Fan’s mind.

After a brief moment of contemplation, he took out the communication talisman he had reserved for Master Yin and established contact.

A short moment later, Master Yin’s voice rang out.

“Fellow Daoist Li Fan, are you here because of the Immortal-Mortal Miasma?”

“Cough, cough… Daoist Yin, you’re actually fine?” Li Fan looked at the other party, who appeared full of vigor, and couldn’t help but feel a bit surprised.

“Haha, I’m not like you all. Perhaps it’s because I’ve been exposed to the Immortal-Mortal Miasma for years. I only felt unwell for a day or two before bouncing back full of energy!” Master Yin said with a smile.

Hearing this, Li Fan’s eyes flickered. “Fellow Daoist, you truly have good fortune. I, on the other hand, am growing weaker by the day. I fear I may not escape this calamity…”

“Fellow Daoist, don’t scare yourself. Rest well, and you will recover in time.” Master Yin replied indifferently.

“You’ve been infected for quite some time now, and since you can still speak normally, it means the situation isn’t too dire. Those truly in danger will find themselves on the brink of death within three to five days.” Master Yin explained with his professional insight.

“Then I shall take your auspicious words to heart.” Li Fan nodded.

After another bout of coughing, Li Fan steadied himself and asked again, “Fellow Daoist Yin, in terms of research on the Immortal-Mortal Miasma, there are likely few in this world who surpass you. What exactly is this miasma? How has it lingered for thousands of years and remained so terrifying?”

Master Yin was silent for a moment before speaking softly, “The Immortal-Mortal Miasma… is perhaps the product of cultivators going against the natural order.”

“Even mere mortals can kill immortals.”

“It disregards strength and weakness alike.”

Li Fan was puzzled. “If that’s the case, then what about the mutated Immortal-Mortal Miasma? If it already defies natural order, how could it change further?”

Master Yin shook his head. “Only its external form has changed. The principle it defies—has that ever changed?”

“Perhaps it’s because the ratio of cultivators to mortals is even greater than it was in ancient times. That’s why the destructive power of the Immortal-Mortal Miasma is far stronger than before.”

Li Fan pondered the implications of Master Yin’s words.

Then, a thought suddenly surfaced in his mind.

“Daoist Yin, according to your explanation, the Immortal-Mortal Miasma was created to protect mortals and eradicate cultivators.” The most update n0vels are published on Novᴇl_Fire(.)net

“Since it has reappeared and even mutated, does that not mean that the Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign, who defied this principle, still exists in this world?”

“Why have we never heard of this Heavenly Sovereign’s name?”

After a brief silence, Master Yin hesitated before answering, “Regarding this… I already have some thoughts.”

“But I cannot confirm them just yet.”
