“However, I am certain—if we can uncover this Heavenly Sovereign’s identity, then we won’t be far from fully unraveling the mystery of the Immortal-Mortal Miasma.”

His voice seemed to drift, as if carrying some hidden emotions.

Li Fan narrowed his eyes slightly.

But he did not press the matter further.

After a moment, he shifted the conversation, asking for Master Yin’s opinion on the projected spread of the Immortal-Mortal Miasma.

“Daoist Friend, there is no need for concern. The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance has some experience in handling the Immortal-Mortal Miasma.”

“At present, we only seem passive because we have yet to find a way to suppress the mutated miasma.”

“But that solution should come soon.”

“As long as we handle it properly, the outcome of this Immortal-Mortal Miasma will be the same as it was thousands of years ago—it will vanish once more.”

“It will only remain dormant within mortal bodies, serving as a deterrent.” Master Yin’s tone carried a hint of something indescribable.

Within his words, there seemed to be hidden emotions.

Li Fan, on the other hand, appeared lost in thought.

"Actually, I have a premonition."

"Even if we cultivators do nothing, this Immortal-Mortal Miasma will never wipe out cultivators completely."

"At most, it will reduce the overall number of cultivators to a certain level. It is both merciless and merciful at the same time."

After a long silence, Master Yin concluded the communication with these words.

"Cough, cough."

After some contemplation, Li Fan inquired further about the plight of mortals under the outbreak of the mutated Immortal-Mortal Miasma.

Perhaps it was because mortals still carried traces of the miasma within their bodies.

For cultivators, this was a terrifying calamity, but for mortals, its impact was minimal—

It was even less harmful than an ordinary flu.

"I wonder how the Immortal Alliance plans to handle this aftermath. Will this mutated Immortal-Mortal Miasma once again be absorbed into the bodies of mortals, refusing to dissipate? Will there be another great migration?"

Thoughts surged in Li Fan’s mind.

Though his body was suffering, his sharp thinking remained unaffected.

"It seems that for mortals, this Immortal-Mortal Miasma acts as a protective talisman. However, if one insists on pursuing the path of immortality, stepping onto the Dao, then one must abandon this protective talisman."

"So, immortals and mortals are fundamentally incompatible..."

In today's Xuanhuang Realm, there were still only two conventional methods to expel the miasma from one’s body:

The Purification Spirit Pool, invented by the Eastern Extremity Heavenly Sovereign.

The Xuanhuang Tranquil Heart Mantra.

However, both methods only worked for mortals born with the miasma—

For cultivators who were infected later in life, they were ineffective.

"Even though they share the same name, the Immortal-Mortal Miasma manifests in different forms."

Li Fan furrowed his brows slightly, then after a moment, gave up thinking further.

"Forget it. Professional matters should be left to the professionals."

"With this new outbreak of the Immortal-Mortal Miasma, Master Yin’s research will surely advance as well. Perhaps the mystery of the miasma will be unraveled even sooner than expected."

"No rush. I’ll just wait."

With the regions under lockdown and cultivators living in constant fear, everything had come to a standstill.

Li Fan took advantage of this time to focus on cultivation.

He aimed to absorb the Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven and re-enter the Nascent Soul stage.

Even without relying on the feedback cultivation from the Sitting Immortal Art, he was now much faster than before due to his prior experience in cultivation.

With an abundance of resources, his progress was steady—

Though not at the speed of a thousand miles in a single day, he was improving daily.

He was already close to reaching the perfected Golden Core stage.

Seeing Li Fan persistently cultivating despite his illness deeply moved Lin Ling, Tianyang, and Shang Tianci from the Spiritwood Realm.

They were filled with shame.

Motivated by his example, they reduced their idle time and pushed themselves to work harder.

Time passed, and six months after the outbreak of the mutated Immortal-Mortal Miasma, a breakthrough finally arrived.

The Immortal Alliance developed a special elixir—

Cultivators who consumed it experienced a significant reduction in their symptoms.

For those who had not yet been infected, taking it in advance did not grant complete immunity but greatly reduced the likelihood of dying from the illness.

It was nothing short of a divine medicine.

Surprisingly, the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance was uncharacteristically generous this time.

Not only did all cultivators within the alliance receive the elixir for free.

Even rogue cultivators who were unaffiliated with the alliance were given the same benefit.

For a time, cultivators across the realm were filled with gratitude, praising the Immortal Alliance for its benevolence.

Many cultivators who previously held prejudices against the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance chose to join it on the spot after receiving treatment.

With the special-effect elixir, cultivators gradually recovered.

The Immortal Alliance also dispatched cultivators to purify the world once more, dispersing the Immortal-Mortal Miasma that pervaded the land.

At this moment, Li Fan, who had already fully recovered, squinted his eyes as he stared at the so-called "special-effect elixir" in his hand.

He had already consumed one pill earlier.

Aside from experiencing mild symptoms of reinfection by the Immortal-Mortal Miasma, he also felt an intoxicating sensation, as if his soul was soaking in a warm spring.

"This is..."

"The Heart-Desires Ascension Pill?"

Li Fan's expression turned strange.

In his 115th lifetime, he had once taken this very pill, which had been banned by the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

Although this version was significantly weakened, the experience of consuming it was nearly identical to that of the Heart-Desires Ascension Pill.

As the Sect Master of the Medicine King Sect, even though Li Fan was not an expert in pharmacology, he could still discern the mechanism of this special-effect elixir.

It accelerated the outbreak of the Immortal-Mortal Miasma within a cultivator's body while using a strong euphoric effect to suppress the pain caused by the infection.

"No wonder the Immortal Alliance has a rule that each cultivator can only take one pill at most."

"If someone were to take too many, who knows what might happen..."

Carefully analyzing his own thoughts, Li Fan once again looked at the pill in his hand.

He confirmed that he did not have an overwhelming urge to take another one.

"Just one shouldn't be an issue."

Li Fan nodded slightly. ᴛʜɪs ᴄʜᴀᴘᴛᴇʀ ɪs ᴜᴘᴅᴀᴛᴇ ʙʏ novel⚑fire.net

"It seems the number of cultivator deaths has been quite high."

"The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance is clearly resorting to emergency measures, forced to bring this out."

"However, if it can stabilize the situation for now, it could be considered an effective remedy."

Crushing the special-effect elixir into powder, Li Fan closed his eyes, his spiritual sense enveloping the vast Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven below.

After six months of arduous cultivation, he was now infinitely close to achieving a perfect Golden Core.

He was only one step away from opening the path to devouring a Cave-Heaven.

Moreover, he had a strong premonition—

This time, there would still be no Heavenly Calamity!

All he needed to do was wait.

"The Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven is vast; it will take at least two to three years."

"As for the affairs of the Federation of All Worlds, Tianyang and Lin Ling can handle them, so operations won’t come to a halt."

With these thoughts in mind, Li Fan swept his spiritual sense across every inch of the Five Elements Cave-Heaven, perfectly mapping its entire landscape into his mind.

A year after the outbreak of the Mutated Immortal-Mortal Miasma—

Cultivators had already grown accustomed to its presence.

After all, nearly every cultivator had been infected at least once.

Those who couldn’t withstand it had already returned to the Dao.

The survivors had developed sufficient immunity.

Although occasional reinfections still occurred, they were rare.

They no longer posed a significant threat to the overall situation.

Furthermore, the second batch of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance’s special-effect elixirs had been successfully developed and distributed to cultivators.

The shadow of the Immortal-Mortal Miasma was gradually dissipating.

Congyun Sea, Haixuan Island.

"This feels like a lifetime ago!"

The island, which had been sealed off for a year, was finally reopened.

After taking two rounds of the special-effect elixir, the effects of the immortal-mortal miasma had faded within just half a day.

Breathing in the fresh spiritual energy, He Zhenghao and the others couldn’t help but sigh with emotion.

My Longevity Simulation

"The original preparation time was only six months. But now, due to the influence of the Immortal-Mortal Miasma, the entrance examination has been forced to postpone indefinitely. No one knows when it will be held, but I’m already eager to take the test."

"Cough cough." He Zhenghao cleared his throat lightly, but his face was filled with unwavering confidence.

"Turning misfortune into a blessing, indeed!" The others sighed in agreement.

"Even though we have taken two rounds of special medicine, you still must not underestimate the Immortal-Mortal Miasma," Ji Shaoli solemnly reminded them.

"A rather shocking incident recently occurred. In Congyun Sea, a cultivator named Wen Yue, believing himself immune to the miasma after having been infected once, wanted to test whether the Immortal-Mortal Miasma residing in mortals would still affect him.

"In front of many cultivators, he infused his own body with the blood of a mortal."

"As a result, he died instantly, reduced to a pile of bones. The scene was truly horrifying," Ji Shaoli sighed.

He Zhenghao and the others were dumbfounded. "There are actually people foolish enough to gamble with their own lives?"

Then, a sudden realization struck them. "So, our supposed immunity to the Immortal-Mortal Miasma… is nothing but an illusion?"

 

Ji Shaoli nodded slightly. "The Immortal Alliance has already issued an official statement explaining this matter. The existence of the Immortal-Mortal Miasma is a law of heaven and earth. One may adapt to its presence, but it will never truly disappear."

 

"So, in the end, nothing has changed? We only lost a great number of cultivators for nothing?" He Zhenghao muttered, feeling a sense of helplessness.

Pei Tuo clenched his teeth in anger. "Damn it! If I ever reach the Dao Integration realm, I will defy this law!"

"Brother Pei, what great ambition!"

The group was filled with emotion.

After a while, Ji Shaoli raised his hand to interrupt their discussion.

"It’s fine to vent a little. But in the end, all we can do is endure and survive."

"In fact, this sudden outbreak of the mutated Immortal-Mortal Miasma might not be entirely a bad thing for us who have survived," Ji Shaoli said in a low voice.

"Oh? What do you mean?" The others immediately focused their attention on him.

"Do you all know how many cultivators in the system were lost just in Congyun Sea alone during this catastrophe?" Ji Shaoli asked with a mysterious smile.

Seeing the sudden glint in their eyes, he transmitted a number to them through voice transmission.

"Over five hundred?"

The group gasped in shock.

"Exactly. If this is the case in Congyun Sea, then one can only imagine how dire the situation is across the entire world."

"The positions left vacant by the fallen cultivators… these are opportunities for us, the survivors," Ji Shaoli said meaningfully.

"While most cultivators are still grieving the disaster brought by the Immortal-Mortal Miasma, those with foresight have already begun making moves in the shadows."

His words caused the entire group to stir with excitement.

"Daoist friend Ji, then should we still participate in the entrance examination?"

"Yes, we’ve prepared thoroughly, but the competition will surely be even fiercer this time…"

The group looked at each other with uncertain expressions.

Ji Shaoli spoke in a steady voice, "If nothing unexpected happens, this entrance examination will likely be larger in scale than ever before—not only in terms of the number of recruited cultivators but also in the quality of the positions offered!"

"Positions that previously required decades of training to obtain may now be given directly to top scorers!"

"So in my opinion, it's worth taking the risk and competing in the examination!"

"This could be the chance to leap over the dragon gate and change our destinies!"

The fire in their eyes burned even brighter, especially in He Zhenghao’s.

"Furthermore, aside from positions within the system, valuable resources such as cultivation techniques and cave abodes are also likely to be made more accessible. In short, the Immortal Alliance's top priority right now is to restore its strength to pre-catastrophe levels at any cost," Ji Shaoli added.

"Daoist Ji, are you saying that the Immortal Alliance is worried that the Five Elders Association will take advantage of this period of weakness?" someone asked.

"Still, it's strange. When the Immortal Alliance was at its weakest, the Five Elders Association didn’t launch an attack."

"What’s there to be confused about? If we suffered an outbreak of the Immortal-Mortal Miasma, do you think they would have remained unscathed? I’d wager that the Five Elders Association also suffered heavy losses. Now, it’s simply a race to see who can recover faster—whoever does will gain the upper hand in the ongoing struggle."

"Regardless, this is undoubtedly a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity for us ordinary cultivators."

…

Silently listening to the discussions around him, Ji Shaoli did not offer any explanations.

In fact, he had previously sent Lin Ling to make contact with the Five Elders Association.

While using the Immortal Alliance's official entry examination question bank to make a significant profit, he had also secretly investigated the situation of the Five Elders Association amidst the outbreak of the Immortal-Mortal Miasma.

Compared to the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance at the outbreak site, their losses were significantly smaller.

Due to the slight delay in the spread of the Immortal-Mortal Miasma, by the time it reached the territory of the Five Elders Association, they had already received news of its outbreak within the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

They took precautions in advance.

Furthermore, the Five Elders Association is governed by five revered figures.

A series of orders were issued, and all cultivators obediently stayed within their homes, greatly slowing the spread of the Immortal-Mortal Miasma.

The most critical aspect was how to handle the Immortal-Mortal Miasma.

In reality, the Five Elders Association had far more detailed records on the matter than the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

After all, in the ancient cultivation era, it was precisely the cultivation sects that faced the Immortal-Mortal Miasma head-on.

The specific measures taken were not disclosed.

However, it was true that the Five Elders Association had not suffered major losses in this catastrophe.

The only point of confusion on their side was that the Heavenly Sovereign had personally issued an edict, rejecting the plan to take advantage of the chaos and launch an attack on the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

The command of the Heavenly Sovereign was absolute.

They could only continue gathering strength, preparing to deliver a fatal blow to the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

In the Beast Realm.

Lin Ling and Tianyang did not unleash their full power.

Instead, they suppressed their strength to the Soul Transformation realm, engaging in battle against the endless tide of beastkin.

This was naturally Li Fan’s order.

Aside from collecting beast cores as raw materials for the Immortal Spirit Tower’s energy conversion, the more important goal was for Lin Ling and Tianyang to temper their actual combat abilities through battle.

Tianyang was fine.

However, in her previous fight with Ink Stone, Lin Ling—being a newly born tree spirit—had almost no combat awareness. She relied entirely on instinct to execute her attacks, which was unbefitting of someone at the Dao Integration stage.

Thus, Li Fan instructed Tianyang to guide her, using this rare period of stability in the Beast Realm for training.

No one knew how many beastkind had already been slain.

Bathed in endless blood, Lin Ling’s once youthful and innocent face had begun to carry traces of killing intent.

Her combat techniques became more fluid, and even images would occasionally surface in her mind, naturally guiding her on how to fight more efficiently.

Her actual combat strength grew at an astonishing pace.

They gazed toward the distant tower.

As long as they reached its peak, Li Fan’s orders would be fulfilled.

The exotic beasts of the Beast Realm gradually sensed that something was wrong.

Although the two intruders only revealed Soul Transformation cultivation, they stood firm like an unshakable boulder against the endless waves of beasts. In fact, they grew stronger the more they fought!

A series of mournful beast roars echoed throughout the entire Beast Realm.

In the sky, the winds and clouds shifted drastically. Above the central black tower, a massive vortex took shape.

Within the vortex, the faint image of a Mysterious Black Bird could be seen.

For the first time, Tianyang and Lin Ling's expressions turned solemn.

But that was all.

Just like in the previous life, when Elder Liu of the Medicine King Sect swept through this realm—

Even though the remnant shadow of Xiao Hei was summoned, calling upon the will of the Beast Realm to fight back—

Following Li Fan's instructions, they killed the most powerful exotic beasts and extracted their beast cores.

Then, they designated an area to gather and confine the remaining beast species.

Afterward, the two moved on to their next task.

Similarly, they transferred the entrance to the Beast Realm into the Spiritwood Realm.

Having previously relocated the entrance of the Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven, this time they handled the process smoothly and completed the task swiftly.

When Ou Daozi was designing the "Federation of All Worlds" headquarters, he deliberately reserved a plot of land.

Specifically for placing the gateways connecting to different worlds.

At the moment, it was still small in scale. However, once more small worlds were connected in the future, it would truly live up to the name "Federation of All Worlds."

Of course, security was also a crucial concern.

The more gateways there were, the greater the risk of potential breaches.

Ou Daozi considered a spatial nesting solution, planning to separate the area containing these world entrances into relatively independent, disposable nested spaces.

If a catastrophe ever occurred, they could sever the connection and sacrifice it to survive.

However, this was still in the conceptual stage.

Even though Tianyang had absorbed the "Ink Stone," it would still take time for him to master the ability to sever space at will.

There were priorities to attend to.

Once the integration of the Beast Realm and the Spiritwood Realm was complete, Tianyang proceeded to Great Li Realm, following Li Fan's instructions.

By this time, the "Immortal Spirit Tower" left behind by Li Fan had already exhausted its supply of beast cores.

Without the production of spiritual energy, the cultivation of those in Great Li was gradually reaching a dead end.

Exploration of the Fire World was still in its early stages.

With no other choice, Su Yuqing sent an urgent request for help to Li Fan via communication talisman.

Tianyang did not conceal his presence.

As soon as he appeared, the pressure of a Dao Integration cultivator descended—

Covering all of Great Li Realm in an oppressive darkness, as if thick storm clouds had enveloped the realm.

The uninformed masses were stricken with fear.

Only Su Yuqing was overjoyed.

Facing Su Yuqing’s respectful greeting, Tianyang remained silent.

He simply restored the operation of the Immortal Spirit Tower, and then linked Great Li Realm to the Spiritwood Realm.

"When the supply of immortal spirit energy runs dry again, you may venture to the Beast Realm to hunt and replenish the necessary beast cores."

"The Beast Realm is far more dangerous than Great Li Realm. You must strive to improve your cultivation as much as possible. If you require rare treasures or cultivation techniques, you may apply for them at the Federations headquarters."

Tianyang spoke concisely.

Su Yuqing nodded repeatedly in agreement.

In fact, at the beginning, Li Fan had considered directly channeling spiritual energy from the Spiritwood Realm into Great Li Realm.

However, after careful consideration, he ultimately dismissed the idea.

After all, worlds without spiritual energy were the majority.

The Spiritwood Realm could sustain one realm, but what about ten? A hundred?

It was far more practical to use Immortal Spirit Towers to gradually transform each realm.

Of course, this would require an astronomical amount of beast cores.

Once he broke through, Li Fan planned to take Tianyang on a journey to the Empire.

The Federation of All Worlds was thriving and developing steadily.

Haixuan Island.

As Ji Shaoli had predicted—

With the release of the latest announcement from the Immortal Alliance, an unprecedented entrance examination is about to take place.

Compared to previous years, the number of available positions has more than doubled.

Even the overall benefits for cultivators within the Immortal Alliance system have seen a significant increase.

Countless cultivators eagerly signed up, hoping to change their fates.

However, despite being well-prepared and full of confidence, He Zhenghao appeared somewhat restless.

"Fellow Daoist He, is something on your mind?" Ji Shaoli asked.

He Zhenghao seemed lost in thought, as if he hadn't heard anything at all.

He remained completely unresponsive.

"Fellow Daoist He!" Ji Shaoli furrowed his brows and called out again.

Only then did He Zhenghao snap out of it.

"Huh?"

"It seems like you're hiding something from us, Fellow Daoist He." Ji Shaoli smiled.

He Zhenghao's strange behavior had started two days ago—after he made a brief trip to Ten Thousand Immortals Island.

Since they all shared a common secret, the cultivators of the Mutual Aid Association immediately sensed something was off upon hearing this.

They all fixed their gazes on He Zhenghao, their expressions turning unfriendly.

"It's a misunderstanding! A complete misunderstanding!" He Zhenghao forced a bitter smile and quickly explained.

"It's not what you think. The reason I've been so absent-minded lately is..."

He hesitated for a moment before finally sighing in resignation and pulling out a picture book.

His old face flushed red.

"The culprit... is this."

The crowd exchanged bewildered glances.

Ji Shaoli maintained a calm expression on the surface, but his heart sank.

With a flick of his hand, he grabbed the picture book and flipped through the first few pages. Then, he abruptly closed it.

"Where did you get this?" Ji Shaoli asked gravely.

The book contained explicit illustrations about "One-Heart Heavenly Sovereign" and their intimate escapades.

Though not as immersive as the illusions Li Fan had once experienced, the content still had its own unique allure—enough to captivate a cultivator’s mind.

No wonder He Zhenghao had been so dazed these past few days.

"I got it from a Daoist friend of mine. He acted all mysterious, claiming it was something valuable. I ended up spending 500 contribution points on it."

"Although... I have to admit, it's actually quite good." He Zhenghao muttered under his breath.

"What exactly is in that book?"

The more He Zhenghao spoke, the more curious the others became.

Ji Shaoli only revealed a portion of the book’s contents to the group.

At first, the cultivators scoffed, mocking He Zhenghao.

"Fellow Daoist He, you're at least a Foundation Establishment cultivator. How could you let something like this affect your mind?"

But when He Zhenghao revealed the true identity of the book’s protagonist, everyone was stunned.

Their eyes instantly changed as they stared at the picture book in Ji Shaoli’s hands.

Ji Shaoli let out a cold snort, snapping them out of their reveries with a stern remark:

"One with the masses… One with the heart?"

"If you sink too deeply into this, you risk being assimilated?"

The crowd’s faces turned pale.

He Zhenghao was especially shaken, his body trembling uncontrollably.

"Fortunately, you haven’t fallen too deep yet."

"Fellow Daoist He, you must enter seclusion immediately and rid yourself of all distractions." Ji Shaoli ordered sternly.

Panicked and overwhelmed, He Zhenghao instinctively obeyed Ji Shaoli’s instructions.

After locking He Zhenghao away in a secluded chamber to reflect, Ji Shaoli reassured the group before discreetly investigating—

The extent to which Senior Sister Zhao’s illustrated book had spread within the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance.

The situation was even worse than expected.

It wasn’t just Congyun Sea.

Across various regions of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, the illustrated books of Senior Sister Zhao were secretly circulating.

Cultivators have their own pride.

Naturally, they wouldn’t openly admit to secretly browsing such books.

However, the content of these illustrated books was truly captivating.

As long as one's will wasn’t exceptionally strong, after viewing them, they would inevitably be overwhelmed with endless thoughts and become mentally unsettled.

Even seeking out other cultivators to vent their desires couldn’t dispel the obsession.

They only wanted to see more illustrated books about Senior Sister Zhao.

Step by step, they lured cultivators further into the abyss.

The most critical aspect was that the timing was impeccable.

From top to bottom, the entire Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance was focused on the grand-scale entry examination.

No one noticed that, in an unnoticed corner, something extremely dangerous was spreading silently within the alliance.

“Can’t wait to start testing the waters already?”

“Have they already realized that the Immortal Ancestor has left the Xuanhuang Realm?”

Ji Shaoli’s expression was unreadable.

The methods of the Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign were beyond comprehension.

Even a weaker Longevity Immortal could effortlessly overwhelm ordinary cultivators. It was almost impossible to guard against.

Even Dao Integration-level cultivators still fell within this "ordinary" category.

Thus, Ji Shaoli wasn’t surprised at all that He Zhenghao fell into the trap.

Even though He Zhenghao constantly thought about his wife and daughter, after seeing Senior Sister Zhao’s scandalous deeds, his soul was completely ensnared.

One had to understand—even though He Zhenghao was no longer worth Li Fan’s attention, he was still an outstanding cultivator.

Without power or influence, he fought his way up alone.

Even under suppression, he managed to become a guardian of an island and made significant achievements in formation techniques, allowing him to converse on equal footing with the many formation masters of the Formation Hall…

There were countless cultivators weaker than him!

Yet, even he succumbed to Senior Sister Zhao’s illustrated books.

One could only imagine how other cultivators would fare.

“This is a hundred times more dangerous than the Heart-Desires Ascension Pill.”

“And yet, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance allowed it to spread unnoticed.”

“Should I warn them…?”

Ji Shaoli was hesitant.

Even though he wanted to see the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance suffer a crushing defeat and be forced to reveal their last trump card…

When facing the means of the One-Heart Heavenly Sovereign, he couldn’t help but feel a trace of fear in his heart.

“The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance should have its own countermeasures. It’s not my concern.”

After contemplating for a moment, Ji Shaoli ultimately chose not to interfere.

Instead, he simply instructed the cultivators within the Mutual Aid Association:

Do not, under any circumstances, let curiosity lead you to look at these illustrated books.

At the same time, he ordered them to closely observe any subtle changes in the shadows.

But soon, Ji Shaoli realized that he had underestimated the abilities of the One-Heart Heavenly Sovereign.

As the saying goes—curiosity killed the cat.

Simply knowing the danger was not enough to completely suppress one’s thoughts.

Moreover, after learning that the subject of these illustrated books was none other than a top-tier powerhouse of the Xuanhuang Realm, a Heavenly Sovereign of the Five Elders Association…

They became even more curious about the book’s contents.

At the same time, they carried a hint of luck and confidence in their own willpower.

"It’s just a glance. It shouldn’t be a big deal… right?"

Once such a thought emerged, it was impossible to erase.

Instead, as time passed, their obsession only grew stronger.

Their minds became restless.

Desires that could not be satisfied began to expand without limit.

By the time Ji Shaoli realized something was wrong, three members of the Mutual Aid Association had already succumbed.

Unable to resist, they secretly acquired the illustrated books and indulged in them.

Shocked, Ji Shaoli had no choice but to lock them away in a dark chamber.

Supervising them as they purified their minds.

“This is truly impossible to guard against…”

Hearing the voices filled with resentment and curses coming from the darkness, along with their frenzied and deranged behavior, Ji Shaoli's expression flickered.

"This is only the early stage, and I immediately cut off its influence."

"But those cultivators who have already fallen deep into it..."

A chill crept into Ji Shaoli's heart.

"Although Senior Sister Zhao may be somewhat weak in actual combat, her influence over cultivators is truly no less than that of any Heavenly Sovereign."

To prevent more members of the Mutual Aid Association from falling into this trap, Ji Shaoli decisively recalled all of them.

Once again, he sealed off Haixuan Island.

"There's still some time before the entrance examination. I refuse to believe that the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance is completely unaware of this."

"Let’s see how they respond."

Just as Ji Shaoli had expected.

As more and more cultivators fell under the influence of Senior Sister Zhao’s illustrated book, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance finally began to take notice.

And the measures they took provided Ji Shaoli with an invaluable lesson.

They did not make a grand public effort to ban the circulation of the illustrated book.

In fact, the officials did not even mention the book's existence at all.

Instead, almost overnight, thousands of different secret tomes suddenly began to circulate within the alliance.

All of these had previously been banned and prohibited from distribution or trade.

Among them was even the This text is hosted at novel_fіre.net

"Illustration of the Immortal Ancestor Seizing the Supreme Primordial True Scripture."

which Li Fan had come across before.

As well as "Devouring Father, Consuming Mother: The Demon Infant's Tale of Forgetting Worries", "The Scholar’s Boastful Words Sever the River Illusion Diagram", and many others...

There were both written texts and illustrated records.

Their contents were bizarre and mysterious, with each one unique. Some even directly contradicted one another.

But they all had one thing in common—

They were all related to the five Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereigns of the Five Elders Association.

Previously, the cultivators of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance only knew that these five Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereigns existed within the Five Elders Association.

Beyond that, they knew nothing.

Now, with so many secret revelations appearing all at once, they naturally captured everyone's attention.

Soon, the contents of these books became the hottest topic within the alliance.

No matter where one went, cultivators could be found discussing them.

Even those who usually paid no attention to worldly affairs were drawn in by the fervor of widespread debate and curiosity.

Ji Shaoli also noticed that, under these circumstances, the allure of Senior Sister Zhao’s illustrated book had unknowingly weakened.

Among the secret tomes released by the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, many naturally contained information about One-Heart Heavenly Sovereign.

They did not deliberately downplay the erotic aspects; rather, they interwove thrilling and inspirational tales of a mighty figure rising from obscurity to revive their sect—while still incorporating plenty of stimulating and blood-boiling content.

Yet, while these accounts were indeed captivating, compared to the illustrations spread by the Five Elders Association—

They lacked that fatal temptation.

After reading them, people would not become obsessed to the point of losing their appetite and sleep.

They would feel a surge of excitement but then quickly forget about it.

Ji Shaoli mused, "Once the veil of mystery is lifted, the allure diminishes in layers."

"After reading it once, seeing it again becomes dull and uninteresting. Of course, they don’t realize that the versions of Senior Sister Zhao’s illustrated book distributed by the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and the Five Elders Association are actually two completely different things."

"And naturally, this atmosphere of widespread discussion itself acts as another barrier."

"A person's energy is limited. When attention is focused on one thing, it inevitably reduces awareness of everything else."

"Moreover, the high-quality illustrated books imbued with Senior Sister Zhao’s true power have already been drowned in the countless crude imitations mass-produced by the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance. As a result, the influence of [One-Heart Heavenly Sovereign] has been minimized to the greatest extent possible."

"What a brilliant move! I’ve learned something from this."

Ji Shaoli, who saw through all the tactics of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, couldn't help but sigh in admiration.

After a brief moment, however, he frowned slightly. "But this approach only mitigates the damage. It does not completely eliminate Senior Sister Zhao’s influence..."

"The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance must have a follow-up plan."

As expected, Ji Shaoli’s prediction was accurate.

While the majority of the alliance's cultivators were engrossed in the deliberately manufactured controversy, there remained a small group unsatisfied with the imitation books. They tirelessly sought out the real, more exquisite editions.

But what they didn't know was that every copy circulating in the market had already been secretly monitored by the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance. It was merely a matter of time before the net was cast.

The moment the transaction was completed, they were all captured in one fell swoop.

Arrested under the charge of attempting to overthrow the Immortal Alliance.

All of this happened so quietly beneath the waves of heated discussions that, had Ji Shaoli not been paying close attention to these cultivators, he might never have noticed their sudden disappearance.

Misdirection and entrapment—two strategies combined.

After more than three months, the initial ripple effect caused by Senior Sister Zhao’s test run had finally been neutralized by the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

"Although it seems like the alliance has won this round, in truth, they have lost."

Ji Shaoli shook his head in secret. "What did the Five Elders Association sacrifice for this disturbance? Nothing more than some mass-produced illustrated books. But the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance had to invest immense time and effort just to suppress the matter."

"They may have contained the situation this time, but the Five Elders Association can strike again at any moment, at little cost. Meanwhile, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance must always remain on high alert. This is the overwhelming advantage of a Heavenly Sovereign's power."

"The decline of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance is becoming increasingly apparent…"

"Still, I hope that moving forward, it can bring me some surprises."

...

No topic remains hot forever.

As time passed, the cultivators' attention toward the leaked secret books gradually waned.

Replacing it was the upcoming entrance examination for the Immortal Alliance, which was finally about to begin.

The reason for the unprecedented level of interest in this examination was not only its massive scale but also due to a bombshell announcement made by the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance not long ago.

To counter the ever-watchful Five Elders Association, the alliance planned to select thirty-three [Chosen Immortals] through this examination.

These individuals would carry the hope of resisting the Five Elders Association.

Once selected as a [Chosen Immortal], they would receive unlimited support from the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

Everything required for cultivation—elixirs, techniques, cave-heaven, transformation blessings, and even the very spirit of heaven and earth itself—

The Alliance would provide it all, free of charge!

Regardless of their previous cultivation level, within ten years, they would undoubtedly reach the Dao Integration realm!

For this selection of [Chosen Immortals], neither family background nor innate talent in cultivation mattered.

The only criterion was an individual's capability—

Could they play a unique role in the coming battle against the Five Elders Association?

The announcement sent the Alliance’s cultivators into a frenzy.

After all, most cultivators considered themselves extraordinary.

Even if they were temporarily stuck at a bottleneck in their cultivation, they rarely blamed themselves—

Instead, they attributed their stagnation to external factors such as lack of superior techniques or insufficient resources.

"If I were to achieve Dao Integration, wouldn't I be far stronger than those who rely on family protection to ascend? At the very least, I wouldn't be retreating step by step under the assault of the Five Elders Association..."

The moment this announcement was heard, countless cultivators had the same thought flash through their minds.

Their blood ran hot, and without hesitation, they rushed toward the examination registration site.

Even Ji Shaoli felt a momentary temptation.

But it was only for a brief instant.

Everything comes at a price. The cost of being forcibly accelerated into Dao Integration was something he might not be able to bear.

His clone was deeply tied to his original self’s secrets, so he would never take such a risk.

However, thinking about it another way—even if he wanted to, it was unlikely he would be chosen.

Under the rule of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, the number of cultivators was vast. Yet only thirty-three individuals would be selected...

Some of them might not fit the traditional definition of a genius, but each would undoubtedly have their own unique advantages. Read complete version only at n͟o͟v͟e͟l͟f͟i͟r͟e͟.net

There were those who had simply been unlucky but were not weaker than others—they just lacked an opportunity.

If they could seize the right moment, they could rise with the wind and laugh proudly above the Nine Heavens!

Ji Shaoli had no doubt that among these thirty-three, some unknown figures would emerge in this selection, shining brightly and astonishing the entire Xuanhuang realm.

But he still had lingering doubts in his heart.

Placing hope in these "Chosen Immortals" to resist the Five Elders Association—did that not imply that the current rulers were unfit for leadership?

Why would the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance make such a self-contradictory move?

Not to mention the mysterious Immortal Ancestors—even the powerful souls of past geniuses chosen across generations had not taken action.

Could the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance truly be so incompetent?

"Unless... these thirty-three so-called stars of hope..."

"Are just a cover."

"They serve another purpose."

Ji Shaoli's gaze flickered with thought.

Under the attention of all, the grand examination of the Immortal Alliance officially began.

Its scale far surpassed that of previous years.

Lasting a full month, all participating cultivators would enter the examination grounds through the Tianxuan Mirror Portals of each region.

Until the exam ended, the testing grounds would be completely sealed off and isolated from the outside world.

Due to the sheer number of cultivators taking part, many regions of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance became eerily empty.

For an entire month, the alliance’s internal defenses were weak.

To prevent a sneak attack from the Five Elders Association, the Immortal Alliance not only deployed heavy troops along the borders for strict defense...

But also silently launched a counterattack.

Inside the Spiritwood Realm.

Li Fan, who had temporarily halted the process of devouring the Five Elements Grand Cave-Heaven, looked at the diamond-like glowing orb that Lin Ling handed him with a solemn expression.

This item had been sent by the Five Elders Association.

As a "business partner" who had successfully traded with them multiple times, Li Fan was surprised that they had taken the initiative to seek help this time.

It was said that this glowing orb had caused considerable trouble for the Five Elders Association.

And they had yet to find a solution.

Out of desperation, they had reached out, hoping that the Federation of All Worlds might have some information on it.

Li Fan held the radiant orb in his hand and sent a strand of spiritual sense into it.

In the next instant, his vision changed dramatically.

His connection to his original body was severed.

The strand of spiritual sense had entered a new body.

At the same time, an overwhelming flood of information surged into his mind.

The body he had possessed belonged to an ordinary mortal.

It took him several days, enduring waves of splitting headaches, to fully absorb all the information.

Li Fan's expression turned strange.

This radiant orb contained an entirely fictional space-time.

Disasters were rampant, and corpses littered the land.

The common folk longed only for a full meal, but even that was an unattainable dream.

In despair, they rose in rebellion.

Smoke of war filled the skies across the land, and the body Li Fan had possessed belonged to an insignificant member of one such rebel army.

Because he had been dazed from absorbing knowledge, others thought he had fallen ill with a strange disease.

He was sent to the army medic for treatment.

This medic, Bai Moxiu, had some skill—he merely glanced at Li Fan and prescribed a calming remedy.

As Li Fan came back to his senses and was about to leave, a notification suddenly appeared before his eyes:

"Discovered a genius strategist: Bai Moxiu."

"Current Favorability: 1."

Li Fan's expression turned even stranger.

"What is the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance trying to pull here?"

For now, he didn’t engage further with the army medic Bai Moxiu. Instead, he wandered around the rebel camp.

Within just three or four days, he discovered a "peerless general", two "ancient divine weapons", and countless other promising talents.

Some had vague favorability prompts, while others even had strategy hints—revealing their interests, personality, and weaknesses in detail.

This piqued Li Fan’s interest.

Following the prompts, he approached them, catering to their preferences.

In no time, he went from being an unknown nobody in the rebel army to gaining some renown.

A little over ten days later, he even received a warning that the government troops would launch a night raid.

Yet, he chose not to alert anyone. Instead, he secretly gathered a group of trusted followers and made preparations in the shadows.

When the night raid struck, the rebel army collapsed instantly.

Li Fan, however, led his followers and barely escaped with their lives.

As the leader who had ensured their survival, he gradually established his authority.

Following another prompt, he led a mere hundred men on a daring assault, seizing a small, poorly defended city where the local army had been deployed to suppress bandits.

Now, he had a foothold.

From this stronghold, he gradually annexed neighboring forces.

Within just five years, he had unified the land, overthrown the corrupt dynasty, and ascended as the founding emperor of a new era.

At that moment, the scene before him shattered layer by layer.

Everything dissolved into nothingness.

Just as Li Fan was contemplating the meaning behind this illusion, the world before him shifted once again.

Another fictional space-time emerged.

This time, it was a cultivation world.

The body he had possessed belonged to a mortal boy, rejected by the Taichu Sect for lacking spiritual roots.

Desperate, the boy had pleaded, earning only a menial disciple position.

He had expected a lifetime of hardship.

But fate had other plans.

One day, by sheer luck, he stumbled upon a stone bead in the sect’s back mountain.

This stone bead possesses the heaven-defying effects of devouring surrounding objects, regurgitating spiritual liquid, and improving one’s innate talent.

With this miraculous artifact, Li Fan transformed from a mere mortal into a cultivator.

Step by step, he advanced—Foundation Establishment, Golden Core, Nascent Soul…

Throughout his journey, he gained three peerlessly beautiful Dao companions and an ancient divine beast as his mount.

He encountered legendary opportunities, discovered the ruins of an Immortal, and even obtained a one-of-a-kind Immortal artifact in the cultivation world. ᴛhis chapter is ᴜpdated by noveⅼfire.net

After a century of adventure, he became the strongest cultivator of his era.

Then, carrying his Dao companions, he broke through the void and ascended.

Once again, the scene shattered.

After returning from the illusionary realm this time, Li Fan vaguely felt that something had changed in his mindset.

However, before he had time to analyze it, he was once again drawn into the cycle of reincarnation within the illusion.

In the following period, Li Fan experienced another ninety-seven cycles of reincarnation.

The encounters were largely the same.

For the most part, he was born into humble beginnings, then unexpectedly obtained a great opportunity. Afterward, he would rise against all odds, eventually achieving the pinnacle of power in a classic story of triumph.

When all the cycles of reincarnation finally ended, the brilliant orb in his hand completely dimmed and vanished.

"..."

Although the experiences of these ninety-nine lifetimes were illusions, they felt far too real.

They were incredibly similar to what he had previously gone through with Senior Sister Zhao—so realistic that it was difficult to distinguish illusion from reality.

After enduring so many cycles of reincarnation, even with Li Fan’s current mental fortitude, he couldn’t help but be affected.

He slowly activated the Xuanhuang Immortal Heart Mantra, gradually fading the memories of these experiences.

"The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance really came up with an interesting move this time."

Li Fan’s expression was hard to read.

Not long ago, countless of these brilliant orbs had rained down like a torrential storm onto certain territories of the Five Elders Association.

Countless cultivators and mortals, driven by curiosity, were drawn to these orbs, their minds captivated.

And just like that, they were plunged into ninety-nine cycles of reincarnation.

When they finally awoke, although their physical bodies remained unaffected, their mindsets had undergone a complete transformation.

That transformation was…

Due to the influence of the illusionary realm, many of these once utterly ordinary people now inexplicably believed that they were "Chosen Ones" of destiny.

If it were merely a delusion, it wouldn't have been a big deal.

However, they all came to a collective realization: they were living in a world forcibly reshaped against the natural order by the Five Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereigns.

Thus, one after another, they swore grand oaths to overthrow the rule of the Five Elders Association.

They vowed to liberate all cultivators from their wretched existence.

Moreover, after undergoing the tempering of ninety-nine cycles of reincarnation, these individuals were indeed no longer the same as before.

They did not recklessly act out but instead chose to lie low.

They would first cultivate and grow stronger—then strike with precision.

Although there were no detailed reports, judging by the reaction from the Five Elders Association, it was clear that the influence of these brilliant orbs had become quite a headache for them.

Li Fan pondered, "Aside from subtly awakening the cultivators, this also seems to implant some kind of spiritual imprint."

"How could a so-called 'Chosen One' possibly bow down to others?"

"To be able to implant the idea of overthrowing the Five Elders Association even under the influence of the Five Heavenly Sovereigns…"

"What an impressive tool!"

Naturally, Li Fan had not been affected by these brilliant orbs.

In fact, even if he had been…

It wouldn’t have mattered much.

After all, unlike the others…

With [Truth] in hand, he was a genuine Chosen One!

Li Fan looked at the storage ring sent over by the Five Elders Association, which was packed to the brim with thousands of these brilliant orbs…

He stroked his chin thoughtfully.

"Judging by the sheer quantity, these things must be relatively cheap to produce. Otherwise, they wouldn’t have been distributed on such a large scale."

He picked up another orb and began examining it.

Within his Sea of Consciousness, the Dissociation Disc emitted a faint glow as it began deciphering the orb's mysteries.

"There are traces of an illusion array."

"But more than that…"

Li Fan slightly furrowed his brows. He sensed a familiar presence.

"A restless heart and a wandering mind?"

After a brief moment, he finally found a similar experience in his past memories.

The Restless Heart and Wandering Mind phenomenon is an existence that fundamentally differs from the laws of the Xuanhuang World.[1]

It is suspected to be the remnants of a heavenly force left behind as the Xuanhuang World devoured and merged with other smaller worlds.

"No wonder it can still exert its influence even within the domain of the Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign’s law-defying authority."

"A peculiar power indeed..."

Li Fan recalled that in his 114th lifetime, during the battle against Mysterious Net, the Heaven-Suppressing Society once created a devastating weapon known as the [Heaven-Rending Arrow].

The exact method of its creation remained unknown, but its materials originated from the increasingly frequent occurrences of these peculiar forces.

Mysterious Net had supplanted the heavens, and its power was no different from the current Heavenly Dao of the Xuanhuang World.

Since the Heaven-Rending Arrow could harm Mysterious Net, it stood to reason that it could also damage the Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao!

"From what I see now, although this peculiar force is different from the laws of the Xuanhuang World, it is ultimately something that can be harnessed and utilized—rather than being a completely illogical and unreasonable existence."

"I just never expected that the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance had already reached this level of research on the peculiar force. It seems that if they hadn’t been pushed into a corner, we would never have known how many trump cards they were still hiding."

"But this is to be expected."

Li Fan suddenly recalled a time when he was in the Congyun Sea Tianji Hall, meeting Gongsun Qixuan, where he saw a massive map.

That map appeared to mark the locations of various strange occurrences within the Congyun Sea region.

"The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance has always kept a close watch on these anomalies. It makes sense that they can now use them on a basic level."

The Restless Heart and Wandering Mind forces were terrifying anomalies linked to spiritual power, capable of directly transforming cultivators into inhuman beings. Follow current ɴᴏᴠᴇʟs on novelFɪre.net

Once transformed into a Heart-Monkey, one’s spiritual sense would be enhanced.

If turned into a Intent Horse, it would directly nourish the soul!

"Back when I consumed the [Intent Horse], I experienced that surreal and hyper-real illusion. If I died within that hallucination, I would truly perish in reality! Consciousness has the power to alter matter..."

"Judging by how cheaply and widely these brilliant orbs are being distributed, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance must have fully mastered the application of this external force."

Li Fan pondered for a long time but found no means of countering it.

Even the laws of the Xuanhuang Realm were beyond his complete mastery—let alone an external force beyond its realm.

He could fully understand the headache that the Five Elders Association must be experiencing at this moment.

A sage once said:

"Thus, the governance of the sage: he empties their hearts, fills their bellies, weakens their ambitions, and strengthens their bones, ensuring that the people remain without knowledge and without desires."

But now, all the cultivators affected by the Brilliant Orbs saw themselves as "Children of Destiny."

Their potential destructiveness far surpassed that of ordinary cultivators.

Before transmigrating, Li Fan had read numerous online novels.

In those stories, nine times out of ten, the protagonist was a transmigrator.

Why?

Besides enhancing reader immersion, it also fueled their anticipation.

A transmigrator’s fate was fundamentally different from that of the so-called "natives."

Having witnessed another world and recognized their own "extraordinary nature," they could never live as the natives did—adrift and directionless.

They were bound to make a name for themselves.

Regardless of the final outcome, there would always be an attempt.

The orbs released by the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance followed the same principle.

They made the infected cultivators believe they were extraordinary, with ambitions reaching the heavens.

Moreover, the tempering of ninety-nine cycles of reincarnation was, in truth, an immense opportunity for cultivators.

It was more than enough to allow some of them to transform from mere serpents into true dragons!

"It’s as if thousands upon thousands of ‘weakened transmigrators’ have appeared within the territory of the Five Elders Association."

"And they’ve been brainwashed into eternal hostility."

"Tsk tsk..."

"On top of that, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance may have even implanted valuable cultivation techniques and other useful knowledge from the Xuanhuang Realm within the dazzling orbs’ reincarnation illusions—helping these ‘Children of Destiny’ to quickly rise in power."

A smirk of schadenfreude appeared on Li Fan’s face.

"Let’s see how they deal with this."

"Lin Ling, if the Five Elders Association sends another message inquiring about the matter, just ignore it for now," Li Fan instructed.

Lin Ling nodded, somewhat understanding yet still uncertain.

"Striking back fiercely means inciting internal chaos within the Five Elders Association, leaving them too preoccupied to interfere with the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance."

"It seems that the Immortal Alliance truly places great importance on this grand examination."

Li Fan stroked his chin in thought.

Amidst great anticipation, the month-long grand examination finally came to an end.

Cultivators returned from the Tianxuan Mirror one after another, each experiencing their own mix of joy and disappointment.

Haixuan Island.

"Judging by Fellow Daoist He’s expression, you must be brimming with confidence this time?"

Six cultivators from the Congyun Sea Mutual Aid Association, who had registered for the grand examination, gathered together.

Initially, only four cultivators, including He Zhenghao, had planned to take part in the examination. However, after the Immortal Alliance announced the selection process for the Thirty-Three Chosen Immortal, two more cultivators were moved by the opportunity and decided to take their chances.

Though their preparation time was far shorter than that of He Zhenghao and the others, their expressions suggested that their results were quite promising.

"Last-minute cramming actually works!" One of the two newcomers, a cultivator named Wei Qizheng, said excitedly.

"The question bank that Fellow Daoist Ji provided was enormous. Honestly, I couldn’t even go through all of it—I just skimmed through and memorized what I could. But I was incredibly lucky! The majority of the exam questions ended up being the ones I had memorized!"

"As for the questions that weren’t in the bank, I think I performed quite well too." Wei Qizheng eagerly shared his joy with the others.

He Zhenghao stroked his beard and smiled. "Then I suppose we should congratulate you in advance, little brother Wei?"

The others joined in, teasing and congratulating him, their confidence evident.

Just then, Ji Shaoli cleared his throat lightly, interrupting the lively atmosphere.

However, since the Immortal-Mortal Miasma outbreak had not long passed, the cultivators present still held lingering fears about coughing sounds.

Before Ji Shaoli could even speak, everyone’s expressions changed, and they turned to look at him warily.

Seeing their questioning gazes, Ji Shaoli was speechless.

"I’m fine," he waved dismissively before getting to the main point. "Once the examination results are out, you won’t be able to avoid the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance’s scrutiny. If they discover that you had prior knowledge of the exam questions, that would be a serious problem."

Upon hearing this, everyone was startled.

"However…," Ji Shaoli smiled slightly.

"Our Mutual Aid Association possesses a secret technique called [Sky-Shrouding Hand]. I will teach it to you all shortly."

"With this technique, you need not worry!"

He Zhenghao and the others were overjoyed.

Ji Shaoli lightly pointed at their foreheads, and soon, everyone closed their eyes, immersing themselves in comprehension and practice.

Ji Shaoli took the opportunity to observe them in secret.

The first to awaken was none other than Wei Qizheng.

In past lifetimes, when befriending He Zhenghao, Ji Shaoli had occasionally heard about this exceptionally talented junior brother.

However, as Li Fan’s horizons broadened over time and he encountered countless prodigies, he eventually paid little attention to this particular individual.

TL:- The idiom 心猿意馬 (xīnyuán yìmǎ) translates literally to "heart monkey and Intent (wandering) horse." It metaphorically describes a state of mental restlessness and distraction, where the mind jumps from thought to thought (like a monkey) and desires wander uncontrollably (like a horse).

"His talent is not bad..."

"But that's all there is to it."

After so many cycles of reincarnation, this person still seems to have only reached the Golden Core stage.

Each time, he perishes in the calamity of the Crimson Flames Burning the Sea.

It seems his fate is destined to be limited—he is not truly one of the peerless prodigies.

Watching Wei Qizheng clasp his hands in gratitude, Ji Shaoli nodded slightly in return. However, these were the thoughts running through his mind.

Yet...

Ji Shaoli never expected that even his sharp eyes, honed over a hundred lifetimes of reincarnation, could misjudge someone!

Seven Days After the Grand Examination.

What was once a confident, relaxed mood had now turned into restlessness.

Laughter and chatter had vanished.

Everyone's expressions became solemn.

Some, unable to bear the anxiety, began pacing back and forth, trying to relieve their stress.

At that moment, Wei Qizheng's face suddenly showed surprise as he retrieved his communication talisman to check its contents.

No one knew what message he had received.

The next instant, he abruptly stood up, his face full of disbelief.

Even his body trembled slightly with excitement.

This sudden change instantly caught the attention of the cultivators present.

A single thought surfaced in their minds at the same time—

"No way... could it be?"

As everyone stared at him with a mixture of shock and doubt, Wei Qizheng took a deep breath and spoke:

"The City Lord has ordered me to report immediately to the Administrative Hall."

"It concerns...

"...the selection process for the Thirty-Three Chosen Immortals."

A dead silence fell over the hall.

Everyone's expressions froze, unable to process what they had just heard.

Even Ji Shaoli's face stiffened in an instant. The rightful source is novel~fire~net

All eyes turned to Wei Qizheng, filled with an unfathomable complexity.

In that moment, Wei Qizheng felt a surge of passion and exhilaration.

Although this was only the preliminary selection for the Thirty-Three Chosen Immortals, and the final list had yet to be confirmed—

To be chosen from countless cultivators in the first place…

That alone was proof of his worth!

At this moment, Wei Qizheng wanted nothing more than to let out a triumphant shout to express the joy in his heart.

But then, as if realizing something, his expression changed.

His pride vanished.

Instead, confusion—and fear—set in.

"Daoist Ji..."

He looked at Ji Shaoli with a pleading gaze and asked hesitantly, "That ‘Sky-Shrouding Hand’ secret technique of yours... does it really work?"

That's right—Wei Qizheng had suddenly remembered.

Although he had received the preliminary selection notice…

He had known the exam questions in advance.

He had cheated!

If this were just an ordinary provincial appointment, it wouldn’t be a big deal.

But now, he was facing the selection for the Thirty-Three Chosen Immortals—an event that was under the full scrutiny of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance!

As those selected were meant to be the hope against the Five Elders Association, strict examinations were inevitable.

Wei Qizheng could already picture the scene in his mind—

Seven or eight Dao Integration Immortal Sages surrounding him, meticulously scanning every corner of his Sea of Consciousness, not letting a single trace escape their scrutiny…

Even with his normally steady heart, Wei Qizheng felt a chill running down his spine.

If he were exposed, being killed on the spot would be the least of his worries.

He might even be publicly denounced and go down in infamy for eternity!

The more he thought about it, the more anxious he became.

"Daoist Ji?" His voice trembled as he asked again.

It was then that Ji Shaoli finally snapped out of his momentary shock.

Looking at Wei Qizheng’s ever-changing expression, Ji Shaoli immediately understood what was going through his mind.

He reassured him at once:

"You don’t need to worry. The secret technique of our Mutual Aid Society is absolutely flawless."

"However..."

"If you’re still uneasy, I can help you once more. Come with me!"

Like grasping onto a lifeline, Wei Qizheng didn’t hesitate at all and followed Ji Shaoli into the secret chamber.

"Sit here in meditation. Empty your mind and dispel all distractions," Ji Shaoli instructed.

Wei Qizheng nodded and did as he was told.

Very quickly, his restless heart calmed down.

Ji Shaoli nodded to himself and patiently waited.

As for what he was waiting for…

Naturally, it was the storage ring being delivered at top speed from Lin Ling, spanning 800 miles.

Leveraging the ceaseless power of the earth’s veins, it took only the time of a tea’s brew for Lin Ling to personally arrive at Haixuan Island with Li Fan.

Their arrival did not alert the other cultivators on the island.

The moment they entered the secret chamber, Lin Ling knocked Wei Qizheng unconscious.

Li Fan and his clone carefully examined Wei Qizheng’s body.

Moments later, Li Fan shook his head slightly. "Strange. He doesn’t seem to possess any special physique."

"His cultivation talent is remarkable, but it is still limited within the scope of a single province. Compared to the true prodigies of the Xuanhuang Realm, he falls far short."

"Why was he chosen by the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance?"

A trace of doubt arose in Li Fan’s heart.

However, regardless of his confusion, it did not affect his actions in the slightest.

He pressed a fluctuating, semi-illusory azure True Temptation Fruit against Wei Qizheng’s forehead.

In just a moment, as the fruit completely dissolved into nothingness, this powerful fruit—capable of controlling a Dao Integration cultivator—was completely wasted on Wei Qizheng, who was merely at the Foundation Establishment stage!

Li Fan felt no regret.

Even if there was only a slim possibility, he was making a bet!

If Wei Qizheng could truly pass the selection, then gaining insight into the truth behind the Thirty-Three Immortal Selectees Plan would be worth far more than the cost!

But if he failed…

A dangerous glint flickered in Li Fan’s eyes.

Then, Wei Qizheng would spend his entire life repaying this debt.

"This True Temptation Fruit alone won’t be enough," Li Fan muttered to himself, his gaze flickering.

Within his Sea of Consciousness, the Final Disassociation Disc emitted a soft, radiant white glow.

A moment later, it appeared in Li Fan’s hands.

Taking a deep breath, he swiftly set up a formation around himself.

Then, with a sharp motion, he slashed downward with his finger like a sword.

The Final Disassociation Disc trembled slightly as a thin layer was sliced off.

As though it had suffered severe damage, the disc immediately dimmed, appearing weak and lifeless.

Li Fan winced, feeling a pang of regret.

He quickly returned it to his Sea of Consciousness for nourishment.

"After all, this isn’t the true Endstone Disc—it’s just a fragmented disc fused with the Disassociation Disc."

"Even though it inherited some of the ability to be divided, cutting even a single piece is like tearing away its very essence."

"You’d better not disappoint me," Li Fan muttered.

Carefully, he implanted the fragile, paper-thin fragment of the Final Disassociation Disc into Wei Qizheng’s Sea of Consciousness.

After finishing, Li Fan quietly left the secret chamber under Lin Ling’s lead.

Only his clone, Ji Shaoli, remained standing silently, waiting.

Not long after, Wei Qizheng slowly regained consciousness.

At first, he appeared dazed.

Then, upon seeing Ji Shaoli—who looked slightly pale—memories surged through his mind.

"Brother Ji, you’ve worked hard."

"I, Wei Qizheng, will never forget this great kindness!"

Wei Qizheng expressed his deep gratitude.

Ji Shaoli waved his hand. "We’re all part of the Mutual Aid Association—naturally, we must help each other."

"It has been quite some time since the City Lord’s summons. You should go now."

"Rest assured, with the secret technique of our Mutual Aid Association, even a Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign won’t be able to detect the secret in your Sea of Consciousness!"

His words carried great confidence, and Wei Qizheng believed them without a doubt.

He nodded firmly.

"Let's go."

Ji Shaoli patted Wei Qizheng on the shoulder, his eyes filled with encouragement.

As they stepped out of the secret chamber, everyone was astonished to see that Wei Qizheng seemed like a completely different person.

No one knew what secret technique Ji Shaoli had used on him, but the nervousness and apprehension from before had completely vanished.

In its place was unwavering confidence.

Neither Ji Shaoli nor Wei Qizheng offered any explanation.

"Everyone, the City Lord is still waiting for me, so I'll take my leave first," Wei Qizheng said with a respectful bow.

"Then let us congratulate Brother Wei in advance on his success!"

"Brother Wei, if you rise to power, don’t forget about us!"

Wei Qizheng gave a slight nod and left Haixuan Island through the teleportation array.

Watching his figure gradually disappear, He Zhenghao sighed, feeling both admiration and self-satisfaction. "I always knew Brother Wei was no ordinary person and would surely make a name for himself one day. But I didn’t expect it to happen so quickly! My past kindness to him was not in vain."

"It's truly frustrating to compare oneself to others. We've been preparing for over a year, yet he surpassed us by sharpening his blade at the last moment! Sigh..."

"Hiss... If Brother Wei is really chosen as one of the Thirty-Three Immortal Candidates and eventually ascends to Dao Integration, wouldn't that mean I could call an Immortal Sage my brother? He wouldn’t turn his back on us by then, would he?"

...

Reactions varied among the crowd.

But most couldn't hide their envy and jealousy.

Only Ji Shaoli’s eyes flickered with deep thought.

The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance had gone to great lengths to organize the selection of the Thirty-Three Immortal Candidates, showing how seriously they regarded this event.

To be cautious, Ji Shaoli refrained from doing anything too conspicuous. He did not leave any detectable killing intent on Wei Qizheng.

Even the [Final Dissociation Disc] that he had separated was merely an independent fragment, unlinked to the main body within his sea of consciousness.

It silently recorded everything it sensed around it, only transmitting the collected information at the moment of its complete destruction.

Such meticulous precautions were taken to ensure that Wei Qizheng would not be exposed.

For some reason, Ji Shaoli had a strong premonition.

Wei Qizheng was likely to be chosen as one of the Thirty-Three Immortal Candidates. However, if that happened, it might be a long time before they saw each other again.

Wei Qizheng’s summons to the Immortal Alliance headquarters went largely unnoticed among the cultivators of Congyun Sea.

He left without a trace.

On the third day after his departure, which was also the tenth day following the grand examination, the results were announced.

Some rejoiced, while others despaired.

On Haixuan Island, however, the mood was jubilant.

"Six applicants, and all six passed! If word gets out, it will definitely cause a sensation!"

"Hahaha! Those who refused to join our mutual aid association before must be regretting it now!" Google seaʀᴄh novel·fire.net

Amidst the celebration, He Zhenghao suddenly furrowed his brows and spoke with concern, "But what if envious people report us? What should we do then?"

As soon as he said this, the room fell silent.

"They… wouldn’t, right?"

A trace of worry flickered in everyone's eyes.

"Heh, what are you all afraid of? As the saying goes, a clear conscience fears no shadow!" Ji Shaoli said in a deep voice.

"We simply guessed the right questions, that’s all! Across the entire Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, there are countless groups studying the grand examination and making educated guesses. What difference does one more group make?" Ji Shaoli spoke with righteous confidence.

He Zhenghao and the others were momentarily stunned.

Then, Ji Shaoli sneered, "Besides, what could they even report us for? Leaking exam questions is a capital offense—without solid evidence, who would dare make reckless accusations?"

"If anyone really lacks the foresight to challenge us..."

"They might not even live to see the consequences!"

His words carried an unshakable sense of dominance.

Hearing this, the group pondered for a moment, and their worries gradually dissipated.

"Alright, let’s not talk about these unpleasant matters. Since you have all passed the grand examination, what are your thoughts on where you would like to be assigned in the future?"

When signing up for the grand examination, candidates had to indicate their preliminary preferences for regions and positions.

However, the specific assignments were ultimately decided by the headquarters of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

The decision was based on various factors, such as a cultivator’s place of origin, cultivation level, potential, and more.

In principle, most cultivators were assigned to positions locally, while elite individuals were selected for transfer to the headquarters.

However, there were occasional exceptions.

For example, He Zhenghao could have easily secured an official position in Tianyu Prefecture, yet he was instead sent to the remote region of Congyun Sea.

This was due to the suppression from the Heng family behind the scenes.

For most cultivators, job assignments were something they had to accept without question.

However, those with connections and influence had ways to maximize their own benefits.

Originally, passing the grand examination was already enough to satisfy most people.

But hearing Ji Shaoli’s words, it seemed there was still room for maneuvering.

As a result, everyone became tempted, quietly sending voice transmissions to Ji Shaoli.

Only He Zhenghao hesitated.

"Daoist He, what about you?" Ji Shaoli asked with a smile.

After a long moment of hesitation, He Zhenghao finally answered, "If possible, I’d like to go to Tianyun Prefecture. Tianquan Prefecture would work as well."

Neither of them were Tianyu Prefecture, but they were both very close to it.

Ji Shaoli immediately understood He Zhenghao’s intentions.

After pondering for a moment, he looked at the group. "This grand examination is special. I can’t guarantee the final outcome, but I will do my best."

"Whether it works out or not depends on your own fortune!"

Everyone understood and expressed their gratitude to Ji Shaoli once again.

"Before the final assignments are announced, you should make good use of this time to focus on your cultivation. If you can reach a higher realm, it could change things significantly."

He Zhenghao and the others nodded in agreement.

With something to look forward to, they devoted themselves to cultivation more seriously than ever before.

Meanwhile, Ji Shaoli began leveraging financial influence, trying to plant connections within the inner territories of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

The destruction of Congyun Sea was inevitable—there was no future in staying here.

The efforts of his clone to establish connections through Jingxuan, Shenyu Zi, Huangfu Song, and others were temporarily left unmentioned.

As the grand examination came to an end, the attention of the cultivators of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance shifted entirely to the biggest winners of this exam—those who had passed the initial selection and were heading to the alliance headquarters for the final round of the Thirty-Three Chosen Immortal Selection.

After all, achieving the rank of Dao Integration Immortal Sage…

The influence of such a position far surpassed that of any ordinary role within the alliance.

Those with sharp intelligence and well-connected sources quickly compiled a list of the more than three hundred fortunate individuals.

Detailed information about them soon circulated among the public.

After careful study, it was evident that there was no clear pattern.

The cultivation levels of the more than three hundred selected cultivators varied widely, ranging from Foundation Establishment to Soul Transformation.

The list included both solitary cultivators with no background and core disciples from prestigious families.

The selection criteria of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance remained a mystery.

At that moment, Li Fan was also holding the list in his hands, studying it carefully.

"Uh… no sign of Shuo Feng."

"Nor are there any names from the direct descendants of the true high-ranking alliance leaders from my past lives."

"..."

"They didn’t take advantage of this rare opportunity to elevate their family disciples."

"Could it be that they truly treat everyone equally and fairly?"

A hint of doubt flashed through Li Fan's mind.

However, based on his understanding of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, things might not be that simple.

"Looking at it from another perspective..."

"Perhaps these so-called Thirty-Three Immortal Selectees aren’t necessarily a good thing. That’s why the families are deliberately avoiding it."

Li Fan's eyes flickered.

This speculation happened to align with his intuition regarding Wei Qizheng’s fate.

"Thirty-three Dao Integration cultivators—without a Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign emerging—would still be a force powerful enough to sway the battlefield."

Li Fan couldn't help but grow interested.

From the information currently available, it seemed that the Immortal Ancestor had, for some unknown reason, temporarily left the Xuanhuang Realm.

Only a trace of his divine consciousness remained.

He would only return in the event of chaos or if the Xuanhuang Realm was on the verge of destruction.

On the surface, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and the Five Elders Association appeared evenly matched.

But without the restraint of the Immortal Ancestor, they were at a clear disadvantage against the Five Elders Association, which had five Longevity Immortal-level powerhouses.

"It’s just like how the 114th generation tried to create the Mysterious Net to resist the Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereigns."

"These Thirty-Three Immortal Selectees must also be related to 'creating a power capable of contending with the Longevity Immortal Realm.'" ᴛʜɪs ᴄʜᴀᴘᴛᴇʀ ɪs ᴜᴘᴅᴀᴛᴇ ʙʏ novel⸺fire.net

A flash of realization crossed Li Fan’s mind.

"Both sides have already made their moves. Now, it's just a matter of seeing how this game plays out!"

Previously, the Five Elders Association had attempted to contact him again.

But Li Fan ignored all their attempts.

The resources he had obtained from the Five Elders Association were already sufficient for the time being.

He decided to first observe the development of the situation before making his next move.

He carefully memorized the information on the list of over three hundred cultivators.

Then, he crushed it into dust and refocused his mind on the Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven.

At this moment, he had successfully advanced to the peak of the Golden Core stage.

Now, he was officially beginning the process of devouring the Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven.

The roots of the Heaven and Earth extended like tentacles, spreading through the gaps between the cave-heavens of each element and temporarily lying dormant.

The Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven was simply too vast.

The only way to consume it in one fell swoop was to first accumulate enough strength and cultivate a sufficient number of Heaven and Earth roots.

There was no shortcut—only slow and steady effort.

The only fortunate aspect was that the Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven had yet to give birth to an autonomous Heavenly Dao consciousness.

Even its instinctive resistance mechanisms were extremely weak.

Thus, Li Fan’s infiltration proceeded exceptionally smoothly.

Within the distinct elemental cave-heaven, dense root tendrils spread out like a doomsday cloud, gradually expanding.

Time passed swiftly.

The contribution points that Li Fan's clone, Ji Shaoli, had spent—over a million—were not wasted.
