On the day of the final appointment announcement, the atmosphere on Haixuan Island once again became lively and cheerful.

"Tianyun Prefecture, Strategy Formation Hall."

He Zhenghao was overwhelmed with excitement, his mind racing.

Even though he had only been appointed as the lowest-ranking formation master, Tianyun Prefecture was at the very core of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

Both the benefits and the future prospects were incomparable to his previous position as a guardian in Congyun Sea.

"Joining the Congyun Sea Mutual Aid Association was the best decision I’ve ever made in my life!"

"Even if it's just a small step, I’ve finally made progress! One day, I will return to Tianyu Prefecture in glory!"

"Ruoshui..."

Just as He Zhenghao was caught in his emotions, Ji Shaoli’s figure appeared before the crowd once again.

Everyone who knew that Ji Shaoli had played a significant role in the allocation of positions quickly saluted him, expressing their gratitude.

"Hehe, we are all family. No need to be so formal," Ji Shaoli waved his hand dismissively.

"However..."

His tone suddenly shifted. "Since all of you will be leaving the Congyun Sea soon, there are some things I no longer need to keep secret."

Everyone's hearts tightened, realizing that the mysterious Mutual Aid Association was finally about to reveal its true nature. They immediately focused their attention.

"The Congyun Sea Mutual Aid Association is merely a small branch of the Xuanhuang Mutual Aid Association in the Congyun Sea region," Ji Shaoli continued.

"Our association's influence extends throughout the Xuanhuang Realm. So even if you go elsewhere, you don’t have to worry about losing your connection to the organization."

Everyone had already expected this.

After all, being able to obtain the exam questions in advance—how could such a thing be accomplished by a mere regional organization?

Ji Shaoli scanned the crowd and, seeing that everyone remained composed, nodded in satisfaction.

"However, I must clarify something. Each prefecture's Mutual Aid Association does have some degree of competition. Since you all joined through me, for the next ten years, your status within the organization will still belong to the Congyun Sea branch."

"Because of this, leaders from other regions will not contact you for the time being. Until your ten-year term is up, you will continue reporting to and coordinating with me."

"Although this arrangement may seem inconvenient, it is necessary to prevent unhealthy competition," Ji Shaoli explained calmly.

No one showed any unusual reactions upon hearing this.

However, a Golden Core cultivator named Yu Hongjian couldn't help but ask, "Daoist Ji, what exactly was the original purpose behind establishing this Mutual Aid Association?"

"It can’t really just be about mutual assistance, can it?"

As soon as he said this, the same doubt surfaced in everyone’s minds.

"That's right. Since joining, we’ve constantly received the organization’s support, yet we’ve never had to contribute anything in return..."

"It feels rather unsettling," Yu Hongjian added hesitantly.

Ji Shaoli smiled faintly. "Don't worry. Right now, your strength is still too weak. Just focus on cultivating diligently."

"There will come a day when the organization needs you."

Even though Ji Shaoli himself was only at the Golden Core stage, no one present objected to his statement that their strength was too weak.

After all, everyone had witnessed powerful Dao Integration cultivators treating Ji Shaoli with great respect.

Clearly, Ji Shaoli was far more than he appeared to be.

At the same time, although his words seemed meant to reassure them, they only made them feel even more uneasy.

Everyone knew—there is no such thing as a free lunch.

The help they had received from the Mutual Aid Association was akin to being granted a second life.

Although no tasks had been assigned to them yet...

If one day, the organization did require their "assistance"...

Everyone subtly exchanged glances.

But at this point, there was no turning back.

They pushed their unease deep down, not daring to show the slightest hint of it.

Instead, they discussed and prepared for the evaluations they might face when assuming their new positions.

Time passed.

Within ten days, five people bid farewell and departed for their respective prefecture territories to take up their posts.

For a time, Haixuan Island became noticeably quieter.

Meanwhile, Ji Shaoli looked at a particular message, his expression revealing a trace of surprise.

The person he had been keeping an eye on—Zhong Shentong—had actually broken through unexpectedly.

Zhong Shentong, wielding the Seven-Colored Divine Light in one hand, was considered invincible within the same cultivation realm. He could even exhaust Senior Brother Zhang to death despite being at the same level.

The cultivation technique he practiced, "Life and Death Profound Art," was an incredibly mysterious method. It was said that, at its deepest level, one could achieve a wondrous state where life and death coexisted, attaining a unique form of immortality.

Cultivating this technique awakened and infinitely magnified a cultivator’s instinctive fear of life and death.

Even someone like Zhong Shentong, who was inherently lazy and indifferent, would seemingly transform into a completely different person when faced with the threat of death, becoming highly motivated.

“According to the original trajectory of history, Zhong Shentong wouldn’t break through unless he was nearing his lifespan’s end.”

“Yet now, he has reached Foundation Establishment early…”

“What happened?”

The most severe period of the mutant Immortal-Mortal Miasma had already passed, so it was certain that Zhong Shentong wasn’t forced to break through because of it.

Li Fan immediately became intrigued.

Thus, to observe Zhong Shentong, his clone, Ji Shaoli, had to take action.

"He has just broken through to Foundation Establishment and has yet to comprehend the Seven-Colored Divine Light. With my Golden Core cultivation, handling him…"

"Shouldn’t be a problem." Ji Shaoli silently pondered.

Still, to be safe, the clone made ample preparations.

In the realm between Foundation Establishment and Nascent Soul, as long as one had enough contribution points to equip themselves, they could disregard cultivation gaps and crush opponents effortlessly.

Not to mention, Ji Shaoli was already a whole realm above him. Thus, he wasn’t overly concerned.

Relying on gathered intelligence, Ji Shaoli used a teleportation formation to arrive at the northwestern border of Yongyun Prefecture, at a remote and desolate mountain.

On this mountain stood a somewhat dilapidated small temple, where Zhong Shentong had chosen to reside in seclusion.

“Originally, Zhong Shentong was just an ordinary old man. Although he had stumbled upon half a scroll of the 'Life and Death Profound Art' by chance, he was never able to make progress in cultivation. It wasn’t until he neared the end of his lifespan that, under immense pressure, he broke through his shackles and successfully stepped into the Qi Condensation realm.”

“After reaching Qi Condensation, he once again lacked motivation for cultivation and simply spent his remaining years in this small temple.”

“Logically, he should have only broken through again when his lifespan was about to run out. Yet now, he has advanced ahead of time…”

“What Foundation Establishment artifact did he use?”

Ji Shaoli concealed his presence, suppressing his aura as he observed from afar.

Inside the temple, besides Zhong Shentong, there was also an eight- or nine-year-old Daoist boy.

What was unusual was that, despite being able to perform mundane tasks with magic, Zhong Shentong insisted that the young boy complete them manually.

The Daoist boy was exceptionally good-looking, with a pair of large, bright eyes that seemed to speak, flashing with intelligence. Yet, he was diligent and obedient, completing chores efficiently and skillfully—his actions far too practiced for a mere child.

While the young Daoist boy managed everything neatly, Zhong Shentong merely sat by a pond in the temple’s backyard, fishing.

The Daoist boy called out several times without receiving a response and had no choice but to bring the prepared meal to Zhong Shentong.

"Master, it’s time to eat." The young boy spoke in a soft, childlike voice.

"Shh, don’t scare away my fish."

The Daoist boy pouted slightly and simply started eating on his own.

Only when the young Daoist boy was nearly finished did Zhong Shentong suddenly react.

“It’s hooked!”

He yanked the fishing rod sharply, but instead of a fish, what emerged was a green light orb.

Zhong Shentong looked disappointed but still reached his hand into the green light, rummaging through it.

After a moment, he pulled out what seemed to be a rusted disc-shaped magical artifact.

Zhong Shentong examined it briefly, shook his head, and casually tossed it to the Daoist boy.

The young boy, unfazed by this, caught it skillfully and asked, “Master, what is it this time?”

“A fire disc. It can produce open flames, so you won’t need to use talismans to start fires anymore.” Zhong Shentong lazily replied.

Then, putting away his fishing rod, he devoured his meal ravenously.

After reaching Foundation Establishment, cultivators no longer needed to eat like mortals.

Yet, Zhong Shentong seemed to enjoy the act of eating immensely, consuming his meal with great enthusiasm.

In just a short time, he swept the entire table clean.

“I’m going to take a nap. Unless it’s an absolute emergency, don’t disturb me.” Zhong Shentong instructed while humming a little tune.

"Got it, got it," the young Daoist boy replied helplessly.

As the sound of deep breathing echoed from the small temple, the young Daoist boy finished clearing away all the kitchen waste and then turned back to the pond.

Out of nowhere, he pulled out a fishing rod and, imitating Zhong Shentong’s previous actions, cast his line into the water.

But after a long time, there was no movement at all.

The young Daoist boy couldn't help feeling a little dejected.

"Master said that only those with true sincerity can fish up treasures from this pond. I've tried for years, yet I’ve never caught anything."

"How frustrating..." Unwilling to give up, he cast his line again.

The result was the same—nothing but an empty hook.

Finally, he accepted defeat and left the pond, his head hanging low in disappointment.

Not long after—

Ji Shaoli slowly revealed himself.

"Interesting." He gazed at the pond not far away, his expression unreadable.

After laying down a concealment technique around the area, he carefully examined the small pond before him.

Under his divine sense, it appeared to be nothing more than an ordinary pond—

No deeper than a single zhang (approximately three meters), with a length and width of no more than three zhang.

The entire pond was clearly visible at a glance.

Aside from some small floating debris, there weren’t even any fish living in it.

If he hadn't just witnessed Zhong Shentong fishing a green glowing orb out of this pond with his own eyes.

Ji Shaoli might have been completely fooled.

Since nothing seemed out of the ordinary, Ji Shaoli decided to take matters into his own hands. He flew directly into the water, attempting to uncover the pond’s mystery.

But…

Even after entering the water, it still felt no different from an ordinary pond!

After returning to shore, Ji Shaoli pondered for a moment before retrieving materials from his storage ring and crafting a fishing rod.

Mimicking the actions of the master and disciple from before, he cast his line into the water.

Sitting by the water’s edge, he held his breath and focused.

The fishing line flew out!

Yet, there was still no change.

Ji Shaoli sat there in silence for a long time, gradually feeling that something was amiss. He retracted the fishing rod.

"This pond clearly holds some hidden mystery. Yet, I can see it, but not perceive it…"

"Could it be that this pond only recognizes Zhong Shentong?"

After thinking for a while, Ji Shaoli dismissed the idea.

If that were the case, the young Daoist boy wouldn’t have attempted to fish from it.

"True sincerity…"

"What does it mean to have true sincerity?"

Fishing was not unfamiliar to Ji Shaoli.

Whether in his past life before crossing into this world or during his years as the Grand Preceptor of the Great Xuan Dynasty,

Whenever he was troubled, he would go fishing to clear his mind. Find the newest release on novel(ꜰ)ire.net

With an unshakable belief that he would never return empty-handed, he always stayed until a fish took the bait before heading back satisfied.

But ever since embarking on the path of cultivation, he had never indulged in such a relaxing activity again.

"True sincerity…"

A glimmer of understanding appeared in Ji Shaoli’s eyes.

This time, he sat by the pond once more.

He no longer focused on uncovering the pond’s secrets.

He simply wanted to fish—purely for the sake of fishing!

"Whoosh!"

With a solemn expression, Ji Shaoli cast his line.

In the next moment—

The scene before him changed drastically!

My Longevity Simulation

What lay before his eyes was no longer a small, still pond.

Instead, it was a vast expanse resembling a sky filled with endless stars!

Countless dazzling orbs of light were concealed within.

From the fleeting images passing over their surface, Ji Shaoli could faintly glimpse visions of exotic beasts, magical treasures, and even cultivators locked in battle!

And Ji Shaoli himself sat atop this starry expanse.

He cast down a single fishing line!

The countless orbs of light were like fish in a pond.

At first, startled, they instinctively fled.

Then, curiosity took hold, and some began to approach cautiously.

 

These orbs of light came in different colors—white, green, blue, purple, and orange.

 

The white ones emitted almost no discernible aura.

But from green to orange, the pressure exuded by the orbs gradually intensified.

Among them, in this vast sea of stars, golden and purple-gold orbs flashed momentarily. The sheer presence contained within them was so overwhelming that even Ji Shaoli—who had seen the remains of Longevity Immortals and True Immortals—felt a shudder in his heart.

"What exactly is this thing…?"

Even after experiencing a hundred lifetimes and witnessing countless grand spectacles,

the sight before Ji Shaoli now left him utterly stunned.

His mind trembled, his state of mind wavered.

In an instant, he was forced out of the starry fishing state!

The endless starlight vanished, leaving only an ordinary, unremarkable little pond before him.

"This…"

Ji Shaoli instinctively clenched his fists, taking a deep breath.

With his unparalleled insight, he immediately realized—he had stumbled upon something truly extraordinary!

Even with his firm temperament, it took him a long time to calm his emotions completely.

Adjusting his mindset to that of a pure fisherman, Ji Shaoli cast his line once more!

However…

Nothing changed.

Ji Shaoli gripped the fishing rod tightly. After pondering for a moment, he recalled how Zhong Shentong and his disciple had merely cast their lines once.

"It seems there's a limit to how many times this can be done within a certain timeframe."

Feeling a slight sense of regret, he withdrew his fishing rod and dispelled his illusion technique.

Then, from a distance, he silently observed once more.

Inside the small temple, the master and disciple's lives seemed unchanged.

Each day was spent in the same routine—eating, resting, and fishing.

When Zhong Shentong fished again, he only caught a single white orb of light, leaving disappointed.

His young disciple, after several attempts, caught nothing at all.

Finally, Ji Shaoli’s turn came again.

Taking a deep breath, as an experienced fisherman, he adjusted his mindset to its peak state.

Then, he cast his line!

In an instant, Ji Shaoli once again entered the boundless starry sky!

This time, he was no longer awed by the breathtaking spectacle—he was prepared for it.

At last, he maintained his state of fishing in the stars.

"Fishing requires bait. If I want to catch these orbs of light, what do I need?"

Watching as the majority of orbs swiftly distanced themselves, leaving behind only an empty space, Ji Shaoli couldn't help but ponder.

It was clear that this place was beyond the realm of Xuanhuang.

Instead, it was an independent space of its own.

His body was nothing more than a projection of thought, and in his hands was nothing but a plain, bare fishing rod.

Naturally, he had no means to attach any bait to it.

"Could it be that this is purely a case of 'the willing take the hook'?" Ji Shaoli couldn't help but wonder.

Because he noticed that, as time passed,

It seemed that the orbs of light were getting used to the presence of his fishing line, gradually beginning to draw near.

Some were even intrigued, tentatively prodding at it with curiosity.

As a white ball of light drifted too close, it was instantly and tightly absorbed into the fishing line.

Ji Shaoli only felt the fishing rod suddenly sink.

Then, unable to control himself, he instinctively lifted it.

The scene before his eyes shattered in an instant, and he found himself back in the small mountain temple.

However, in his hand, he now held a white ball of light.

Inside this light sphere, there seemed to be an independent world—his spiritual sense could not penetrate it.

Following the actions he had observed from Zhong Shentong earlier, Ji Shaoli reached out and groped around inside.

Eventually, after retrieving a dark green stone, the light sphere slowly dissipated.

"This is..."

By now, Ji Shaoli had seen and experienced much.

Yet, upon examining the mineral in his hand, he realized that he had never seen such a material before!

"It’s either an extremely rare variety, or..."

"It is not of the Xuanhuang Realm!"

"The white light spheres should be the lowest tier of value in the starry sky. They shouldn't be so precious that I've never even heard of them."

"If that's the case, then my guess might be correct."

Ji Shaoli's eyes flickered.

This fishing pool likely originated from another cultivation realm, an unparalleled supreme treasure.

It might even be an immortal artifact from the Immortal Realm!

In his 115th life, at the end of his existence, Li Fan had once used the True Cauldron of the Medicine King to break into the Immortal Ruins, where he had encountered the remains of a True Immortal.

Through that, he had experienced the awe-inspiring might of an immortal.

But at this moment, from within the endless starry sky of this fishing pool, he once again sensed the same level of power that emanated from the remains of that True Immortal!

And it wasn’t just one such aura!

The fleeting purple-gold and dark-gold light spheres that streaked across the starry sky gave him a feeling that was in no way inferior to that of a True Immortal!

"This shouldn't be my imagination."

"Even if I’m mistaken in some details, the caliber of this fishing pool must be extraordinarily high."

Ji Shaoli’s eyes gleamed.

He suddenly recalled a rumor he had heard before.

In the ancient Xuanhuang Realm, immortal artifacts once existed.

However, during the great catastrophe, all immortal artifacts—along with even the remnants of immortals—disappeared without a trace.

"Could it be that this fishing pool is one of the few immortal artifacts that survived?"

"And Zhong Shentong, a mere mortal with no background, was able to obtain the Life and Death Profound Art and even divine abilities like the Seven-Colored Divine Light..."

"All because of this fishing pool?"

In an instant, Ji Shaoli pieced together the possible cause and effect.

"This fishing pool is highly unique. Only by maintaining the mindset of a true fisherman can one discover it. Perhaps this is also why it has remained intact until now."

His thoughts swirled, and an uncontrollable sense of greed surged in his heart.

However, possessing a far stronger will than most, he quickly suppressed his desires.

His attempts for the day were already used up, so Ji Shaoli chose not to act recklessly.

Instead, he temporarily withdrew.

On the third day, after Zhong Shentong’s master once again failed to catch anything, Ji Shaoli stood by the pond and cast his line once more.

Knowing that the fishing pool likely contained power related to the Immortal realm, he couldn't help but feel a wave of emotion.

Perhaps it was because of this fluctuation in his heart that, shortly after entering the fishing starry sky, he was forcibly expelled.

Ji Shaoli was momentarily stunned.

Then, realization dawned upon him.

"Anyone who seeks treasure or tries to unravel its secrets—none of them are allowed?"

"Only a true fisherman can enter the starry sky."

Understanding this, Ji Shaoli shook his head.

He had no choice but to wait for the next day to come.

At the same time, he adjusted his mindset.

Once he had completely suppressed his greed, Ji Shaoli successfully entered again.

This time, he cast his line with extraordinary focus.

The fishing line slowly descended, and countless light spheres surged once more.

My Longevity Simulation

"Fish bite the bait because they want to eat. But what exactly are these light orbs seeking?"

Seated in the endless starry sky, Ji Shaoli pondered this question.

"From the brief glimpses I've caught, it seems that within these light orbs exist various items, cultivation techniques, divine abilities, or even battle experience."

"……"

"This fishing pond might be an immortal artifact designed with some kind of restriction, specifically for distributing rewards."

As Ji Shaoli's gaze swept across the different-colored light orbs—white, green, blue, purple, and orange—he contemplated.

"The more valuable an item is, the higher its tier. That means attracting them becomes even more difficult."

"But right now, only my consciousness remains. Even if I wanted to fish up those white light orbs, I could only rely on luck—let alone the higher-tiered ones."

After trying various methods, Ji Shaoli still couldn't attach "bait" to the dangling fishing line.

 

His luck was particularly bad.

 

Even after a long time, not a single white light orb was drawn toward him.

It seemed that this starry sky had a time limit as well.

As the surrounding starlight grew dimmer, like ripples in water fading away, Ji Shaoli found himself back in the real world.

His fishing attempt ended in complete failure!

Feeling a sense of frustration, Ji Shaoli immediately prepared to cast his line again—only to remember that he could only activate the power of the Fishing Pond of the Starry Sky once per day.

With no other choice, he took a deep breath and waited for tomorrow to arrive.

For the next ten days, Ji Shaoli participated in one fishing attempt each day.

In total, he fished up only six light orbs.

Five white, one blue.

The white orbs contained nothing more than ores and spiritual herbs—nothing particularly valuable.

However, the blue light orb contained a jade slip.

"Taikang Gengjin Sword Qi?"

Ji Shaoli carefully read through the contents of the jade slip.

"As expected, this is not a product of the Xuanhuang Realm."

Taikang Gengjin Sword Qi came from the Taiyi Realm and was a sword technique from the Divine Sword Sect.

The Taiyi Realm was similar to the Xuanhuang Realm in many ways.

However, it had five great cultivators who reached the peak of their cultivation but chose not to ascend to the Immortal Realm. Instead, they integrated themselves into the Dao, merging with the Taiyi Realm's Heavenly Dao itself.

These five were revered by Taiyi Realm cultivators as the "Five-Direction Emperors of Taiyi."

Taikang was one of these Five Emperors.

"By borrowing the power of Taikang the Emperor, this sword technique can be cultivated all the way to the Dao Integration realm?"

"Why is it only a blue-tier technique?"

After reading through the jade slip, Ji Shaoli was momentarily stunned.

But as he attempted to cultivate the Taikang Gengjin Sword Qi, he immediately understood the reason.

It was all about adapting to local conditions.

This sword technique was created specifically for the Taiyi Realm, and its cultivation required the power of Taikang the Emperor as a fundamental condition.

However, in the Xuanhuang Realm, Taikang simply did not exist.

Thus, this technique was completely unusable.

If not for the fact that it was a Dao Integration-level technique, it might have been classified as a mere white-tier item.

"So this Fishing Platform actually reevaluates the value of items based on their environment?" Ji Shaoli couldn't help but marvel at this discovery.

Even though his results were nearly worthless, he did not feel angered.

For the past ten days, he had been observing Zhong Shentong's fishing process.

Since Zhong Shentong had encountered the Fishing Platform before him, it seemed that he had grasped some special techniques.

In ten attempts, he had never come up empty-handed.

Even though he only caught eight white and two blue light orbs, he still fared much better than Ji Shaoli!

After thinking it over, Ji Shaoli decided not to waste any more time.

That day, after Zhong Shentong finished drinking and eating his fill, he was just about to take his afternoon nap—

—when his expression suddenly changed.

A golden barrier of light enveloped the entire small temple, including the fishing pond.

Countless golden serpentine lightning bolts were forming in the sky, as if they would strike at any moment.

"Master!" The young Daoist boy, who was washing dishes, turned pale with fright.

"Liu Li, quickly come behind me!" Zhong Shentong grabbed the young boy and shielded him.

At the same time, he took out a command flag and planted it into the ground.

An earthy-yellow energy formed into a sphere, enclosing both of them.

"Which Fellow Daoist is out there? Would you be willing to come forward?"

"There may be some misunderstanding here!" Zhong Shentong called out loudly.

But Ji Shaoli could see everything clearly. Though Zhong Shentong spoke these words, he had already quietly taken out a small wooden sword.

Even though Ji Shaoli's cultivation realm surpassed the other, he could still sense a trace of deadly danger emanating from that small sword.

Ji Shaoli did not reveal himself. Instead, he spoke coldly, "Daoist Zhong, if you don’t want the matter of the fishing pond to become known to the world—"

"I advise you not to resist."

"Actually, I mean no harm."

"I’m merely a fellow fishing enthusiast who is equally curious about it."

At these words, Zhong Shentong could no longer remain calm.

His greatest secret had been exposed, and a wave of panic surged in his heart.

His expression constantly shifted, but in the end, he still put away the wooden sword.

"If that’s the case, then please come forward and meet me! Hiding in the shadows—what kind of conduct is that?" he said in a deep voice.

"Heh, Fellow Daoist, you don’t know how many treasures you’ve fished out of that pond. How could I not be cautious?" Ji Shaoli was unmoved by his words.

Instead, he directly asked about the method to catch higher-quality light spheres.

"Don’t try to deceive me either—I’ve been keeping track of your harvest over the past ten days." Ji Shaoli spoke with a mocking tone.

Zhong Shentong’s heart sank completely.

The other party had been watching him all this time, and he had been completely unaware.

This was enough to prove that the opponent's strength vastly exceeded his own.

His power had already overwhelmed him, yet he remained so cautious...

Zhong Shentong couldn't help but curse in his heart.

Having no choice, he could only explain what he had discovered.

"The more times you cast your line from the fishing platform, the stronger the connection you establish with the pond."

"Perhaps in the past, there were other ways to directly enhance the connection. But now, it can only be done through persistence—accumulating attempts and time."

"Once the connection strengthens to a certain degree, you can use your own willpower as bait to attract the surrounding light spheres."

"The light spheres seem to possess a form of intelligence—they can perceive the intent embedded within the bait."

...

Zhong Shentong confessed everything honestly.

Ji Shaoli carefully listened while discerning the truth in his words.

"You needn't worry about me deceiving you—you can try it yourself."

"From the day I discovered the secret of this fishing pond, I knew I couldn’t monopolize it forever."

Zhong Shentong let out a long sigh.

"Unfortunately, this fishing pond seems to be fused with heaven and earth itself, fixed in this place. It cannot be moved or taken away."

"Otherwise..."

Zhong Shentong’s face was full of helplessness.

"I only ask that you spare Liu Li’s life. If you must kill someone, take me instead." He pleaded.

At this moment, Ji Shaoli finally revealed himself.

"Heh, Daoist Zhong, you might as well put away your treasure."

"I have no intention of monopolizing this secret either."

Hearing this, Zhong Shentong's expression became doubtful.

However, he still discreetly clutched a purple-gold gourd in his hand, refusing to let go.

Ji Shaoli spoke eloquently, “If my guess is correct, the treasures each person can obtain from this fishing pond are independent of one another and do not interfere with each other. In other words, you and I are not in a life-or-death competition. That is the first point.”

“Furthermore, we both have a common goal—keeping the number of cultivators who know the secret of this fishing pond as small as possible. Fellow Daoist Zhong, do you think you alone have the strength to keep this secret safe?”

“Today, I was able to discover the anomaly here. Sooner or later, other cultivators will also discover it. Can you stop them?”

Ji Shaoli stared intently at Zhong Shentong, questioning him bluntly.

Zhong Shentong could only remain silent.

“However, with our help, the risk of other cultivators discovering this place will be significantly reduced. It might even be possible to occupy this supreme treasure forever!” Ji Shaoli said with a smile.

“Our?” Zhong Shentong’s expression finally changed.

After a long hesitation, he sighed, put away the purple-gold gourd in his hand, and said helplessly, “Come down and talk, Fellow Daoist.”

Only then did the overwhelming sense of danger lingering in Ji Shaoli’s heart completely disappear.

Zhong Shentong chuckled, “I’ve guarded this fishing platform for most of my life and only managed to fish out this one treasure.”

“The Hunyuan Purple Gold Gourd, of violet-grade quality. I don’t know which cultivation world it originates from, but inside, it contains the Primordial Qi. In a single thought, the Two Primordial Qi can be transformed into flying daggers to attack enemies. It is said that even a Soul Transformation cultivator can be instantly slain by it. Unfortunately…”

Zhong Shentong shook his head slightly, “That’s only in other cultivation worlds. In our Xuanhuang World, once a cultivator reaches the Nascent Soul stage, they become one with the heavens and earth. As long as the heavens and earth endure, the cultivator will not perish. Because of this, the Hunyuan Purple-Gold Gourd is not as powerful here.”

His words revealed why he hadn’t chosen to act rashly.

With the overwhelming aura emitted by Ji Shaoli, enhanced by numerous protective treasures, he had already exceeded the realm of a Golden Core cultivator.

Zhong Shentong couldn’t gauge Ji Shaoli’s true cultivation level and lacked the confidence to kill him in a single strike.

After hearing that Ji Shaoli might have an organization behind him, he had no choice but to back down.

“How many years has it been since you discovered the mysteries of this fishing pond, Fellow Daoist Zhong?” Ji Shaoli finally descended from the clouds.

A trace of reminiscence flashed in Zhong Shentong’s eyes. “I can’t quite remember. That was back when I was still young… Time flies.”

Ji Shaoli, however, silently observed the young Daoist child standing behind Zhong Shentong.

Delicate as a porcelain doll, their appearance was exquisite.

Dressed in a wide Daoist robe, at first glance, it was difficult to determine their gender.

At this moment, the Daoist child, Liuli, peeked out, eyes filled with defiance rather than fear, glaring at Ji Shaoli angrily.

“This little one…”

Zhong Shentong forced a stiff smile and said, “Just an orphan I took in.”

But at that moment, Liuli widened her eyes in shock and looked up at Zhong Shentong. “Master, didn’t you say that I was also fished out of the pond—”

“Mmhh!”

Before the words were fully spoken, Zhong Shentong hastily covered her mouth in regret.

“Hahaha.” Ji Shaoli laughed heartily but then abruptly stopped, his expression turning ice-cold as he stared at Zhong Shentong. “Fellow Daoist Zhong, if you insist on being stubborn, don’t blame me for showing no mercy.”

“Lin Ling!”

Liuli realized her mistake and immediately stopped struggling.

Zhong Shentong did not scold them but instead gently stroked the head of the teary-eyed Daoist child, comforting them.

The two sides remained in a tense standoff.

Then, as a figure appeared in the sky, the pressure of a Dao Integration cultivator descended upon them.

Zhong Shentong’s face turned deathly pale. He let out a long sigh and finally relented.

“Little Liuli… was indeed fished out from the pond.”

"At first, it was just a transparent fruit, as clear as colored glaze. I was about to eat it when I faintly heard the cry of an infant from within."

...

Zhong Shentong, having given up on resisting, plopped down onto the ground and slowly recounted his tale.

Meanwhile, Lin Ling was quite curious about this pretty little Daoist child and continuously scanned her with spiritual sense. Discover more novels at novel·fire·net

Surprisingly, the young girl seemed to sense this and, unwilling to back down, glared at Lin Ling in return.

The two of them locked eyes, neither willing to yield.

This scene left Zhong Shentong both amused and exasperated, and the unease in his heart began to dissipate.

When the other party revealed the strength of a Dao Integration Immortal Sage, he had felt utterly hopeless.

However, judging from this Immortal Sage’s actions, things did not seem as dire as he had imagined.

At this moment, Ji Shaoli also walked over to the fishing pond.

With his back facing Zhong Shentong, he slowly spoke:

"I am not one who kills indiscriminately. Unless absolutely necessary, I do not wish to commit needless slaughter. However, the secret of the fishing pond must never be revealed."

"Fellow Daoist Zhong, you now have two choices."

"The first is to give up your life and end yourself. If you do so, I promise you that this child will live the rest of her life without worry."

"As for the second..."

Zhong Shentong narrowed his eyes as Ji Shaoli deliberately paused.

"That would be to join our Federation of All Worlds. If we are family, then there will be no need to worry about secrets being leaked."

"Federation of All... Worlds?" Hearing this completely unfamiliar name, Zhong Shentong was momentarily stunned.

However, with a Dao Integration cultivator overseeing it, this organization was definitely no ordinary force.

Having no real choice, Zhong Shentong quickly and decisively agreed.

"I am willing to join you."

"Good! Fellow Daoist Zhong, you are indeed a man of vision!" Ji Shaoli clapped his hands and praised him.

"Lin Ling!" he then called out.

Lin Ling looked at Ji Shaoli before lightly pointing into the air.

Immediately, a blurred image of a faceless stone statue appeared above Zhong Shentong’s head.

Though its features were indistinct, an intense sense of dread surged in Zhong Shentong’s heart.

After spending countless days in the fishing pond, surrounded by orbs as vast as the stars, he had developed an almost instinctive ability to assess the rank of artifacts.

With just one glance, he knew—this statue had to be something extraordinary!

Sure enough, Ji Shaoli spoke in a tone of deep reverence:

"This is the statue of the [Merciful True Immortal of Salvation and Mortal Compassion]. Anyone who joins the Federation must recite an oath before it."

With that, a lengthy oath of over two hundred words was transmitted into Zhong Shentong’s mind.

"True Immortal..." Zhong Shentong’s heart trembled.

"Could it be that behind this Federation of All Worlds..."

He dared not think further.

Having seen countless artifacts from different cultivation realms within the fishing platform, he was utterly convinced of the real existence of the Immortal Realm, which stood above all cultivation worlds.

With an incomparably solemn expression, Zhong Shentong, before everyone present, recited the oath to join the alliance.

The process seemed endlessly long, and the oath itself seemed to contain a mysterious and unfathomable power.

After reciting the oath, Zhong Shentong felt a heavy weight settle upon his heart, as if an invisible shackle had been placed on him.

“Hahaha, good.” Ji Shaoli, now seemingly relieved, immediately withdrew all the magical treasures protecting him, appearing completely defenseless.

This further convinced Zhong Shentong that the membership oath carried some kind of restrictive power.

“Now that Fellow Daoist Zhong has joined, why not have the little girl, Liuli, join as well?” Ji Shaoli said with a bright smile.

Though his words sounded like a suggestion, his tone left no room for refusal.

Zhong Shentong had no choice but to signal for Liuli to comply.

There was no need to transmit instructions.

Having just heard Zhong Shentong recite the oath once, Liuli had already memorized it completely.

She immediately recited it word for word, without a single mistake.

Zhong Shentong couldn’t help but sigh inwardly: Truly, the young know no fear. A mere child, unaware of the mysteries of true immortals.

Sensing Zhong Shentong’s unease, Ji Shaoli spoke, “Fellow Daoist Zhong, there is no need to worry. I have already contacted the headquarters. You will continue to oversee this fishing pool.”

“Everything will remain as it was.”

Zhong Shentong was momentarily stunned by these words.

“Furthermore, we will not make any effort to conceal this place. After all, only treasures require secrecy. A mere ordinary pond—what reason is there to go to such lengths to protect it? However, you may set up a formation outside your mountain temple to prevent outsiders from spying on it again,” Ji Shaoli added calmly.

“If anything is truly exposed, we can arrive quickly to assist.”

…

Ji Shaoli’s detailed explanation eased most of Zhong Shentong’s doubts.

"It seems I was being overly cautious. This Federation of All Worlds truly lives up to its name," he thought to himself.

With Lin Ling’s help, a protective formation around the small temple was quickly established.

Ji Shaoli then prepared to take out some magical treasures to aid Zhong Shentong in self-defense.

Having not experienced such kindness for a long time, Zhong Shentong actually felt a bit embarrassed.

“There’s no need for these. Over the years, I’ve fished up all sorts of random things,” he said, shaking his head.

“If a real crisis occurs, these wouldn’t be of much use anyway.”

As he spoke, he tossed over a storage ring.

“Take a look inside, Fellow Daoist. See if there’s anything I may have overlooked.”

Ji Shaoli scanned the contents with his divine sense and saw what appeared to be a junkyard, the storage space filled with a chaotic pile of items.

After a brief moment, he shook his head. “Not of much value.”

“However…” Ji Shaoli paused slightly.

“Some of these objects, though not of high quality, might have other unique values. After all, most of them originate from other cultivation realms. From what I know, there are some cultivators who are quite interested in such items.”

Zhong Shentong nodded slightly. “I am well aware of that. But to avoid drawing unwanted attention, I’ve simply never attempted to trade them.”

“That will no longer be a concern for you,” Ji Shaoli said, putting the storage ring away.

“We have specialists who will handle these items. Half of the profits will go to the alliance, and the other half will be returned to you.”

Zhong Shentong had no objections to this arrangement and even sighed in admiration. “Having a strong backer is indeed better than struggling alone.”

“The fishing pool is an extremely rare and precious treasure. The Federation will impose strict confidentiality measures regarding it. Aside from the occasional visitor coming to fish, it will not be used too frequently,” Ji Shaoli explained the future plans in detail.

These precautions put Zhong Shentong even more at ease.

After that, Ji Shaoli once again sought advice from Zhong Shentong about his experience fishing in the starry sky.

"What exactly does it mean to use intent as bait?"

"Can any kind of intent work?"

Zhong Shentong pondered for a moment before explaining: "The fishing pool doesn’t come with any instructions. Everything had to be figured out on my own."

"Based on my years of experience, using intent as bait generally follows the principle of 'like attracts like'."

"There are countless light clusters within the fishing pool, each naturally belonging to different attributes and classifications."

"Light clusters that share similarities with the condensed intent bait are more likely to be caught."

Zhong Shentong then took out a Hunyuan Purple-Gold Gourd and said, "For example, this gourd—I was able to fish it up because I visualized a gourd-shaped offensive treasure I had once seen. Only then did I have the luck to reel it in."

Ji Shaoli listened and fell into deep thought. "If we assume these light clusters have their own consciousness, wouldn’t that mean they are drawn to intent bait that resembles them or that they find interesting?"

Zhong Shentong nodded.

"That may be true, but luck still plays a big role." Zhong Shentong frowned.

"The starry sky within the fishing pool is too vast. The range of influence of an intent bait is only a tiny fraction of it. Dropping the fishing line and hoping to encounter an attractable light cluster…"

"Difficult, difficult, difficult!" Zhong Shentong repeated the word three times, expressing his frustration.

"I suspect that this fishing pool was originally meant to be used alongside a specialized technique. However, that method has long since been lost, leaving only the fishing pool itself in this world." He sighed.

Ji Shaoli nodded in agreement.

Their entire conversation was conducted through spiritual voice transmission.

Liuli and Lin Ling, who were nearby, remained unaware.

However, in this short time, the two of them had grown much closer.

No longer glaring at each other, they had started playing together instead.

Watching this scene, Zhong Shentong was filled with emotion.

"I see that this young lady…"

He hesitated for a moment but ultimately did not call her "senior."

"This young lady named Lin Ling doesn’t seem very old?" He asked cautiously.

Ji Shaoli nodded. "She was born just over ten years ago and has yet to experience the world, so she still has the heart of a child."

These words completely stunned Zhong Shentong.

"Just over ten years? A Dao Integration cultivator?"

"Haha, Fellow Daoist, there’s no need to be surprised. Within our Federation, peerless geniuses are too numerous to count. This level of talent…"

"Is nothing remarkable."

Ji Shaoli smiled mysteriously and left it at that.

Zhong Shentong, still in shock, fell into a whirlwind of thoughts.

Meanwhile, Ji Shaoli once again attempted fishing.

He calmed his mind and entered the boundless, dazzling starry sky. Updates are released by novel fire.net

"Intent as bait…"

He tried to condense his visualization into bait.

As expected, he failed.

However, luck was on his side this time, and he fished up a blue light cluster.

He couldn’t discern its exact use, but it seemed to be a fragment of some treasure.

After failing to uncover anything useful from it, Ji Shaoli temporarily stored it away.

For the next period of time, he remained at the small temple, continuously honing his skills.

As he became more familiar with Zhong Shentong and his disciple, his progress accelerated under their guidance.

Half a month later.

Ji Shaoli finally succeeded in condensing his first intent bait.

Following the principle of sustainable resource exploitation, Ji Shaoli did not choose an overly outrageous target for his first attempt at baiting with intent.

Although he was quite eager to see what would happen if figures like Mr. Bai, the True Immortal, Chaos, Hunger, or even [Truth] were turned into conceptual bait, the Fishing Pond was, after all, an Immortal Artifact of the highest grade, with unfathomable mysteries within.

If he acted recklessly, there was no telling whether he might end up fishing out some indescribable monstrosity, which could then wreak havoc—just like how, in the 115th cycle, the True Immortal had brutally destroyed the Xuanhuang Realm.

This cycle had only just begun, and the grand scheme had only started taking shape.

For now, Li Fan had no real intention of using [Truth].

"Perhaps, when this cycle nears its end, it will be worth a try."

Returning to the first attempt at conceptual bait, Ji Shaoli chose to visualize the Seven-Colored Divine Light that Zhong Shentong had fished up in the previous cycle!

If like attracts like, what could be more fitting than an object that already exists in the brilliant starry sky itself?

At the same time, this was also an experiment.

Then, with [Truth]’s assistance, the difficulty of fishing could be significantly reduced.

As long as there were enough cycles and attempts, and if they could compile a complete catalog of items within the Fishing Pond’s orbs of light…

It might even be possible to empty out the entire Fishing Pond one day!

The most crucial aspect was that the Fishing Pond’s resource production was completely independent and unaffected by anything else in the Xuanhuang Realm.

No matter how Li Fan’s different schemes in each cycle led to diverging historical outcomes, the Fishing Pond would always remain the most stable source of treasured artifacts.

Its significance could not be overstated.

Of course…

This all depended on whether Li Fan’s hypothesis was correct.

Within the brilliant starry sky of the Fishing Pond, the thoughts of Ji Shaoli's clone conjured up the characteristics of the Seven-Colored Divine Light he had previously witnessed Zhong Shentong wielding.

The Seven-Colored Divine Light was unceasing, stretching on without end.

Not only was its offensive power terrifying, but its speed was equally astonishing.

Even at the Foundation Establishment Realm, it could rival the abilities of a Nascent Soul cultivator.

Additionally, it seemed to possess a hidden protective function.

Back in the 114th cycle, Zhong Shentong was able to use the Seven-Colored Divine Light to travel freely through the White Mist, remaining completely unaffected by its energy-draining properties.

A true all-in-one ability, excelling in attack, defense, and escape, with endless applications. Obtaining it would mean never needing another artifact.

Even with Li Fan’s vast experience across countless cycles, the Seven-Colored Divine Light still ranked among the most miraculous abilities he had ever seen.

If it was already this formidable at the Foundation Establishment Realm…

Then at Soul Transformation, Dao Integration, or even Longevity Immortal Realm, what kind of inconceivable abilities would the Seven-Colored Divine Light manifest?

As Ji Shaoli continued his visualization, a blurred, seven-colored glow began to take form at the end of the dangling fishing line.

Since he only knew its external properties and had not actually mastered it like Zhong Shentong, the conceptual bait he formed was slightly different from the real Seven-Colored Divine Light.

However, the moment the bait took shape, it was as if a single droplet of water had fallen into a pond—

Ripples spread outward in all directions.

Countless orbs of light within the Fishing Pond reacted in various ways.

The vast majority remained completely unmoved, as if they hadn’t sensed anything at all. These were predominantly white, with a few blue orbs mixed in.

A few, however, seemed to recognize something familiar and drifted toward the conceptual bait in curiosity. These were mostly a mix of blue and purple.

Yet, as they drew closer, most of them seemed to realize something—

And did not take the bait.

Ji Shaoli paid no attention to these low-quality light orbs.

Instead, he focused his mind, carefully observing whether any golden or even higher-quality light orbs would be attracted.

However, just as Zhong Shentong had explained, the range of influence of the mental bait was extremely limited.

The invisible ripples quickly diminished after spreading a certain distance, eventually vanishing completely into the endless starry sky.

The outcome of this fishing attempt was clear.

He failed to reel in the Seven-Colored Divine Light.

His only gain was a blue light orb containing a defensive magic treasure.

He casually put it away, but Ji Shaoli felt no disappointment.

He simply waited patiently for tomorrow.

At the very least, this attempt proved that the method of visualizing existing objects in the fishing pool was indeed effective.

It was just a matter of bad luck—his cast had not reached an area where the Seven-Colored Divine Light could detect it.

"Although this is like searching for a needle in the ocean, I have enough room for trial and error. No rush."

"But ordinary cultivators don’t have nearly as many opportunities to keep trying as I do..."

"Perhaps the technique that accompanies the fishing pool has a way to cast the line more precisely."

Ji Shaoli gazed at the shallow yet unfathomable waters of the pool, contemplating in silence.

"I wonder if a genius cultivator with extraordinary talent could reverse-engineer the method of controlling the fishing pool based on their needs. Although it is an immortal artifact..."

"But in the end, it is still just an artifact. Compared to a true immortal, there should still be a vast gap."

A white figure flashed through Ji Shaoli's mind.

In the following days, Ji Shaoli continued his persistent attempts with unwavering patience.

Each time, he used the same mental bait—always the Seven-Colored Divine Light!

The light orbs within the fishing pool seemed to possess a certain intelligence.

As the invisible ripples of the Seven-Colored Divine Light were sent out more frequently, fewer and fewer orbs were drawn in and willing to take the bait.

At first, Ji Shaoli was still able to fish up some blue light orbs.

But later on, blue light orbs became almost nonexistent. Tʜe sourcᴇ of thɪs content ɪs N0veI.Fiɾe.net

Even white light orbs appeared less and less frequently, with the vast majority of his casts coming up empty!

Observing Ji Shaoli’s fishing progress, Zhong Shentong couldn’t help but shake his head in silence.

Yet Ji Shaoli did not feel frustrated.

On the contrary, he grew increasingly excited.

Because when all the wrong answers are eliminated, what remains must be the only correct answer!

And so, Ji Shaoli continued casting empty lines for twenty consecutive days.

On this day, Zhong Shentong saw Ji Shaoli slowly rise from beside the pond, seemingly still empty-handed.

He could no longer hold back and offered words of comfort: "Fellow Daoist, do not be disheartened. In the Dao of Fishing, returning empty-handed is the norm. As long as you can endure the solitude, one day, luck will shine upon you, and you will catch the great fish you seek."

Ji Shaoli's expression remained calm.

"Daoist Zhong’s words are absolutely true."

"I completely agree."

"My sixty days of meditation have not been in vain..."

"I have finally gained a small reward."

Hearing Ji Shaoli’s response at first, Zhong Shentong nodded repeatedly.

But the more he listened, the more he felt something was off.

A trace of astonishment surfaced on his face.

And then, accompanied by a dazzling golden radiance descending upon them, his astonishment instantly turned into utter disbelief.

In Ji Shaoli’s hand, a golden light orb emitted an incomparably brilliant glow.

It was like a second sun, so radiant that everyone inside the small temple was momentarily blinded.

If not for the protective formation Lin Ling had set up around the small mountain temple earlier, the dazzling brilliance of the golden orb in Ji Shaoli’s hand would have immediately drawn the attention of other cultivators.

“This… this…” Zhong Shentong was dumbfounded, pointing at Ji Shaoli, unable to form a complete sentence.

“Sigh, what a pity it isn’t a purple-gold or dark-gold orb. But this will have to do.” Ji Shaoli said indifferently. Right in front of everyone, he reached his hand into the golden light and began to search.

The golden radiance gradually dissipated.

In its place was a round pearl emitting a seven-colored halo.

The moment Zhong Shentong laid eyes on this seven-colored pearl, a strange and complex mix of emotions welled up within him—greed, disappointment, and even a sense of regret.

It left him feeling unsettled.

“Seven-Colored Jade Void Glimmering Light…” The moment Ji Shaoli touched the pearl, information about it naturally appeared in his mind.

It originated from a cultivation world known as 'Chongyan.'

Later, a great cultivator gathered and refined these seven glimmers of light.

Though he succeeded in creating an unparalleled treasure, it directly led to the destruction of the Chongyan Realm.

As time passed, this cultivator perished, and the treasure he refined drifted into the Fishing Pond.

…

Ji Shaoli was deeply shaken.

Not just because the seven-colored divine light was of an extraordinarily high grade, far surpassing ordinary Dao Integration treasures.

But because even a treasure of this caliber was merely classified as a gold-tier item in the Fishing Pool.

Then what kind of unimaginable existence would the purple-gold and dark-gold orbs be?

And what exactly was the Fishing Pond, which contained all these treasures?

“This is definitely no ordinary Immortal artifact.”

“But they all remain ownerless…”

“What on earth happened in the Immortal Realm?”

Countless thoughts flooded Ji Shaoli’s mind, but he did not immediately refine the seven-colored divine light.

Instead, he stored it away to hand over to his true self in the future.

Regaining his composure, he looked at the still-shocked Zhong Shentong and asked curiously, “What? Is it really that difficult to fish up a golden orb? You’ve occupied this fishing platform for decades. With your skill, you should’ve caught quite a few by now, right? Why the surprise?”

Zhong Shentong opened his mouth, but no words came out.

“Heh… heh…”

Zhong Shentong’s eyes were filled with confusion, and he could only respond with a dry laugh.

“Well, luck is always balanced. This time, I caught something good, but if I don’t exercise restraint, I’ll probably be wasting my time for a long while.”

“I’ll leave this place to you, Daoist Zhong.”

“The Federation has many affairs to handle, so I can’t stay here forever,” Ji Shaoli said with some regret.

“Oh, right. In the future, some of the geniuses from our Federation might come here to try their luck. I’ll notify you beforehand.” Ji Shaoli tossed a communication talisman to Zhong Shentong before reluctantly glancing at the Fishing Pond one last time.

Then, calling Lin Ling, he finally left the small mountain temple.

Zhong Shentong looked at the all-too-familiar temple, now with an additional protective formation.

Everything that had happened felt like a dream.

It left him in a daze.

Then, suddenly, a faceless stone statue appeared before him, startling Zhong Shentong awake.

After a long contemplation, he let out a sigh and reluctantly accepted the reality before him.

Then, looking back at the Fishing Pond, he stubbornly sat back down. Thɪs chapter is updated by NoveI-Fire.ɴet

Even though he had already used up his allotted fishing attempts for the day, he still wanted to get a feel for it.

No matter how much Ji Shaoli surpassed him in cultivation, realm, or divine abilities, Zhong Shentong could accept it.

But the fact that Ji Shaoli had fished up a gold-tier orb—something he himself had only managed twice in his entire life—in such a short amount of time was simply unbearable.

“The Dao of Fishing—I refuse to believe I am inferior to him!”

With determination in his heart, Zhong Shentong continuously replayed the motion of casting his fishing rod in his mind.

Amidst the mountains, above a small temple.

Ji Shaoli stayed hidden in the shadows, carefully observing Zhong Shentong’s daily life for two to three days.

He discovered that aside from becoming increasingly obsessed with fishing, Zhong Shentong showed no other unusual behavior. Only then did Ji Shaoli feel reassured enough to leave.

"Relying solely on the title of 'True Immortal of Salvation and Mortal Compassion' as a bluff is not a long-term solution."

"In order to ensure that this secret remains undiscovered, other measures will be necessary."

"For a Foundation Establishment cultivator, there’s no need to use True Temptation Fruit. Once I complete my breakthrough, the Bloodline Transmission secret technique will suffice."

The endless treasures within the fishing pond were clearly not something that could be fully excavated in just one lifetime.

Therefore, Ji Shaoli never intended to stay there indefinitely, fishing every single day.

Even if he spent a hundred years fishing alone, it would still be insignificant compared to the vast and endless starry sky. Moreover, relying solely on luck to fish for treasures without knowing their exact nature was far too inefficient.

"Hmm. In the future, any distinguished contributors to the Federation of All Worlds shall be granted a chance to fish here."

"Even if someone does manage to reel in a supreme treasure, it won’t matter. In the end, everything will still be mine."

After pondering this matter, Ji Shaoli personally traveled with Lin Ling to the Spiritwood Realm and handed over the Seven-Colored Jade Void Glimmering Light to his true self.

Only then did he return to Haixuan Island.

As usual, he checked the Tianxuan Mirror.

During his time focusing on fishing, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance had not remained quiet.

Among the hundreds of candidates in the Thirty-Three Immortal Selection, the vast majority had already returned.

Only thirty-three cultivators remained at the Immortal Alliance Headquarters.

This signified that the final Immortal Selectees had been officially confirmed!

Everyone knew that these chosen immortals were guaranteed to reach Dao Integration Realm in the future, with limitless potential ahead of them.

Their backgrounds had already been thoroughly investigated.

Whether it was to curry favor or establish connections in advance, any cultivator with a modicum of intelligence was now doing everything possible to forge ties with these thirty-three individuals.

Wei Qizheng, one of the chosen ones, had always been alone.

However, many cultivators still traveled from afar to establish contact with his friends.

Naturally, the organization Wei Qizheng had once been part of—the Congyun Sea Mutual Aid Association—also came into the public eye.

Upon investigation, people discovered that the members of this association were all cultivators within the Immortal Alliance system, and none of them had strong foundations.

At most, they had only reached the Nascent Soul stage.

"It's nothing more than a small group banding together for survival," they concluded.

They could only marvel at the group’s sheer luck—despite having so few members, they had managed to produce an Immortal Selectee.

At first, the members of the Mutual Aid Association were a bit nervous about the overwhelming inquiries directed at them.

However, when they realized that these so-called "powerful factions" showed little real interest in them—redirecting every conversation back to Wei Qizheng after just a few words—their worries gradually faded.

Besides, there wasn’t much for them to reveal in the first place.

The true secrets of the Mutual Aid Association rested solely with Ji Shaoli.

Returning to Haixuan Island, Ji Shaoli naturally received numerous banquet invitations and requests for meetings.

He completely ignored them.

"There are too many eyes and ears around. This clone is not suitable for going out right now. I should remain in seclusion for a while."

"However, the fact that the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance actually allowed the rejected candidates of the Chosen Immortal Plan to return is truly unexpected." Ji Shaoli frowned slightly, a hint of doubt flashing through his mind.

If the Thirty-Three Immortal Selection Plan were truly of great importance, then at the very least, before the plan had fulfilled its intended purpose, the identities of the chosen ones should have remained secret.

Naturally, those who were not selected should not have been released. Instead, their return should have been prevented to keep the true identities of the Thirty-Three Immortal Candidates hidden.

Yet, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance had no such intentions...

"It doesn't matter who they are."

"As long as there are thirty-three individuals who meet the conditions, that's enough."

"Interesting. Let me see what the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance is really up to."

"It's time to put some pressure on them again."

Ji Shaoli's clone remained seated on Haixuan Island, motionless.

Meanwhile, in the Spiritwood Realm, Lin Ling, following Li Fan's orders, once again went to Jiushan Prefecture to contact the Five Elders Association.

The Five Elders Association questioned why there had been no response for so long.

Lin Ling, following Li Fan’s prior instructions, informed him about the matter of merging the dazzling orb with the two strange powers of "Heart Monkey" and "Intent Horse."

Although the representative of the Five Elders Association remained outwardly calm, Lin Ling keenly sensed the intense psychological fluctuations within them.

After delivering another batch of supplies as a gesture of gratitude, the Five Elders Association began inquiring about the "Thirty-Three Chosen Immorta Planl."

Lin Ling remained vague, skillfully evading their inquiries.

Just as they were about to feel disappointed, Lin Ling dropped a bombshell.

"In response to the Five Elders Association's watchful gaze, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance has not only developed the Chosen Immortal Plan but has also created numerous world-shaking weapons, including the 'Sky-Splitting Cannon.' If you do not take action soon, you may regret it when it's too late."

Lin Ling faithfully relayed Li Fan’s exact words.

Along with them, a recorded image was transmitted.

A black pillar of light, capable of annihilating all in its path, pierced through layers of white mist, erasing everything before it.

Even after the black pillar faded, the void it created remained unfilled for a long time, its lingering power repelling anything that approached.

Even in the blurry footage, the might of the Sky-Splitting Cannon was undeniable.

No matter how composed the Five Elders Association's representative was, they could not conceal their shock.

Taking a deep breath, they cupped their hands and promised future gratitude before hastily departing.

Watching the figure disappear, Lin Ling smirked before returning through the earth veins to report back.

Inside the Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven

"I don't know if the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance has truly completed this world-ending weapon. But whether it's real or not doesn’t matter."

"The Five Elders Association was already restless, merely delayed by the Immortal Alliance’s clever tactics."

"Now, with the radiant orb incident resolved, and the added pressure of the Thirty-Three Chosen Immortal Candidates and the Sky-Splitting Cannon, I believe they will choose to strike first."

"Now, all I have to do is wait."

Receiving Lin Ling’s report, Li Fan pondered for a moment before shifting his focus.

Inside his dantian, a seven-colored sphere radiated divine light, mesmerizing to the eye.

"As expected of a supreme treasure refined from the heavenly light of an entire world."

"Completely mastering it won't be a quick task."

As spiritual energy wrapped around the seven-colored orb, countless images flashed before Li Fan’s eyes.

There were cultivators soaring through the clouds and mortals living upon the land. Thɪs chapter is updated by NovєlFіre.net

These were scenes from the now-extinct Chongyan Immortal Realm.

"Unfortunately, time and space shift too unpredictably. I can't make out the details."

Li Fan felt a hint of regret.

So far, aside from the Xuanhuang Realm, he had learned of three cultivation realms—Xiaoyao, Taiyi, and Chongyan.

But that was all.

Beyond their names, he knew little about their inner workings.

"If I could break free from the shackles of the Immortal Ruins, I might be able to explore them."

"But Chongyan is already destroyed. As for whether Xiaoyao and Taiyi still exist, it's hard to say."

As Li Fan channeled his spiritual energy, refining the seven-colored orb, his attention shifted back to devouring the Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven.

Before long, however, he noticed something unusual.

The speed at which the heaven and earth's root was proliferating had nearly doubled!

At this rate, within less than a year, the entire Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven would be completely devoured!

"Hmm?"

Li Fan had not ventured out recently.

The only variable was the newly obtained seven-colored orb.

Surprised, he carefully analyzed and studied the cause of this sudden change.

It didn’t take long for him to discover a possible explanation.

As his spiritual energy refined the seven-colored orb, a mysterious force was simultaneously nourishing and transforming his spiritual energy.

With the infusion of this power, the heaven and earth’s root seemed to have received an enormous boon, multiplying at an alarming rate.

Moreover, as Li Fan’s refining of the seven-colored orb progressed, the proliferation speed kept increasing.

Even Li Fan himself felt a hint of unease.

Like storm clouds sweeping in, Li Fan was consuming the Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven at an unimaginable and terrifying speed.

"If not for the sheer number of monsters in the Xuanhuang Realm, I might have been able to claim it for myself within just a few decades using this method."

A premonition arose in Li Fan’s mind.

"This mysterious power… what exactly is it?"

He carefully examined it.

After seven days, realization dawned upon him.

"The Power of the World’s Source?"

"The seven-colored heavenly light of Chongyan Realm was a manifestation of the Heavenly Dao, containing the world's fundamental source power."

"After being refined into a treasure, this power remained within it."

"In ordinary combat or flight, this attribute wouldn’t reveal itself. However, when it comes into contact with the heaven and earth’s root—a method specifically designed to consume entire worlds—it triggers a reaction!"

"Like a catalyst, it greatly amplifies the power of the heaven and earth’s root, accelerating the process of devouring this Cave-Heaven."

"Strictly speaking, the loss of the world’s source would weaken the seven-colored orb to some extent."

"But that’s just a matter of time. Ultimately, it doesn’t make a real difference."

"For me, however..."

"It doesn’t matter at all!"

Li Fan understood everything now.

With this realization, he accelerated his refining and extraction of the world's source power.

"If the Power of the World’s Source can aid advancement at the Nascent Soul stage..."

"Then what about the Soul Transformation, Dao Integration, and even the Longevity Immortal stages?"

"Could it still provide assistance?"

As he gazed at the rapidly proliferating countless tendrils, Li Fan couldn’t help but ponder.

Using the power of one world to devour another...

What was once an impossible feat had now become reality, thanks to this supreme treasure, the Fishing Pond.

“No wonder this Seven-Colored Divine Light seems endless in battle, without any need to worry about depletion. It turns out that it is backed by the essence of an entire cultivation world’s power.”

Within Li Fan’s dantian, as the world’s source power was continuously extracted, the seven-colored orb seemed to dim slightly.

At the same time, the sky-covering, sun-blocking roots of the Heaven and Earth stretched into every corner of the Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven.

However, the Heaven and Earth roots, nourished by this source power, were different from those merely formed by an ordinary cultivator’s spiritual energy.

They became fiercer and...

Even more greedy.

As if it had developed a taste for it, there was no need for Li Fan to exert deliberate control.

With just a single thought, the densely packed black tendrils impatiently expanded into untouched territories.

The once vibrant, magnificent Cave-Heaven world was gradually shrouded in darkness.

Looking at this indescribable scene, Li Fan had a premonition—

Even if he did not actively control it, these enhanced Heaven and Earth roots could complete the devouring process in a short time.

"The devouring between worlds…"

"When the Immortal Ancestor created the new cultivation method back then, he must have personally witnessed the fusion of worlds."

With this realization, Li Fan no longer cared about the consumption of the seven-colored orb.

He pushed the devouring speed to its limit.

Three Months Later.

"It is time."

Li Fan suddenly opened his eyes.

By now, the black roots had completely entangled the Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven.

From the outside, what was once a vast and majestic world now appeared as nothing more than a bizarre, fur-covered sphere wrapped in countless tendrils.

Not even a trace of its former grandeur remained.

With a single thought, the roots below immediately flared to life. Read complete versıon only at noveⅼfire.net

The Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven trembled slightly.

Pure, boundless vitality surged through the roots like conduits, flowing directly into Li Fan’s body.

“Ah…”

His originally twenty-something-year-old physique seemed to regress in an instant to the prime of youth, as if he had returned to his teenage years.

Every part of his body—organs, bones, and flesh—was undergoing an earth-shattering transformation under the influence of this purest, most refined life force.

Taking a deep breath, Li Fan adapted to the overwhelming vitality.

Without hesitation, he narrowed his eyes and sliced a deep wound across his arm, cutting down to the stark white bone beneath.

A wound this severe…

Yet, within mere seconds, it healed at a speed visible to the naked eye.

And this was even before he had fully devoured the Nascent Soul Great Cave-Heaven!

Just relying on the life force feedback from the Cave-Heaven, he had already achieved such a level of regeneration!

"Far superior to the initial-stage Cave-Heaven from before," Li Fan murmured in admiration.

Then, his body slowly dissolved into streams of inky black energy, surging along the countless tendrils toward the Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven.

Sensing the impending crisis, the entangled Cave-Heaven began to struggle.

Deafening roars echoed across the world—lands crumbled, oceans rose into towering tsunamis…

Countless beings within the realm let out cries of despair.

Yet, none of this could slow down Li Fan’s devouring process in the slightest.

As more and more black energy poured in, parts of the Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven began to turn transparent and vanish.

The resistance of the world grew weaker and weaker.

Until, at last—

Everything fell silent.

The Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven was gone.

And yet, the void it once occupied remained.

A vast, empty nothingness.

No one knew how much time had passed before—

A figure suddenly appeared in the void.

It was none other than Li Fan, now having successfully advanced to the Nascent Soul realm.

Power surged through every part of his body. Since embarking on his cultivation journey, Li Fan had never felt so strong.

He even had the feeling that even an ordinary Dao Integration cultivator might not be his match.

"Ordinary Dao Integration cultivators can extend their power across an entire prefecture of Xuanhuang."

"But the Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven that I have devoured is equivalent to merging five prefecture into one."

"A quantitative change leads to a qualitative transformation. With sheer absolute power alone, I can crush those feeble Dao Integration cultivators."

"Not to mention, I also possess numerous divine abilities."

Li Fan's eyes flickered as he finally felt a sense of security in his heart.

As long as no Longevity Immortal intervenes, no matter how recklessly he acts in this era, he should still be able to escape with ease!

"With such an expansion in power, future planning will also be much more convenient," he mused to himself.

Despite completing his breakthrough, Li Fan did not leave immediately.

Instead, he repeatedly scanned the void in this area with his divine sense, as if searching for something.

Once. Twice.

After multiple attempts, he still did not detect anything unusual.

Yet, Li Fan refused to give up.

After his dramatic increase in strength, he had keenly sensed that within this Five Elements Void, there seemed to be something else hidden.

It was concealed extremely well.

But at the very moment when Li Fan successfully broke through and completely devoured the Five Elements Cave-Heaven, the dramatic environmental change exposed a tiny flaw.

And Li Fan had caught it.

This hidden existence did not belong to the Root of Heaven and Earth in the Xuanhuang Realm.

Rather, it was something that had been haunting him all along, appearing around him time and again…

The Du'e Sect!

Li Fan snorted coldly.

A dazzling, seven-colored radiance burst forth from his body. In an instant, the radiance intensified countless times, expanding explosively into the surrounding void.

The seven-colored divine light seemed almost tangible.

It filled and occupied the entire space, repelling everything foreign and forcing all hidden entities to reveal themselves!

Compared to the abilities of Zhong Shentong from his previous life, Li Fan's current display was like the difference between the radiant full moon and the dim light of a firefly.

Only with the vast Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven as his foundation could Li Fan afford to unleash his power so extravagantly.

But the effect was undeniably impressive.

Li Fan's goal was finally achieved.

Under the pure pressure of the seven-colored divine light, an anomaly was finally exposed.

Li Fan’s gaze flickered as he reached out and pulled the object toward him.

Upon close examination, he found himself holding a tiny figure made of yellow talisman paper.

It seemed ancient, its yellowish hue faded with time.

Moreover, the paper figure was eerily bizarre.

It had no facial features—just a single solitary eye, occupying its entire face.

What made Li Fan even more serious was that the one-eyed paper figure seemed alive.

The moment he grabbed it, its eye shifted slightly, locking onto him with an unwavering stare.

A sudden searing heat spread through Li Fan's palm, as if he were being scorched by raging flames.

"Tricks of the occult!"

A burst of flames erupted in his hand, engulfing the one-eyed paper figure.

Li Fan attempted to incinerate it completely.

But after burning for a long time, the talisman figure remained completely unharmed.

It was as if it had no physical form at all—no matter how intense Li Fan’s flames were, they could not cause the slightest damage!

Next, Li Fan tried various methods.

Five Elements spells, the Annihilation Sword, even formations.

Nothing could destroy it.

Seeing this, a phrase suddenly surfaced in Li Fan’s mind:

"Beyond the Three Realms, outside the Five Elements."

The one-eyed paper figure’s eye turned slightly.

It seemed to be mocking Li Fan’s futile efforts.

Li Fan was not enraged.

A cluster of pure, radiant seven-colored light emerged in his hand, enveloping the one-eyed paper figure within.

The seven-colored divine light was continuously and deliberately compressed by Li Fan, nearly merging into a single hue—turning into an intensely dazzling white glow.

It was as if a miniature sun had appeared in his palm, illuminating the entire surrounding void in blinding brightness.

Within the white light, the yellow paper figure began to distort under the immense pressure.

However, Li Fan did not stop; instead, he further increased the output of the seven-colored divine light.

With the Five Elements Cave Heaven supplementing him, even the already-damaged Seven-Colored Jade Void Glimmering Light could still exert its maximum potential.

The seven-colored divine light did not belong to the Xuanhuang Realm.

As it condensed, it continuously repelled all foreign substances.

Its eye spun rapidly as it looked toward Li Fan, appearing as if it wished to communicate.

But Li Fan completely ignored it.

Without any hesitation, he further increased the output power of the seven-colored divine light.

Finally, when a single point of white brilliance was refined to its absolute limit—

A violent explosion, akin to the primordial chaos of creation, erupted.

In the blazing flames, the yellow talisman paper was utterly incinerated.

The weight pressing on his heart was finally lifted. Li Fan let out a long sigh of relief and slowly withdrew the seven-colored divine light into his body.

Having just advanced to the Nascent Soul stage, he had yet to fully refine the Seven-Colored Jade Void Glimmering Light.

His previous actions had slightly exceeded his limits.

However, destroying this technique of the Du'e Sect was well worth it.

“[Eternal Cataclysm of the World], seeking the one who answers the calamity.”

“No wonder it’s the sect legendary for using [Overcoming Calamity] as its cultivation sustenance. Ordinary spells can’t even touch these paper figures, let alone destroy them.”

“...”

“I wonder where those old geezers are hiding.”

Li Fan furrowed his brows.

After pondering for a long time, he found no clues and decided to put the matter aside for now.

The Five Elements Cave-Heaven had already been devoured into his body, and the passage with altered coordinates had naturally lost its function.

At this moment, Li Fan was hovering in the void of Tianling Prefecture.

As he concealed his aura and tore through the void, returning to the Xuanhuang Realm—

A chilling sensation suddenly surged from within his heart.

Li Fan lifted his gaze toward the heavens and earth.

He wasn’t sure if it was just his imagination, but he seemed to see—

Countless one-eyed paper figures, made entirely of yellow talisman paper, scattered throughout every corner of the Xuanhuang Realm.

Unnoticed by anyone, they silently widened their single eyes, observing the world.

At the very moment Li Fan returned to the Xuanhuang Realm, they seemed to sense the one who had destroyed one of their own.

All at once, their eyes turned toward Li Fan!

Locked in place by countless gazes, Li Fan’s body instantly froze.
