Yet, before the shock could fully register in his mind, the eerie stares suddenly vanished.

From beginning to end, it was as if it had all been a mere illusion.

His stiff body gradually regained its mobility, but Li Fan’s expression did not relax.

He knew that the terrifying scene from just moments ago was no illusion.

It had truly happened.

The Xuanhuang Realm—

Had been completely infiltrated by the Du'e Sect’s watchful eyes!

And all of this had happened without anyone realizing it!

Li Fan’s thoughts drifted back to when he was still a mere mortal, standing at the edge of the Great Xuan Abyss.

Back then, he had almost been bewitched by an illusion from the abyss and nearly plunged into the chasm.

Yet, at the last moment, he was suddenly awakened by another illusion—

Escaping death by a hair’s breadth.

Could this mean…?

Even the Xuanhuang Realm had been spread with and fixed in place by those yellow one-eyed paper figures?

The thought that his every move might have been clearly observed by the cultivators of the Du'e Sect in the shadows sent a chill down Li Fan's spine.

However, he had been through too much to lose his composure.

After analyzing the situation, he gradually calmed down.

First, it could be confirmed that the surveillance range of each one-eyed paper figure was not too large.

Otherwise, there wouldn’t be a need for so many talismans to cover the entire Xuanhuang Realm.

Second, the Du'e Sect’s talismans seemed to have no other function beyond surveillance.

The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and the Five Elders Association were certainly aware of the existence of these yellow talismans.

But destroying them was not an easy task.

Most likely, they had chosen to simply ignore them.

“No wonder the headquarters of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance was built inside the Tianxuan Mirror instead of being located within the Xuanhuang Realm.”

“They probably didn’t want to deal with these yellow paper figures, which are like a persistent skin disease.”

“And Senior Sister Zhao’s One-Heart Immortal Sect is also situated in an isolated space.”

Li Fan recalled his near encounter with being taken into the One-Heart Immortal Sect.

“This Du'e Sect has such disgusting conduct.”

Across a hundred lifetimes, Li Fan had encountered figures such as Ink Death, the Heavenly Doctor, Ruomu, Mr. Bai, and True Immortals.

Although each time was filled with peril, he always held deep respect for these true powerhouses.

They all carried themselves with the demeanor of true experts.

Even if he made a mistake and died at their hands, he would have no complaints.

He would simply accept that he had been careless or that his skills were inferior.

But this time was different—this time, he truly felt repulsed.

Who wouldn’t feel disgusted knowing that such a magnificent Xuanhuang Realm was covered with these talismans everywhere?

Even back in the 114th lifetime, when the Mysterious Net descended upon the world, at least it was done openly and with grandeur.

A green sky, while strange, was still far better than this suffocating mass of paper talismans blanketing the heavens and the earth like stubborn, festering sores.

Recalling that brief glimpse earlier, Li Fan couldn’t help but feel an urge to completely cleanse them from existence.

But…

It was just a fleeting thought.

After so many years, if the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance had allowed these paper figures to remain, it only proved that removing them completely was no easy feat.

After all, who would willingly live under constant surveillance?

“Du'e Sect… Du'e Sect…”

A glint of cold killing intent flashed in Li Fan’s eyes.

For the first time, he had the urge to personally eradicate them.

“It seems other matters will have to be put on hold for now.”

“At the very least, I need to resolve this issue of being watched at all times.”

Li Fan thought to himself.

At the same time, a trace of doubt arose in his heart.

What exactly was the Du'e Sect trying to achieve?

He had experienced countless outcomes of the Xuanhuang Realm.

He had even witnessed apocalyptic destruction.

Yet, no matter what fate the Xuanhuang Realm took, he had never seen any actual Du'e Sect cultivators reveal themselves.

“Are they waiting for the one destined to face tribulation to appear, for the calamity to pass completely?”

Sensing the faint yet ever-present gaze lingering between heaven and earth, Li Fan’s thoughts fluctuated.

After a long pause, he took flight toward Jiushan Prefecture.

He needed to have a discussion with the Five Elders Association.

Although one can contend with Dao Integration cultivators after advancing to the Nascent Soul stage, this was a sensitive moment when the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and the Five Elders Association were on the verge of conflict. Thus, Li Fan refrained from being overly arrogant.

The seven-colored divine light was too conspicuous, so Li Fan deliberately consumed additional spiritual power to condense it into a faint white glow, just as he had done when destroying the yellow one-eyed paper talisman before.

Flying at low altitude while concealing his aura with a secret technique, his speed was astonishing. In just a short moment, he had already traversed the entire Tianling Prefecture.

Faced with the obstruction of the white mist barrier ahead, he did not evade but charged straight through!

The Seven-Colored Jade Void Glimmering Light was supremely domineering, allowing no external interference.

Even the mysterious white mist, capable of devouring lifespan, was unable to find a flaw to infiltrate. It could only linger outside, unable to advance.

With the nearly endless supply of pure spiritual energy from the Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven as its driving force, Li Fan was able to push the speed of the seven-colored divine light to its absolute limit.

Before departing, he had notified Lin Ling.

Yet, both of them arrived at Shilin Prefecture almost simultaneously.

With this, his weakness in fleeing was finally remedied. In future life-or-death crises, he wouldn’t have to immediately think about perishing alongside his enemy but could attempt to escape first.

“Master.”

Lin Ling, sensing the overwhelming transformation in Li Fan’s presence, couldn’t help but be astonished as she examined him up and down.

“Let’s go.”

Li Fan gazed into the distance toward the border between Shilin and Jiushan Prefecture, where cultivators had gathered in formation.

During his secluded breakthrough, the misleading information he had provided had led to skirmishes between the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and the Five Elders Association in the bordering prefecture.

Both factions’ territories also experienced varying degrees of unrest.

At present, the defensive formations of each prefecture were permanently activated.

Furthermore, due to the failure to uncover the traitor within the Formation Hall, the newly devised [Divine Destruction Formation]—an unprecedented creation from the Immortal Alliance headquarters—had been deployed this time.

The name was indeed imposing.

And its actual effect was just as formidable.

Even the Final Dissociation Disc, which had never failed before, was unable to break through this formation in a short time.

Li Fan narrowed his eyes.

“This seems to be more than just a simple formation. Some rather powerful cultivators appear to be acting as the formation’s cores, compensating for its possible weaknesses.”

According to the calculations derived from the Dissociation Disc, even if one of the key cultivators maintaining the formation was defeated, as long as the overall structure remained intact, the formation could draw power from other nodes and rapidly regenerate itself.

Moreover, the newly generated formation would differ from the previous one.

“The Divine Destruction Formation’s power continuously increases with the strength of the cultivators maintaining it.”

“If there are four Dao Integration cultivators…”

“Then only a Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign could break through it.”

That was the conclusion derived from the Dissociation Disc’s analysis.

Fortunately, the formation only covered the territory’s surface and sky, leaving the deep underground earth veins untouched.

Under Lin Ling’s guidance, Li Fan successfully bypassed the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance’s defensive line and arrived at Jiushan Prefecture.

At this moment, Jiushan also exuded an air of imminent battle.

One could see that the Five Elders Association had constructed numerous fortresses atop the nine mountain peaks.

These fortresses resembled enormous black spheres buried underground, with only their curved upper portions exposed.

On the surface of the black spherical fortress, a faint red dot flickered.

It constantly moved.

When Li Fan’s gaze landed upon it, the red dot immediately reacted, turning to stare back at him.

A faint sense of crisis arose in his heart.

However, it quickly faded as the red dot’s lock-on was removed.

It seemed Lin Ling had already sent out the prearranged contact signal.

While waiting for the other party to arrive, Li Fan carefully observed Jiushan Prefecture.

This had nothing to do with the defensive arrangements of the Five Elders Association. Li Fan was merely trying to see if he could find any more traces of the yellow paper figures from the Du'e Sect here.

Unfortunately, the short-lived effect brought by destroying the paper figures had already disappeared. Li Fan scrutinized the area for a long time but still could not find where those hidden talismans were concealed.

"Out of sight, out of mind, but it still leaves an uneasy feeling," Li Fan muttered to himself, frowning.

As he was deep in thought, a figure suddenly appeared on the horizon.

In the blink of an eye, the figure traversed a thousand miles and stood right in front of Li Fan.

Unlike the previous contact person, the one sent to negotiate this time was a young cultivator dressed like a scholar, exuding an air of righteousness.

What was particularly strange was the large stone tablet strapped to the scholar’s back.

The inscriptions on it seemed to be obscured by some kind of power, making them unreadable.

"Greetings to the two fellow Daoists of the Federation." The scholar saluted them with a calm and gentle tone.

Li Fan's heart tightened—he couldn't discern this person's cultivation level. He dared not be negligent.

"You seem unfamiliar. Where is the previous one?"

"The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance launched a surprise attack recently. He, unfortunately, perished," the scholar said indifferently, his expression devoid of sorrow.

Li Fan didn’t know whether this was true or not, nor did he care.

His expression grew serious, and he got straight to the point: "This time, our Federation of All Worlds has come seeking assistance."

A hint of surprise finally flashed across the scholar’s face.

However, he quickly regained his composure. "Although our past dealings were purely transactional, we did benefit greatly. If you are in trouble, feel free to speak."

Li Fan glanced around, then set up a formation to isolate their conversation from the outside world.

Lowering his voice, he spoke carefully: "Not long ago, one of our elders emerged from secluded cultivation and discovered something that deeply shocked him."

"The Xuanhuang Realm is filled with countless yellow talisman-paper figures with a single eye."

"Not only this realm but even the surrounding small worlds are full of these things."

"Being watched at all times is an unsettling feeling. Yet, despite our efforts, we have been unable to remove these talismans…"

"May I ask, Fellow Daoist, do you have a solution?"

As Li Fan spoke, he carefully observed the scholar’s reaction.

Seeing that the scholar showed no particular surprise at the mention of the talisman-paper figures, Li Fan instantly understood—this person's identity was far from simple. He must have already known about the existence of the Du'e Sect's talismans.

The scholar with the stone tablet spoke seriously: "There are indeed ways to completely eradicate these talismans. However, the cost is quite steep, and I would not recommend doing so."

"Moreover…"

The stone tablet on his back emitted a faint, nearly imperceptible blue light. He paused briefly before continuing, "This 'World-Observing Divine Eye' has already been integrated into the fundamental laws of the Xuanhuang Realm. If they are all forcefully removed, it will undoubtedly cause catastrophic consequences for the realm itself."

At this point, the scholar’s meaning was crystal clear.

Li Fan frowned. "The Five Elders Association also has many former members from the Ten Great Immortal Sects. Doesn't anyone take issue with how the Du'e Sect operates?"

The Stone Tablet Scholar stared at Li Fan for a while, seeming somewhat surprised.

After a moment, he finally spoke, his tone indescribable.

"Even if you still have unresolved grievances, what’s the point of struggling against the dead?"

Li Fan was slightly taken aback.

"The Du'e Sect of the past no longer exists in this world," the Stone Tablet Scholar said with some emotion.

"The World-Observing Divine Eye is merely carrying out the final command it received."

"The Du'e Sect is gone?" Upon hearing this, Li Fan’s heart trembled.

Seeing Li Fan’s expression of disbelief, the Stone Tablet Scholar smiled faintly and nodded in confirmation. "Absolutely. Dead beyond any doubt."

"Could it be a deception to evade calamity?"

Had they already been completely wiped out?

For a moment, Li Fan found it hard to accept that he had essentially been waging an intellectual battle against thin air. Still unwilling to believe it, he pressed further.

The Stone Tablet Scholar chuckled. "The Immortal Ancestor personally took action. There was no chance of survival for the Du'e Sect. Back then, it was something all the sects acknowledged."

"However, your Federation of All Worlds is relatively young, so it’s natural that you wouldn't know."

Hearing this, Li Fan fell silent.

"After defying the laws of heaven and attaining the rank of Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign, the Immortal Ancestor rarely took action again. The extermination of the Du’e Sect was one of the few exceptions. Even when they fled beyond the boundaries of this realm, they could not escape their destined demise," the Stone Tablet Scholar said with a tinge of emotion.

"The instigators may be dead, but the damage they caused is irreparable. The World-Observing Divine Eye was left behind as a result."

"Fortunately, unless one deliberately looks for it, it’s hardly noticeable. So, people have chosen to ignore its existence."

"Besides, in at most a hundred thousand years, these paper effigies will naturally dissolve with the passage of time. That’s why no one pays them much mind."

The scholar explained this very seriously.

Li Fan finally understood what had happened.

It was like the previous analogy—treating the Xuanhuang Realm as a house.

After defying the laws of heaven, the Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign had become part of the house itself.

However, due to a moment of negligence, this house had been filled with surveillance devices.

Everywhere one looked, there were cameras—unsightly and intrusive.

The most critical issue was that when these surveillance devices had been installed, they had been integrated into the structure of the house.

Removing them would inevitably cause irreversible damage to the house.

Already teetering between life and death outside the Immortal Ruins, this was a consequence that the cultivators within the Xuanhuang Realm could not afford.

So, despite their frustration, they had no choice but to accept this reality.

Enraged, the Immortal Ancestor, who considered himself the master of the house, personally took action and annihilated the Du’e Sect that had installed the surveillance.

After piecing everything together, Li Fan fell into silence.

"Why exactly did the Du'e Sect do this?"

A trace of reminiscence flashed in the Stone Tablet Scholar’s eyes.

"Those people were always enigmatic and secretive. Who could truly know what was going on in their minds?"

"But one thing is certain—they must have foreseen the consequences of their actions."

"And yet, they still insisted on doing it."

"Honestly, I’m very curious as well," the scholar said with a smile.

"But the dead are gone. Perhaps this mystery will never be solved."

Li Fan’s expression grew solemn.

From this conversation and the scholar’s demeanor since he had appeared, it was clear—

This scholar was undoubtedly a powerful cultivator who had survived since ancient times.

"Dare I ask, Senior, what is your name?" Li Fan clasped his hands respectfully.

The scholar did not hide anything and said, "Among the Ten Great Immortal Sects, the one without a name— that is me."

Li Fan's heart trembled violently.

When he had previously researched the Ten Great Immortal Sects, no matter how hard he searched, he could only find the names of nine sects.

The remaining one had no records at all.

At one point, Li Fan even thought that the so-called "Ten Great Sects" was merely a conventional saying.

Or perhaps, one of them had already been wiped out.

He never expected that today, he would witness the most mysterious, nameless final sect!

Moreover, the words of this stone tablet scholar were quite intriguing.

"The one among the ten sects without a name— that is me..."

"Just like Senior Sister Zhao, one person alone constitutes an entire sect?"

Even though the scholar before him appeared harmless, Li Fan's vigilance was at its peak.

This might be the second true Longevity Immortal expert he had ever encountered.

The stone tablet scholar saw Li Fan's wary stance, as if he was facing a great enemy, and couldn't help but shake his head slightly.

"No need to be so tense. I have no interest in the conflicts between the Five Elders Association and the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance."

"In fact, even the survival or destruction of the Xuanhuang Realm hardly concerns me."

"If one day, the Xuanhuang Realm were to be completely destroyed, I would be the first to applaud." The scholar spoke as if his words carried deeper meaning.

The scholar glanced at the stone tablet on his back, his expression somewhat complex.

Seeing that the other party did not seem to be lying and bore no hostility, Li Fan's courage grew.

"Senior, this stone tablet..."

"In ancient times, cultivators often sought to steal the power of eternal life from heaven and earth through the fruit of the Ruomu Tree."

"However, by sheer coincidence, I obtained this stone tablet, which allows me to exist alongside heaven and earth, never perishing through countless ages." The scholar's voice was filled with vicissitudes and exhaustion.

"This artifact is called the Genesis Stone Tablet. Everything that happens within the Xuanhuang Realm, no matter how trivial, is automatically recorded upon it."

"The world considers it a supreme treasure, wanting to take it from me."

"I would gladly part with it, yet no one has ever succeeded in seizing it."

"Fellow Daoist of the Federation, would you like to give it a try?" the scholar asked sincerely.

Li Fan was deeply shaken.

Everything in the Xuanhuang Realm would be automatically recorded?

Was this not the ultimate fusion and enhancement of a Bloodline Historical Archive and the World-Observing Divine Eye?

If he could obtain it, the secrets of past and present would all be at his fingertips.

What kind of fortune would that be?

Li Fan suddenly felt his throat go dry.

However, he still had some sense left.

Faced with the scholar’s invitation, he dared not act recklessly and quickly shook his head.

The stone tablet scholar seemed a bit disappointed but explained, "I am not lying. There is truly no harm in trying."

Although the other party spoke with utmost sincerity, Li Fan still refused to comply.

The scholar sighed with a trace of loneliness and did not insist.

"People these days are growing more and more timid."

Li Fan closed his eyes, pretending not to have heard anything.

After a while, seeing that the other party no longer brought up the matter, he asked instead, "Senior, with your status, why would you suddenly take the initiative to meet me?"

The stone tablet scholar fixed his gaze on Li Fan, a trace of amusement flashing in his eyes.

"I came specifically for you."

Li Fan's heart tightened. "Senior, please don’t scare me. I am but a mere Nascent Soul cultivator—how could I possibly be worthy of your attention?"

"The Genesis Stone Tablet may be able to record everything within the world."

"But there are some things that transcend this world itself." The scholar spoke in a deep voice.

As soon as the Stone Tablet Scholar spoke these words, Li Fan’s heart tensed to the extreme.

However, the current Grand Preceptor Li had already reached Dao Integration-level combat power. He was also armed with numerous great divine abilities, such as the Seven-Colored Jade Void Glimmering Light.

He was no longer someone who could be easily frightened by mere words.

Not even if the other party was a Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign!

Li Fan made a decision...

To further probe into the other party’s true intentions!

So, Li Fan feigned a mixture of doubt and surprise. "Transcending beyond the Xuanhuang Realm? What does that have to do with me?"

The Stone Tablet Scholar smiled. "Since you refuse to admit it, then let us take a look at what is recorded about you within the stone tablet."

A burst of azure light surged from the stone tablet behind him.

The scholar let out a muffled groan as his body began to expand.

His appearance and attire inexplicably shifted at a rapid pace.

One moment, he was a refined scholar.

The next, a sturdy woodcutter.

Then, an enchanting beauty.

At times, he was not even human—

Transforming into a towering tree, a delicate flower,

A bird soaring in the sky, a beast roaming the land…

Yet, the stone tablet behind him remained unchanged—its azure glow eternal.

Eventually, the images swirling in the surrounding light curtain began to stabilize.

Glowing brilliantly, a figure emerged—it was Li Fan!

However, it did not show the moment he flew out of the Great Xuan Realm.

It did not even display the moment he first entered the Xuanhuang Realm through a spatial passageway and went directly to Tianyang Cave Abode to subdue Tianyang.

Instead, the records began when he led Tianyang into Shilin Prefecture.

Discovered the entrance to the Spiritwood Realm.

Entered and exited, then later captured Shang Tianci in Jiushan Prefecture.

Found Mr. Bai’s secret chamber beneath Taihua Prefecture.

Returned to the Spiritwood Realm, and later emerged with Lin Ling, who had Dao Integration-level strength.

Completed a transaction with the Five Elders Association, and then headed straight for Tianling Prefecture’s Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven...

The images continued to shift.

However, Li Fan’s sense of vigilance eased significantly.

"Just as I expected."

"The Genesis Stone Tablet automatically records everything that happens within the Xuanhuang Realm, down to the finest detail. But… it only applies to the original Xuanhuang Realm!"

"One must understand—today’s Xuanhuang Realm is no longer what it used to be. It has merged with countless Cave-Heaven, small worlds, and even fragments of numerous other cultivation realms!"

"For these external additions, the Genesis Stone Tablet might not have any records at all!"

It was like a house—

The original Xuanhuang Realm was merely a small, standalone hut.

But over the years, countless cultivators had expanded it, making it many times larger than before.

At the beginning, the Genesis Stone Tablet, which was born alongside Heaven and Earth, had full authority to record everything inside the original hut.

But for these foreign lands, the Genesis Stone Tablet had lost its ability to record them!

The scene continued to shift.

Just as Li Fan had anticipated, it was intermittent.

The most crucial part was that the places he frequently visited—the Congyun Sea, the Spiritwood Realm, the Five Elements Great Cave Heaven—were all beyond the scope of the recorded images.

As a result, most of the footage consisted of him traveling—constantly on the move.

"So, what this scholar said—he came for me..."

"Where did I make a mistake?"

Li Fan's mind raced.

The images displayed by the stone slate were fast approaching the present moment.

Then, his clone, Ji Shaoli, suddenly appeared in the projection.

The moment he entered Yongyun Prefecture, the images abruptly cut off.

Afterward, Ji Shaoli left Yongyun Prefecture and headed straight for the Spiritwood Realm.

The screen dimmed, and then it showed Li Fan advancing to the Nascent Soul stage. After leaving the Spiritwood Realm, he wielded the Seven-Colored Divine Light, swiftly fleeing across the regions.

"Was it the Seven-Colored Divine Light that caught his attention?" Li Fan couldn't help but think.

The next words of the Stone Tablet Scholar confirmed his suspicions.

"I don’t really care whether that so-called Federation of All Worlds is real or fake."

"What interests me more is where you obtained that Seven-Colored Divine Light in Yongyun Prefecture." The scholar's gaze was intense as he looked at Li Fan.

"The energy level of this item is beyond what the remnants of the prefectural domains could possibly nurture."

"Couldn’t it be that I comprehended this divine ability myself?" Li Fan countered.

The scholar chuckled in silence.

"I possess the Genesis Stone Slate. I am naturally very familiar with the aura exuding from your Seven-Colored Radiance. It contains power akin to the condensation of a world’s Heavenly Dao. If you truly had such capability, then the one asking questions here today would not be me."

"It would be you instead," the scholar said indifferently.

Though there was no intent to mock, the expression and tone he used made Li Fan snort coldly.

Seeing Li Fan remain silent, the Stone Tablet Scholar continued, "Don't worry, I won’t take your belongings. Though this Seven-Colored Divine Light is indeed powerful, to me, it is nothing but a burden."

"What I truly want to know is the place that gave birth to the Seven-Colored Divine Light," the scholar stated honestly.

Li Fan narrowed his eyes. "What do you mean by that, senior? How can you be so sure that the Seven-Colored Divine Light was created by something? Couldn’t it simply be a singular treasure hidden within Yongyun Prefecture?"

The scholar sighed.

The surrounding light curtain suddenly turned pitch black.

Then, a single point of seven-colored radiance emerged.

In the darkness, it was incomparably dazzling and prominent.

The scholar looked at Li Fan. "Do you understand now?"

"Such a treasure, as long as it exists in the world, will always be like this—whether it has been refined or not."

"A long time ago…"

"Some people searched the entire Xuanhuang Realm thoroughly. Aside from that Tianxuan Mirror, no treasure above the level of a realm artifact remains in the world today."

"Which means that your Seven-Colored Divine Light must have only recently appeared…"

Hearing this, Li Fan's expression darkened.

He hadn’t expected that, despite its incredible power, the Seven-Colored Divine Light would be so conspicuous in the eyes of truly formidable experts.

Faced with the scholar’s inquiry, Li Fan’s mind raced, contemplating how to respond.

After a brief moment, he made up his mind.

Feigning great difficulty and hesitation, he finally let out a long sigh. "Forget it. I knew I wouldn’t be able to hide this matter forever."

"Senior, follow me, and you will see for yourself."

With that, he awakened Lin Ling, who had been standing frozen in shock, silently watching and not daring to speak.

Then, he dove underground, heading straight for Yongyun Prefecture.

Beneath the earth’s veins, the Stone Tablet Scholar followed unhurriedly, strolling as if he were taking a leisurely walk.

Seeing this, Li Fan was secretly astonished.

At the same time, he thought to himself, "No wonder in my previous life, despite having a treasure like the Fishing Pond, Zhong Shentong didn’t stay and guard it forever. Instead, he wandered around."

"It must have been because he left Yongyun Prefecture and revealed the Seven-Colored Divine Light, which led this Stone Tablet Scholar to notice something amiss and track him down."

"He was forced to relinquish ownership of the supreme treasure."

"What a grave mistake."

"It is likely that Zhong Shentong, a mere Foundation Establishment cultivator, was able to keep such a treasure as the Seven-Colored Jade Void Glimmering Light without having it taken away because he surrendered the Fishing Pond in exchange for protection."

Li Fan sighed in his heart.

He should not have overlooked this detail.

However, having first obtained a priceless treasure and then successfully breaking through, his mindset had become somewhat elated.

Thus, he had ignored this suspicious point.

"But it's not necessarily a bad thing. At the very least, I now understand that the Seven-Colored Divine Light cannot be easily wielded. Moreover, it has drawn out this great figure."

Li Fan glanced at the Stone Tablet Scholar behind him without any visible emotion.

Amidst the flowing earth veins, the scholar walked as if he were a mere mortal, unhurried and steady.

The ancient trees within the earth veins, which would usually attack intruding cultivators, remained completely still.

Even Lin Ling's calls were completely ignored.

Li Fan cursed inwardly but urged Lin Ling to continue forward.

Meanwhile, in Jiushan Prefecture.

At the previous meeting spot—

Shortly after Li Fan and the scholar had left, a cultivator dressed in the robes of the Five Elders Association arrived late.

He waited for a long time but saw no one appear.

He was utterly baffled.

Yongyun Prefecture.

Inside a small temple nestled in the mountains, by the Fishing Pond—

"Senior, please take a look." Li Fan respectfully pointed at the small pond before them.

Since Ji Shaoli had given prior notice, Zhong Shentong was already aware that someone would be coming.

Seeing the Stone Tablet Scholar and Li Fan, he didn’t dare to even breathe too loudly.

He carefully shielded Liuli behind him, firmly holding her head down to prevent her from peeking out.

The scholar scrutinized the scene with great interest for a long time.

"This is nothing more than an ordinary little pond... Could there be some deeper mystery?"

Intrigued, the scholar became curious.

Li Fan gave Zhong Shentong a look, signaling him to demonstrate.

"I have already used up today’s attempts." Zhong Shentong said helplessly.

Seeing this, Li Fan had no choice but to take action himself.

He sat upright by the pond, maintaining a proper posture.

Casting his fishing rod into the water.

The next moment, a strange glimmer flashed in the stone tablet scholar’s eyes.

When Li Fan retrieved his line and examined the white light cluster in his hand, realization dawned on him.

"So that’s how it works."

Eager to try for himself, the scholar stepped forward.

Just as Li Fan was about to explain the correct method of using the Fishing Pond—

He saw the scholar pause for a moment before his body blurred, suddenly changing appearance!

The form he assumed was one that Li Fan was extremely familiar with.

It was none other than the eccentric Old Fisherman!

Only this time, the basket on his back had turned into a heavy, blue-green stone tablet!

"Oh, I forgot to mention—this scholar’s appearance was never my original one."

"I merely imitated a figure from the Five Elders Association."

The "Old Fisherman" smiled, humming a tune as he cast his fishing line.

His demeanor and movements were almost indistinguishable from the real fisherman.

Li Fan’s heart sank.

From his previous encounters, he had somewhat underestimated this Longevity Immortal Realm powerhouse.

After all, the monitoring capabilities of the Genesis Stone Tablet only worked in certain areas.

This figure had failed to recognize his identity and had reacted to the treasure Fishing Pond like any ordinary cultivator, filled with joy and excitement.

Unintentionally, this had lowered his sense of awe and vigilance toward him.

But now, looking at him again...

This person was also deeply hidden.

Although he did not attain the Dao by defying the natural order, he was by no means someone to be underestimated.

Li Fan stood to the side, not daring to act rashly.

Zhong Shentong was even more motionless, like a solemn statue, his face and body completely frozen.

Only Lin Ling and Liuli, the two bold ones present, dared to secretly stare at the stone tablet fisherman.

The fisherman’s first fishing session was unusually long.

He seemed to be deeply immersed in the process.

Even after more than half a day, he remained seated without moving, making Li Fan suspect that he had already failed but was merely putting on an act.

However, when a brilliant golden light reappeared in the small temple nestled in the mountains—

Li Fan’s doubts instantly vanished.

Looking at the golden orb of light in the stone tablet fisherman’s hand, Li Fan couldn't help but question his own understanding of reality.

Zhong Shentong was equally dumbfounded, unable to believe his eyes.

The Stone Tablet Fisherman gazed at the orb for a moment and muttered, "The Heavenly Emperor’s Qi Classic?"

"A method to achieve the title of Emperor Sovereign in this world, gathering the fortune of all beings and dynastic destiny. Without the need for cultivation, one can become a powerhouse comparable to the Longevity Immortal Realm..."

"All you people ever think about is fighting and killing. How dull."

The Stone Tablet Fisherman sighed in boredom. "Here, you take it."

With that, he casually tossed the golden orb toward Li Fan and the others.

Zhong Shentong wanted to reach out and grab it, but under Li Fan’s cold gaze, which carried a hint of killing intent, he dared not act presumptuously.

Li Fan caught the golden orb and quickly examined it.

The contents matched what the fisherman had said.

It was a unique cultivation method that had been passed down in a world devoid of spiritual energy.

"An ingenious concept."

"But unfortunately, to gather enough fortune to match the scale described in this text, it would take hundreds of years and over a dozen generations of continuous effort."

"Useless."

Li Fan regretfully commented, yet he still carefully stored it in his storage ring.

He looked at the Stone Tablet Fisherman, who remained in his fishing posture, and couldn't help but say, "Senior, this fishing pond only grants one opportunity per day."

The Stone Slab Fisherman yawned, "I know."

"But I’m just fishing for the sake of fishing."

Li Fan was taken aback.

The Stone Slab Fisherman seemed to truly enjoy the process of fishing itself.

He didn’t seem to care whether he caught a treasure or not.

Compared to Zhong Shentong and Li Fan, he appeared to be a genuine fisherman.

"From now on, I’ll be staying here."

"You don’t need to worry about me—just pretend I don’t exist."

"Whatever I catch, I don’t want it. It’s all yours."

The Stone Tablet Fisherman suddenly spoke.

Although Li Fan had already expected this, even with the Fisherman's reassurance, how could he possibly ignore the presence of such a powerful Longevity Immortal Realm expert?

"Senior, are you perhaps searching for something useful from this fishing pond?"

The Stone Tablet Fisherman did not seem to harbor any malice.

Gathering his courage, Li Fan asked.

The Stone Tablet Fisherman’s reply was straightforward: "Yes. There is nothing in the Xuanhuang Realm that can remove the stone tablet on my back."

"Perhaps something within this fishing pond might."

This answer caught Li Fan off guard, leaving him in silent contemplation.

Meanwhile, Zhong Shentong and Liuli curiously turned their attention to the ancient stone tablet on the Fisherman’s back.

"It's exhausting. It's unbearable."

The Stone Tablet Fisherman sighed while continuing to fish.

"The Xuanhuang Realm... Every moment, countless events unfold."

"Even if I don’t want to know, they flood my mind uncontrollably."

"You think that’s a good thing?"

The Stone Tablet Fisherman shook his head repeatedly.

"In the beginning, I even tried splitting my own head open."

"But as long as the stone tablet remains intact, I cannot die."

"Even if I were reduced to a skeleton, memories would still flood my mind."

The words of the Stone Tablet Fisherman frightened both Liuli and Lin Ling, turning their faces pale.

Li Fan’s expression also grew serious.

Being forced to receive an endless stream of information at every moment, unable to seek death even if one wished for it…

That was indeed an excruciatingly painful fate.

"If we truly find a way to sever your connection with the stone tablet from within this fishing pond, would you die?" Li Fan mustered his courage and asked after a brief silence in the small temple.

The Stone Tablet Fisherman chuckled softly but kept facing the pond, his voice carrying a faint sigh. "I’ve just lived too wearily. I only want to live with ease, not to stop living altogether."

Li Fan understood.

After speaking, the Stone Tablet Fisherman closed his eyes, adopting a demeanor that signaled he did not wish to be disturbed.

Thus, Li Fan led Zhong Shentong and Liuli into the small temple.

"Knowing too much will not benefit you. Just serve carefully at his side. If that one is willing to give you even the slightest guidance, it would be a tremendous fortune for you." Li Fan said coldly.

Zhong Shentong hurriedly nodded.

Li Fan then turned to Lin Ling. "From now on, whatever the senior fisherman pulls from the pond, you will be responsible for collecting it. I will come periodically to retrieve them."

Lin Ling naturally agreed.

Finally, Li Fan’s gaze landed on the young Liuli.

This young Liuli had a mysterious origin. It was Zhong Shentong who had fished her out of the pond—an entity formed from a translucent fruit. Being a creation of golden-light tier, she was at the very least above the Dao Integration stage, making her not to be underestimated.

However, her true nature remained unclear. Nonetheless, since she was merely an innocent little Dao child, Li Fan had plenty of ways to control her.

Putting on a kind and gentle expression, Li Fan softly reassured Liuli that the Stone Tablet Fisherman was a benevolent senior and that she had nothing to fear.

She could even accompany him in fishing whenever she had free time.

Little Liuli didn’t dare to speak, only nodding in confusion.

"With the senior fisherman guarding the fishing pond, its safety is assured. In a way, this is a blessing in disguise," Li Fan thought to himself.

Outwardly, he appeared helpless about the fishing pond's secret being exposed.

But deep down, he didn’t actually care.

For him, the only secret that must never be coveted by outsiders…

Was [Truth].

If the existence of [Truth] were ever revealed, then no matter how peaceful things seemed on the surface…

He would have to return immediately.

That was the bottom line in Li Fan’s heart.

The Stone Tablet Fisherman sat at the edge of the small pond, fishing silently throughout the night.

He remained completely still, like a sculpture.

The next day, when he lifted his fishing rod again, all he caught was a white ball of light.

This surprised Li Fan.

"As long as it bites the hook, it's a good fish. In my eyes, there’s no difference."

"Besides, the thing that can help me sever my bond with the Genesis Stone Tablet may not necessarily be of the highest grade."

The Stone Tablet Fisherman lazily explained.

But his explanation only made things more confusing.

Since the matter involved the fisherman’s deepest secrets, Li Fan refrained from asking further.

Instead, he turned to seek advice on how to conceal the Seven-Colored Divine Light.

After all, the Seven-Colored Jade Void Glimmering Light was too extraordinary—it combined offense, defense, and evasion into one. If he couldn't use it freely, it would be a complete waste of such a divine ability.

The Stone Tablet Fisherman remained silent for a moment.

He seemed to be in deep thought.

"There is a way," he finally said.

A moment later, he gave his answer:

"The Seven-Colored Divine Light— the reason I immediately saw through it is because its unique fluctuations are too conspicuous. It’s like the only beam of light in the darkness."

"However, if the wielder of the Seven-Colored Divine Light—that is, you—can emit fluctuations no weaker than the divine light itself, you can suppress its traces. Just like how a beam of light naturally blends into the environment during the day."

Upon hearing this, Li Fan was left speechless.

To possess a power on par with the Seven-Colored Divine Light, which was refined using the very essence of the Heavenly Light of the cultivation world, wouldn't that require at least a Dao Integration-level cultivator?

If he had that kind of strength, would he even need to hide?

Seemingly seeing through Li Fan’s thoughts, the Stone Tablet Fisherman turned around and glanced at him.

"For others, that might not be possible. But you are different."

Li Fan's heart tensed up once again.

"Didn’t you break through to the Nascent Soul stage by devouring the 'Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven'?"

"That thing can barely be considered half a cultivation world on its own."

The Stone Tablet Fisherman's words left Li Fan momentarily stunned.

"Heh, don’t assume that every cultivation world is as vast as the Xuanhuang Realm. In ancient times, among the many lower realms, Xuanhuang was already considered one of the larger ones."

"Let alone now."

"If you can fully unleash the power of the 'Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven,' then under the Longevity Immortal stage, you may not be invincible, but at the very least, you will be undefeated." The Stone Tablet Fisherman said calmly.

Although Li Fan had already speculated about this, he still couldn't contain his excitement.

"Back then, the secret methods of the [First Origin Sect]... who would have thought that thousands of years later, a mere Golden Core junior would end up reaping the benefits?" The Stone Tablet Fisherman let out a low chuckle, as if recalling something amusing.

Li Fan looked at him curiously, and the Stone Tablet Fisherman did not mind explaining.

"When the Great Catastrophe first arrived, every sect had its own countermeasures. The First Origin Sect, for instance, discovered the very root of the Xuanhuang Realm and used a secret method to forcibly cultivate the Five Elements Cave-Heaven."

"According to them, the Heavenly Dao of the Xuanhuang Realm had already been corrupted and was beyond salvation. Instead of struggling to restore it, it was better to abandon it completely—extract its essence and use the Five Elements Cave-Heaven as a prototype to nurture a brand-new world within!"

"Like a mother giving birth to a child."

"It was a good idea, but unfortunately, even humans cling to life. How much more so would the Heavenly Dao itself?" The Stone Tablet Fisherman sneered.

"As soon as they began their plan, someone found out and forced them to halt."

Although Li Fan was extremely curious about who could have stopped the First Origin Sect's plan, he saw that the other party had no intention of elaborating. He had no choice but to suppress his curiosity.

After speaking so much, the Stone Tablet Fisherman seemed to grow tired.

He closed his eyes once more.

Seeing this, the perceptive Li Fan immediately withdrew.

On the third day.

The Stone Tablet Fisherman fished up a purple light orb.

"Oh?"

Unlike before, he did not immediately throw it to Lin Ling, but instead examined it with great interest.

"What is it, Senior?" Li Fan quickly stepped forward and asked.

The Stone Tablet Fisherman did not answer. It was as if he had discovered something truly fascinating.

He stared blankly at the pond in front of him.

Completely motionless.

Like he had turned to stone— for seven whole days.

During those seven days, Li Fan never left.

Following the Stone Tablet Fisherman’s gaze, he too observed the pond, attempting to comprehend the reason for the man's sudden fixation.

The result was obvious.

Even though he saw nothing, Li Fan still put on a thoughtful expression.

"You see it too?"

After an unknown amount of time, that evening, the Stone Tablet Fisherman suddenly awoke from his silence.

"This junior is foolish and has failed to perceive any profundities." Li Fan admitted honestly.

"I only feel that this fishing pond holds boundless mysteries that may be of great benefit to me."

This bit of nonsense, however, earned a nod of approval from the Stone Tablet Fisherman.

"Indeed, I misjudged before."

"I originally thought that the things in this fishing pond had been placed inside a thousand years ago when it was first forged."

"But the item I fished out last time was not from that era at all."

"It only appeared within the last five hundred years."

The Stone Tablet Fisherman opened his palm, revealing a curved black jade piece resembling a horn.

"This is..." Li Fan couldn't recognize it.

"The Conquering Heaven Horn—an invention of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance. Blowing it briefly invokes the power of the Heavenly Dao within a Prefecture," the Stone Tablet Fisherman explained concisely.

"The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance?" Li Fan was momentarily stunned, then his expression shifted slightly.

Turning his gaze toward the fishing pond, countless thoughts surged through his mind.

"As we fish in the starry skies, it is also fishing across the myriad realms..."

The Stone Tablet Fisherman’s words confirmed Li Fan’s suspicions.

A tidal wave of realization struck his mind, leaving him unable to calm down for a long time.

Even though he had personally experienced the fishing pond’s mysteries, he never imagined he still didn’t fully grasp its nature.

"So this is the power of an Immortal Artifact."

"It not only contains countless treasures but also never runs out."

This was what Li Fan thought.

However, the Stone Tablet Fisherman was focused on something else.

His usually calm tone carried a rare hint of excitement. "This is the true Dao of Fishing."

"This Immortal Artifact is not simple."

"If I can master it, perhaps I won’t even need to rely on it anymore. I could fish across the myriad realms on my own and find whatever I seek." His voice carried a trace of eagerness.

Li Fan fell silent.

Only now did he fully realize—

For a mystical object like the Genesis Stone Tablet, how could it possibly attach itself to someone ordinary?

With this new discovery, the Stone Tablet Fisherman stopped fishing.

At the same time, he transformed.

No longer appearing as an old fisherman, he now looked like a newborn baby.

He slept soundly by the pondside with his eyes closed.

Days passed, yet he showed no signs of waking.

Li Fan shook his head and withdrew.

"Even with the senior’s level of comprehension, understanding the Dao of Fishing won’t be a quick matter."

"And yet, he’s hogging the fishing pond, and no one dares to disturb him."

Li Fan felt helpless.

He had no choice but to instruct Lin Ling to stay and keep watch, informing him at the first sign of movement.

Li Fan then returned alone to the Spiritwood Realm.

At that moment, he received a message from the Five Elders Association.

"Even the Five Elders Association’s contact was a fake."

"That Stone Tablet Senior really gets into character," Li Fan mused, recalling the other party’s tone and expressions, shaking his head in amusement.

"This must be one of his little amusements. Fortunately, he has a good temperament—at least he didn’t kill me outright over some minor disagreement."

During these past few days with the Stone Tablet Senior, aside from learning some ancient secrets—

The most important thing was finally understanding the core conflict between the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and the Five Elders Association in the Xuanhuang Realm.

Li Fan recalled the senior’s words:

"The Xuanhuang Realm is like a ship—one that is about to sink."

"The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and the Five Elders Association are fighting over who gets to take the helm."

"Both sides are absolutely convinced that they can prevent the Xuanhuang Realm from sinking, but only if one of them holds the final authority."

"Heh, just like the Ten Great Immortal Sects years ago."

"It’s not that they were blinded by power, but rather that escaping would require coordinating and concentrating the full strength of the entire realm. If there were internal betrayal..."

"So, fighting and killing don’t matter. Once the very existence of the Xuanhuang Realm is truly threatened, both sides will still join forces—just like five hundred years ago, when those traitors returned."

When mentioning those traitors, the tone of the old fisherman of the Stone Tablet became uncharacteristically fierce.

"Five hundred years ago… That should refer to the counterattack from the small worlds. However, these small worlds seemed to be mere puppets. The true mastermind behind it was likely those cultivators who had once betrayed the Xuanhuang Realm."

Within the Spiritwood Realm, as he compared the old fisherman's words with the hidden secrets uncovered in prior investigations, Li Fan was deep in thought.

"As expected of the bearer of the Genesis Stone Tablet… He knows too many secrets. Too bad his strength isn’t enough."

"How much one can know entirely depends on how much the other party is willing to share."

"Otherwise, he would surely be subjected to relentless interrogation, day and night."

Li Fan's thoughts turned slowly.

Through the perspective of the elder of the Stone Tablet, many things that had seemed obscured in a fog to Li Fan suddenly became clear.

At that moment, after hearing the old fisherman’s discussion on the struggle between the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and the Five Elders Association, Li Fan couldn't help but ask, "Then what about the Immortal Ancestor? What is his stance on all of this?"

The old fisherman of the Stone Tablet seemed to have heard an incredibly amusing joke.

He first burst into laughter, as if no one else was present.

Only after laughing heartily did he finally respond, "Immortal Ancestor?"

"Even if the Xuanhuang Realm sinks..."

"The Dharma-Transmitting Immortal Ancestor can still fly, can’t he?"

"He simply doesn’t care."

"However..."

The old fisherman’s smile suddenly faded.

"This is just my speculation."

"In reality, for the Immortal Ancestor—who views the Xuanhuang Realm as his personal possession—his stance is somewhat unpredictable."

"Otherwise, after all these years, he could have left long ago."

His voice gradually weakened until it became completely inaudible.

"The Dharma-Transmitting Immortal Ancestor can fly."

"So, he has already freed himself from the influence of the Immortal Ruins and can leave on his own."

Li Fan pondered silently.

"I wonder… exactly how powerful one must be to escape from Xuanhuang?"

"Perhaps..."

"I could give it a try."

A sudden thought emerged in Li Fan’s mind.

Although, in the Xuanhuang Realm, aside from the Immortal Ancestor, there had never been a precedent of any Longevity Immortal successfully escaping…

But Xuanhuang’s longevity was bound to the realm itself.

It was possible that the lack of escape wasn’t due to insufficient strength, but rather the binding force acting as a counterbalance.

Just like the Senior Stone Tablet.

"Besides, I don’t necessarily have to rely solely on my own strength. External assistance could be an option as well."

Li Fan recalled the 114th era, when countless obelisks stood towering over the Xuanhuang lands.

"If I could use my Five Elements Cave-Heaven to achieve the Nascent Soul stage… and then merge the Five Elements into one, forging a new world…"

"And if I were to construct obelisks upon the land, harnessing their force for propulsion..."

"Perhaps escaping the Xuanhuang Realm wouldn’t be impossible."

In truth, as someone who possessed the [Truth] ability, Li Fan had never planned to be trapped in an endless struggle with the Xuanhuang Realm.

If an alternative cultivation world could be found, it would certainly be preferable to staying in this forsaken place.

After all, the Xuanhuang Realm—on the verge of collapse—was unpredictable, no matter what happened next.

Throughout his journey, Li Fan had encountered far too many demons, devils, and ghosts.

"A kind of attempt, using a dual approach."

Li Fan silently calculated his next move.

Escaping from the collapsing ship that is the Xuanhuang Realm requires a solid foundation of technological reserves.

Li Fan alone could not accomplish such a feat.

By drawing inspiration from the existing achievements of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and the Five Elders Association, then innovating upon them, there was a chance to break free from this predicament.

"I wonder how the Chosen Immortal Plan is progressing."

"Even though the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance harbored ulterior motives from the very beginning, before the truth is exposed, they still remain the highly regarded Chosen Immortal, the shining hope of the Alliance."

"They should be able to serve as valuable insiders, right?"

With such thoughts in mind, Li Fan sent a reply to the Five Elders Association.

He did not disclose the existence of Senior Stone Tablet, merely stating that he had received an urgent notification that the meeting had been compromised, forcing its cancellation.

As for where the problem lay—it was undoubtedly on the Five Elders Association’s side.

Even though he was making things up, Li Fan didn’t mind.

Spies? If you look for them, you'll always find some.

Putting aside matters concerning the Five Elders Association, Li Fan shifted his focus inward, concentrating on the Five Elements Origin Cave Heaven within his body.

Previously, he had believed this Five Elements Cave Heaven had naturally formed within the Xuanhuang Realm, rendering it impervious to external threats.

However, Senior Stone Tablet had since revealed that it was, in fact, the handiwork of the First Origin Sect from thousands of years ago…

Given Li Fan’s cautious nature, he naturally had to conduct a thorough inspection.

Fortunately, his fears were unfounded.

After meticulous examination, he confirmed that there were no residual imprints left behind by the First Origin Sect in his Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven.

This allowed him to breathe a slight sigh of relief.

After all, the Xuanhuang Realm was a treacherous place, and every potential threat, no matter how small, had to be handled with extreme care.

"With my Nascent Soul fully formed, the next step is advancing to Soul Transformation..."

"The impending transformation of heaven and earth..."

A vision flashed through Li Fan’s mind—Mr. Bai, during his 115th reincarnation, wandering across the Xuanhuang Realm, absorbing the Life-transforming phenomenon of Xuanhuang into his personal Cave Heaven.

Thanks to Mr. Bai, Li Fan had already gained a deep understanding of nearly all the Life-transforming phenomenon of Xuanhuang that could be harnessed within the next century.

"With the Sitting Immortal Art, combined with the continuous feedback cultivation provided by the members of the Federation of All Worlds, I hardly need to worry about the accumulation process of my cultivation."

"The only real concern is the existence of Heaven’s Calamity, as well as how to harmoniously integrate multiple different Life-transforming phenomenon into myself."

Now that his Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven had enabled him to reach the Nascent Soul stage, ordinary Soul Transformation techniques no longer interested him.

Even typical Spirit of Heaven and Earth failed to capture his attention.

They were simply too weak!

This wasn’t arrogance on Li Fan’s part.

It was just the reality of his situation.

Although he had never exerted his full power before, the vast and boundless strength derived from his Five Elements Cave Heaven had already placed him leagues ahead of ordinary Nascent Soul cultivators.

Back in his Foundation Establishment stage, he could already use various methods to go toe-to-toe with Nascent Soul cultivators, even if it meant mutual destruction.

Now, with his exponentially increased power, crushing an ordinary Nascent Soul cultivator was as easy as crushing an ant.

On top of that, he possessed:

The Five Elements Annihilation Sword,

The Seven-Colored Jade Void Glimmering Light,

And even the 'Chaos' Character.

Existences like Crimson Flame and Black Swamp, who embodied powerful Spirit of Heaven and Earth, were no match for him.

Only entities on the level of Ink Death could prove to be a real challenge.

However, even in the face of such formidable beings, he was confident he could escape unscathed.

Given all this, how could Li Fan possibly resign himself to following the conventional Soul Transformation and Dao Integration paths?

Like Mr. Bai, he aimed to integrate all the Life Transforming phenomenon of Xuanhuang into himself—

To turn his Nascent Soul Cave-Heaven into a true Inner World!

Afterward, he distorted and absorbed numerous spirit of heaven and earth, seizing the fundamental source power of the Xuanhuang World on a large scale.

This was the most ideal method for rapid power expansion.

For now, he set aside the question of whether doing so would make him an opponent of the Immortal Ancestor.

Li Fan believed that if he could truly reach that level, at the very least, he would not be at a disadvantage even against an ordinary Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign.

"Moreover, if I can truly find a way to escape the Xuanhuang Realm, then in any other cultivation world, within the same realm, my strength would undoubtedly stand at the pinnacle."

Cultivators of the Xuanhuang Realm devoured heaven and earth itself. Their cultivation methods were inherently more formidable than conventional techniques.

And Li Fan’s strength far surpassed that of ordinary cultivators of the new methods, by several times over.

In comparison, he was absolutely dominant.

However, while this was an ideal scenario, one major problem stood in Li Fan’s way, demanding an urgent solution.

Mr. Bai was faintly an incarnation of the Heavenly Dao’s will. Extracting the transformations of heaven and earth or the Spirit of Heaven and Earth was as effortless for him as using his own possessions.

Naturally, he encountered no resistance.

But who was Li Fan?

Why would the Heavenly Dao of the Xuanhuang World allow him to do the same?

Even ordinary cultivators practicing the new methods had already provoked the resentment of the world itself.

If Li Fan followed his envisioned plan, it would be no different from stripping the world of its flesh and bones, scraping away its very marrow.

It would make him the ultimate enemy of the Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao.

With heaven and earth both as his foes, how could he possibly absorb and claim the transformations of the world and its Spirit of Heaven and Earth for himself?

Even if he forcefully absorbed one or two, a violent backlash would be inevitable.

"Unless…"

Li Fan's gaze flickered.

For someone as knowledgeable as Grand Preceptor Li, this was not an unsolvable dilemma. In an instant, he thought of a countermeasure.

The reason the Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao harbored such deep hatred for cultivators was simple.

Cultivators, in order to cultivate, had to extract resources from the Xuanhuang Realm itself.

As long as this fundamental fact remained unchanged, the conflict between the two would never be resolved.

However, at present, the Xuanhuang Realm was at a severe disadvantage in the ongoing struggle.

This provided Li Fan with a potential opportunity.

That was—to switch allegiances and choose to stand on the side of the Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao.

Li Fan vaguely recalled that when he brought back Qian Hong’s remains from the Great Xuan to the Xuanhuang World, an anomaly had occurred.

Originally, a celestial phenomenon signaling death should have appeared the moment Qian Hong perished.

Yet, it inexplicably manifested again later.

And after completing this act, Li Fan distinctly felt that something within him had changed.

At the time, he had not fully grasped its significance.

But after years of studying ancient texts from various cultivation worlds, Li Fan now understood the reason.

In the Xuanhuang World, while rare, similar occurrences had happened before.

There had been cultivators who, despite being forced to adopt the new methods due to changes in the laws of the world, ultimately benefited the world as a whole through their actions.

For example…

They could assist in exterminating cultivators of the new methods, accelerating the process of returning the Dao to the heavens.

Though in the eyes of cultivators, such individuals were unambiguous devil cultivators—targets of strict suppression by both the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and the Five Elders Association—

To the Heavenly Dao, they were, in fact, the greatest benefactors.

Righteous cultivators standing on the side of heaven and earth!

Of course, this was merely an extreme example. Aside from slaughtering cultivators, one could also mend the deficiencies of the world or aid the Spirit of Heaven and Earth in fulfilling its heavenly duties…

All of these could increase one’s favorability with the Heavenly Dao.

Once that favorability reached a certain level, even when a cultivator fell, the celestial phenomenon accompanying their death would no longer be one of mockery or malice.

The scene of the fall bore some resemblance to when Lan Yu faked his death.

Even heaven and earth mourned.

It was not just about assisting heaven and earth.

Helping these cultivators, whom the world regarded as allies, would still increase the favor of the Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao.

From a rational perspective, in the Xuanhuang Realm, being a mere lackey of the Heavenly Dao would never lead to a good outcome. It would only result in being relentlessly suppressed by the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and the Five Elders Association.

Any cultivator with a clear mind would never make such a choice.

However, with [Truth]’s assistance, Li Fan had nothing to worry about.

Because he wasn’t truly becoming an enforcer for the Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao—he was merely deceiving it into trusting him.

If I help you, you should at least lend me some power.

As long as he could successfully swindle a portion of the remaining power of the Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao, Li Fan’s goal would be achieved.

Expecting him to truly go to war against the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and the Five Elders Association?

Naturally, that was impossible.

Once he returns to [Truth], he fundamentally owed nothing to anyone!

"But how exactly do I gradually earn the trust of the Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao? That requires careful planning."

"This is absolute taboo knowledge—there are no records to reference. I must proceed with caution and experiment on my own."

"That said, by pushing the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and the Five Elders Association into conflict, doesn't that count as well?"

Li Fan suddenly looked up, his gaze seemingly piercing through the Spiritwood Realm, reaching straight into the heavens of the Xuanhuang Realm.

"No, working in silence and toiling away unnoticed won’t earn recognition from my superiors."

"If I accomplish something but the higher-ups don’t know, it’s as if I accomplished nothing at all."

"Perhaps I can use the Senior Stone Tablet to reach the Heavenly Dao’s ears."

An idea formed in Li Fan’s mind.

Most of his schemes had been carried out in hidden realms like the Spiritwood Realm and Congyun Sea.

The Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao might not even be aware of them.

In the future, he could visit the Senior Stone Tablet more often and report every battle result and achievement in meticulous detail.

This way, he could make himself known to the Senior Stone Tablet while also gaining favor from the Heavenly Dao.

"No, if I do this myself, it might seem too deliberate."

"Hmm… I could let Lin Ling handle it."

As the image of Lin Ling’s naturally innocent and naive expression surfaced in his mind, Li Fan nodded to himself.

Within a brief moment of contemplation, he had mapped out two future paths.

Li Fan called Tianyang over.

Recently, Tianyang had been staying in the Spiritwood Realm, helping Shang Tianci and Ou Daozi construct the headquarters for the Federation.

Even though he had not had any leisure time, Li Fan still noticed that Tianyang’s strength had improved significantly since he had first reached the Dao Integration stage.

"Little Junior Brother, let’s have a sparring match."

Li Fan said warmly.

Tianyang looked at Li Fan with some doubt, then glanced at his own fists.

He slowly shook his head, seemingly afraid of hurting Li Fan.

Li Fan chuckled, revealing a trace of his Five Elements Grand Cave-Heaven aura.

Tianyang’s eyes immediately lit up.

He grinned, seemingly pleased with Li Fan’s significant improvement in strength.

"Don’t worry, Junior Brother. My combat power is no weaker than yours now."

That one sentence ignited Tianyang’s competitive spirit, and he instantly became eager to fight.

Li Fan glanced around the Spiritwood Realm, observing the newly constructed Federation headquarters and its growing structures.

"The Spiritwood Realm may be vast, but it cannot withstand the aftermath of our battle."

A thought crossed his mind, and Li Fan immediately knew of a suitable place.

"Follow me."

After leaving the Spiritwood Realm, the two of them traveled one after the other across four prefecture, finally arriving within the borders of the present-day Langhuan Prefecture.

This province concealed a small world known as [Soul Shade].

During the 115th era, among the many small worlds explored by the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, this Soul Shade Realm was one of the most peculiar.

Back when mortals first migrated into this realm, for some unknown reason, they were all completely wiped out.

Only countless ghostly spirit shadows, similar to soul entities, remained, drifting endlessly between heaven and earth.

Furthermore, these soul entities seemed to be linked to spatial power.

For the Rift-Whales, they were an extraordinary source of nourishment.

After the Void-Drifting Whale Herd accidentally discovered the existence of the Soul Shade Realm, they would occasionally return to hunt.

Moreover, after these soul entities vanished, they would be naturally reborn by the world itself, becoming an endless, natural food source for the Rift-Whales.

As a result, among all the small worlds where Rift-Whales existed, this Soul Shade Realm was the most prosperous breeding ground for their species.

Rift-Whales continuously opened spatial passages, making this Soul Shade Realm the farthest from the Xuanhuang Realm.

“During the 115th lifetime, the Immortal Alliance squad sent to explore this place completely lost contact. At first, we assumed they had perished, but later we realized that the distance was simply too vast, rendering conventional communication methods ineffective.”

“This vast void space is perfect for Tianyang and me to unleash our full power.”

With that thought in mind, Li Fan located the entrance to the Soul Shade Realm.

After setting up a formation to conceal the surroundings, he took the lead and flew inside.

A deep, dark sensation immediately overwhelmed him.

It felt completely different from traveling through the spatial passages leading to Great Li and Great Xuan.

An eerie, oppressive atmosphere surged within Li Fan’s heart.

Even Tianyang, who was usually a bit slow to react, uncharacteristically showed a solemn expression.

“This feeling…”

Li Fan narrowed his eyes, carefully sensing the strange phenomenon.

After a long while, a sudden realization struck him:

“It’s like a mortal sinking into the deep sea…”

“Could it be because of the extreme distance from the Xuanhuang Realm?”

“There was no mention of this in the information we gathered earlier. No wonder none of the members from that exploration team were ever seen again after returning.”

“It seems that traversing the endless void is not as simple as I imagined.”

Li Fan pondered deeply before setting aside his thoughts for the moment.

He continued flying along the spatial passage for half a day.

Feeling that he had traveled far enough, he finally stopped.

“Junior Brother, make your move.” Li Fan said in a deep voice.

Tianyang nodded without hesitation.

A surge of oppressive energy erupted from him.

His Heaven and Earth Spirit Body, colored in interwoven red and black hues, was revealed.

In an instant, Li Fan felt as if the space around him was completely locked.

His limbs seemed bound by heavy shackles, unable to move.

“So this is the power of space.”

Li Fan knew that Tianyang had held back.

Otherwise, if the full force of this spatial power acted directly upon his body, he would have been torn apart instantly!

“Junior Brother, I told you—go all out!”

Without attempting to break free from the spatial restraints, Li Fan’s expression darkened, speaking with firm resolve.

Tianyang was momentarily stunned.

Then, Li Fan suddenly felt the surrounding space deepen, as if an invisible beast had taken a bite out of it.

His head, arms, and legs instantly vanished into the darkness.

Only his bare torso was left floating helplessly in midair.

If this had been an ancient cultivator, they would have perished instantly.

However, for a New Method Cultivator who practiced Devouring Cave-Heaven, such injuries were insignificant.

Boom!

Li Fan’s torso exploded into a mist of blood.

Yet, his voice thundered like rolling lightning, echoing through the void around Tianyang.

“Junior Brother, now it’s my turn!”

With a thunderous roar from Li Fan, a colossal giant emerged in the deep void—far larger than the Tianyang Puppet from before, magnified dozens of times over.

This was none other than Li Fan’s Nascent Soul Dharma Form, conjured using an almost boundless amount of Five Elements Cave-Heaven essence!

Had this appeared in the Xuanhuang Realm, this towering figure would have been an awe-inspiring sight, enough to draw the attention of every cultivator in the world.

Behind the giant’s head, five ethereal cave-heavens loomed like interlinked rings, casting an incomparably sacred aura around Li Fan’s Dharma Form.

Compared to this behemoth, Tianyang was no more significant than an ant.

"Suppress!"

The giant looked down, extending its right index finger, pressing down upon Tianyang with overwhelming force.

The sheer mass of the descending finger was like the collapse of the heavens, its ridges and grooves resembling layers of talismanic seals, aiming to imprison Tianyang in an instant.

For the first time, Tianyang caught a glimpse of how ordinary cultivators must perceive him. Yet, despite facing this overwhelming strike from the giant, he remained calm.

Spatial distortions spread outward like cascading waves, originating from Tianyang and expanding rapidly.

As the waves propagated, Tianyang’s figure became increasingly blurred.

In just moments, he had vanished completely!

Li Fan’s finger struck nothing but empty air.

"Interesting! Even with my Five Elements power and a space-sealing formation, I still couldn't stop you from escaping..."

Li Fan’s Dharma Form thundered as his gaze swept across the surroundings, searching for Tianyang’s presence.

Yet Tianyang had seemingly evaporated from existence, leaving not the faintest trace of energy fluctuation.

"Junior Brother, don’t—"

Before Li Fan could finish speaking, Tianyang reappeared abruptly, as if materializing from thin air, right before the forehead of Li Fan’s Dharma Form!

With an effortless motion, he pointed at the giant’s brow.

Like a drop of water falling into a still pond, the forehead of the Dharma Form twisted bizarrely—then shattered completely!

Tianyang prepared to withdraw his hand.

However, despite its head crumbling to pieces, the Dharma Form remained unaffected.

Its hands swiftly came together, fingers bending to form a cage-like structure.

The energy fragments of the shattered head, seemingly sentient, rapidly converged outside the finger cage, forming an intricate formation in an instant!

Tianyang hesitated momentarily.

Within this formation, not only was he unable to tear through space to escape, but even his previously successful Spatial Folding technique had lost its effectiveness!

It had worked just moments ago—yet in the blink of an eye, Li Fan had devised a countermeasure with a formation.

What kind of genius was this?!

Before Tianyang could dwell on it further, layer upon layer of formation shadows continued to appear outside the finger cage.

As if limitless, these formations stacked upon each other in mere breaths, their compounded might reaching a level that even Dao Integration cultivators like Tianyang would find daunting.

Of course, the price for this feat was the rapid collapse of Li Fan’s Nascent Soul Dharma Form, deflating like a punctured balloon.

Sensing the imminent danger surrounding him, Tianyang dared not move.

Li Fan reappeared not far away, smirking smugly. "Well, Junior Brother? Convinced now?"

Tianyang nodded reluctantly.

"Haha." Li Fan, satisfied, did not press him further. His eyes gleamed with a faint blue light as he casually pointed at Tianyang’s location.

In an instant, the overwhelmingly intricate formations that had seemed inescapable to Tianyang were effortlessly dispelled by Li Fan’s simple gesture!

"I wasn’t even using my full strength. I wouldn’t want to accidentally hurt you." Seeing the lingering defiance in Tianyang’s expression, Li Fan added pointedly.

"I... neither was I." Tianyang struggled to squeeze out those three words.

Li Fan once again looked at Tianyang and proactively proposed another battle.

"Eh!" Unexpectedly, Li Fan just waved his hand and refused.

"Sparring should only go so far. We are fellow disciples—do we really need to fight to the death?"

"No more, no more!" Li Fan said with a cheerful smile.

Tianyang was helpless but couldn’t force the issue.

"Speaking of which, little junior brother, your power is also related to space. Not far ahead, there is a small world filled with spiritual entities. It might be of some help to you," Li Fan introduced the details of the Soul Shade Realm to Tianyang.

Although Tianyang had already reached the Dao Integration stage, apart from the laws contained in the Spirit of Heaven and Earth, his knowledge was not much different from when he was just a Dao Foundation cultivator a thousand years ago.

For such strange phenomena, he was naturally at a loss.

However, he had always followed Li Fan’s words.

Thus, the two of them continued forward along the spatial passage.

By now, they had already left the Xuanhuang World far behind, and Li Fan no longer had any reservations.

Seven-colored divine light streaked across the sky, traversing millions of miles in an instant.

Tianyang, who had mastered spatial techniques proficiently, could also shrink space at will and closely follow behind.

Even with their incredible speed, the length of this spatial passage still exceeded their expectations.

According to Li Fan’s calculations, it took them more than a month before they vaguely sensed the presence of a Rift-Whale swarm ahead.

Li Fan halted his movements.

Looking into the distance, he saw countless Rift Whales resembling a vast ocean of whales, moving in groups through the void, carving out a path forward.

And that was only what was visible on the surface.

In the pitch-black void, who knew how many more Rift Whales existed?

The immense aura radiating from the entire swarm made even Li Fan’s expression change slightly.

"It has already reached the critical point where quantity transforms into quality."

"How could there be so many of them?"

Li Fan couldn't help but turn his gaze toward the Soul Shade Realm, which was concealed not far away.

"Let's go."

Transforming into a streak of light, Li Fan descended upon this small world within moments.

"Hiss..."

The moment he landed, Li Fan couldn’t help but furrow his brows.

This place was far too cold.

Even the spiritual energy within his body showed signs of freezing.

He circulated the power of the Five Elements, attempting to counteract the extreme cold by converting his spiritual energy into fire attributes.

However, the moment he did so—

A terrifying chill surged inexplicably from within his body.

In an instant, he was encased in ice, transforming into an ice sculpture. Then, as an eerie wind of unknown origin blew past, he shattered into countless ice fragments that scattered across the ground.

Moments later, a ripple of energy emerged, and Li Fan's body reappeared.

"Strange..."

An intrigued expression appeared on his face.

Just now, instead of radiating heat, the fire attribute energy within him had manifested as extreme cold.

This coldness did not come from an external source.

Rather, in this place, fire inherently possessed an icy nature.

"Senior Brother, something is off here."

Even Tianyang, who was usually taciturn, managed to say a complete sentence with a serious expression.

"It's as if something around us is consuming my power..."

"But I can't find them."

Tianyang then transmitted his thoughts through voice transmission, sharing his discovery.

"Devouring your power?"

Upon hearing this, Li Fan was startled.

The ability Tianyang spoke of naturally originated from the spatial power of the Spirit of Heaven and Earth—Ink Stone.

It was a manifestation of the Xuanhuang Laws, and once a cultivator absorbed it through the New Method, even the current Xuanhuang Realm had no means of stripping it away.

Yet, in this bizarre and remote small world, it was being devoured?

"Senior Brother, don't worry. To me, those unknown entities are like mere ants crawling all over me."

"It may sting or itch, but they pose no real threat to my life."

Tianyang transmitted an image, briefly conveying his thoughts.

However, Li Fan did not lower his guard.

With heightened vigilance, Li Fan and Tianyang began exploring the Soul Shade Realm.

This small world was not vast—in fact, its area was even smaller than the Spiritwood Realm.

But strangely, Li Fan could not find any of the spiritual entities described by the Immortal Alliance Expedition Team.

The vast land was dim and gloomy, without any noticeable changes in terrain.

It was composed entirely of gray soil.

Not a single plant or animal could be found—not even an intact rock.

Sweeping his divine sense across the Soul Shade Realm, Li Fan discovered that apart from himself and Tianyang, there was no other presence.

With a serious expression, Li Fan picked up a handful of the gray soil and examined it carefully.

It seemed to be nothing more than ordinary dirt.

Yet, as he observed his own hand—only moments after coming into contact with the soil—he noticed charred markings, as if it had been burned.

Li Fan immediately knew this was no ordinary substance.

"No pain. The corrosion is completely silent." His eyes flickered with thought.

A surge of vital energy emerged from his body, attempting to heal the wound on his hand.

However, to his shock, the energy he injected seemed to become nourishment for the scorched area!

The blackened flesh rapidly expanded, and in mere moments, it began spreading toward the rest of his body.
