Without hesitation, Li Fan decisively severed his own hand.

What happened next made his pupils contract sharply.

The severed flesh and blood hand, after landing on the gray soil—

Instantly faded, turned to ash, and merged with the earth.

"What in the world...?"

Li Fan looked at the endless expanse of gray soil, feeling an inexplicable chill run down his spine.

The eerie nature of this place far exceeded his imagination.

Just as he was contemplating leaving, Tianyang suddenly sent a voice transmission.

"Senior Brother, the strength of this devouring force varies in different areas."

"Perhaps we can determine the anomaly's source based on its intensity."

Li Fan hesitated for a moment before nodding in agreement.

Receiving Li Fan’s approval, Tianyang began sensing his surroundings while swiftly flying over the Soul Shade Realm.

Soon, he locked onto a particular location.

There, the devouring force was extraordinarily strong.

Li Fan could faintly sense an unseen fluctuation emanating from Tianyang's body—

As if Tianyang was locked in an intense battle with an equally formidable opponent.

After only a short while, Tianyang was forced to retreat.

"It feels like being devoured by a swarm of countless ants. Senior Brother, do you not feel it?" Tianyang asked through a voice transmission.

Li Fan shook his head. He simply controlled his Seven-Colored Divine Light and flew toward the location.

Indeed, he felt nothing unusual.

However, deep in his heart, he had a vague premonition—if he were to use fire-element spiritual power like before,

The consequences would not be as simple as merely having his physical body frozen into a sculpture.

Thus, Li Fan completely suppressed his internal spiritual energy.

He chose to rely solely on his physical body and the power of the Seven-Colored Divine Light to proceed.

Upon arriving above the target location, Li Fan carefully observed his surroundings, attempting to find useful clues.

He soon noticed something unusual.

He had previously investigated the entire Soul Shade Realm and found it to be an absolutely flat terrain.

But this particular spot…

Seemed to be slightly raised.

As if something was buried beneath the gray soil.

This time, Li Fan was more experienced. With the Seven-Colored Divine Light protecting his right hand, he began digging into the soil.

He dug deeper and deeper until, suddenly, his fingers touched a hard object.

His expression grew solemn as he retrieved it from the depths of the gray soil.

The layer of accumulated gray dust on the object disappeared shortly after leaving the ground.

Revealing its true form.

"This is…?"

Li Fan was momentarily stunned.

What he held in his hand was a human skull.

However, unlike an ordinary skull, this one had what appeared to be a third eye at the center of its forehead—a hollow cavity the size of an eye socket.

Additionally, the skull naturally bore intricate gold-and-black markings.

Flipping it over to examine the interior, Li Fan was shocked to find that the inside of the skull seemed to be covered in mold.

Clusters of gray spots—ghastly and unsettling.

Even more disturbingly, these gray spots seemed to have a will of their own.

After lying dormant for who knows how many years, the moment they detected the presence of a living being nearby, they began to wriggle eerily.

As if they were exploring their surroundings.

A deep, indescribable sense of danger suddenly surged in Li Fan’s heart.

Without hesitation, he unleashed the Seven-Colored Divine Light, forming a perfect seal.

It completely isolated his presence.

Only then did the gray mold spots settle down again.

Staring at the peculiar skull now encased within the glowing sphere of divine light, Li Fan frowned slightly.

"A skull with three eyes… similar to a human, but also different. Clearly, this being did not originate from the Xuanhuang Realm."

"It seems that the disaster that befell the Soul Shade Realm was caused by these gray mold spots."

"Could it be… that this foreign entity brought the gray mold spots here, turning this place into a desolate gray land?"

"And this instigator… was ultimately consumed by the gray mold spots, leaving behind nothing but this skull."

"The only reason it remained intact was because of the black-and-gold runes engraved upon it."

…

A possible answer formed in Li Fan's mind.

"This place is located at the farthest edge of the Xuanhuang Realm… It’s very likely that it has already reached the boundary of another cultivation realm."

"This three-eyed being must have come from that realm."

"Did he come here seeking refuge?"

"But in doing so, he brought this terrifying gray mold with him."

A series of images flashed through Li Fan’s mind.

He realized that even the Seven-Colored Divine Light was not enough to completely resist the power of the gray mold spots.

Even though it was merely sealing them, he could still feel the divine light being steadily consumed.

If not for the Five Elements Cave-Heaven providing an endless supply of power, the seal would have already collapsed.

After contemplating for a moment, Li Fan did not return the skull to its original location.

Instead, he attempted to store it inside his storage ring.

Surprisingly, it was abnormally smooth.

There was no resistance whatsoever—it was effortlessly sealed inside.

However, when he observed it through the storage ring, he found that the gray mold spots remained active.

Not only were they still consuming the power of the Seven-Colored Divine Light…

Even the space within the storage ring itself was starting to become unstable.

Li Fan pondered for a moment, then added another layer of seven-colored divine light as a seal outside his storage ring.

With three layers of restriction in place, the faint sense of crisis lingering in his heart finally began to fade away.

"......"

"It seems that it may not just be the Xuanhuang Realm that has suffered calamity."

"With the severance of the Immortal Path, great catastrophes have arrived everywhere."

Casually, he placed the dangerous sealed object into his personal Cave-Heaven for suppression.

Then, turning to Tianyang, he asked, "How do you feel now?"

Tianyang flew beside Li Fan, sensed for a moment, then nodded. "That gnawing sensation has indeed weakened, though it hasn't completely disappeared."

Li Fan crouched down and touched the gray soil beneath him.

Before the blackened spots could spread further, Li Fan skillfully severed his own palm.

The severed hand fell to the ground and disintegrated into ashes.

Even though the culprit had been suppressed by Li Fan, the eerie state of the Soul Shade Realm remained unchanged.

"This is..."

"Has the fundamental law of this world been completely altered?"

After a moment of thought, Li Fan suddenly felt a chill.

"If the Immortal-Mortal Miasma specifically targets cultivators, then this gray blight is meant to corrupt the world itself."

"The current state of the Soul Shade Realm—it’s like the corpse of a world."

"What kind of person would be so utterly insane as to develop something like this?"

A flicker of interest flashed through Li Fan's eyes.

"In the 115th lifetime, from this moment until the Immortal Alliance expedition team arrived, only about twenty years passed. What could have happened in that short time to create ghost-like soul entities in this dead land?"

"Hmm, no... Something is off."

Li Fan suddenly froze.

The previous investigative team had concluded that the countless soul bodies in the Soul Shade Realm nourished the immense Rift-Whale swarms seen outside.

But now, no soul bodies had appeared.

So where did all those Rift-Whales come from?

Unraveling this mystery wouldn't be difficult.

Li Fan and Tianyang remained in the Soul Shade Realm for three more months, concealing their presence and waiting in the shadows.

They wanted to determine whether Rift-Whales had the habit of coming to the Soul Shade Realm to "feed."

Their patience paid off.

One day, just as Li Fan was growing slightly impatient, distant, resonant cries echoed through the void.

Around a dozen Rift-Whales descended from the sky and arrived above the Soul Shade Realm.

Compared to typical Rift-Whales, these were noticeably larger.

Perhaps sensing the dangers of this place, the whales did not act as freely as they did in the void beyond.

Instead, they moved cautiously, swimming through the air in a structured manner, heading toward a particular location within the Soul Shade Realm.

Li Fan and Tianyang silently followed.

At the edge of the Soul Shade Realm, in a location the two had previously examined without detecting anything unusual, the Rift-Whales suddenly stopped.

One whale, seemingly more experienced, took the lead.

It aimed at a specific spot on the gray soil and dove headfirst into it.

In an instant, the leading Rift-Whales vanished without a trace.

The rest followed suit, mimicking the motion.

However, the passage they were using did not seem particularly wide. Out of the ten whales, three miscalculated their positioning and collided directly with the gray soil.

There was no loud crash.

The black spots rapidly devoured them, turning them into gray dust that scattered across the land.

Li Fan arrived at the spot where the Rift-Whales had disappeared, hesitating slightly.

"Senior Brother, let me go first," Tianyang volunteered.

Li Fan nodded. Without hesitation, Tianyang flew forward and entered.

Li Fan, however, did not rush in and patiently waited outside the entrance.

Before long, Tianyang returned.

His usually expressionless face now displayed a rare look of shock.

As Tianyang transmitted what he had seen, Li Fan finally understood what lay within.

It was a vast, yellow river, surging endlessly, winding in a circular loop.

Countless souls floated atop the yellow waters—young and old alike.

They still wore different types of clothing, but all of them had their eyes tightly shut, as if trapped in an eternal slumber.

No one knew how long they had been immersed in this yellow river, but their souls had undergone eerie transformations.

Their lower halves were no longer human; instead of legs, they had grown countless tendrils.

These tendrils plunged deep into the river, as if anchoring them there to resist being washed away by the currents.

The Rift-Whales that had snuck in appeared as if they had entered a paradise of indulgence.

They were ecstatic, feasting greedily.

With each deep inhale, they swallowed thousands upon thousands of souls.

After devouring these souls, which had been steeped in the yellow river, the Rift-Whales underwent dramatic transformations.

Almost instantly, their bodies expanded, as though something was being nurtured within them.

In the vast yellow river, countless billions of souls floated densely packed.

Even with all seven Rift-Whales gorging themselves to the brim, they had only consumed a minuscule fraction of the total.

Once the creatures departed, content with their feast, Li Fan, protected by a radiant seven-colored divine light, entered the yellow river.

Even though he had previously seen countless frozen corpses drifting in the Reversal Life-and-Death Formation,

The sight of these billions of eerie, humanoid souls still sent chills down his spine.

Especially unsettling were their tendrils—some entwined and coiled together so densely that clusters of closed-eyed faces were pressed against one another.

They formed grotesque spheres of countless human faces, twisted and horrific.

"Senior Brother, this place..."

Tianyang's transmitted voice carried a trace of unease.

Li Fan drifted through the yellow waters, brushing past the endless souls.

Protected by his seven-colored divine light, he felt nothing more than mild disgust—no real discomfort.

This yellow river was far larger than the entire Soul Shade Realm itself.

After scanning the area, Li Fan gradually discerned the cause of this strange phenomenon.

"The Heavenly Dao of the Soul Shade Realm has mutated due to the erosion of the gray blight."

"Fire burns like ice, and life withers like death."

"But here, new life is emerging—because this place was originally the realm of death within the Soul Shade Realm."

Li Fan observed that as the yellow river flowed in a complete loop,

Some mysterious particles within the water gradually accumulated, forming vague humanoid shapes.

As the current continued to churn, these soul figures became more distinct—

Until finally, they took on the form of complete human beings.

"In the normal cycle of the Great Dao, these newly formed souls would be reincarnated into the mortal world."

"But the Soul Shade Realm has already perished, and the cycle of life and death no longer exists."

"For countless years, these newly created souls have continuously emerged and piled up in this place."

Having previously witnessed the entirety of the Reversal Life-and-Death Formation and gained some insights into the laws of life and death, Li Fan comprehended the root cause of this bizarre phenomenon.

“If no outsiders break this cycle, this phenomenon might only completely stop once the power that nurtures soul bodies within the Yellow River fully dissipates.”

“However, I can sense that the energy here remains incredibly strong. If not for my Seven-Colored Divine Light protecting me, I probably wouldn’t be able to stay here for long.”

“This level of power… It shouldn’t have only lasted for just twenty or thirty years, right?”

A trace of doubt arose in Li Fan’s heart.

“What broke the peace of the Soul Shade Realm and released the countless trillions of souls from the Yellow Springs?”

“Unless… it was a cultivator like me who accidentally entered this place.”

“Or perhaps…”

In an instant, a thought flashed through Li Fan’s mind—he recalled the skull he had suppressed not long ago.

“Could it be… that person isn’t actually dead?”

This wasn’t mere paranoia brought on by the eerie surroundings.

The Soul Shade Realm was unimaginably remote. Even at Li Fan’s current speed, it would take over a month of continuous flight to reach it.

The chances of someone mistakenly wandering here were incredibly slim—unless they had a clear and definite purpose.

On the other hand, that skull…

Although it was just a severed head, the black-gold patterns on its cranium remained intact despite the relentless corrosion of the gray mold growing upon it.

“The black-gold patterns remain untouched on the surface, while the gray mold festers within the skull.”

“This could mean that the two forces are evenly matched, unable to overpower one another.”

Recalling the peculiar appearance of the skull, Li Fan increasingly felt that his speculation held some truth.

“If it had been completely corroded, it should have turned to dust like everything else in this realm.”

“The fact that the skull remains… suggests that it hasn’t truly perished.”

The cultivation world contained countless secret techniques. In the Xuanhuang Realm, some cultivators had even achieved the feat of preserving their personal cave-heaven indefinitely, attaining a form of immortality.

If this mysterious skull could use its black-gold markings to revive, it wouldn’t be all that shocking.

“It’s certainly dangerous. But it’s also an opportunity.”

“If I can use this to learn what’s happening in the other cultivation realms…”

Li Fan’s eyes flickered as he instantly devised dozens of ways to take advantage of the situation.

However, he didn’t forget his primary purpose for coming here.

“Little Junior Brother, this Rift-Whale has the ability to carve out space within the void. These spirit bodies are drawn to it, which must mean they hold some great benefit for them. Do you want to give it a try as well?”

Tianyang quickly shook his head.

“They aren’t actually human souls. They just look similar.”

“These spirit bodies are simply condensed manifestations of the Yellow Springs’ energy.”

Seeing Tianyang’s distaste, Li Fan explained further.

Hearing this, Tianyang felt somewhat reassured.

He reached out and captured a long-drowned, unrecognizable old soul from the Yellow Springs’ waters.

Channeling his spiritual energy, he absorbed it.

Moments later, his eyes lit up.

“Senior Brother, I understand now why those great whales love devouring them.” Tianyang spoke excitedly.

“This small world was originally formed from the energy of this Yellow Springs. It’s like a fruit growing on a tree.”

“The Yellow Springs’ water contains rare and powerful laws. The most abundant of these… is the authority to create and expand space.”

“Although it’s only at the small-world level, it’s still useful to me.”

Tianyang quickly transmitted his thoughts while retrieving another spirit body crystal to absorb.

This time, however, he frowned slightly.

“Unfortunately, it seems that the gray mold’s influence has corrupted it, causing some instability.”

“Just one is enough. Taking more won’t be beneficial.” Tianyang concluded.

Li Fan nodded slightly.

His spiritual sense swept across the area and found an ancient spiritual crystal.

Upon absorbing it, a series of images instantly surfaced in his mind.

The waters of the Yellow Springs surged in a circular flow.

At specific intervals, remnants of power would accumulate.

Over countless years, this power grew stronger and stronger.

Eventually, it blossomed and bore fruit, forming a ring of nine "worlds."

An unknown amount of time passed before life emerged in these worlds.

Civilizations began to appear.

When the beings of these worlds died, they would return to the Yellow Springs. The river’s current would carry them forward, sending them to other worlds to experience new lives.

Days of peace continued—until this day...

A golden chain tore through the sky, descending from the distant void.

It spread across the Yellow Springs World in an instant, tightly binding and sealing it.

Then...

Under an immense pulling force, the Yellow Springs World trembled violently.

Mountains and rivers collapsed as if the apocalypse had arrived.

Yet the chains showed no sign of loosening.

From them, a continuous surge of sacred golden energy poured out.

The energy sharply severed the Yellow Springs World’s connection to space itself, as if dragging it toward some unknown destination.

This was an overwhelming power beyond the Yellow Springs World’s comprehension.

Resistance was futile—the entire realm was forcibly dragged through the void for an unknowable amount of time before it finally stabilized.

In the end, the extreme force tore the Yellow Springs World apart.

Of the nine worlds, only one remained, drifting through the cosmos alongside the Yellow Springs, arriving in this unfamiliar starry sky.

…

The images in Li Fan’s mind gradually faded.

A strange light flickered in his eyes.

He had long known that in ancient times, the Xuanhuang Realm possessed an unfathomable formation.

A formation capable of capturing distant cave-heaven and entire worlds from the void.

Even opening spatial passages to wage war against other realms.

Most of the countless Cave-Heaven and small worlds within the Xuanhuang Realm today had come into existence through this method.

However, ever since the fall of the Xuantian Sect and the rise of the Ten Great Immortal Sects, this formation seemed to have been damaged.

Its name faded into obscurity, seemingly lost in the river of history.

Now, through the lingering memories of the Soul Shade Realm’s shattered Heavenly Dao, he had the fortune of witnessing the power of this ancient formation in action.

Li Fan was shaken.

"Traversing the void, golden chains binding enemies…"

"How powerful must this be?"

Li Fan was already considered a grandmaster of formations.

With the Final Dissolution Disc in his possession, there might not be a single person in the Xuanhuang Realm who surpassed his mastery of formations.

Yet even he found it difficult to imagine how such a grand formation could have been constructed.

"Seizing the stars, grasping the moon—this must be the work of a True Immortal, right?"

The thought crossed Li Fan’s mind.

Moreover, from his brief glimpse into the Yellow Springs’ lingering memories, he realized that the golden chains he saw…

Seemed somewhat similar to the one he had encountered in the Immortal Ruins—

The one used to imprison a True Immortal’s remains.

"Could there be some connection?"

"That True Immortal was trapped right at the boundary of the Xuanhuang Realm’s Immortal-Mortal Passage. That can’t be a coincidence."

"Before the Immortal Path was severed, the cultivation world and the Immortal Realm still had contact."

"If they could receive immortal artifacts as aid, then having assistance in constructing formations should also be possible."

Li Fan's thoughts surged.

Tianyang, seeing his senior brother motionless for a long time, feared something had gone wrong.

He transmitted his voice in inquiry, finally snapping Li Fan out of his trance.

"Little junior brother, did you also see the image of the golden chains tearing through the void?"

Li Fan couldn’t help but ask.

"Golden chains tearing through the void?" Tianyang was momentarily stunned, but he quickly recollected himself.

"It seems like I did see such a scene, but I didn’t really understand what it meant, so I didn’t pay much attention."

Tianyang had been more focused on the spatial power contained within the Yellow Springs Spirit Body.

Meanwhile, Li Fan, who had little understanding of spatial abilities, concentrated entirely on the ancient secrets.

Like blind men feeling an elephant, each had their own focus.

Li Fan then turned his gaze toward the Yellow Springs River.

"This great river can be considered the River of Creation of the Soul Shade Realm. But with the cycle of life and death already shattered, no matter how much power it may contain, its constant creation of spirit bodies will inevitably lead to its eventual depletion."

"When the Yellow Springs dry up, trillions of spirit bodies will scatter into the void..."

"Under normal circumstances, this process would take thousands or even tens of thousands of years. However, in the 115th lifetime, it happened prematurely, likely due to the three-eyed skull being brought into the Yellow Springs for some unknown reason."

Through his past-life knowledge and present-life investigation, Li Fan deduced the possible truth behind what had transpired in this remote subsidiary world of the Xuanhuang Realm.

After a long moment of contemplation, Li Fan chose not to interfere with the still-flowing Yellow Springs.

Before leaving with Tianyang, Li Fan silently thought: "If anyone in this era attempts to escape the Xuanhuang Realm, perhaps the Soul Shade Realm could serve as a prime testing ground."

After passing through an extensive spatial passage and spending nearly a month traveling, Li Fan and Tianyang finally returned to the Xuanhuang Realm.

Six months had passed, and the war between the Five Elders Association and the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance had fully ignited.

However, what Li Fan hadn’t expected was that the instigator this time was not the Five Elders Association but the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, which had previously been at a disadvantage.

They launched a surprise attack, catching the Five Elders Association completely off guard and even reclaiming the lost Jiushan Prefecture in one swift move!

The formidable fortifications that the Five Elders Association had painstakingly constructed across nine mountain ranges were reduced to nothing more than a joke!

Despite achieving such a decisive victory, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance did not boast or widely publicize their triumph, which was unusual.

While news of consecutive victories kept arriving, no one within the alliance could definitively explain how they had managed to accomplish such an incredible feat. Speculations ran rampant, with many suspecting that it was related to the "Thirty-Three Chosen Immortals" plan.

During these six months, Ji Shaoli's clone, stationed at Haixuan Island, had once visited the small temple by the fishing pond, hoping to learn the truth about the battle from the Senior Stone Tablet.

However, the other party seemed deeply immersed in the Dao of Fishing, completely ignoring him.

Meanwhile, due to the defeats on the front lines, the Five Elders Association had grown suspicious of the Federation of All Worlds.

Attempts to establish contact and uncover the deeper truth behind the war were met with silence.

Ji Shaoli had no choice but to put the matter aside for now.

During this time, Lin Ling had gradually grown closer to Liuli.

Despite her Dao Integration cultivation, Lin Ling was still a newly born spirit with a childlike nature, showing no sense of seniority.

She would actively seek out Liuli to play with, slowly breaking down the small Dao Child’s initial wariness.

From an outsider’s perspective, Liuli appeared adorably naive, but in truth, she was quite cautious. However, after spending so much time with Lin Ling, she had finally let her guard down.

After observing them for a while, Li Fan noticed something peculiar.

The once naïve and somewhat clueless Lin Ling seemed to have developed a new sense of awareness.

Or rather—she had become more human.

Li Fan gazed thoughtfully at the little daoist child hiding behind Lin Ling.

For now, he chose not to intervene and simply instructed Lin Ling, "Come with me to the Nine Mountains border."

In the past, Lin Ling would have agreed without hesitation.

But this time, a flicker of doubt flashed in her eyes—she hesitated, as if she wanted to say something but held back.

Li Fan's eyes gleamed with understanding, though he merely offered a brief explanation:

"I’ve made some discoveries during my six-month absence—perhaps they will help shift the current situation in favor of the Five Elders Association."

Lin Ling finally bid farewell to Liuli.

Afterward, she took Li Fan and traveled through the flowing earth veins.

Before long, the two arrived at a remote location within Nine Mountain Prefecture.

After carefully investigating the surroundings and confirming that no cultivators were lying in ambush, they quietly emerged from underground.

Sweeping the area with their divine sense, they took in the familiar yet strangely foreign landscape of "Nine Mountain Prefecture." For a brief moment, both Li Fan and Lin Ling were dazed.

"I'm afraid that from now on, Nine Mountain Prefecture will have to be renamed."

After regaining his composure, Li Fan sighed softly.

The once-majestic nine mountain ranges that defined Nine Mountain Prefecture had been entirely leveled by some unknown, formidable force.

The once-dangerous and rugged terrain of the prefecture had now transformed into a vast, boundless plain.

However, since this land was originally formed from the corpse of the ancient beast (Heaven), the spatial stability had always been fragile.

Now, after enduring a cataclysmic battle, this instability had become even more pronounced.

Above them, the sky was riddled with black spatial fissures, flickering in and out of existence like lightning.

"When Tianyang completes his seclusion and gains enlightenment, perhaps I can bring him here for a visit," Li Fan thought to himself.

"Master, there seems to be a lingering presence of an extremely terrifying aura here."

Lin Ling's focus was different from Li Fan's.

She closed her eyes, took a deep breath, and then spoke with a hint of trepidation.

"To make even a Dao Integration Immortal Sage feel fear... this must be the power of a Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign. And judging by the devastation that flattened Jiushan..."

"Could it be that the Immortal Ancestor made a move?"

However, Li Fan quickly dismissed this thought.

"If it didn’t concern the fundamental safety of the Xuanhuang Realm itself, the Immortal Ancestor would likely remain indifferent to conflicts of this level."

"But aside from the Immortal Ancestor, who else within the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance possesses the power of a Longevity Immortal?"

"The Eastern Extremity, a figure mentioned only in ancient records? Or perhaps Emperor Sanmo, the curator of the Divine Treasure Museum?"

Li Fan then recalled rumors circulating among the immortals.

"Could it be... the Thirty-Three Chosen Immortal Project?"

His eyes narrowed slightly.

One of the so-called Immortal Candidates, Wei Qizheng, had previously received a fragment of the Final Dissolution Disc from Li Fan.

Although it lacked real-time communication functions, the disc was capable of recording nearly all of Wei Qizheng's experiences in detail.

As long as he met Wei Qizheng again—or if Wei Qizheng perished and the disc was damaged—the stored information would be synchronized back to Li Fan.

Although he was curious about the methods of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, Li Fan knew that the time to reap the rewards had not yet arrived.

The longer this planted seed remained hidden, the more secrets he could uncover.

"I'll wait a little longer."

Suppressing his thoughts, Li Fan activated a special signal to contact the Five Elders Association.

After waiting for a long time, there was still no response.

But Li Fan did not give up.

He kept sending out the signal, repeatedly.

This continued for a total of seven attempts.

Finally, from a certain location within Jiushan Prefecture, a faint response came through.

When Li Fan arrived, he discovered that the source of the signal was nothing more than a smooth, mirror-like stone.

[Translator’s Note: Just so you know, Jiushan Prefecture translates to Nine Mountains Prefecture. I’ve swapped between "Jiushan" and "Nine Mountains" a few times—my bad if that threw you off! It’ll be "Nine Mountains" consistently from here on out. Thanks for bearing with me!]

This stone was quite similar to the tool Zhou Qingang had previously used to communicate with his superiors.

Li Fan pondered for a moment before placing both hands over it, activating it using the secret technique of the Five Elders Association that he had memorized.

As expected, it worked. Ripples spread across the stone’s surface, and a blurred face gradually appeared.

Upon seeing the situation on Li Fan's side, the person on the other end was momentarily stunned. Then, as if switching to another contact, the image shifted.

The new person glanced at Li Fan and, after a moment, let out a cold snort.

"You even know the recently changed reception secret method… It seems the Ten Thousand Worlds Alliance really has planted spies among us."

Li Fan smiled and replied, "That’s not the case. I just tried it at random—pure coincidence."

A loud bang erupted from the other end, clearly indicating dissatisfaction with Li Fan’s response.

However, they did not cut off communication. Instead, they asked, "Why have you contacted us this time?"

"We prepared an entire strategy in response, thinking we could use an unexpected approach to seize victory. But who could have guessed…"

"Hmph! Because of misleading intelligence, we made an incorrect strategic decision, resulting in a severe loss."

The face on the stone mirror suddenly expanded, making it look even more eerie in sync with the person's tone.

Li Fan narrowed his eyes but did not respond immediately.

After thinking for a moment, he sighed and shook his head. "It wasn’t my intention to provide false information. The truth is, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance acted too convincingly this time—even we were deceived."

"Who would have thought that a world-dominating weapon with such immense power was merely a decoy?"

"But you didn’t fare any better, did you?"

Li Fan suddenly changed the topic. "The distinguished Five Elders Association—would you really determine a major strategic direction based on just a few words from us?"

"You must have discovered something yourselves before making your final decision."

"If even you were deceived, how could we have avoided it? We have to admit that the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance played their hand well."

The face representing the Five Elders Association looked displeased.

"We initially assumed that the grand selection of Thirty-three Chosen Immortals was just a distraction, a smokescreen concealing their true killing move. Who would have thought that the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance would be so arrogant, leaving no hidden tricks at all?"

"They laid all their cards on the table…"

Frustration was evident in the voice, as if they had mustered all their strength only to swing a fist into thin air.

Li Fan seized the opportunity to ask, "What exactly happened on the Nine Mountains battlefield?"

"Your defeat was too swift. When we received the news, we had to personally confirm it on-site before we could believe it was real."

The face of the Five Elders Association darkened, and they remained silent.

Seeing this, Li Fan decided to play his trump card.

"The Headquarters of the Martial Hall of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance—Immortal Sage Ziqiong—is actually one of yours, isn’t he?"

The face froze in shock.

Clearly, this person was not high-ranking enough to be aware of such matters.

"Go confirm it with your superiors. That person…"

"…has a problem. He cannot be fully trusted," Li Fan said with a serious expression.

The face, no longer as composed as before, hastily withdrew and disappeared.

Li Fan, on the other hand, remained calm as he waited.

Beside him, Lin Ling was quietly observing Li Fan, unable to hide her growing curiosity.

The Five Elders Association responded quickly.

Before long, another figure emerged on the smooth stone surface.

"This friend, regarding what you just said…"

"Why do you believe that Immortal Sage Ziqiong cannot be fully trusted?"

The voice belonged to a more senior individual, sounding robust and full of authority.

"If our intelligence is correct, Immortal Sage Ziqiong is actually a Obsession-Craze Cultivator. His true loyalty does not lie with your Five Elders Association, nor with the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance."

"He is only devoted to the Dharma-Transmitting Immortal Ancestor alone," Li Fan whispered.

"Sometimes, his information is accurate. But in certain situations..."

"I'm afraid truth and falsehood are intertwined, making it hard to distinguish," Li Fan said meaningfully.

Although his words were somewhat vague, the members of the Five Elders Association fell into a long silence.

"I see..." From the murmured words of one of the Five Elders, it was clear how deeply shaken he was.

After all, Immortal Sage Ziqiong was their most deeply hidden and crucial spy.

Many important pieces of intelligence had come from him.

This matter was of the utmost secrecy—originally, only a handful of people within the Five Elders Association even knew about it.

And yet, the cultivator from the Federation of All Worlds standing before them had already uncovered Ziqiong’s true identity.

Adding to that, the devastating defeat they had suffered due to inaccurate intelligence...

The implications of this revelation sent a bone-chilling shiver down the middle-aged man’s spine.

However, he was mentally strong and quickly regained his composure.

Taking a deep breath, he thanked Li Fan. "We will conduct a thorough investigation. Thank you for the warning, my friend."

Li Fan got straight to the point. "We need to know exactly what happened in Nine Mountain Prefecture at that time. Due to a misjudgment, our attention was not on the battlefield there."

"Although we gathered some information from within the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, the details were too shocking. We need confirmation from you."

"Actually, in a short time, He should be able to appear more frequently... I'll send you the footage from that moment—see for yourself." The middle-aged man, seemingly eager to verify the truth of Li Fan’s claims, transmitted the data before taking his leave.

The smooth jade stone shattered on its own, rendering it useless.

Meanwhile, Li Fan viewed the scene unfolding in his mind and was struck with awe and terror.

The skies over Nine Mountains Prefecture were clear and vast, with gentle clouds drifting by.

Suddenly, a face emerged from the sky.

Wearing a tall crown, with a long beard flowing down his chest.

His expression was solemn, his eyes half-lowered.

There was a sense of compassion for all beings—yet also an undercurrent of boundless, hidden killing intent.

No cultivator of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance would be unfamiliar with this face.

For in every heavenly city across the prefecture, in every corner of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance’s territory,

one could find statues of this being.

He was none other than the founder of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

The creator of a new path that defied the laws of Heaven.

The Dharma-Transmitting Immortal Ancestor, who had dominated Xuanhuang for thousands of years!

As his face appeared, a hazy, translucent figure swiftly materialized in the sky.

At that moment, the Five Elders Association cultivators in Nine Mountains Prefecture sensed the anomaly and immediately gathered, preparing for battle.

But the Immortal Ancestor did not give them much time to prepare.

With his eyes closed, he had remained silent—

until suddenly, he opened them.

In an instant, an unimaginable, terrifying force descended upon Nine Mountains Prefecture.

Countless cultivators didn’t even have time to scream before they were crushed into pulp, their blood soaking the earth.

Under the sheer weight of this overwhelming force, the nine great mountain ranges trembled violently.

The mountains collapsed, their layers crumbling.

From top to bottom, they disintegrated without pause.

As long as the Immortal Ancestor kept his gaze fixed on Nine Mountains Prefecture, the catastrophic pressure did not cease.

Thus, inch by inch, the nine great mountain ranges were flattened into nothingness.

Under the gaze of the Immortal Ancestor, the layered defenses set up by the Five Elders Association in Nine Mountains Prefecture collapsed instantly.

Before an absolute power gap, all struggles and resistance were futile!

Every living being within the province—including the stationed cultivators of the Five Elders Association, the followers of the Lingyuan Sect, and even countless mortals—perished the moment the Immortal Ancestor opened his eyes!

Just as the Xuanhuang Realm cannot withstand the direct gaze of a True Immortal, the living beings of Nine Mountains Prefecture could not endure the might of the Immortal Ancestor's power!

An untold number of cultivators died in an instant.

Originally, the sky should have been filled with countless celestial phenomena marking their demise.

But perhaps because the presence of the Immortal Ancestor had not dissipated, the pressure from his presence suppressed even those celestial omens, preventing them from forming.

This scene seemed to suggest that even the Heavenly Dao of the Xuanhuang Realm had to restrain itself before the Immortal Ancestor, not daring to mock or celebrate the deaths of the cultivators.

...

Though it was indeed shocking, to Li Fan—who had already witnessed a True Immortal’s world-ending display—it was nothing extraordinary.

After carefully analyzing the situation, Li Fan immediately sensed something was off.

"Immortal Ancestor? One of the Thirty-Three Chosen Immortal?"

In his 115th lifetime, the Immortal Ancestor had once revealed his true form.

At that time, the entire Xuanhuang Realm trembled under his presence, as if the apocalypse was imminent and the world could be torn apart by his power at any moment.

By comparison, the Immortal Ancestor appearing in Nine Mountains Prefecture now was significantly weaker.

"What is this? A projection? A clone?"

A sharp glint flashed in Li Fan’s eyes.

From what he could sense, Wei Qizheng, one of the Immortal Chosen, was still alive and well.

Moreover, the cultivators of the Five Elders Association had just mentioned that this Immortal Ancestor projection might become a recurring phenomenon in the future.

This indicated that it wasn’t a one-time, expendable technique but something that could be reproduced repeatedly.

"Although its power is far inferior to the true Immortal Ancestor, it still possesses the combat strength of the Longevity Immortal realm."

"More importantly, we still don’t know how the Immortal Ancestor projection appeared in the sky over Nine Mountains Prefecture. From beginning to end, none of the Immortal Chosen had shown themselves. If this projection can be summoned without location constraints..."

"Then the deterrent effect is overwhelming. Without a proper countermeasure, the Five Elders Association wouldn’t dare to act rashly."

Li Fan’s eyes flickered as he surveyed the devastated Nine Mountains Prefecture.

Countless beings had perished here moments ago, yet oddly, there was no trace of blood in the air.

After all, under the crushing might of the Immortal Ancestor presence, even blood had been completely obliterated.

"As expected of a technique that embodies the Immortal Ancestor itself. Rather than slaughter, this is pure annihilation."

Li Fan sighed inwardly.

Now that he understood what had transpired in Nine Mountains Prefecture, he wasted no time lingering and swiftly used the power of the earth’s veins to return.

"If I’m not mistaken, the Five Elders Association’s counterattack will likely involve using the ‘Samantabhadra True Boat’ to launch a surprise assault from within the White Mist."

"If they manage to initiate battle in the heart of the Immortal Alliance’s territory, then even the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance would have serious reservations about deploying the Immortal Ancestor projection again."

"However, such a trick is most effective the first time it’s used. The Five Elders Association will probably save it for a decisive moment when they intend to end things in one blow…"

"Interesting. Let’s see how they choose to proceed."

The sheer deterrent power of the Immortal Ancestor projection was undeniable.

Even though it was only used once in Nine Mountains Prefecture, it still terrified the members of the Five Elders Association in other fallen border territories, forcing them to retreat and consolidate their forces.

Without much effort, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance swiftly reclaimed several previously lost border states.

The string of victories left cultivators, who had grown accustomed to the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance suffering setbacks, in disbelief.

As a result, conspiracy theories began to spread everywhere.

Congyun Sea, Haixuan Island.

"The speed at which the Immortal Alliance is reclaiming lost land is simply too fast. Don’t you think there’s something suspicious about it?"

"Heh, I heard a little rumor. Supposedly, these territories weren’t actually won back by our Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance. The Five Elders Association deliberately returned them to us!"

"Why would they willingly give up land they fought so hard to take?"

"You don’t know? Sure, they returned it, but all that’s left is a wasteland. Anything of value has already been plundered by those from the Five Elders Association. According to a friend of mine, the situation in those reclaimed states is absolutely horrific!"

"Hiss! I get it now! This is an open scheme by the Five Elders Association. Once the lost land is reclaimed, it has to be rebuilt, right? When we painstakingly restore everything, they’ll just attack again and plunder it all over…"

"I was wondering why we suddenly became so formidable. So this is the reason!"

Conspiracy theories always find an eager audience.

Many cultivators simply couldn’t accept that the supposedly "weak" Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance had achieved such a glorious victory in such a short time.

Some began concocting possible schemes behind the scenes.

Just as they were reveling in their discussion, they were unaware that their words had infuriated two individuals.

"Bang!"

A loud slam on the table resounded as a figure abruptly stood up.

"I originally thought the Congyun Sea Mutual Aid Association was well-known far and wide, a truly remarkable organization."

"But I never expected it to be so disgraceful!"

Sweeping his gaze across the cultivators present, the man spoke coldly, "The war at the front lines is far from over. Countless comrades have died on the battlefield. Yet you people, instead of contributing, are here gossiping behind their backs!"

"I, Kou Hong, am ashamed to associate with the likes of you!"

"Bah!"

Kou Hong’s eyes blazed with fury, his voice thundering.

Beside him, another cultivator in white robes, with a tall figure and sharp brows, stood up with a hearty laugh.

"Well said, my brother! I, Dao Xuanzi, also despise these beasts!"

Their words instantly offended the small group that had been chatting.

Cold glares were cast toward Kou Hong and Dao Xuanzi, with traces of killing intent flashing in their eyes.

If this weren’t Ji Shaoli’s territory, they might have already drawn their swords against the two outspoken cultivators.

"Hmph! What kind of mutual aid association is this? It’s not worth staying in!"

Kou Hong and Dao Xuanzi fumed, preparing to leave.

"Wait, you two!"

Someone suddenly stepped forward to block them.

Everyone turned to look and immediately bowed in respect.

It was none other than the master of Haixuan Island, the leader of the Congyun Sea Mutual Aid Association—Ji Shaoli himself!

"Fellow Daoist Ji, as the saying goes, 'Those who walk different paths cannot make plans together.' Let us part ways here today!" Kou Hong turned away, ignoring Ji Shaoli.

Dao Xuanzi, however, still showed some courtesy, cupping his hands in respect.

Clone Ji Shaoli’s said nothing. He merely looked at the two familiar faces before him, a faint smile appearing on his lips.

He couldn’t help but sigh inwardly, "Fate truly works in mysterious ways!"

In the original timeline, these two had only reached the Foundation Establishment stage even decades later. Yet now, they had already attained early-stage Golden Core cultivation.

A decision formed in his heart.

The drastic changes in the fates of Kou Hong and Dao Xuanzi could not be separated from Li Fan.

These two were once proud and unwilling to become mere workhorses for the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance just for the sake of cultivation techniques.

Instead, they preferred to risk their lives exploring the ruins of various sects, searching for ancient cultivation techniques, rather than joining the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance or the Five Elders Association to serve others.

However, in this lifetime, their attitudes had undergone a complete transformation.

The turning point occurred when, after Tianyang achieved Dao Integration, Li Fan ordered the detonation of the void in Qiling Prefecture.

As a result, the Immortal-Mortal Miasma, which had been sealed within, returned and wreaked havoc upon the world.

No cultivator was able to escape its contamination.

Kou Hong and Dao Xuanzi were no exception.

At that time, they were merely at the Foundation Establishment stage, without any special constitutions. Upon infection, their symptoms worsened rapidly.

Just as they were preparing to face death together…

They unexpectedly received a special elixir distributed freely by the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance!

Originally harboring deep prejudices against the alliance, the two had no choice but to cast aside their reservations in the face of life and death.

They swallowed the medicine whole.

The effects were immediate—within a few days, they had already started to recover.

By the time the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance distributed a second dose, they had fully survived the calamity.

Having been saved by the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, Kou Hong and Dao Xuanzi deeply reflected on their past biases.

Thus, they both decided to join the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

Perhaps it was true that great misfortunes bring great fortune.

After joining, the two brothers sold off all the miscellaneous items they had acquired from their explorations and exchanged them through the Tianxuan Mirror—earning a massive fortune in the process.

With this wealth, they immediately obtained two Golden Core cultivation techniques and even had some extra left over.

With their solid foundation, they quickly broke through the Foundation Establishment stage and ascended to the Golden Core realm.

"Fate truly works in mysterious ways."

On Haixuan Island, upon unexpectedly encountering the two, Ji Shaoli spent some contribution points to uncover their experiences.

Later, when they got into a dispute with members of the Mutual Aid Association, he stepped in to stop them.

"These two may be a bit stubborn, but their unwavering nature—once they commit to something—can be a great advantage." Ji Shaoli thought.

Seeing Dao Xuanzi’s determination to leave, Ji Shaoli remained composed and posed a soul-searching question:

"Why exactly are you two so angry? Did these people truly say something wrong?"

Dao Xuanzi was momentarily stunned.

Ji Shaoli continued solemnly, "If they were mistaken, I will have them apologize to you immediately."

"However, I have heard the same claims from other cultivators. Though I, too, find it hard to believe, there is no smoke without fire. The Immortal Alliance has always been vague about how victory was achieved, which defies common sense…"

"Can we really be blamed for questioning it?"

"Or perhaps… have you personally witnessed the battles at the front lines and can confirm that our claims are false?"

Ji Shaoli’s words left Kou Hong and Dao Xuanzi speechless.

They opened their mouths, but no words came out in rebuttal.

Ji Shaoli smiled slightly.

"Please, have a seat."

"Our Mutual Aid Association has grown quite large. With more people, differences in perspectives are inevitable."

"That is why seeking common ground while respecting differences is our fundamental principle."

"Everyone is entitled to their own views. If you believe the other person is wrong, then present evidence, debate with reason."

"Resorting to insults the moment there's a disagreement—how is that the way of a gentleman?"

With that, Ji Shaoli extended his hand and firmly pressed the still-resistant duo back into their seats.

Ke Hong and Dao Xuanzi exchanged glances, both feeling somewhat shocked. However, they couldn't deny that Ji Shaoli's words made sense.

They were straightforward in their actions. After a brief moment of contemplation, they first apologized to the small group they had previously clashed with.

Then, they sat down and carefully examined Ji Shaoli.

They had long heard of this leader of the Congyun Sea Mutual Aid Association.

It was said that he was extraordinarily mysterious and likely had a significant background.

But they had not expected his strength to be so unfathomable.

"Brother, he is clearly only at the Golden Core stage. Why is it that we couldn't resist him at all?" Dao Xuanzi asked through voice transmission.

Ke Hong narrowed his eyes. "He must be concealing his cultivation level. The two of us, while we may not be able to match the top prodigies in one-on-one combat, when we join forces, we should not be weaker than any peer in the same realm!"

Dao Xuanzi nodded slightly, feeling somewhat reassured. "That must be the case. Does this mean he is actually at the Nascent Soul stage? It seems this Mutual Aid Association is far from simple."

The two of them focused on listening to Ji Shaoli's speech.

He spoke about many things, including but not limited to: the rapid achievements of the Congyun Sea Mutual Aid Association over the past few years, its outstanding members and their accomplishments, and the organization's future plans.

Although none of it contained any real substance—just grand words of encouragement—Ji Shaoli delivered it with passion, his tone rising and falling in perfect rhythm, making his speech extremely persuasive.

The cultivators present all became visibly excited, as if they could already see the bright future awaiting them after joining the association.

Ke Hong and Dao Xuanzi were also deeply drawn in by the benefits Ji Shaoli described, instantly forgetting the minor conflict they had just experienced.

"It seems we have truly come to the right place."

Exchanging glances, they both came to the same conclusion.

After the speech, under the witness of the True Immortal of Salvation and Mortal Compassion, they officially joined the Mutual Aid Association.

A lively celebration followed.

Only after the crowd dispersed did they suddenly feel as if they had just woken from a dream.

"Did we… act too hastily?"

Before they could think further, Ji Shaoli discreetly led them to a secret chamber on the island.

"Fellow Daoist Ji, what is the meaning of this?" Ke Hong immediately became alert.

However, Ji Shaoli's expression was sincere as he said, "In truth, your earlier words deeply resonated with me. But to calm the crowd, I had no choice but to argue against you just now."

"In these troubled times, there are few cultivators as passionate and honorable as you two."

Ji Shaoli gave them a respectful bow, expressing his heartfelt apology.

Ke Hong and Dao Xuanzi were caught off guard by this gesture and hurriedly returned the courtesy.

"However…" Ji Shaoli's expression suddenly changed, his voice turning cold. "Your loyalty has been given to the wrong cause!"

The sudden shift left them completely bewildered.

"Fellow Daoist Ji, what are you—"

Ji Shaoli sneered, "I know you joined the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance out of gratitude for the life-saving elixir."

"But tell me, do you really know what that so-called miracle medicine is?"

"See for yourselves!"

With that, Ji Shaoli tossed out a jade slip.

Inside was detailed information on the Heart-Desires Ascension Pill!

"The… Ten Thousand… Immortal Alliance…"

After reading the contents, Ke Hong's expression twisted with fury, his face turning red with rage.

"It's not some miraculous elixir at all. It's just a weakened version of the Heart-Desires Ascension Pill, while also accelerating the eruption of the Immortal-Mortal Miasma within a cultivator's body..."

"So, does that mean that even without this so-called special medicine, we could have survived on our own?"

Compared to Kou Hong, Dao Xuanzi appeared much calmer.

However, his fists were still tightly clenched, and his expression remained grim.

"No wonder I've been feeling mentally disoriented from time to time lately. I want to do something, but I end up feeling lost and unsure. So, this Heart-Desires Ascension Pill is the culprit!" Kou Hong gritted his teeth in realization.

"And to think that we two brothers were even grateful, rushing to join the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance overnight..."

Kou Hong suddenly stood up, feeling utterly deceived and deeply humiliated.

"No, the more I think about it, the angrier I get."

"I can't stay in this Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance for another moment!"

"Wait!" Ji Shaoli reached out to stop him.

"Heh, I understand your frustration, Brother Kou. But..."

"Have you considered the consequences of leaving the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance?"

Ji Shaoli's words carried a deep meaning: "Have you ever heard of anyone leaving the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and living to tell the tale?"

Kou Hong's brows shot up as he said angrily, "So what? I'm not one to fear death."

"If it comes to that, I'll expose the truth about this so-called special medicine! I'll go down with them!"

"Either way, I refuse to stay in this disgusting Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance any longer!"

Dao Xuanzi also stood up, clearly having made the same decision as Kou Hong.

"You two are truly men of honor and righteousness!"

"I knew I wasn’t mistaken about you!" Ji Shaoli clapped his hands in admiration.

"What do you mean by that?" Dao Xuanzi's eyes flickered as he asked.

"I, too, believe that the Immortal Alliance is unjust. We cultivators must band together to overthrow it and restore a bright and just Xuanhuang Realm!" Ji Shaoli declared solemnly.

Kou Hong and Dao Xuanzi were taken aback and exchanged glances. They instantly became more respectful toward Ji Shaoli.

However, while they disliked the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, they were not foolish.

After all, they were merely at the Golden Core stage, while the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance boasted countless Soul Transformation and Dao Integration powerhouses...

Overthrow the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance?

What a joke.

The two of them pretended they hadn’t heard Ji Shaoli's words and prepared to take their leave.

But how could Ji Shaoli let them go so easily?

Inside that small chamber, he forcefully introduced them to the existence of the Federation of All Worlds.

The means he employed to persuade them need not be mentioned.

By the time he finished speaking, Kou Hong and Dao Xuanzi had shifted from their initial fear and avoidance to a state of deep temptation.

"As the saying goes, the strongest fortresses are often breached from within."

"Our Congyun Sea Mutual Aid Association is the hidden thorn within the Immortal Alliance! We remain concealed, waiting for the day when the time is ripe to completely bury the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance!" Ji Shaoli’s tone was resolute.

"What do you two think?"

As they faced Ji Shaoli’s fervent and eager gaze, Kou Hong and Dao Xuanzi still hesitated.

They knew this was different from simply ranting as wandering cultivators. This was real treason—punishable by death!

But by now, having learned of the Federation of All World’s secrets, they realized that if they refused, they might not walk out of that chamber alive.

Just as the two brothers wavered, Ji Shaoli raised the stakes once more.

"Do you two know why, despite existing for only a few short years, our Congyun Sea Mutual Aid Association has managed to attract countless cultivators to join?"

"Aside from the principles of mutual aid and shared resources, the real reason is that the Federation of All Worlds selects its core members from among us and cultivates them."

"All cultivation resources are provided without restriction."

"For example..."

"Nascent Soul Cave-Heaven, Soul Transformation life-transforming phenomenon, and even the Spirit of Heaven and Earth!"

Ji Shaoli’s tone was light, but to Kou Hong and Dao Xuanzi, his words were like a thunderclap in their ears.

Kou Hong couldn’t help but swallow nervously. “Fellow Daoist Ji, are you serious about this?”

Ji Shaoli smiled slightly and nodded in confirmation.

“You two were both rogue cultivators before, so you must know how difficult the path of cultivation is. Let’s not even talk about the Spirit of Heaven and Earth or the Life-transforming phenomenon. Just take the Nascent Soul Cave-Heaven as an example—do you really have confidence in finding it relying solely on your own luck?”

“With no hope of advancing to the Nascent Soul stage, are you truly willing to have your cultivation permanently stuck at the Golden Core realm?”

Ji Shaoli’s voice grew louder, echoing continuously in their minds.

Their expressions gradually shifted, and at last, they made their decision.

“A true man born under heaven and earth—how can he allow himself to remain mediocre for a lifetime!” Kou Hong resolved in his heart.

“A divine opportunity like this must not be missed,” Dao Xuanzi said solemnly.

“Good! Excellent! Then let us hold the initiation ceremony once more—the true initiation ceremony,” Ji Shaoli laughed heartily.

At that moment, the enigmatic, faceless stone statue once again appeared in the chamber.

Under Ji Shaoli’s guidance, Kou Hong and Dao Xuanzi recited the oath anew.

Some parts of the pledge were altered, and as they finished, they felt as if an invisible shackle had been placed upon their souls.

The two brothers exchanged glances, feeling secretly apprehensive.

“Now that we are all family, I’ll be frank with you,” Ji Shaoli said warmly, leading them to sit at the stone table in the chamber.

“If I’m not mistaken, the Foundation Establishment treasures you two used—one is the Dao Xuan Sword, and the other is the Coiling Dragon Branch, am I right?” Ji Shaoli asked.

How did he figure that out?

The two brothers were so shocked that they nearly stood up on the spot.

Gesturing for them to stay calm, Ji Shaoli continued bluntly, “I see that you both have extraordinary talent. However, you’ve been held back by the quality of your Foundation Establishment treasures.”

“Let’s not even talk about Heavenly or Earthly Wonder. Even if you switched to a Top-grade human treasure, your future prospects would be boundless.”

Though the two brothers were quite proud, they couldn’t help but feel flattered by Ji Shaoli’s praise.

Their faces flushed, and they were about to offer some modest words.

But what Ji Shaoli said next instantly captured their full attention.

“Our Mutual Aid Association selects core members not based on talent or aptitude—but on temperament.”

“As long as one’s temperament meets our standards, we will help them…”

“To defy fate and rewrite destiny!”

Kou Hong’s breathing faltered. “Rewrite destiny? But we have already…”

“That’s right. Tell me, have you ever heard of the ‘Re-establishing the Dao’ method?” Ji Shaoli’s voice was filled with an enticing allure.

“The ‘Re-establishing the Dao’ method allows a cultivator to establish a new Dao Foundation without affecting their existing cultivation or spiritual power in the slightest. Over time, the new Dao Foundation will gradually devour and replace the old one, enabling a seamless transformation—correcting all past flaws.”

As Ji Shaoli spoke, Kou Hong and Dao Xuanzi’s breathing grew increasingly rapid.

“Such a heaven-defying technique actually exists in this world?”

“Indeed. Although you two have already formed your Golden Cores, you only recently broke through. The cost of shattering your cores and rebuilding them would not be too steep,” Ji Shaoli nodded.

"Moreover, the association has just received news not long ago."

"In the next ten years, the Xuanhuang Realm will witness the birth of two Earthly Wonders."

"One of them is located in this Congyun Sea. It is the Canghai Pearl, containing the boundless power of vast seas."

"The other is in Guanglan Prefecture. It is the Ten Thousand Mountains Cauldron, within which endless mountain ranges are nurtured, holding unfathomable mysteries."

Kou Hong and Dao Xuanzi couldn't help but tremble slightly.

"Earthly Wonders?"

Such treasures were things they had only dared to dream of.

"If you are willing, the Federation can assist you in obtaining these two artifacts," Ji Shaoli said solemnly.

Kou Hong and Dao Xuanzi were stunned on the spot.

The two of them...

What virtue or capability did they possess to deserve this?

As if seeing through their thoughts, Ji Shaoli patted their shoulders. "You two need not belittle yourselves. Although those so-called prodigies have superior backgrounds and talents compared to you—"

"But what the Federation values most is willpower!"

"Your ambitions are no weaker than any prodigy I have ever seen!" Ji Shaoli declared firmly.

Kou Hong and Dao Xuanzi were bewildered.

Are we really that strong?

Both of them had this thought pop into their minds.

"I believe that if you are given a high enough starting point, you will be able to stand toe-to-toe with those prodigies!" Ji Shaoli said in a deep voice.

"Are you willing?" he asked again.

Though they still couldn't believe such fortune would befall them, they also realized—

What reason was there to deceive them at this point?

If they could truly obtain an Earthly Wonder...

Then even if they perished in the process, it would be worth it, wouldn't it?

Having struggled for half their lives in the wilderness, the two of them immediately nodded repeatedly.

"If I can truly use an Earthly Wonder to establish my foundation, I swear to devote my life to the Federation!" Kou Hong declared sincerely.

Dao Xuanzi also made a solemn vow.

"Good! Then it's settled." Ji Shaoli made the decision on the spot.

Just like that, he casually allocated two Earthly Wonders—once considered priceless treasures—to Kou Hong and Dao Xuanzi.

The Canghai Pearl was an old acquaintance of Li Fan.

The Ten Thousand Mountains Cauldron was also an artifact that Li Fan had previously investigated, foreseeing that it would emerge around this time.

Both were immensely valuable.

However, as his cultivation grew by the day, these Earthly Wonders had become useless to him.

Rather than allowing the Immortal Alliance cultivators to discover and claim them,

Why not use them to strengthen the Federation instead?

As for why he chose Kou Hong and Dao Xuanzi—

It was simply because Grand Preceptor Li had a momentary whim.

After all, to him, so-called peerless prodigies were no different from cultivators who spent their lives stuck at the Foundation Establishment stage, ultimately dying of old age.

"In truth, these two are not entirely untalented. At the very least, judging by their performance in the battle at Grand Xuan Imperial City, their actual combat prowess far exceeds that of ordinary cultivators."

"Since their destinies in this life have already deviated so drastically... I might as well push things further and see just how far their limits can go!"

With that thought in mind, Ji Shaoli personally stood guard for the two brothers.

He took out numerous precious treasures to minimize the dangers of their Core Shattering and Rebuilding process.

To be honest, encountering these two in this lifetime was a bit unexpected for Li Fan.

And in the current Xuanhuang Realm, there were few things left that could truly surprise him.

Perhaps that was why he was willing to try this experiment today.

However, for Kou Hong and Dao Xuanzi, this day could be said to have completely changed their destinies. It was merely that the clone, Ji Shaoli, had stayed on Haixuan Island for too long and, out of boredom, decided to make an idle attempt.

The result, however, was of no concern.

What Li Fan truly cared about was only himself.

At this moment, within the Spiritwood Realm, Li Fan’s true self had immersed his consciousness, merging with the Great Five Elements Cave-Heaven.

Feeling the surging power of the Five Elements, he attempted to consolidate them into one.

“The Five Elements unite as one, the limitless ebbs and flow; its power endures unending, the divine soul remains unextinguished”

“With an endless supply of the Five Elements’ power, I can elevate my Limitless Fullness and Emptiness Technique to an entirely new level.”

“This will complete my final shortcoming.”

Under Li Fan’s exquisite control, the power of the Five Elements perfectly fused into one.

It formed an unknown energy, something Li Fan had never encountered before.

His soul suddenly reacted as if it had been starved for a long time, catching a faint whiff of nourishment.

A deep hunger arose, making Li Fan almost believe that the side effects of the Hunger technique were manifesting again.

However, he quickly discerned the truth—his soul had simply sensed something highly beneficial to itself, reacting instinctively.

Without hesitation, like a great whale swallowing water, he absorbed this mysterious energy.

The sensation was similar to when he had previously consumed Intent Horse—his soul felt as if it were soaking in a hot spring, warm and comfortable.

But the key difference was that Intent Horse had only a temporary effect.

Once it was fully digested, its nourishment to the soul would dissipate completely.

However, the Limitless Fullness and Emptiness Technique would never cease as long as Li Fan continued supplying the Five Elements' transformation!

If consuming Intent Horse was like taking a hot bath where the water quickly cooled down…

Then the Limitless Fullness and Emptiness Technique was like an ever-heated hot spring.

As he continuously absorbed nourishment, Li Fan’s soul visibly grew stronger at an astonishing rate.

If, back in the Great Xuan World, his initial defensive formation was like donning a simple raincoat for his soul’s protection…

Then now, with the ongoing circulation of the Limitless Fullness and Emptiness Technique, Li Fan felt as if his soul no longer required any external shielding.

His very being was as solid as steel.

No matter how fierce the external storm, he would remain unshaken!

"Perhaps my previous soul strength was simply too weak, which is why the effects of cultivation are now so dramatic."

However, not long after, Li Fan sensed the Limitless Fullness and Emptiness Technique beginning to wane. A realization dawned upon him.

"The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance guards soul-related techniques too tightly. Without relying on the Derivation Law Jade, even if I reincarnated across countless worlds, I wouldn’t have found many high-quality techniques."

"But after today, things will never be the same."

Li Fan closed his eyes, immersing himself in the meditative refinement of the Limitless Fullness and Emptiness Technique.

It had been a long time since he had felt the joy of rapid cultivation progress.

"I wonder if, as my soul grows, my other abilities will also evolve?"

A thought suddenly surfaced in his mind.

When Li Fan finally emerged from seclusion, the first thing he did was test the so-called divine soul remains unextinguished effect of the Limitless Fullness and Emptiness Technique.

In his memory, there existed a secret technique known as Soul Ignition Art, which temporarily granted an immense boost in cultivation power at the cost of burning one’s own soul.

Without a moment’s hesitation, Li Fan decisively activated it.

"Boom!"

Li Fan felt as if his soul was suddenly plunged into molten lava.

The extreme heat threatened to completely incinerate his very essence.

Wrapped in endless radiance, he sensed his soul dissolving and vanishing at a terrifying speed.

However, in contrast, the remnants of his burned soul transformed into a mysterious form of nourishment.

The Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven trembled slightly, and then a layer of blood-colored radiance appeared across the various Cave Heaven worlds, casting a strange yet mesmerizing glow over the Five Elements scenery.

Under the shroud of this crimson light, numerous anomalies emerged in the sky of the Cave-Heaven.

Even more terrifying, within the Cave-Heaven, the circulation of Five Elements power nearly doubled in speed in an instant. This wild catalytic effect seemed to have no limit, further accelerating the burning of Li Fan’s soul!

A surge of deadly crisis flooded his heart.

Suppressing the impulse to return to [Truth] himself, Li Fan silently activated the [Limitless Fullness and Emptiness Technique].

An invisible vortex appeared at the convergence point of the Five Elements Cave-Heaven, siphoning the wildly surging Five Elements power and redistributing it evenly.

The Five Elements unite as one, through limitless ebbs and flow; its power endures unending.

It was like an exposed seabed after the tide had receded—only for a mighty tidal wave to crash back in the next moment.

The portion of Li Fan’s soul that had already vanished suddenly reappeared under the nourishment of the Limitless Fullness and Emptiness Power!

Though it was quickly burned away again by the Soul-Ignition Secret Art, the continuous flow of Limitless Fullness and Emptiness Power made his soul resilient, like wild grass that could not be completely eradicated by flames.

Due to the effects of the Soul-Ignition Secret Art, Li Fan’s entire body was now shrouded in a faint layer of blood-colored light, exuding a terrifying aura that could make anyone tremble in fear.

After a long while, Li Fan gradually adapted to the constant transformation of his soul between burning and regeneration.

Upon inspecting himself, he found that not only had his usable strength nearly doubled, but even his thought process had become significantly sharper.

The power boost from burning his soul was an all-encompassing enhancement!

"And this is just from burning the outermost layer of my soul. If I use the denser, purer core of my soul as fuel instead…"

"The amplification effect will double once again!"

Li Fan closed his eyes and briefly sensed his condition.

"With my current recovery speed using the Limitless Fullness and Emptiness Technique, I can maintain the initial stage of Soul Ignition indefinitely."

"Maintaining the mid-stage of Soul Ignition for an extended period might cause some damage to my soul, requiring time to recover afterward."

"As for extreme Soul Ignition…"

"There’s no need for that."

With his newfound surge in power, Li Fan’s battle instinct flared up.

With a mere thought, Tianyang appeared before him, his eyes burning with fighting spirit.

Through the newly established Soul Shade Realm Passage, Li Fan and Tianyang once again found themselves in the vast, empty Void Corridor.

With no more reservations, Tianyang struck first.

Ever since his defeat at the hands of his senior brother, he had been obsessed with turning the tables.

Unfortunately, Li Fan had always avoided combat.

Now that the long-awaited rematch had arrived, Tianyang immediately noticed that his senior brother’s strength had once again advanced by leaps and bounds.

Thus, he attacked with full force from the very start.

Manipulating the space around Li Fan, he attempted to use the power of spatial fragmentation to cut apart his body.

However, to his shock, this previously effective technique had completely lost its power!

A bizarre blood-colored aura enveloped Li Fan’s body.

Even though the surrounding space shattered, he remained unaffected, standing firmly within the broken void.

"Body and soul, perfectly fused."

"Immune to all techniques…"

Li Fan narrowed his eyes, feeling the limitless power coursing through him.

With a flicker of his figure, he appeared instantly beside Tianyang.

Countless blood-red tendrils erupted from his body, like tens of thousands of crimson dragons, roaring as they lashed toward Tianyang!

At the same time, a silver light flashed in his eyes, and in an instant, he set up a formation around him, sealing off any possibility of Tianyang escaping.

Facing Li Fan’s overwhelming and ferocious assault, Tianyang’s expression changed slightly.

Realizing that he had no way to dodge, his entire body transformed into a mass of darkness, colliding with countless strands of blood-colored energy.

"Boom!"

Loud explosions echoed continuously. With every clash, Tianyang’s dark form trembled violently, gradually dimming with each impact.

On the other hand, Li Fan’s crimson energy was nearly endless, showing no signs of weakening.

He even had enough energy to reveal his figure, watching Tianyang’s desperate struggle with interest.

The countless blood threads completely enveloped Tianyang, forming a spherical blood cocoon around him. With no way to escape, he could only resist in a pathetic state.

With the Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven providing him with an endless supply of spiritual energy, Li Fan could maintain his peak combat state indefinitely.

Meanwhile, the sealed Tianyang’s aura was growing weaker and weaker.

It wouldn’t take long before he would be beaten to death by Li Fan.

Finally, Tianyang sent out a plea for mercy.

After launching a few more attacks, Li Fan finally withdrew his hand, though somewhat reluctantly.

"Junior Brother, how about now? Still unwilling to submit?" Li Fan asked with a light chuckle.

Tianyang gritted his teeth and muttered, "I yield. Senior Brother, you are indeed stronger."

Li Fan burst into hearty laughter.

Overpowering someone with sheer force was far more satisfying than winning through trickery.

The thousands of blood threads retracted into his body, but the Soul Ignition state was not lifted.

He only slightly restrained the eerie phenomena surrounding him.

Though the blood-colored glow had faded somewhat, Li Fan still exuded a faintly sinister aura.

"Unless it’s someone at the level of Mr. Bai, even a group of Dao Integration cultivators, whether they attack together or take turns, may not be able to outlast me."

"And this is without me using my divine abilities."

Through his battle with Tianyang, Li Fan had roughly gauged his upper limits of strength and nodded slightly.

"It's time to visit the Empire."

A sharp gleam flashed in his eyes.

Bringing Tianyang along, he effortlessly found the entrance to the Empire’s small world.

Then, moving at full speed, he soon arrived outside the Empire.

Without concealing his immense aura, Xiao Qing and Xiao Hong had already sensed his presence. Now, they stood waiting with grave expressions.

"Senior…" Xiao Qing looked at Li Fan, who was exuding an ominous aura, and a trace of worry flashed in her eyes as she tentatively spoke.

"I am an envoy of the Federation of All Worlds. Your small world has been requisitioned!" Li Fan coldly announced.

Xiao Qing and Xiao Hong's expressions drastically changed.

Even if the aura radiating from him hinted at Dao Integration-level power, he was far too arrogant to think that he could take over the Empire with just a few words!

"Empire Guards!"

Xiao Qing transmitted a message in secret while suppressing her anger and asked again, "What Federation of All Worlds? We've never even heard of it. Senior, your actions…"

Li Fan let out a sinister chuckle. "It seems you still harbor delusions."

"Very well, then. Let me show you… true power!"

Before his words even finished, the illusory form of the Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven spread across the sky above the Empire.

Under the effect of Soul Ignition, it resembled five intertwined blood-red moons, radiating an eerie and demonic glow!

The entire Empire Small World trembled under this terrifying force.

The ocean below surged with monstrous waves.

The city built upon the body of the Red Nine-Headed Beast quaked incessantly, seemingly on the verge of collapsing from the sky at any moment.

What frightened Xiao Qing and Xiao Hong the most was that under this immense pressure, not to mention the exotic beasts controlled by the Imperial Guards—even they themselves were overwhelmed by fear, unable to muster a single thought of resistance!

"The difference in strength is too vast. Even if we release that fused beast, it won’t be a match for this person!"

"If we forcefully resist, he could destroy the entire empire with a single thought."

Xiao Qing and Xiao Hong exchanged glances, their eyes filled with helplessness and unwillingness.

"We can only feign submission for now and look for another opportunity later."

That was their conclusion.

"Hmph. Don't think I don’t know what you’re plotting."

Seeing this, Li Fan retracted the illusory projection of his Cave-heaven.

His gaze swept back and forth between Qing and Hong. "You’d be better off abandoning those little schemes. The Federation of All Worlds has been watching you for a long time."

"I know all about your so-called trump cards, clear as day."

"Even if [Emperor Yi] himself came, I wouldn't fear him—let alone his poor imitation."

Li Fan’s words were beyond arrogant, but to Xiao Qing and Xiao Hong—who had no understanding of his true strength—they were utterly shocking.

Li Fan’s unfathomable gaze sent chills through their hearts.

The Myriad Phenomena Fusion Beast was an absolute secret of the Empire.

Only the Emperors of past generations and the two of them knew about it.

And yet, this powerful figure from the Federation of All Worlds—whom they had never heard of before—was fully aware of it?

Did that mean they had no secrets at all in his eyes?

More importantly, they had no idea when this information had leaked.
