A sense of despair and fear surged within them.

Not even when they were in the Beast Taming Sect, facing Longevity Immortal Realm experts, had they ever felt so powerless.

"Let’s go. Take me to the Empire’s treasury."

Seeing that his intimidation had done its job, Li Fan spoke casually.

Now that they were at his mercy, Xiao Qing and Xiao Hong had completely abandoned the idea of resistance.

They could only obey his command.

Soon, Li Fan arrived at the Empire’s treasure vault—a place filled with countless rare treasures and ancient records.

It was no different from what he had seen in his previous life.

After a brief tour and a final inspection of the Myriad Phenomena Fusion Beast, Li Fan revealed his true purpose.

"Hand over Xu Ke’s research notes on the [Ten Thousand Reincarnation Beast Wheel] as well."

Li Fan turned to face Xiao Qing and Xiao Hong, his voice deep and commanding.

The moment those words left his mouth, the two bird-women were unable to maintain their composure.

"Who exactly are you?!"

Xiao Qing’s beautiful eyes were full of shock, and her body trembled slightly.

This man not only knew their master’s name, Xu Ke, but also had detailed knowledge of his research on the Ten Thousand Reincarnation Beast Wheel.

And then there were the words "Federation of All Worlds"…

A single possibility surfaced in Xiao Qing’s mind.

"The Beast Taming Sect?"

Seeing the utter shock on her face, Li Fan let out a sinister smile.

"What? Are you planning to resist?"

"Fine then, I’ll grant your wish."

"Tsk tsk tsk, that brat Xu Ke… If he knew about your deaths, he’d be heartbroken." Li Fan chuckled darkly.

Xiao Qing and Xiao Hong quickly spoke up, "Senior, this is a misunderstanding..."

"Wait, senior, what do you mean?"

The two of them stared blankly at Li Fan.

"You heard me correctly. That brat Xu Ke… is still alive."

Li Fan snorted coldly.

This revelation was too shocking. Xiao Qing and Xiao Hong nearly lost their balance.

"Enough. Stop wasting time."

"Death…"

"Or submission!"

Seeing the impatience on Li Fan’s face, Xiao Qing and Xiao Hong felt a tightening in their hearts.

"We..."

"We are willing to submit," Xiao Qing bowed her head and said.

After hesitating for a moment, she finally handed over a jade pendant engraved with a Azure Luan Bird.

This jade pendant had originally belonged to Xu Ke. Over the years, she had always carried it with her.

Now, as she handed it over, her eyes were filled with reluctance.

At the same time, Xu Ke’s image faintly surfaced in her mind.

While she was lost in thought, Li Fan had already read through the contents of the jade pendant.

"Beast-Controlling Wheel…

"As expected of the supreme treasure of the Beast Taming Sect, its mysteries are profound."

Back in the day, after the Beast Taming Sect migrated to a small world to seek refuge, they gathered their elite disciples to research the Beast-Controlling Wheel, attempting to find a way to control demonic beasts without practicing the sect’s true Beast Control Technique.

Whether they ultimately succeeded or not, Li Fan did not know.

However, Xu Ke, who later fled, managed to develop the Heart-Linking Technique on his own, using it to control the exotic beasts of the empire’s small world.

Li Fan had long known about the Heart-Linking Technique.

What truly intrigued him was the mystery behind the Beast-Controlling Wheel itself.

And Xu Ke, who had been recognized by Mr. Bai and had pioneered a lineage within the empire, was indeed an unparalleled genius.

The jade pendant contained far more detailed records of the Beast-Controlling Wheel than Li Fan had anticipated.

"With such thorough information, once the True Cauldron of the Medicine King returns, Fang Zaiji might be able to forge a weakened version of the Beast-Controlling Wheel."

Though there was still some time before the Medicine King Sect returned, Li Fan had already assigned their tasks in advance.

Seeing Xiao Qing's dazed and despondent expression, Li Fan chuckled and tossed the jade pendant back to her.

"I know about your plan to escape the Xuanhuang Realm..."

"But let me make it very clear— that is nothing but a road to death."

"Beyond the endless void, the dangers are far greater than those in the Xuanhuang Realm..."

Li Fan sighed slightly, then his expression became serious.

"The only path to survival is to join our Federation of All Worlds, counterattack the cultivation world, and reclaim the Xuanhuang Realm!"

Hearing these words, Xiao Qing became even more convinced of her judgment.

This so-called Federation of All Worlds was indeed formed by sects that had fled to various small worlds during ancient times.

"Your place here is weak, yes, but it has some unique advantages."

Li Fan commented, then assigned them a task.

"For example, your spiritual energy synthesis technology is highly valuable for many small worlds that lack spiritual energy."

"However, the efficiency is still far too low."

"Even if you exhaust your entire world raising exotic beasts solely for slaughter, it still wouldn’t be enough to meet the needs of multiple small worlds."

"Therefore..."

Feeling Li Fan’s gaze, Xiao Qing and Xiao Hong shuddered.

"Upgrade the spiritual energy synthesis technology at all costs."

"I’m giving you three years. In three years, I will return for an inspection."

"If the results satisfy me, there will be rewards."

"If not… well..."

"Useless people living is just a waste of resources. It’d be better for them to die sooner rather than later."

Li Fan let out a sinister, chilling laugh, his words filled with murderous intent.

Xiao Qing and Xiao Hong shuddered in fear.

They could tell that this sinister senior was not making empty threats. If they failed to meet his demands, he would truly kill them!

"Spiritual Energy Synthesis..."

The discovery that the crystal cores of exotic beasts could generate spiritual qi had been purely accidental. Achieving a breakthrough within three years would be extremely difficult.

As Xiao Qing furrowed her brows in deep thought, Li Fan suddenly sneered and said, "Heh, I have always been a man of my word! To prevent anyone from harboring unrealistic hopes..."

In the next moment, Li Fan flashed into the sky above the empire.

Thousands of blood-red threads spread out from his body, whistling as they shot toward every corner of the imperial capital.

Within moments, the threads had returned.

However, each thread now held a bound mortal from the empire at its end.

The terrifying sight was so overwhelming that many people below fainted on the spot.

As the red threads tightened, the unfortunate captives couldn't even cry out before being sucked into Li Fan’s Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven, where they were sealed away.

Li Fan did not simply slaughter these mortals.

Instead, he intended to deliver them to Master Yin as research material for the Immortal-Mortal Miasma experiment.

After brutally intimidating the empire, Li Fan plundered its resources before leaving, satisfied.

As for the red string left behind by Mr. Bai for Xu Ke...

Li Fan did not take it—yet.

If needed, he could guide a "fated person" to claim it.

As for his own true self…

He had no interest in it.

When the oppressive demonic presence of Li Fan finally vanished, the people of the empire collapsed in relief, weeping as if they had narrowly escaped death.

Xiao Qing, upon checking the list of missing individuals, felt her heart skip a beat.

To her shock, she realized that all those abducted by the Federation of All Worlds Senior were from the empire’s conservative noble faction—the very group that had always opposed the royal family and obstructed reforms.

Now, with all of them gone, they could finally unify the empire’s resources to tackle the spiritual energy synthesis breakthrough.

"This isn't a coincidence—it's a warning."

"The fact that he understands our empire to this extent..."

A chill ran through Xiao Qing’s heart, and all thoughts of resistance vanished.

Without hesitation, she summoned the empire’s top researchers to begin discussing this critical technological advancement that would determine their future.

After returning from the empire’s small-world, Li Fan worked with Tianyang to relocate the spatial gateway to the Spiritwood Realm.

He then personally set up a formation at the exit, ensuring that no one from the empire could escape.

As for the empire’s outlawed cultivators wandering the outside world? If they couldn’t find their way back, it was of no concern to Li Fan.

With that settled, Li Fan took a short trip to Yin Yin Island.

After delivering the captured mortals to Master Yin, he inquired about the progress of his research.

"It’s almost done… almost done…"

Master Yin’s expression was peculiar.

He did not look excited about an impending breakthrough.

Instead, he appeared dazed and unsettled, his mind elsewhere.

Even his conversation with Li Fan was disjointed, responding only half-heartedly.

Seeing this, Li Fan chose not to press further.

Upon returning to the Spiritwood Realm, he was immediately approached by Ou Daozi and Shang Tianci.

After years of relentless effort and arduous construction, the headquarters of the Ten Thousand Realms Alliance had finally begun to take shape.

However, since Li Fan had previously instructed that the final cornerstone-laying decision must be made by him personally, they had all come together to seek his opinion.

Li Fan spread his spiritual sense across the Spiritwood Realm.

He saw that surrounding the central spirit tree was an expansive architectural complex, occupying nearly one-tenth of the entire Spiritwood Realm.

For any visitor arriving, the first sight to greet them would be a 99-zhang-tall black jade gate tower. (approximately 1,083 feet tall)

The plaque above the gate was still empty, awaiting Li Fan’s inscription.

Beyond the gate stretched a long, broad avenue.

The road’s surface glowed with a jade-green hue, identical to the one before the Guardian Hall Headquarters of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, entirely crafted from Spiritual Stones.

Walking upon it would seal off spiritual energy.

Combined with the No-Flight Formation, it would force any visiting cultivators to walk forward step by step, like ordinary mortals, completing the path of reverence at a deliberate pace.

At the end of the long road stood a circular grand hall.

The center of the grand hall remained empty for now, as Li Fan planned to place the Xuantian Divine Statue there—

To give all first-time visitors a sense of awe and mystery.

From the circular grand hall, roads branched out in all directions, leading to various functional buildings—

Such as the Welcoming Hall, Assembly Hall, Martial Training Grounds, and even the gathering hubs for members of the Ten Thousand Realms, as well as the inter-realm passageways.

These buildings were not clustered tightly together but interwoven with breathtaking Xuanhuang scenic wonders, where mountains and rivers overlapped in picturesque beauty.

Outside the headquarters complex, a "Miniature Xuanhuang Realm" had been artificially constructed, closely resembling the original Xuanhuang Realm.

Using the Heavenly Scene Treasure Gourd of Shang Tianci, which had collected iconic landscapes from various regions, they had faithfully recreated the Xuanhuang Realm within the Spiritwood Realm.

With a single glance, Li Fan could recognize the Luoyan Lake of Luoyan Prefecture, the Nine Mountains of Nine Mountains Prefecture, and even the Congyun Sea, which he was deeply familiar with.

In Ou Daozi’s design, the headquarters' terrain had been elevated, while the surrounding land was lowered.

From a distance, it appeared as though the Federation of All Worlds was towering above and suppressing the Xuanhuang Realm itself.

"Excellent! Excellent!"

It was indeed the work of a master architect, and the more Li Fan observed, the more delighted he became.

"It was worth all the effort I put into bringing Ou Daozi here... even at the cost of a True Temptation Fruit..."

"Absolutely worth it!"

If he had undertaken this construction himself, it would never have turned out this magnificent.

"Not bad. I'm very satisfied," Li Fan nodded.

Shang Tianci's face lit up with joy, while Ou Daozi looked visibly proud.

"Senior, when do you think we should hold the foundation-laying ceremony?" Shang Tianci asked eagerly.

Li Fan pondered for a moment before replying, "No rush. Wait for my signal."

With that, he transformed into a streak of rainbow light, soaring into the sky of the Spiritwood Realm.

Looking down at the newly completed Spiritwood Realm, which now emanated an ethereal, misty aura, Li Fan settled his mind and attuned himself to the formation materials previously transported across various locations.

"It is time to begin the initial formation refinement."

"Refining an entire small world into a treasure is not something that can be accomplished overnight."

"Especially now that, nourished by vast amounts of heavenly materials and earthly treasures, this Spiritwood Realm appears to be undergoing yet another metamorphosis..."

"But as long as I engrave the formation onto the world's very foundation, no matter how it evolves in the future, it will never escape my control."

Li Fan contemplated.

"This is both the formation refinement process and the defensive formation for the Federation."

"Rather than constantly maintaining it in the future, it is better to perfect it in one go."

After careful thought, Li Fan finally made his decision—

To pursue absolute perfection in this place.

A faint glow flickered in Li Fan’s mind. Moments later, the Final Dissociation Disc, radiating a soft white light, appeared in his hands.

It hadn’t been long since Li Fan last cut a fragment from it.

The Final Dissociation Disc still seemed to have not fully recovered its vitality.

“Back then, the nine discs fought for supremacy before ultimately merging into one.”

“In other words, at most, this Final Dissociation Disc can be divided into nine fragments.”

“Its ability to derive and break formations won’t be affected, but its power level will be fixed at the moment of division.”

“However, moving forward, its natural evolution and computational speed will slow significantly.”

“But that’s not a problem—so long as I periodically synchronize the computational results of the main Dissociation Disc, it will be fine.”

Thoughts flashed through Li Fan’s mind. Then, his fingers, like an iron sword, struck down fiercely on the Dissociation Disc.

The Final Dissociation Disc trembled slightly as a thin fragment was sliced off.

After storing away the increasingly weakened main disc, Li Fan held the fragmented Dissociation Disc in his palm.

At the same time, countless blood threads extended from his body, rapidly spreading throughout the Spiritwood Realm.

This eerie scene instantly drew the attention of all living beings within the Spiritwood Realm.

The entire Treefolk Race dared not look directly and immediately lowered their heads.

Only cultivators like Tianyang and Shang Tianci curiously observed Li Fan.

The countless blood threads resembled paintbrushes, using the pre-prepared formation materials as ink, engraving a massive formation across the Spiritwood Realm’s land.

Ordinarily, for a grand formation covering an entire world, even a skilled Nascent Soul Formation Master would need years to barely complete it.

However, with the powerful computational support of the Dao-Deviation Stone in his mind, Li Fan was working on multiple points simultaneously—single-handedly accomplishing the workload of hundreds of formation masters.

At a speed visible to the naked eye, an enormous formation was gradually taking shape across the Spiritwood Realm.

“You can set up a formation like this?”

Even cultivators who had no understanding of formations were left speechless, staring in awe at the unfolding spectacle.

The formation Li Fan was engraving onto the Spiritwood Realm was entirely new—something never before seen in the Xuanhuang Realm and created entirely by him.

Its core was inspired by top-tier grand formations like Ten Thousand Miles of Rivers and Mountains, Heavenly Origin Transformation, and Tianxuan Spirit-Locking.

Initially, Li Fan had considered incorporating key aspects of Reversal Life and Death into it.

However, the moment this thought crossed his mind, an inexplicable sense of danger surged in his heart, prompting him to decisively abandon the idea.

Within just seven days, the core foundation of the formation was complete.

Li Fan tossed the Dissociation Disc Fragment into the air.

With a burst of intense light, the fragment vanished into thin air, merging into the heart of the grand formation.

“With the Final Dissociation Disc as the formation’s core, it can function like Tianxuan Spirit-Locking, allowing complete surveillance and control over the Spiritwood Realm.”

“More importantly, through the principle of infinite law, it can endlessly reinforce the protective formation.”

“Until it becomes utterly impregnable.”

Li Fan’s eyes gleamed with excitement.

As soon as the Dissociation Disc merged with the formation, the formation’s completion speed skyrocketed a thousandfold.

If the previous process had been like a child drawing by hand, now it was akin to a printing machine at full efficiency.

Before the onlookers could react, the Spiritwood Realm’s land roared and trembled.

Blinding light erupted from the ground, shooting straight into the sky.

Under this dazzling brilliance, all living beings in the small world were forced to close their eyes.

When they finally reopened them, all anomalies had vanished without a trace.

However, at this moment, the Spiritwood Realm was no longer the same.

Weaker cultivators didn’t notice much of a change.

But Tianyang, a Dao Integration Realm cultivator, instinctively scanned his surroundings and the sky above with confusion.

It felt as though countless invisible eyes were staring at him intently, making him deeply uncomfortable.

Before he could dwell on the eerie sensation, Li Fan’s loud laughter drew his attention.

Li Fan retracted the countless blood threads from his body and descended before the 99-zhang-high gate tower of the Federation of All Worlds.

With his hand as the brush, he carved the four large characters “Federation of All Worlds” in a bold, flowing script beneath the black jade plaque!

His strokes were powerful and fluid, completing the inscription in one breath.

At the moment he finished, the Spiritwood Realm responded with a faint yet continuous tremor.

Li Fan carefully examined his own calligraphy, his face brimming with satisfaction.

For some unknown reason, the words “Federation of All Worlds” also appeared as a projection in the sky above the Spiritwood Realm.

Under the leadership of the matriarch, the treefolks knelt and kowtowed in reverence.

All the cultivators also descended to the ground, looking up at the sky in awe.

With this final stroke, the headquarters of the Federation of All Worlds was officially completed.

Most of the main structure required no further modifications—only minor refinements remained.

“It’s certainly magnificent, but this enormous headquarters feels far too empty.”

“If outsiders come and see it so deserted, they might have some doubts.”

Rubbing his chin, Li Fan quickly came up with an idea.

With a light snap of his fingers, figures began appearing throughout the headquarters one after another!

They bustled about as if engaged in important tasks.

Some even conversed with each other, no different from real people.

The previously desolate Federation of All Worlds headquarters now exuded vitality.

“Mm, this looks much better.”

“Though it’s a bit of self-deception, that’s fine. Soon enough, this place will truly come to life.”

Li Fan smiled in satisfaction.

“Senior…”

Just as Li Fan was lost in his imagination, Shang Tianci approached nervously.

At first, Li Fan thought he wanted permission to seek out Lin Ling.

However, it turned out to be about a new recruit for the Federation of All Worlds.

“Senior, after much persuasion, Yan Fangzhou has agreed to join our alliance.”

“But… he says he wants to assess our strength first.”

Worried about angering Li Fan, Shang Tianci spoke cautiously.

“Yan Fangzhou?” A flicker of recognition crossed Li Fan’s face.

He vaguely remembered the name—it belonged to a member of Shanhe Pavilion, the elite youth organization of the Xuanhuang Realm, whom Shang Tianci had mentioned before.

Despite his young age, Yan Fangzhou had already reached the Soul Transformation stage. He had even suggested using the Heavenly Scene Treasure Gourd to manifest a Xuanhuang illusion powerful enough to forcibly rupture another Nascent Soul cultivator’s cave-heaven—a ruthless strategy indeed.

His personality was quite to Li Fan’s liking.

Li Fan’s expression turned warm and welcoming. “No problem, personally bring him here.”

“When the time comes, I’ll make sure to give him a proper welcome.”

Hearing this, Shang Tianci was overjoyed. “Yan Fangzhou is much stronger than me. If he joins our Federation, he will definitely contribute greatly to the cause of the Federation of All Worlds.”

With that, he bid farewell and rushed off to bring Yan Fangzhou.

Watching Shang Tianci’s departing figure, Li Fan shook his head slightly.

Then, with a flicker of movement, he arrived at the circular grand hall at the entrance of the headquarters.

Looking at the vast but empty hall, he pondered for a moment before retrieving the Xuantian Divine Statue from Mr. Bai’s secret chamber.

"Xuantian Sect..."

Li Fan gazed at the faceless divine statue before him, his expression shifting unpredictably.

No matter what method he used to examine it, the results were always the same: the statue appeared utterly ordinary, devoid of any supernatural power.

And yet, despite its seemingly mundane nature, this statue could block spiritual sense detection.

One could only see it with their eyes.

Clearly, the Faceless Xuantian Divine Statue was far from being as simple as it appeared.

Moreover...

In this world, Li Fan had named it the "True Immortal of Salvation and Mortal Compassion" and used it as a conduit to channel the feedback from the Sitting Immortal Technique. Afterward, every member of the Mutual Aid Association who swore an oath before this statue felt an inexplicable sense of restraint deep within their hearts.

Through subtle probing by his clone, Ji Shaoli, it was confirmed that this was not an isolated incident but a widespread phenomenon.

"And it's not just a psychological effect."

"The Xuantian Divine Statue indeed produces a special reaction when faced with a cultivator's oath."

Li Fan narrowed his eyes, his gaze fixed on the statue's hollow face.

He had placed the statue in the great hall at the entrance of the Federation of All Worlds, where countless visitors would come to pay their respects.

Li Fan was almost certain that unforeseen events were bound to occur!

"Has the statue gained self-awareness? Or will it attract the remnants of the Xuantian Sect?"

With these thoughts in mind, Li Fan decisively placed the Xuantian Divine Statue down.

With a loud rumble, the faceless stone statue settled firmly on the ground.

Immediately, countless white threads appeared around it—these were the core formations of the Spiritwood Realm, controlled by the Dissolution Disc Unit-II, rapidly forming a protective formation around the statue.

"With my current strength, I can already crush an ordinary Dao Integration cultivator. And with the grand formation spanning this entire small world..."

"Since Longevity Immortals cannot enter small worlds, within this Spiritwood Realm, I am an invincible existence."

A sharp gleam flashed in Li Fan's eyes.

"If they don't come, so be it."

"But if they dare seek me out, let them witness my methods firsthand!"

Li Fan never doubted the possibility that remnants of the Xuantian Sect still lurked in the Xuanhuang Realm.

After all, he was well aware that in the ruins of Purple Heaven Sect in Linlang Prefecture, a Dharma King of the Xuantian Sect was still in deep slumber.

Surely, there must be other remnants scattered elsewhere.

However, at this moment, Li Fan felt no fear at all.

"Based on the various pieces of information gathered before, aside from the Xuantian King, who has reached the Half-Immortal Realm, the other twelve Dharma Kings of the Xuantian Sect are merely at the level of the Ancient Method of Longevity Immortal Realm."

"..."

Li Fan let out a cold snort in his heart. The next moment, his figure began to blur, reappearing in the space beneath the Spiritwood Tree.

This was the most crucial location in the entire Spiritwood Realm, even more important than the Spiritwood Tree itself.

It was an independent space, capable of being cut off from the Spiritwood Realm at any moment for self-preservation.

Beyond this space, the Spiritwood Grand Formation layered upon itself in countless protective barriers. Within this core area, a fragment of the Final Dissolution Disc was securely placed.

This was also the location that Li Fan had prepared for his closed-door cultivation.

"Ancient Method Longevity... If I make the necessary preparations, I may not be unable to fight against them."

With this thought, Li Fan retrieved a multi-colored light sphere from within his Cave-heaven.

As soon as the light sphere appeared, the Spiritwood Tree seemed to sense an overwhelming lethal threat.

Its branches and leaves swayed violently despite the absence of wind, and its towering form trembled incessantly.

This immediately drew the attention of all the living beings in the Spiritwood Realm.

Li Fan hadn’t expected the Spiritwood Tree's instinctive perception of mortal danger to be so intense.

Frowning slightly, he released multiple layers of seven-colored divine light, forming an additional barrier around himself.

Only then did the Spiritwood Tree's fear subside.

Not long after returning from the Soul Shade Realm, the gray mold within the Three-Eyed Skull had already nearly corroded the storage space it was placed in.

The storage ring was on the verge of shattering at any moment.

The seven-colored divine light that originally enveloped it had also dimmed, fading from vibrant hues to a dull gray-white.

Since it had lost connection with Li Fan, even if he wanted to replenish its energy, he could do nothing.

Having personally witnessed the destructive power of the mysterious gray mold, Li Fan couldn't help but feel a deep sense of unease.

"Technically speaking, this Three-Eyed Skull is still my possession. So, if I start over again, can I choose to preserve it?"

"If I can, then I should be able to uncover its true nature."

With this thought in mind, Li Fan took out a frozen exotic beast he had scavenged from the Empire's Treasury.

Carefully wrapping it in a rainbow-hued glow, he merged it with the seven-colored light sphere before him.

As if sensing the presence of life, the gray mold residing within the Three-Eyed Skull suddenly became restless and agitated.

When Li Fan withdrew the seven-colored divine light from around the frozen exotic beast, he could clearly observe the gray mold writhing as if it were a living entity.

However, the existence of the skull seemed to serve as a kind of restraint for it.

Just as the mold was about to spread beyond the skull, it suddenly shrank back.

Li Fan closely observed the changes in the dark golden patterns on the skull's surface during this process.

But to his disappointment, the mysterious markings did not react at all.

"Could my assumption be wrong? Is this Three-Eyed Skull truly lifeless?"

With extreme caution, Li Fan guided the frozen exotic beast closer to the skull.

The gray mold became even more agitated.

It roamed erratically within the skull, appearing ready to pounce at any moment.

Yet, it also seemed reluctant, hesitating at the last critical moment each time.

Watching this scene, Li Fan fell into deep thought.

Under his mental command, the frozen exotic beast gradually regained its vitality.

A surge of life energy burst forth.

In the end, the gray mold could not resist the temptation—it abruptly lost a portion of itself.

There was no trace of movement.

Instead, as if space itself had been corroded, it formed a yellowish hollow.

In an instant, the exotic beast that had just regained its vitality faded like an old photograph, completely losing its color.

Then, it crumbled into ashes and drifted down.

Amid the floating gray particles, Li Fan sharply noticed a newly formed speck of gray mold!

Having waited for this opportunity, he naturally wouldn't let it slip away.

A streak of radiant light shot out like a flowing ribbon, swiftly encasing and sealing the newly emerged gray mold layer by layer.

The gray mold, which had just gained its freedom, grew enraged upon realizing it was about to be sealed again.

Furious, it lunged at the seven-colored divine light, as if trying to corrode it as well.

But Li Fan, who saw through everything, would not be fooled by such petty tricks.

Without neglecting the main body of the mold, he unleashed another burst of radiant brilliance, sealing away an almost imperceptible speck of gray mold hidden in a distant corner of the space.

"Trying to play mind games with me? How laughable."

Gazing at the three seven-colored light orbs before him, Li Fan thought to himself.

Everything was within Li Fan’s control. He successfully obtained two copies of the gray mold.

The entire process was thrilling but without real danger.

"Fortunately, I have the Seven-Colored Jade Void Glimmering Light, which acts like a container to seal the gray mold. Otherwise, ordinary methods would never be able to contain it."

"If this gray mold were to escape, it could lead to an apocalyptic disaster."

Holding such a terrifying object in his hands, Li Fan showed no fear on his face.

He carefully observed the different reactions of the gray mold within the three orbs of light.

The largest one, after witnessing the fate of the mold that had been lured out, calmed down once again.

It quietly lurked inside the skull, just as Li Fan had seen it before.

The second orb, however, still seemed unwilling to accept being sealed. It continued its frantic attempts to erode the surrounding Seven-Colored Divine Light.

The gray mold in the third orb was the smallest in quantity. Since it had only recently split off, it was the most tranquil. Its color was also lighter than the previous two, lacking the deep gray hue of its predecessors.

"This is…"

Because of this, Li Fan was finally able to see the true form of the gray mold.

It was composed of numerous orderly lines, resembling…

Some kind of character.

Li Fan narrowed his eyes.

A massive symbol from the Immortal Ruins suddenly surfaced in his mind.

The pattern hidden within this gray mold bore a striking resemblance to that symbol!

Though the scale of the two was vastly different, when Li Fan examined and compared them from the perspective of calligraphy,

He still discovered that some of the strokes overlapped almost perfectly!

Since he had not yet seen the complete form of this character, Li Fan could not determine which exact character had manifested as this terrifying, world-ending gray mold.

However, he was certain that this character, like Hunger (饑) and Chaos (亂), was one of the fundamental sources of turmoil across all realms!

"There are differences between the three."

"I have never seen the true form of the Chaos character, only a copy traced by a mysterious figure."

"The complete Hunger character led to the creation of the Immortal Ruins. The endless void, countless cultivation worlds, all were affected."

"But this new character… It has no complete physical form. Instead, it manifests as countless gray mold spores, eroding various worlds."

Characters flashed rapidly through Li Fan’s mind.

He was trying to find one that matched the disaster brought by the gray mold.

But none fit.

"I see. What I have seen so far is only the surface."

"They are just the external effects created by the True Immortal Characters."

"Just like when I saw Xuanhuang World being drawn toward the Immortal Ruins…"

"That attraction was merely an outward phenomenon. The true essence could only be understood by witnessing the True Immortal Character itself—it was the Hunger (饑) character…"

"Then what is the essence of this gray mold?"

Li Fan silently stared at the three orbs of light before him, lost in deep thought.

He didn't know how much time had passed before he finally emerged from his contemplation.

Clearly, just guessing alone—no matter how profound his comprehension—would not allow him to unravel this mystery.

"Perhaps if I cultivate more of the gray mold and observe its reproduction process, I might discover something…"

"However…"

After a moment of hesitation, Li Fan temporarily suppressed this thought.

Even though the Seven-Colored Divine Light had an innate sealing effect on the gray mold, that did not necessarily mean that the Seven-Colored Jade Void Glimmering Light was of a higher level than the mold.

After all, all Li Fan could do was seal the mold.

As time passed, the mold would not disappear or weaken on its own. Meanwhile, the Seven-Colored Divine Light would continuously be eroded.

To put it bluntly, he was merely using the power of a world’s Dao Source to delay the mold’s outbreak.

"It's just like how the Xuanhuang World has managed to persist for nearly ten thousand years despite being drawn toward the Immortal Ruins."

"Even though I have the Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven, ensuring that the Seven-Colored Divine Light will not be completely exhausted anytime soon…"

"For safety’s sake, three sealed orbs are more than enough."

"After all, I have already achieved my goal."

Li Fan once again sealed these light spheres orbs deep within his own cave-heaven, suppressing them heavily.

“With this item in hand, even a Longevity Immortal expert will fall into my calculations.”

As for the consequences of using the Gray Spots…

At worst, the world of Xuanhuang will face annihilation, and the [Truth] will restart!

However, this ultimate trump card—Li Fan would not use it lightly.

Now that his strength had greatly improved and his soul’s shortcomings had been remedied, he could at least exchange a few moves against a Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign.

Moreover, with the protection of the Seven-Colored Divine Light, he should no longer encounter a situation like before, where he couldn’t even activate the [Truth].

He wouldn’t be instantly killed and could use the [Truth] in time.

With these two conditions met, gaining more experience in fighting Longevity Immortal Realm cultivators wouldn’t be a bad thing.

Li Fan had already started planning the most suitable opponent.

“I’ll start with the Ancient Method Longevity Immortal cultivators first.”

Unfortunately, those who had survived until now under the Ancient Method of Longevity were all ultimate old monsters.

For the moment, Li Fan couldn’t find an easy target to crush.

…

While Li Fan was brewing his thoughts in the Spiritwood Realm, outside, the Immortal Ancestor’s Dharma Form, summoned by the combined efforts of thirty-three Chosen Immortals, took action once again!

This time, the location where the Immortal Ancestor’s Dharma Form appeared was shockingly within the Five Elders Association’s territory!

In Yongliang Prefecture, adjacent to Nine Mountains Prefecture!

Unlike the previous overwhelming and unstoppable suppression in Nine Mountains Prefecture, this time, when the Immortal Ancestor’s Dharma Form emerged in the sky and opened its eyes—

The countless beings in Yongliang Prefecture immediately sensed an impending catastrophe.

Yet at this critical moment, the phantom of a Scholar stood before the Dharma Form.

He slightly raised his head, his lips moving as if speaking something.

Gradually, the cultivators of Yongliang Prefecture were astonished to see that the Immortal Ancestor’s Dharma Form in the sky was slowly closing its eyes again!

Boom…

With a slight tremor, the phantom of the Dharma Form dissipated into nothingness.

A world-ending catastrophe was thus averted.

The scholar’s figure also slowly faded away, while countless cultivators knelt toward the heavens, expressing their gratitude.

“It seems that within the domain shrouded by the defiance of natural order by the Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign, attempting to contend against Longevity Realm cultivators is still somewhat difficult.”

“No wonder the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance has been unable to gain any real advantage over the Five Elders Association for so many years.”

“The power of the Heavenly Sovereigns is simply too formidable.”

“Rather than calling it a struggle against cultivators, it’s more like a battle of Daoist techniques between five Longevity Immortal Realm experts.”

“There’s simply no chance of victory.”

Upon receiving the recorded footage from the Five Elders Association, Li Fan thought as much.

However, he then slightly furrowed his brows.

The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance had always acted with careful planning, never engaging in meaningless actions.

They couldn’t possibly be unaware that the Immortal Ancestor’s Dharma Form would be at a disadvantage within the Five Elders Association’s territory.

And yet, they still chose to act.

“Could they be experimenting with something?”

Li Fan’s curiosity was piqued.

In the following period, the Immortal Ancestor's Dharma Form manifestation appeared with remarkable frequency.

Within a month, it had manifested a total of five times.

On one occasion, it even appeared twice within just two days.

Initially, Li Fan had assumed that unleashing such a grand technique would force the Thirty-Three Chosen Immortals to pay a significant price.

However, based on this frequency, it seemed that was not the case.

Each time the Immortal Ancestor's Dharma Form manifestation appeared, it was in different regions governed by the Five Elders Association. After forcing the Heavenly Sovereigns of the Five Elders Association to take action, it would quietly vanish once again.

What was even more terrifying was that, with each fleeting appearance, the manifestation seemed to become increasingly "lifelike."

At first, it merely opened its eyes.

Then, over time, it began to attempt palm strikes.

It was hard to imagine—if it continued practicing enough times, would it eventually become indistinguishable from the true Immortal Ancestor?

"It doesn’t need to reach the level of the Immortal Ancestor. Even if it only attains a tenth of that power, it would be enough to give the Five Elders Association a serious headache."

"No wonder the Five Elders Association is so anxious. They've sent multiple urgent inquiries, hoping I could help investigate the origins of the Thirty-Three Chosen Immortals."

Li Fan sneered, "Unfortunately, I’m truly powerless this time."

Ignoring the Five Elders Association, Li Fan shifted his focus to the new arrivals in the Spiritwood Realm.

At that moment, they were being led on a tour of the Spiritwood Realm by Shang Tianci.

Among them was a young man who appeared even younger than Shang Tianci. His face still bore a hint of youthful inexperience, but from time to time, a faint trace of wickedness flickered across his features.

"I say, Tianci, this small world does have some nice scenery. But calling it the ‘Federation of All Worlds’—isn’t that a bit of an exaggeration?"

The speaker was Yan Fangzhou, whom Shang Tianci had gone to great lengths to bring here.

Yan Fangzhou scoffed, "Is this so-called ‘Federation of All Worlds’ just made up of this small number of people? What a waste of my excitement—I thought I was finally going to accomplish something significant."

"Let alone overthrowing the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance—just dealing with the Martial Hall and the Guardian Hall of Shilin Prefecture would probably be beyond your capabilities."

Shang Tianci’s face flushed red, and he was about to retort.

But before he could, a cold voice suddenly rang out:

"You’re young, but you sure have an arrogant mouth. Why don’t you test it out?"

The voice carried the wrath of heaven and earth, echoing throughout the small world.

Yan Fangzhou's expression changed slightly as he attempted to locate the speaker.

To his surprise, he realized that he had been completely isolated without even noticing it. Shang Tianci was nowhere to be seen.

The entire world seemed to be expanding infinitely, while he himself felt as insignificant as an ant between heaven and earth—an endless expanse stretched before him.

Moreover, his words just now seemed to have provoked this very world.

The skies darkened, and an unimaginable killing intent enveloped him.

"Tricks and illusions!" Yan Fangzhou, being a prodigious talent, was not so easily intimidated.

"Break for me!"

A black flame suddenly emerged behind him.

The moment the black fire appeared, the previously turbulent sky instantly fell into complete stillness.

A destructive aura emanated from the black flame.

The killing intent of the world froze, and then—everything fell into complete silence.

Boom!

The surrounding scene shattered like fractured glass, exploding layer by layer.

A hint of smugness appeared on Yan Fangzhou’s face.

But that arrogance disappeared almost instantly.

Because the very next moment, what lay before him was still the same vast world, brimming with boundless killing intent!

It was as if all he had shattered just now was a mere illusion!

"No matter how many layers there are, I’ll break through them all!"

Yan Fangzhou snorted coldly, and the black flames shot up like a meteor streaking against the heavens.

Wherever it passed, space itself seemed to freeze, falling into a state of absolute stillness—

Only to be violently torn apart by the black trajectory.

The surrounding scenery shifted once again, reverting back to its original form.

The black flame’s momentum did not wane, rampaging forward relentlessly.

In the blink of an eye, countless layers of the world were shattered.

Yet…

No matter how many layers shattered, the scene surrounding and enclosing him remained unchanged.

It was like an endless labyrinth—no matter how he ignored its walls and charged straight through, he could never see the exit. As a result, he was forever trapped within this maze.

No one knew how much time had passed. The confidence on Yan Fangzhou’s face gradually faded, replaced first by disbelief and then by sheer panic.

When he finally confirmed that he could not break through the seal of this time-space confinement, his expression shifted drastically.

"If you have the guts, come out and fight me openly!"

"Do you think these petty tricks can truly subdue me?"

Yan Fangzhou shouted at the heavens, addressing the force that had trapped him.

Unfortunately, much to his disappointment, the other party seemed not to have heard him at all.

There was no response.

A cold glint flashed in Yan Fangzhou’s eyes as he took out a golden talisman, crackling with streaks of lightning.

He tossed it into the air.

But to his astonishment, the talisman—his once-reliable Void-Shattering Talisman—failed to take effect.

Not only did it fail to tear open space and create an escape route, but it also seemed lost, spinning aimlessly in midair.

Next, Yan Fangzhou desperately tried every life-saving technique he had.

None of them worked!

At this moment, he was truly panicked.

"I admit defeat!"

"I shouldn't have spoken so arrogantly! The Federation of All Worlds truly lives up to its reputation!"

Suppressing the malice in his eyes, Yan Fangzhou shouted toward the sky.

"Senior, please allow me to join the Federation!"

The sky remained silent.

There was still no response.

Yan Fangzhou froze in shock, thinking the other party hadn't heard him. He repeated his plea several times.

The result remained the same.

Now, he was utterly bewildered.

...

Spiritwood Realm.

Shang Tianci looked at Yan Fangzhou, who had suddenly frozen in place, and found it strange.

He called out a few times, but Yan Fangzhou seemed unable to hear him at all.

Finally, he realized something was wrong.

Around Yan Fangzhou, an invisible barrier had formed, sealing him inside.

Not only could outsiders not touch him, but it also seemed like he was completely cut off from the outside world.

"Senior..." Shang Tianci weakly addressed the newly appeared Li Fan.

"The kid has potential, but he needs some polishing. Let him stew for a year or so." Li Fan said casually.

In his hand, a black flame flickered, constantly shifting and struggling as if trying to break free.

But it was held firmly, unable to escape his grasp.

Shang Tianci dared not argue and could only bow his head in agreement.

Li Fan looked at Yan Fangzhou, whom he had trapped using the Infinite Law, and stroked his chin in thought.

With a flick of his mind, Yan Fangzhou was instantly transported outside the Black Jade Gate of the Federation.

Like a figurine, he was carefully placed in a suitable pose.

"Once he breaks down, we’ll let him out."

"Makes it easier to discipline him."

Li Fan mused.

A so-called genius is merely a strong individual who has yet to reach maturity.

As for the current Li Fan, he could easily crush them.

"This Black Flame is quite interesting."

"However, compared to Crimson Flame, the transformation of Xuanhuang appears to be inherently more formidable."

With a layer of Seven-Colored Jade Void Glimmering Light covering his hand, invisible to others, Li Fan effortlessly suppressed the black flames released by Yan Fangzhou and examined them closely.

"This aura seems remarkably similar to what was left after Crimson Flame burned away the Congyun Sea. Both belong to the category of great annihilation..."

Li Fan carefully contemplated.

In the previous life, within the cave-heaven created by Mr. Bai, he had never encountered such a phenomenon as [Heaven and Earth Undergoing Change]. It was indeed quite rare.

Before long, he began to grasp some insights.

"Multiple worlds fused into one."

"Although Xuanhuang remains the primary world, it has absorbed so many external elements that even the Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao has inevitably undergone changes."

Li Fan slowly clenched his fingers. His hand, imbued with a powerful seven-colored divine radiance, started to blur slightly.

Despite its endless struggle, the black flame was extinguished inch by inch under his grasp.

"If it were the Spirit of Heaven and Earth, I might have been tempted."

"Unfortunately, it is merely the transformation of Heaven and Earth."

Li Fan shook his head slightly and temporarily put aside Yan Fangzhou.

His thoughts drifted toward the upcoming Crimson Flame Burning the Sea.

"I already know the locations of many Spirit of Heaven and Earth, so there’s no need to be fixated on Crimson Flame."

"On one hand, Crimson Flame is too weak. On the other hand..."

"Once Crimson Flame dies, Ink Death will descend. Even if I escape from Ink Death, I will likely draw the attention of the hidden powerhouses in the Xuanhuang Realm."

"That would be far too conspicuous."

"For now, it's best to remain dormant."

After a brief moment of contemplation, Li Fan made up his mind.

"The time is almost right to arrange for the members of the Congyun Sea Mutual Aid Association to retreat."

"After all, they are hard-earned seedlings, the future core strength of the Federation of All Worlds. I can't let them die in vain."

At present, the strongest member of the Congyun Sea Mutual Aid Association was Pei Tuo, who had reached the early Nascent Soul stage.

Although he did not retake the Immortal Alliance entrance examination, his breakthrough in cultivation had earned him favor from the higher-ups.

Now, he had been promoted to the position of Martial Guard within the Congyun Sea Martial Hall, commanding three martial training squads—an authoritative role.

"Hmm, I need to find a way to transfer him inland."

"But at his level, a lateral transfer would be difficult."

"Perhaps I can help him earn some merit..."

In an instant, the faces of various Five Elders Association spies flashed through Li Fan’s mind.

Since he had already decided, his clone, Ji Shaoli, immediately began making arrangements.

Li Fan also recalled what Yan Fangzhou had just said.

"This little world is indeed scenic. But to call it the [Federation of All Worlds]—doesn't that seem a bit undeserving of the name?"

...

"Even a young brat isn't convinced. It seems like I need to refine it further."

As he pondered, his divine sense swept across the surroundings. Although the Spiritwood Realm had wondrous Xuanhuang scenery, it still felt somewhat desolate.

With an idea forming, his figure flickered, and he arrived at a mountain peak.

Following the image in his memory, he focused his mind.

Before long, an ancient and solemn stone tower emerged from the earth.

Li Fan then retrieved a spire from his storage ring.

He placed it atop the stone tower.

Once the spire was set in place, the newly unearthed tower instantly radiated a mysterious and profound aura.

Li Fan nodded in satisfaction.

Looking around the stone tower, he saw buildings rising one after another amid rumbling noises.

"Once the treefolks finish decorating, it will be just about perfect."

Arriving outside the architectural complex, Li Fan picked up a brush and wrote three large characters on a blank boulder: "Heavenly Mechanism Sect".

"A perfect one-to-one replica, combined with the Heavenly Mechanism Sect’s supreme treasure, the Heaven and Earth Divination Dice—who would dare say my Heavenly Mechanism Sect is fake?"

Li Fan smiled slightly.

Next, he repeated the process.

Recalling the scenery of the Heavenly Sword Sect, he carefully replicated it.

Looking at the newly built mountain gate, still empty and desolate, Li Fan couldn’t help but think of the Heavenly Wonder [Sword], which had yet to emerge and remained buried within the Heavenly Sword Sect’s Sword Tomb.

"It’s an exceptional treasure. However, since it was left behind by Mr. Bai, it might also be part of his hidden schemes."

"I must remain cautious."

"Besides, all Heavenly Wonders have their own spiritual will. Even if I try to claim it, it may not submit to me."

"Perhaps I can turn this into a favor instead."

Thinking this, Li Fan casually broke off a wooden branch.

He recalled his own comprehension of swordsmanship in his mind.

He also referenced Mr. Bai’s red string insight from his past life, along with the enlightenment he had gained regarding the [Sword] within the Heavenly Sword Sect.

Gradually, the wooden branch in his hand underwent a profound transformation.

Countless sword phantoms emerged around it.

Then, in an instant, they all merged into the branch.

The color deepened, the texture hardened.

Slowly, the branch’s original characteristics faded away.

It was becoming more and more like a true [Sword].

Unfortunately, after initially absorbing a vast number of sword phantoms, the influx of sword intent sharply decreased.

That was because Li Fan’s own comprehension had already been exhausted.

He could not sustain the transformation of this ordinary object into a Heavenly Wonder.

A moment later, Li Fan reached his limit.

Looking at the half-formed sword-branch in his hand, he shook his head slightly.

"At best, this can only be considered a ‘Human Wonder.’"

With a light grip, the sword-branch crumbled into dust.

Yet he did not feel any frustration. Unlike formations, where he devoted long periods to cultivation, his swordsmanship was merely something he had picked up along the way.

Being able to create even a Human Wonder from nothing was already an incredible feat.

"Even if I don’t take it for myself, I might as well visit the ruins of the Heavenly Sword Sect."

"While I’m at it, I can check out the former sites of the Medicine King Sect, the Purple Heaven Sect, and other lost sects."

Li Fan planned to recreate these cultivation sects—long erased by the river of history—within the Spiritwood Realm.

Of course, he wouldn’t need to make them perfect. As long as they were convincing enough to deceive others, that would suffice.

"I have the relics of the Heavenly Mechanism Sect."

"In the future, when the True Cauldron of the Medicine King returns, I will even have the original members of the Medicine King Sect."

"Blurring truth with falsehood—who would be able to tell the difference?"

Feeling a bit pleased with himself, Li Fan exited the Spiritwood Realm and headed straight for the ruins of the Heavenly Sword Sect.

The known ruins of the Heavenly Sword Sect were located in Tianguang Prefecture.

However, in his past life, Li Fan had learned from Shuo Feng that the Sword Tomb—where the [Sword] was truly located—was not in Tianguang Prefecture.

Instead, it was in Tianyou Prefecture, separated by a single region.

The area had been split in two by the White Mist Barrier, keeping the Sword Tomb hidden from the world.

Thus, no one had ever discovered it.

Traveling discreetly, avoiding the attention of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance cultivators along the way, Li Fan soon arrived at the ruins of the Tianyou Prefecture Sword Tomb.

Looking at the unremarkable site before him, which resembled nothing more than a neglected mass grave, he couldn’t help but sigh:

"Who would have thought that the mighty Heavenly Sword Sect would one day fall into such a state?"

On the desolate and withered land, countless small mounds rose like tumors.

Even from a great distance, the stench of decay and rot could be clearly smelled.

Some curious individuals had dug open a few of these mounds.

Inside, apart from black, rotting pus, there was nothing else.

It was said that the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance had once dispatched specialists to investigate this place.

After finding nothing conclusive, they decided to completely clear out this festering land, which seemed like an abscess on the earth.

Yet, to their shock, within less than half a year, the endless mounds resurfaced once more.

Thus, the alliance sent people again to deal with the phenomenon.

This process repeated three times, yet these festering mounds remained stubbornly persistent.

However, Li Fan knew that the reason behind this abnormality was not due to some supernatural force.

Rather, it was the residual will attached to countless swords, which had twisted and decayed over thousands of years, causing the strange phenomenon.

"You can’t really blame the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance for their lackluster response."

"Even an ordinary Dao Integration cultivator would struggle to notice anything unusual here if they lacked deep comprehension of the Way of the Sword."

With this thought in mind, Li Fan activated his Reverse Five Elements Creation-Destruction Sword technique.

In his vision, the scene ahead suddenly changed.

Countless dark shadows drifted out from the swollen mounds.

Like specters, their eyes glowed with a crimson hue as they locked onto Li Fan with unwavering focus.

From all directions, eerie and unintelligible murmurs arose—sounding both like agonized screams and resentful curses.

The whispers seemed to penetrate directly into his mind, bypassing even his eardrums.

Even if he blocked his hearing or shielded his divine sense, he could not stop the invasion.

Li Fan furrowed his brows slightly, understanding that this was a necessary step to enter the Sword Tomb of the Heavenly Sword Sect.

He could only maintain his composure and endure the assault of these bizarre and piercing voices.

The crimson-eyed shadows, seeing that Li Fan remained unmoved, were enraged.

They transformed into streaks of darkness and lunged at him.

As they drew closer, their appearances became clearer.

Some resembled freshly dead corpses, their flesh rotting, covered in festering wounds, and writhing with maggots.

Others appeared as if they were being burned alive, their bodies melting into grotesque, dripping forms.

Some had been sliced into countless pieces, their fragmented flesh barely holding together.

…

Yet, the most horrifying part—every single one of them bore Li Fan’s appearance!

At the same time, countless visions of his own deaths flooded Li Fan’s mind!

These were not mere hallucinations but an illusion so vivid that it felt as real as life itself—as if he had consumed a Intent Horse and was experiencing ultimate reality.

Even his body began to feel the corresponding pain of each gruesome demise.

"Such petty tricks."

"Not only do I have the Immortal Heart Mantra protecting me, making me immune to all techniques, but even if I were to fall for this trap, at my level of New Method Nascent Soul Realm, I can endlessly regenerate my physical body..."

"A decent technique—but sadly, outdated."

With this thought, Li Fan let the shadows consume him.

A moment later, the Five Elements Cave-Heaven within him trembled slightly, and in the blink of an eye, his body was restored anew.

More shadows surged from the mounds, shrieking as they charged at him again.

Thus, Li Fan continuously reformed his body after being devoured, enduring the assault until every shadow from the nearly ten thousand graves had stained his existence.

Each time a shadow consumed him, Li Fan felt his body subtly "sink"—not into the ground, but into another dimension.

These shadows were like drowning ghosts, attempting to drag him into their world.

When he was finally completely submerged, his vision shifted—he had truly entered the Sword Tomb.

It was just as Shuo Feng had described.

Countless broken swords stood slanted across the land.

Each one leaned slightly toward the center, as if bowing in reverence to their king.

Yet, despite Li Fan’s presence as an outsider, none of them reacted to him in the slightest.

Carefully observing these seemingly decayed and broken swords, Li Fan realized that rather than them deteriorating…

It was more accurate to say…

Under the baptism of the Central Heaven’s extraordinary [Sword], they were becoming purer and purer.

No longer constrained by physical form, they were, like the [Sword], gradually transforming into concepts, into pure energy.

"The dark shadows above are the remnants of killing intent, obsessions, and the lingering desires of those slaughtered by these countless swords."

"In this world of pure swords, they are slowly being driven out, finding no place to exist."

Li Fan circulated the Reverse Five Elements Creation-Destruction Sword, disguising himself as a sword, remaining completely still as he observed his surroundings.

"If there are no external disturbances, under the imperceptible influence of the [Sword], the thousands of swords in this sword graveyard might truly shed their physical forms and become conceptual existences."

A flicker of astonishment flashed in Li Fan’s eyes.

"What is this, ‘one person attains the Dao, and even their chickens and dogs ascend to the heavens’?"

"As expected of an existence enlightened by Mr. Bai."

Thinking this, Li Fan finally took his first step forward.

In the next instant, his expression shifted slightly.

Because at that very moment, the thousands of swords around him simultaneously released their sword intent—

They seemed displeased with his "cutting in line."

Through his perception, these outwardly decayed swords finally revealed their true, dazzling forms.

Some had crimson blades, blazing like scarlet flames.

Some radiated a misty sword aura, as ethereal as the azure sky.

Some were pitch black, exuding an overwhelming stench of blood.

Some gleamed with golden light, entwined with thunder, emanating a divine and awe-inspiring majesty…

Even though these were merely the outermost swords of the graveyard, after thousands of years of refinement by the true intent of the [Sword], they had long surpassed the realm of mere mortal weapons.

Each of them could be considered a supreme Treasure of Humanity!

Li Fan let out a cold snort, unleashing his Reverse Five Elements Creation-Destruction Sword Intent in an explosive burst.

Despite being struck by countless sword intents, he took another step forward.

This time, he provoked even more swords.

In an instant, his body was covered in countless sword wounds, fresh blood streaming down.

Even his very soul seemed to be slashed by the sword auras, faintly throbbing in pain.

"I cannot fight back—I can only endure silently."

"Otherwise, I will be regarded as an enemy by all the swords in this graveyard, and they will swarm to attack me."

"Even that wooden sword at the center might take action."

Realizing this, Li Fan temporarily withdrew from his Soul-Ignition State.

He fully activated the Limitless Fullness and Emptiness Technique, striding forward with large steps.

For a moment, he truly understood what it meant to be pierced by ten thousand swords.

His body was already riddled with wounds. Even with the power of the Five Elements Cave-Heaven constantly regenerating him, he could barely maintain his human form.

Though his soul, after suffering heavy damage, rapidly healed, the excruciating pain was unavoidable.

"This is why Shuo Feng had it so easy."

"He didn’t even have to worry about these ten thousand swords attacking him. With the golden armor bestowed by his mother, he simply strolled into the very heart of the graveyard as if it were a leisurely walk."

In the midst of his suffering, Li Fan recalled Shuo Feng’s description and couldn’t help but sigh.

Despite his complaints, in truth, the combined force of the swords in this graveyard still failed to stop him in the slightest.

In no more than half a day, Li Fan had already arrived steadily at the very center of the Sword Tomb.

A seemingly ordinary wooden sword was planted upright in the ground.

It was no different from the one Li Fan had once seen in the Heavenly Sword Sect of the Fallen Immortal Realm.

As if the passage of time held no sway over it—

even after a thousand years, it remained unchanged.

Gazing upon this sight, Li Fan even began to doubt himself, feeling as though the wooden sword he had seen in the Fallen Immortal Realm had been this very one.

“I wonder what method that brat Shuo Feng used to take this wooden sword away…”

By now, Li Fan had also discerned some clues.

Here, amidst tens of thousands of broken swords, an array faintly took form with the [Sword] as its core.

To forcefully claim this heaven-bestowed treasure was not only to endure the resistance of the [Sword] itself—one would also have to face the combined assault of every sword present here.

“No… the proper way is to let it willingly follow me.”

“Unfortunately…”

When Li Fan tried to convey his intent, the wooden sword paid him no heed whatsoever.

Fortunately, he had never truly planned to seize it.

He retrieved a Dao Comprehension Pill, swallowed it, then sat cross-legged upon the ground, attuning himself to the sword intent emanating from the wooden sword.

At this moment, Li Fan was seated closest to the wooden sword, among all the broken swords in the Sword Tomb.

Ignoring the faint hostility radiating from the other blades, he simply immersed himself in deep comprehension.

With the help of the Dao Comprehension Pill, coupled with his already decent talent, and the insights he had previously gained in the Fallen Immortal Realm—in an instant, countless images flooded into his mind.

“Hm?”

“It seems that even this wooden sword itself has undergone some kind of transformation over the course of thousands of years…”

“Compared to what I saw in the Fallen Immortal Realm, it has become even more…”

Li Fan thought for a long while but could not find the proper words.

Perfect? But the sword that Mr. Bai had once casually condensed was already the embodiment of the Xuanhuang World’s sword dao—flawless beyond flaw.

Stronger? The difference was not in strength, but in nature. The wooden sword of a thousand years past was by no means weaker than the one before him now.

“Rather, it should be said that as the Heavenly Dao of the Xuanhuang World shifted, this heaven-bestowed treasure changed along with it.”

“In short, the sword before me is now the one more capable of unleashing greater power in the present Xuanhuang World.”

Li Fan’s heart stirred with realization.

While he was in the Sword Tomb, diligently comprehending the true essence of the Xuanhuang Sword Dao—seeking to replicate Mr. Bai’s feat of conjuring a heaven-bestowed treasure with bare hands.

Elsewhere, in the Congyun Sea, on Haixuan Island—a cultivator by the name of Yan Longjiang quietly sought out the clone, Ji Shaoli.

Seeing Yan’s hesitant demeanor, Ji Shaoli smiled.

“Fellow Daoist Yan, speak freely. You are one of the founding elders of our Congyun Sea Mutual Aid Association. Our current success owes much to your tireless efforts in spreading its name.”

Yan Longjiang finally lowered his voice nervously:

“When the six of us first joined the Association, Fellow Daoist Ji once promised to provide each of us with a cave-heaven necessary for advancing to the Nascent Soul True Lord stage…”

“I wonder if that promise still stands…”

He swallowed hard, his face full of unease.

It was hard to blame him. The Mutual Aid Association of today was no longer what it once was. In just a few short years, it had grown deep-rooted and far-reaching, with many of its members already serving in positions within the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, their futures boundless.

As for Ji Shaoli himself, he had grown ever more unfathomable. Even Dao Integration Immortal Sages treated him with utmost respect.

If he refused, Yan Longjiang dared not show the slightest hint of dissatisfaction.

But to Yan’s surprise, Ji Shaoli turned out to be far more approachable than he had imagined.

“Haha, Fellow Daoist Yan, what are you saying? When I, Ji, speak, my word is law. Just a mere Cave-Heaven—giving it as a reward to one who has rendered merit to our association, why would I be reluctant?” Ji Shaoli patted Yan Longjiang’s shoulder to reassure him.

He then asked, “Fellow Daoist Yan, what path of cultivation do you practice? What type of Cave-Heaven would you prefer?”

In truth, Ji Shaoli had already long since investigated the other’s circumstances, but he still asked this question.

Hearing this, Yan Longjiang was overjoyed and hurriedly replied: “I cultivate the Seven Fiends Wind-Controlling True Art. As for the Cave-Heaven… I dare not be greedy, just something a little more spacious will suffice.”

Yan Longjiang spoke softly.

Ji Shaoli gave a slight nod, and after a brief pause, an appropriate target appeared in his mind.

Without further words, he brought Yan Longjiang quietly toward their destination.

At Juchao Isle, Ji Shaoli stood guard as his protector.

In just seven days, Yan Longjiang successfully devoured the Fiery Wind Cave-Heaven.

Suppressing the lingering fluctuations of his aura, Yan Longjiang respectfully bowed to Ji Shaoli.

“Many thanks, Fellow Daoist, for fulfilling this. This grace is beyond repayment. In the future, I will serve the Mutual Aid Association unto death!”

Ji Shaoli waved his hand dismissively. “There are too many eyes here. Let’s return and speak further.”

Not long after the two departed, A middle-aged cultivator in a green robe strolled leisurely to the vicinity of the Fiery Wind Cave-Heaven.

He looked around carefully, making sure no one else was present.

Forming hand seals, he tried to enter the Cave-Heaven.

But—nothing happened.

His expression changed drastically. Refusing to believe it, he tried again.

Still no response.

This time, he panicked completely.

He pulled out a talisman to send a message.

Before long, a burly cultivator in black robes arrived at the scene.

The black-robed cultivator concealed his appearance, but the aura he exuded was already of the Soul Transformation realm.

After a round of inspection, his face turned extremely unsightly.

“This Fiery Wind Cave-Heaven… has been stolen!”

The green-robed cultivator was utterly shocked: “What? The Cave-Heaven is gone?”

He stared blankly ahead. “Who would dare such a thing!”

Murderous intent flashed in the eyes of the black-robed cultivator, impossible to suppress.

“Heh… normally, only our Xiang Clan seizes things from others. And now? Someone dares to bully us instead!”

“Investigate! Pursue this to the very end! I want to see who is so arrogant!”

The Xiang Clan reacted swiftly.

In less than half a cup of tea’s time, five or six more cultivators rushed to the scene.

After casting several spells, they revealed two blurry silhouettes.

“Unfortunately, the other party is no amateur. They used secret arts to conceal themselves. This is the best restoration we can manage.”

The white-haired man leading the investigation spoke with some regret.

“Can you trace their path?”

“Not too much time has passed. It should be possible.” The white-haired man nodded.

He took out a golden square compass and tossed it into the air.

Two faint silver trails appeared before everyone’s eyes.

“Judging from the direction, they are heading toward Juchao Heaven City.”

“Hmph, could it actually be someone from within the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance?” The Xiang Clan’s black-robed cultivator ground his teeth in a cold sneer.

“Most likely cultivators from another prefecture, not from our Juchao region. What I don’t understand is, how did information about the Fiery Wind Cave-Heaven leak out?” the white-haired man said, puzzled.

“Speaking of which, have you heard of something recently?”

“Oh?”

“Not long ago, the Immortal-mortal Miasma suddenly erupted. After it subsided, the Immortal Alliance sent people to investigate beneath Qiling Prefecture. They discovered traces of a Spirit of Heaven and Earth once active there, but it had suddenly vanished.” The white-haired man spoke via voice transmission.

“What do you mean?” The black-robed cultivator narrowed his eyes.

“That vanished Spirit of Heaven and Earth had been repairing the underground void beneath Qiling Province. Its disappearance directly caused the eruption of the Immortal-Mortal Miasma.”

"The Essence of Heaven and Earth, having received its heavenly mandate, will never disappear suddenly unless slain, before completing its mission," the white-haired man said quietly.

The black-robed cultivator was momentarily stunned, unsure why his companion would bring up this matter.

After a brief pause, he furrowed his brow and asked hesitantly, "Brother Zhan, do you mean that these two incidents were orchestrated by the same organization?"

"Impossible, right?" The black-robed cultivator frowned. "To be able to slay the Spirit of Heaven and Earth without attracting the attention of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance… such strength…"

The white-haired man surnamed Zhan chuckled faintly. "Brother Xiang, don’t you find it strange? This Fiery Wind Cave-Heaven, your Xiang clan only discovered it recently. How could these outsiders have known about it?"

"Honestly, a single Nascent Soul-level Cave-Heaven isn’t that significant. The unsettling part is the power it reflects behind the scenes," the black-robed cultivator said.

"It is said that the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance takes this matter extremely seriously, to the point that even Immortal Ancestor has intervened," the white-haired man said solemnly.

The black-robed cultivator was taken aback. "This… to such an extent?"

Earlier, he had been somewhat arrogant, but upon hearing the words Immortal Ancestor, he grew noticeably nervous.

"You know that my father serves in the Heavenly Oversight Division," the white-haired man said, letting the point hang.

The black-robed cultivator nodded, his mind already calculating the implications.

The cultivator named Zhan looked at his friend, aware that there were still things left unsaid.

The so-called Heavenly Oversight Division is a mysterious organization within the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, dedicated to observing and monitoring the Spirit of Heaven and Earth and traces of the Dao’s principles.

It is not listed among the official organizational roster, and only a select few cultivators even know it exists.

The Spirit of Heaven and Earth are directly tied to the power of those who have attained Dao Integration. Each one is critically important, so it is reasonable for the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance to regulate them.

Their goal is to monitor as many Spirit of Heaven and Earth as possible. Over the years, the efficiency of registration has improved. Although it is not yet complete, nearly one-third of all known Spirits in the world are now recorded in the Heavenly Oversight Division’s archives.

This is one of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance’s most valuable assets.

However, this is only a secondary task for the division.

Its primary duty is to constantly observe traces of the Principles of Heaven and Earth.

Even though the Principles of Heaven and Earth may remain unchanged for thousands of years, the division must maintain strict vigilance at all times.

The Principles of Heaven and Earth form a vast, interwoven web, composing the Heavenly Dao of the Xuanhuang Realm.

Longevity Immortals who reverse the Principles of Heaven and Earth inevitably tug on the threads of this web, sending out fluctuations.

The greater the degree of reversal, the stronger the fluctuations.

By observing these fluctuations, the division can detect whether a cultivator is reversing the Principles of Heaven and Earth in pursuit of Immortality.

Once such traces are discovered, the identity of the cultivator must be immediately verified.

If the cultivator is neutral, the matter is simpler.

If, however, they belong to the Five Elders Association, every effort must be made—at any cost to prevent their success in reversing the Principles of Heaven and Earth.

…

These thoughts about the Heavenly Oversight Division flashed through Zhan Fei’s mind.

Although he was about to serve in this organization, he held little enthusiasm for it, even though his father had repeatedly stressed its importance.

After all, once you join the Heavenly Oversight Division, most of your life will be spent sitting in front of monitoring instruments.

One might not even get a single day off in a century.

Such a life…

Unfortunately, the appointment to the Heavenly Oversight Division was not his decision to make.

Zhan Fei glanced at his friend, a twinge of envy crossing his heart.

Being a local tyrant wasn’t so bad, after all.

But Xiang Zengqiang, the black-robed cultivator, had no idea what his friend was thinking.

He pondered and hesitated for a long while before making his decision.

First, he would identify the cultivators who had stolen the Fiery Wind Cave-Heaven, but he would not act rashly.

He would wait and observe the movements of the Heavenly Oversight Division first.

…

Congyun Sea.

Ji Shaoli, who had already returned to Haixuan Island, had no idea that he had already drawn someone’s attention.

However, after finishing the many miscellaneous tasks for the Mutual Aid Association, he received an anonymous message:

"Fellow Daoist Ji, have you had a conflict with the Xiang family from Juchao Prefecture? I see someone there quietly investigating your news."

Ji Shaoli’s expression shifted slightly: “Juchao Prefecture?”

His brow furrowed.

The only connection he had with Juchao Prefecture was probably the recently devoured Fiery Wind Cave-Heaven.

In an instant, he understood the possible reason he might have offended them.

After some searching, Ji Shaoli felt a bit relieved.

The Xiang family was merely a local power in Juchao Prefecture, with only one Dao Integration cultivator stationed at home.

Even if they came after him, Ji Shaoli would remain unafraid.

"Still, I should make some preparations."

His eyes flickered with determination.

Heavenly Sword Sect, Sword Tomb.

Li Fan, who was meditating and studying sword comprehension, suddenly woke up in alarm.

It wasn’t because of the potential dangers his clone might face, but because, inexplicably, he could no longer perceive anything from the Sword.

Li Fan looked around.

He realized it wasn’t just him.

The thousands of legacy swords in the Sword Tomb also seemed to have lost their connection to the Sword.

Slightly bent blades had straightened, appearing utterly bewildered.

Li Fan focused on the wooden sword in front of him: “Is this a change in its own nature? Has it lost its spiritual essence?”

"No, this is temporary."

Soon, Li Fan began to discern the pattern.

He didn’t act rashly but observed the wooden sword carefully, waiting patiently.

Sure enough, after just a single minute, the wooden sword once again regained its heavenly uniqueness, radiating the profundity of the Sword, making all other swords bow in respect.

The question was…

What had happened during that one minute?

Li Fan’s interest was immediately piqued.

While cultivating his sword comprehension, he began to await the next “failure” event.

After several days of continuous observation, Li Fan discovered a clear pattern.

At fixed intervals, the swords would lose their spiritual connection for exactly one minute.

During this time, all the thousands of legacy swords in the Sword Tomb would simultaneously lose their connection to the Sword.

Except for one!

Thanks to the Dao Deviation Stone in his mind, Li Fan could fully record the reaction of every sword and compare them.

Thus, he discovered this exceptional case!

Target locked, Li Fan leapt to its side the next time the “failure” event occurred.

It was an inconspicuous black sword, covered in dust.

Plain and unremarkable.

It had neither a sharp blade nor intricate patterns.

It looked like the first practice sword forged by an apprentice—a bit ordinary, even somewhat ugly.

Yet, it was this sword that gained the favor of the Heavenly Wonder Wooden Sword.

If the scene of ten thousand swords in the Sword Tomb bowing could be considered a collective lesson under the Wooden Sword,

then during the “failure” period, it was as if the Wooden Sword was giving a private lesson solely to this black sword.

Being able to make Heavenly Wonder Wooden Sword set aside fixed time for one-on-one guidance—

this alone proved that the unremarkable black sword must hold extraordinary significance.

Li Fan slowly swept his divine sense over it.

No matter how he examined it, this was nothing more than a lump of ordinary iron, as if he could snap it in half with ease.

Yet, at the very moment when the Wood Sword lost its spirituality and the other remnant swords wandered in confusion, the black sword itself began undergoing subtle transformations.

“It’s like being slowly tempered in fire, burning away the dross and keeping only the essence. On the surface it looks simple and unadorned, but in truth, like the Wooden Sword itself, it embodies ‘all laws return to one, the Great Dao is found in simplicity.’”

Gradually, Li Fan discerned the hidden mystery within it.

“Could it be… that Heavenly Wonder Wooden Sword is attempting to create another body for himself?”

This sudden thought surged in Li Fan’s heart.

“Perhaps this is also one of the reasons why Wooden Sword was willing to leave together with Shuofeng,” Li Fan mused.

Looking at the not-yet-fully-formed black sword, Li Fan temporarily dismissed the idea of taking it away.

“It will probably need another ten years or so…”

“This can be regarded as a fruit of Heavenly Wonder Wooden Sword’s labor. If I were to take it away, then within the Spiritwood World, the Heavenly Sword Sect’s dominance would be firmly established.”
