Although he still did not understand why Heavenly Wonder Wooden Sword would go to such lengths, this did not prevent Li Fan from putting it to use when the time was right.

Returning to his original place, he lingered in the Sword Tomb for several more days.

When he could no longer comprehend anything new from the Wooden Sword, Li Fan reluctantly departed.

Before leaving, he used a secret method to conceal the Sword Tomb once again and left behind a mark.

The moment anyone intruded, he would immediately sense it.

“With the affairs of the Heavenly Sword Sect settled, next is the Medicine King Sect.”

The location of the Medicine King Sect ruins was no secret. It lay deep within a desolate mountain range in Liuxian Prefecture.

Over the years, cultivators had long since scavenged it clean, leaving behind only worthless scraps of metal scattered across the ground.

When Li Fan arrived, within a hundred li radius he found no trace of any other living person.

The air was suffused with a faint foul stench that instinctively stirred disgust in one’s heart.

“Indeed, the Medicine King Sect acted in a way that pleases me,” Li Fan thought to himself.

“Even when the entire sect was preparing to flee, they deliberately left behind such nauseating miasma, ensuring their old sect grounds could not be easily occupied by others.”

This unique stench was deliberately cultivated by the Medicine King Sect.

It had merged into the very earth itself, persisting for thousands of years without dispersing.

Unless it was purified, no one would willingly live in a place saturated with such filth.

Vile as it was, the method proved extremely effective.

Li Fan looked over the fairly well-preserved ruins. Following the directions given by Jiao Xiuyuan, he entered an abandoned workshop.

Enduring the foul smell, he circulated his spiritual power and dug out several small Medicine King Cauldrons buried deep underground.

“There are thirty-six cauldrons?”

Li Fan’s expression shifted slightly.

Though he had previously entrusted Jiao Xiuyuan to excavate them, the man had sworn there were only a little over twenty.

“Ah… Fellow Daoist Jiao, Fellow Daoist Jiao…”

Li Fan shook his head and silently recorded this debt.

As per habit, he carefully searched the place again.

Other than these cauldrons, the Medicine King Sect indeed had nothing else of value left.

Without further delay, Li Fan turned directly toward the Purple Heaven Sect.

At the same time—

Haixuan Island.

Ji Shaoli suddenly felt a wave of unease in his heart.

“Strange. I clearly made ample preparations. By reason, even if a Dao Integration cultivator came personally, I should still be able to retreat calmly.”

“But where is this sense of danger coming from?”

Always trusting his own premonitions, Ji Shaoli suddenly stood up, his expression growing increasingly grim.

He paced back and forth repeatedly, yet the feeling of danger did not subside.

On the contrary—it intensified.

His heart thumped violently, as if a great disaster was about to descend!

Ji Shaoli knew something was wrong.

After inspecting the island’s teleportation array, he discovered that it had indeed been sealed, unable to activate!

“Trying to trap me like a turtle in a jar?”

A cold glint flashed in Ji Shaoli’s eyes.

He tried to activate an instant-movement array, but it too had lost its effect.

It was as if some force had sealed the entire space around Haixuan Island!

Although startled, Ji Shaoli did not lose his composure.

Holding a withered branch in his hand, he felt the surging power of the earth veins beneath his feet—it remained unrestricted.

He let out a slight sigh of relief.

After a period of growth, Lin Ling—who followed the Dao child Liuli every day—had also made great progress in strength.

Moreover, as her spirituality increased, her bond with the ancient Earth Vein Tree grew even deeper.

From it, she had obtained this Earth Vein Withered Branch. Anyone holding it could travel freely within the earth veins.

With a method of escape in hand, Ji Shaoli did not leave immediately.

Instead, he wanted to see who exactly was targeting him.

To be able to shut down the bidirectional teleportation formation of Ten Thousand Immortal Island, and to render useless all the connections he had spent so much contribution value maintaining…

All of this only proved the enemy’s strength.

Definitely not something the Xiang Clan—merely a regional overlord of one prefecture, could achieve.

Ji Shaoli was unafraid of exposure; he only wished to clarify the cause of failure.

Humming a little tune, he brewed two cups of spirit tea.

Patiently, he waited for his guest to arrive.

The members of the Mutual Aid Association on Haixuan Island had already been dismissed by him under some excuse.

As for the two Earthly Wonders he promised to Kou Hong and Dao Xuanzi, Ji Shaoli had already provided them with detailed information.

Whether they could find them and survive… depended entirely on their own fortune.

He did not have to wait long.

Suddenly, the figure of a young man appeared beside Ji Shaoli.

What made Ji Shaoli’s pupils contract sharply was that the youth appeared without any trace of aura fluctuation—as if he had been standing beside Ji Shaoli all along.

And what shocked him even more…

He had seen this youth before!

“A Dharma-Transmitting One?!”

Ji Shaoli blurted out.

It was none other than the true body of Li Fan. Back in the Fallen Immortal Realm, during the scene when Ning Yuan obtained the Longevity Fruit, Ji Shaoli had searched the soul of an early member of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance—and saw among the memories one of those cultivators spreading the New Law.

“Hm?”

Hearing Ji Shaoli directly call out his identity, the youth was slightly surprised.

“Interesting.”

His eyes burned brightly as he stared at Ji Shaoli.

The next moment, Ji Shaoli’s clone felt his mind and body completely frozen.

Even the contingency methods he had prepared beforehand to escape were rendered useless!

It was as if his soul was being drawn out, and upon Ji Shaoli’s body, a vague shadowy figure began to emerge.

Just at that moment—

Two streams of seven-colored radiance suddenly surged forth, striking toward the youth.

Yet the instant they neared him, they were pinched still between his two fingers—unable to advance even half a step further.

“This is…” The youth looked at the seven-colored divine light in his hand, his eyes flashing with a trace of curiosity.

Flipping his hand, he suppressed and stored it away.

Then, once more, he turned his gaze upon Ji Shaoli.

At this moment, Ji Shaoli stood frozen like a lamb awaiting slaughter.

His face was stiff, frozen with an expression of both terror and shock.

Seeing the yellow withered branch in the other party’s hand, the young man’s lips curled into a faintly mocking smile.

“An Ancient Earth Vein Tree, and this mysterious seven-colored radiance…”

“For a mere Golden Core stage to actually possess such treasures.”

“Since when has such a remarkable organization appeared under the rule of our Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance?”

“Allow me to take a closer look.”

Under the youth’s gaze, Ji Shaoli’s divine soul was slowly pulled from his body.

In that instant, his flesh rapidly withered, aging a hundredfold.

What the young man displayed was clearly a soul-searching technique of extreme malice!

Ji Shaoli’s divine soul, without the slightest resistance, fell into the youth’s hand.

In the blink of an eye, as the soul-searching spell operated, torrents of information surged into the young man’s mind.

His body trembled slightly, and a trace of shock flashed through his eyes.

“The Xuantian Sect?”

In that instant, the soul-searching seemed to trigger a certain prohibition hidden within Ji Shaoli’s divine soul.

Before the young man could fully read all the information, the divine soul withered like a dying flower and dissipated into nothingness.

Yet, the young man showed no concern.

If what he had just seen was true, then it was natural that a restriction would be embedded in the soul.

“To think… even after thousands of years, the Xuantian Sect still refuses to vanish?”

The youth frowned slightly.

From what he had glimpsed, this cultivator named Ji Shaoli had secretly become a subordinate of a mysterious Xuantian Sect Dharma King.

In the Congyun Sea and throughout the territories of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, forces were being nurtured in the shadows, plotting a comeback.

“In this age, and they still refuse to give up? Truly absurd.”

The youth gave a cold snort, though inwardly he did not relax in the slightest.

“The Purple Heaven Sect ruins? Hiding in a place like that…”

Murderous intent flickered in his eyes, and his figure slowly vanished.

Meanwhile.

Not far from the Purple Heaven Sect ruins, Li Fan suddenly sensed the disappearance of his clone.

His body paused for a moment.

Vague images flickered into his mind, leaving him thoughtful.

“Heavenly Oversight Division?”

“So such an organization still exists.”

But after pondering, he found it reasonable.

“Previously, I thought that merely knowing about the existence of the Spirit of Heaven and Earth would allow me to freely cultivate Dao Integration Immortal Sages. That was rather naïve.”

“The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance has lasted for thousands of years. If they lacked such methods of control, they would have long since been overthrown.”

Suppressing his thoughts for now, Li Fan turned his gaze to the Purple Heaven Sect ruins ahead.

“Since the fish has already taken the bait, I’ll just sit back and watch the show.”

Narrowing his eyes, he swept his divine sense across the area.

Very quickly, using the intelligence from his previous life, and following a faint thread of vitality, so subtle it would be overlooked by most—

Li Fan discovered, deep underground in a sealed chamber, the slumbering Dharma King of the Xuantian Sect!

Looking at his face, it was identical to that of Li Chen of the Purple Heaven Sect, whom Li Fan had once possessed!

Without hesitation, he unleashed a strand of Annihilation Sword Qi, striking straight toward the underground chamber.

Carrying with it a destructive aura, it seemed determined to engulf everything within.

Yet just as the black radiance was about to touch the chamber, strands of golden threads suddenly appeared, weaving out of the void.

The secret chamber collapsed, but the protective barrier formed by circles of golden threads continued to shield Li Chen at the center.

Seeing this, Li Fan pressed on relentlessly, unleashing several waves of destructive sword qi in succession.

The golden threads, struck by the tremendous force, caved inward, seeming as though they might snap at any moment.

At this life-or-death moment, the Xuantian Sect’s Dharma King finally opened his eyes slowly.

Li Fan gave a faint smile, and with a flash of his figure, vanished without a trace.

Moments later, when Li Chen regained consciousness, he stood dazed in place for a while.

Having slumbered for so long, it would take time to sort through the memories in his mind.

Yet before he could fully understand the current situation, Li Chen’s expression suddenly shifted.

He abruptly sensed that the surrounding space had been sealed off by someone.

Thinking back to the sudden assault just moments ago, Li Chen immediately understood—the place where he had been hiding must have been discovered.

However, he was still a Dharma King of the Xuantian Sect, a figure who had once escaped unscathed even when hunted by the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance’s top ten sects.

Though startled, he did not panic. First, he drew a porcelain vial from his storage ring.

Taking a sip of the rainbow-colored divine nectar within, his aura, withered from long dormancy—instantly solidified again.

As Li Chen restored his strength, a door opened in the sky above, and a squad of several dozen black-clad cultivators emerged in unison.

Their expressions were solemn, their bodies radiating killing intent as tangible as steel.

The one leading them was none other than the young cultivator who had recently soul-searched Ji Shaoli in the Congyun Sea.

His eyes narrowed as he swept his gaze across the ruins below.

“Three chimes… so it really is the Xuantian Sect’s Dharma King!”

Excitement flickered in his heart. With a grand gesture, he ordered the black-clad cultivators to spread into the corners of the sky. Each held a small mirror in hand.

Once in position, countless streams of azure-green light shot forth from the mirrors.

In an instant, the beams swept across the space, illuminating everything.

Under the glow of the green light, the underground chamber became transparent, and Li Chen’s hidden figure was revealed before the eyes of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance cultivators.

Surrounded on all sides, Li Chen’s expression remained calm.

He fixed his gaze on the small mirrors in their hands, a trace of nostalgia and hatred flashing in his eyes.

The young Dharma-Transmitting disciple, seeing Li Chen’s look, gave a cold snort in his heart.

With a thought, the black-clad cultivators raised their mirrors high at his command.

Countless beams of green light converged, locking onto the Xuantian Sect’s Dharma King below.

The light bound Li Chen like unyielding chains.

Li Chen sneered. “Using the treasures of my Xuantian Sect to capture a Dharma King of the Xuantian Sect?”

“Have today’s cultivators truly grown so foolish?”

At his words, a crisp chime rang out at his side.

In an instant, the binding green light warped in strange ways.

The restraints loosened.

Both Li Chen and the young cultivator revealed starkly different expressions.

Li Chen’s was one of shock and gravity.

The youth’s was one of wild delight.

“This fellow Daoist from the Xuantian Sect, you’d better come with me!” the young man declared, drawing in a deep breath, suppressing his excitement as he spoke loudly.

But Li Chen completely ignored him.

The crisp chime sounded once again. The green beams from the mirrors shuddered violently, then spun out of control.

Like a rampaging storm, they erupted in every direction.

In an instant, the green light engulfed the ruins of the Purple Heaven Sect.

Amid the dazzling brilliance, before the eyes of all, Li Chen’s figure vanished in a flash!

So sudden was the turn of events that even the young Dharma-Transmitter was caught unprepared.

As the azure light erupted, it was not only the vision that was disrupted—even divine sense lock-on was thrown into disarray.

Everyone present instantly lost their lock on the Xuantian Sect’s Dharma King.

“As expected—other than a Heavenly Sovereign, the only ones who can influence and manipulate the Tianxuan Mirror are the Xuantian Sect!”

This thought flashed across the young man’s mind.

He swept his gaze across the area but could not find any trace of the opponent. His heart sank, and just as he was about to order a pursuit—he suddenly sensed that something was amiss.

“Hm?”

“This place has already been sealed off beforehand by my Nine Heavens Ten Earths Formation. Unless the formation is broken, he has absolutely no chance of escaping.

In other words… he’s still here?!”

The youth immediately commanded his squad of black-clothed cultivators to scan the surrounding space once more.

The young Dharma-Transmitting Envoy’s expression darkened.

“The Xuantian Sect… truly troublesome. No wonder they managed to survive back then, even under the joint extermination campaign of the Ten Great Immortal Sects.”

His gaze swept over the surrounding space again and again.

“Where exactly are you hiding?”

Suddenly, his eyes froze—landing on the very group of black-clothed cultivators under his command.

A faint unease rose within him.

“Wait… how many people did I bring with me this time?”

Such a simple question surfaced in his mind.

But what made his hair stand on end was that—he could not recall the answer!

He had already reached Dao Integration countless years ago; for such a situation to occur was inconceivable.

“So this is the eerie nature of the Xuantian Sect’s cultivation arts…”

The youth narrowed his eyes as the various ancient rumors about the Xuantian Sect surfaced in his mind.

Realizing the Dharma King must be hidden among his own black-clothed cultivators, he ordered them to cross-check one another’s identities.

Although he himself was not well-acquainted with most of them, they were certainly familiar with each other.

Yet, to his astonishment, after they completed the verifications—Not a single discrepancy was found!

Every individual’s identity records were flawless.

Even their minds carried memories of countless interactions from the past.

…

The youth’s expression turned extremely unsightly.

At this point, no matter how unwilling he was, he had to admit—this time, he had underestimated his enemy.

As one of the earliest Dharma-Transmitting Envoys who had followed the Immortal Ancestor to overthrow the Ten Great Immortal Sects, he had never regarded this so-called Dharma King of the Xuantian Sect as a serious threat.

After all, the Ten Great Immortal Sects that once crushed the Xuantian Sect were all defeated by his own side.

No matter how powerful the Xuantian Sect might be now, what could they possibly do?

Thus, seeking sole credit, he had come without informing the other Envoys.

Yet now, he found himself trapped in this humiliating predicament.

His face shifted with conflicting emotions.

At this moment, he had two options:

First, to report back to the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance headquarters and request the list of black-clothed cultivators assigned to this mission. With a simple comparison, he could expose the hidden Dharma King.

But doing so would surely draw the attention of the other Envoys—perhaps even invite ridicule.

After some consideration, the youth made another choice.

He casually pointed at one of the black-clothed cultivators and said coldly:

“You—end your life.”

Hearing this cold and merciless command, the black-robed cultivator who had been pointed out did not hesitate in the slightest.

With both hands, he suddenly slapped his forehead with great force. In an instant, his aura dispersed. His body dissolved into fragments of dust, as if melting into the air.

Only a streak of azure light, carrying something unknown, tore through the void and vanished.

The young man’s expression did not waver in the slightest as he turned his gaze upon the next black-robed cultivator.

Under the youth’s deathly stare, one after another of the black-robed cultivators committed suicide.

Yet, what was bizarre was that the celestial phenomenon that should have been born from a cultivator’s fall never appeared from beginning to end.

Together, there had been thirty-five black-robed cultivators who accompanied him.

Now, twenty-six had already killed themselves, yet the hidden Xuantian Dharma King had still not been found.

“Could it be… my luck is really this poor?”

“Or have I judged incorrectly?”

The youth’s expression darkened to the extreme.

But at this point, there was no room left for regret.

Hardening his resolve, like a gambler with bloodshot eyes staking everything, his command for suicide did not cease.

Until…

Only the final black-robed cultivator remained.

Like the others before him, he raised his hand and struck fiercely toward his own skull.

Yet at the final instant, just before shattering his head, he stopped.

Lowering his hand slowly, he looked mockingly at the youth, the Dharma-Transmitter before him.

“So this is the so-called ruling cultivation organization of today?”

“Treating subordinates as worthless weeds…”

“They all say that our Xuantian Sect is cruel and tyrannical. But in my eyes, compared to you, we are far less so.”

The youth was not angered by Li Chen’s words.

In his eyes, those black-robed cultivators were nothing more than resources that could be regenerated at will.

Dozens dead?

Even if hundreds or thousands perished, he would not feel the slightest heartache.

“What kind of sorcery is this?”

The youth absolutely refused to believe that mere coincidence had caused the last person he pointed to to be the Xuantian Sect Dharma King.

It had to be the result of that strange and deceptive cultivation art.

Indeed, Li Chen did not deny it.

“‘Sorcery?’”

Li Chen sneered coldly. “This is the supreme Dao lineage, the orthodox immortal sect! How could the likes of you ever discern it?”

How exalted was this youth’s status?

For thousands of years, no one had ever dared to speak so brazenly before him!

Especially that deep, heartfelt contempt within Li Chen’s eyes—it ignited a rage in the youth he could not suppress.

“Now, it is just the two of us. Let’s see what tricks you can still play!”

Murderous intent surged in his voice as his robes billowed though no wind blew.

Within the space sealed by the Great Formation of Nine Heavens and Ten Earths, countless specks of starlight suddenly appeared.

Then, as though night had fallen, the entire sky was filled with stars.

Beams of starlight rained down, each like a sharp arrow, aiming to pierce the body of the Xuantian Cult Dharma King!

Facing the youth’s sudden onslaught, Li Chen appeared as though terrified into stupidity, standing motionless in place.

Just as countless rays of starlight were about to descend and pierce his heart, the youth faintly sensed something amiss.

But it was already too late.

In the next instant, countless tiny holes appeared across the youth’s body.

Blood spurted madly as he was pierced through by his own starlight, his body shredded into a pulp.

Beneath the myriad star-beams, his form became nothing more than a pool of ruined flesh.

Moments later, with a squirming motion, a perfectly intact body crawled forth again from the void.

“You…”

The youth looked at the black-robed cultivator before him, and at last, a surge of fear rose in his heart—an emotion he had not tasted in a very long time.

“Me?”

“Am I not you?”

The black-robed cultivator looked at the youth and revealed a strange smile.

The youth’s eyes flickered in a daze.

For before him, the other’s face had already become identical to his own!

“Demonic heretic!”

The young Dharma-Transmitter glared at the wicked smile on the other’s face. Shock, fear, and anger surged within him, and he could not help but rebuke.

Yet his own actions betrayed his true heart.

Dark ghostly light spread and wrapped around his body.

Space itself seemed to split apart as the youth’s figure slowly sank into nothingness, his form gradually fading.

“I can feel the fear within your heart. Why do you flee? What is it you are afraid of?”

The Xuantian Sect’s Dharma King gazed upon the youth, his voice low and strange.

“Face your true self… let yourself… return to the real you…”

The words of the Dharma King carried an uncanny force.

On either side of that line, it was like two mirrored worlds—reflecting each other perfectly.

In an instant, the figures of the Dharma King and the youth overlapped.

At that moment, the Dharma King was also shrouded in the same ghostly black light as the disciple—as though he were truly his mirror image!

Even when the youth’s expression grew more terrified, that same fear appeared upon the Dharma King’s face.

The dividing line between them grew brighter.

Moments later, the space between them was cut away, leaving the two far closer than before.

“You forced me to this!” the youth snarled, terror and unease boiling within him.

A golden thread suddenly emerged from between his brows.

This golden thread carried a unique might—one that the Dharma King of Xuantian Sect could not replicate.

The mirror world reflected everything except this golden thread, creating a faint dissonance.

The mirrored realm trembled on the verge of collapse, even the Dharma King’s figure blurred.

“You and I are one. Do you hate yourself so much that you must resort to such treasures? Is that necessary?”

At this critical moment, the Dharma King’s whispers once again echoed in the youth’s ears.

The disciple’s fierce, twisted expression softened into confusion, then slowly calmed.

The golden thread retreated back into his brow.

The distance between the two shrank further.

“You have lived long, yet the road ahead is blocked. I can sense your hesitation, your unwillingness… Reclaim your true self, and you will awaken your supreme hidden potential. The Grand Dao may yet be within reach…”

As the Dharma King whispered again and again, the gap between them narrowed until only the dividing line remained.

Their gazes met—expressions identical, no longer filled with fear or doubt, only with the joy of newfound clarity.

The line exploded in radiant light—then vanished.

The mirrored world descended into reality.

The two figures overlapped completely.

In the field of battle, only the young Dharma-Transmitter remained.

Having completed the fusion, he stood quietly in mid-air, eyes closed, digesting the vast flood of information in his mind.

“Immortal Ancestor? The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance?”

Moments later, his eyes snapped open, puzzlement flickering within them.

“So even in this age, they still guard against our Xuantian Sect.”

“The ‘Extermination of Xuantian’ secret art…”

The “youth” gave a cold snort. “I don’t know where they got their confidence from. Thousands of years have passed, yet their so-called secret art remains completely unchanged. They underestimate us far too much.”

As he spoke, the aura around him subtly shifted.

“This should be enough to fool them, as long as I refrain from using our sect’s forbidden techniques.”

Satisfied, he nodded.

But soon, doubt clouded his face again.

“It wasn’t a chance discovery—they were directed here.”

“They used the name of our Xuantian Sect to recruit followers, even knew my whereabouts…”

“After exposure, they immediately lured disaster elsewhere.”

“The Congyun Mutual Aid Association… the True Immortal of Salvation and Mortal Compassion?”

In an instant, he pieced together the truth from the fragments of intelligence.

Yet the youth did not flare with anger. Instead, his face grew solemn as he recalled the faceless divine statue of Xuantian mentioned in the reports.

He pinched his fingers to calculate, then his expression turned to shock.

“I cannot sense its position? But it is indeed the true statue of Xuantian…”

The doubt in the young man’s eyes grew stronger.

“Could it be… the work of one of our sect brothers?”

“Speaking of it, this style of action truly does resemble that of our Xuantian Sect disciples.”

One face after another flashed through the young man’s mind.

“They must have realized that the matter has already been exposed and cannot be salvaged, so they borrowed my hand to suppress it?”

“It seems this brother has also only recently awakened.”

Yet, the young man felt no doubt about why the other party did not choose to meet him in person.

Back then, when the Ten Great Immortal Sects launched their sudden assault, it was during the critical moment when the 'Xuantian King' was in closed-door seclusion.

In one fell swoop, they broke through the Xuantian Sect.

The timing was chosen with uncanny precision.

Even the distribution of the sect’s defensive forces and the flaws in the protective formations were known to them in detail.

The defenses were as good as nonexistent.

Caught off guard, the Xuantian Sect suffered a crushing defeat.

The casualties were disastrous.

The Xuantian King and the supreme treasure, the Xuantian Mirror, vanished without a trace, while the Dharma Kings were either slain or gravely wounded.

It was clear—the defeat had been so absolute that there had to be traitors within the sect.

And not just one.

Thus, every surviving Dharma King became extremely cautious.

Other than the Xuantian King, they trusted no one.

The young man was no exception.

“Before the Xuantian King went missing, he sent us a secret message: to remain dormant and preserve our lives.”

“To await his summons.”

“Yet after all these years, no word has come.”

Even so, the young man had no doubt that the Xuantian King still lived.

After the war between the Xuantian Sect and Heavenly Capital, though the Xuantian King had been seriously injured, he had forcibly seized some Immortal Spirit Qi from the enemy, giving him hope of forging a True Immortal Body.

That was the reason for his closed-door cultivation.

“As long as I can reshape my Immortal Body in the lower realm, I will lead us brothers out of this [Darkest Star Sea].”

The young man still remembered clearly the lofty words the Xuantian King had spoken before entering seclusion.

This was also why, even after so many years, he had never once considered betraying the sect.

For him, thousands of years were but a slightly longer sleep.

But to be trapped here for endless ages—that was true despair.

Thus he could never understand why anyone would choose betrayal.

The only explanation he could arrive at over all these years was that the Ten Great Immortal Sects had also promised a way to escape the Darkest Star Sea—one more reliable than the Xuantian King’s method.

At first, he did not believe it.

But after receiving the full memories of this Dharma-Transmitter, his judgment wavered.

For he learned that, when the great calamity of “Incompatibility Cultivation” descended, several high-level cultivators of the Ten Great Immortal Sects had vanished together.

They even took with them a large portion of the Xuanhuang Realm’s resources.

And since then, they had never been seen again.

“If that is true, then those traitors may already be living carefree.”

A flash of killing intent flickered in the young man’s eyes.

“Without the power of a True Immortal, escaping the Darkest Star Sea comes at an unbearable price. Such a chance cannot be repeated.”

“So my only hope still lies with the Xuantian King.”

As for whether the Xuantian King might have abandoned them and escaped first, the youth had no such worry.

The Xuantian King cultivated the "Dao of Word and Deed as One"—he would never casually give his word.

Once he made a promise, it had to be fulfilled. Otherwise, he would shatter his Dao foundation. Even if he became a True Immortal, he would risk falling back into mortality.

So long as he lived, he would certainly gather the Dharma Kings again and fulfill his vow.

It was for this reason that he had once been able to win the allegiance of twelve peak cultivators with nothing but the eloquence of his tongue.

“If I can find that Faceless Xuantian Statue, perhaps I can determine the Xuantian King’s whereabouts.”

The Xuantian Divine Statue was not modeled after the Xuantian King himself, but after the True Immortal he once encountered within the Ascension Passage.

According to the Xuantian King, the aura that True Immortal exuded was vast as the boundless seas.

Compared to him, the newly ascended Xuantian King was as insignificant as an ant.

At that time, he had just pierced through the void and entered the Ascension Passage.

Before he could even fly to the Immortal Realm he longed for, a terrifying roar echoed from afar.

The Xuantian King then witnessed a sight he would never forget.

The Ascension Passage shattered section by section.

Countless figures scrambled to escape, only to be sucked into that terrifying black ruin.

Unnumbered corpses fell through the cracks of the collapsing passage.

Something catastrophic had clearly struck the Immortal Realm!

The Xuantian King turned and fled at once, scavenging the corpses of fallen Immortals along the way.

Yet the collapse of the passage was faster than he imagined.

Just as he was about to fall into the abyss like the others, a figure flashed past him and grabbed him.

That figure pulled him out of the collapsing void.

The Xuantian King, shaken but alive, hastily expressed his gratitude.

But this mysterious being, clearly a high-ranked Immortal, was such that the Xuantian King could not even discern his face.

“Hurry and flee. Any slower, and it will be too late.”

The Faceless True Immortal spoke only this before disappearing without a trace.

Leaving behind a bewildered Xuantian King.

Only much later did the Xuantian King understand what that Immortal meant by “escape.”

The Ascension Passage had collapsed. The road to immortality was severed.

Only a remnant known as the Immortal Ruins remained.

And the influence of the Immortal Ruins upon the lower realms was only just beginning to show.

The return of Xuantian King, who had failed in his ascension attempt, caused a great uproar within the Xuanhuang Realm.

Countless cultivators sent inquiries, yet he ignored them all. After all, this matter was too shocking. If word were to spread, the despairing cultivation world would instantly plunge into chaos, as if the end times had arrived.

Hiding away alone, Xuantian King reviewed his gains from the attempt and pondered the meaning behind the words of that Faceless True Immortal.

The Xuanhuang Realm, after a period of uproar, gradually returned to calm. With the collapse and disappearance of the Ascension Passage, the Immortal Realm’s great tribulation seemed to have slowly lost all influence upon the lower realms.

About a year later, however, Xuantian King suddenly noticed a subtle shift in the landmark position of the Xuanhuang Realm.

The change was extremely small.

Had he not been constantly vigilant and had his strength not skyrocketed after being bathed in immortal spiritual energy—he might have overlooked it.

But Xuantian King, who had been prepared, could not possibly ignore such a detail.

Another three years passed.

What shocked him even more was that it wasn’t only the Xuanhuang Realm.

Every cultivation realm he could observe or connect with—was the same!

The conclusion was clear.

Something within the endless void was pulling every cultivation realm toward itself!

Recalling the Faceless True Immortal’s words—

“Hurry and flee. If you delay any longer, it will be too late.”

Xuantian King felt a chill run down his spine.

In that instant, perhaps he did consider abandoning everything and fleeing alone.

But as the most gifted cultivator of the Xuanhuang Realm, he could not bear to watch his homeland march toward destruction.

Thus, Xuantian King made a noble decision—

He would take the Xuanhuang Realm and flee together with it.

Even though he already possessed a half-immortal body, attempting to move an entire world was nothing but a delusion.

Not to mention resisting such a terrifying and unimaginable force of attraction…

Yet Xuantian King did not give up.

After exhaustively studying the texts he had seized from immortals, and combining them with his own vast knowledge, the scholarly Xuantian King deduced a grand, unparalleled formation.

He named it the Floating-Starry Sky Grand Formation.

According to his calculations, resisting the mysterious pull of the endless void could not be achieved with only the resources of the Xuanhuang Realm.

Even if he hollowed out the realm entirely, it would not suffice to withstand that terrifying, inconceivable power.

Therefore, one of the formation’s functions was to lock onto nearby pocket worlds and minor realms, seize them, and initiate wars of realms.

This would allow him to plunder resources, replenish his own realm, and at the same time form a chain effect—like iron-linked ships—slowing down the speed at which the Xuanhuang Realm was being dragged away.

It was truly killing many birds with one stone.

However, constructing such a formation was impossible through his strength alone.

Only by uniting and mobilizing the vast majority of the Xuanhuang Realm’s power could the Floating-Starry Sky Formation be completed.

As for revealing the truth of the situation to the public and calling for unity…

Xuantian King had considered it.

But after thoroughly observing the conduct of cultivators across the Xuanhuang Realm, he decisively abandoned the idea.

If they were told of the crisis at this moment, the vast majority of them would choose to flee immediately.

Choosing to stay and follow the Xuantian King to save the Xuanhuang Realm was almost impossible—practically zero chance.

Yet, constructing the Floating-Starry Sky Formation required the power of these cultivators.

Therefore, the Xuantian King decided to first unify the Xuanhuang Realm and better coordinate its strength.

He was, after all, a once-in-a-millennium genius, and now the only half-immortal in the Xuanhuang Realm.

Moreover, he had inherited numerous immortal techniques from the Ascension Passage.

Accomplishing this goal was not particularly difficult.

As expected, after persuading twelve other top-tier cultivators with extraordinary talent to become his aides, the Xuantian King swept away all resistance within just a few years.

With him as the leader and the twelve Dharma Kings as his deputies, he established the Xuantian Sect, a power that dominated the Xuanhuang Realm.

All beings in Xuanhuang submitted.

The Floating-Starry Sky Formation was constructed with unprecedented efficiency.

It soon began successfully capturing and conquering other worlds.

The speed of the landmark's deviation was also gradually slowing down.

Everything seemed to be moving in the right direction.

The Xuantian King appeared to foresee a bright future where the Xuanhuang Realm would escape calamity.

However, the arrival of an unexpected guest completely disrupted his plans.

The moment the purple aura appeared in the Xuanhuang Realm, the Xuantian King could vaguely discern the visitor’s background.

A half-immortal body not yet fully purified, and incomplete immortal spiritual energy.

It must be a cultivator like him, who had escaped the collapse of the Ascension Passage.

Naturally, the Xuantian King was on high alert for this opponent, who matched him in strength.

Yet the visitor claimed he was merely passing by, staying only briefly before leaving.

If the two half-immortals fought, it would inevitably leave irreparable damage to the Xuanhuang Realm.

After much deliberation, the Xuantian King chose not to strike.

Little did he know, this decision would sow the seeds of future calamity.

While the Floating-Starry Sky Formation captured yet another world, during the interval when the Xuantian King personally went on a campaign, the one who called himself the Grand Mage of Heavenly Capital actually lured many native Xuanhuang cultivators into his sect,

teaching them numerous techniques, secret arts, and divine powers.

Upon his victorious return, the Xuantian King immediately understood the Grand Mage’s intention.

He sought to use these cultivators to shake the authority of the Xuantian Sect, stir up rebellion, and, when both sides were weakened, harvest the spoils.

The ultimate goal was the immortal spiritual energy within the Xuantian King himself.

But the Xuantian King would never yield to such schemes.

He immediately charged into Heavenly Capital, confronting the Grand Mage directly.

Although he sustained minor injuries, his opponent was far more severely wounded, forcing him to behave more cautiously thereafter.

Yet the Grand Mage refused to leave, and the Xuantian King had few good options.

Fearing the opponent might act recklessly, the Xuantian King decided to simply ignore him.

From this battle, however, he gained subtle benefits.

With some immortal spiritual energy seized from his opponent, he might even reconstruct a true immortal body directly in the lower realm.

Once infused with true immortal power, the resources needed to activate the Floating-Starry Sky Formation would be greatly reduced.

The Xuanhuang Realm could then quickly extricate itself from danger.

Still, the Xuantian King underestimated some cultivators’ treachery, or the Grand Mage’s talent for deceiving hearts and minds.

Those who entered Heavenly Capital eventually united at the critical moment, just as everything seemed to be heading in the best direction,

launching a sudden assault against the Xuantian Sect.

From that moment, the history of the Xuanhuang Realm completely diverged onto another path.

…

Recalling all of this from the past, the young man’s expression became distant.

He looked up, as if he could see that terrifying existence that absorbed and devoured everything.

“Thousands of years have passed… is it already within reach?”

[Translator's Note: I previously translated (大法師) as 'Grandmaster' when the character was first mentioned. After further consideration, I believe 'Grand Mage' is the more appropriate term. While 'Grand-master' is not incorrect, as the word can also carry that meaning, 'Grand Mage' better suits the context]

“Truly pathetic…”

Through the mind of the young Dharma-Transmitter, he learned of the various events that had occurred in the Xuanhuang Realm during his slumber. These revelations caused the Dharma King of the Xuantian Sect to feel as though he were reading a third-rate, absurd story.

“Even with disaster looming, they still bicker endlessly…”

“Perhaps human nature has always been this way. Xuantian King’s judgment back then was not wrong.”

The Dharma King of the Xuantian Sect shook his head slightly.

Of course, he had no intention of rectifying chaos or setting things right.

All he wanted now was to locate Xuantian King and escape from this place before the Xuanhuang Realm completely fell into the Immortal Ruins.

If Xuantian King could no longer be found…

Then he would have to rely on himself.

Yet, in the eyes of the Dharma King, these plans were hardly feasible.

What exactly is the Darkest Starry Sea?

Why did Xuantian King declare with absolute certainty that only those who reached the True Immortal realm could escape this Deadly zone?

Many escape strategies devised by the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance could indeed allow some cultivators to leave the Xuanhuang Realm temporarily and evade the pull of the Immortal Ruins.

But the Immortal Ruins influence an unimaginably vast void.

Within this void, numerous once-vibrant cultivation worlds, like clusters of stars, had long since been swallowed by the Immortal Ruins over the years.

The once-brilliant starry skies had thus become dark and lifeless.

Escaping the Xuanhuang Realm, many could achieve that.

But escaping this dark cage…

Was not just a matter of the void being too vast. Even those at the Longevity Immortal stage, without reference points or guiding markers, would only become lost and eventually trapped if they dared to fly recklessly into it.

More importantly, beyond the Darkest Starry Sea, a High Wall had been artificially constructed.

At the edge of the Darkest Starry Sea, it caused any cultivator attempting to break through to sigh in despair.

Xuantian King speculated that this High Wall might have been built by cultivators outside the Darkest Starry Sea to prevent the calamity of the Immortal Ruins from spreading further outward.

To cross the High Wall, one must unleash a power in an instant that surpasses mortal forms.

Otherwise, the so-called escape would merely mean moving from one part of the cage to another.

“If the Floating Starry Sky Formation is still intact, given the current scale of the Xuanhuang Realm, fully activating the formation’s power might produce a peak burst sufficient to surpass the High Wall.”

The young disciple pondered this as he glanced at the ruins of the Purple Heaven Sect.

With a wave of his hand, he dismantled the Nine Heavens Ten Earth Formation covering the area.

Then, his figure blurred and vanished.

The Purple Heaven Sect ruins fell once again into the long-standing tranquility.

Seven full days passed.

The air twisted, and a figure suddenly appeared.

The Dharma King of the Xuantian Sect, who seemed to have departed, had actually returned.

Or rather, he had never left.

His earlier “departure” had only been a diversion.

“I was still hoping to meet my brother from the sect, but alas…”

Since fate did not allow it, the Dharma King did not insist.

With a flicker, his figure vanished completely.

This time, it was no mere illusion—he had truly left.

After more than ten days had passed, a furtive figure appeared outside the ruins of the Purple Heaven Sect.

His features were indistinguishable, and his aura was completely concealed.

It was Li Fan.

He observed from a distance for a while, confirming there was no danger, and sensed nothing unusual in his surroundings.

Only then did he cautiously move forward.

During this time, after using the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance’s Dharma-Transmitter as a diversion, he had patiently waited in the vicinity.

Once he sensed that all traces of the previous aura had completely disappeared, he waited a long time before finally returning.

He had originally assumed that when two powerful figures clashed, at least one would be injured.

But what surprised him was that the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance had no reaction at all to the incident.

Even those from the Congyun Sea Mutual Aid Association who had already been exposed were not pursued by the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

It was as if nothing had ever happened.

Li Fan wanted to understand exactly what had occurred here.

A glimmer of silver light appeared in his eyes, activating a hidden formation in the air.

This formation had been derived by Li Fan using the Final Dissociation Disc—a formation one tier beyond the current generation, nearly impossible for other cultivators to detect.

It had only one function: to record everything within its coverage area.

As Li Fan continued to cast his spell, the scenes from over ten days ago began to reappear in the air.

Vividly.

When he saw the extremely strange divine abilities of the Dharma King of the Xuantian Sect, a flash of shock crossed Li Fan’s mind.

Especially when the Dharma King effortlessly devoured the young Dharma-Transmitter, who seemed to be at the peak of Dao Integration—Li Fan’s heart shook violently.

He took a deep breath to suppress his shock.

“So this is the true power of the Dharma King of the Xuantian Sect?”

“Truly unpredictable and devious, impossible to guard against.”

Li Fan put himself in the position of the young Dharma-Transmitter. For a moment, he could not think of an effective way to respond.

Although he possessed the enormous strength of the Five Elements Cave-Heaven and was protected by the Seven-Colored Radiance, facing the extremely bizarre offensive techniques of the Xuantian Sect, he could not leverage any significant advantage.

He could not help but recall the several divine arts of the Xuantian Sect he had seen in Senior Sister Zhao’s illusion:

Heaven and Earth Converging Manual, Eternal Sole-Dominance Technique, Soul-Severing Divine Art, and Heaven’s Sorrow and Earth’s Grief Scripture.

Senior Sister Zhao could achieve the rank of One-Heart Heavenly Sovereign with just the Eternal Sole-Dominance Technique.

This alone demonstrated the extraordinary depth and power of the Xuantian Sect.

“Good thing I was cautious and didn’t provoke this person recklessly just because of my own strength. Otherwise, I might have ended up being the one captured,” Li Fan thought quietly.

Next, Li Fan saw that after devouring the young Dharma-Transmitter, the Dharma King appeared dazed, occasionally looking up at the sky, occasionally muttering to himself.

When he mistakenly treated Li Fan as a member of the Xuantian Sect, Li Fan’s expression slightly changed.

Afterward, the Dharma King seemed to sink into memories.

Li Fan could only vaguely discern words like “Xuantian King” and “escape” that were occasionally spoken, but could not know what exactly was on his mind.

Li Fan continued to play back the recorded scenes.

When he saw the Dharma King attempt a trick to ambush him, Li Fan could not help but sneer.

If he had not ensured absolute safety, how could he have revealed himself?

Patiently, he fast-forwarded through the remaining recorded scenes and then erased the formation.

He hurriedly returned to the Spiritwood Realm, arriving at the circular hall where the Faceless Xuantian God statue stood.

Li Fan fixed his gaze on the statue.

“I had originally thought I could use this as bait to attract the remnants of the Xuantian Sect, then trap them and extract secrets of the ancient Xuantian Sect from their minds.”

“But now it seems I was overconfident.”

“If I really lured someone at the Dharma King level, I would probably end up being the one caught instead.”

Although at times his mindset could be fickle, Grand Tutor Li had one virtue: he cared deeply about his pride and could admit his mistakes.

Since the foundation of the Xuantian Sect was somewhat beyond imagination, Li Fan decided to change his plan for now and avoid provoking them.

With this in mind, Li Fan intended to use the Seven-Colored Divine Light to reseal the Faceless Divine Statue.

However…

Just as he was about to act, Li Fan suddenly froze.

In that instant, the statue seemed to come alive.

Even though the stone figure had no eyes, Li Fan distinctly felt that it “looked” at him.

He could not help but leap backward a great distance, preparing for any sudden danger.

After several breaths, seeing that everything remained calm and nothing unusual occurred, Li Fan slowly approached again.

It seemed that the glance he thought he had seen was merely an illusion.

Li Fan even reviewed the recordings stored in his Dao Deviation Stone.

In the footage, the statue stood silently, just like any ordinary object, without any extraordinary features.

“Could it be that I really saw it wrong?” Li Fan wondered, feeling uncertain.

After pondering for a moment, he ultimately decided not to leave this potential threat unchecked.

He activated the Seven-Colored Divine Light, intending to seal and store the Faceless Divine Statue.

Yet, his expression changed drastically.

Although the statue was clearly in front of him, it seemed as if it did not exist at all!

The Seven-Colored Divine Light sealed nothing—he ended up empty-handed.

Li Fan froze.

He reached out to touch the statue.

The icy surface felt incredibly real.

But when he focused his Divine Sense to lock onto it and store it in his spatial storage, the location of the statue appeared completely empty.

It was impossible.

This strange scene had clearly surpassed Li Fan’s understanding.

“Could it be the lingering spirit of Xuantian King?” Li Fan’s expression shifted unpredictably.

He was certain that before this moment, the statue had not exhibited such an anomaly.

Yet, with that brief glance just now, some subtle transformation seemed to have occurred within the statue, placing it in this peculiar state of being both present and absent.

“So it wasn’t my imagination. Even the Dao Deviation Stone cannot record it…”

Li Fan’s face darkened.

At that moment, he finally understood what it truly meant when they said, “inviting a god is easy, sending one away is difficult.”

This statue, it seemed, had no intention of leaving.

It was as if it had taken permanent residence in this Spiritwood Realm, within the headquarters of the Ten Thousand Realms Alliance.

The base he had painstakingly built was now burdened with an irreparable “bomb,” one he had placed on a whim…

Li Fan’s face twitched.

As he considered whether to abandon the Spiritwood Realm and start anew elsewhere, a melodious female voice suddenly echoed through the hall:

“May the Compassionate True Immortal of the Mortal World bless our Great Li, and may this expedition into the Fire Realm go smoothly…”

Li Fan’s heart skipped a beat.

Looking around, he found no source for the voice.

Yet the prayer continued, ceaselessly.

At first, it sounded like Su Yuqing from Great Li Realm, then He Zhenghao, Kou Hong, Dao Xuanzhi, and others, appearing one after another.

Only after careful observation did Li Fan realize that these voices were entering his mind directly!

Moreover, as long as he focused on a specific voice, the corresponding scene appeared vividly before him.

It was as if he were truly present, able to sense the state of the supplicant.

Even…

Li Fan still felt a faint sensation in his heart—if he wished, he could respond to these supplicants.

“What is going on?”

He had never realized that he possessed an ability almost completely identical to the legendary immortals.

Li Fan was utterly shocked.

He suddenly looked toward the Faceless Statue standing silently in the great hall, knowing in his heart that all of this had to be the doing of that statue.

“Back then, I fabricated the tale of the Compassionate True Immortal of Mortal World, using the faceless stone statue as an intermediary to create a connection between myself and the members of the Ten Thousand Worlds Alliance.”

“As a result, I could receive feedback on their cultivation progress…”

“But that was merely the effect of the Sitting Immortal Art, and it was limited to that.”

“Now…”

Li Fan narrowed his eyes, his expression extremely serious.

Although there appeared to be no immediate danger, he was already considering in his mind whether he should truly ‘return to [Truth]’.

Though he did not understand the principles behind it, it was clear that behind this Faceless Statue lay a power far beyond Li Fan’s comprehension.

Li Fan silently recited the command to ‘[Truth]’.

An instantaneous prompt appeared:

“Would you like to virtualize the current scene and return to the anchor point?”

The surrounding scene also began to blur and virtualize.

“The use of ‘[Truth]’ has not been affected…”

“As long as I wish, I can reactivate it at any time.”

Li Fan pondered, ultimately choosing ‘No’.

This was not because some mysterious force prevented him from deciding, but because no danger had actually occurred, and the source of all these anomalies remained unclear…

To be scared into activating [Truth] under these circumstances would have been humiliating.

“Even the True Immortals in the Immortal Ruins, I have faced them directly.”

“It’s just a statue…”

Li Fan snorted coldly, forcing himself to calm down.

He focused his mind on the statue and the multitude of voices appearing in his consciousness.

Li Fan discovered that the owners of these voices, without exception, were members of the Association who had once sworn before the Faceless Statue in the name of the Merciful True Immortal of Salvation and Mortal Compassion.

They had nothing to do with the Merciful True Immortal of Salvation and Mortal Compassion itself.

It was simply that when they first saw the Faceless Statue, they associated it with the so-called True Immortal.

Thus, whether they liked it or not, the image of the Faceless Statue would periodically surface in their minds.

The more frequently they visualized it, the deeper the connection between them and the statue became.

When they surpassed a certain threshold, their presence would appear in Li Fan’s consciousness.

“No wonder the Xuantian Sect is called the Xuantian Sect.”

“Back then, when its followers were spread across the world, could the Xuantian King also sense and know the status of his disciples as I do?”

“That would truly be no different from a deity.”

“A deity…”

Li Fan’s heart stirred as he sensed the disciple with the deepest connection in his mind.

It was Su Yuqing from the Great Li Realm.

Though her talent was extraordinary and she was the embodiment of the Great Li Realm’s Dao, due to environmental and resource limitations, she was currently only at the early stage of Golden Core cultivation.

In the resource-scarce Great Li Realm, all spiritual energy was produced by the “Immortal Spirit Tower.”

That she could reach this level in such a short time marked her as a prodigious genius.

Through the connection with the Faceless Statue, Li Fan sensed Su Yuqing’s physical condition.

It was as if he were personally observing her with his divine sense.

Every detail was perfectly clear; nothing could be hidden.

“Even…”

Li Fan felt it.

After a moment, a small portion of pure spiritual essence, insignificant to him, but immense to Su Yuqing, disappeared from Li Fan’s body.

It then descended upon Su Yuqing.

Great Li Realm.

Just after finishing her prayers, Su Yuqing, who was cultivating beside the Immortal Spirit Tower, suddenly felt her face flush a deep red.

It was as if her body had been violently forced open by some massive, unseen force, letting out a muffled, painful groan.

As she stood there, bewildered and unsure of what was happening, a wave of pure spiritual energy mysteriously entered her body. It surged like a melting glacier, shattering violently!

Roaring through her body, it only took a few cycles around her meridians before transforming into a power she could fully control.

It obediently returned to her dantian!

At the same time, her cultivation realm began climbing at a speed terrifyingly visible to the naked eye.

In just a few breaths, she skyrocketed from early Golden Core stage to perfect Golden Core stage.

Her advance only halted reluctantly because the materials required for the new method’s breakthrough had reached their limit.

Su Yuqing stared in disbelief at the level of her cultivation, unable to fully comprehend it.

As she carefully traced the source of the spiritual energy that had helped her break through, realization dawned on her, and her expression changed.

She quickly knelt on both knees, meditating and giving thanks for the gift granted by the Merciful True Immortal of Salvation and Mortal Compassion.

Spiritwood Realm, before the Faceless Divine Statue.

An invisible feedback of cultivation suddenly appeared within Li Fan’s body.

It originated from the Sitting Immortal Art, triggered by Su Yuqing’s consecutive breakthroughs!

Even accounting for the previous transfer of cultivation that Li Fan had granted Su Yuqing, the two-way exchange resulted in Li Fan’s cultivation slightly improving as well.

“What is this?”

Li Fan felt an inexplicable shock in his heart.

But soon, he calmed down.

The generation of feedback cultivation did not violate any laws; it still fell within the operational mechanisms of the Sitting Immortal Art.

It was as if Li Fan had personally expended cultivation to help someone else advance. After the task, it was indeed possible to receive some feedback cultivation.

However, the process normally consumed far too much cultivation, making it a loss-making endeavor. Truly, it was not worth the effort.

“But now, through this Faceless Xuantian Statue, the loss of cultivation during transfer has been drastically reduced.”

“This makes the process profitable!”

Li Fan understood instantly—this was a special function attached to the mysterious Faceless Stone Statue.

“Communicating with followers, bestowing divine blessings…”

“This is getting more and more like a cult.”

Li Fan narrowed his eyes, his gaze returning to the Faceless Divine Statue.

“But here’s the question: if some great being is really behind this statue, why wouldn’t they contact the followers directly? Why transfer all these abilities and responses to me instead?”

“Have my secrets been exposed?”

After much contemplation, Li Fan concluded that probably not.

After all, judging by the temperament of such powerful beings, if they truly knew about the [Truth] residing within him, they would almost certainly not play any cat-and-mouse games with him.

Most likely, they would have descended directly to seize it.

“Otherwise… perhaps it is sleeping for some reason.”

Li Fan’s eyes flickered.

He stared at the statue for a long while before finally stepping away.

There was no order forbidding ordinary people from approaching the Faceless Statue; everything proceeded as usual, as if nothing had ever happened.

As he moved farther from the statue, the prayers echoing in Li Fan’s mind gradually faded.

This only made Li Fan more certain of his judgment.

“Xuantian Sect…”

A burning curiosity surged within him—he desperately wanted to know more about this ancient and mysterious sect.

Even thousands of years later, it remained an absolutely taboo topic. Back in the era of the Ten Great Immortal Sects, the Xuantian Sect was still a matter only the true core of each sect could know about.

Even after countless reincarnations, Li Fan had only been fortunate enough to catch a glimpse of the Xuantian Sect through Zhao Shijie’s dream.

“Perhaps… there is another way.”

Suddenly, in Li Fan’s mind, the first dungeon in the Fallen Immortal Realm, [Ningyuan’s Quest for the Longevity Fruit], came to mind.

His incarnation, Li Chen, had been the target for possession by the future Dharma King of the Xuantian Sect.

“If I just wait patiently… might I be able to see this Dharma King in the Fallen Immortal Realm?”

Li Fan’s heart skipped a beat at the thought.

Since only a divine consciousness entered the Fallen Immortal Realm, even if the Dharma King tried to assimilate him, his true body would not be harmed in any way.

“Perhaps this is a rare opportunity that cannot be realized in the real world.”

“When you stare into the abyss, the abyss also stares into you. While he tries to occupy Li Chen’s body and merge with him, Li Chen is also attempting to peek into his memories.”

As for whether the Dharma King in the Fallen Immortal Realm could cross its boundaries and affect or harm the real-world Li Fan…

Unless one’s power surpassed that of the Fallen Immortal, it was absolutely impossible.

Li Fan’s eyes flickered as he considered this, and he deemed it feasible.

He quickly made his decision.

With a flicker of his form, he appeared in the secluded meditation chamber of the Spiritwood Realm.

He skillfully set up the ritual.

“Previously, out of wary of Mr. Bai, I refrained from entering the Fallen Immortal Realm until I found a way to eliminate the latent threat that had yet to manifest.”

“But now, the crisis posed by the Xuantian Sect seems far more imminent.”

“As for the risks…”

Li Fan’s gaze was resolute, with not a trace of fear: “He who fears to act will accomplish nothing! Am I, Li Fan, such a crude man? Certainly not!”

“Blessings to the Celestial Venerable Of Xuanhuang!”

He whispered silently. In the next instant, the surrounding scene twisted.

As expected, he returned to the [Ningyuan’s Quest for the Longevity Fruit].

“Junior Brother? Junior Brother?”

Zhang Qianmo’s familiar voice came from beside him.

The strange sensation ebbed away like a tide, and Li Fan turned to look at Zhang Qianmo.

“Junior Brother, what’s wrong?” Zhang Qianmo asked, his eyes filled with concern and confusion.

“First time descending from the mountain… a bit excited,” Li Fan quickly assumed his role, replying in character.

They joked and conversed, arriving at Ningyuan City along the expected path.

As per the established trajectory, Senior Brother Zhang was eager to meet his old lover, Chi Xia, leaving the task of collecting the Longevity Fruits to Li Fan.

Li Fan smiled but did not intervene.

After parting ways, Li Fan made no reckless moves, instead heading directly to the [Tree of Longevity] in the city center to collect three Longevity Fruits.

Guided by Ningyuan City steward Song Hesong, Li Fan quickly retrieved the fruits from their seal.

According to the “script,” it wouldn’t be long before the ambush by Chu Liang and other Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance cultivators, targeting Chi Xia to provoke Zhang Qianmo and then encircle him—only to be counterattacked.

Li Fan looked back at Song Hesong, a strange smile creeping across his face.

Song Hesong’s heart jumped; an ominous premonition surged through him.

“Pfft!”

Without warning, Li Fan suddenly spat a mouthful of blood, his face pale as paper.

“Senior Brother! Save me!”

Li Fan shouted.

Li Fan’s aura weakened at an alarming speed.

Yet his voice remained remarkably loud, instantly spreading throughout the entire Ningyuan City.

Song Hesong stared in astonishment at the scene before him, his mind completely blank, unable to react for a moment.

Li Fan’s figure quickly flew toward Zhang Qianmo, but he did not forget to turn and throw the jade box containing three Longevity Fruits in the opposite direction.

Song Hesong hesitated for a moment, but ultimately chose to go first and catch the jade box.

This gave Li Fan precious time to catch his breath.

“Junior Brother?!” Zhang Qianmo sensed what had happened with Li Fan and shouted angrily, his body flashing like purple lightning as he instantly arrived beside Li Fan.

“Attack!” Although he did not know why Song Hesong chose to act first, the situation had reached a point of no return—an arrow on the string must be released.

Meanwhile, Chu Liang and the other four members of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance lying in ambush within the city immediately revealed themselves.

The five of them, faces grim, surrounded Zhang Qianmo and the seemingly unconscious Li Fan.

The other four stared intently at Zhang Qianmo, while only Song Hesong looked at Li Fan, a flicker of doubt passing through his eyes.

“Senior Brother Zhang! Long time no see!” Chu Liang sneered.

“Senior Brother? Do I know you?” Zhang Qianmo’s cold gaze swept over him, his tone laced with murderous intent.

Chu Liang froze for a moment, then erupted in fury.

What followed was not much different from what Li Fan had experienced before.

However, this time, Zhang Qianmo revealed his Purple Core early to protect his severely injured “junior brother” under the assault of the others.

Facing the five attackers, Senior Brother Zhang crushed them like withered reeds, annihilating them with overwhelming force.

Then, ignoring these inconsequential people, he carried the still unconscious Li Fan and quickly returned to the Purple Heaven Sect.

Amid the clamor, Li Fan soon felt someone tending to his injuries.

To make his act more convincing, the self-inflicted wound he had just inflicted was not light.

Fortunately, it was not a fatal injury.

After careful treatment, his condition gradually stabilized, and his life was no longer in danger.

However, under Li Fan’s deliberate control, he remained in a deep, unbroken slumber.

At first, quite a few people came to check on him.

But as time passed, Li Fan showed no signs of awakening.

Gradually, only Zhang Qianmo occasionally came to visit.

Li Fan’s room grew quiet and deserted.

Half a year later, one night, a ghost-like figure quietly approached Li Fan’s bedside.

In the darkness, the figure’s features were indistinguishable.

It simply stared at the sleeping Li Fan with a sinister smile.

Then, a faint dividing line appeared between him and Li Fan.

The scene twisted, and the room was split into two along the dividing line.

It became a completely mirrored world.

The figure, whose face remained unseen, also appeared gravely injured, quietly lying on a bed.

As the dividing line emitted flickering light, the two mirrored worlds gradually approached and merged together.

When the two figures completely fused,

the dividing line vanished without a trace.

The dark, small room returned to its usual tranquility.

Yet within the mind of the body on the bed, a tumultuous storm erupted.

“What’s going on? Li Chen’s soul… is actually an empty shell?”

After devouring Li Chen of the Purple Heaven Sect lying on the bed, the Dharma King of the Xuantian Sect found that he had gained absolutely nothing from the opponent’s soul.

It was like an apple that had been hollowed out by worms—only a thin outer layer of skin remained!

The Dharma King of the Xuantian Sect felt a dark premonition in his heart, thinking this must be a trap set by the Ten Great Immortal Sects to capture him.

But immediately afterward, his expression changed.

Because upon fusing with Li Chen’s soul, it seemed that some foreign substance had also entered his mind.

It was very well hidden.

He had even neglected its presence due to the shock in his heart just now.

Now, regaining his senses, that tiny speck could no longer escape his divine vision.

“Seeking death!”

Discovering that someone had been peeking into his memories, the Dharma King of the Xuantian Sect was enraged.

With a roar of divine intent, he instantly crushed the speck into pieces.

……

“Ugh…”

Li Fan emitted a muffled groan as he returned to reality from the Fallen Immortal Realm.

It seemed that his soul had suffered considerable injuries during this encounter.

The Limitless Fullness and Emptiness Method naturally circulated, repairing his injuries.

Li Fan remained immersed in the memories he had glimpsed within the mind of the Xuantian Dharma King.

Although it was only a fleeting glance, he had still uncovered a large amount of crucial and shocking information.

“Xuantian King… the Floating Starry Sky Formation.”

“And also…”

“The Faceless True Immortal.”

A strange gleam appeared in Li Fan’s eyes.

The Xuantian Dharma King who had possessed Li Chen was named Mo Rubin.

In the Ancient Cultivation Era, before the Xuantian Sect was founded, he had belonged to the cultivation sect Nine Refinement Temple.

Later, he was persuaded by the Xuantian King to join the Xuantian Sect.

……

“The Darkest Star Sea… High Wall.”

Unexpectedly, Li Fan found himself transported to such a desperate situation.

Yet he felt no despair.

Knowing the larger world context had instantly broadened his perspective.

“It seems that my previous idea of escaping the Xuanhuang Realm is impossible. If I want a chance to survive, I must first establish a foothold within the Xuanhuang Realm.”

“The power of a True Immortal… is required to leap over the High Wall.”

Li Fan’s gaze flickered.

Suddenly, he thought of the Supreme Treasure Fishing Pond.

He seemed to realize a possible breakthrough and his thoughts raced.

“Senior Stone Tablet said that while we fish in the Fishing Pond, the pond itself also fishes across the heavens, collecting treasures from the outside to replenish itself.”

“If the information I obtained from Mo Rubin’s mind is true, then the vast majority of cultivation worlds in this starry expanse of the Xuanhuang Realm have already been devoured by the Immortal Ruins.”

“Then…”

“It’s highly likely that the latest treasures collected in the Fishing Pool come from beyond the High Wall.”

“This also means that the so-called High Wall is not completely sealed.”

“There can still be communication inside and outside the High Wall. Just like…”

“…that Faceless True Immortal statue.”

Having understood part of the truth, Li Fan’s concern about the statue was temporarily eased.

Clearly, even True Immortals would not lightly venture into a place like the Darkest Star Sea.

Looking on the bright side, this also meant that aside from the True Immortal within the Immortal Ruins, Li Fan did not have to worry—at least for now—about other True Immortals descending to crush him in an instant.

“The Darkest Star Sea… a forbidden land for living beings.”

“But for me, it is a relatively safe place to develop.”

“Provided, of course, that I can successfully escape from this death zone.”

Having learned much about Mo Rubin, Li Fan’s fear toward him had significantly lessened.

He even began planning how to seek some benefit from him.

The Dharma-Transmiter—this was the highest-ranking existence within the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance that Li Fan had come into contact with since stepping into the Xuanhuang Realm.

Moreover, what made it even more intriguing was that this Dharma-Transmiter is not a true Dharma-Transmiter.

His true identity was that of the malicious Dharma King of the Xuantian Sect.

“Once you reach the position of a Dharma-Transmiter, even casually leaking a piece of information has unimaginable value and endless utility.”

“The only difficulty now is how to make contact with Mo Rubin and gain his trust.”

As before in the Fallen Immortal Realm, Li Fan had only glimpsed fragments of Mo Rubin’s memories.

However, any parts of these memories related to cultivation techniques, divine abilities, or secret arts had not been preserved.

Therefore, if he wanted to disguise himself properly in front of this Dharma King of the Xuantian Sect without revealing anything, he would need a long-term plan.

Mo Rubin’s infiltration into the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance seemed to have had no effect on the current situation in the Xuanhuang Realm.

The main point of contention remained the Immortal Ancestor Manifestation, which repeatedly appeared within the territory of the Five Elders Association.

The number of techniques it could employ was increasing, and the manifestation itself had become more lifelike.

From the latest footage transmitted from the Five Elders Association, even the solemn and majestic face of the Immortal Ancestor now exhibited subtle emotional fluctuations.

It was truly astonishing.

Perhaps because this Immortal Ancestor Manifestation was becoming increasingly realistic, the five Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereigns felt a hint of unease.

When the Immortal Ancestor Manifestation appeared once more, rolling black clouds suddenly emerged from the horizon, completely enveloping the sky.

The entire region was plunged into absolute darkness, all external and internal areas sealed, and the Immortal Ancestor Manifestation entirely consumed by shadow.

The final outcome of that battle remained unknown to Li Fan.

However, after this event, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance indeed became more restrained.

The frequency of the manifestation’s appearances slowed considerably, though it did not cease entirely.

Meanwhile, the Five Elders Association seemed to have lost hope that the Federation of All Worlds could gather intelligence on the Thirty-Three Chosen Immortal Candidates.

Requests for assistance had nearly disappeared.

At most, they feigned inquiries about the sudden destruction of the “Congyun Sea Mutual Aid Association.”

Li Fan simply responded that the Congyun Mutual Aid Association had no connection with the Federation of All Worlds.

The situation for the Federation of All Worlds was exceptionally favorable.

The Five Elders Association only needed to manage their own affairs.

Yet, paper cannot completely conceal fire. As the Immortal Ancestor Manifestation appeared more frequently, rumors about it finally began to spread within the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

Even though the alliance officially prohibited public discussion, it could not stop the enthusiastic cultivators.

For a time, opinions diverged wildly, and various speculations sprang up like mushrooms after rain.

Li Fan also paid attention, investigating and collecting information.

Most of these were merely cultivators’ conjectures, easily seen to be unreliable.

However, one particular rumor caught Li Fan’s attention.

It claimed that the Immortal Ancestor Manifestation was likely connected to the statues of the Immortal Ancestor scattered throughout the alliance.

“Everyone, have you ever wondered why every Heavenly City has a statue of the Immortal Ancestor?”

“And have any of you used a long-distance teleportation formation? These statues are actually hollowed out and serve as carriers for long-distance teleportation formations!”

“What a desecration!”

“Although the Immortal Ancestor does not meddle in worldly affairs, his divine authority remains. Without his permission, would those in power within the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance dare to do this?!”

“I am certain there is something strange going on here!”

A cultivator named Yue Gu declared with absolute confidence.

“Brother Yue makes a very good point! No wonder that every time I use that long-distance teleportation formation, when I see the cloud cluster representing the Xuanhuang Realm, I feel a strange, indescribable sensation in my heart.”

“I think you’re overthinking it. Clearly, the Immortal Ancestor’s manifestation is cast through the Thirty-Three Chosen Immortal Elects. What does that have to do with the statue?”

Everyone held their own opinion, and none could convince the others.

Li Fan, however, recalled the tall, high-crowned Immortal Ancestor statue in various Heavenly Cities and pondered deeply.

“The Xuanhuang Realm holds a uniquely important position in the heart of the Immortal Ancestor.”

“Even if he temporarily departs, he should not have left the Darkest Star Sea. And if I were the Immortal Ancestor, for safety’s sake, I would certainly leave contingencies in the Xuanhuang Realm, just in case.”

“Perhaps these statues themselves are the means of Immortal Ancestor.”

“And the Thirty-Three Immortal Elects are the keys to activating such means,” Li Fan guessed silently.

However, he was in no hurry to verify this.

After all, he had already secretly placed a Dissociation Disc inside one of the Immortal Elects, Wei Qizheng. Once Wei Qizheng perished, the recorded secrets would be transmitted back to Li Fan.

Li Fan did not believe that the frequent use of the Immortal Ancestor’s manifestation by the Thirty-Three Immortal Elects—whose cultivation at most had reached Dao Integration—would come without any cost.

So, before this world ended, he would certainly be able to wait for the day Wei Qizheng fell.

That is, as long as there were no inexplicable accidents.

Temporarily setting aside the conflicts in the Xuanhuang Realm, Li Fan began to recreate a clone in the secret chamber of the Spiritwood Realm.

Previously, his clone, Ji Shaoli, had died at the hands of a young Dharma-Transmitter. With the Xuanhuang Realm in constant crisis, not having a clone was highly inconvenient.

This time, Li Fan secretly took a trace of Su Yuqing’s essence blood and used it to forge a new clone.

Unlike previous clone creations, Li Fan, having mastered the Limitless Fullness and Emptiness Method, applied special modifications to the clone’s soul.

All memories relating to [Truth] were completely removed from the soul.

The remaining memories were also adjusted.

The clone could still transmit sensations to the original, but the experiences of the clone could only be selectively received by the original.

In the clone’s memory, it considered itself a creation of the Ancient Xuantian Sect’s Sleeping Dharma King after awakening.

Severely injured, its memories were incomplete.

Yet it remembered the benevolence of the Xuantian King and vowed to rebuild the Xuantian Sect.

Quietly gathering forces from various minor worlds, it organized the Federation of All Worlds to recruit troops for restoring the sect.

Such manipulation of the soul had been impossible for Li Fan before.

But with mastery of the Limitless Fullness and Emptiness Method, it became achievable.

Although the method was somewhat crude, imprecise cutting could even injure the soul directly the method’s extraordinary soul-repairing ability allowed Li Fan, through repeated attempts, to achieve targeted soul modification.

Previously, he had fabricated Ji Shaoli’s memories to deceive the young Dharma-Transmitter. This was accomplished using the same method.

…

Three days later.

Looking at the male-bodied, female-faced, exceptionally handsome clone before him, Li Fan showed a satisfied expression.

“True caution means even your own clone must be guarded against.”

“In extreme circumstances, it may even need to be used as bait.”

This was the progress Li Fan had made after experiencing the young Dharma-Transmitter incident and the Xuantian Sect Dharma King event.

He pointed at the clone’s brow; the clone’s eyebrows twitched, gradually awakening.

“I’ll call you Li Qing.”

The created clone is always one cultivation level below the original.

Now, Li Fan is in the early stage of Nascent Soul, so his clone, Li Qing, is only at the perfection stage of Golden Core.
