Moreover, the clone possesses only the shell of the cultivation level; it has none of the foundation-establishing treasures or the Golden Core Laws within its body.

However, for Li Fan, this posed no real difficulty.

“Perfect opportunity to test how a clone, made from the blood and essense of the small-world Heavenly Dao incarnation, compares to Mr. Bai.”

Carrying his clone, he quietly returned to the Sword Tomb of the Heavenly Sword Sect.

He approached the unremarkable black sword.

Since he was not competing for a seat beside Heavenly Wonder Wooden Sword, he did not need to face the oppressive aura of the ten thousand swords in the tomb.

With the protection of the original, the clone could barely survive within the Sword Tomb.

Li Fan snorted coldly in his heart, completely ignoring the sword’s displeasure.

He summoned several beams of seven-colored light to protect the clone, Li Qing.

Then Li Qing approached the black sword and sat cross-legged.

Focusing his own mind, he condensed sword intent to nurture the blade.

Indeed, Li Fan intended to accelerate the maturation of the black sword using his own understanding of the Dao of Sword!

Since Li Fan’s comprehension of swordsmanship originated mostly from Heavenly Wonder Wooden Sword, it shared the same source as the creation of the black sword.

Thus, there was no violent resistance from the blade.

In this way, the clone, Li Qing, slowly imprinted its own mark, strand by strand, onto the black sword.

Perhaps due to the clone’s innate talent from being an incarnation of the Heavenly Dao, after some time, the murderous intent from Heavenly Wonder Wooden Sword gradually dissipated, seemingly accepting the result.

Li Fan observed the Sword Tomb for a while longer to ensure nothing went wrong before quietly departing.

Of course, before leaving, he left the clone Li Qing with sufficient measures to ensure that, even in case of an accident, it could forcibly pull out the black sword and retreat safely.

“With the clone assisting in catalysis, the time required for the black sword to transform into a miraculous object is greatly reduced. It should take only about a year to be born. Although its power may be slightly lower than if naturally nurtured, that matters little to me.”

As for the path of the clone afterward, since it had not experienced Heavenly Wonder Wooden Sword’s Foundation Establishment, Li Fan did not make any preemptive arrangements.

“Reportedly, Heavenly Wonder’s Foundation Establishment is unlike that of other miraculous objects. There is no need to seek other mystic realms, the method of life creation, or the spirit of heaven and earth; relying solely on Heavenly Wonder is sufficient.”

“We shall see how it unfolds.”

“If that is indeed the case, under the new cultivation system, this advantage would be immense. Free from the restrictions of required resources, the clone’s cultivation speed might even surpass mine, who relies on the [Sitting Immortal Art] to reap the benefits effortlessly.”

“At that time…”

Li Fan suddenly froze.

In principle, a clone’s cultivation cannot exceed that of the original.

But…

Just hypothetically, what if there were some special method to remove this limitation?

Could it result in the clone surpassing the original?

Although Li Fan could not achieve this yet, in the Xuanhuang Realm, with its long history and countless demons and monsters, such a thing had happened before, and it would not be surprising.

“Original… clone…”

Li Fan furrowed his brow. A thought that had briefly flashed through his mind before and then been discarded suddenly resurfaced.

He pondered silently, but did not return directly to the Spiritwood Realm. Instead, he made his way to the Fishing Pond.

Earlier, he had received a message from Lin Ling saying that Senior Stone Tablet, who had been comprehending the Dao, had suddenly awakened some time ago.

For the first time, he had left his fishing spot, and now walked silently in the backyard, strolling alone.

Li Fan recalled the images sent by Lin Ling of Senior Stone Tablet’s changing forms while pacing, and his heart trembled slightly.

Because that figure… was none other than Mr. Bai!

“It seems that Senior Stone Tablet must be aware of what has happened to Mr. Bai.”

His pacing and contemplation did not last long before Senior Stone Tablet returned to the form of an infant.

Li Fan did not approach, but bowed from a distance.

Then he quietly asked, “May I ask, Senior, how much you know about the Xuantian Sect?”

Li Fan knew that someone of Senior Stone Tablet’s stature, even while cultivating the Dao, was still capable of communicating with others.

“I have seen what you went through.”

“That Dharma King is named Mo Rubin. He is a decent person; you need not worry about your personal safety.”

Senior Stone Tablet spoke directly.

“As for other matters concerning the Xuantian Sect…”

Li Fan felt that the infant, with eyes closed in deep sleep, seemed to smile at him.

“I don’t know.”

Li Fan was momentarily stunned.

“The Xuantian Sect seeks to supplant Heaven itself. Even the Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao met such an end, let alone a mere little stone tablet like me.”

“Speaking of which, I do miss those days. Though I had my eyes closed, essentially a blind bystander, it was wonderfully quiet.”

“If not for being forced, I would not have joined in that commotion.”

“Alas…”

Senior Stone Tablet suddenly shifted tone: “However, if you now wish to return to the Xuantian Sect, perhaps I could give you some assistance.”

“I seek nothing else—only a moment of peace.”

As he spoke, a map appeared on the ground before Li Fan.

The terrain was unique. Familiar with the layout of Xuanhuang, Li Fan immediately recognized the location depicted.

“Go take a look there; perhaps you will gain something.”

With that, Li Fan’s vision blurred for a moment.

The next instant, he found himself outside a small, dilapidated temple.

Although it was territory of their Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, Senior Stone Tablet had reversed the roles, driving him out!

Yet Li Fan did not feel angered.

He sped toward the location indicated by the stone tablet.

The situation had eased, and he encountered no unusual circumstances along the way.

However, the patrol arrows in the sky seemed to have grown more numerous.

Originally, across the entire Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, there were only a handful.

Now, above every state, at least three patrol arrows circled day and night.

This indicated just how terrifying the recent military development of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance had become.

Fortunately, these patrol arrows did not attack indiscriminately. They seemed to have a method for distinguishing cultivators, targeting only the Five Elders Association members.

Li Fan, equipped with secret techniques, passed safely without incident.

Soon, he arrived at his destination.

A ring-shaped mountain, whose interior, rather than molten lava, was filled with blooming flowers.

But this beauty was only an illusion from a distance.

In reality, these flowers were formed by the dispersal of a special spiritual energy.

This energy could not be absorbed by cultivators and took the form of various flowers in the air.

This place was in Dongyong Prefecture—not exactly a remote area.

Yet its unique beauty always attracted many visitors.

When Li Fan arrived, he even saw a few cultivators arriving in small groups.

“You really enjoy playing the mysterious messenger… What am I supposed to do here?” Li Fan muttered to himself, activating his secret technique, [Execution of Xuantian].

The Execution of Xuantian secret technique, once created by the former Ten Great Immortal Sects to hunt down followers of the Xuantian Sect, naturally contains profound mysteries of its own.

When one activates [Execution of Xuantian], as long as there are people or objects connected to the Xuantian Sect nearby, a melodious bell tone will ring in the ear.

The higher the rank of the target within the Xuantian Sect, the more times the bell tolls.

Three tolls is the maximum.

Yet now, when Li Fan, filled with anticipation, carried the [Execution of Xuantian] secret technique around this ring-shaped mountain, not a single bell rang out.

“Hm?”

“Senior Stone Tablet isn’t the kind to play jokes…”

Although he was a little surprised, Li Fan did not really suspect that Senior Stone Tablet was merely teasing him.

“That’s right. With such strange terrain, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance must have already scoured this place long ago. If the Execution of Xuantian secret technique truly worked here, then whatever secrets are hidden would surely have been uncovered by now.”

After a brief pause, he dispelled the protective layer of Seven-Colored Divine Light and once again wandered leisurely through the ring-shaped mountain overflowing with blossoms.

This was the Ring Mountain of Dongong Prefecture, famed as the “Flowers of Spiritual Power.” The common saying went: they may be admired from afar, but must not be desecrated by touch.

Although these blossoms were formed by condensed streams of anomalous spiritual energy and could not be absorbed by cultivators, if one drew too close, that eerie spiritual energy would resonate and merge with the cultivator’s own qi.

If one failed to protect or purge themselves in time, it was all too easy to end up with countless blossoms of every color sprouting throughout the body—a tragedy beyond words.

And these blossoms were nearly inescapable.

Once they rooted themselves within, what they affected was not only the fleshly body. Even Foundation Establishment treasures or even a cultivator’s Golden Core of Law would be corroded by the Flowers of Spiritual Power.

Beautiful they might be, yet they were also perilous to the extreme.

But Li Fan at this moment was able to stride boldly into this sea of blossoms, allowing them to bloom freely within his body.

Naturally, this was thanks to the [Seven-Colored Jade Void Glimmering Light].

As long as he sealed his internal cave-heaven with the Seven-Colored Divine Light, then even if his fleshly body was destroyed hundreds or thousands of times, no real harm would befall him.

These blossoms of spiritual energy, to the touch, were no different from ordinary flowers.

They carried tangible substance, and even emitted a delicate fragrance.

Yet the more he came into contact with them, the more phantoms suddenly flickered before his eyes.

One after another, blossoms of spiritual power appeared within Li Fan’s body.

Far from discomfort, he instead felt his spirit surge with vigor.

The circulation of spiritual qi accelerated, and even his thoughts grew sharper and faster.

From his perspective, the blossoms before his eyes grew ever more radiant, dazzling, and irresistibly charming.

He could not bear to part from them.

Along his meridians, one blossom after another bloomed, forming a radiant road of flowers, leading directly toward his dantian and between his brows.

And even though he could clearly see the situation within his body, Li Fan felt no sense of danger at all.

On the contrary, he faintly produced the thought: “To die amidst a hundred flowers—what a romantic ghost I would make.”

Watching the blossoms of spiritual energy perform their dance within him, Li Fan merely sneered inwardly: “Such strangeness, bewitching the heart. As expected, it bears a resemblance to the Xuantian Sect’s cultivation arts.”

In less than the time of a single incense stick, Li Fan’s dantian was completely overtaken by blossoms.

Densely packed, beautiful, yet demonic.

The spot between his brows as well.

At this moment, the true nature of those spiritual power blossoms was finally revealed.

His body stiffened, and even his thoughts seemed on the verge of freezing.

Outside his Sea of Consciousness, those flowers stretched out roots, attempting to take root and invade.

Yet before they could succeed—

Li Fan’s body suddenly exploded without warning.

There was no spray of blood or flesh.

Instead, like fireworks bursting in the sky, countless blossoms that had been generated within Li Fan’s body scattered outward, drifting to fill the heavens.

It was, in its way, a beautiful sight.

These newly formed flowers floated with the breeze, gradually mingling with the blossoms that had long existed in the crater valley.

No longer distinguishable from one another.

Amid this scene of beauty, a figure slowly reappeared—

Li Fan.

“Strange…”

Li Fan raised his head to gaze at the flowers drifting across the sky, his brows faintly furrowed.

Even though he had detonated his own body in advance, preventing the spiritual power blossoms from devouring him further, Li Fan keenly noticed that, in the process, part of his soul and cultivation had unavoidably been lost.

For someone like him, even the loss of a tiny fraction could not escape his perception.

His expression grew solemn as he looked upon the flower sea drifting through the crater valley, moving seemingly without order.

If the devouring of his soul could still be explained as the strange nature of these blossoms, then the loss of his cultivation pointed unmistakably to one thing—this sea of flowers was, in all likelihood, formed from cultivators themselves.

“Neither truly alive, nor truly dead… lacking a physical form, transformed into blossoms…”

And recalling that the Senior Stone Tablet had indicated clues to the Xuantian Sect could be found here, Li Fan was now almost certain—this anomaly was tied inseparably to the Xuantian Sect’s Dharma King.

“To linger for thousands of years in such an inhuman form… if that Dharma King still lives…”

Li Fan drew in a sharp breath. “No wonder they are called a legacy of the Immortal Realm.”

The secret had been uncovered.

The next step was to unravel it.

Li Fan pondered in place for a long time, until his second and third bodies in succession exploded.

Amid the repeated corrosion of the blossoms, he finally discerned a possible method of resolution.

He focused his mind and condensed a fourth body.

Then he rose into the air, embracing the flower sea to the fullest extent.

This time, Li Fan paid no heed to the changes within his body.

Instead, he devoted his full attention to the fleeting images flashing before his eyes.

Fragmented, fleeting—short scenes with no apparent connection, each recording an isolated event.

Within his Sea of Consciousness, the Dao Deviation Stone spun to its utmost.

Li Fan memorized every one of those broken, fleeting images.

When he had accumulated enough, his body could endure no longer and exploded once more.

Unhurried, Li Fan simply created another new body and repeated the process.

Such bizarre behavior naturally drew the notice of other cultivators in the area.

At first, some thought to approach, to strike up conversation or pry into the matter. But once they felt the oppressive might Li Fan released, their expressions changed, and they lowered their heads and departed quickly.

Time flowed on.

The number of fleeting visions Li Fan had collected grew ever larger.

Like fragments of a shattered puzzle, he gathered the scattered pieces, and with the Dao Deviation Stone’s immense computational power supporting him, he sought to restore the original, complete picture.

In this crater valley, the drifting blossoms numbered in the countless trillions.

And within them lay innumerable broken visions.

Without the Dao Deviation Stone to sift through and organize them, Li Fan would never have had the slightest chance to reassemble them.

But now, as the blue light flickered again and again, sequences of complete images began to appear one after another in Li Fan’s mind.

Li Fan gazed at the series of light screens arranged by the Dao Deviation Stone.

“These recorded scenes can be roughly divided into two categories,” he murmured.

“Some are from cultivators who have fallen here over the years. Those hold little value.”

“As for the rest…”

A flicker of excitement flashed across Li Fan’s eyes.

“As I suspected—they all come from the same person.”

“One of the Twelve Dharma Kings of the Xuantian Sect… Ji Yuzhen!”

Li Fan extended his divine sense, touching one of the light screens.

In an instant, countless scenes poured into his mind as if he were experiencing them firsthand.

“Brother Xuanyuan? Didn’t you already ascend?”

“Heh, it seems you’re still the same—always in seclusion, never caring for worldly affairs. I’ve been back for some time now.”

The man before her had a firm and resolute face, his eyes shining like the stars of the heavens. His tone was warm, soothing to the heart.

“This Xuanyuan fellow… he must be none other than the Xuantian King. Though his looks aren’t as breathtaking as Mr. Bai’s, he is still strikingly handsome by any standard.” Li Fan thought to himself.

The Xuantian King let out a sigh, then spoke with grave sincerity:

“Zhen’er, there is something I wish to accomplish. It may put me against the entire world. Will you walk with me?”

Ji Yuzhen froze for a moment, but without the slightest hesitation she rose to her feet.

Spiritual power surged around her, rippling the white clouds crowning the mountain peaks.

“Very well!”

The Xuantian King was taken aback. “You’re not going to ask what it is?”

Ji Yuzhen held his gaze for a long moment, then smiled faintly and shook her head.

The Xuantian King averted his eyes, lowering his head with a touch of guilt. Then, breaking through the sea of clouds, he descended toward the mountain below.

Ji Yuzhen followed closely, her gaze fixed upon his departing figure, reluctant to turn away.

Li Fan withdrew from the vision, brows furrowed.

He continued to examine the second complete scene.

Inside a dim underground chamber.

The Xuantian King was recounting his experiences after ascension, along with his observations of the shifting of the Xuanhuang Realm.

Twelve figures stood scattered throughout the chamber.

Their expressions and faces alike were hidden within shadow, impossible to discern.

“This concerns the safety of countless lives in the Xuanhuang Realm. We cannot stand idly by. Xuanyuan Hong, do as you must—this old man will risk his very life to aid you.”

An aged voice rang out first.

Xuanyuan Hong bowed deeply toward the elder, his expression solemn. “Elder Cui, your righteousness is boundless!”

Several others echoed their agreement.

But a few remained impassive, unmoved.

Ji Yuzhen’s eyes, however, never once strayed from Xuanyuan Hong.

In the cramped chamber.

“Zhen’er, from the celestial records I’ve perused, I’ve chosen a cultivation art most suited to you.”

“Immeasurable Celestial Pivot Sundering Divine Technique.”

Xuanyuan Hong’s expression brimmed with excitement. “This method is wondrous beyond compare—the unification of body and soul, extending into the boundless and measureless!”

He spoke passionately, expounding upon the mysteries of the art.

Ji Yuzhen only smiled softly, listening in silence.

Upon a battlefield reeking of blood.

Ji Yuzhen’s body dissolved into myriad wandering soul-shards. Each fragment of divine soul turned into a wisp of ghostly light, claiming the life of an enemy cultivator.

As she reaped lives one after another, her gaze unconsciously drifted across the battlefield toward Xuanyuan Hong.

There he stood, besieged by several Longevity Immortal Realm cultivators, yet his expression remained unshaken.

Above his head, an ancient, simple mirror emitted a deep, shimmering light, sealing the surrounding enemies within.

Xuanyuan Hong’s brows arched sharply. He uttered a soft command:

“The Law Shall Not Be Violated!!”

A radiant brilliance swept across his body in a flash.

Afterward, the attacks launched by the five Longevity Immortals against Xuanyuan Hong all struck empty, as if vanishing into thin air, without the slightest effect.

“Strength of the Great Body!” Xuanyuan Hong declared once more.

He casually stretched out his hand, seizing the colossal seal that had silently torn open space above his head and descended, covering nearly half the sky.

“Eyes Like Torches!”

A golden beam of light shot forth from Xuanyuan Hong’s eyes.

Wherever his gaze swept across the five Longevity Immortals besieging him, a golden chain inexplicably appeared on their bodies, binding them firmly in place.

In an instant, the tide of battle turned!

“Execute the Will of Heaven!” Xuanyuan Hong’s voice grew cold and grim, his body emanating an awe-inspiring heavenly might.

He fixed his gaze on the five Longevity Immortals, their faces twisted in ferocity. In a flicker, he appeared above their heads.

Lifting his left foot, he stomped down fiercely.

Invisible ripples spread over the five Immortals.

Their expressions shifted from unwillingness, to panic, and finally to sheer terror.

Xuanyuan Hong showed not the slightest mercy.

In the blink of an eye, the bodies of the five Longevity Immortals melted away like ice in the sun, vanishing into the air.

Only illusory shadows of five fruits remained, radiating a strange brilliance.

With a wave of his hand, Xuanyuan Hong sent the five fruits soaring off as streaks of divine light, piercing through the skies.

The battle ended completely with the fall of the five Longevity Immortal realm cultivators.

...

A space resembling the endless starry heavens.

“Brother Xuanyuan, this is the Floating Starry Sky Formation?”

Ji Yuzhen gazed at the scene before her and let out a soft laugh. “It’s so ugly!”

Xuanyuan Hong’s expression was calm. “As long as it serves its purpose, that is enough.”

Before the two of them, countless golden chains tightly wrapped around and bound the Xuanhuang Realm, forming what looked like a golden flattened sphere floating in the void.

The chains were not completely still. They seemed to circle around some hidden core within, ceaselessly in motion.

Upon the golden chains were inscribed innumerable complex talismans.

“Now, let us begin the first attempt at capture.”

For the first time, Xuanyuan Hong’s voice carried a trace of tension.

As his words fell, hundreds of stars in the void ahead suddenly flared with light.

Xuanyuan Hong observed quietly for a moment, then locked onto one of them.

“Go!”

With a light flick of his finger, a golden chain shot out from the flattened sphere, flying straight toward the target star.

It entered the void in complete silence, without the slightest response, as if lost within endless nothingness.

Xuanyuan Hong maintained his focus, watching intently.

Several days later, he finally shook his head with some regret. “The navigational Dao-landmarkers and the actual position have once again shifted.”

“This attempt at capture has failed.”

With that, he pointed gently, and the golden chain stretching into the void began to retract.

“Shifted? Is it due to that unknown suction force?” Ji Yuzhen asked softly.

“Indeed. And not only our cultivation world—before long, the entire fabric of time and space itself will inevitably be affected.”

Xuanyuan Hong sighed. “We must hasten our progress.”

“Brother Xuanyuan, allow me to treat your injuries.”

Within the secluded chamber, Ji Yuzhen separated a strand of her divine soul and sent it drifting toward Xuanyuan Hong.

“Though it cannot compare to True Immortal Spirit Qi, my Immeasurable Celestial Pivot Sundering Divine Technique has just reached minor completion. If you consume my soul essence, your wounds should recover swiftly.”

Hearing Ji Yuzhen speak in such a way, Xuanyuan Hong’s expression sank.

“Nonsense!”

“The cultivation method you practice—would I not know it well? Though you can divide your soul into countless fragments, the only thing capable of healing my injuries must be the most refined, primal origin soul. If you lose that, your cultivation will suffer greatly!”

“How could I possibly allow that to happen!”

Yet, looking at Ji Yuzhen’s ever-gentle smile, Xuanyuan Hong could not bear to scold her further.

Instead, he consoled her softly:

“Zhen’er, don’t worry. It’s only a minor wound. If I go into seclusion for a time, I will fully recover.”

Ji Yuzhen silently nodded, her gaze lingering on Xuanyuan Hong, unwilling to move away for a long while.

...

Xuanyuan Hong, the Xuantian King, sat high upon the main seat. Below him stood the twelve Dharma Kings.

“In my last battle with the Grand Mage of Heavenly Capital, though I suffered slight injuries, I also gained much from the encounter.”

“I will soon enter closed-door cultivation. During this time, the affairs of the sect—both great and small, will be entrusted to all of you.” Xuanyuan Hong declared with solemn authority.

“Xuantian King, rest assured—there will be no mishaps!” replied the Dharma King known as Elder Cui, stroking his beard.

Xuanyuan Hong nodded slightly.

“If all goes well this time, I may be able to reforge a True Immortal body in the lower realms. Then, our plan to escape the Darkest Star Sea will be advanced by leaps and bounds!”

At these words, the expressions of the twelve cultivators varied.

Some were joyous and offered congratulations.

Some remained indifferent, betraying no interest.

Others were solemn, their thoughts unreadable.

...

In a shadowy secret chamber.

“Zhen’er, I sense that someone has been making restless moves lately. That person who once secretly contacted you…”

“Go find him.” Xuanyuan Hong’s calm tone carried a faint trace of killing intent.

Ji Yuzhen froze for a moment, then quickly understood.

“Brother Xuanyuan, you mean… to lure the snake from its hole?”

Xuanyuan Hong’s face darkened with murderous resolve.

“Exactly! This time, I’ll deal with him and that Grand Mage of Heavenly Capital—once and for all!”

Ji Yuzhen’s eyes lit up with delight.

“Brother Xuanyuan… you’ve already broken through?”

Xuanyuan Hong smiled and nodded.

Ji Yuzhen drew in a deep breath, suppressing the surge of excitement in her heart.

“Good. I’ve always kept up the pretense with that person. I’ll contact him as soon as I return.”

“Mm. But be cautious in all things.”

...

A crimson blood of slaughter surged skyward.

The dying screams of countless cultivators echoed through the air.

“Zhen’er, run quickly…”

After that final transmission, Xuanyuan Hong’s aura completely vanished.

Ji Yuzhen sped toward the last place where she had sensed his presence.

But something abnormal had already drawn the attention of many other cultivators.

Not only she, but the other Dharma Kings, as well as those swayed by the Grand Mage of Heavenly Capital, all rushed there in unison.

Fighting as they advanced. Racing against time.

“Junior Sister, there are far too many enemies! We must first find Brother Xuanyuan, and only then plan our next move!” transmitted Zhou Yangli, one of the twelve Dharma Kings, his expression grim.

The unease in Ji Yuzhen’s heart only deepened.

Indeed, the number of scheming cultivators was far beyond her expectations. But if Xuanyuan Hong was still there, none of this would matter.

Yet…

Ignoring the backlash as her soul transformed into streaks of azure light that scythed through the dense ranks of enemies ahead, Ji Yuzhen pushed herself to fly even faster.

The scene cut off abruptly at this point.

Li Fan carefully went over it again, making sure nothing had been overlooked.

“I never expected that the ambush by the Ten Great Immortal Sects back then was actually orchestrated by the Xuantian King himself. He wanted to lure out the unstable elements within the Xuanhuang Realm and resolve everything in a single strike.”

“But for some unknown reason, at that critical moment, something happened to the Xuantian King himself.”

“Interesting…”

Li Fan narrowed his eyes.

“If the information extracted from Ji Yuzheng’s memories is true, then at that time the Xuantian King had already gone a step further beyond the body of a Half-Immortal. He was already invincible within the Xuanhuang Realm, and after breaking through—who could possibly have stood against him?”

“The Ten Great Immortal Sects? The Grand Mage of Heavenly Capital? Or perhaps…”

Suddenly, the image of that faceless stone statue flickered before Li Fan’s eyes.

For some reason, a faint sense of dread welled up within him.

“That faceless statue was crafted by Xuanyuan Hong, in gratitude for the Faceless True Immortal who saved his life back in the Ascension Passage.”

“From what we can see, the Xuantian King, Xuanyuan Hong, was indeed a man of upright character.”

“But this Faceless True Immortal…”

“That’s harder to say.”

Li Fan analyzed silently to himself.

“Saving Xuanyuan Hong’s life casually back then doesn’t necessarily mean anything. Perhaps in the eyes of a True Immortal, a Half-Immortal like Xuanyuan Hong is no different from an ordinary mortal—worthless without utility.”

“But once Xuanyuan Hong condensed a True Immortal body, everything would change.”

Dark conjectures about what might have happened in those years stirred in Li Fan’s mind. The more he thought about it, the more reasonable it seemed.

It was like when he had once ruled over the Great Xuan: toward ordinary commoners, he had been gentle and approachable; but when facing officials and nobles, he had been sharp-eyed, predatory—like two completely different men.

By analogy, the Faceless True Immortal might also show different faces depending on the people before him.

This theory also neatly explained why the power behind the Faceless Statue cared little for the prayers of those from the Xuanhuang Realm, instead diverting them onto Li Fan himself.

“It seems that for now, using the statue’s abilities is safe enough—as long as I don’t reveal any [Immortal] power…”

Even so, Li Fan did not relax his vigilance toward the Faceless Statue.

After all, even the Xuantian King might have fallen to it.

How could Li Fan possibly be without fear?

“Ji Yuzheng’s memories are incomplete. The most crucial moments are missing—especially those concerning her cultivation methods. Either they were never here, or they were deliberately hidden.”

Li Fan gazed at the drifting blossoms all around.

“The Xuantian King once said that after cultivating the Immeasurable Celestial Pivot Sundering Divine Technique, one’s countless scattered soul-fragments are distinct from the Original Soul.”

“Now it seems that what lingers in this crater are merely Ji Yuzheng’s scattered soul-fragments. What I’ve obtained are only the memories dispersed among them.”

“As for the Original Soul that holds the truly vital information…”

Li Fan searched the crater once more, then frowned.

“It’s not here?”

“Either it’s hidden too deeply for me to detect right now… or it was never here at all.”

After a long time, unwilling as he was, Li Fan could only give up for the moment.

But even this gave him a new insight.

“With the information I’ve gained here, plus what I glimpsed from Mo Rubin’s mind, I can convincingly pass myself off as a member of the ancient Xuantian Sect.”

“If confronted and caught on details, I can always claim damage to my soul and memory loss.”

“The only flaw is that I can’t reproduce the cultivation methods of the Xuantian Sect…”

Li Fan recalled how, in Senior Sister Zhao’s illusion, she had once obtained several of those very techniques from the Xuantian Sect.

Based on the current information, Senior Sister Zhao might be the only person in the Xuanhuang World apart from the Dharma King of the Xuantian Sect who understands those inherited cultivation methods from the Immortal Realm.

“Senior Sister Zhao’s foundation lies in the Eternal Sole Dominance Art. As for the others…”

“Perhaps we can exchange something with her.”

The One-Heart Immortal Sect, the Great Dao is mine alone.

After pondering for a moment, Li Fan made his decision.

“I will wait until my clone retrieves the Black Sword from the Sword Tomb. I have already altered the clone’s soul—its mind holds no memories of [Truth]. Even if it becomes lost and trapped in her illusions, it won’t matter.”

“It will only take a year. No need to rush.”

For now, he temporarily left the surrounding crater. Just as he was nearing the Spiritwood Realm, Li Fan suddenly stopped in place.

He turned his gaze toward a certain direction at the center of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

Somewhere, nine new Dissociation Discs of this era had been born.

Perhaps the Final Dissociation Disc had originally been created by the fusion of nine such discs. Now, upon the birth of new sub-bodies, even across millions of miles, the Final Dissociation Disc could clearly sense their presence.

Even more…

Li Fan faintly perceived from the Final Dissociation Disc an emotion of hunger, of greed.

“Nine Discs becoming One has already forged a flawless, perfect Dissociation Disc. But if it were to devour another version of itself…”

“To what kind of evolution would the Dissociation Disc ascend?”

Even Li Fan, who had seen countless treasures, could not help but feel his heart stir with excitement.

After all, the Dissociation Disc had aided him immensely.

In this Xuanhuang Realm, a land crawling with hidden ancient monsters, compared with them in terms of foundation, cultivation, and divine abilities—even after cycling through countless reincarnations—Li Fan held no true advantage.

Except in the Dao of Formations…

Through lifetimes of accumulated experience, combined with the existence of this heaven-defying creation, the Dissociation Disc, Li Fan’s attainments in formations were enough to utterly crush others.

It could even be said that his level was far ahead of his era—an entire age beyond the rest!

Not long ago, he had laid down a recording formation in front of both the Dharma-Transmitter and the Xuantian Sect’s Dharma King, Mo Rubin, and yet neither side had noticed. This alone proved his superiority.

“In the Dao of Formations, only by overtaking through innovation is there any chance to break this stalemate early.”

“When ordinary formations are pushed to their utmost limits, the next step is…”

“Immortal-Rank Formations!”

“Between immortal-rank formations and common ones lies a gulf of qualitative difference. For the Dissociation Disc to undergo this next transformation, it requires data from at least one Immortal-rank formation…”

In Li Fan’s mind flashed the image of the Floating Starry Sky Grand Formation.

It had once been personally designed by King Xuantian, Xuanyuan Hong, bearing the hope of carrying the Xuanhuang World over the High Wall Barrier. That Floating Starry Sky Formation was likely the closest thing in the Xuanhuang World to an immortal-rank formation.

“Although the formation was damaged long ago in the era of the Ten Great Immortal Sects, some remnants must still exist.”

“In fact, in the 114th Era, the countless obelisks scattered across the Xuanhuang Continent may well be connected to the Floating Starry Sky Formation.”

“The Dissociation Disc, the Floating Starry Sky Grand Formation…”

“Both are top-level secrets that only the upper echelons of the Immortal Alliance can touch.”

Thus, Li Fan’s path in this lifetime had become clear.

He would have to find a way to contact Mo Rubin and gain his trust.

Then, by leveraging his status as a Dharma-Transmitter, he would acquire the classified knowledge he needed.

Compared with this, the improvement of his cultivation realm was of lesser importance.

With Li Fan’s current combat strength, as long as a Longevity Immortal did not appear, he could essentially move unhindered and remain safe from death.

The gulf between Dao Integration and Longevity Immortal realm cultivators was simply too vast. Even if Li Fan were to break through one or two more realms, he still might not be a match for a cultivator of the Longevity Realm.

Thus, it was better to take another path—a circuitous strategy to achieve the goal.

“Whether it succeeds or not will depend on Senior Sister Zhao.”

“But one mustn’t hang oneself from a single tree.”

With this thought, Li Fan returned to the Spiritwood Realm.

Before long, Shang Tianci came looking for him.

“Senior…” he stammered, clearly hesitant, words caught in his throat.

“What is it?”

“Yan Fangzhou’s condition seems a little bad. Would it be possible to let him out?” Shang Tianci asked cautiously.

Li Fan’s expression remained unchanged, revealing neither joy nor anger. “I will handle this matter myself. You may go.”

Shang Tianci did not dare to argue. He bowed and withdrew.

At once, Li Fan’s divine sense focused on Yan Fangzhou.

Speaking of which, this so-called “Heaven’s Chosen” had already been imprisoned by Li Fan for quite some time.

Confined within a reinforced version of the Two-Extreme Microdust Formation, no matter how he struggled, all he faced was endless repetition and monotonous scenery. There was no escape.

The formation severed him from the spiritual energy outside, preventing cultivation.

Even when he tried to calm his mind and meditate, it was impossible. At every crucial moment, the formation would issue precise disturbances, leaving him irritable, restless, and nearly driven mad.

Under such torment, Yan Fangzhou was on the brink of insanity.

He struck out indiscriminately at the surrounding illusions, venting his fury.

But it was nothing more than impotent rage.

Not only did it fail to change anything, it only worsened his own condition.

When Yan Fangzhou finally regained awareness, all his strength had been completely exhausted—leaving him like an ordinary mortal, slumped in defeat within the sealed formation, helpless and awaiting death.

After passing through stages of skyward roars, weeping, and despair, this “Heaven’s Chosen” now seemed to have lost all essence, spirit, and vitality.

He sat limp on the ground, eyes vacant, motionless like a statue.

Yet Li Fan did not appear to mock him. Instead, he carefully observed Yan Fangzhou.

Soon, a faint smile curved his lips.

Though Yan Fangzhou acted well, deceiving the sly and cunning Li Fan was still beyond him.

It was clear he had never truly seen what a completely broken person looked like.

For deep in his hollow gaze, a trace of spirit still remained.

“This is nothing but feigned madness—hoping to deceive the heavens and cross the sea, waiting for me to lower my guard so he can strike back.”

“Too bad. He might fool that fool Shang Tianci, but he can’t fool me.”

Li Fan shook his head slightly. “As long as you still have the wits to play tricks like this, you’re far from true collapse.”

“When you’re truly insane—then we’ll talk.”

With a light tap on Yan Fangzhou’s body, which stood stiffly before the black jade gateway, Li Fan once more reinforced the formation.

Only then did he leave in satisfaction.

Unaware that his cleverness had backfired, Yan Fangzhou continued his act of stupidity within the formation, waiting futilely for someone to come.

…

After resolving this small matter, Li Fan came before the Faceless Divine Statue.

Since he intended to win the trust of Mo Rubin, the Dharma King of the Xuantian Sect, Li Fan naturally had to play his role well.

The recruitment of followers must not be interrupted.

The closer he drew to the statue, the more images involuntarily surfaced in his mind.

They were all former members of the Mutual Aid Association who had once sworn oaths before the Faceless Stone Statue in the name of True Immortal of Salvation and Mortal Compassion.

Among all the feedback he sensed, the strongest came from Su Yuqing of the Great Li Realm.

Perhaps because she had truly gained tangible benefits in her cultivation, her faith in the True Immortal of the Compassionate Mortal World was the most pure and fervent.

Compared to before, Li Fan was now able to observe not just her surroundings, but—astonishingly—he could even faintly perceive some of the thoughts in her heart.

“Thanks to the blessings bestowed by the True Immortal, I was able to lead everyone safely back from the campaign against the Fire Realm.”

“This humble woman dares not break her promise. From this day forth, I vow to serve loyally at your side, unto death without regret.”

Su Yuqing bowed devoutly, knocking her head several times before the faceless stone statue she herself had carved.

At that moment, Li Fan sensed a strange force pierce through the restrictions of time and space and descend upon his body.

It was but the faintest trace—so thin it could almost be ignored compared to the boundless ocean of his own power.

Yet it bore some resemblance to the cultivation feedback from the Sitting Immortal Art, though its essence was entirely different.

It did not surge toward his dantian, but instead crept toward his sea of consciousness.

But Li Fan, who had long been wary of the Faceless True Immortal, would never let it succeed.

Seven-colored divine radiance flared forth, weaving into layer upon layer of light cocoons that enclosed this alien energy.

Once sealed, its reaction surprised him.

It did not struggle violently, but instead settled down in silence.

Unlike his own spiritual power that glimmered with soft white light, this faint golden strand, though weak, gleamed like pure gold.

Its grade seemed even slightly higher than spiritual power itself.

Li Fan examined this golden energy quietly for a long time.

He knew that this was the result of the faceless stone statue’s effect—transforming Su Yuqing’s gratitude and devotion into substance.

“Could this be the legendary Power of Faith? Or perhaps the Vow Power of All Beings?”

“Or something else entirely?”

“…Too little information. For now, I’ll simply call it Vow Power.”

Li Fan’s expression grew solemn.

Even knowing that this golden vow power was like poisoned candy, at this moment he had no choice but to swallow it.

The idol’s link to him was already established. Unless he immediately severed the truth of his incarnation, no matter how far he was from the statue, this golden vow power would always flow into his body.

Moreover, it was not a one-time occurrence.

As Su Yuqing continued her devout prayers, before long, another thread of golden vow power condensed, following the same path toward Li Fan’s sea of consciousness.

“Killing Su Yuqing would be useless.”

“Those cultivators who swore vows before the statue—they’ve all essentially become machines generating golden Vow Power.”

“Though they cannot yet match Su Yuqing, with time, the faceless stone idol will seep deeper into their hearts.”

“One day, they too will reach this state.”

Li Fan narrowed his eyes. Though startled, his mind remained calm as he weighed countermeasures.

Once more he drew upon his Seven-colored Divine Light, carefully isolating the new golden vow power and merging it with the first.

His countless reincarnations, his relentless gathering of hidden truths across the worlds—none of it had been in vain.

Soon, he had already devised a way to counter it.

And after some experimentation—the results were astonishingly effective.

Li Fan released the seven-colored divine light’s seal over the golden power of vows, then forcibly guided that alien energy, slowly gathering it within his dantian.

Yet even then, the energy remained restless, surging about as though it wished to rush into his Sea of Consciousness.

Just then—

A phantom figure suddenly took shape inside his dantian.

Like a whirlpool, it drew in the golden vow power that was about to escape, swallowing it whole.

“As expected—it works.” Li Fan’s heart leapt with joy.

That phantom figure was none other than the Calamity Body, the technique he had once used to store overflowing cultivation whenever he hit a bottleneck.

It had been a long time since he was last trapped in such a bottleneck. With no surplus cultivation to overflow and be wasted, this method had not been used for ages.

But now, when confronted with the troublesome golden vow power, it showed astonishing effectiveness.

This secret art of the Calamity Body originated from the [Supreme Primordial True Scripture].

In the ancient cultivation world, there were occasionally cultivators whose advancement was too fast, causing their foundations to become unstable.

At such times, the cultivator needed to forcibly suppress their realm and solidify their Dao foundation.

Every sect had its own method.

The Taishang Sect’s method was to manifest a phantom figure within the dantian, to house excess cultivation.

Since the sect believed an unstable foundation was itself a form of tribulation, they called this phantom vessel the Calamity Body.

“The true inheritance of the Taishang Sect came from the Grand Mage of Heavenly Capital.”

“And the Grand Mage of Heavenly Capital, like the Xuantian King, possessed a Half-Immortal body. It is highly possible that he, too, gained many inheritances from the Immortal Realm during those ancient calamities.”

“No wonder this method can restrain even the golden vow-power, which clearly surpasses ordinary spiritual energy by an entire grade.”

So Li Fan reasoned to himself.

Now that the Calamity Body was taking in the vow-power, it was as if the golden energy had found its rightful home.

From then on, without Li Fan’s deliberate guidance, it flowed naturally toward the golden Calamity Body within his dantian.

Seeing this, Li Fan finally breathed a sigh of relief.

“For now, the crisis is resolved.”

“This Calamity Body is an independent vessel. I can abandon it at any time, and it won’t affect my true body in the slightest.”

“Even if, in the worst case, it develops into a separate entity like Xu Bai of the 115th lifetime, it will lack its own will. That alone would make it far easier to deal with.”

“At present it is nothing more than a crystallization of energy, with no other abnormalities.”

After carefully examining and confirming this once more, Li Fan gave a small nod.

Deep down, he felt that as the golden vow-power accumulated further, the Calamity Body could even be detonated directly.

He could not be sure what the destructive force of such an explosion would be.

But he knew well that detonation was only the lowest, crudest method of using golden vow-power.

“Licking blood from the tip of a blade…”

Li Fan’s eyes turned dark and profound, as he murmured to himself.

He knew perfectly well the risks hidden behind this golden vow-power.

But with the [Truth] backing him, he didn’t have to cower before every possibility.

Just as he pondered how best to deal with this power in the future.

A sudden disturbance rose from within his body.

The source of the anomaly…

Was none other than the dark-golden skull sealed deep within the Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven, together with the gray mold festering inside it!

Perhaps because the Calamity Body had now accumulated a sufficient level of vow-power, even though the skull was sealed within the Cave-Heaven,

The gray mold sensed the presence of the golden vow-power.

Like a starving beast catching the scent of fresh blood—

For the very first time, the gray mold surged out from within the skull, madly crashing against the seven-colored walls of light around it.

The rainbow divine light was consumed at a terrifying pace.

Li Fan’s expression darkened. Mobilizing the spiritual power of the Five Elements Cave-Heaven, he quickly replenished the defenses with an unending stream of energy.

The gray mold spots seemed to have an obsession with this golden vow power.

Unlike their previous lazy, lurking state, they suddenly became extremely aggressive.

That relentless, unyielding posture—even Li Fan felt a chill run down his spine when he saw it.

If it weren’t for the inexhaustible spiritual power support from his Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven, in just this short time, the Seven-Colored Divine Light seal might already have been at risk of being broken.

“As expected of a baleful thing capable of extinguishing worlds…”

Li Fan’s heart grew cold, yet his hands did not pause as he continuously strengthened the seal.

What was at first only a thin cocoon of light was reinforced layer after layer until it became a thick sphere of radiance.

Only then did the gray mold spots lose their sense of the golden vow power, gradually calming down.

They retreated once more into the dark-golden skull, falling into dormancy.

“In fact, for those three characters, golden vow power may very well serve as a great tonic.”

“In other words, it might even be possible to use golden vow power to manifest or reproduce the three True Immortal Seal-Characters.”

“…”

At that thought, Li Fan fell silent.

It was certainly an extremely tempting notion—but the consequences of doing so might not be something he could bear.

The destruction of the Xuanhuang World was a small matter. If it attracted the notice of True Immortals within the Immortal Ruins, or even some unknown existences beyond those mighty ones, then even [Truth] might not be able to act in time.

Li Fan still remembered clearly: in his 115th lifetime, at the very end, when a True Immortal annihilated Xuanhuang with a mere glance, and [Truth] was automatically triggered.

The surrounding scene had not immediately dissolved into illusion.

Instead, everything had fallen into an extremely peculiar state.

Beyond [Truth]’s boundary was absolute darkness, forming a circular domain.

Outside that domain, the scenes of Xuanhuang’s destruction flashed past at incredible speed.

It was obvious that, in that moment, even the power of [Truth] had been somewhat affected.

“If I were to attempt it, it must be done through a memory-severed clone… or perhaps through another’s hand. I believe there are still quite a few people in Xuanhuang who hunger for the power beyond Longevity…”

Faces flashed through Li Fan’s mind as he began plotting suitable candidates.

Meanwhile, within the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, a rather sensational event had occurred.

Of course, this “sensation” was limited to a very specific circle.

That was—the former head formation master of the Formation Hall, Lu Xichan, had returned.

Back then, because the Alliance’s great protective formation had suffered repeated leaks and the traitor could never be identified, Lu Xichan resigned in shame, to appease public anger.

So much time had now passed. Though the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance still had not found the real leaker, they casually picked a scapegoat and closed the case. The impact of the incident had gradually faded, and thus Lu Xichan was reinstated to her original post.

However, according to rumor, Lu Xichan’s return was heavily backed by a Dharma-Transmitter.

Because of that, the process went unusually smoothly—so much so that even the factions within the Alliance who had always opposed her uncharacteristically fell silent, all at once.

After her return, Lu Xichan began making frequent, large-scale moves.

She transferred elite formation masters from Formation Halls across various prefecture to the headquarters of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, and her true purpose was hardly concealed.

Li Fan needed almost no effort at all to uncover it.

To the current protective grand formation of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, a comprehensive round of improvements was initiated. Moreover, through the power of formations, they aimed to create a force on the same level as the Immortal Ancestor.

At this critical period of confrontation, Lu Xichan invoked the grand cause of resisting the Five Elders Association as justification, and thus, no one dared to openly oppose her.

As a result, every formation master of decent talent from across the prefecture was selected.

That included He Zhenghao.

From the fervent words he uttered during his prayers to the True Immortal of Salvation and Mortal Compassion, it was evident that he was deeply moved.

He even fantasized that if he could rely on his exceptional formation talent to render extraordinary service in this matter, he might return in glory to the Heng Clan, raising his head proudly at last!

As for Li Fan, being the True Immortal of Salvation and Mortal Compassion, once he perceived He Zhenghao’s aspirations, compassion welled up within him and he decided to lend a hand.

Thus, in the days that followed, He Zhenghao would often find various details about the Xuantian Spirit-Sealing Formation surfacing vividly in his mind.

“If my guess is correct, the one standing behind Lu Xichan as the Dharma-transmitter should be Mo Rubin. Yet his intentions likely go beyond what appears on the surface…”

“His true objective should be the Tianxuan Mirror.”

Based on Li Fan’s experiences in previous reincarnations, Mo Rubin, as the Dharma King of the Xuantian Sect, ought to be able to impose certain restrictions upon the Tianxuan Mirror.

However, with the passage of millennia, the Tianxuan Mirror had gradually diverged from the Xuantian Treasure Mirror.

Relying on Mo Rubin alone was perhaps insufficient.

This was precisely why he sought out Lu Xichan—likely intending to harness the power of formations to restrain the Tianxuan Mirror.

“In the 115th lifetime, the Xuantian Spirit-Sealing Formation came first, and only then did Mo Rubin appear.”

“But in this lifetime, it is the reverse: first came Mo Rubin, and then the hope placed upon the formation.”

“Nevertheless, with my unseen influence pushing from behind, all paths shall ultimately converge at the same destination.”

Watching He Zhenghao suddenly enter a state of comprehension—intoxicated, elated, and reveling in the insight—Li Fan couldn’t help but smile faintly.

In his eyes, the Tianxuan Mirror, bound beneath the Xuantian Spirit-Sealing Formation and restricted by cultivators, was clearly far easier to deal with than the Tianxuan Soul Locking Formation evolved into its ultimate form, the Heavenly Net.

“Once He Zhenghao earns merit by contributing the formation diagram, his status at the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance headquarters will naturally rise like the tide. At that time, I may even coax those formation geniuses around him into joining the Mutual Aid Association.”

“As for whether the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance will detect it…”

A glimmer flashed in Li Fan’s eyes.

“Hmph. Mo Rubin knows full well that He Zhenghao is a member of the Mutual Aid Association.”

“With his vision, he will naturally discern that such a brilliant and intricate Xuantian Spirit-Sealing Formation could not possibly have been devised by someone of He Zhenghao’s mediocre aptitude. He will inevitably realize the true source of this formation—that it was I, once the Dharma King of the Xuantian Sect, who secretly lent my aid.”

“Barring any unforeseen accidents, he will likely cover up the matter on his own initiative—perhaps even take it upon himself to claim the Mutual Aid Association’s background as his own cover.”

Li Fan’s eyes gleamed.

“This is the unspoken understanding between comrades who once fought shoulder to shoulder in the ancient era.”

“If he truly acts in line with my intentions, then perhaps the time will soon come for us brothers to meet once again.”

“Of course, the premise is that I must first trick Senior Sister Zhao into handing over the Xuantian Sect’s cultivation method.”

As for what he would use to exchange with her, Li Fan hadn’t yet decided.

If he could obtain it without giving anything, that would be ideal. If not, he still held many things that Senior Sister Zhao would be interested in. He was confident he could persuade her.

Picturing the future, Li Fan felt a surge of satisfaction.

He truly relished this sense of orchestrating everything from behind the scenes and determining victory a thousand miles away.

However, the world is ever unpredictable.

During the year that Li Fan patiently waited for the changes within the Xuanhuang Realm, and for his clone to successfully retrieve the Black Sword, something utterly unforeseen occurred—something that had never once happened in any of his previous cycles of reincarnation.

That day, Tianyang, who had been lying idly within the Spiritwood World, suddenly sat upright.

He gazed in a particular direction toward the Xuanhuang Realm, his expression solemn.

Tianyang’s unusual behavior immediately caught Li Fan’s attention.

He knew his junior brother’s temperament well. Aside from himself, Tianyang rarely showed concern for anything or anyone else.

To see such grave seriousness on his face now could only mean that something extraordinary had happened.

“Junior brother, what is it?” Li Fan flashed before him, pretending to ask casually.

“I sensed an extremely powerful spatial fluctuation descending upon the Xuanhuang Realm. It vanished in an instant, making it impossible to pinpoint the source.”

Li Fan’s heart skipped a beat. “An extremely powerful spatial fluctuation? What do you mean?”

“If it were just ordinary spatial teleportation within the Xuanhuang Realm, it would not produce such an intense ripple. This means the Xuanhuang Realm…”

“Has received a visitor from beyond the heavens?” Li Fan interjected.

Tianyang gave a slight nod.

At once, Li Fan’s expression grew grave.

“In this dark star sea, there are still cultivators alive?”

“Or… could this person have come from beyond the Great Wall?”

Countless thoughts flashed through Li Fan’s mind.

Even with his usual composure, he found himself unsettled.

The matter of an outsider arriving from beyond the heavens was shocking enough, but what truly disturbed him was that such an event had never occurred in any of his prior reincarnations.

Where had the course of fate diverged, leading to the descent of a guest from beyond?

“Or perhaps…”

A sudden thought stirred in Li Fan’s mind. “Maybe this did happen in previous lives, but at that time my strength was too low to perceive it.”

After pondering for a long while, Li Fan finally calmed himself.

Such a tremendous disturbance would certainly not go unnoticed by the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance or the Five Elders Association.

He decided to first observe their reaction.

“Junior brother, I’ll trouble you for a while. See if you can trace that spatial fluctuation,” Li Fan instructed.

Tianyang nodded in acknowledgment.

As it turned out, although the descent of the heavenly outsider remained unknown to the common populace, it undeniably caused considerable unrest among the ruling powers of the Xuanhuang Realm.

Most notably, the previously tense standoff between factions had suddenly eased.

For more than thirty consecutive days, the Immortal Ancestor Manifestation of the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance did not appear again.

Meanwhile, the Five Elders Association was eerily quiet, almost unnaturally so.

It was as if both sides had paused their ongoing struggles to focus on something else entirely.

Li Fan, too, sent a message to the Five Elders Association, inquiring about the intense spatial fluctuation.

Their reply confirmed his suspicions: they had indeed detected the anomaly and were already investigating its cause.

They further added that, should the Federation of All Worlds discover anything, they were to report it immediately.

…

"Such seriousness is rarely seen." Li Fan rubbed his chin, his brow slightly furrowed.

"The most crucial thing is that the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance joined hands with the Five Elders Association. After searching for so many days, they still have not found that outsider from beyond the heavens?"

A faint sense of unease rose in Li Fan’s heart.

After pacing back and forth several times, he finally made up his mind.

He went to the small, worn-out temple in Yongyun Prefecture and stood before the Stone Tablet Elder.

"You are talking about that fluctuation from not long ago?" Senior Stone Tablet seemed to have truly grasped some insight into the Way of Fishing. The aura around him fluctuated unpredictably, rising and ebbing like the tide, exuding an invisible pressure that shook the surroundings.

With Li Fan’s current strength, even trying to get close caused him to be forcibly pushed away by that unintentional power. Li Fan could not help feeling alarmed.

"Yes. The intensity of that spatial fluctuation clearly exceeded the standard of spatial teleportation within the Xuanhuang Realm. If it truly came from beyond this world, I fear..." Li Fan said with a worried expression.

"The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and the Five Elders Association have been searching together, yet still have no results. For the safety of the Xuanhuang Realm, I could only come to seek your guidance, Senior."

Senior Stone Tablet fell silent for a long time.

However, it was not that he refused to answer—it was as if he had fallen asleep.

After a while, when he awoke again, he shook his head and smiled. "Though I have long grown weary of this life, I still bear the responsibility of the Genesis Stone Tablet. If the Xuanhuang Realm were truly facing life and death, how could I possibly sit idly by?"

"This matter is actually a misunderstanding. It was not an outsider from beyond the heavens..."

"In any case, if you truly wish to know the full story, go to this place and find this person."

As the Senior Stone Tablet spoke, he lightly tapped toward Li Fan.

Immediately, corresponding information surfaced within Li Fan’s mind.

Senior Stone Tablet once again immersed himself in the insights of the Way of Fishing. Li Fan bowed respectfully and then departed.

"Qinghuang Prefecture, Han Zhong?"

Li Fan frowned as he examined the information the Senior Stone Tablet had sent him.

He had been to Qinghuang Prefecture before.

It was located in the southwest corner of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, desolate and remote, vast in land but sparsely populated.

Compared to the Congyun Sea, it was even more backward, ranking at the very bottom among all territories under the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

"Could it be that precisely because of that, it is the most suitable place to hide?"

Thinking so, Li Fan turned into a streak of light and flew toward Qinghuang Prefecture.

After considerable effort, when he finally arrived and stood before Han Zhong’s residence, even before entering, Li Fan smelled a strong scent of alcohol.

"Why does no one believe me?"

"Good wine!"

"Heh, it’s all fake, nothing but a dream! Hic..."

Li Fan’s frown deepened.

Stepping into the room, he saw a disheveled cultivator with an unkempt beard, his clothes tattered, lying sprawled on the floor without a shred of composure.

In his hand, he clutched a wine jar tightly, his eyes unfocused.

A sweep of divine sense across Han Zhong’s body revealed no danger.

The man was merely a mid-stage Golden Core cultivator, posing no threat whatsoever.

"You are Han Zhong?" Li Fan asked coldly.

Han Zhong looked at Li Fan in confusion, his gaze vacant for a few seconds.

Then, as if he had not seen Li Fan at all, he lifted the wine jar again and continued drinking.

Li Fan snorted coldly and was about to use a Soul-Searching Secret Art to extract the truth directly from the drunkard’s mind.

However, just as his right hand touched Han Zhong’s head, he suddenly withdrew it, as if burned by fire.

"Hm?"

Li Fan stared at his palm in astonishment.

Though his flesh appeared unharmed, he could clearly sense that at the instant of contact, his divine soul had withered!

It was not an injury—it was as if his very soul was decaying, like that of a cultivator on the verge of death.

Li Fan’s heart trembled.

He knew that his divine soul strength at this moment was such that even among Dao Integration cultivators, few could match him.

Yet now, before a mere Golden Core cultivator, he had been injured?

Li Fan’s face was dark and silent.

He immediately began circulating the Limitless Fullness and Emptiness Method, attempting to mend the damage within his soul.

But to his surprise, the technique said to possess endless power and undying soul essence had actually lost its effect before the withered state of his spirit!

Sensing that the black corruption within his soul seemed to be spreading, Li Fan’s heart sank. Without hesitation, he chose to sever the decayed portion.

His head felt as if struck by a heavy hammer. His vision went white, dizziness overwhelmed him.

His complexion turned pale. In that single instant, at least half a year’s worth of the Limitless Fullness and Emptiness Method’s soul-nourishing effect was wiped away.

Li Fan instantly understood what had happened to him.

If the strength of one’s soul could be quantified, then all the previous damage he had suffered merely reduced that number temporarily. Once the Limitless Fullness and Emptiness Method circulated, the value would return to its peak.

However, this unknown spiritual decay directly affected the upper limit of his soul strength itself.

A dangerous gleam appeared in Li Fan’s eyes. His figure flashed as he instinctively retreated far from the drunken Han Zhong ahead of him.

The drunkard seemed completely unaware of what had transpired, still muttering nonsense.

Suppressing the killing intent rising in his chest, Li Fan’s gaze flickered. A sudden torrent of water appeared above Han Zhong’s head.

Splash!

It poured down endlessly upon him.

“Mm? Mm!”

Han Zhong was truly dead drunk. It took quite some time for the water to finally rouse him from his stupor.

Dazed, he stared blankly at the column of water descending from the heavens, confusion covering his face.

“You’re awake?” Li Fan’s cold voice reached his ears.

Only then did Han Zhong realize that an uninvited guest had appeared in his home.

He raised his hand to block the falling water and slowly stood up.

“You are…”

“Who I am is not important. What matters is that I am very interested in your… experience.” Li Fan’s sharp gaze swept across Han Zhong repeatedly.

A chill rose within Han Zhong’s heart.

Sensing that this visitor was no ordinary figure, Han Zhong dared not show any disrespect.

With cupped hands, he bowed deeply and said respectfully, “Senior, please ask anything you wish. I will tell you all I know, without concealment.”

Li Fan nodded slightly. “I heard you muttering in your drunken sleep that no one believed you. What was that about?”

At those words, Han Zhong’s expression turned somewhat awkward.

“It is, in truth, a rather… peculiar experience of mine,” he said. “I once spoke of it to others, but no one believed me. I even reported it to the Immortal Alliance, yet it was left unresolved. If Senior is truly interested, I can recount it again.”

Seeing Li Fan give a slight nod, Han Zhong paused for a moment, organizing his thoughts before continuing slowly.

“I do not know how many years ago it was, but I did something foolish…”

He was immediately interrupted by Li Fan.

“What do you mean, you ‘don’t know how many years ago’?” Li Fan frowned slightly at the man before him, a Golden Core Lord clearly no older than a hundred years.

Han Zhong gave a bitter smile. “Because, this junior truly does not know how long it has been since I left the Xuanhuang Realm and then returned. The people I once knew have already died, and even my identity within the Immortal Alliance was erased because too much time had passed.”

“Even the Tianxuan Mirror no longer recognizes me. All the contribution points I had accumulated back then are completely gone.”

When Li Fan heard the words “left the Xuanhuang Realm,” his heart skipped a beat.

And when he heard the word “returned,” he became certain that the one responsible for the spatial disturbance earlier was none other than the man before him, Han Zhong.

This realization stirred Li Fan’s curiosity about the man’s experiences.

“Go on,” Li Fan said.

Seeing that Li Fan did not mock him, Han Zhong’s spirits lifted.

He casually lifted the wine jar beside him and took a deep swig, then continued, “Back then, I was young and arrogant. I doubted all forms of authority.”

“When I traveled to Nine Mountains Prefecture, I was awed by the sight of the nine mountain ranges stretching endlessly across the land, where cultivators were forbidden to fly. I also heard that using teleportation arrays within Nine Mountains Prefecture carried great risks…”

“At that time, I do not know what I was thinking, but I insisted on taking the risk and trying it myself.”

Han Zhong sighed deeply.

Li Fan narrowed his eyes, suddenly recalling something.

While studying the records of Nine Mountains Prefecture, he had once come across a strange rumor.

It told of an unfortunate cultivator who, driven by reckless curiosity, tried to use a teleportation array there—only to be sent outside the Xuanhuang Realm, never to return.

“You were that unlucky fool who was said to be teleported outside the Xuanhuang Realm?” Li Fan asked.

Han Zhong did not expect this senior to have heard of his story. His old face turned slightly red.

“Yes, that was this junior. Back then, I was ignorant and overconfident. I truly did something foolish.”

Li Fan’s curiosity deepened. “After you left the Xuanhuang Realm, where did you go? What did you see?”

A trace of fear and confusion flickered in Han Zhong’s eyes.

“In truth… I am not too sure where I was after leaving the Xuanhuang Realm. It was as if I was trapped inside an invisible bubble, drifting endlessly through boundless darkness.”

“Most of the time, everything outside was pitch black and unchanging. But occasionally, distorted scenes would flash by in an instant.”

“But…” Han Zhong shuddered. “At that time, I was almost driven mad. So I cannot be certain whether what I saw was real or merely an illusion.”

“So what exactly did you see?” Li Fan’s tone was already tinged with impatience.

“I saw…” Han Zhong fell silent for a long time.

His expression showed he was struggling internally.

Finally, he lowered his voice and said tremblingly, “I think I saw the Immortal Ancestor.”

As he spoke, he activated a Water Mirror Technique to display what he had witnessed.

On the round curtain of light appeared endless darkness.

Suddenly, a beam of golden light flared—so striking within that void.

As it drew nearer, the golden light gradually revealed a figure.

White-haired, with a long flowing beard. His expression was solemn, his presence naturally commanding respect.

And that face—throughout the Xuanhuang Realm and the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance—was one everyone knew.

It was exactly the same as the statues of the Immortal Ancestor erected in every floating celestial city.

“That… should be the Immortal Ancestor, right?” Han Zhong asked uncertainly.

Li Fan stared at the image on the light curtain and slowly nodded.

He was not surprised that the Immortal Ancestor would appear beyond the Xuanhuang Realm.

What truly caught his attention was what lay behind the Immortal Ancestor.

The Immortal Ancestor was soaring through the endless void, and from his body extended several golden chains—stretching far back, connected to something beyond sight.

The object bound by golden chains was shrouded in a hazy radiance.

Its details could not be clearly seen, yet there was no doubt it was an enormous existence.

Compared to the Immortal Ancestor’s size, it was nearly as vast as half of a prefecture within the Xuanhuang Realm.

And yet, as the Immortal Ancestor dragged this colossal mass along, it seemed he felt no strain at all.

His expression remained unchanged, as calm and cold as eternal ice.

With that massive orb of light trailing behind him, the Immortal Ancestor resembled a comet flying backward through the endless dark void.

In just a few moments, he vanished completely from sight.

The scene within the Water Mirror Technique ended there, but Han Zhong did not stop his narration.

“What I just described,” he said, “is only one of the many scenes I witnessed during the long years of my imprisonment.”

As Han Zhong spoke, he repeatedly cast the Water Mirror Technique.

Before Li Fan, more than a dozen shimmering screens appeared.

Each displayed a similar image, yet with faint differences.

In every one, the Immortal Ancestor was dragging a glowing sphere behind him with golden chains.

The only difference was that the light spheres varied in size.

“These scenes look far too alike,” Han Zhong muttered.

“To the point that I even began to doubt myself, wondering if despair had driven me to hallucinate.”

He looked at his own conjured visions with a face full of confusion.

Li Fan, however, knew this was certainly no illusion.

The Immortal Ancestor’s image could be imagined from a statue he had once seen, but those golden chains behind him…

With Han Zhong’s cultivation only at the Golden Core stage, there was no way he could have drawn such details unless he had truly seen them with his own eyes.

Because Li Fan had seen those very same golden chains before.

They were the ones from the Floating Starry Sky Formation recorded in the memories of Ji Yuzhen, the Dharma King of the Xuantian Sect.

The Floating Starry Sky Formation could use those golden chains to capture pocket worlds and small realms.

Thus, Li Fan naturally arrived at a reasonable speculation.

“Could it be,” he thought, “that what the Immortal Ancestor is dragging behind him are other worlds?”

“He left the Xuanhuang Realm, traveling through the pitch-black sea of stars, to collect the remaining fragments of the cultivation worlds scattered throughout the cosmos?”

In an instant, countless thoughts surfaced in Li Fan’s mind.

“What is the purpose of doing all this?”

“Where are these cultivation worlds now?”

“Could it be that controlling the Xuanhuang Realm alone is not enough for him, and he seeks to devour more cultivation realms to advance even further?”

“To break through and become a True Immortal?”

Combining all the information he had recently gathered on the Xuantian Sect, Li Fan derived what seemed the most reasonable conclusion.

Just as Li Fan fell silent in deep thought, Han Zhong noticed his lack of response. Believing that Li Fan also thought he had hallucinated due to despair, Han Zhong hesitated for a moment before adding,

“In fact, besides the Immortal Ancestor, I once saw another person.”

“I had never seen that person before, and he appeared only once.”

“That is why I believe what I witnessed may not have been an illusion at all.”

As he spoke, Han Zhong once again activated the Water Mirror Technique.

The image that appeared made Li Fan’s heart tremble violently.

Because the figure soaring through the void was one of Li Fan’s deepest psychological shadows.

The Heavenly Doctor (Tianyi).

The Heavenly Doctor flew swiftly through the darkness, surrounded by a white, sacred radiance.

Unlike the Immortal Ancestor, there were no golden chains dragging anything behind him.

He merely paused and moved again, as if making calculations with his fingers while traversing the starry void.

After successfully discerning the direction, he hurriedly flew onward.

“Heavenly Doctor actually managed to escape the pull of the Immortal Ruins?”

“How could that be possible?”

The instant Li Fan saw Heavenly Doctor, that thought surged up in his mind.

Utterly shocked, he quickly glanced toward Han Zhong.

He even began to suspect that this might all be some scheme fabricated by Han Zhong against him.

Although Heavenly Doctor’s true cultivation level was unknown, Li Fan had never once dared to underestimate him.

Even now, though Li Fan was considered invincible beneath the Longevity Immortal Realm, he would not claim he could gain any advantage if he faced Heavenly Doctor.

Heavenly Doctor’s identity was shrouded in mystery.

He could issue missions through the Tianxuan Mirror.

Yet aside from that single mission involving the Cloud-Water Diagram, Li Fan had never been able to find any trace of him within the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance during his many reincarnations.

It was as if Heavenly Doctor, though technically part of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, stood in a different position from ordinary cultivators.

More like Emperor Sanmo, serving in some “guest elder” capacity, rarely showing himself in public.

Moreover, Heavenly Doctor’s abilities were extraordinary.

That secret art of observation, listening, inquiry, and pulse diagnosis could peer directly into the heart of a cultivator. Other than Heavenly Doctor, Li Fan had never seen anyone else capable of such a thing.

But even after already assuming the highest possible estimation of Heavenly Doctori’s true cultivation, Li Fan never imagined that Heavenly Doctor could, like the Immortal Ancestor, could ignore the restraints of the Immortal Ruins to leave the Xuanhuang Realm and wander freely through the Darkest Star Sea.

“To be capable of what even Longevity Realm experts cannot accomplish...”

“What in the world...”

Li Fan’s heart trembled violently.

But soon he calmed himself down.

“No, that doesn’t necessarily mean Heavenly Doctor’s strength has surpassed the Longevity Immortal Realm.”

“The Longevity Immortal Realm is indeed powerful, but the price is that one becomes deeply bound to the Xuanhuang Realm itself.”

“Unless one achieves transcendence like the Immortal Ancestor, they will never be able to leave this world.”

“Even without the Immortal Ruins, that remains unchanged.”

“This doesn’t mean Longevity Immortal Realm cultivators cannot resist the pull of the Ruins.”

“Heavenly Doctor, however, never attained Longevity. Perhaps for that very reason, he can move freely beyond the bounds of the Xuanhuang Realm.”

...

After slowly organizing his thoughts, Li Fan’s mood gradually steadied.

Han Zhong, who had been observing him closely, could not discern any change in Li Fan’s inner state.

Li Fan’s unchanging expression gave nothing away.

With a trace of regret, Han Zhong continued, “Aside from the scenes I’ve already described, I didn’t see anything else.”

“I don’t know how long I remained within that invisible bubble. For most of the time, I was surrounded by absolute darkness.”

“I’m amazed I didn’t go insane from it.”

“Also, I discovered that inside that bubble, I showed no signs of aging.”

“At first, I thought if I were to suffer such endless confinement, it might be better to end my own life.”

“But not long ago, for some reason, the bubble seemed to encounter something.”

“It began to shake and shrink...”

“I thought I was doomed,” Han Zhong said with some relief, “but before the bubble completely collapsed, there was a loud bang, and somehow, I found myself back in the Xuanhuang Realm.”

“Of course, when I saw that vast plain, I had no idea it was the Nine Mountains Prefecture. Only after meeting some cultivators from the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and questioning them did I finally understand.”

Han Zhong recounted his strange experience in full detail.

While Li Fan was still deep in thought, he suddenly heard Han Zhong’s voice tremble with astonishment, “You are...”

But the words were not directed at him.

Startled, Li Fan turned around—and saw that at some unknown moment, a figure had silently appeared in the room.

It was—

Heavenly Doctor!

Although he could not understand why the Heavenly Doctor suddenly appeared here, ever since the last time he was “diagnosed” by the Heavenly Doctor and almost failed to restore his true self, Li Fan had already rehearsed countless times in his mind what to do when they met again.

So, in that instant like lightning flashing between clouds, Li Fan made what he believed to be the most correct choice.

His mind went completely blank, his thoughts seemingly frozen in stillness.

Yet, that abnormal reaction instantly drew the Heavenly Doctor’s attention.

He lightly pointed toward Han Zhong,

and several streaks of silver light flashed out in an instant—like countless silver needles that sealed Han Zhong completely within the surrounding space.

The expression on Han Zhong’s face froze,

his thoughts suspended in that very moment.

Then, the Heavenly Doctor turned his clouded eyes toward Li Fan. A faintly amused expression appeared on his face.
