Li Fan did not think at all. His instinctive response came first.

“Cut the nonsense, you scum. Someone like you deserves to be destroyed by all!”

With a face full of righteous fury, Li Fan shouted,

then launched several strikes of the Great Five Elements Annihilation Sword Light in rapid succession.

Within the black sword light, the Heavenly Calamity Sword Intent was greatly strengthened.

Facing the incoming sword light, the Heavenly Doctor did not dodge. He merely looked at that familiar sword intent, and a subtle wave rippled through his gaze.

Without making any visible movement, the hundreds of black sword lights suddenly curved midair on their own, all converging into the Heavenly Doctor’s outstretched left hand.

There, he casually crushed them into a single black sphere.

Li Fan lost all control over his attack.

Such a divine level of skill truly shocked Li Fan—

and this time, it was not part of his act.

But he quickly recovered and continued his performance.

“Old thief!”

Seeing his attacks blocked so easily, Li Fan’s expression turned furious.

He cursed, then pointed a finger toward the Heavenly Doctor’s forehead as his figure turned into a streak of light, retreating rapidly.

Yet to his horror, he found that the small room where Han Zhong lived had suddenly become boundlessly vast. No matter how far he fled, he could not escape.

“Heavenly Calamity Sword, Cloud-Water Illusory Dream Technique...”

“What else can you do?”

Despite Li Fan’s insults and disrespect, the Heavenly Doctor did not grow angry.

He only looked at Li Fan with complex eyes and asked softly.

“Bah! You dog thief, don’t try to trick me!

Falling into your hands today is my bad luck!

If you want to kill or torture me, do as you please!”

As if admitting he was no match, Li Fan spat in disdain, his voice righteous and unyielding.

“Hmph.” The Heavenly Doctor gently shook his head,

as if not surprised by Li Fan’s attitude.

“So many years have passed, and they still have not changed. Still hating me that much...”

He let out a light chuckle.

Li Fan’s anger flared.

“A sea of blood vengeance will never fade, not even after a thousand lifetimes!”

“Young man,” the Heavenly Doctor said with a faint smile,

“If I told you that I am a good person, would you believe it?”

Li Fan studied him closely again.

White hair, kind eyes, and a benevolent face—

at first glance, he looked nothing like an evil man.

Yet Li Fan still snorted coldly.

“Old thief, don’t try to deceive me. You can know a man’s face, but never his heart.”

The Heavenly Doctor laughed softly, then asked again, “You can believe the words of a madman, so why can’t you believe me?”

Li Fan’s expression changed.

Before he could respond, the Heavenly Doctor continued, “If I were truly a bad person, would Tian Jue still be alive and well right now? He’s insane and confused, but you cannot understand that either, can you?”

Li Fan’s expression froze as if he had fallen into deep thought. Judging by his face, there was indeed some doubt in his heart.

“Sometimes, things are not as simple as they seem. Even what you witness with your own eyes may not be the truth,” the Heavenly Doctor sighed softly, his tone filled with endless age and weariness.

Li Fan remained silent. He clearly would not be persuaded so easily by a few words.

However, the Heavenly Doctor did not seem to mind.

“It’s fine. Soon, I will completely resolve everything.”

He said this to himself, though it sounded as if he were speaking to Li Fan as well.

“Young man, your character is good, but you are too reckless. In the future, you should act with more caution. Plan before you move.” The Heavenly Doctor spoke like an elder advising a child.

Then he suddenly produced a jade slip out of thin air and tossed it toward Li Fan.

The jade slip was clearly no ordinary item. Nine golden rays of divine light coiled around it, exuding a sacred aura. As it flew through the air, it caused layers of space to tremble.

Li Fan instinctively caught the golden jade slip and looked at the Heavenly Doctor with uncertainty and suspicion.

“It’s always good for young people to read more books.”

“Alright, now let me deal with the real matter.”

The Heavenly Doctor turned his gaze toward Han Zhong, who remained sealed in ice.

The white-haired old man narrowed his eyes, his expression solemn.

A silver needle silently appeared in his right hand. With a flick of his finger, it shot toward Han Zhong’s crown.

Clang!

The needle pierced bone. The once completely frozen Han Zhong suddenly began to struggle violently.

The Heavenly Doctor’s expression remained calm. Several more silver needles flew out at once, pinning Han Zhong firmly in place.

Li Fan suppressed his urge to examine the golden jade slip, keeping his mind empty as he focused entirely on observing the Heavenly Doctor’s actions.

When Han Zhong’s body was finally covered with eighty-one silver needles, his expression froze completely.

His face became hideously twisted. His eye sockets, mouth, and nostrils seemed to melt away into pitch-black holes, as if corroded by something unseen.

An invisible, horrifying aura flowed out of those dark holes, seeping from within Han Zhong’s body.

Even with the Heavenly Doctor’s seals in place, Li Fan could not help but feel a powerful sense of danger rising within him.

His eyelids twitched violently, as if great calamity was upon him.

Without a sound, he retreated to stand behind the Heavenly Doctor, and only then did that oppressive feeling slightly ease.

The Heavenly Doctor paid no attention to Li Fan’s small movements. He drew out a jade bottle and tossed it lightly toward Han Zhong’s head, the mouth of the bottle facing him.

The jade bottle seemed to possess the ability to absorb that invisible aura. Gradually, the source of Li Fan’s sense of danger faded away.

During this process, Han Zhong’s body completely dissolved into nothingness.

When all was done, the Heavenly Doctor solemnly retrieved the jade bottle and sealed it carefully.

“What is that?” Li Fan could not help asking, his gaze fixed on the bottle in the Heavenly Doctor’s hand.

“This is an disease,” the Heavenly Doctor sighed softly.

“That boy, I cannot tell whether his fortune was good or bad. He discovered the Eye of the Heavenly Beast and left the Xuanhuang Realm. Because of that, he became infected with this disease.”

Li Fan could not help recalling the withering and decaying sensation he had felt within his soul when he had come into contact with Han Zhong earlier.

“disease?” Li Fan murmured thoughtfully.

The Heavenly Doctor glanced at him.

"Enough. This isn’t something you should be worrying about."

The Heavenly Doctor gently shook his head.

"Knowing too much will do you no good."

"To be able to sense that spatial fluctuation and locate the infected person shows that your abilities are not bad."

"Focus on studying the jade slip I passed on to you. Compared to the half-baked inheritances of Tian Jue and the others, it is far superior."

The Heavenly Doctor nagged a few more words.

"Don’t wander around unnecessarily. The Xuanhuang Realm is not as safe as it appears."

After giving his final instruction, before Li Fan could respond, the Heavenly Doctor’s figure vanished into thin air, leaving only his voice echoing in the air.

Li Fan stood still in the room, his mind tense and alert, not daring to relax.

Only after returning to the Spiritwood Realm and confirming that he was completely safe did Li Fan finally let out a long breath of relief.

"Although this unexpected encounter with the Heavenly Doctor was strange... luckily—"

"I gambled correctly."

Li Fan’s eyes gleamed as he exhaled deeply.

Indeed, although his exchange with the Heavenly Doctor seemed smooth and without danger, in truth, Li Fan had been gambling all along—gambling that the Heavenly Doctor was actually a good person.

At the very least, that he would treat cultivators who shared the same origin with him differently.

Based on the scenes and conversations during the battle between the Heavenly Doctor, Tian Jue, and the Sage, Li Fan speculated that perhaps the massacre at Cloudwater Heavenly Palace years ago truly had not been the Heavenly Doctor’s doing.

It might all have been a misunderstanding.

From the looks of it, the deranged Tian Jue had sought revenge against the Heavenly Doctor more than once or twice already.

Yet despite being able to annihilate Tian Jue in an instant, the Heavenly Doctor had never truly struck to kill, not even against the Sage.

All of this indicated that what the Heavenly Doctor said might indeed be true.

Therefore, the instant Li Fan saw the Heavenly Doctor, he unleashed the Five Elements Annihilation Sword infused with the intent of the Heavenly Calamity Sword, followed by Qin Tang’s secret technique, the Cloudwater Illusory Dream Technique, to attack the Heavenly Doctor.

He did this to disguise himself as Tian Jue’s successor—someone carrying the mission of avenging his master.

If the Heavenly Doctor was truly as benevolent and compassionate as he appeared, then when facing what might be the only surviving descendant from the same origin within the Xuanhuang Realm, he surely would not harm Li Fan.

Even if Li Fan spoke rudely, the result would be the same.

And indeed—things unfolded exactly as Li Fan had expected.

Not only did the Heavenly Doctor not grow angry, he even took the initiative to bestow upon him a golden jade slip.

"This is what they call a gentleman’s honesty being his weakness to exploit."

Recalling his previous trauma, Li Fan could not help but feel a surge of pride at having deceived the Heavenly Doctor so effortlessly this time.

Of course, the main reason the deception went so smoothly was because Li Fan already knew in advance of the Heavenly Doctor’s ability to observe, listen, inquire, and diagnose.

During his performance, even his inner thoughts had been perfectly aligned with the “script.”

Although the Heavenly Doctor possessed unparalleled strength, he never would have imagined that from the very beginning, he had already fallen into Li Fan’s carefully laid trap.

Confident in his diagnostic ability, the Heavenly Doctor had been misled by Li Fan’s deliberate act, leading him to a false judgment.

Replaying the entire process several times in his mind, Li Fan felt an ever-deepening sense of satisfaction.

The last time he had exposed himself before the Heavenly Doctor, he had barely escaped with his life.

Now, after countless cycles of reincarnation, although his strength still could not match the opponent, he was able to successfully deceive them.

This alone demonstrated how tremendous his growth had been.

“As long as I am given some more time, it may not be impossible to directly contend with Heavenly Doctor.”

However, thinking back to Heavenly Doctor’s performance during his earlier probing, Li Fan still slightly furrowed his brow.

Although it had been only a display, the hundreds of Great Five Elements Annihilation Swords were certainly unleashed at full power. Almost all of them were his full-strength attacks without activating the [Soul-Ignition] state.

Yet such an offensive was effortlessly nullified by Heavenly Doctor. Li Fan could not even discern how Heavenly Doctor had compressed the Annihilation Swords into a sphere.

“And then there was that kind of [disease] Heavenly Doctor mentioned…”

Li Fan’s expression turned solemn.

A disease capable of causing the spirit to decay was formless and invisible.

Heavenly Doctor’s visit this time was clearly to deal with the disease carried by Han Zhong. Encountering Li Fan was purely coincidental.

“Perhaps this also explains why the Han Zhong incident in the previous life caused no significant ripple.”

“Because Heavenly Doctor had handled everything in secret.”

“If such a disease were allowed to spread, it might even affect the Xuanhuang Realm. Seeing it this way, could Heavenly Doctor really be a righteous figure?”

Li Fan stroked his chin.

“For me, this is actually good news. The more righteous the character, the lower the risk when interacting with them.”

“As long as the existence of [Truth] is not exposed.”

“I might even be able to gain some benefits from them.”

Li Fan’s thoughts spun continuously. This discovery left him rather exhilarated. While resolving a major hidden concern, he had already begun to plan how to maximize the use of this new finding.

“Right, Heavenly Doctor just mentioned that the invisible bubble used to move Han Zhong out of the Xuanhuang Realm is the Heavenly Beast’s Eye?”

“It can observe the void near the Xuanhuang Realm, and those within it do not even age…”

“No wonder it is the handiwork of the Xuantian Sect.”

…

After a long while, Li Fan’s turbulent thoughts finally settled. He composed himself. After a moment of reflection, he took out the golden jade slip that Heavenly Doctor had gifted him.

Its majestic and noble aura even affected the spirit wood not far above the secluded chamber, causing the branches and leaves to sway as if moved by wind.

Li Fan’s heart stirred. After careful consideration, he finally decided to divide a portion of his divine sense and enter the golden jade slip.

“Boom!”

Countless pieces of information surged into Li Fan’s mind.

“[Record of Mending Heaven]?”

Pressing his throbbing temples, Li Fan skimmed through the contents of the jade slip, his expression growing peculiar.

There was no doubt that the author of the Record of Mending Heaven was Heavenly Doctor.

The Record of Mending Heaven posited that as the Dao of Heaven gradually shifts, it is highly likely that the Dao itself may begin to manifest various diseases, much like humans.

At this time, it would be necessary to heal the Dao of Heaven.

Yet how difficult it was to heal the Dao!

Humans are the spirit of Heaven and Earth, and the human body can reflect a portion of the principles of Heaven and Earth.

Therefore, to heal Heaven, one must first heal humanity.

The opening sections of the Mending Heaven Record extensively explain how to heal all living beings of Heaven and Earth, including humans.

If the Heavenly Doctor Immortal Scripture Li Fan had previously read was an encyclopedia introducing countless species, then the first half of the Mending Heaven Record was an expansion of it—showing the practical application of medical techniques across all species in Heaven and Earth.

Once one can skillfully heal all beings in the world, one may progress to the next stage:

[Healing Heaven]!

To heal the Dao of Heaven, one must first understand it as intimately as one does the human body.

Moreover, one must possess the power to reshape Heaven and Earth.

For ordinary cultivators, changing the world is extraordinarily difficult. Even the Longevity Immortal Realm experts of the Xuanhuang Realm could only reverse a small part of the laws of Heaven and Earth.

Therefore, the second major section of the Records of Mending Heaven focuses on how to repair deficiencies and strengthen oneself.

It steps beyond the constraints of conventional cultivation systems and approaches the essence of life itself.

It lists hundreds of possible methods to surpass one’s own limits.

The final and largest section of the Records of Mending Heaven explains in detail how to "heal Heaven."

If anomalies occur in the operation of the Heavenly Dao, it is similar to a human falling ill, manifesting various "symptoms." Treating the symptoms accurately is the only way to cure the disease.

Strictly speaking, the Records of Mending Heaven is not a cultivation technique. It is a summary of the Heavenly Doctor’s (Tianyi) personal cultivation experience, combining methodology with practical insights.

Many of its ideas and ingenious concepts were completely novel to Li Fan.

Moreover, the records of the various anomalies in the Heavenly Dao greatly expanded his horizons.

Li Fan read it with rapt attention, his respect and caution toward the Heavenly Doctor growing further.

Although he temporarily convinced the Heavenly Doctor that he was a descendant of Tian Jue, he knew that Tian Jue himself was erratic, mentally unstable at times, and extraordinarily elusive, making verification of his claims nearly impossible.

However, for the Heavenly Doctor, it might not have been impossible to forcibly probe Tian Jue’s mind and memories.

Li Fan vividly remembered that, during the confrontation with Tia Jue and the Sage, the Heavenly Doctor, after revealing his true form for just a moment, subdued the insane Tian Jue and even performed a "surgical procedure" on him.

Thus, even after gaining a minor advantage, Li Fan remained cautious.

He tried to forcibly memorize as much of the vast Records of Mending Heaven as possible. If the Heavenly Doctor discovered the deception and came looking for him, Li Fan would immediately return it.

Even if all other plans in this world were wasted, possessing the Records of Mending Heaven alone would never be a loss.

This, however, was merely Li Fan’s worst-case plan.

In reality, according to his deductions, with the combined inheritances of the Cloudwater Heavenly Palace and Tian Jue, he could indeed be considered their true successor.

As for how this inheritance came to him…

For the Heavenly Doctor, it might have been entirely irrelevant. As long as Li Fan did not reveal the matter of [Truth], the Heavenly Doctor would not act against him.

The Records of Mending Heaven was profound and obscure. Even with Li Fan’s current knowledge, studying it was extremely demanding.

“In the era of the Tianxuan Spirit Locking, before the advent of the Mysterious Net, there was also a technique called the Records of Mending Heaven.”

“At that time, the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance forced cultivators throughout the world to practice it…”

“In the end, it facilitated the ultimate transformation of the Tianxuan Mirror into the Mysterious Net.”

“All of it was about repairing one’s own deficiencies. Now, it seems that these two share common principles. Perhaps there was no real difference between them.”

During the process of reading, Li Fan suddenly recalled his previous reincarnation experiences.

By aligning the Tianxuan Mirror with the Mysterious Net, combining the process of ultimately replacing Heaven with the theories in the [Record of Mending Heaven], various insights surged in Li Fan’s mind.

For a moment, he felt overwhelming joy.

Li Fan immersed himself in study, losing track of how much time had passed.

When he reached the final section of the Record of Mending Heaven, regarding the last ultimate method of the Heavenly Doctor, his entire body trembled violently, and he instantly regained full clarity.

“This…”

Li Fan’s eyes shone with an unbelievable light, and his body trembled slightly.

He then took a deep breath, forcibly suppressing the shock in his heart.

He read this section carefully, over and over, more than ten times.

It was merely one possible theory proposed by the Heavenly Doctor, and even he had never implemented it.

However…

“The Floating Starry Sky Formation, capturing other worlds, Cave-Heavens…”

“The Ancient Great War…”

“Cloudwater Heavenly Palace, Tian Jue…”

“Thousands of years of upheaval in the Xuanhuang Realm…”

The words spoken by Mr. Bai about the Dao during the 115th generation when facing the Immortal Ancestor…

Countless previous clues flashed through Li Fan’s mind, corroborating the contents he was reading.

He involuntarily drew in a sharp breath.

“If this is really the case…”

A trace of alarm passed through his eyes.

At this moment, he no longer had the heart to continue reading the Record of Mending Heaven.

If his speculation was correct, then the true power of the Heavenly Doctor…

Even Li Fan, rarely so, felt an urgent desire to verify this theory as soon as possible.

Yet, in the end, he forcibly suppressed it.

“No, I must wait until the next life.”

“Other than the Heavenly Doctor, no one should know the contents of the Record of Mending Heaven. If I test it in this life, I will inevitably expose myself!”

“In the next life, everything else can wait. First, I must verify this matter…”

“If it is really so…”

In that instant, the pride Li Fan felt from having deceived the Heavenly Doctor vanished completely.

In its place arose an unprecedented gravity.

Along with this, even the Record of Mending Heaven, a record of supreme cultivation methods, now seemed slightly intimidating.

After much thought, Li Fan finally decided to continue reading it.

“I cannot learn it all.”

“But some of the viewpoints may be borrowed and adapted for my own use.”

“I will extract the essence, integrate it with my own strengths, and develop a Record of Mending Heaven that belongs to me.”

Thinking this, Li Fan once again immersed his divine sense in the vast ocean of knowledge within the Record of Mending Heaven.

…

At the Heavenly Sword Sect, in the Sword Tomb,

Li Fan’s clone, Li Qing, sat beside the Black Sword, feeding the sword with his own insights in sword Dao.

That day, his spiritual sea suddenly received a vast influx of information.

It all came from the original Li Fan.

“The Dao of Heaven has a flaw; I shall mend it myself.”

Li Qing pondered over the profound meaning of these words, his eyes shining brighter and brighter.

Due to the limits of his own cultivation, Li Qing did not know the origin of this mysterious method.

Yet judging from its intricacy, it was clearly not the product of his own understanding.

This, Li Qing, who was very familiar with the original body’s talent, could be almost certain of.

“It seems the original must have encountered some extraordinary event…”

Li Qing no longer paid attention to anything else and concentrated on studying this method.

“I see now…”

“The Way of the Sword is one aspect of the Heavenly Dao. If the Heavenly Dao can have flaws, so too can the Way of the Sword.”

“Thus the uniqueness of the Wooden Sword Heavenly Wonder inherently seeks to complete itself. This Black Sword is one of its instinctive attempts.”

His eyes shimmered with excitement.

“The Wooden Sword Heavenly Wonder is already infinitely close to perfection. To take it even further—how could that be easy.”

“However, perhaps I can take another path, starting from another Dao.”

“This is the so-called lesson from another’s strength can improve one’s own.”

With this in mind, while feeding the sword Dao, Li Qing also integrated other insights.

The insights Li Qing transmitted, apart from those related to the Sword Dao, were almost entirely filtered out by the Black Sword.

It did not accept even the slightest trace of anything else.

However, this was within Li Qing’s expectations.

The Wooden Sword, Wonder of the Heavens was a creation of pure Sword Law, so how could it easily accommodate any other Law?

Li Qing was not discouraged and continued to experiment with different methods.

Time slowly passed.

The Black Sword grew more condensed, and the aura it emitted became increasingly powerful.

Then, one day, this Black Sword, which had always strongly rejected any external energy—suddenly absorbed a faint trace of the insights Li Qing had been feeding it.

Li Qing’s eyes brightened. After a quick investigation, he immediately identified the one concept that seemed to harmonize with the Black Sword.

“Hide the edge and keep to simplicity. Restrain the sword’s sharpness. By not attacking, one achieves ten thousand victories...”

In that moment, endless inspiration surged through Li Qing’s mind.

Some of the images felt strangely familiar, though he could not recall their source.

He did not dwell on it; instead, he poured the surging inspiration directly into the Black Sword.

The previously aloof Black Sword which had cared for nothing beyond the Way of the Sword—now responded with unusual cooperation.

It even seemed eager, actively accepting Li Qing’s infusion.

As the Dao of Simplicity slowly merged into it, the once razor-edged, radiant Black Sword began to lose its sharp aura.

Bit by bit, it turned dark and plain again, appearing utterly ordinary.

Yet Li Qing understood that this was a sign of transcendence—the Black Sword had surpassed the limits of ordinary swordsmanship and taken a step into a higher realm.

Within the Sword Tomb, countless abandoned swords remained unaware.

Only the Wooden Sword Heavenly Wonder at the center let out a faint, nearly inaudible sword hum, as if expressing joy.

Because of this sword cry, ten thousand swords once again bowed their heads. Only the black sword beside Li Fan, though appearing to bend as well,

remained utterly motionless.

“It’s done.”

Li Qing knew that he was now close to completely subduing the Black Sword, Heavenly Wonder.

He immediately closed his eyes and infused his final Sword Dao comprehension into the Black Sword.

After a single hum from the Wooden Sword, the Sword Tomb sank into a deeper silence.

It was so quiet that it became eerie, and Li Qing began to experience faint auditory illusions.

He seemed to hear thousands of remnant swords whispering softly, trying to tempt him—urging him to give up on taming the Black Sword and instead take another from the tomb.

Magnificent visions of swords capable of destroying heaven and earth flickered in his mind, each trying to shake his focus.

But Li Qing was no ordinary man.

He instantly realized that this was likely a subtle test from the Wooden Sword Heavenly Wonder itself—

either a final trial to measure his resolve or an instinctive act of reluctance, unwilling to part with the Black Sword.

Whatever the reason, such tricks could not sway Li Qing.

He stood unshaken before the endless illusions, his mind one with the Black Sword, his heart devoid of distraction.

Thus passed three full months.

On this day, Li Qing suddenly opened his eyes.

He extended his right hand naturally, grasping the Black Sword’s hilt.

With a gentle pull—

No divine phenomena erupted.

In fact, not even the faintest sound was heard.

Amid the tranquil air, the Black Sword quietly fell into Li Qing’s hand.

Within the Sword Tomb, the countless remnant swords seemed completely unaware that anything had happened.

Even the most central figure, Wooden Sword, Heavenly Wonder, did not show any sign of objection.

Silence was acknowledgment.

The deathly stillness within the Sword Tomb was no different from proof of Li Qing’s success.

"Using the false wonders of heaven and earth to build the foundation of the Dao."

Li Qing silently recited in his heart. Then, the Black Sword in his hand instantly turned into a stream of dark light and merged into his body.

It flew directly into his dantian, settling down there.

Moments later, the spiritual power of Li Qing’s Golden Core perfection realm suddenly began to boil violently.

It surged like ten thousand rivers flowing together, all rushing toward the black sword.

Like a hundred rivers pouring into the sea, under the torrent of spiritual energy, the Black Sword gradually became illusory.

It completely merged into Li Qing’s dantian, transforming into his Dao Foundation.

“Glimpsing the methods of Heaven and Earth to refine the Golden Core.”

Li Qing again chanted inwardly.

The surging spiritual power within him did not stop but continued to pour into the Black Sword Dao Foundation.

Within the vortex of spiritual energy, the Black Sword’s phantom grew fainter and fainter.

Finally, when it completely vanished, it seemed to form an abyss, devouring all spiritual power.

Boom!

A brilliant light erupted, like the radiance of the world’s creation.

It illuminated every corner of Li Qing’s body.

The dazzling glow flickered for several breaths.

When the blinding light finally faded, a pitch-black Golden Core, exuding an ancient and simple aura, appeared within Li Qing’s dantian.

If one looked carefully, they could faintly see countless sword shadows engraved on the surface of the black Golden Core.

Yet it was as though an illusion born from darkness—when one tried to look again, those sword shadows vanished.

Golden Core formed.

From beginning to end, it took no more than a few breaths.

The clone of Li Qing had transformed from a hollow cultivator stuck at the Golden Core perfection realm into a true Golden Core Lord, whose foundation was established through the Heavenly Wonder of the Black Sword.

However, Li Qing was still not satisfied.

“To devour the essence of Heaven and Earth and achieve Nascent Soul.”

He continued to chant within.

Ordinary cultivators must rely on a Cave Heaven to achieve the Nascent Soul realm.

But those who establish their Dao Foundation through a Heavenly Wonder do not need to.

Because a Heavenly Wonder itself is part of the Heavenly Dao.

It can independently evolve into its own Cave Heaven.

Li Qing’s heart stirred. The newly formed black Golden Core suddenly exploded.

The spiritual energy within spread throughout his entire body in an instant.

Countless fragments of the black Golden Core shot across his body.

Though seemingly scattered without pattern, there was hidden order within.

The arrangement of the Golden Core’s fragments faintly resembled the form of the Black Sword itself.

Using these remnants as the foundation, Li Qing’s spiritual energy, flesh, and bones all began to melt like liquid, being absorbed by those black fragments.

From the outside, Li Qing’s body instantly looked like a torn, twisted puppet.

As his flesh and bones were forcibly extracted, horrifying creaking sounds echoed.

Combined with the grotesque sight of his body being compressed and reshaped, the process appeared both eerie and otherworldly.

Yet Li Qing ignored the surging pain.

He only accelerated the process of his body being devoured by the fragments.

When every trace of his flesh and blood in the air had been consumed, the scattered fragments of the Golden Core connected faintly like human meridians.

Threads of dark-red tissue intertwined, strange and demonic.

Suddenly, a radiant light emerged from every piece of the Golden Core.

In an instant, it flowed throughout his body.

Amidst the flashing brilliance, a miniature “Sword Cave Heaven” gradually took form.

This Sword Cave Heaven was different from ordinary Cave Heavens born through natural evolution.

Inside, there were no mountains, rivers, or lakes—only a scene almost identical to the Sword Tomb outside.

The entire land was covered with countless swords stabbed into the ground in chaotic disarray.

Sword qi surged and intertwined, forming howling gales of sharp wind.

The whole Cave Heaven was a world that belonged solely to the sword. It could not tolerate the existence of any other living being.

Outside the Sword Tomb, beside the Sword Cave Heaven, the clone Li Qing, whose body had previously been shattered into pieces, slowly reformed as his flesh and blood wriggled back together.

“Nascent Soul early stage,” he murmured, sensing his current cultivation and nodding slightly.

His realm was somewhat weaker than his true body. Although his actual combat power was inferior, the foundation he had built upon Heavenly Wonder far surpassed ordinary cultivators. Crushing an average Soul Transformation cultivator would not be difficult.

However, after stepping into the Nascent Soul realm, Li Qing felt a vague resistance hindering his advancement.

A phrase suddenly echoed in his mind:

“The new law of the Heavenly Sovereign defies the will of heaven itself. The more blessings one receives from heaven and earth, the harder it will be to rebel against their laws in the future.”

“Even when offering sacrifices to the Spirit of Heaven and Earth, one will suffer multiple layers of backlash from the will of the world. No matter how high one’s talent, most can only stop at the Soul Transformation realm.”

Perhaps because Li Qing had contributed in part to the birth of that Black Sword, when he devoured it and transformed it into a Cave Heaven, he did not encounter much resistance.

But he could sense that this was already the utmost limit of what heaven and earth would tolerate.

If he wished to go further, to advance to Soul Transformation or even Dao Integration—he would have to face the full malice of heaven itself.

Yet Li Qing did not pay much heed to it.

After all, as a clone, his mission was not to cultivate but to travel to the Five Elders Association and seek One-Heart Heavenly Sovereign to reclaim the lost cultivation manuals of the Xuantian Sect.

After reviewing the information sent from his true body, he learned that due to a mysterious spatial fluctuation earlier, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and the Five Elders Association were currently in a rare period of truce.

After orienting himself, Li Qing transformed into a streak of black sword light and sped swiftly toward his destination.

Once in flight, Li Qing immediately noticed the difference from before.

When his true body soared through the sky, it needed to resist the pressure of heaven and earth and the fierce winds that came with it.

But Li Qing, having transformed into sword light, moved as smoothly as a fish in water, perfectly merging with his surroundings.

Not only was the resistance negligible, but the energy consumption was astonishingly low.

“Heavenly Wonder naturally belongs to the Dao of Xuanhuang itself,” he thought. “Hence, it receives preferential treatment.”

Flying was no longer a chore—it had become a pleasure.

Li Qing’s heart felt utterly refreshed. If not for the risk of attracting the attention of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, he would have let out a long, joyous roar.

The Black Sword light grew faster and faster, flashing across the heavens in an instant.

Even if someone happened to glimpse it, they would merely think it a trick of the eye.

Seven days later, the region of Jiwei Prefecture, under the domain of the Five Elders Association, was already in sight.

Before the vast white mist barrier that stretched across heaven and earth, a squad of cultivators from the Martial Hall of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance was stationed.

Without alerting them, Li Qing relied on the information transmitted by his true body to easily evade the Alliance’s defensive formations and slip into the white mist.

As a buffer zone between the Five Elders Association and the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, Jiwei Prefecture had no Heavenly Sovereign presiding over it—aside from Carefree Heavenly Sovereign, no other Heavenly Sovereign power extended into this region.

The reason for choosing to enter through this location of Five Elders Association was that it allowed one to avoid the Realm of Truth. By passing through the Heavenly Domain of Humanity, one could reach the One-Heart Immortal Sect directly.

Within the Realm of Truth, all lies were laid bare. It was clearly not a suitable place for infiltration, and one should avoid it whenever possible.

By contrast, the Heavenly Realm of Humanity was much safer.

Compared to the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, which was sharpening its blades for war, the territory of the Five Elders Association appeared far more peaceful.

Only the bordering and buffer states had heavy military presence.

In other regions, it almost seemed as though the war did not exist at all. Along the way, every cultivator and mortal Li Qing encountered appeared relaxed, even somewhat lazy.

This made Li Qing click his tongue in quiet admiration, deeply impressed by how well the Five Elders Association governed its people.

Encountering no real danger, Li Qing passed through the Heavenly Domain of Humanity and finally arrived at the lands governed by the One-Heart Immortal Sect.

Of course, the smoothness of his journey was not only due to his cultivation foundation being rooted in the Heavenly Wonder, granting him excellent concealment, but perhaps also because he was not a member of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

Had he been one of their cultivators, sneaking through so easily would have been far more difficult.

This region was called Yilu Prefecture.

As its name implied, the land stretched with fertile plains as far as the eye could see.

He could even see mortal caravans traveling between cities.

Unlike the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, where mortals and cultivators lived separately, every city within the Five Elders Association housed both mortals and cultivators together.

However, there was a distinction between the inner and outer cities.

Mortals resided in the outer city, while cultivators lived within the inner city.

As Li Qing took in the familiar scenery around him, he felt a strange sense of déjà vu.

“I feel like I have been here before…”

Suppressing the fleeting thought, Li Qing began searching for his target.

According to the information transmitted from his true self, the key to entering the true One-Heart Immortal Sect was to attract the attention of the One-Heart Heavenly Sovereign.

Among the Five Elders Association, there were secretly circulated erotic picture scrolls, which were considered the fastest and most effective method to draw such attention.

Unfortunately, this operation did not seem to be going smoothly.

Li Qing had wandered around Yilü Prefecture for several days but could not find any of those daring merchants.

This was understandable, for under the authority of a Heavenly Sovereign, anyone caught publicly spreading such things would truly lose their heads.

Just as Li Qing was considering moving on to another prefecture to try his luck, the previously quiet city suddenly became noisy.

Li Qing’s heart stirred, and he followed the crowd toward the source of the commotion.

“You are Wan Zailai?!”

Several cultivators surrounded a handsome young man in white robes, their expressions hostile.

“So you found me. Well, that’s fine. I’ve rested long enough; it’s about time I got back to work.” Wan Zailai tilted his head, glancing lazily around. Under the pressure of his gaze, the surrounding cultivators subconsciously took half a step back.

This caused the cultivators of Yilü Prefecture to feel humiliated.

One of them shouted angrily, “A mere Golden Core cultivator, and you dare to speak so arrogantly! Are you saying all cultivators of Yilu Prefecture are useless?”

“Today, I’ll teach you a lesson!”

“Brother Pei, you’re already at the Nascent Soul True Lord realm. Isn’t it unfair to bully someone weaker?” someone nearby tried to dissuade him.

Before the cultivator surnamed Pei could respond, Wan Zailai chuckled softly. “A Nascent Soul cultivator? So what? In my eyes, you are no more than chickens and dogs.”

Every cultivator of Yilu Prefecture present instantly grew furious.

“Good! Very good!”

“I, Pei Qingshan of Yilu Prefecture, accept your challenge!”

As Pei Qingshan spoke, a transparent, circular structure suddenly appeared in the sky.

Amidst the gasps of the onlookers, the arena-like construct cast down two beams of light, pulling both duelists inside.

“That’s the Heavenly Sovereign’s Trial Arena!”

“So the rumors were true after all. Wan Zailai really intends to challenge a Nascent Soul cultivator as a Golden Core Lord, and thereby earn entry into the One-Heart Immortal Sect!”

Amid the crowd’s astonished and shaken discussions, Li Qing could not help but cast his gaze toward the circular, transparent dueling arena in the sky.

Inside, Wan Zailai and Pei Qingshan were already clashing intensely.

Pei Qingshan showed no mercy, directly manifesting a Greenwood Cave-Heaven in an attempt to suppress Wan Zailai.

However, Wan Zailai remained calm and unafraid. In an instant, his body split—one into two, two into eight...

By the time the Greenwood Cave-Heaven fully emerged, the entire arena was filled with tens of thousands of Wan Zailai’s figures.

“Ten Thousand Swords Return to the Origin!”

Wan Zailai shouted loudly. All his countless clones grew solemn and, in unison, transformed into swords, slashing toward the Greenwood Cave-Heaven.

Sword light poured down like rain, releasing dazzling brilliance.

Even the blazing sun above appeared dim under that radiance.

Before his body could regenerate, the newly formed flesh and blood were again annihilated by the sword glow.

The sword momentum was boundless, seemingly without end.

The Greenwood Cave-Heaven trembled continuously under the overwhelming pressure, on the verge of complete collapse.

“I surrender! I surrender!”

Pei Qingshan’s panicked voice echoed across the heavens.

A flash of white light appeared, and he was immediately ejected from the dueling arena.

His figure looked disheveled, and the fear on his face completely replaced his earlier rage.

“Thank you for letting me win,” Wan Zailai sheathed his sword as his countless clones merged back into his body.

Hovering high in the air, his white robes fluttered in the wind as he looked down arrogantly upon the cultivators of Yilu Prefecture.

Pei Qingshan’s defeat had come far too quickly, catching everyone off guard.

Moreover, the endless sword light unleashed by Wan Zailai was terrifying beyond measure.

Many were still struggling to recover from the suffocating pressure they had just experienced.

Even criticism toward Pei Qingshan was momentarily forgotten, and the entire scene fell into utter silence.

“If any of you are unconvinced, step forward!”

“I, Wan Zailai, shall block your attacks with a single sword!”

The proud voice of the white-robed youth echoed over Yilu City.

Oppressed by his aura, not a single cultivator dared to step forth for a moment.

After all, everyone was well aware of Pei Qingshan’s strength. Even at the peak of the Nascent Soul True Lord stage, he could not possibly be defeated so easily—yet Wan Zailai had done just that.

“Perhaps only a Soul Transformation True Monarch could subdue him,” many cultivators thought simultaneously.

But the Soul Transformation cultivators of Yilu Prefecture were either within the One Heart Immortal Sect or stationed on the front lines.

Even if one were present, none would lower themselves to battle Wan Zailai.

A Nascent Soul fighting a Golden Core Lord was already an act of bullying the weak.

A Soul Transformation fighting a Golden Core—that could no longer be called bullying. It would be disgraceful beyond words.

And if they were to lose...

They would become the laughingstock of the entire Five Elders Association, and the stepping stone for Wan Zailai’s fame.

The cultivators present each harbored their own thoughts and kept silent.

For a time, the white-robed youth continued to dominate the skies unchallenged.

“It seems Yilu Prefecture truly has no one of worth,” Wan Zailai said coldly, his tone dripping with disdain.

“Young man, it is better not to be too arrogant.”

At that moment, an icy voice suddenly rang out, drawing the attention of every cultivator both on the ground and in the air.

A stunningly beautiful figure—delicate and androgynous—slowly flew into the sky.

“I am Li Qing,” he said respectfully, cupping his hands.

A white light then carried him into the dueling arena.

“Oh?” Wan Zailai’s eyes narrowed slightly.

He had always been proud and arrogant. Now, being reprimanded by a young man who appeared even younger than himself, and in the tone one would use to scold a junior, he naturally felt extremely displeased.

“Early Nascent Soul stage?” A dangerous gleam flashed across Wan Zailai’s eyes.

“I will not use the power of my Cave Heaven. Even with just my Golden Core strength, I can suppress you with one hand.” Li Qing waved his hand as he spoke, his tone filled with arrogance and his expression deadly serious.

At that moment, not only did Wan Zailai’s face change drastically, but even the cultivators from Yilu Prefecture who were watching from below broke into an uproar.

“I thought Wan Zailai was already crazy, but this Li Qing is even crazier.”

“This fellow Li looks unfamiliar. Is he one of our Yilu Prefecture cultivators?”

“Nonsense. If he wasn’t, why would he stand up for us? Our Yilu Prefecture is vast and rich in talent. He must be a hidden genius from the countryside.”

The crowd’s voices buzzed endlessly.

Wan Zailai let out a low, sinister laugh. “Very good. I can’t wait to see you torn apart by ten thousand swords.”

As soon as his words fell, he unleashed his most powerful killing technique.

“Ten Thousand Swords Art!”

Just like before, the entire dueling arena was instantly filled with tens of thousands of clones.

However, unlike the previous Ten Thousand Swords Return to Origin, this time it was not a simple sword-slashing technique.

Each clone formed hand seals and activated a different sword art.

The sky was instantly illuminated by countless brilliant sword lights of every color.

One after another, phantom swords of varying forms appeared in midair, each emitting a dragon-like roar as they howled toward Li Qing.

The sword light tore through space, causing endless tremors. Even the transparent barrier that confined the arena began to crack slightly.

The cultivators of Yilu Prefecture watching below stared in shock at the overwhelming sight.

“So this is Wan Zailai’s true strength?”

“He’s too strong. Even a Soul Transformation cultivator might perish under this strike.”

“What background does this Wan Zailai have? He’s only at the Golden Core stage, yet this strong. If he ever reaches the Nascent Soul stage, who could stop him?”

The spectators were all filled with awe and disbelief.

Every single one of them believed that the unknown cultivator Li Qing would undoubtedly fall under this Ten Thousand Swords Art.

But before they could sigh in pity, amidst the endless roar of sword cries, Li Qing’s calm yet powerful voice rang out.

“No matter how many sword arts you command…”

“When you face me, you shall still bow your head.”

The voice was not loud, yet it effortlessly drowned out all the sword cries.

In that instant, within the arena high above, an astonishing scene unfolded before everyone’s eyes.

The countless sword phantoms, which had been rushing toward Li Qing like a flood of radiant dragons, suddenly slowed as they neared him.

And finally, they came to a complete stop before him.

Each sword revealed its distinct form in midair, suspended motionless.

“Hm?” Li Qing’s gaze swept over them.

Under his calm yet commanding stare, despite their unwillingness, all those countless sword phantoms began to tremble slightly, lowering their tips in submission.

“Go.”

Li Qing uttered a light command.

In the next instant, the countless sword shadows turned, reversing direction.

They roared back toward the stunned and speechless Wan Zailai, who still hadn’t figured out what had just happened.

Just as Wan Zailai was about to be torn apart by his own ultimate technique, a beam of white light surged forth.

The next moment, his figure vanished from the arena and reappeared back on the ground below.

But by then, no one cared about him anymore.

All the cultivators present fixed their gazes firmly upon Li Qing.

Within the transparent martial arena, Li Qing stood under the gaze of tens of thousands of cultivators from Yilu Prefecture.

Yet he did not spare even a glance at the crowd below.

With a flick of his finger, he once again seized control of the countless sword techniques that had lost their targets moments ago.

Then he raised his head and looked toward the higher heavens.

“I have a sword. I ask the Heavenly Sovereign to witness it.”

His clear voice echoed across the skies, spreading through all directions, causing shock among every cultivator present in Yilu Prefecture.

“What is he doing?”

“How dare he speak so rudely to the Heavenly Sovereign!”

“Stop him quickly!”

Behind Li Qing, the phantom of a black sword suddenly appeared.

The moment it manifested, the countless sword arts before him seemed to be violently stimulated.

The radiance of the sword light multiplied several times over.

The brilliance was so intense that the cultivators below could hardly open their eyes.

Even Wan Zailai, who had already been defeated and was filled with despair, raised his head at this sight.

Watching his own sword technique being elevated to such an astonishing level, a glimmer of hope rekindled within his darkened eyes.

But Li Qing ignored everyone’s reactions.

Laughing loudly, his figure merged completely with the black sword phantom.

Amid the embrace of countless sword techniques, he became like the emperor of swords, leading thousands of troops, cleaving through the heavens.

The transparent circular martial arena resisted for only an instant before it shattered inch by inch beneath the overwhelming strike.

The sword light did not falter, as if it wished to split the very sky apart.

In the collision between sword and heaven, the countless lights burst like fireworks, scattering across the firmament and dyeing the sky in multicolored brilliance.

Only the black sword that Li Qing had become remained resolute and unyielding.

At last, it flew into a magnificent celestial realm that suddenly appeared high above.

Through the brief rift that emerged in the sky, faint silhouettes could be seen, all gazing at the intruding Black Sword, each wearing a different expression.

...

“Sigh, this young man is truly pitiful. So young, and yet…”

“What a waste of such a fine appearance.”

“Who told him to overestimate himself and keep pestering Senior Sister Zhao? She just entered the Foundation Establishment stage not long ago and is expected to become a core disciple soon. He, on the other hand, still hasn’t succeeded in Qi Condensation.”

“Truly a toad dreaming of eating swan meat.”

“Wait, I heard it was actually Senior Sister Zhao who kept seeking him out. He refused her many times and even said they should avoid meeting again.”

“Impossible. Absolutely impossible.”

The noise of gossip woke Li Qing from his sleep.

Seeing him awake, the few people nearby immediately fell silent and left the room, leaving him alone in quiet.

His mind was in a haze. Only after a long while did he fully recall his circumstances.

He was originally from Changfeng Village in the Great Green Mountains.

Half a year ago, the village had been massacred by a group of mountain bandits.

Only he and Zhao Ruoxi survived because they happened to be away that day.

When they saw flames rising from the village, they rushed back, only to encounter the retreating bandits head-on.

The bandits, captivated by Zhao Ruoxi’s beauty, intended to abduct her.

Fortunately, at that very moment, an immortal master from the Grand Dao Sect descended from the sky and slew all the bandits.

Seeing their pitiful state, the immortal took them both back to the Great Dao Sect.

From mere mortals, they thus stepped onto the path of cultivation—truly a blessing in disguise.

However, Li Qing’s fortune was not as deep as Zhao Ruoxi’s.

Within half a year, Zhao Ruoxi had already succeeded in Foundation Establishment, becoming a disciple of the Moonlight Branch under the Soul Transformation True Monarch, Zhang Wangshuang.

Li Qing, meanwhile, was still struggling at the Qi Condensation stage.

The difference between them was enormous.

Yet even that was not what Li Qing found hardest to accept.

As he felt the sharp pain from his lower body, his heart turned to ashes.

All of this misfortune began because of a woman’s beauty.

Qin Shou of the Lianshan Branch had fallen in love with Zhao Ruoxi at first sight.

But since Zhao Ruoxi showed him no affection and had already secretly given her heart to Li Qing, Qin Shou’s jealousy grew.

Zhao Ruoxi often came to visit Li Qing in the outer sect, bringing him many pills in secret, even including a precious Foundation Establishment Pill.

That pill was no ordinary one—it was the Purple Resonance Refining Dao Pill which Zhao Ruoxi had specially begged from her master for Li Qing’s sake, to help reduce the aftereffects of forced breakthroughs and even slightly improve one’s spiritual aptitude.

It was truly a heaven-defying divine medicine capable of changing fate.

That day, after sending Zhao Ruoxi away, Li Qing held the pill in his hands, overjoyed.

Who could have expected that joy would turn to tragedy?

His closeness with Zhao Ruoxi had provoked Qin Shou’s wrath.

Qin Shou sent men to his quarters, who brutally beat Li Qing and crippled him completely.

They even robbed him of the Purple Resonance Refining Dao Pill.

“Qin Shou…”

As Li Qing awoke from his memories, hatred flashed in his eyes. But the pain in his lower body quickly brought him back to grim reality.

Trembling, he reached a shaking hand downwards—

and felt nothing there.

Li Qing’s heart instantly turned ice cold.

“My life root is gone, and so is my hope of breaking through the Qi Condensation stage.”

“What’s the point of living anymore…”

Li Qing’s eyes were filled with despair.

At that moment, a figure suddenly pushed the door open and entered.

Without even lifting his head, just from that familiar fragrance, Li Qing already knew who had arrived.

“Ruoxi…”

Before he could finish, he suddenly recalled the warning of those wicked men when they assaulted him. The sharp pain in his lower body had not yet faded.

Li Qing shuddered, then quickly changed his words. “Senior Sister Zhao…”

Zhao Ruoxi looked at Li Qing’s state, and a trace of pain flashed across her eyes.

Then her face turned cold, filled with killing intent.

“Where are you injured…” she asked softly.

Li Qing trembled again, instinctively covering his lower body.

Zhao Ruoxi immediately understood. Her face turned pale.

Her divine sense swept over him, and her delicate fists clenched tightly. Endless killing intent surged in her eyes.

Having his defect exposed completely, Li Qing felt as if he could die from shame.

But because of that very shame, he could only tremble all over, unable to do anything else.

Seeing Li Qing shivering like a frightened chick, Zhao Ruoxi’s heart filled with pity.

“It’s all right, it’s all right.”

She comforted him softly, pulling him gently into her embrace.

“It’s just a physical injury. When your cultivation becomes strong enough, you may be able to reconstruct your body one day…”

“Senior Sister, although my cultivation is weaker than yours, I still know some cultivation basics. I have not even established my Foundation, yet my body is already crippled. This is an innate defect…”

“I fear that even a Soul Transformation True Monarch would find it difficult to restore. Moreover, with my limited talent, how could I ever reach Soul Transformation…”

The more Li Qing spoke, the more despair filled his voice, until he finally broke down and cried bitterly.

In the end, under the double blow of body and spirit, he fell into a deep sleep in Zhao Ruoxi’s arms.

Zhao Ruoxi looked at Li Qing’s tear-streaked face, her eyes filled with sorrow.

Yet as she gently wiped away his tears, she found herself dazed by his handsome face and slightly furrowed brows in slumber.

Gradually, her expression turned strange.

She carefully laid Li Qing down and covered him with a blanket.

Then she began pacing the room, as if wrestling with a difficult decision.

After a long time, she finally made up her mind.

She leaned down, kissed Li Qing lightly on the cheek, and left the room.

When Li Qing awoke from his deep sleep, he did not immediately get up.

His eyes were empty as he stared at the ceiling, his mind blank.

“Living like this… is meaningless. I might as well die.”

Just as he was thinking about ways to end his life, Zhao Ruoxi entered again.

This time, a strong stench of blood accompanied her.

Bang!

She tossed a string of five human heads before Li Qing. “The ones who assaulted you, I’ve killed them all!”

“Of course, I know they were only following orders.”

“The one who commanded them… was Qin Shou of Lianshan.”

Hearing that name, a faint glimmer of light returned to Li Qing’s lifeless eyes.

“But right now, I can’t touch him. Not only is Qin Shou’s cultivation higher than mine, but his backer is also someone I cannot yet shake.”

“But I promise you, one day, I will return to him all the pain he caused you a thousandfold.” Zhao Ruoxi spoke softly but firmly.

Li Qing only nodded slightly, saying nothing.

“Oh, and I found a cultivation technique for you.”

Seeing Li Qing’s lifeless expression, Senior Sister Zhao took out a jade slip and handed it to him.

“Cultivation technique?”

Li Qing hesitated at first, unwilling to take it.

But when Zhao Ruoxi said that this technique was especially suited to him, he hesitated for a moment longer before finally accepting it and reading.

“Scripture of Reversing Order?”

At first, Li Qing seemed indifferent, but when he read the line ‘To master this art, one must first castrate oneself,’ his whole body trembled.

He suddenly looked up at Zhao Ruoxi.

Zhao Ruoxi explained softly, “This is a technique hidden deep within the Secret Pavilion of the Grand Dao Sect. Its origin is unknown, and because the cultivation requirement is too harsh, almost no one has ever practiced it.”

“I searched nearly the entire pavilion to find this method that suits you best.”

A spark of hope ignited in Li Qing’s heart as he eagerly continued to read the jade slip.

“Heaven and Earth are boundless, the cosmos follows order, Yin and Yang follow the Dao.”

“This is the law of nature.”

“Yet by reversing Yin and Yang, one may seize creation itself and step into True Immortality.”

...

Just the opening preface alone completely captivated Li Qing’s mind.

Forgetting everything around him, he became fully immersed in this mysterious and extraordinary technique.

“To reach the realm of True Immortal…”

“If that is possible, then even self-castration is nothing worth fearing.”

After finishing a quick read-through, Li Qing could not help but think so.

Li Qing’s process of forming his Golden Core was exceptionally smooth.

He did not experience any of the dangers or obstacles described in cultivation manuals. It was as natural as water flowing into place.

In less than half a day, he successfully stepped into the Golden Core Realm.

“Pure Yin Physique…”

Li Qing took a deep breath, feeling the earth-shaking transformation occurring within his body.

All the yang energy in his body was completely converted. The final barrier vanished, and he felt that his newly transformed body had reached a state of near-perfect harmony.

The circulation speed of spiritual power nearly doubled. Even his comprehension of cultivation methods and divine abilities became much sharper than before.

It was a complete rebirth and transformation.

However, his Golden Core was different from what was described in the ancient records.

All these changes filled Li Qing with boundless joy.

“In terms of cultivation talent alone, even Zhao Ruoxi is now far inferior to me.”

“And the quality of my Golden Core is among the finest.”

“Unfortunately, all of this must remain hidden for now. I cannot expose it.”

Li Qing understood clearly that if anyone discovered the true miraculous power of the Reversing Order Scripture, it would trigger unimaginable madness.

At that time, even the Soul Transformation and Dao Integration masters within the Inner Sect would come to seize it.

Compared to attaining the Great Dao itself, something as minor as reversing gender was insignificant.

“Until I have enough strength to protect myself, I must continue to conceal my power.”

He changed back into his clothes, suppressing the aura of a Golden Core cultivator that had just emerged from his body.

No one would imagine that this person, who a year ago had been a mere Qi Refining outer disciple with both body and spirit severely damaged, had now truly stepped into the threshold of the cultivation path.

After returning to the outer sect to continue hiding, Li Qing soon encountered an unexpected problem.

He could no longer absorb yin energy from female outer disciples to aid his cultivation.

After careful thought, Li Qing decided to reveal a portion of his cultivation and apply for entry into the Inner Sect of the Great Dao Sect.

Following serious consideration, he also selected the person he intended to take as his master.

Just like Senior Sister Zhao, he chose the Moonlight Lineage, under True Monarch Huo Jingtong, a master of the Soul Transformation Realm.

In truth, with the level of talent he currently displayed, it would normally be difficult for Li Qing to attract Huo Jingtong’s attention.

But Li Qing had already learned that Huo Jingtong was known to be extremely partial to beauty.

Li Qing believed that with his increasingly delicate and enchanting appearance, along with the natural charm radiating from his every movement, entering her tutelage would not be difficult.

The main reason he chose Huo Jingtong as his target was that she possessed extraordinary talent. Within less than a hundred years of cultivation, she had already reached the Soul Transformation Realm.

Moreover, she was wholly devoted to the Dao and rarely interacted with male cultivators. To this day, she remained pure.

All her disciples were also young female cultivators.

As a secret place for Li Qing to develop quietly, it was absolutely perfect.

A glint of danger flashed in Li Qing’s eyes as he began to secretly plot his scheme.

For an outer sect disciple to be accepted under a Soul Transformation True Monarch of the inner sect, careful maneuvering was naturally required.

Like a patient hunter, Li Qing waited for the right moment for more than three months.

On this day, Sima Jing, the youngest disciple under Huo Jingtong, received a sect trial task. She had to go to Yin Wind Valley, thousands of miles away, to collect Soul Yin Pearls.

Before Sima Jing departed, Li Qing, through a connection with a female outer sect disciple she was acquainted with, managed to approach her.

He pitifully recounted her plight and begged Sima Jing to take him along.

“Yin Wind Valley is a place of extreme Yin energy. Perhaps I can absorb enough Yin energy there to completely shed my male appearance.”

At first, Sima Jing hesitated, but seeing Li Qing on the verge of tears, her heart softened, and she finally agreed.

Sima Jing was barely in her twenties yet had already reached the late Foundation Establishment stage.

However, her experience was shallow. On the way to Yin Wind Valley, she was quickly swayed by Li Qing’s flattering words.

Their relationship rapidly deepened. Sima Jing came to regard Li Qing as a confidante and often lamented the misfortunes that had befallen her.

“Don’t worry, Qingqing. I’ll gather a few extra Soul Yin Pearls for you in Yin Wind Valley,” Sima Jing promised, patting her chest.

Li Qing gratefully clasped Sima Jing’s soft hands, refusing to let go.

Sima Jing’s cheeks reddened, but she did not pull away.

However, the innocent young girl had no idea that Li Qing had already leaked her journey to Yin Wind Valley to a male cultivator from another branch of the Dao Sect, Wei Lu, who had long coveted Sima Jing.

Like Qin Shou, Wei Lu was lustful. After repeated rejections in his pursuit of Sima Jing, he had developed resentment.

Upon learning that Sima Jing was traveling alone, his desire was immediately aroused. Persuaded by those around him, he finally made a decision.

He would stage a heroic “rescue the beauty” scene. A group would be sent to pretend to kill, steal treasures, and seize women. At the critical moment, he would step in, defeat the bandits, and win the beauty’s heart.

While scheming secretly, Wei Lu had no idea that he was merely a pawn in Li Qing’s plot.

As planned by Li Qing, at the critical moment of collecting the Soul Pearls in Yin Wind Valley, an unexpected group of intruders appeared.

Although Sima Jing’s strength was formidable and she had many protective treasures, she was outnumbered. Moreover, she had to protect the physically weaker Li Qing, causing her to gradually lose stamina and fall into a disadvantage.

Just as defeat seemed inevitable, Li Qing resolutely said, “Jing’er, don’t worry about me! You must run!”

Then, to avoid being a burden, Li Qing recklessly drew the attackers’ attention to himself with provocative words.

Constantly taunting them, he diverted their attacks toward himself.

Sima Jing faced less pressure, but the gap in strength between Li Qing and the bandits was immense. Within moments, Li Qing was gravely injured.

This was still the case despite the bandits holding back on Wei Lu’s orders.

Seeing Li Qing on the brink of death, Sima Jing’s tears nearly flowed.

Before Wei Lu could appear, Sima Jing used a secret technique of “jade and stone in unison,” temporarily erupting with Golden Core stage power. She forced the group to retreat and then escaped with Li Qing deeper into Yin Wind Valley.

Wei Lu’s expression darkened as he ordered his men to pursue them.

Near death, Li Qing looked at Sima Jing, who was crying while holding him, and said that he had a secret technique. If performed, it could not only heal his injuries but possibly allow him to advance further.

However, this technique required Sima Jing’s cooperation.

If Sima Jing refused, Li Qing would not force her.

Completely blinded by love and utterly naive, Sima Jing could not bear to see him die. She immediately agreed.

After an indescribable, exhilarating secret technique,

Sima Jing looked a little exhausted. However, seeing Li Qing, now full of vitality and even having broken through to Foundation Establishment stage, she could not help but smile with happiness.

Not long after, Wei Lu and his group followed the trail and found the two.

However, they never could have imagined that, in such a short time, the prey they were chasing would transform into the hunter.

After breaking through to the Foundation Establishment stage, Li Qing's combat strength nearly doubled.

Moreover, his attacks were ruthless, causing even more damage than Sima Jing, who was in the late Foundation Establishment stage.

It should be noted that this group was merely hired mercenaries.

Seeing that the situation was hopeless, they immediately considered retreating.

At this moment, Wei Lu grew anxious and couldn't help but stop them.

During this brief standoff, Li Qing seized the precise opportunity and directly struck Wei Lu, who was hiding in the shadows, exposing his true identity.

Wei Lu's cover was blown, and his expression changed drastically.

Sima Jing, trembling with rage, had a glint of killing intent in her eyes for the first time.

At this point, there was no way the matter could end peacefully.

Wei Lu, hardening his heart, promised his entire fortune to persuade the retreating bandits to fight again.

The two sides clashed once more.

No longer holding back, Li Qing and Sima Jing were quickly put at a disadvantage.

At the critical moment, Li Qing, amidst the battle, seemed to achieve another breakthrough, stirring the extreme yin energy in the Yin Wind Valley into a frenzy.

The two took advantage of the chaos to escape.

Next, Li Qing and Sima Jing fought while retreating, retreating while fighting.

They nurtured their strength through battle.

In this process, their coordination grew increasingly seamless, as if their minds were in sync. Their combined attacks nearly doubled their actual combat power.

Ultimately, relying on the terrain advantage of Yin Wind Valley, they achieved a counter-kill.

Looking at Sima Jing's disgusted expression, Wei Lu opened and closed his mouth, as if he wanted to say something.

But before he could speak, Li Qing had already reduced him to ashes.

With the crisis resolved, Sima Jing, with Li Qing's help, subsequently completed the sect's trial mission.

The two returned to the sect together.

As for what happened in Yin Wind Valley, although Wei Lu had plotted against them first, they had killed him in a fit of anger.

To avoid punishment from the sect, under Li Qing's persuasion, Sima Jing ultimately did not mention the incident to anyone.

The disappearance of Wei Lu, a Foundation Establishment disciple, did not attract much attention and was soon forgotten.

Though they were already inseparable, they had to restrain themselves in public.

Sima Jing returned to the inner sect to report to her master.

At the same time, she began to consider how to persuade her master to take Li Qing as a disciple, so they could see each other often in the future.

Meanwhile, Li Qing concealed his identity and quietly went to the market, using the spirit stones looted from Wei Lu and his group to purchase some pills that could hide his cultivation. 𝐫άΝỐ𝐛ÈȘ

Half a month later, Sima Jing's master, Huo Jingtong, finally relented under persistent pleading and agreed to meet Li Qing.

It seemed that Huo Jingtong still had some reservations about the fact that Li Qing had been castrated and transformed from male to female.

However, all these concerns vanished when she met Li Qing in person.

Li Qing knelt in the hall, head lowered, awaiting Huo Jingtong's questions.

Unexpectedly, after a long time, Huo Jingtong showed no reaction. Li Qing, thinking his plan had failed, couldn't help but look up, only to find Huo Jingtong still staring at her in a daze.

"Ahem," Huo Jingtong, being a Soul Transformation cultivator, was far more composed than the young Sima Jing.

"Qing'er has told me everything. You may leave for now."

She did not give Li Qing an immediate answer, speaking calmly instead.

Li Qing respectfully bowed and turned to leave.

But from the divine sense that remained locked on him, Li Qing knew the matter was settled.

Sure enough, seven days later, Li Qing received a sect notification and formally became a disciple under Huo Jingtong.

The outer sect female cultivators, though reluctant to see Li Qing leave, silently wished him well in their hearts.

Li Qing also promised to frequently return and visit.

After a flurry of tender farewells, Li Qing moved to the Moonlight Mountain Range.

The outer sect female cultivators, due to their longing for Li Qing, were spurred to cultivate diligently. Surprisingly, many broke through long-standing bottlenecks and joined the inner sect, fulfilling their wishes to visit Li Qing often.

That is a story for later, and need not be mentioned for now.

Huo Jingtong's lineage resided on Crystal Moon Peak in the Moonlight Mountains.

It was not far from Crystal Moon Peak, where Senior Sister Zhao was located.

However, Zhao Ruoxi was still in seclusion, so Li Qing naturally had no plans to visit Crystal Moon Peak.

On Crystal Moon Peak, there were over a hundred female disciples.

The vast majority were pure, untainted maidens.

Li Qing's arrival was akin to a mouse falling into a rice bin.

Yet, with great resolve, he restrained himself from acting recklessly.

Instead, he focused on cultivating the technique imparted by Huo Jingtong.

The true inheritance of the Moonlight lineage, [Moonlight Myriad Transformations].

Worthy of being a top-tier technique of the Grand Dao Sect, it far surpassed the unorthodox methods Li Qing had previously gathered.

Li Qing studied it repeatedly, overjoyed beyond measure.

Moreover, when he began practicing it, he was met with continual surprises.

The Reversing Order Scripture had transformed his pure yin body, which seemed to grant him a natural advantage in cultivating Moonlight Myriad Transformations.

After seven days of seclusion, he had already refined this technique to match his own realm, reaching the early Golden Core stage.

He also discovered that practicing two techniques simultaneously did not burden him.

In fact, the two complemented and reinforced each other, giving him even greater growth potential despite his already astonishing cultivation speed.

For the next period of time, he devoted all his energy to cultivation, only attending to Sima Jing during brief leisure moments.

He did not stop until both the Reversing Order Scripture and Moonlight Myriad Transformations were perfected at the early Golden Core stage.

Calculating with his fingers, Li Qing was somewhat shocked to realize that only three months had passed.

After the Golden Core stage, the cultivation speed of ordinary cultivators is usually measured in years. A ten-year seclusion is common.

Someone like him, without relying on any external resources and barely consuming any spiritual stones during practice, reaching the bottleneck from early Golden Core in just three months… was simply unheard of.

However, the bottleneck he sensed brought him some relief.

“With my current pure yin body, it seems insufficient to continue cultivating the Reversing Order Scripture,” he thought.

“I will need more, even purer yin energy.”

Li Qing’s eyes flickered.

The figures of hundreds of beautiful female disciples on Crystal Moon Peak, each with different physiques and temperaments, appeared in his mind.

They were all excellent sources of energy for his cultivation techniques.

Yet, this was after all the inner sect of a Grand Dao Sect.

His early Golden Core cultivation was still insufficient to act recklessly.

If he were discovered, he might be stripped of his cultivation and expelled from the sect.

Thus, Li Qing decided…

He would begin directly from the top of Crystal Moon Peak: his master, Huo Jingtong, a Soul Transformation cultivator!

......

To capture the mind of a Soul Transformation cultivator, even if the other party is an innocent maiden untouched by worldly affairs, is truly no easy feat.

Over the past six months, Li Qing has patiently played the role of an obedient disciple.

Aside from occasionally engaging in passionate encounters with Sima Jing, he has restrained himself and observed propriety at all other times, behaving with refined elegance. He has merely focused on cultivating the Moonlight Myriad Transformations.

Li Qing himself is already extraordinarily handsome. After achieving minor success in Moonlight Myriad Transformations, the charm it brings stacks with the effects of the Reversing Order Scripture.

Coupled with his exquisite thoughtfulness and peerless skill in handling interpersonal relations.

Thus, though he has only recently entered the sect, Li Qing has already become the most popular cultivator throughout Crystal Moon Peak.

In their daily interactions, the female cultivators gradually forgot that Li Qing is originally a man.

Six months later, on this day, Li Qing, who has endured for so long, finally awaits a perfect opportunity.

Huo Jingtong’s master, the Great Elder of the Grand Dao Sect and Dao Integration cultivator Yang Nishang, is nearing the end of her lifespan. Having failed to break through to the Longevity Immortal realm, she passes away in seated meditation within her secluded cave dwelling.

Huo Jingtong was personally selected by Yang Nishang from the foot of the mountain and raised by her hand.

The two were as close as mother and daughter.

Yang Nishang’s death strikes Huo Jingtong immensely.

Even while imparting teachings to her disciples, she suddenly becomes dazed.

Yet at this very time, the Grand Dao Sect’s competition among the nine veins and seventy-two peaks begins.

The sect competition rankings not only determine resource allocation within the sect for the next century; they are also closely tied to the bestowal of Longevity fruits.

One must know that even in the Grand Dao Sect, one of the Ten Great Immortal Sects, Longevity fruits are exceedingly rare and fiercely contested among numerous Dao Integration cultivators.

Yang Nishang, in the previous century, saw the Moonlight Lineage rank poorly in the competition, causing her priority to drop.

Thus, she died of old age without ever receiving a Longevity fruit.

This matter has become a knot in Huo Jingtong’s heart, so she desperately wishes to achieve a good ranking in the competition to comfort her master’s spirit in heaven.

Unfortunately, the Moonlight Lineage’s strength is already at the bottom among the Nine Lineage.

Among the younger disciples, Zhao Ruoxi, the most outstanding in potential and talent, has cultivated for too short a time and cannot yet shoulder great responsibility.

Thus, this competition ends with the worst result in the Moonlight Lineage’s history.

Li Qing, whose surface cultivation is merely Foundation Establishment, is not yet qualified to participate in the competition. So no blame falls on him.

But after the competition, the oppressive atmosphere throughout the Moonlight Lineage truly affects him.

As the saying goes, know shame and then be brave. The Moonlight female cultivators set aside their playful attitudes. They all focus intently on bitter cultivation, striving to regain face in the next competition.

The sect’s atmosphere becomes pure, and Li Qing’s flowery words become somewhat untimely and difficult to employ.

Huo Jingtong’s temperament also changes greatly. Her preference for disciples shifts from valuing appearance to valuing cultivation aptitude.

Thus, naturally, she gradually grows cold toward Li Qing, whose surface cultivation has stagnated.

Yet Li Qing is not worried at all.

He knows that although Crystal Moon Peak has many female cultivators with excellent talents, there is no true peerless genius like Senior Sister Zhao who can bear the burden of a Lineage’s rise.

So Li Qing is fully confident that when he reveals his true cultivation, he will completely reverse Huo Jingtong’s impression of him.

“But now is not the best moment. Let's wait a little longer.”

Sure enough, as Li Qing expected.

The cultivation progress of the Crystal Moon Peak female cultivators cannot satisfy Huo Jingtong’s demands.

Her temper grows increasingly irritable; she frequently scolds and reprimands.

The disciples dare not retort and can only lower their heads and accept punishment.

Blind punishment cannot change the status quo.

The atmosphere throughout Crystal Moon Peak becomes ever more oppressive.

Under immense psychological pressure, Zheng Keyin, the direct disciple on whom Huo Jingtong had placed high hopes, fails to break through to Nascent Soul, even damaging her cultivation foundation and rendering her future path hopeless.

This incident causes the already emotionally unstable Huo Jingtong to completely lose control.

She does not even offer a single word of comfort to this former beloved disciple. Cold as frost, she flicks her sleeve and leaves.

The indifference in her eyes leaves Zheng Keyin’s heart ashen.

A sense of sorrow for the death of a kindred spirit arises in the hearts of the other disciples.

After prolonged silence, Li Qing knows that the best opportunity he has awaited has finally arrived.

He first supports the gravely injured Zheng Keyin back, then spends three full days consoling her shattered Dao heart.

Drawing on the pure primal yin energy within her body, he breaks through to mid Golden Core in one go.

He then patiently waits another half month.

He confirms that Huo Jingtong has nearly lost all expectations for her disciples and is preparing to descend the mountain to take new ones.

On this night, Li Qing secretly knocks on Huo Jingtong’s door.

The restriction on the door is lifted, and Huo Jingtong’s cold voice comes from within.

“It is so late; what do you want?”

“Master… I have doubts about cultivation and wish to seek your guidance.” Li Qing lowers his head, speaking with sincere trepidation.

Huo Jingtong is silent for a moment and does not open the door, instead dismissing him: “Go find any senior sister. They should be able to resolve your doubts.”

Yet Li Qing does not leave.

Just as Huo Jingtong begins to feel impatient.

Li Qing suddenly speaks again: “Master, I am afraid the senior sisters cannot resolve the doubts in my heart.”

As he speaks, Li Qing releases a trace of his mid Golden Core cultivation.

“Hm?”
