The door bursts open with a boom, and Huo Jingtong instantly appears before Li Qing, scrutinizing him with shock.

For this disciple of extraordinary beauty, Huo Jingtong has paid little attention since the competition ended.

After all, his cultivation is too low, and his aptitude is mediocre.

She never imagined that this disciple she overlooked had quietly broken through to the Golden Core realm!

How long has he been cultivating?

Less than three years in total!

Such talent…

“Follow me!” A strange light flashes in Huo Jingtong’s eyes as she grabs Li Qing and pulls him into the room.

“Pure yin constitution?” After careful examination, Huo Jingtong is shocked once more.

At the time of accepting the disciple, because she still felt some disdain in her heart for the other party having changed from male to female, she did not examine carefully. She only scanned roughly with divine sense.

She never imagined that a male body could also be a supreme yin constitution.

“Master, is my cultivation speed a bit abnormal?”

“Too fast…”

“Fast enough that I am somewhat afraid.” At this moment, Li Qing, who had been observing her words and expressions, spoke up timely.

Huo Jingtong’s expression grew solemn upon hearing this.

She carefully checked Li Qing’s progress in the “Moonlight Myriad Transformation” technique once more.

After confirming nothing had gone wrong, she suppressed the joy in her heart and comforted: “It is fine; do not worry. The cultivation speed of a true heaven’s chosen is indeed beyond what ordinary people can imagine.”

“Fast is good; the faster, the better.”

Huo Jingtong murmured softly.

“By the way, have you revealed your cultivation progress to anyone else?” After a moment, Huo Jingtong reacted and quickly asked.

“No. Besides Master, I dared not mention this to anyone else. The senior sisters have all been busy cultivating during this time, so none of them know I have already reached the Golden Core realm.” Li Qing confessed honestly.

“Very good. Remember, from now on, do not easily reveal your cultivation in front of outsiders.” Huo Jingtong earnestly instructed.

Li Qing nodded repeatedly.

From that night onward, Li Qing moved to the separate courtyard next to Huo Jingtong’s.

He received personal guidance in cultivation from Huo Jingtong.

Li Qing, who carried all of Huo Jingtong’s hopes, enjoyed treatment that was worlds apart from before.

Spirit stones and pills were never in short supply; various technique manuals were provided as much as possible.

Even if a question arose and he came to ask, Huo Jingtong would temporarily pause her own cultivation to patiently resolve Li Qing’s doubts.

Day or night.

In this way, for half a year, Huo Jingtong’s thoughts were almost entirely focused on Li Qing.

Yet what made Huo Jingtong somewhat anxious was that, during this period, Li Qing’s cultivation did indeed progress.

But compared to the speed a true heaven’s chosen had shown before, the difference was far too great.

“Perhaps the pressure I put on was too much.”

After carefully examining Li Qing’s body again and failing to find the reason, Huo Jingtong could only think this.

Thus, she specially approved Li Qing’s request to take leave and relax.

When Li Qing returned three days later, her vitality and spirit seemed entirely different.

Moreover, her cultivation progress suddenly surged.

Reaching late Golden Core was not far off.

This eased Huo Jingtong’s mind slightly.

But not long after, Li Qing’s cultivation speed gradually slowed again, with changes almost perceptible.

Li Qing once more requested to go out and relax.

Huo Jingtong agreed on the surface, but doubt had already arisen in her heart.

She secretly followed Li Qing.

Yet she unexpectedly witnessed a scene that made her face flush and heart race.

In the room, Li Qing embraced a female disciple named Han Haiyan from her sect, along with Sima Jing; the three tangled together.

Pleasures of the flesh filled the room with spring scenery.

They kept uttering absurd, licentious words; Huo Jingtong could not bear it and almost rushed in to stop this unseemly behavior.

But in the end, Huo Jingtong held back.

After all, though absurd, it was consensual; they had not violated sect rules.

Huo Jingtong’s expression kept changing; ultimately, she did not interrupt Li Qing’s enjoyment and left with a flick of her sleeve.

Li Qing sensed Huo Jingtong’s figure departing outside the room; a barely perceptible smile appeared at the corner of his mouth.

His movements grew even more intense.

Three days later, when he returned to Huo Jingtong.

Seeing the other’s unfriendly expression, Li Qing said nothing and knelt directly.

“This disciple knows her mistake!”

Huo Jingtong snorted coldly: “What mistake have you committed!”

“This disciple should not have lost her mind for a moment and done such absurd things with the senior sisters. But…” Li Qing said pitifully.

“But what?” Huo Jingtong glared fiercely at Li Qing.

“But every time after finishing, I feel my cultivation speed become faster. To not disappoint Master’s expectations, I…” Li Qing’s face was full of self-reproach.

Huo Jingtong’s heart jumped upon hearing Li Qing’s words.

After checking, she found Li Qing was not lying.

The pure yin qi within Li Qing’s body had become even purer. In terms of cultivation, one month later, Li Qing smoothly broke through to late Golden Core.

“This cultivation speed…”

Huo Jingtong was shocked once more, while her heart filled with doubt.

“Could it be that doing such things really benefits cultivation?”

Huo Jingtong, who knew nothing about this, could not help feeling bewildered.

After quietly consulting some classics, Huo Jingtong understood.

It must be due to Li Qing’s extremely special constitution!

No matter the intention, Huo Jingtong had no reason to stop Li Qing’s behavior.

Thus, regarding Li Qing’s disruption of Crystal Moon Peak, she chose to turn a blind eye.

“As long as she can maintain this cultivation speed…”

“Not even in a hundred years. Soon, the entire sect will be greatly shocked.”

Huo Jingtong immersed herself in fantasies of the Moonlight lineage rising in prestige.

After multiple tests, Li Qing, certain that Huo Jingtong had tacitly approved his actions, finally stopped restraining herself.

He bared his fangs toward the female cultivators of Crystal Moon Peak.

Li Qing had always been extremely popular among these female disciples.

Now that he had become Huo Jingtong’s treasured one, as long as it was not excessive, matters on Crystal Moon Peak were practically decided by his word.

With help from female cultivators like Sima Jing who had already fallen into Li Qing’s clutches, Li Qing hardly needed effort to half-coax, half-deceive these female cultivators into bed.

Thus, Li Qing harvested the yin essence of numerous female cultivators at a terrifying speed.

The benefits were extremely evident.

Three months after breaking through to late Golden Core, aided by this unimaginably pure and vast yin essence.

Li Qing successfully formed a nascent soul and stepped into the Nascent Soul realm.

This cultivation speed could no longer be simply described as fast.

Even Huo Jingtong, who had witnessed Li Qing’s cultivation process from beginning to end, could not help feeling fear in her heart.

She seemed to understand the bewildered feeling Li Qing had when coming to her door in the middle of the night.

Just as doubt began to waver in her heart about whether to continue letting Li Qing act recklessly.

She received a sect order to assist in investigating the spreading dharma of Immortal Ancestor incidents within the sect’s territory, like sparks gradually rising.

Helpless, she could only verbally warn Li Qing before hurriedly leaving the mountain gate, hoping to complete the task and return soon.

But she could never imagine that without her presence.

Almost no one on Crystal Moon Peak could restrain Li Qing anymore.

Li Qing no longer concealed anything and openly began to ravage the remaining female cultivators.

Perhaps simply calling it ravaging was inaccurate.

In fact, those female cultivators not only did not resist.

Most even enjoyed it.

Physical and psychological factors were secondary; the most crucial was that the female cultivators of Crystal Moon Peak discovered that after enjoying pleasure with Li Qing, their own cultivation speed became several times faster than before.

At first, with few instances, they did not notice.

Later, as it accumulated day by day, this difference gradually became apparent.

It brought pleasure and benefited cultivation.

Who could refuse?

Thus, in less than half a month.

Crystal Moon Peak completely fell.

No female cultivator could escape Li Qing’s demonic grasp.

When Huo Jingtong returned, this was the situation she faced.

Huo Jingtong’s expression was extremely unsightly.

"Disobedient one!"

Huo Jingtong’s heart burned with anger.

Before leaving, she had repeatedly reminded and warned him to behave properly.

Yet this wayward disciple not only ignored her instructions but had grown even more reckless, wreaking havoc on all the disciples of Crystal Moon Peak!

If this were to be exposed…

The very thought of the consequences made Huo Jingtong feel her vision darken.

"I cannot continue to indulge him. I must give him a severe lesson!"

With this thought, Huo Jingtong condensed one-tenth of her full strength into a streak of moonlight and struck toward Li Qing.

The moment she launched the attack, a pang of regret struck her.

After all, she was a Soul Transformation cultivator. Even one-tenth of her power was far beyond what Li Qing, who had just entered the Nascent Soul stage, could withstand.

If she injured him…

As she considered restraining her strength, something astonishing occurred.

A crescent moon rose behind Li Qing, illuminating his already extraordinary features, making him appear like a celestial being.

The moonlight strike from Huo Jingtong was effortlessly blocked by Li Qing!

"Impossible! The moon is only half revealed. This is the sign of ‘Moonlight Myriad Transformation’ entering mastery! Only late Nascent Soul practitioners can achieve this! I’ve only been gone for a short time!" Huo Jingtong’s heart surged with both joy and shock, and her blood boiled.

The movement stirred her internal injuries, her face turning pale, and she coughed up a mouthful of blood.

Seeing this, Li Qing instantly flashed beside Huo Jingtong and supported her shoulders, his expression filled with concern. "Master, you are injured. Let me heal you!"

"Hmph, I am a proud Soul Transformation cultivator, I—" Huo Jingtong’s words were cut short by a groan as she was forced to stop.

Feeling the pure Yin force flowing from Li Qing’s heated palms, Huo Jingtong sensed an indescribable tingling, as if ants were crawling all over her body, yet it was incredibly pleasurable.

However, as a Soul Transformation cultivator, she quickly suppressed the sensation. Her attention shifted to the pure energy continuously transmitted into her body by her disciple, leaving her astonished.

Once the pure Yin force entered her body, it acted like a catalyst, stirring waves in her moonlight cultivation. After the tumultuous intertwining, the Yin force fully merged into her vast moonlight energy.

What Huo Jingtong had once considered nearly perfect moonlight power now became even purer after the fusion, subtly infused with the profound aura of the Dao.

This was a sign of breakthrough toward the Dao Integration stage!

Words could not describe Huo Jingtong’s shock and confusion at that moment.

A fleeting thought crossed her mind: how wonderful it would be if Li Qing’s transmission of pure Yin force would never stop.

As the two forces intertwined, her long-stalled cultivation gradually rose, and Huo Jingtong’s mind slowly became lost in the sensation.

Time seemed to pass unnoticed…

Li Qing released the palms pressing against Huo Jingtong’s back.

"Master…" he softly called, looking at her still slightly dazed state.

Huo Jingtong regained her senses, and a blush instantly rose on her cheeks.

"I am healed. You may leave now," she said in a flustered tone.

"Then I can be at ease." Li Qing exhaled, cupping his hands before leaving.

Watching him leave quickly, a trace of irritation surfaced in Huo Jingtong’s heart once again.

From that day onward, a subtle, unusual emotion began to spread between master and disciple.

However, Li Qing did not directly expose it, instead maintaining the image of a obedient disciple who respected the master and valued the Dao in front of Huo Jingtong.

Yet behind the scenes, the actions that brought chaos to Crystal Moon Peak never ceased.

Huo Jingtong’s divine perception covered the entire mountain, and everything that happened was within her sight.

Although the situation remained utterly absurd, the deed was already done. Was she really going to wipe out her disciples?

Moreover, Li Qing had not lied. Under the effect of that extraordinary extreme Yin power, the improvement in the disciples’ strength was visible to all.

Thus, Huo Jingtong could only let it be, allowing Li Qing to act as he wished.

To prevent detection by cultivators from other peaks, she even actively set up formation arrays to conceal him.

With the nourishment of the extreme Yin power from the Reversing Order Scripture, the disciples of Crystal Moon Peak enjoyed pleasure while their cultivation advanced rapidly.

Only Huo Jingtong herself did not receive these benefits.

Li Qing also behaved as if he had no particular thoughts toward his master, acting with utmost propriety in every movement.

Thus, two years passed in the blink of an eye.

At the top of Crystal Moon Peak, inside a secluded chamber for meditation.

Huo Jingtong watched anxiously as Li Qing stood before her, a massive aura of spiritual power surrounding him. Her mind was filled with complex emotions.

“Just over two years, and he is about to break into the Nascent Soul stage.”

“This cultivation speed is unheard of.”

“If he succeeds, will his power be on par with mine? If he forces his way...”

Huo Jingtong’s mind was a chaotic blur.

At that moment, a strong wind swept through as a tremendous aura surged from Li Qing, only to vanish abruptly.

“He really succeeded?!” Huo Jingtong stared at Li Qing, stunned.

“Thank you, Master, for protecting me!” Li Qing cupped his hands and bowed politely.

Huo Jingtong, however, turned away, avoiding his gesture.

According to the rules of the Daoist sect, once a disciple’s cultivation reaches or surpasses the master’s, they may address each other as equals.

Of course, if one respects the master and values the Dao, the hierarchical relationship can remain regardless of relative strength.

Li Qing smiled slightly. “Even if one day I attain Longevity Immortal, in my heart, Master, you will always be my master. My one and only master.”

Huo Jingtong’s body trembled slightly at his words.

Seeing Li Qing’s earnest expression, a wave of emotion rose in her heart.

“Let’s go. With another Nascent Soul cultivator on Crystal Moon Peak, such a joyful occasion should be shared with others promptly.” Li Qing stepped forward and gently held Huo Jingtong’s flawless hand.

Huo Jingtong symbolically resisted but did not pull away.

She no longer resisted.

On Crystal Moon Peak, a moment of indulgent pleasure unfolded.

And in the depth of their intimacy, Huo Jingtong could not remain indifferent.

At night, after everyone else had fallen into deep sleep.

Li Qing absorbed the previously untapped, massive Yin energy from Huo Jingtong’s body, nodding in satisfaction.

“The feedback from a Soul Transformation cultivator is indeed extraordinary.”

“This immense Yin essence is enough to support my rapid cultivation in the Soul Transformation stage for some time.”

“However, it is still not enough!”

After this leap in power, Li Qing’s ambition swelled further.

He began to set his sights on other female disciples of the Moonlight branch.

“Only the Longevity Immortal stage is my ultimate pursuit.”

Under the moonlight, Li Qing’s shadow remained hidden.

Only his face was partially obscured by the night, impossible to see clearly.

The next day, Huo Jingtong woke and brought Li Qing to meditate together.

The bottleneck that had constrained and troubled her for years finally loosened slightly after the breakthrough last night.

Huo Jingtong felt it in her heart. Her advancement to Dao Integration was no longer far away.

Chapter 923: Dreams Eventually End

Half a month later.

At the height of the sun, an overwhelmingly powerful aura suddenly surged from Crystal Moon Peak, shooting straight into the sky.

It pointed directly toward the heavens.

The sunlight was instantly obscured, and a bright white moon appeared in the sky.

It was as if night had suddenly descended upon the Grand Dao Sect. This extraordinary phenomenon immediately drew the attention of everyone in the sect.

Under the gaze of all, a graceful figure in white emerged.

Her posture was elegant, like a true immortal from the moon. The moment she appeared, every man and woman in the Daoist Sect was momentarily stunned.

“Junior Sister Jingtong has advanced to the Dao Integration realm. Congratulations are in order!”

The voice of the sect leader, Fang Dingge, rang loudly throughout the sect, followed by one congratulatory message after another.

No one had expected that the usually weak Moonlight branch would be the first to have a core disciple advance to Dao Integration.

What was even more remarkable was that Huo Jingtong had been cultivating for less than a century.

She was truly very young.

In other words, as long as she did not recklessly provoke death, it was highly likely she would live to the day she consumed the Longevity Fruit position.

A potential Longevity Immortal-realm powerhouse had appeared, and the balance of power in the Grand Dao Sect was about to change completely.

Countless hearts stirred.

Once they realized this, many immediately sent their subordinates to prepare congratulatory gifts.

The celebration ceremony for Huo Jingtong’s advancement to Dao Integration was held in a grand manner under Fang Dingge’s direction.

Not only did everyone within the sect offer congratulations, but invitations were also sent to other sects of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

The festivities lasted for more than a month before finally concluding.

Once everything had settled, Huo Jingtong, now a Dao Integration cultivator, quietly returned to Crystal Moon Peak.

“Master…” Li Qing had already been waiting for some time.

He looked at Huo Jingtong and smiled faintly.

Huo Jingtong knew that her advancement to Dao Integration was inseparable from Li Qing’s support.

“You little troublemaker…”

“Have you ever experienced the taste of being a Dao Integration cultivator?”

Her eyes were dreamy as she spoke words full of contrast.

At the same time, she casually set up a restriction formation, sealing the door.

After secluded cultivation for seven full days, she finally left, still somewhat reluctant.

The effects of Dao Integration were indeed beyond imagination.

Because of her exposure to the power of the Heavenly Dao after reaching Dao Integration, Huo Jingtong’s Reversing Order Scripture not only achieved “Reverse Yang into Yin”, but also came into contact with other principles of heaven and earth.

The results this time were even better than all her previous attempts combined.

It directly helped Li Qing, who had just advanced to Soul Transformation, break through to mid-stage Soul Transformation.

He had moved one step closer to his goal.

After Huo Jingtong reached Dao Integration, as the only existing Dao Integration cultivator of the Moonlight branch, she naturally became its true ruler.

Dao Integration cultivators possessed many privileges.

Not only could they designate a single peak as their personal residence, but they could also exercise life-and-death authority over ordinary disciples.

The Grand Dao Sect had complete trust in Huo Jingtong, who had grown up within the sect.

To support her in revitalizing the Moonlight branch, she was even granted permissions that other Dao Integration elders did not have.

Thus, Huo Jingtong, who now held supreme power in the Moonlight branch, gradually began implementing her plan.

Having personally experienced the terrifying nature of Li Qing’s special constitution and being the greatest beneficiary of it, her stance had completely aligned with his.

Using various pretexts, she summoned the most outstanding female cultivators of the Moonlight branch to her residence.

Li Qing then personally guided them.

Although it carried an element of pressure, after cultivating together, they found slight improvements in their own realms.

The small remnants of dissatisfaction in their hearts vanished instantly.

Some even chose to keep it secret, hoping to gain more opportunities in the future.

In less than a year, the Moonlight branch had completely fallen under Li Qing’s control.

As Li Qing’s cultivation grew deeper and more profound, the strange atmosphere surrounding hie naturally drew the attention of the few remaining male cultivators within the Moonlight Branch.

However, without any solid evidence, and with Huo Jingtong, a Dao Integration cultivator, overseeing matters, they were left helpless.

The only thing they could do was to volunteer for missions outside the sect, hoping to avoid any further entanglement.

Huo Jingtong, of course, readily agreed.

With the departure of those male cultivators, the Moonlight Branch finally fell completely under the control of Li Qing and Huo Jingtong.

Freely absorbing Yin essence, Li Qing’s cultivation advanced without encountering any bottleneck, soaring rapidly.

He now stood at the peak of Soul Transformation, just one step away from breaking through to Dao Integration.

“I need a new Dao Integration female cultivator to assist me,” Li Qing said slowly to Huo Jingtong within the secluded chamber.

Huo Jingtong’s gaze lingered on Li Qing for a long time before she finally nodded.

“There are not many Dao Integration female cultivators in the sect. Among them, Zhang Xiyu of the Righteous Path Court has the weakest network of connections. She would be the most suitable target.”

Li Qing had already considered every Dao Integration female cultivator within the Grand Dao Sect.

“She is a solitary person and rarely interacts with others. Indeed, a fine target. But since she has reached Dao Integration, I worry things might not go smoothly,” Li Qing said, a flicker of concern passing through her eyes.

Huo Jingtong smiled. “Don’t worry. It doesn’t always have to come down to fighting and killing.”

“Zhang Xiyu cares little about her physical body or appearance. What she values most is cultivation itself. If I tempt her with the secret of my rapid progress, do you think she would refuse?”

“Master, you are becoming more and more like me,” Li Qing said with a hint of admiration.

As the two whispered to each other, a great web of conspiracy slowly spread.

The plan proceeded smoothly.

Upon hearing Huo Jingtong’s words, Zhang Xiyu hesitated only briefly before agreeing to try.

She did, however, make it clear that if there were no results, the two of them would pay with their lives.

Li Qing smiled gently and told her not to worry.

Two Dao Integration cultivators and one who was on the verge of reaching that realm entered a secluded cultivation chamber together.

Time passed quickly. Within a month, Zhang Xiyu emerged from the chamber.

By then, Li Qing had already successfully broken through to Dao Integration.

If not for the presence of the two women concealing the disturbance caused by his breakthrough, the entire event might have been exposed.

“Now, are you finally satisfied?”

From behind, Huo Jingtong wrapped her arms around Li Qing and whispered softly.

Li Qing was silent for a moment before asking, “Master, do you not desire the position of the Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign?”

Huo Jingtong’s hands suddenly froze, then clutched Li Qing tightly, refusing to let go for a long time.

After a while, she chuckled lightly. “With your talent, the next Longevity Immortal seat will surely be yours.”

Li Qing grasped her hands firmly and said earnestly, “I still need your help, Master.”

...

After that, the two began their breakthrough toward the Longevity Immortal realm, the highest realm in the entire cultivation world.

At that moment, less than ten years had passed since Li Qing had first built his Foundation.

In other words, Senior Sister Zhao Ruoxi was still in seclusion.

Li Qing seemed to have completely forgotten about her childhood companion and made no effort to seek her out.

Finally, the ten-year period came to an end.

The sealed stone gate slowly rose, and Zhao Ruoxi stepped out of the chamber.

Taking a deep breath, her expression suddenly changed.

Then...

The entire Grand Dao Sect began to tremble violently.

Chapter 924: The True Dao of the Grand Dao Sect

At the same time, inside the Grand Hall of the Grand Dao Sect, Li Qing’s expression changed drastically as he watched the Fruit of Longevity before him fade from solid to illusory, about to disappear entirely.

Instinctively, he reached out to seize it, trying to hold it back.

Over the past ten years, he had relied on the terrifying power of the Scripture of Reversing Order to secretly corrupt the female cultivators of the Grand Dao Sect, turning their cultivation into nourishment for himself.

He even selected exceptionally talented female disciples and trained them in secret.

In the end, among the Grand Path Sect’s seats of elders, women occupied eight out of ten positions.

Within the sect, yin flourished while yang declined. Female disciples, in both number and quality, completely surpassed their male counterparts.

Although the sect’s senior Longevity Immortals eventually noticed that something was amiss, the momentum of Li Qing’s faction had already become too great.

If they truly tried to eradicate Li Qing’s lineage, the Grand Dao Sect would suffer far more than internal injury.

It might well perish in civil strife.

From the standpoint of the greater whole, after several rounds of negotiation, both sides finally reached a compromise.

Li Qing’s past misconduct would be forgiven and not further pursued. Going forward, he would no longer be excessively interfered with. However, he had to ensure that the ratio of male cultivators within the sect remained stable and that newly admitted female disciples retained their purity.

As part of the agreement, a portion of the Fruit of Longevity would be allocated to Li Qing’s faction.

The Fruit of Longevity was born upon the Ruo Tree.

It was jointly managed by the Ten Great Immortal Sects, and a single fruit could grant one eternal longevity.

Today was the day Li Qing was finally to receive his share—the moment he had schemed toward for ten long years.

Yet, right at this crucial instant, the fruit disappeared before his very eyes.

How could Li Qing, who had exhausted all his efforts and plotted for a decade, possibly accept this?

“No!”

Unable to maintain his composure, Li Qing let out a furious roar.

“What are you all waiting for? Help me!”

No matter how he raged, he could not stop the Fruit of Longevity from vanishing.

He turned instinctively toward his companions in the hall.

But that single glance made Li Qing’s heart tremble.

Inside the Grand Hall, more than ten female cultivators—including his master, Huo Jingtong—all stood there, gazing at him in unison.

And yet…

Their eyes were utterly different from before. Gone was the affectionate tenderness he was used to. What replaced it was something utterly alien, strange, and chilling.

It was as if, in that instant, their souls had all been replaced.

As the entire Grand Dao Sect trembled more and more violently, Li Qing could feel the gaze of every cultivator within the sect converging upon him.

“This…”

Even Li Qing, who had always been brazen and fearless, could not help swallowing hard as he took a step back.

The hall was utterly silent.

Without warning, a figure appeared quietly before him.

It was Zhao Ruoxi—his senior sister, who had been in seclusion for ten years and had not been seen since.

Looking at the woman before him, so familiar yet so unfamiliar, Li Qing’s heart was filled with confusion and unease.

At this moment, he was already at the peak of Dao Integration, just a step away from the Longevity Realm.

Yet in front of this former Senior Sister Zhao, his spiritual intuition screamed in alarm.

“What is happening?”

A wave of dizziness struck him, as though he had forgotten something vital.

Memories of the past ten years flashed rapidly through his mind, then receded like a tide, becoming vague and indistinct—like a fading dream.

“Very good.”

Senior Sister Zhao looked at Li Qing, her first words an expression of approval.

“I originally intended only to give you a small punishment for your earlier insolence.”

“Yet I did not expect that, under such circumstances, you could reach this level in merely ten years.”

“Of all those who have entered my path over the years, you are the first.”

“An intriguing experience indeed.”

Senior Sister Zhao’s face showed no emotion as she spoke calmly.

At that moment, Li Qing suddenly realized that every other female cultivator in the great hall wore the exact same expression as Senior Sister Zhao.

“Uh…”

A sudden, splitting pain pierced Li Qing’s skull. He clutched his head instinctively.

The surroundings of the Grand Dao Sect began to waver more violently, until at last the illusion completely collapsed, shattering inch by inch.

Amid the breaking lights and shadows, Li Qing saw that everyone’s faces had turned into Senior Sister Zhao’s face.

Boom.

The world went completely dark.

When Li Qing regained consciousness, the memories that had been sealed for so long finally surged back into his mind.

“Senior Sister Zhao’s illusion art truly is formidable…”

“Even with full awareness, I still fell into it and could not pull myself free.”

Li Qing frowned slightly and extended his divine sense downward to check his body.

“Fortunately, it was only a dream.”

Thinking of the countless intoxicating scenes during those ten illusory years, and then remembering that all those women were merely incarnations of the One-Heart Heavenly Sovereign, Li Qing could not help but feel momentarily dazed.

But his will was strong. He quickly regained his composure and focused his thoughts on that astonishing scripture, the Reversing Order Scripture.

Unfortunately, no matter how hard he tried to recall, every detail of the technique remained like a reflection in water or flowers in a mirror, impossible to grasp.

Regret filled Li Qing’s heart.

“Such divine power, yet I cannot bring it out. I wonder if this technique truly exists in reality, or if it was merely something the One-Heart Heavenly Sovereign fabricated within the illusion.”

Countless thoughts churned in his mind before he finally calmed himself.

Looking around, the scenery was strikingly familiar.

It was identical to the Grand Dao Sect of the illusion.

He was now standing at the entrance of the sect.

Gazing at the stone path that led up the mountain, Li Qing hesitated, unable to take the first step.

“What’s wrong? Weren’t you bold a moment ago? Why so timid now?”

A mocking voice came from further up the path.

Following the sound, Li Qing saw a young male cultivator holding a broom, dressed in the outer-sect robes of the Grand Dao Sect.

The man leaned on his broom, looking down at Li Qing from above.

Li Qing knew this was yet another of the countless bodies of the One-Heart Heavenly Sovereign, so he did not dare to be disrespectful.

He cupped his hands and bowed politely, then began walking up the stone steps.

“You know the way. Go up yourself. I’ve got cleaning to do, so I won’t be keeping you company,” said the young outer-sect disciple casually as he walked down the stairs, brushing past Li Qing without looking up.

At the same time, he began carefully sweeping the very steps Li Qing had just walked upon.

“Even though they are all the same person, each body still seems to retain its own original or assigned identity…”

“What would you call that… role-playing?”

Li Qing narrowed his eyes slightly and continued walking deeper into the Grand Dao Sect.

Unlike the eerie stillness at the end of the illusion, when everyone had turned into Senior Sister Zhao, this Grand Dao Sect was full of vitality.

Along the way, Li Qing encountered many cultivators.

They glanced at him briefly, then returned to their own affairs.

They chatted, argued, and sparred.

Li Qing even saw several pairs of Dao companions whispering intimately to each other.

The scene was lively and bustling, as if the Grand Dao Sect of old had never been destroyed.

Yet the more lifelike it seemed, the more vigilant Li Qing became toward the One-Heart Heavenly Sovereign.

“It seems that after several thousand years, Senior Sister Zhao has indeed made progress.”

Chapter 925: The One-Heart and the Shattered Bone Face

“Besides the One Heart that represents the proof of immortality, the attribute of Myriad Voices is becoming increasingly prominent.”

As Li Qing walked forward, he quietly observed his surroundings.

“Boy, did you have fun inside the illusion realm?”

At that moment, a voice suddenly drew his attention.

Li Qing looked over and saw an old man in tattered clothes lying carelessly on the ground, as if no one else existed in his world.

Uncertain of the man’s intentions, Li Qing chose not to respond and remained cautious.

“Hehe, no need to be so tense. Being too stiff will only make things worse.”

“Just act the same way you did inside the illusion realm. Our group happens to be missing someone like you.”

The old man spoke highly of Li Qing, unreserved in his praise.

However, as the old man continued speaking, Li Qing faintly sensed several unfriendly gazes settling upon him.

“Oh, right. Let me tell you a little secret.”

“To make things more entertaining, inside the illusion realm, not only were your original memories sealed, but so were mine.”

“Only when the illusion begins to collapse does my true consciousness awaken.”

“In that instant, the memories of everyone within the illusion erupt all at once.”

A look of intoxicated pleasure appeared on the old man’s face, as though he had just tasted a jar of fine aged wine.

“Two hundred twenty-three thousand six hundred and eighty times…”

“Two hundred twenty-three thousand six hundred and eighty times!”

The old man repeated the number again.

“Tsk, tsk, tsk… Your sense of pleasure is not even one ten-thousandth of mine.”

He shook his head, muttering to himself in delight.

When Li Qing heard that number, 223,680, he was momentarily stunned, not quite understanding what it meant.

But soon, realization struck him, and his expression turned strange.

When he looked again, the ragged old man had already vanished without a trace.

“This body seems to have once belonged to a Dao Integration Elder of the Grand Dao Sect.”

Li Qing recalled fragments of the illusion’s memories and pondered silently as he continued toward the sect’s main hall at the summit.

Along the way, he overheard many heated arguments.

“Why did you have to castrate him? Wouldn’t a normal start have been fine?”

“Now you object? You were the one who agreed back then.”

“I think a bit of punishment was fine, but the real issue is, why did you give him the Reversing Order Scripture?”

“It was a newly developed cultivation method. Of course we had to test its effects. Who could have guessed that brat would stir up so much trouble? Tsk, tsk…”

“Heh, I think you did it on purpose.”

“In that case, we can’t use the Reversing Order Scripture again next time.”

“No way. Such a fine thing can’t just be banned like that.”

“I oppose it!”

“So do I!”

…

No one could be seen, yet the voices echoed endlessly around Li Qing’s ears like whispers of ghosts.

It was as though countless unseen figures were staring at him and murmuring among themselves.

Outwardly, Li Qing maintained a calm expression, but deep down, a faint chill crept through his heart.

The overlapping voices tangled together, like countless thoughts colliding within his mind.

His spirit seemed to fracture into innumerable shards.

The closer he drew to the sect’s grand hall, the more chaotic the chorus became.

The words grew increasingly deranged, turning into the mad murmurs of demons, stabbing into his mind like needles.

Suddenly, Li Qing halted.

He noticed a faint wetness upon his face. When he gently touched it, he realized that blood was streaming from his nostrils and eyes.

At some point, his vision had begun to blur.

Li Qing wiped his blood clean, and while his body still had strength, he quickened his pace.

But the demonic sounds in his ears did not stop, they only grew more intense.

"Cough, cough."

Li Qing let out a violent cough, and fragments of his internal organs were actually expelled.

After climbing several dozen more steps, this body could not hold on any longer.

Under the vibration of countless clamorous voices, it turned into a pool of rotten flesh.

But soon, as the blood and flesh in the void writhed, a new body began to reform.

Yet those omnipresent demonic sounds seemed determined not to let Li Qing recover.

Before the body fully appeared, it was crushed again.

Thus on the long stairway, an extremely uncanny scene unfolded.

A mass of formless rotten flesh painfully crawled and climbed upward.

Each time it was crushed, it reappeared.

The total amount of flesh seemed to lessen each time.

Although Li Qing never gave up, by the end only a small malformed lump of flesh remained, struggling and clumsily rolling.

Even in that state, the surrounding sounds showed no sign of abating.

If anything, they grew more excited. The noise became sharp, no longer resembling human voices, but rather meaningless static from the world itself.

Just as Li Qing’s last bit of flesh was about to vanish entirely, a shadow of a Black Sword suddenly materialized.

It gave out a faint sword chime.

In an instant, it temporarily suppressed the surrounding cacophony of demonic chaos.

Seizing that single moment, the Black Sword shadow erupted with speed. It became a streaking line and shot straight into the sect’s main hall.

Although the hall doors were open, from the outside the interior was pitch black.

Like an abyss, nothing could be seen.

After that momentary silence, countless voices burst out.

Like an avalanche and a storm, they wailed and howled.

"I told you he could do it."

"Hehehe, interesting, very interesting."

"Why spare him on purpose, why? Why not let me grind him into minced meat inch by inch?"

"Stop pretending. Is it fun to fool yourself?"

...

In stark contrast to the noisy and terrifying environment outside the hall, the Grand Dao Sect’s main hall was unnaturally quiet.

Inside the broad hall, aside from the leader’s seat at the highest point, there was nothing.

Senior Sister Zhao sat quietly in the seat.

Like a child, she sat properly, with a straight back.

Her hands rested on her thighs.

Her expression seemed frozen, utterly motionless.

Li Qing glanced at Senior Sister Zhao secretly.

Her face seemed fixed at the age of a teenager.

It was exactly the same as what had been seen in the illusion.

"I pay respects to the One-Heart Heavenly Sovereign."

Although the atmosphere was strange, Li Qing still bowed respectfully.

"What brings you here?"

Senior Sister Zhao’s pleasant voice sounded.

It did not come from the figure on the seat, but from all four walls of the hall.

Li Qing did not conceal his purpose and spoke directly, "I have come for the Xuantian Sect’s former cultivation manuals."

"The Heaven and Earth Converging Manual, the Sole Dominance Eternal Art, the Soul-Severing Divine Radiance art, the Scripture of Heaven's Sorrow and Earth's Grief...."

"These texts originally belonged to my Xuantian Sect. They should be returned to their rightful owner today."

Li Qing spoke seriously.

Silence fell in the hall for a moment.

Then Senior Sister Zhao seemed to hear something extremely amusing, and she chuckled repeatedly.

"Members of the Xuantian Sect are not all dead yet?"

"How did you know I once had those techniques?"

"Apart from those, I have many others. Do you want them?"

Chapter 926: The Strange Object that Intimidated the Heavenly Sovereign

“Do you want it?”

The few words sounded as if they were spoken by different people. Each tone and cadence was distinct.

Their echoes lingered throughout the Grand Hall of the sect, refusing to fade, making the already eerie atmosphere even more sinister.

Yet Li Qing showed not a trace of fear. “If the Heavenly Sovereign dares to give it, I dare to take it.”

Senior Sister Zhao’s laughter abruptly stopped.

In that instant, Li Qing felt as though countless gazes were cast upon him from every direction within the hall.

“Remnant of the Xuantian Sect…”

“Even if I were to give it to you, so what? Do you think you can walk out of my Grand Dao Sect alive?”

Only a single cold voice remained, questioning her.

Li Qing smiled faintly. “If I do not try, how would I ever know?”

The provocation in his words was so sharp that even though his actions in this illusion were strange, it still seemed as though he had truly angered the One-Pattern Heavenly Sovereign.

All at once, countless human faces emerged within the empty hall beside Li Qing.

Each face bore a different expression, yet all of them fixed their gaze upon him.

From beneath those faces, out of the void-like darkness, countless pale arms stretched out toward him.

In an instant, Li Qing was swallowed by that tide of pallid limbs, as if he would soon vanish from the hall altogether.

However...

Moments later, countless shrill screams suddenly burst forth from those faces.

The cries were filled with terror, panic, and hatred, as if something horrifying lay hidden within Li Qing’s body.

Without exception, all of them scattered in every direction, fleeing even faster than when they had rushed to devour him.

At the center of the hall, the composed young Zhao Senior Sister finally showed a flicker of emotion upon her calm face.

Bang!

Several stone pillars abruptly appeared above Li Qing and crashed down, forming a cage that trapped him within.

“What is that thing... on you?”

For the first time, a trace of unease appeared in the One-Heart Heavenly Sovereign’s usually cold voice.

Li Qing smiled and countered, “I was hoping to ask the Heavenly Sovereign that myself. Do you perhaps recognize it?”

The hall fell silent for a few breaths.

Then the Heavenly Sovereign’s voice echoed once more. “I had doubted whether you were truly of the Xuantian Sect, but now I am inclined to believe it.”

“To dare to implant such a thing within your divine soul...”

“What a pity. We can no longer merge as one.”

Li Qing said nothing.

He merely focused on the flickering sphere of seven-colored light deep within his divine soul.

It had been there since he first became self-aware, sealed deep within his spiritual consciousness—clearly something his original body had implanted when creating this clone.

The seven-colored radiance itself was not what mattered. What mattered was what lay sealed within it.

Even through that prismatic barrier, Li Qing constantly felt as if a blade hung above his head.

It was evident that whatever was sealed inside was unimaginably dangerous.

Though he retained no memory of its origin, Li Qing understood one thing clearly—his original self had dared to send him, merely at the Nascent Soul True Lord realm, alone into the Grand Dao Sect, precisely because of this object’s terrifying deterrence.

Despite the dreadful entity slumbering within his divine soul, Li Qing remained calm and unafraid.

His thoughts passed quickly. Looking at the straight-backed young Senior Sister Zhao before him, he spoke solemnly.

“The Heavenly Sovereign has already attained the position of Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign. Such cultivation methods are now meaningless to you.”

“But to us of the Xuantian Sect, they are of utmost importance. If the Heavenly Sovereign would grant us this favor, our sect will surely repay the kindness in full.”

Seeing that the One-Heart Heavenly Sovereign still remained silent, Li Qing hesitated for a moment before adding, “In truth, our Xuantian Sect is not unreasonable. If the Heavenly Sovereign is willing to return the item to its rightful owner, we are prepared to offer suitable compensation.”

“And I believe this is something the Heavenly Sovereign will definitely find interesting,” Li Qing said confidently.

Without a sound, the countless human faces that had previously retreated now pressed forward again.

“Compensation…”

Those faces let out eerie laughter.

“The Xuantian Sect was destroyed a thousand years ago. You people are nothing but rats who dare not see the light of day.”

“What could you possibly have that would make me…”

Before the voice could finish, it abruptly stopped.

Everyone stared at the sudden burst of golden light that appeared in Li Qing’s palm, their expressions frozen in shock.

This place, the Grand Dao Sect, was the foundation of her ascension to the Longevity Immortal Realm.

Although it still existed within the Xuanhuang Realm, it was, in truth, a separate domain—a world within a world—entirely under her control.

Within the Grand Dao Sect, no energy fluctuation, no ripple of power could escape her perception.

Yet this sudden golden light…

One-Heart Heavenly Sovereign was certain the light did not originate from Li Qing’s body, but from beyond the Grand Dao Sect itself.

To be able to ignore her restrictions and move freely in and out…

Sensing the energy contained within that golden glow, ancient memories from the Grand Dao Sect’s former elders surfaced within her mind.

Seeing Senior Sister Zhao’s reaction, Li Qing knew that his plan had succeeded.

He raised his voice and declared, “A single defeat does not mean defeat for eternity. These years of silence do not mean we have vanished from the river of history.”

“Even a centipede, long dead, still twitches. How much more so a True Immortal legacy?”

Li Qing lifted his head proudly.

Senior Sister Zhao, who had obtained several cultivation methods from the Xuantian Sect, naturally understood how terrifying the sect’s true heritage was.

Just a few of their inherited techniques had nearly allowed her to ascend as a Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign.

The true inheritance of the Xuantian Sect was undoubtedly unfathomable.

More importantly…

Though the Xuantian Sect’s downfall back then was said to be caused by the combined forces of the Ten Great Immortal Sects, according to secret records preserved within the Grand Dao Sect, that war of annihilation had been full of strange circumstances.

At first, the allied sects had never intended to completely destroy the Xuantian Sect. Yet, as the battle went on, the opposing side suddenly collapsed on its own.

Even more strangely, the Xuantian King—said to have reached the Half-Step True Immortal realm—never appeared on the battlefield.

That was the only reason the war ended so easily.

The Ten Immortal Sects had long suspected that something was amiss.

Fearing that the Xuantian King might one day return, they issued a “kill on sight” order against all surviving members of the Xuantian Sect, hoping to draw him out.

Unexpectedly, it was as if he had evaporated from existence. From that day onward, he never appeared again within the Xuanhuang World.

“Now that the Xuantian Sect has risen from the ashes… does this mean the Xuantian King will also return to the mortal world?”

That thought involuntarily surfaced in the mind of One-Heart Heavenly Sovereign.

After all, the gray mold-like aura and the golden radiance of willpower displayed by Li Qing were clearly not powers a common cultivator could possess.

She did not dwell on the matter for long.

In her view, another contender within the Xuanhuang World was not necessarily a bad thing.

Though a Half-Immortal was powerful, the Xuanhuang Realm had changed greatly since those days.

Perhaps the return of that Half-Immortal might even bring about transformation and new life.

Inside the grand hall, the thousands of pale faces staring coldly at Li Qing vanished in an instant.

The gloomy chamber became bright again.

“You brought quite the lovely gift,” a voice spoke, its tone now entirely different from before.

Chapter 927: Twists and Turns

“Since you want the cultivation method so badly…”

“Considering how good you are at pleasing people, I’ll give it to you.”

“However, I do have one condition.”

Hearing One-Heart Heavenly Sovereign’s words, Li Qing was momentarily stunned.

From within the shadows, a tall and voluptuous woman slowly stepped out.

She looked to be in her thirties. Compared to the young Senior Sister Zhao who sat before her, she appeared more mature and alluring.

“You performed quite well in the illusion. I wonder, how capable are you in reality?”

“If you can satisfy me, perhaps, if I am in a good mood, I might even gift you a few extra cultivation methods.”

The mature Senior Sister Zhao raised her index finger to her lips and gently licked it.

Her eyes were hazy and sultry as she gazed at Li Qing, her face flushed as if dripping with desire.

“Alright.”

Li Qing nodded, agreeing without hesitation.

Moments later...

A black longsword appeared before him.

Its tip pointed directly at One-Heart Heavenly Sovereign.

Li Qing’s expression was solemn. “I have one sword. Please, Senior Sister, enlighten me.”

His voice echoed through the grand hall like rolling thunder, reverberating for a long time.

The seductive smile on Senior Sister Zhao’s face instantly froze.

She gave Li Qing a deep, unreadable look. Then her figure retreated swiftly and vanished into the darkness.

“Get lost.”

A streak of silver light shot toward Li Qing.

Contained within it were the cultivation methods of the Xuantian Sect that Li Qing had long yearned for.

Aside from the techniques he already knew—such as Heaven and Earth Converging Manual and Eternal Sole Dominance Art—there were two completely new ones.

[The Secret Canon of Sitting in Oblivion], [The Three Perils of Ghosts and Spirits in the Netherworld Record].

Li Qing was overjoyed. “Many thanks, Heave—”

Before he could finish speaking, a wave of dizziness overcame him.

In the next instant, his surroundings shifted abruptly.

He was no longer inside the Grand Dao Sect, but had already been kicked out by Senior Sister Zhao.

He had returned to the territory of the Five Elders Association.

“It seems she got angry after being rejected in her excitement,” Li Qing thought with a quiet laugh.

Using his various trump cards, he had successfully obtained the Xuantian Sect’s cultivation methods.

Yet Li Qing did not let this victory cloud his judgment.

He still held deep reverence toward the Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign.

To lose oneself in an illusion was one thing—but to entangle with the Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign in reality…

That would carry unimaginable risks.

Thus, Li Qing had decisively refused.

“One must remain vigilant at all times,” he reminded himself once more.

He looked around, identifying the path back.

Although his mission was complete and his true body was already aware of everything that had happened, the Xuantian Sect’s cultivation manuals were vast and profound.

They could not be fully comprehended in a short time, so they needed to be transported to his true self as soon as possible.

“This place seems unfamiliar. I wonder which Heavenly Sovereign of the Five Elders Association rules this domain.”

However, he had no intention of asking anyone.

After orienting himself toward the direction of his true body, he swiftly sped away.

At first, just like when he came, everything went smoothly.

No cultivators of the Five Elders Association stopped him for questioning.

But just as he was about to cross the border of this prefecture—an unexpected incident occurred.

Three figures suddenly flew up from the ground, blocking his path.

Li Qing’s heart tightened. Before he could react, one of the three ahead asked, “Who goes there? Where are you headed?”

Li Qing was just about to speak and bluff his way through.

However, the moment he opened his mouth, his words suddenly changed.

“I am Li Qing of the Xuantian Sect! I infiltrated the Five Elders Association and have obtained the cultivation method. I am returning now!”

It was as if the words bypassed his mind entirely, and he blurted out his secret without any thought!

As soon as he said that, Li Qing’s face turned pale.

The three cultivators who were questioning him froze for a moment.

Then all three showed expressions of shock and fear.

“There is…”

Before they could finish their words, a streak of black sword light flashed like lightning.

It pierced through the three bodies in an instant.

Bang!

In the blink of an eye, the three cultivators exploded into a mist of blood, their corpses completely obliterated.

The celestial phenomenon of a cultivator’s fall began to condense in the sky.

Li Qing seized the opportunity to flee at full speed.

“The Realm of Truth!”

“Senior Sister Zhao really holds grudges!”

At that instant, the words he had meant to use for deception had turned into his true situation.

Li Qing immediately realized where he was.

“The power of the Heavenly Sovereign of Reality truly is extraordinary!”

Fleeing in panic, he replayed what had just happened and felt deep alarm.

With his mental fortitude, he had noticed nothing unusual at all.

Only after speaking did he realize something was wrong.

He could even sense that now, even knowing the rules of this place, it would still be impossible for him to tell a lie!

This was the power to overturn the very laws of heaven and earth.

“To bewitch the heart and mind… truly the hardest thing to guard against.”

Li Qing’s heart sank, and he accelerated again.

Although his identity had been exposed, fortunately, this place was deep within the Five Elders Association’s territory, which had long been at peace. The defenses were not so tight, and no pursuers appeared immediately.

Moreover, Senior Sister Zhao had likely meant only to frighten him, not to truly harm him. Otherwise, their trade would have been in vain.

Thus, she had only sent Li Qing to the border region of the Realm of Reality.

Before long, Li Qing had flown back into the territory of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

However, when crossing the Alliance’s border defenses, a small incident occurred.

During the time he had spent infiltrating the Five Elders Association, the entire defensive formation along the border had been altered.

The weaknesses previously provided by his true body had become invalid, almost causing Li Qing to be discovered by patrolling cultivators of the Alliance.

Fortunately, his true body sensed the situation and quickly re-analyzed the formation, allowing Li Qing to slip through unnoticed.

Once he re-entered the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance’s territory, Li Qing finally breathed a sigh of relief.

“Though I obtained the cultivation method this time, the return journey has been nothing but perilous.”

“Is this what they call ‘a blessing in disguise’? I hope no further trouble awaits.”

Thinking so, Li Qing hurried toward the Spiritwood Realm.

Perhaps fate truly played a part, for just as he neared the entrance to the Spiritwood Realm, for some unknown reason, he was suddenly locked onto by a patrolling Sky-Patrolling Arrow flying above.

The arrow light flashed, and before he could react, it pierced through his body.

Had Li Qing not attained the level of opening a Cave-Heaven and possessed exceptional strength, if he had not unleashed countless sword techniques in the instant before impact to partially counter its power, he would have perished on the spot!

Even so, he was seriously wounded.

The launch of the Sky-Patrolling Arrow also drew the attention of nearby Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance cultivators.

Fortunately, Lin Ling, who had been assigned to retrieve him, arrived swiftly and carried the heavily injured Li Qing away.

By the time the Alliance cultivators arrived, all they found was a large crater and scattered traces of blood.

Inside the Spiritwood Realm.

Li Fan personally tended to his clone’s injuries.

Chapter 928: Little Heavenly Doctor Li Fan

Boundless spiritual power poured continuously into the clone, Li Qing’s, body.

Yet the body, which should have recovered swiftly, instead became more and more shattered as it regenerated.

It was as if his very bones were being stripped and his soul torn apart.

Feeling the pain coming from his clone, even Li Fan could not help but frown slightly.

It seemed that some extremely strange power was entrenched around the wound, preventing it from healing.

This power did not vanish with the destruction of the flesh. Instead, like maggots gnawing at bone, it began to seep into the cultivator’s Dao Foundation.

A foreboding rose in Li Fan’s heart. If left unchecked, even the “Heavenly Wonder” Cave Heaven of his clone might be corroded.

“The Sky-Patrolling Arrows didn’t used to be this strong. It’s as if they were specially designed to target cultivators of the New Method.”

“Not only have their numbers multiplied severalfold, but their lethality has increased too…”

Thinking of the growing number of Sky-Patrolling Arrows filling the skies above the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, Li Fan felt a rare sense of unease.

In his view, although these arrows acted individually, they might very well form a vast formation that could enshroud the entire Alliance.

Point by point, woven together into a colossal net that could cover the heavens.

Just like the Mysterious Net he had once encountered.

In a moment of focus, Li Fan activated the power of the Final Dissociation Disc to perform a deduction.

After a few breaths, the results confirmed the feasibility of his suspicion.

He then recalled how the clone, upon returning, had encountered an entirely new defensive grand formation.

There was little doubt now. The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance had been preparing for something monumental. The only question was when it would be revealed, perhaps giving the Five Elders Association an unexpected “surprise.”

“Perhaps it’s related to that Mo Rubin, who replaced the Dharma-Transmitter.”

Li Fan narrowed his eyes, countless thoughts flashing through his mind.

After a moment, he decided to set those aside for now.

The most urgent matter was to heal the clone.

The “Heavenly Wonder” Dao Foundation had been attained through great effort. If it were destroyed so easily, that would truly be a pity.

While the clone had gone to the Five Elders Association, Li Fan had remained secluded in the Spiritwood Realm, diligently studying the Record of Mending Heavens.

Combining it with the Immortal Scripture of the Heavenly Doctor and the many pieces of knowledge he had gathered across his reincarnations,

Li Fan could now be said to have taken his first true step into the Path of Medicine.

And that so-called “first step” was in comparison to the Heavenly Doctor himself.

Compared to the ordinary healers of the Xuanhuang Realm, Li Fan’s skill far surpassed theirs, almost to the point of absolute domination.

After all, with the lifelong insights of a Heavenly Doctor as his foundation, it would be harder not to excel.

“The defeat of the divine soul must first be met by weakening it, then mended through harm…”

Li Fan recalled the passage from the Record of Mending Heavens, his expression solemn.

He divided off a strand of his divine soul, wrapped it in pure spiritual power, and formed several silver needles.

With a gentle wave, those needles all pierced into the broken body of his clone, Li Qing, disappearing from sight.

The clone, whose body had been wracked with agony and spasms, instantly fell into a deep slumber.

No matter how much pain there was, it could not be felt, as if already dead.

Holding his breath for a moment, Li Fan focused his mind and said: “Swift!”

In an instant, all the silver needles returned, arranging themselves neatly in front of him.

Originally silver-white, the needles had turned completely gray in just a short time.

It was as if some kind of toxin had been absorbed along the tips.

Li Fan sensed the spiritual power within these needles and within himself.

He realized that once tainted by this gray toxin, the spiritual power was directly converted, quickly falling into a state of silence.

“Quite powerful.”

“However, compared to the [Disease] I saw on Han Zhong, it is still far weaker.”

“After all, this gray power only suppresses the spirit. With my Limitless Fullness and Emptiness Method, even if my spirit is consumed, it can be quickly replenished.”

“The otherworldly illness, however, directly limits the upper bound of the spirit.”

Thinking this, Li Fan’s hands moved without pause.

One by one, the silver needles flew into Li Qing’s body, drawing out the continuously corrosive gray power.

As the culprit disappeared, Li Qing’s complexion gradually improved.

As for the extracted gray power, Li Fan temporarily sealed and preserved it using the Seven-Colored Divine Light.

He would study it later; perhaps there would be some surprises.

The treatment took the time of a full incense stick.

Once the last trace of gray power was eliminated, Li Fan finally exhaled in relief.

“The Record of Mending Heaven is indeed remarkable. A small test, and I’ve neutralized a great weapon that the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance is still experimenting with.”

The principle behind this treatment was actually simple.

It involved suppressing the spirit activity of his clone, Li Qing, then injecting the silver needles’ own spiritual power as bait to draw out the toxin.

Of course, to complete this treatment without harming the patient’s spirit required the healer to have extremely high spiritual proficiency.

If the patient were not his own clone, with whom Li Fan was intimately familiar, and if he did not have the Limitless Fullness and Emptiness Technique to endlessly replenish spiritual power, the treatment would not have been so easy.

After a while, Li Qing slowly awakened.

The first thing he said was: “The Sky-Patrolling Arrow’s targeting was not just bad luck. It should be that when I broke through the protective formation, I left some trace on my body.”

“That is why I was attacked by the Sky-Patrolling Arrow.”

Li Fan nodded slightly. “I thought of that too.”

“That new formation does have some tricks. Although it doesn’t look especially difficult to break, in retrospect, the flaw was deliberately exposed.”

“Like bait, when a formation master follows the exposed flaw and appears to break the formation, they have already quietly triggered a mark.”

“Using this mark, combined with the ever-present Sky-Patrolling Arrows within the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, they can carry out post-event assassinations.”

“It seems that Lu Xichan’s return was somewhat useful. A formation that appears defensive but is actually a trap requires skill to even conceive,” Li Fan said slowly.

Li Qing also sighed: “Fortunately, as a Dao Foundation cultivator of Heavenly Wonder, my flesh and blood are integrated with the Sword Dao. Even if blood is left behind, I need not fear being tracked. An ordinary cultivator, even if surviving the Sky-Patrolling Arrow, could be tracked for thousands of miles using the blood left on the arrow.”

“In any case, we should lie low for a while. The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance has prepared so many reserves; it seems they are planning a major move. All we can do is wait and see,” Li Fan instructed.

Li Qing nodded in agreement.

Then, a silver light containing the Xuantian Sect cultivation method flew from his mind.

Li Fan was extremely cautious and did not view it directly.

Instead, his clone read it, synchronizing cognition so that the contents of the method were recorded step by step in Li Fan’s own mind.

Each cultivation method of the Xuantian Sect far surpasses any existing technique in the Xuanhuang Realm today.

Chapter 929: Xuantian’s Lost Immortal Techniques

In the secret chamber of the Spiritwood Realm, simply reading through the texts once took Li Fan and his clone more than a month.

Among them, several techniques such as The Heaven and Earth Converging Manual and The Eternal Sole Dominance Art were almost completely consistent with the understanding Li Fan had gained in the illusionary realm.

In fact, the depictions in the illusionary realm were somewhat simplistic.

Take The Heaven and Earth Converging Manual for example. In the illusion, it was merely a dual-cultivation technique. When an insurmountable tribulation arrives that makes certain techniques incompatible, its effect of rapidly boosting cultivation would be neutralized.

However, in reality, this technique had another, even more profound and mystical use beyond dual cultivation.

It could lock onto a target and forcibly share the target’s fortune, cultivation speed, and even personal attributes such as comprehension.

This was the principle of “Heaven and Earth Sharing Longevity.”

For a true peerless prodigy, this technique would naturally seem trivial. But for someone like Li Fan, it was an exceptional mystical skill.

This was only the divine ability available at the initial stage of The Heaven and Earth Converging Manual.

As one cultivated it to a higher level, just as the name implies, the locked target could expand from a single person to the heavens and the earth.

“To use a mortal body to balance the power of heaven and earth…”

“Truly worthy of the immortal legacy.”

The upper limit of The Heaven and Earth Converging Manual was extraordinarily high, even hinting that it could still be used after ascending to the Immortal Realm.

Its only fatal flaw was that the locked target could sense the practitioner of the technique.

This was the meaning of “Conflict Sharing.”

Even this single drawback greatly reduced the technique’s significance in Li Fan’s mind.

As someone who preferred to plan and act strategically from the shadows, exposing himself to another person at all times was far from wise.

The only potential use he could think of now was to capture a peerless prodigy and confine them.

Then, he could forcibly equalize himself with the target, improving his own comprehension, aptitude, fortune, and so on.

Li Fan studied The Heaven and Earth Converging Manual, then briefly glanced through The Eternal Sole Dominance Art.

“Senior Sister Zhao actually trusted me with this Dao-attaining technique…”

After a moment of reflection, Li Fan suddenly understood.

Among all these techniques, The Eternal Sole Dominance Art was arguably the least valuable.

Because by the principle of “Unity of All,” it had already been dominated by Zhao Ruoxi.

There was no future path for it, and during cultivation, Senior Sister Zhao could very well perceive everything clearly…

Li Fan decisively sealed it and set it aside.

After roughly skimming through several other techniques, he then focused his attention on the two techniques he had encountered first:

The Secret Canon of Sitting in Oblivion, The Three Perils of Ghosts and Spirits in the Netherworld Record.

“The previous techniques came from one of the Twelve Dharma Kings, a giant man named Sikong Lin.”

“But these techniques…”

The faces of the twelve unique cultivators of the Xuantian Sect flashed through Li Fan’s mind one by one.

Quickly, Li Fan matched the style of the techniques to possible sources.

“Sun Xingwang.”

The aura emanating from these two techniques was simply too distinctive.

Take The Secret Canon of Sitting in Oblivion as an example. Its power was somewhat similar to the abilities of the former Xuantian King.

Both possessed a divine power akin to “words becoming law.”

The difference was that King Xuanyuan Hong’s words affected only himself, such as [Immense Strength] or [Walking the Way of Heaven].

The Secret Canon of Sitting in Oblivion, however, affected everything in the external world.

At advanced stages, through murmurs of the technique, one could reshape the entire world according to their own will.

For example, the technique contained a case:

A sign of small mastery of the Secret Canon of Sitting in Oblivion was to whisper and fabricate a person who never existed.

The more detailed the setting of this person became, the more they would actually come into being.

And they would act according to the predetermined rules.

Moreover, it would not sense the creator behind it.

The wonders of the Secret Canon of Sitting in Oblivion left Li Fan repeatedly in awe.

However, just like the Heaven and Earth Converging Manual, the Secret Canon of Sitting in Oblivion also had a severe side effect.

Every hundred years, a practitioner of this cultivation method would lose all memories except for the content of the Secret Canon of Sitting in Oblivion itself.

Any previously left written records or hints would be actively ignored by the practitioner.

In other words, even if one cultivated the Secret Canon of Sitting in Oblivion to its highest level, the entire world could be their creation.

Yet the cultivator would remain completely unaware.

Every hundred years, a new life would begin.

...

“To invent the Secret Canon of Sitting in Oblivion would require truly world-shaking talent,” Li Fan murmured, then turned to the final cultivation method.

The Three Perils of Ghosts and Spirits in the Netherworld Record.

This cultivation method was the most unusual.

It was a summoning technique.

But it did not summon beings from other worlds. Instead, it summoned the Ghosts and Gods within the human body itself.

According to the method’s explanation, every person is born with endless thoughts.

These thoughts are like waves on the sea, fleeting and ephemeral.

Yet it is these countless waves that form the vast sea known as the Human.

If every thought that arises is preserved, nurtured, and strengthened day and night,

Then hundreds of millions of thought essences would form within one’s Sea of Consciousness.

These essences take shape according to the nature and content of the original thought, becoming the Ghosts and Gods.

The so-called “Three Perils” refer to these three: Human, Ghost, and God.

Because these Ghosts and Gods originate from oneself, all three are interconnected.

Furthermore, as the strength of the Human increases, the power of the Ghosts and Gods multiplies hundreds or thousands of times.

A single thought released would seem as if the Netherworld itself had returned to the mortal realm.

Darkness would spread, and souls would run rampant.

If deliberately unleashed, it would be easy for one thought to destroy the entire world, transforming all other living beings into one’s own Ghosts and Gods.

This Three Perils of Ghosts and Spirits in the Netherworld Record did not have any particularly strong side effects.

If one had to mention a drawback, it would be the constant whispering of countless, never-ending Ghosts and Gods within the body.

If the mind is not firm, one could truly drive oneself insane.

Even with a strong will, facing the ceaseless murmurs of billions of Ghosts and Gods would eventually become unbearable.

When that moment came, the practitioner would lose control.

Billions of Ghosts and Gods could be unleashed to destroy the world.

However, when combined with the Secret Canon of Sitting in Oblivion, the results were unexpectedly beneficial.

The memory deletion every hundred years would sweep away all the negative emotions accumulated from the billions of Ghosts and Gods.

Yet the Ghosts and Gods themselves would not disappear.

Even if one could no longer remember the Three Perils of Ghosts and Spirits in the Netherworld Record, the cultivation of Ghost and God essences would have already become an instinct of the body.

In this way, as time passed, one’s strength would continue to grow.

“However, I remember Sun Xingwang mentioning that cultivating these two methods together has other unexpected points of conflict,” Li Fan thought.

“It is not as perfect as one might imagine.”

Chapter 930: Holy Blood Reforms the Embryo 

Which cultivation method should he practice?

Li Fan hesitated for a moment, uncertain.

All of these were indeed genuine Immortal methods, impressive in their own right, but…

A shadow flickered across Li Fan’s eyes.

In the first illusion he experienced under Senior Sister Zhao, he had once practiced two methods: The Heaven and Earth Converging Manual and Soul-Severing Divine Radiance Technique.

Beyond the characteristics of the methods themselves, they shared a very special feature.

Once cultivated, they could never be discarded.

Even using the secret techniques of the Taishang Sect or the original scriptures of the Taishang Sect could not bypass this.

Moreover, there was an even more fatal point.

All methods of the Xuantian Sect seemed to carry a special mark. True experts, no matter how well hidden, could be recognized at a glance by those in the know.

The Xuantian Sect even possessed a secret method called [Seize Heaven and Replace It], which could not only completely strip away a method or cultivation, but also transfer the realm and strength gained from practicing a Xuantian Sect method as if performing a miraculous substitution.

At that time, he was merely an ordinary cultivator who had accidentally entered the illusion; Senior Sister Zhao had no reason to deliberately alter information regarding the Xuantian Sect.

Therefore, it could basically be considered true.

The strange part was here:

From the soul fragments of Ji Yuzhen, Li Fan had found no related memories.

Combined with the near-perfect persona displayed by Xuantian King…

It sent a chill down Li Fan’s spine.

This was also a major reason why Li Fan had always been suspicious of Xuantian King’s “good person” identity.

Of course, it was also possible that Ji Yuzhen’s soul was incomplete, causing some memories to be lost.

But in any case, Li Fan had to remain cautious regarding these Xuantian Sect methods.

After all, these were not unique copies he had personally obtained. They had been passed down by Xuantian King and then transferred through Senior Sister Zhao.

Given their cultivation levels, if they had tampered with the methods, Li Fan would have no way of noticing.

“My objective is merely to make it appear convincing,” he thought.

…

After a moment of contemplation, Li Fan came up with an idea.

“Perhaps I can use the Derivative Law Jade to derive a method that looks similar externally but differs in essence.”

“This carries some risk, but I can employ the Holy Blood Embryo Transformation method to create a clone and try it out.”

“If it fails, only my true self will have to risk practicing it.”

“However, after the next use of [Truth], cultivation cannot be retained.”

Li Fan’s choice may have seemed cautious to the extreme, but he knew well that when contending with the old monsters of the Xuanhuang Realm, no amount of caution was excessive.

A single misstep could easily plant the seed of ultimate failure.

Of course, regardless of the outcome, this trip to the Grand Dao Sect was far from unproductive.

Even if he could not immediately devote himself fully to cultivation, first, the True Immortal methods had expanded his horizons, showing him that cultivation techniques could indeed be so mysterious.

Second…

When Li Fan’s strength gradually grew in the future and he uncovered the secrets of the Xuantian Sect, these methods could truly become resources for his cultivation.

Taking a deep breath, he temporarily set these methods aside in the depths of his mind.

Li Fan then followed his plan and directly activated the Holy Blood Embryo Transformation Method.

The materials he needed had all been leftover from his last scavenging in the Empire. Not long after, a body extremely similar to Li Fan’s appeared before him.

The clone, Li Qing, had no memory of the “Holy Blood Embryo Transformation” technique, and a trace of surprise appeared in his eyes.

As usual, Li Fan had modified the memories and soul of the Holy Embryo.

With previous experience, his movements became increasingly skillful and smooth.

Before long, the Holy Embryo Li Fan opened its eyes.

The greatest weakness of the Holy Blood Embryo Transformation technique was that the resulting Holy Fetus was only a mortal body, possessing no cultivation.

It required cultivation step by step.

Without a prodigious talent like Mr. Bai, it would seem quite useless.

But in this world, with the existence of the Faceless Statue, Li Fan could easily resolve this drawback.

Grasping the Holy Embryo, Li Fan instantly appeared before the Faceless Statue.

As usual, countless visions surged like a tidal wave.

However, the strongest and most genuine among them was not Su Yuqing.

It was He Zhenghao!

“True Immortal of Salvation and Mortal Compassion, above! Please bless me to come up with more content for the Xuantian Spirit-Sealing Formation…”

He Zhenghao prayed constantly in his heart, extremely devout.

From the constantly flashing visions, Li Fan immediately understood what had recently happened to him.

Just as Li Fan had anticipated, on that day, he had used the Faceless Statue to transmit the contents of the Xuantian Spirit-Sealing Formation into He Zhenghao’s mind.

At the headquarters of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance’s Array Formation Hall, when He Zhenghao casually presented his various conjectures about the Xuantian Spirit-Sealing Formation, he immediately drew great attention.

He himself was regarded as a rare talent in array formation, and his treatment and circumstances instantly changed.

He Zhenghao also continuously reported the inspirations that surfaced in his mind in hopes of attaining higher status.

But problems soon arose.

Although He Zhenghao’s talent in formation was considerable, it was still far from independently deriving an array of the Xuantian Spirit-Sealing Formation’s level.

Even if he understood the complete formation diagram, the true essence of the formation remained elusive to him.

He Zhenghao was also somewhat shrewd, not submitting the full contents all at once.

He would occasionally improve some parts, trying to delay as much as possible.

He hoped to study the Xuantian Spirit-Sealing Formation through his own effort.

However, as days passed, the slow-progressing He Zhenghao eventually realized the truth.

The chasm between him and the Xuantian Spirit-Sealing Formation was far too vast and deep.

Relying solely on himself, it was impossible to comprehend the formation’s true essence.

Thus, he placed his only hope in the True Immortal of Salvation and Mortal Compassion.

Every day, though he appeared to be diligently deriving the formation, in reality, his mind repeatedly prayed.

His devotion exceeded that of all other members of the Alliance.

Li Fan, understanding the situation in an instant, shook his head slightly.

However, since He Zhenghao was a familiar figure, and to attract Mo Rubin’s attention he still needed him as a pawn, Li Fan would not let him die.

With a thought, a vast amount of annotations and explanations regarding the Xuantian Spirit-Sealing Formation were transmitted ceaselessly into He Zhenghao’s mind.
