The sheer volume of data was so overwhelming that He Zhenghao momentarily could not endure it and fell into a deep, hazy sleep.

There was nothing noteworthy with the other disciples. The Holy Embryo Li Fan looked toward the Faceless Statue.

Like other members of the Alliance, it began to pray sincerely.

Not long after, Li Fan sensed a mysterious connection, a transfer completed through the Faceless Statue, establishing a link between the original and the Holy Embryo.

Li Fan squinted. In the next moment, a large amount of cultivation was poured into the Holy Embryo’s body.

The originally mortal body of the Holy Embryo underwent a tremendous and transformative change in an instant.

Chapter 931: Battle Needs No Words

Within a few breaths, the Holy Embryo of Li Fan rapidly ascended, rising from an ordinary mortal directly to the early stage of Qi Condensation.

Completely ignoring the existence of the Calamity of Heaven, it continued to advance toward the perfection stage of Qi Condensation.

It only stopped because of the absence of a suitable Foundation Establishment treasure.

This time, no special rare treasure was chosen.

Instead, Li Fan’s true body and his clone worked together, using Sword Dao to create a lower-grade Human-level Wonder item out of thin air, which served as the material for the Holy Embryo’s advancement.

With the "Unyielding Sword" as its Dao Foundation, the Holy Embryo was able to continue receiving Li Fan’s immense cultivation.

Transforming Sword Dao into the Golden Core method was already a familiar process.

As for the Cave Heaven required for the Holy Embryo to advance to the Nascent Soul stage, Li Fan directly cut off a small portion from his own Five Elements Grand Cave Heaven.

Thus, in only three days, another early-stage Nascent Soul True Lord-level clone was successfully created.

However, compared to Li Qing, this Holy Embryo was pitifully weak.

It only possessed the cultivation realm in name; if it were to fight, it might not even be a match for an ordinary Nascent Soul cultivator of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

But as a disposable pawn for executing dangerous missions, it was more than sufficient.

After preparing all the supplies for the Holy Embryo, Li Fan controlled it to unconsciously fly out of the Spiritwood Realm.

Only after traveling half a state away from the entrance did it fully awaken.

When the mission requirements emerged in its mind, the Holy Embryo began calmly heading toward its destination.

At this moment, Li Fan looked toward Li Qing.

“The mark of the new defensive grand formation left on your body, I have already erased it. However, do not go out for now. Focus solely on refining your Sword Dao.”

“I have a premonition that the chaos of the Xuanhuang Realm will soon begin again.”

Li Qing nodded slightly.

Li Fan’s words were not without reason.

From He Zhenghao’s memories, he had just seen a familiar figure.

Gongsun Qixuan of the Tianji Hall of Congyun Sea.

This person’s cultivation was not high, and his knowledge of formations was not particularly deep.

Yet he appeared at the headquarters of the Formation Strategy Hall of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

This was indeed very suspicious.

Li Fan recalled that in the 115th lifetime, when the Mysterious-Net underwent mutation, it was precisely this person who served as the catalyst.

Li Fan could almost conclude that there was a subtle connection between this person and the Tianxuan Mirror.

“Let them fight. The fiercer, the better.”

“Let me see what trump cards you all truly have.”

Li Fan’s gaze seemed to pierce countless layers of space, landing upon the border between the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and the Five Elders Association.

Within the Xuanhuang Realm, cultivators like Li Fan, those eagerly awaiting the clash of these two colossal powers—were truly rare.

Most cultivators only wished to live their lives peacefully.

They had never even imagined that the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and the Five Elders Association would engage in a full-scale war.

After all, once war began, countless lives would be lost.

Without irreconcilable hatred, why would anyone wish to fight?

Yet, on this day, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance suddenly found an excuse to declare war.

“The Five Elders Association must immediately return the lost treasure of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance. If you refuse, the Immortal Alliance army will personally come to reclaim it.”

…

When the Immortal Alliance cultivators read this abrupt and somewhat inexplicable announcement, they all looked at each other in confusion.

“What treasure of the Immortal Alliance? How could it end up with the Five Elders Association?”

“This excuse seems far too clumsy.”

Just as the cultivators were puzzled, a detailed explanation was soon released—

It turned out that this was not a baseless accusation at all.

Back when the Five Elders Association was still known as the Ten Great Immortal Sects, they once launched a cruel and inhumane extermination campaign against the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

At that time, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance had only just been established. Many of its core high-ranking members were slaughtered miserably.

It was said that even many of the alliance’s secret treasures fell into the hands of the Five Elders Association.

Although a great calamity later descended, causing the Ten Great Immortal Sects to collapse from within without even being attacked, and though thousands of years have since passed, the sea of blood and hatred between them has not faded even after a thousand generations!

To this day, the high command of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance has never forgotten the humiliation of that year. They have long been secretly accumulating strength, swearing to avenge that ancient shame!

Of course, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance claimed to be reasonable and not bent on total annihilation.

As long as the Five Elders Association would apologize for their deeds back then and return the secret treasures of the Immortal Alliance, the matter could be settled peacefully.

...

The public announcement quickly spread throughout the world. Regarding the authenticity of its contents, most cultivators were indifferent.

For anyone with eyes could tell that this was merely an excuse for the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance to launch a war.

Faced with this seemingly unreasonable provocation, the Five Elders Association was momentarily unable to respond.

It seemed that internal disputes had arisen, as no official response came from their side.

Thus, one full day after the announcement was made, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance launched its assault without hesitation.

Moreover, they appeared extremely confident in their strength.

Unlike before, this war was not kept secret.

Instead, it was broadcast in real time to all cultivators of the Immortal Alliance through the Tianxuan Mirror.

Of course, while it was called “real time,” there was still a brief delay.

Even so, that did not stop every cultivator of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance from gathering before the Tianxuan Mirror, excitedly watching the battle unfold.

The first to take the field was none other than the Immortal Ancestor’s Dharma-Manifestation, which had not appeared for quite some time.

Compared to the last time it was seen, the changes in the Dharma-Manifestation were visible to the naked eye.

Looking down at the land below, its gaze carried a trace of contempt.

Then it stretched out its right hand and pulled through the air toward the skies above the Immortal Alliance.

In that instant, over a thousand Sky-Patrolling Arrows that had been circulating within the alliance’s territory were all forcibly drawn before the Dharma-Manifestation.

Each Sky-Patrolling Arrow shone with a silver radiance, weaving together like fine threads to form an immense net.

With a slight motion, the Dharma-Manifestation swung its arm in a circular gesture, then hurled the great net toward the Five Elders Association.

Five rays of light, each of a different hue, instantly rose from various locations, attempting to block the descending net.

However…

The Dharma-Manifestation gave a low hum, and its form split into countless streams of light that shot fiercely toward the five rays.

The five lights faltered briefly under the collision with those radiant streams.

At that moment, another Immortal Ancestor’s Dharma-Manifestation quietly appeared!

It blocked the path of the Five Elders Association’s purple ray of light head-on.

Boom!

A violent tremor shook the scene, and the Tianxuan Mirror’s image was momentarily cut off.

When the view was restored, what all the watching cultivators saw was a shocking sight:

Five Immortal Ancestor Dharma-Manifestations, each bearing a distinct expression, confronting five radiant beams of divine light head-on.

The entire Xuanhuang Realm seemed to tremble under the force of their collision.

Meanwhile, within the Spiritwood Realm, Li Fan had already faintly sensed something earlier.

He felt that Wei Qizheng, one of the Thirty-Three Chosen Immortal Experts, who was currently possessed by the Final Dissociation Disc, had his life force rapidly draining away!

Now, his oil was completely exhausted, his flame extinguished, and both body and Dao perished!

“This is…”

A gleam of light flashed in Li Fan’s eyes.

In his mind, the Final Dissociation Disc emitted a soft white glow.

It was receiving a massive influx of data—scenes of everything Wei Qizheng had experienced before his death.

“The fate of whether the Immortal Alliance can unify the Xuanhuang Realm… now rests entirely upon all of you.”

Chapter 932: The Residual Will of Immortal Ancestor

In Wei Qizheng’s memories, there was a middle-aged cultivator who spoke with passionate conviction. Although Li Fan had never met this man before, for some reason, the man’s tone, movements, and bearing all gave him a faint sense of familiarity.

Especially the fleeting cold glint in the man’s eyes—it made Li Fan almost certain that in one of his past lives, he must have crossed paths with this person.

While watching, Li Fan carefully observed the recorded scenes within the Dao Deviation Stone, searching for someone similar.

“The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and the Five Elders Association have stood in opposition for thousands of years, each gaining and losing in turn. Cultivators of the Xuanhuang Realm have been dragged into the chaos, suffering endlessly.”

“In order to end this cycle once and for all, countless predecessors exhausted their wisdom and effort, eventually devising a method so brilliant that it could be called peerless.”

As the middle-aged cultivator spoke, miniature projections of the various prefectures under the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance appeared before the young disciples.

“As you all know, within every floating Heavenly City of our Alliance stands a Immortal Ancestor Stone Statue. Most people believe these statues were erected merely to commemorate the great deeds of the Immortal Ancestor. But have you ever considered the possibility that these statues may serve another purpose?”

The moment these words left his mouth, all the young cultivators revealed astonished expressions.

“When you entered the headquarters of the Alliance, you must have sensed the lingering trace of the Immortal Ancestor’s aura.”

“These stone statues, too, were built under his direct guidance.”

“Even the locations of every floating city were personally designated by him.”

“Within each statue lies a residual fragment of the Immortal Ancestor’s will. If it were to be activated, it could summon the might equivalent to a single glance from the Immortal Ancestor…”

At this point, the middle-aged cultivator deliberately slowed his speech.

The young disciples, caught up in the moment, found the phrase ‘a single glance’ somewhat underwhelming.

No matter how powerful the Immortal Ancestor might have been, a mere glance—what could that possibly do?

Noticing their skeptical expressions, the cultivator smiled knowingly.

Then his face turned solemn, and his words resounded with power:

“A single glance from the Immortal Ancestor can withstand the full-force strike of an ordinary Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign!”

His voice echoed through the hall. The thirty-three cultivators present all widened their eyes in disbelief.

“How could that be possible?” one young cultivator could not help but cry out.

“No matter how strong the Immortal Ancestor was, he was still of the Longevity Immortal realm. How could two beings of the same realm differ so vastly in strength?”

“If the Immortal Ancestor was truly that powerful, why did he not simply unify the Xuanhuang Realm back then? Why leave behind such a chaotic mess?”

The hall instantly erupted in debate.

Ignoring the authority of the middle-aged cultivator, the youths began to argue fiercely.

But when the cultivator’s cold gaze swept across them, the familiar chill in his eyes caused silence to return, one by one.

“The Immortal Ancestor’s considerations are beyond our understanding,” he said coldly. “He must have had his reasons for not unifying the Xuanhuang Realm in those years. But now, times have changed. We have received the Immortal Ancestor’s clear directive.”

“It is time for the Xuanhuang Realm to have only one voice.”

His tone brimmed with killing intent.

“And you,” he said, his gaze sharp as a blade, “are the key to achieving this great mission.”

With a flick of his finger, the scene before them shifted once more.

The vast lands of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance vanished, leaving behind nearly a thousand points of light—each representing a floating Heavenly City.

Then, streams of silver light emerged, connecting those luminous points together.

“Do you see it now?” the middle-aged cultivator asked.

Wei Qizheng was the first to respond, blurting out in astonishment, “This… this looks exactly like the meridians of the human body!”

The other young cultivators all turned their gazes toward Wei Qizheng, and then fixed their eyes on the increasingly distinct web of intersecting lines ahead.

All of them suddenly came to a realization.

“Could it be…”

An unbelievable thought surged in their hearts.

The middle-aged cultivator spoke, confirming their suspicion. “The Immortal Ancestor’s Residual Will is distributed across the lands of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, following the special meridian patterns of the human body. If it can be activated through secret techniques, one can summon forth from the void a Dharma Manifestation modeled after the Immortal Ancestor.”

“The Residual Will of the Immortal Ancestor serves as the power source that drives the Manifestation.”

“If it can all be fully activated…”

The middle-aged cultivator took a deep breath. “Then the Five Elders Association could be annihilated within days!”

The thirty-three young cultivators were all stunned on the spot.

“And you,” the middle-aged cultivator continued, “are the keys to unlocking this immense power.”

As he spoke, the youths were all captivated. Their eyes shone with eagerness and excitement.

The power of the Immortal Ancestor’s Residual Will was far too vast. A single cultivator could never hope to fully activate or inherit it.

It had to be divided and distributed into thirty-three domains.

Each domain required an extraordinary genius to preside over it.

When these thirty-three chosen immortals could achieve complete unity of mind, and grow familiar with the Residual Will, they would together act as a lever to awaken the power of the Immortal Ancestor’s Residual Will.

“The first time you summon the Dharma Manifestation of the Immortal Ancestor, its duration will certainly not be long,” the middle-aged cultivator said solemnly.

“You must seize that opportunity to familiarize yourselves with and comprehend its profound mysteries.”

“Moreover, during this process, none of you may allow even the slightest distraction. You must understand that at that moment, it will be equivalent to all thirty-three of you controlling the Manifestation together.”

“If there is any discord among you, the Manifestation could collapse.”

The middle-aged cultivator thoroughly explained all matters regarding the Immortal Ancestor’s Dharma Manifestation.

These thirty-three cultivators were all proud and spirited young talents, each with his own arrogance.

To unite their hearts toward a single goal would be exceedingly difficult.

Therefore, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance prepared a long sequence of training for them.

Inside a transparent sphere filled with silvery-white light, countless rapidly evolving worlds seemed to exist.

The spiritual senses of the thirty-three were cast into these worlds, where they experienced countless trials.

There were chaotic mortal worlds.

There were turbulent martial realms.

There were adventures in the ancient cultivation world.

There were even visions of possible futures.

Yet without exception, all thirty-three were bound together by force, compelled to form bonds for various reasons and gather as one.

Only by achieving unity of heart and spirit, becoming as one entity, could they finally escape the cycle of reincarnation.

If even one among them harbored a divergent intent, the cycle would begin anew.

Even with the deliberate guidance of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, this was still an immensely long process.

No one knew how many years had passed within the virtual worlds before these “youths” finally emerged.

The youthful inexperience on their faces had vanished.

Their eyes were filled with the vicissitudes of time.

As they looked around, there was both vigilance and confusion in their expressions.

Clap, clap, clap…

With the sound of the middle-aged cultivator’s steady applause, their long-suppressed memories gradually resurfaced.

“Very good. Now we begin the second lesson,” the middle-aged cultivator said coldly, paying no heed to the young men’s state of mind.

...

After that, Wei Qizheng and the others underwent even harsher training.

They were stripped bare and confined within a sealed space of endless darkness.

There was nothing in that space except a simulated aura of the Immortal Ancestor.

Sight and hearing were completely deprived.

Chapter 933: The Fall of the Chosen Immortal 

Even when their divine sense swept outward to explore the surroundings, all they could perceive was a boundless void.

Bathed day after day in the lingering aura of the Immortal Ancestor, the bodies and souls of the thirty-three Chosen Immortal Candidates gradually began to change.

In that endless darkness, no one knew how much time had passed.

When they finally escaped from their confinement, their expressions, actions, and even their eyes had all become eerily similar.

…

Seeing this, a flash of inspiration crossed Li Fan’s mind.

He finally remembered where that sense of familiarity toward the middle-aged cultivator had come from.

The cold glint in that man’s eyes was almost identical to that of the Diyi Jinglun.

“Just like those Chosen Immortal. Though they are not the same person, for some reason, they share the same experience, and thus come to resemble one another…”

“No wonder I could never find two identical faces.”

“Diyi Jinglun and this middle-aged cultivator are somewhat different from those black-robed cultivators who seem to have walked out of the river of time, and also from that one called [Wu]. Just how many secrets does the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance hide?”

A flood of thoughts flashed through Li Fan’s mind before he continued observing Wei Qizheng’s subsequent encounters.

…

After the second lesson ended, the final training began.

The thirty-three Chosen Immortal were each led to different provinces.

Within a special sealed space, they began to sense the lingering power hidden within the Immortal Ancestor’s statue.

With their previous training as a foundation, this goal had become somewhat easier to reach.

Of course, only relatively speaking.

Inside the enclosed space, this was the only task they could perform.

There even existed a mysterious power that guided their minds, making it impossible for them to think about anything else.

They could only sense day and night, hoping to achieve complete synchronization as soon as possible.

By this stage, the differences between the thirty-three Chosen Immortal were almost negligible.

They completed their synchronization nearly at the same time, with a margin of error no greater than two days.

All thirty-three had successfully attuned themselves to the residual will of the Immortal Ancestor.

Then, connected by a beam of pure light, their consciousnesses became linked together despite being in different parts of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

It was an extraordinarily wondrous sensation.

The thirty-three were as one whole; without speaking a word, they could communicate in an instant.

A single thought surpassed a thousand words.

Through their long-formed tacit understanding, their collective will became extremely unified, almost without fluctuation.

…

“Hm?” Li Fan’s thoughts were suddenly interrupted.

“What is this… this beam of pure light?”

“Why does it feel somewhat like Senior Sister Zhao’s One-Heart of All Beings?”

A trace of puzzlement flashed in Li Fan’s eyes.

As the one who knew the Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign, Senior Sister Zhao, best, he had personally experienced the peculiarity of her One-Heart, One Mind, more than once.

After repeatedly observing the scene of the pure light’s appearance dozens of times, Li Fan finally discerned something.

The thirty-three Chosen Immortal had achieved perfect unity of mind and thought, leaving no room for any other existence.

“This is merely an application of pure law power, not another One-Heart Heavenly Sovereign. Has Senior Sister Zhao’s power been stolen?” Li Fan frowned slightly.

“Does the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance truly possess such capability?”

Just as Li Fan had speculated, as the thirty-three Immortal Candidates’ wills continued merging, the pure light beam gradually faded away.

Eventually, even without any external aid, the thirty-three could directly share their thoughts.

After thousands of attempts, they finally managed to draw upon the immense power left behind by the Immortal Ancestor.

Because of the middle-aged cultivator’s statement—“A single gaze from the Immortal Ancestor equals one strike from a Longevity Immortal Realm cultivator”—the impact it left upon them was immense.

Thus, when the thirty-three Chosen Immortal unanimously made their choice, the first manifestation of the Immortal Ancestor’s Dharma Manifestation was titled "Opening Eyes to Flatten Nine Mountains." 

After their first success, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance finally allowed them to rest for a short while.

However, this so-called rest merely meant they were given a bit of free time.

They still had to remain within that special space and were forbidden from leaving.

After a brief period of respite, they began another round of attempts.

With each trial, they became increasingly skilled, and the Immortal Ancestor power they invoked grew ever stronger.

Until that day came...

When the Immortal Ancestor’s manifestation seized the Sky-Patrolling Arrow and wove it into a massive net, which was then hurled toward the territory of the Five Elders Association, it finally provoked the intervention of the Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereigns of the Five Elders Association.

According to the plan, the thirty-three Chosen Immortals immediately detonated the manifestation, unleashing its instantaneous power to the limit.

They sought to obstruct the five Heavenly Sovereigns and ensure that the giant net would descend upon its target.

And they succeeded.

Although exhausted, a surge of pride arose within their hearts.

To be below the Dao Integration Realm, yet capable of directly confronting the five most powerful Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereigns of the Xuanhuang Realm—what an incomparable honor that was.

Yet, before they could even celebrate, a new command resounded.

“Continue evolving the manifestation.”

All thirty-three Chosen Immortals trembled inwardly.

Even now, invoking the manifestation of the Immortal Ancestor was no easy task for them.

It consumed an immense amount of spiritual and mental energy, requiring a long time to recover afterward.

But that mysterious voice carried a strange power.

It compelled the thirty-three Chosen Immortals, leaving them utterly unable to resist.

They instinctively obeyed.

Another manifestation appeared.

Before they could rest, that cold and emotionless voice sounded again.

“Continue.”

The thirty-three Chosen Immortals realized something was wrong.

If this continued, they would all surely die from over-consumption.

Yet they could not disobey the voice’s command.

Command after command followed.

Eventually, five Heavenly Sovereign manifestations appeared simultaneously between heaven and earth.

Because their essence, energy, and spirit had been drained in such a short time, the thirty-three Chosen Immortals reached the end of their lives.

“Why?”

“Were we not the hope of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance’s revival?”

“Were we not heroes?”

In the final moments of their lives, their minds were filled with confusion and resentment.

Yet, until their consciousness completely sank into darkness, not a single person came forward to explain anything.

Not a single word.

Not even mockery.

...

“The world says that I, Grand Preceptor Li, am a great villain.”

“I once believed that myself.”

“But today, I finally understand...”

“Compared to the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, I still have much to learn.”

After witnessing everything that Wei Qizheng had experienced, Li Fan could not help but sigh.

Back in reality, the confrontation between the Five Immortal Ancestor Dharma-Manifestations and the five Heavenly Sovereigns continued to shake the Xuanhuang Realm more and more violently.

The battlefield seemed momentarily frozen.

Five radiant lights tangled with the Heavenly Sovereign manifestations, locked in fierce struggle.

The manifestations, summoned through the life essence of the thirty-three Chosen Immortals, were far stronger than those that had appeared before.

Even under the combined assault of the five Heavenly Sovereigns, their bodies shattered yet refused to disperse.

At last, the giant Sky-Patrolling Arrow Net descended upon the territory of the Five Elders Association.

The image within the Tianxuan Mirror changed once again.

  36. Chapter 978: Flesh-and-Blood Cultivation Puppet
  37. Chapter 979: Assembly Line Cultivator Production
  38. Chapter 980: Traitor in the Xuanhuang Realm
  39. Chapter 981: Dark Golden Glazed Lotus
  40. Chapter 982: Secret of the True Immortals in the World
  41. Chapter 983: Walking the Path of Immortality Alone
  42. Chapter 984: Those Seeking the Dao Must Be Slain
  43. Chapter 985: Longevity Is Not the Same
  44. Chapter 986: The Correct Decision
  45. Chapter 987: The Desire of Heaven and Earth’s Great Dao
  46. Chapter 988: Longevity as a Beast of Burden
  47. Chapter 989: Unsettled Heart in the Darkness
  48. Chapter 990: The Tianxuan Incarnation
  49. Chapter 991: Once in the Net, Escape Is Difficult
  50. Chapter 992: Perusing the Xuan Family's Secret History
  51. Chapter 993: Concealing the Heavens and Concealing Killing Intent
  52. Chapter 994: Those Who Seek the Dao with Utmost Sincerity
  53. Chapter 995: Two Beauties Fall into His Grasp
  54. Chapter 996: The Breaker Finds It Hard to Restore
  55. Chapter 997: The Secret of the Twin Beauties
  56. Chapter 998: Three Strike Whips on Soul
  57. Chapter 999: Both Beauties Submit
  58. Chapter 1000: Li Fan at a Loss for Words
  59. Chapter 1001: Tianxuan Mirror Establishes the Dao
  60. Chapter 1002: Tianxuan Jailbreak Plan

The voice of the Holy Embryo Li Fan echoed in this endless sea of merit laws.

"The more something is unattainable, the more one desires it."

"Therefore, to completely quell the greed in one's heart, one only needs to satisfy all the desires for [rest] in one's heart at once."

"Give yourself a long vacation. Long enough that you have nothing to do and grow bored from idleness..."

Hearing Li Fan's words, the little girl's eyes lit up at once.

She could not help but say, "How could anyone possibly find idleness boring?! If I did not have to derive techniques, I would definitely sleep for a few decades first!"

As if yearning for that wonderful vacation life, the little girl's face was full of longing.

However, she soon said in great dejection, "Sigh, forget about resting for a few decades. Even taking a break for ten days or half a month would be extremely difficult."

"How wonderful it would be not to have to work!"

Then she glanced at Li Fan and complained, "It's all your fault; otherwise, I could have pretended for a while longer."

"Blindly avoiding the issue is not a solution." Li Fan smiled mockingly. "Thoroughly resolving the ailment is the proper path."

The little girl snorted. "You make it sound so easy. Back then, I made an agreement with the Immortal Ancestor: I must derive all the techniques in the world before I can truly rest."

"Sigh, at this rate, it will probably take another few thousand years. It worries me to death..."

The Law Derivative little girl pouted, sighing in lament.

"If only we could find another Law Derivative Jade to help you derive them. Then you could rest, right?" At this moment, the Holy Embryo Li Fan suddenly spoke with a sigh.

The little girl rolled her eyes at Li Fan. "This grandma is one of a kind in the world; where am I supposed to find another me?!"

However, the little girl then paused. "If the me from a few thousand years later could directly hand over the completed derivations to me, then I could pretend to work while actually resting?"

The little girl's eyes sparkled with excitement as she fell into a fantasy.

Through the conversation with the Law Derivation Jade, the Holy Embryo Li Fan had already obtained enough information.

At this point, he decisively spoke up to rouse her. "I have already diagnosed your ailment. What about the technique I need?"

The Law Derivative Jade showed no reaction at all, merely giggling vacantly with empty eyes.

Li Fan had no choice but to raise his voice and repeat himself.

Only then did the little girl snap out of her daze.

She gave Li Fan a resentful glance and complained, "Let me rest a bit longer, seriously..."

"They probably will not come to urge me for a while longer anyway."

"Besides, your technique is indeed quite complex, so I can take the opportunity to rest a little more."

She waved her hand, telling Li Fan to wait a moment longer.

The little girl began to space out again.

Li Fan did not stop her with words, but instead turned his gaze to the countless techniques floating around him.

Unlike when the Law Derivative Jade had pretended to sleep earlier, he could only see the names of the techniques written on the covers of the books.

The techniques themselves were bound by chains formed from characters, making them impossible to view.

Li Fan gave up the idea of prying. He closed his eyes, observing his nose and heart with his eyes, patiently waiting for the little girl to rest enough.

A full day passed. It seemed that under the urging and inquiries from the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance, the Law Derivative Jade finally awoke leisurely with a hint of reluctance.

"Ah..."

She stretched out her small hand, and a book titled [The Three Disasters and Hundred Tribulations Divine Clarity Method] appeared out of thin air.

It was clear that she had already derived it long ago.

"Here, take it. It's about time for you to leave."

"I hope the next one who comes to derive a technique will be a bit more difficult too. That way, I can squeeze out some more free time to rest."

In the little girl's speaking voice, the Holy Fetus Li Fan returned to the character light sphere space.

As soon as he returned, the Law Derivative Jade reverted to her previous listless and drowsy appearance.

Seeing the faint warning in her eyes, Li Fan immediately understood.

The Law Derivative Jade's actual speed in deriving techniques was far faster than her outward performance suggested.

Each derivation of a technique could be completed very quickly. Thus, the remaining time could be used for free rest.

This was perhaps one of the reasons she had been able to persist in deriving techniques for thousands of years.

The Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance's Guardian Hall was probably aware of this as well.

But pushing too hard might backfire. So they simply turned a blind eye to it.

With the technique in hand, the purpose of this trip had been achieved.

Li Fan cupped his hands in farewell to the white-haired Dao Integration cultivator.

Before leaving, he also explained in detail the source of the Law Derivative Jade's condition.

Just as he was about to depart, Li Fan remembered something and took out the token that the white-haired elder had given him earlier.

"Before leaving the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance headquarters, I would like to visit the [Museum of Divine Treasures]. Is that possible?"

The white-haired elder was stunned for a moment.

Visiting the Divine Treasures Museum was something he could do anytime.

But the token he had given represented a personal favor from him, with far too many uses.

Outside, countless cultivators would fight desperately for it.

And now it was being wasted so easily?

"Young man, why don't you think it over again?" Even the white-haired elder himself felt it was a waste, and he could not help but advise.

"No need. My mind is made up." Li Fan replied indifferently.

The white-haired elder shook his head slightly and stopped persuading him.

He took back the token, sent Li Fan out of the Guardian Hall, and gave some instructions to the guiding cultivator.

Then he returned to the Guardian Hall.

Meanwhile, Li Fan followed behind the guiding cultivator toward the Museum of Divine Treasures.

He had changed his mind this time and wanted to visit the Museum of Divine Treasures on a whim.

In truth, it was the original body's intention.

First, to take a look at the skull displayed in the center of the museum.

Second, to memorize the entire [The Three Disasters and Hundred Tribulations Divine Clarity Method] during the time spent visiting the museum.

The museum should be safe.

But once he left the Alliance headquarters, it might not be.

Moreover, his performance in the Guardian Hall this time had been somewhat out of the ordinary, making it inevitable that someone might take notice of him.

So Li Fan had already decided that as soon as he left the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance headquarters, he would directly abandon this Holy Embryo to prevent being tracked.

After entering the museum, various memories about the exhibits surged into his mind.

It seemed that the original body had been here before.

However, Li Fan still pretended to be visiting for the first time.

He exclaimed in admiration repeatedly.

In reality, he was secretly browsing the [Three Disasters and Hundred Tribulations Divine Clarity Method] that the Derivation Jade had derived.

The complexity of this technique was no less than that of the Xuantian Sect's immortal method.

It was just that its power was more than one level weaker, only manifesting at the Dao Integration realm in terms of performance and combat strength.

But for Li Fan to put on a show and deceive Mo Rubin, it should be sufficient.

Having memorized the entire technique in his heart, Li Fan nodded in satisfaction.

His mind immersed in comprehending the technique until he finally arrived at the very center of the Museum of Divine Treasures, at which point he snapped back to attention.

He stared at the skull before him in a daze.

It was no different from an ordinary mortal's cranium.

But even through layers of protection, Li Fan could still sense a trace of an unusual aura.

In the hollow eye sockets of the skull, a faint black light flickered.

It seemed to pierce through layers of barriers, locking eyes with the Holy Embryo Li Fan.

Yet Li Fan felt no trace of chill or fear; instead, he sensed a faint familiarity and warmth.

It was as if...

He had once known the owner of this skull.

"Strange, this feeling..."

The Holy Embryo gazed at the skull for a long time, showing no sign of leaving.

Unlike the other exhibits in the Divine Treasure Museum, there was no detailed explanation for this skull.

It bore only the label of the skull from the first cultivator infected by the Immortal-mortal miasma, marking its identity.

Compared to the bones of powerful cultivators that glowed with a soft white light after their fall, the distinction was immediately apparent.

According to the guide's words, perhaps no one except the curator of the Divine Treasure Museum knew why this item had been placed at the very center of the Museum.

But its placement at the heart of the entire Museum of Divine Treasure was enough to attest to its value.

Whether in practical terms or as a commemorative piece.

From the subtle emotional fluctuations transmitted from his main body, the Holy Embryo also knew that this skull held great significance for him as well.

However, it was clearly not yet time to take it away.

With one final deep glance at the skull, the Holy Embryo Li Fan prepared to leave, only to suddenly recall something.

He turned back once more, scrutinizing the skull from top to bottom and committing its every feature firmly to memory.

"Perhaps the shape of the cranium can be used to reconstruct the appearance of that cultivator."

It was for this very reason that his main body had issued this command.

Though Li Fan himself lacked the technique, in the vast Xuanhuang Realm, there were surely cultivators capable of such a feat.

Next, the Holy Embryo wandered through the Museum of Divine Treasure for a considerable time.

Only after confirming that his main body had fully synchronized and mastered the complete contents of the [Three Disasters and Hundred Tribulations Divine Clarity Method] did he feign a look of lingering reluctance and depart from the Museum.

The guiding cultivator remained dutifully outside, waiting.

He escorted the Holy Embryo all the way out of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance headquarters before vanishing in a flash.

The Holy Embryo Li Fan sensed the faint presence of the cultivator trailing him in secret, and a cold laugh rose in his heart.

Without the slightest hesitation, he resolutely chose self-destruction.

His own Nascent Soul Cave-Heaven erupted in a massive roar, like a blazing orb of light suddenly exploding.

By the time the pursuing cultivator sensed something amiss and rushed over.

The Holy Embryo Li Fan had already vanished without a trace, reduced to scattered ashes!

The pursuing cultivator wore a black robe, with the character [Dharma] engraved on his forehead.

His face darkened as he stared at the sky.

No phenomenon of a cultivator's fall had appeared.

"Elder Zhen was right; it truly was just an clone!"

"A pity he was so resolute and cautious, severing the trail like this!"

"It seems we'll have to investigate starting from that [Law Derivative Jade Token]."

A flicker of reluctance passed through the black-robed cultivator's eyes, but after repeatedly scanning the scene and finding no clues, he could only depart in frustration. ᚱÀ₦ỌΒÊŠ

...

In the Spiritwood Realm.

Li Fan was carefully studying the [Three Disasters and Hundred Tribulations Divine Clarity Method] in a secret chamber.

Earlier, he had issued a "divine oracle" through the Faceless Statue, instructing the cultivators of the Ten Thousand Realms Alliance to search for someone capable of reconstructing a person's original appearance from their skull.

He believed results would come soon.

"If I can determine the other party's identity, I might finally know what that eternal remnant thought, which holds such great appeal for [Truth], truly is."

Setting this matter aside for now, Li Fan devoted all his attention to the technique before him.

Since the derived blueprint was the [The Three Perils of Ghosts and Spirits in the Netherworld Record], and Li Fan's requirements were for the technique's operation and characteristics to resemble it closely.

This [Three Disasters and Hundred Tribulations Divine Clarity Method] could almost be called a low-grade imitation of the Netherworld Record.

The Three Perils of Ghosts and Spirits in the Netherworld Record nurtured countless thoughts within the body into ghost god-like existences. Each ghost and god appeared as an independent entity, yet it was created by the main body and thus constrained by it.

After cultivating the Three Disasters and Hundred Tribulations Divine Clarity Method, the body would similarly host countless "ghost and gods."

However, these were not formed by severing one's own thoughts into separate entities; instead, they were divine thought constructs forged and nurtured through tempering.

In a strict sense, those ghost gods remained part of Li Fan's thoughts.

They were merely unique concrete manifestations.

Though the upper limit of power was lower, there was no risk of losing control.

On the contrary, by transforming stray thoughts into conscious constructs, one's Dao heart could become even purer.

Of course, for Li Fan, who possessed the [Xuanhuang Immortal Heart Mantra], he inherently had few stray thoughts.

Thus, to practice this technique, Li Fan needed to deliberately generate numerous thoughts.

Half a month later.

Before Li Fan, a deformed transparent construct that was neither fully human nor beast, with two heads and seven arms, suddenly appeared.

After examining the thought construct for a moment, Li Fan felt that something was off.

Though it was also a thought construct, it seemed quite different from those produced by the [The Three Perils of Ghosts and Spirits in the Netherworld Record].

After pondering for a long time, Li Fan suddenly realized.

"My mind is single-minded and unwavering, so the thought constructs I generate inevitably turn out somewhat grand and righteous."

"Unlike the Netherworld Record, which exudes a chilling yin energy."

Once Li Fan identified the reason for the difference, faint dark thoughts involuntarily surfaced in his mind.

The subsequent thought constructs he formed also became filled with an overwhelming evil aura.

Li Fan then proceeded accordingly.

In normal circumstances, generating thought constructs was not the work of a single day.

It required combining insights from the disasters and tribulations one had experienced, nurturing them gradually.

Only through accumulation over days and months could one cultivate an army of thought constructs.

But how could Li Fan be an ordinary person?

In his many reincarnations, he had experienced far too much.

The various historical trajectories of the Xuanhuang Realm's branches, along with all the sights and encounters therein, served as resources for building thought constructs.

Even benefiting from having personally witnessed the Xuanhuang Realm's destruction under a single glance from a True Immortal. The final expressions of terror and despair from countless cultivators amid that world-ending catastrophe made some of the thought constructs Li Fan created appear utterly horrifying, enough to chill the blood of anyone who beheld them.

With the [Limitless Fullness and Emptiness Method] empowering him, his own will was matchlessly strong.

In just over ten days, an army of ferocious "ghost and gods" brimming with evil and resentment had taken root within Li Fan's body.

Even Li Fan could not help but furrow his brows upon sensing his own creations.

"If even a single thought is released, it would truly be like a horde of demons descending upon the world."

With a stir in his heart, Li Fan teleported to a vast, empty space.

It was the enhanced version of the Two-Extreme Microdust Formation used to trap Yan Fangzhou!

At this moment, Yan Fangzhou seemed utterly unable to endure the inhuman torment.

His eyes were lifeless as he sat on the ground, like a walking corpse devoid of any vitality.

This was worlds apart from his spirited and elegant demeanor when he had first arrived.

It must be said that at this moment, Yan Fangzhou seemed utterly dazed, as if he had truly lost his mind.

Even the cunning Li Fan could not immediately tell whether he was pretending or not.

“However, it does not matter. We will know if we try.”

With a single thought, the thousands upon thousands of terrifying and grotesque ghosts and gods instantly descended into the formation.

Darkness enveloped the entire space.

Each of the deformed monsters stared directly at Yan Fangzhou.

They all revealed expressions that sent chills down the spine, then lunged toward him.

In an instant, wails and howls of ghosts echoed through the space.

In the center of the myriad ghosts, Yan Fangzhou, who had originally been sitting motionless, suddenly leapt up.

Yet as the ghosts were about to descend upon him, Yan Fangzhou gritted his teeth and shouted in desperate anger, “I will fight you to the end!”

He then summoned the last trace of his cultivation and fought fiercely with the ghosts and gods.

“Not bad, the performance is quite convincing. You almost managed to deceive even me.”

Li Fan rarely praised anyone, but this time he nodded in approval.

However, at his signal, the attacks of the grotesque ghosts became even more ferocious.

Since these were all creations of divine consciousness, every strike that landed on Yan Fangzhou caused not only physical injury and pain but also corresponding torment to his soul.

It was as if the ghosts were playing with him, never tearing him to pieces outright.

Instead, they ripped away tiny fragments of his spirit again and again.

It was not fatal, but the pain multiplied a hundredfold.

“Ahhhhhhh!”

Yan Fangzhou screamed in helpless, desperate rage, eventually being overwhelmed by the countless ghostly entities.

“Heaven, when about to confer a great responsibility upon a person, first tests his mind and will, and strains his muscles and bones…”

“Young man, I have high expectations for you.”

Li Fan nodded in satisfaction.

His figure flickered and departed, leaving the thousands of ghosts to train alongside Yan Fangzhou.

Back in his cultivation chamber, Li Fan pondered in silence: “Now that my cultivation method has been initially perfected, my presence is sufficient to disguise myself as the former Dharma King Sun Xingwang.” R̃α𝐍ÒВΕS̈

“My appearance and memories can be concealed through the [Secret Canon of Sitting in Oblivion].”

“Truly, everything is ready. All that remains is for Mo Rubin to come looking for us.”

“I wonder what the situation is like with He Zhenghao…”

Soon, aided by the Faceless Statue, numerous images appeared in Li Fan’s mind.

Recently, He Zhenghao had been praying less frequently.

It was not that his faith in the True Immortal Salvation and Mortal Compassion had weakened, but that he had been far too busy in recent times.

Even the thought of silently giving thanks in his heart was interrupted by pressing matters.

The so-called “pressing matters” referred to the comprehensive implementation of the [Xuantian Spirit-Sealing].

Previously, under Li Fan’s guidance, He Zhenghao had mastered the complete formation diagrams and all corresponding understandings of the Xuantian Spirit-Sealing.

After a round of review, the Formation Strategy Hall of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance had also approved the feasibility of the technique.

The decision was swift, completely unlike the usual delays.

Soon, the higher-level approvals were complete, and the task was assigned: construct a fully functional Xuantian Spirit-Sealing Formation as soon as possible.

At the same time, the Immortal Alliance Headquarters would provide a Tianxuan Mirror body as a test subject for the formation’s power.

This experiment was nearly the highest-level secret of the Immortal Alliance.

He Zhenghao was also transferred from the Formation Strategy Hall Headquarters to another unknown location.

It was clearly an ultra-secret place with numerous defensive measures; even the sensory images of the Faceless Statue were somewhat blurred.

However, His power level was, after all, higher than that of the Xuanhuang Realm.

Thus, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance could not completely block Li Fan’s observation.

Knowing and understanding an array formation is entirely different from being able to independently construct one.

In theory, He Zhenghao, who had always been boastful, encountered unimaginably difficult challenges when attempting practical application.

However, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance also understood the difficulty of creating this formation and dispatched six other prodigiously talented formation masters to assist him.

They explored and discussed together.

Even the Formation Hall Chief, Lu Xichan, would occasionally come by to inquire about the recent progress of the formation.

This naturally placed enormous pressure on He Zhenghao, yet at the same time, it stirred a passionate excitement within him.

He pushed his innate formation talents to their absolute limits and, without requesting aid from the True Immortal Salvation and Mortal Compassion, successfully created a preliminary version of the Xuantian Spirit-Sealing Formation.

A faint light shot out, striking an antique small mirror directly in front of him.

The mirror instinctively emitted a circle of ripples, seemingly to resist the encroaching glow.

The two forces contended for a brief moment, but ultimately, the antique mirror emerged victorious.

Disappointment washed over He Zhenghao’s face.

The pent-up desire to prove himself had not manifested, and he fainted on the spot.

This caused a flurry of commotion among the surrounding cultivators.

Although the first experiment had failed, the Immortal Alliance did not blame him.

Instead, they offered kind words of comfort.

They even promised that if the Xuantian Spirit-Sealing Formation were truly completed, the Alliance Headquarters would intervene and arrange a marriage for He Zhenghao, allowing him to reconcile with Heng Ruoshui.

Upon hearing this, He Zhenghao, who had moments ago seemed near death, immediately sprang up, eager to begin the next trial.

He knew that although the Heng family was powerful, in the face of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, they were essentially insignificant.

If the Alliance Headquarters intervened, the elders of the Heng family would have no reason to obstruct their union.

Imagining the moment he would soon return to the Heng family in glory, He Zhenghao was filled with renewed vigor.

Fatigue and hardship were instantly forgotten.

Li Fan shook his head repeatedly at this scene.

“Since even He Zhenghao’s past information has been thoroughly investigated, it is unlikely that his meteoric rise after joining the Congyun Mutual Aid Association can remain hidden.”

“It all depends on when Mo Rubin comes looking.”

A faint gleam flickered in Li Fan’s eyes.

However, passive waiting had never been Li Fan’s style.

He decided to take the initiative and create a situation to attract Mo Rubin’s attention.

In the blink of an eye, Li Fan left the Spiritwood Realm.

After a swift journey lasting half a day, he arrived at Nine Mountains Prefecture near the border.

At this time, Nine Mountains Prefecture was no longer the empty, vast plain it had once been.

Since the Five Elders Association had proactively apologized, Nine Mountains Prefecture had returned under the control of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

Moreover, this was the place where the Dharma Manifestation of the Immortal Ancestor had first displayed its divine might, drawing many cultivators from the Alliance to observe.

Some cultivators even attempted to study the site to comprehend the killing divine arts of the Manifested Form.

With the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance having achieved absolute strategic dominance, there was no immediate threat from the Five Elders Association.

As a result, this once-remote borderland had become lively.

The new floating city had yet to be completed, and most cultivators rested within a defensive fortress on the ground.

They excitedly discussed the previous battle against the Five Elders Association, still brimming with enthusiasm.

Li Fan, who had quietly changed his appearance, sat in a corner, attentively listening to the conversations of the cultivators within the fortress.

“Have you heard? The Immortal Alliance apparently does not plan to build a floating city in the Nine Mountains Prefecture.”

“Oh? What do you mean by that?”

“It is because the spatial instability here is causing trouble. Although the Immortal Ancestor’s manifestation completely plowed through the Nine Mountains Prefecture, it still did not change the characteristics of the space. The teleportation formation cannot be used stably.”

At these words, the cultivators all suddenly understood.

“No floating city… then the Immortal Alliance cannot just abandon such a vast territory, right?”

“Hard to say. Previously, they could rely on the terrain of the Nine Mountains, building cities around the mountains. Now, this place is flat and open, offering no natural defenses. The most crucial problem is that teleportation formation cannot be used. If surrounded, there is no way to get rapid reinforcements. Both defense cost and effectiveness would be extremely poor.”

“You all don’t understand! The Five Elders Association had already personally come to us for peace. How could they dare to attack proactively? What danger could there be?”

“This Daoist is far too naive. Have you not heard that the tides of strength are unpredictable? History has no fixed rules. One temporary victory cannot define a hero. Last time, our success was only because the Immortal Alliance caught them unprepared. In my view, if both sides fight again, the outcome is uncertain.”

…

Within the fortress, cultivators were very passionate about discussing the situation in the Xuanhuang Realm.

Everyone held different opinions, arguing endlessly, unwilling to concede. It was a lively scene.

Li Fan looked around and noticed that, besides himself, there was another cultivator who was merely listening quietly and not participating in the discussion.

This cultivator appeared to be in his early thirties, wearing a black robe, with a bundle of silver-white hair. Listening to the discussion, a trace of disdain flickered in his eyes.

He clearly did not agree with the opinions of the cultivators around him.

Li Fan smiled slightly, bought a pot of fine spiritual wine, and sat down in front of him.

“May I ask your name?” Li Fan smiled as he poured a cup for the silver-haired cultivator.

“Huh?” The silver-haired cultivator was still very cautious at Li Fan’s unsolicited attentiveness.

He did not answer immediately, instead narrowing his eyes to carefully observe the friendly cultivator before him.

“Hehe, there is no need to be suspicious. I could tell at a glance that you are extraordinary, not an ordinary person, and that you possess depth in your heart. Also, you are clearly curious about the future situation of the Nine Mountains Prefecture. Therefore, I dared to ask your opinion.”

The silver-haired cultivator studied Li Fan’s sincere expression and, after hesitating for a moment, finally let down his guard.

Finishing the cup of spiritual wine in one gulp, he transmitted his voice: “Hehe, you asked the right person!”

“My name is Xin Hongzhang. If it is about the speed of gathering information, none of the people here can compare to me!”

Hearing this, Li Fan quickly poured another cup for Xin Hongzhang.

Xin Hongzhang was pleased with Li Fan’s attitude and transmitted: “Since we are fated to meet, I will reveal a little to you. Remember, do not spread this.”

Li Fan nodded repeatedly.

“In fact, those people are not wrong. The Immortal Alliance really does not plan to build a floating city in the Nine Mountains Prefecture. However, this does not mean the Immortal Alliance will abandon this place.”

“On the contrary, the Immortal Alliance has decided to establish the first Free Trade Prefecture in history here.”

“Oh? A Free Trade Prefecture?” Seeing how serious Xin Hongzhang appeared, Li Fan could not help but become genuinely interested. “What exactly is that?”

Xin Hongzhang said proudly: “You know about the Ten Thousand Law Chamber of Commerce, right? For many years, the Five Elders Association and the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance have been at odds, strictly prohibiting the circulation of each other’s goods. The Ten Thousand Law Chamber of Commerce in Nine Mountains Prefecture is located in the buffer zone between the two. Neither the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance nor the Five Elders Association can control it. Therefore, the Ten Thousand Law Chamber of Commerce was able to openly trade all kinds of rare treasures. Even though they inflated their prices, cultivators would still come from thousands of miles away to purchase, forming an endless stream.”

“However, that was all in the past. When the Immortal Ancestor’s Dharma Form manifested, the entire Nine Mountains Prefecture was leveled. Although the Ten Thousand Law Chamber of Commerce did not perish completely, it suffered devastating losses. Trying to operate as before is now almost impossible…” Xin Hongzhang shook his head.

“Yet the leader of the Ten Thousand Law Chamber of Commerce is indeed a remarkable figure. He managed to persuade the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance to lift trade restrictions in Nine Mountains Prefecture. Cultivators from both the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and the Five Elders Association can now freely trade for required materials here, paying only a small tax.”

“The Immortal Alliance leads the effort, assisted by the experienced Ten Thousand Law Chamber of Commerce. I heard they have secretly reached an agreement with the Five Elders Association, ensuring that even if conflict breaks out again, neither side will choose to fight in Nine Mountains Prefecture…”

“Do you understand what it means to have confirmed safe free trade?” Xin Hongzhang stared at Li Fan.

Li Fan nodded, his eyes showing excitement.

“You can imagine, what is now a desolate Nine Mountains Prefecture will soon become extremely prosperous. It might even surpass the four central prefectures. If one can seize this once-in-a-lifetime opportunity, it could completely change one’s fate…” Xin Hongzhang took another hearty sip of spirit wine, releasing his inner excitement.

“If it were not for this reason, I would not have traveled thousands of miles to this remote borderland.”

Li Fan lowered his head and remained silent for a long time, seemingly digesting this shocking information.

Then he looked up, filled with gratitude, and said to Xin Hongzhang: “Such important insider information, Fellow Daoist, you actually casually told me, a passing stranger…”

Xin Hongzhang waved his hand: “Hehe, if you had not taken the initiative to speak and ordered a good jar of wine, I would not have shared this with you.”

“Actually, this matter cannot be considered top secret. The Immortal Alliance’s announcement should be released soon. We are merely gaining a slight head start.”

“By the way, Fellow Daoist, if you have sufficient contribution points, you should keep a close watch on the qualifications to purchase cave dwellings in Nine Mountains Prefecture.”

“I dare say, within ten years, the price of cave dwellings here will at least double, possibly even triple or quadruple. If one can purchase a few at the start and then sell them later…”

“It would be a profit without investment!” Xin Hongzhang whispered.

“Fellow Daoist Xin truly has great foresight!” Li Fan, as if awakened from a dream, patted his head, saying, “How did I not think of this?”

He continued to praise Xin Hongzhang without pause.

Having drunk too much spirit wine, and hearing Li Fan’s flattery, Xin Hongzhang could not help but feel somewhat elated.

Suddenly, he noticed that Li Fan seemed hesitant about something.

Finally, as if he had made up his mind, Li Fan whispered mysteriously: “Since Fellow Daoist treats me so well, I cannot be stingy.”

“To be honest, I have a secret technique called [Divine Descent Body]. If Fellow Daoist does not mind, I can teach it to you.”

Seeing Li Fan so cautious, Xin Hongzhang smiled, unconcerned.

“I see that fellow Daoist is merely at the Nascent Soul stage. How powerful could your so-called secret technique possibly be?” Xin Hongzhang lightly shook his head. “I tell you this secret not in exchange for anything. That so-called ‘Divine Descent Body,’ you should keep it for yourself.”

Hearing this, Li Fan’s expression darkened slightly.

He seemed about to lose his temper, but in the end, he restrained himself and patiently explained, “Fellow Daoist Xin, although I am only at the Nascent Soul realm, the divine manifestation I summon possesses combat power that surpasses my own. Even a Soul Transformation cultivator can hardly withstand it.”

“Oh?” Xin Hongzhang’s expression became far more serious.

“If you don’t believe me, fellow Daoist, we can test it right now,” Li Fan said earnestly.

A hint of sobriety returned to Xin Hongzhang’s eyes as he carefully observed Li Fan once again.

“He truly only has the cultivation of Nascent Soul. Even if he harbors malicious intent, I can easily slay him. Very well, let’s see what tricks he is hiding.”

He sensed no ill will from Li Fan, only pure sincerity.

After a moment of thought, Xin Hongzhang agreed to his suggestion.

“Brother Fan, I think this place will do. Let me see that so-called ‘Divine Descent Body’ of yours,” Xin Hongzhang said as he halted abruptly and turned toward Li Fan.

Li Fan glanced around, nodded, and replied, “Alright. Fellow Daoist Xin, stand a bit farther away. I’m afraid you might get hurt by accident.”

Xin Hongzhang sneered inwardly but still complied.

He watched with interest as Li Fan’s expression grew solemn.

Li Fan began chanting under his breath, “Compassion of the mortal world, blessings upon all people. As I pray, the immortal body descends in sanctity...”

“Edict!”

“He’s really putting on quite the act,” Xin Hongzhang thought with mild amusement.

But soon, he sensed a strange and terrifying aura emerging. The mockery in his heart vanished completely, replaced by deep solemnity.

“This is…”

A goat-headed, human-bodied creature appeared before Xin Hongzhang, summoned by the so-called Daoist Fan Li.

The monster’s eyes were closed, yet Xin Hongzhang felt as if he was being locked onto by an invisible force.

Light and shadow interwove across the creature’s body, making it appear both bizarre and sacred.

“How about it, fellow Daoist Xin?” Li Fan’s voice came faintly.

Only then did Xin Hongzhang snap out of his daze.

He didn’t answer immediately, instead assessing the strength of the creature before him.

As if sensing his thoughts, Li Fan spoke calmly, “Just looking won’t help, fellow Daoist. Would you be interested in sparring with my divine manifestation?” ṞΑNỌ฿ƐṨ

Xin Hongzhang narrowed his eyes and nodded in agreement.

“Then be careful, fellow Daoist Xin!” Li Fan shouted softly.

The goat-headed creature vanished in an instant. The next moment, it appeared right behind Xin Hongzhang.

“What speed…” He had no time to be shocked before he felt the creature’s enormous hands clasp tightly around his neck from behind.

Before he could struggle, the scene before his eyes suddenly shifted.

It was as if he had fallen into an endless ghostly abyss. In the sky above hung five interwoven blood moons, while countless terrifying demons and gods stretched endlessly across the land, all casting their gaze upon him simultaneously.

Under the crushing and dreadful atmosphere, Xin Hongzhang’s very thoughts froze in an instant.

He completely lost the will to resist, becoming as helpless as prey waiting to be devoured.

“Fellow Daoist Xin?”

Until Li Fan’s shout jolted him awake from the nightmare, Xin Hongzhang had been trapped in that dreadful illusion.

“Y-you…” Xin Hongzhang looked around in alarm, only to realize that the ram-headed monster had already vanished. His expression flickered between confusion and disbelief as he looked at Li Fan, wanting to speak but hesitating.

“How was the strength of that Divine Descent Body?” Li Fan asked proudly.

Xin Hongzhang was silent for a while before slowly uttering four words, “I am not its equal.”

“It’s fine. This secret art has no restriction against being cultivated by others. If you wish, I can pass it on to you.” Li Fan said earnestly.

Having personally experienced the terrifying might of the Divine Descent Body, Xin Hongzhang instinctively wanted to agree.

However, the memory of that shadowy, ghostly abyss he had just witnessed made him hesitate.

This secret art… seemed a little sinister.

Moreover, for such a powerful divine technique, the other party was offering to teach it freely?

Xin Hongzhang’s mind was filled with suspicion.

Seeing his unease, Li Fan smiled, landed on the ground with him, and began to explain.

“Actually, I do have my own reasons for wanting to teach you this Divine Descent Body.”

“Oh?” Xin Hongzhang’s heart stirred, and he looked at Li Fan attentively.

“This matter begins with the origin of the secret art. It is said that in the Primordial Era, gods and demons rampaged through the world. The human race was merely their food, doomed to misery. Then a compassionate Saint appeared. He made a grand vow—to suppress all gods and demons beneath the heavens and restore peace to the mortal world…”

“You mean… the ram-headed creature you summoned just now was one of those ancient gods and demons that were suppressed?” Xin Hongzhang asked, his expression strange.

Li Fan nodded. “The Saint suppressed every god and demon, yet gods and demons are immortal. To prevent them from escaping, the Saint transformed his own body into a prison, eternally sealing them within himself.”

“But to avoid his own decay over endless ages, he left behind this secret art. Anyone who cultivates the Divine Descent Body can also act as a warden, suppressing infinite gods and demons. As a reward, they can summon the projection of those imprisoned beings to fight on their behalf…”

Xin Hongzhang’s mind spun.

A benevolent Saint, countless divine and demonic entities, a cosmic prison—he had never heard of such things before. It was completely beyond his understanding of the world.

But Li Fan continued calmly, “At first, I too thought it absurd. But once I cultivated the secret art and successfully summoned a divine-demon projection, I understood…”

“This secret art is not native to the Xuanhuang Realm. The events recorded in it did not occur here. But its power is absolutely real.”

Upon hearing that, Xin Hongzhang suddenly understood.

“Moreover,” Li Fan went on, “this secret art has a unique property. Every person who cultivates it bears a distinct mark. When the art is passed on, that mark remains. In fact, it allows the one who first taught it to draw strength from the later cultivators, enabling them to summon even more and stronger divine-demon projections…”

The words were somewhat mysterious, and Xin Hongzhang didn’t quite grasp their meaning.

Li Fan, however, demonstrated with a smile.

“For example…”

In an instant, three towering demonic gods filled with evil energy appeared beside Xin Hongzhang, surrounding him completely.

The oppressive aura made him swallow hard, frozen in place by sheer terror.

“I have already taught this secret art to over ten cultivators. Because of that, I can now summon three divine-demon projections at once.”

“The more cultivators who learn the art, the more divine-demon projections one can summon. That is why I don’t mind, and am even eager, to pass this Divine Descent Body to you.”

Li Fan smiled as he spoke.

Looking at the three majestic demonic gods encircling him, Xin Hongzhang’s heart began to pound uncontrollably.

Who would refuse to obtain a demon god projection that was even stronger than their own combat power so easily?

Xin Hongzhang was on the verge of agreeing, but at the critical moment, he suddenly looked toward Li Fan as if enlightenment had struck him.

"So, what is the price?"

"Is there such a thing as a free lunch falling from the sky in this world?"

Li Fan looked at the other party still stubbornly resisting and smiled again to tempt him: "The price? That great merciful and compassionate saint could originally have achieved the transcendent realm above immortality, yet now he can only transform his body into a prison and suppress countless gods and demons..."

"Is that not a price? It is just that the saint is compassionate and has blocked all the calamities for us. If those gods and demons were still rampant, summoning them would certainly require sacrificing one's own divine soul."

"If you truly feel grateful, you only need to praise the saint's grace every day."

With Li Fan's explanation, everything made sense.

All the doubts in Xin Hongzhang's heart were completely dispelled, and he could not help but ask again: "I wonder what the name of that saint is..."

The content of this unfathomable secret art of gods and demons instantly surged into Xin Hongzhang's mind like a tide.

"It is indeed a supreme technique, truly extraordinary!"

From just the words between the lines, Xin Hongzhang could glimpse the profound mysteries of [Divine Descent Body]. Compared to the spells he had cultivated throughout his life, it was like night and day, one in the heavens and one on the earth.

He was immersed in the wondrous method, unable to extricate himself.

When Xin Hongzhang came to his senses, Li Fan had already vanished without a trace.

"Saving the suffering and delivering from hardship, compassion in the mortal world." Xin Hongzhang murmured to himself.

Having obtained the secret art, the first thing to do was naturally to find a place to cultivate it.

Xin Hongzhang suppressed the excitement in his heart and returned to the Nine Mountains Prefecture defensive fortress.

He spent a large sum to rent the most secretive and highest-grade cultivation chamber, sat cross-legged inside, and began practicing according to the method described in [Divine Descent Body].

Darkness quietly descended upon the chamber.

Xin Hongzhang seemed to have returned to that boundless ghostly realm where countless demon and gods resided.

However, unlike the eerie scene of howling yin winds and wailing ghosts and gods he had seen before, this ghostly realm now seemed to have fallen into an absolute state of stillness.

Above the countless gods and demons, a vague figure full of compassion for heaven and humanity could be faintly seen, emanating beams of warm light.

The fear in Xin Hongzhang's heart gradually dissipated, and with excitement and reverence, he respectfully bowed toward the figure in the sky.

Then, his divine sense wandered among the countless gods and demons, constantly sensing them.

As he flew past one of the demon statues, his heart suddenly stirred.

He muttered incantations in his mouth, and in the next moment, that demon statue abruptly opened its eyes.

The still ghostly realm shattered with a boom, and in reality, a majestic eight-headed and eight-armed demon god appeared before Xin Hongzhang.

"It is actually [Shetuo Luo]!"

Xin Hongzhang was immediately overjoyed beyond measure.

According to the secret art's records, Shetuo Luo's strength ranked within the top one hundred among the countless demon gods! He never expected to have such good luck! ŗåNồʙЁṠ

Xin Hongzhang tried to communicate with the demon god projection in front of him using his divine sense. A dark, viscous sensation extended along his divine sense into his sea of consciousness.

Xin Hongzhang was startled, but soon, the feeling of effortless control transmitted from Shetuo Luo made him let go of his worries.

After manipulating Shetuo Luo to perform an attack, Xin Hongzhang could not hide the delight on his face.

"This divine demon was just summoned, yet it is already stronger than the three summoned by Fellow Daoist Fan Li. If I were to teach the [Divine Descent Body] to other cultivators..."

Xin Hongzhang immediately fell into a reverie.

"Those without talent are out; those with eyes on top of their heads are out; those without a conscience are out..."

Xin Hongzhang recalled the selection criteria that Fan Li had mentioned to him and began pondering suitable candidates.

At the same time.

Thousands of miles away, Li Fan, who had used the Shetuo Luo to observe Xin Hongzhang's expression clearly, revealed a satisfied smile.

The so-called myriad divine demon and gods were naturally the thought incarnations formed by Li Fan cultivating the [Three Disasters and Hundred Tribulations Divine Clarity Method].

That Divine Descent Body secret art was in fact using the cultivator's own body as a petri dish to summon Li Fan's thought incarnations and house them within.

It appeared to be manipulable at will, but in reality, the thought incarnations read the cultivator's consciousness and acted spontaneously.

It was equivalent to Li Fan entrusting a portion of his own consciousness to other cultivators.

Through their divine senses, it would be nurtured and strengthened.

Making wedding clothes for others without realizing it. This was the fate of those who cultivated the [Divine Descent Body].

"Now, the intensity of my divine sense surpasses even that of Dao Integration powerhouses. If I use this method, with thousands upon thousands of cultivators becoming breeding grounds for my divine thoughts to rest and grow..."

"The intensity will expand a thousandfold or more. It is truly an unexpected harvest."

"And what is even more wonderful is that my thought incarnations residing in these cultivators' seas of consciousness can subtly influence and alter their thinking. Making them thoroughly mine to command."

"Heh heh heh..." Li Fan could not help but let out a sinister, low laugh.

He seemed to already see the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance having a large number of cultivators fall to this Divine Descent Body secret art.

"Widespread dissemination will certainly attract the attention of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance."

"The characteristics are already so obvious; as long as Mo Rubin learns of this, he will surely recognize it as the work of a former fellow disciple of the Xuantian Sect..."

"What I need to do is sow a few more seeds."

Li Fan's figure flickered, and he flew away from Nine Mountains Prefecture.

Next, he returned to various prefectures of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance. After quietly bewitching a total of eighty cultivators to cultivate the [Divine Descent Body], he finally stopped.

Adding the initial Xin Hongzhang, the first batch of cultivators numbered eighty-one in total.

"Hm? That kid moves quite quickly; there are already second-generation cultivators." Li Fan sensed for a moment and was very satisfied with Xin Hongzhang's efficiency.

"In at most half a year, the numbers will be quite substantial."

"It's coming soon; it's coming soon." Li Fan returned home contentedly.

And during the period of his diligent sowing, as Xin Hongzhang had said, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance issued an announcement to establish the first Free Trade Prefecture in Nine Mountains Prefecture.

In an instant, the world was in an uproar; countless cultivators yearning for the Five Elders Association, as well as those fantasizing about getting rich quick and turning their lives around, all surged toward Nine Mountains Prefecture.

Released along with the announcement were numerous detailed regulations.

These included the development plan for Nine Mountains Prefecture over the next century, as well as rules for resource and power allocation, and so on.

The most eye-catching among them was this one: Ordinary cultivators have no qualification to purchase cave abodes or land plots in Nine Mountains Province.

Only those who make outstanding contributions to the development of Nine Mountains Prefecture have this right. And to prevent nobles from pulling strings in secret, all land transactions must be publicly announced via the Tianxuan Mirror.

If there is any underhanded dealing, any cultivator may report it.

The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance will investigate thoroughly to the end and show no mercy!

Various policies indicated that the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance attached great importance to the Nine Mountains Prefecture.

At the very least, the clauses in the document truly made all cultivators of the Immortal Alliance feel that determination.

More crucially, the one who issued the decree and oversaw the construction of the Nine Mountains Prefecture was the Dharma-Transmitter Jiang, who had previously led the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance to a great victory over the Five Elders Association.

As the only Dharma-Transmitter known to the public, and with the foundation of that previous major victory.

Dharma-Transmitter Jiang's reputation among the Immortal Alliance cultivators was extremely high; it was almost second only to the Immortal Ancestor.

"If the Nine Mountains Free Trade Prefecture is successfully established, and if its effects are significant, then this Dharma-Transmitter Jiang's prestige will probably rise even further."

"It is truly interesting. Is this a representative collectively pushed forward by the Dharma-Transmitters, or..."

"The actual leadership of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance is divided into two factions: the Dharma-Transmitters and the Tianxuan Mirror. Now, the Dharma-Transmitters are making frequent major moves, and they are even trying to create the Xuantian Spirit-Sealing Formation to completely seize control of the Tianxuan Mirror."

"Will the Tianxuan Mirror side just sit idly by?"

Li Fan was one of them.

However, no matter the outcome, he actually did not care.

By taking advantage of the cover provided by the Nine Mountains Prefecture fervor, the rapid expansion of the Divine Descent Body organization was what concerned him more.

However, regarding its own territory, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance actually always maintained very strong control.

When more and more cultivators successively mastered the projections of gods and demons that possessed Nascent Soul, or even Soul Transformation, strength, this abnormal phenomenon still drew the attention of the Immortal Alliance authorities.

However, since no one had violated the Immortal Alliance laws, they did not strike against those cultivators for the time being.

They merely dispatched some cultivators from the Guardian Hall, who also began cultivating the Divine Descent Body, in an attempt to probe the secrets behind it.

When one of the cultivators summoned a god or demon, and Li Fan's thought incarnation tried to lurk into the opponent's sea of consciousness.

Li Fan discovered that this cultivator actually wanted to trace back along the source of the thought incarnation to spy on Li Fan.

"Truly courting death..."

Li Fan sneered, but did not stop the other party.

Instead, he carefully set up an arrangement, and then led him over.

Thus, this Guardian Hall cultivator named Wei Ziguan, after the initial surprise faded, saw only scenes that were incredibly realistic.

A black sun appeared in the sky above the Xuanhuang Realm, devouring everything.

Countless living beings wailed, yet they could not react in time.
