They all vanished into that endless blackness.

The Xuanhuang Realm shattered; living beings suffered and perished.

This terrifying apocalyptic scene, in an instant when Wei Ziguan was caught off guard, flooded into his mind all at once.

It was not an illusion.

The expressions on the faces of every cultivator facing the great calamity were incredibly real.

It was as if the end of the world had truly happened right before his eyes.

"Aaahhh!"

Wei Ziguan went mad.

He only had Golden Core cultivation, and his path of cultivation had been less than a hundred years so far. He had always had smooth sailing; how had he ever witnessed such a hellish scene? 𝙍ᴀＮοΒΕS̈

Breaking off the spying and returning to reality, Wei Ziguan could not stop shrieking.

He appeared deranged, his mouth incessantly muttering words like the end of the world was imminent.

His colleagues quickly subdued him.

After reporting upward, the cultivator who came to examine him, upon understanding Wei Ziguan's experience, also furrowed his brows tightly and had a grim expression.

Realizing the severity of the matter, that cultivator ordered someone to confine Wei Ziguan, then hurriedly returned.

……

Similar incidents like this occurred in various places across the Immortal Alliance, and there was more than one such event.

After the reports from all regions were gathered and submitted, they finally shook the higher-ups of the Immortal Alliance.

However, the matter was quite suspicious, and it was hard to say whether it was a secret plot from the Five Elders Association.

Therefore, before the final decision was made, the Immortal Alliance suspended its investigation into the Divine Descent Body technique.

It only ordered the regions to secretly control all the cultivators who practiced the Divine Descent Body technique.

But with Li Fan, the instigator, continuously spreading the seeds.

The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance's actions were merely a drop in the bucket.

The Divine Descent Body organization continued to grow as before.

"Hmm?"

Li Fan, who had just successfully bewitched another cultivator, suddenly felt a sense of being spied upon without reason.

It was as if through heaven and earth, it had directly located Li Fan's position.

Fortunately, when Li Fan went out, he always changed his appearance. So his true identity was not exposed.

With a cold snort, Li Fan pointed lightly toward the sky.

A sharp sword intent severed the source of the secret surveillance.

But in just this short moment, his position seemed to have been locked.

A thin line suddenly descended from the sky, and only afterward did the roaring whistle come from afar!

"Sky-Patrolling Arrow!"

The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance clearly attached great importance to Li Fan, this covert sower of mischief.

It was not just one, but three Sky-Patrolling Arrows in succession that locked onto Li Fan!

Even a Dao Integration cultivator would have to pay a heavy price in this situation!

But Li Fan was unafraid.

His eyes gleamed as he waved his wide sleeve toward the approaching Sky-Patrolling Arrows!

In an instant, the three arrows that tore through the air, as if to rip everything apart, vanished inexplicably!

Li Fan revealed a disdainful smile, then his figure fled swiftly and left the place in a moment.

When a team of fully armed Immortal Alliance cultivators arrived belatedly and figured out what had happened, their faces all showed undisguised expressions of shock and fear.

……

In the space passage leading to the empire's small world.

Li Fan frowned slightly, looking at the Sky-Patrolling Arrow rampaging in his Five Elements Great Cave-Heaven.

That move, the beggar's version of "Universe in Sleeve," had indeed been quite impressive.

However, it was after all a weapon capable of severely injuring a Dao Integration cultivator.

Forcibly taking it into his own Cave-Heaven naturally required paying a considerable price.

The Cave-Heaven rumbled and trembled slightly.

The water, fire, and earth grotto-heavens, due to the Sky-Patrolling Arrow's attacks, even showed faint cracks in the sky.

Fortunately, there were still the metal and wood Cave-Heaven to support, plus Li Fan personally taking action and using the Seven-Colored Divine Light to help suppress it.

In the end, these three Sky-Patrolling Arrows were completely subdued by Li Fan.

With the flow of the five elements, in just a moment, the effects brought by the Sky-Patrolling Arrows disappeared without a trace.

Li Fan then held one Sky-Patrolling Arrow in his hand and quietly studied it.

He did not know what material it was made from, but it was incredibly hard.

Even when Li Fan bombarded it with the Annihilation Sword, the arrow body remained undamaged.

The arrow body was engraved with many intricate patterns. After Li Fan analyzed it with the Final Dissociation Disc, he obtained a hundred thousand layers of composite formations.

More than half of them were things Li Fan had never learned, and even the Final Dissociation Disc's own derivation database did not have them.

They were completely different from the formation systems of the Xuanhuang Realm itself and seemed to come from another cultivation world.

"This is a great supplement for the Final Dissociation Disc!"

Li Fan was overjoyed in his heart.

"As expected, the fastest way to progress is to deconstruct existing unknown creations!"

Li Fan sped through the spatial passage. Before reaching the Empire’s small world, the Final Dissociation Disc had already absorbed, transformed, and deciphered all one hundred thousand formations engraved upon the Sky-Patrolling Arrow.

He paused briefly. Twin silver rays shot from his eyes, and in an instant, the formations on the arrow’s surface were completely erased.

Those hundred thousand formations not only granted acceleration, positioning, and amplification effects, but also layered together to form armor-like protection. This made the Sky-Patrolling Arrow incredibly hard, to an unimaginable degree.

Yet with those formations gone, its inner core material was now revealed.

Li Fan then realized—this Sky-Patrolling Arrow seemed to be a living creature!

Beneath a layer of hardened keratin, faint spiritual fluctuations could be sensed. The fluctuations were so weak that without Li Fan’s soul strength—far surpassing that of an ordinary Dao Integration cultivator—he would have overlooked them entirely.

“What is this thing…”

Li Fan’s interest was piqued.

He separated a wisp of divine sense, attempting to communicate with the arrow. However, it seemed frightened. Almost instantly, its spiritual fluctuations vanished completely, and no sign of life remained.

Afterward, no matter how much Li Fan probed, the Sky-Patrolling Arrow stubbornly refused to show any trace of life again.

Helpless, Li Fan stored it within his own Inner World, leaving a thread of divine sense to monitor it constantly. He planned to wait until it lowered its guard before investigating further.

“No wonder the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance managed to deploy over a thousand Sky-Patrolling Arrows in such a short time. So they were actually some kind of unknown living organism, combined with layered formations…”

“There must also be a central control hub to coordinate them all.”

Recalling the massive web formed by the Sky-Patrolling Arrows during the battle between the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and the Five Elders Association, Li Fan pondered deeply.

“Now that I have fully deciphered the composite formations, if I can analyze the nature of this living organism…”

“I can mass-produce Sky-Patrolling Arrows myself.”

“Whether for personal use or to sell the secret to the Five Elders Association, both options would be highly profitable.”

Although in good spirits, Li Fan remained cautious.

Seeing the Empire’s small world in the distance, he did not reveal his presence immediately.

Instead, he first used divine sense to scan thoroughly, ensuring the Empire had not set any traps. Only then did he activate his power.

Under the Soul-Ignition Technique’s enhancement, five eerie blood moons instantly descended over the Empire’s heavens.

Darkness fell as the original sun was completely blotted out.

Terrifying divine demons emerged from the blood moons, swiftly occupying every corner of the Empire.

The extreme yin and darkness radiating from their bodies froze the minds of mortals below.

They could not even produce thoughts of fear, their bodies stiff and motionless.

As the spectral domain enveloped the Empire, Li Fan’s cold voice echoed through the world.

“The three-year deadline has arrived. How is the task I gave you progressing?”

His voice was like thunder, shaking the entire Empire.

Everyone within was overwhelmed by despair, as if witnessing gods and demons effortlessly tearing their world apart.

Moments later, three streaks of light—azure, crimson, and golden—flew toward Li Fan. They were Qing, Hong, and the Imperial Princess.

“Greetings, Senior.”

Compared to the last time, Li Fan’s aura had grown even more overwhelming.

The three could barely remain standing.

“Fortunately, we did not fail your expectations. Over the past three years, we have poured the full strength of our nation into upgrading the Spiritual Energy Synthetic Technology,” Qing finally reported, his voice trembling yet determined.

Li Fan’s gaze locked onto Qing, causing her heart to tighten for an instant.

“Ha ha ha ha…”

“Very good. Take me to see it.”

Moments later, Li Fan’s laughter made her secretly sigh in relief.

They walked together into the Imperial Palace Treasury.

At the place where the Myriad Phenomena Furnace had once stood, there was now a massive machine.

Its outer form resembled an hourglass, and faint sounds could be heard, as if something were dripping from the upper chamber to the lower one.

“Senior, please have a look.”

Qing pressed a button on the side of the hourglass-like device.

The dripping sound became faster and faster.

When it reached a certain point, a small opening suddenly appeared at the bottom of the hourglass.

Immediately, a stream of pure spiritual energy burst out from the opening.

The concentration of spiritual energy was so high that at first, it condensed into “spiritual rain.” Only after a while did it turn into white mist and slowly disperse into the air.

Li Fan stretched out his hand and caught a wisp of the spiritual energy.

Aside from the faint trace of blood scent that lingered within it, it was almost no different from natural spiritual energy.

Even so, compared to the spiritual energy produced through the catalysis of exotic beast flesh and blood, this was far superior in quality.

After a short outburst of spiritual energy, the metallic hourglass grew nearly silent.

Only after a long while did the soft dripping sound return.

However, Li Fan noticed that as time passed, the frequency of the dripping became increasingly faster.

He realized that once it reached the same speed as before, new spiritual energy would once again erupt.

When his divine sense penetrated through the metal hourglass and entered its interior, Li Fan discovered that the upper chamber of the hourglass was filled with countless minute flesh-like tissues.

No, rather than flesh, they resembled a colony of fungi.

Their blood vitality was faint, and there was no trace of consciousness within them. Their only purpose was to absorb nutrients and reproduce themselves.

“How interesting.”

Sensing his reaction, Qing began to explain at the perfect moment.

“In the past, spiritual energy could only be extracted from the beast cores of certain exotic beasts. From birth to the formation of their crystalline cores, even with our accelerated breeding methods, an exotic beast required at least half a year.”

“Even then, the production efficiency of spiritual energy was far too low. So, we changed our approach and began cultivating them through guided evolution.”

“We eliminated all other functions, retaining only the part responsible for generating beast cores.”

“Then, we merged in the traits of a fungal-type exotic beast known for its extreme reproductive speed.”

“After over a hundred generations of iterative cultivation, we finally created this nearly perfect organism.”

Though Qing’s tone remained steady, her eyes shone with undisguised excitement as she spoke of their research achievements.

“As Senior can see, from the moment this creature is born, it begins self-replication.”

“It no longer requires the process of reproduction. It can multiply endlessly through pure self-copying. Moreover, the nutrients it needs are no more than those of ordinary fungi: water and sunlight.”

“Once a crystalline core is formed within its body, the creature dies naturally. Its flesh separates from the core.”

“The cores are collected into the lower part of the funnel, while the corpses of the beasts are decomposed and converted back into nutrients, to be absorbed by their own kind.”

“This cycle continues endlessly. As long as a small amount of nutrients is added at fixed intervals, this device can continuously produce spiritual energy.”

After listening to Qing’s explanation, Li Fan carefully observed the entire operational process of the hourglass-like device once more.

A faint trace of delight arose in his heart.

Under the pressure of their nation’s fall and the threat of extinction, the people of this empire had indeed unleashed an unimaginable potential.

Even Li Fan had not expected that they could create such a nearly flawless device.

Even with his current discerning eyes, it was difficult to find any true flaw in this construct.

“This kind of spirit beast and the hourglass device still lack names,” Qing said respectfully. “Please, Senior, grant them names.”

After speaking, Qing subtly gestured with her eyes. The imperial princess bowed deeply and spoke softly.

Li Fan chuckled.

Even though he clearly understood their intentions, he was still rather pleased by their respect.

“When heaven and earth first opened, they divided into yin and yang,” he said slowly.

“Yin and yang merged, giving birth to all things.”

“It is also said: The Dao gives birth to One, One gives birth to Two, Two gives birth to Three, and Three gives birth to the myriad beings…”

“This spirit beast shall be named Dao-One Insect.”

“As for this device…”

Li Fan paused for a moment, then declared solemnly, “It shall be called Heaven and Earth Furnace!”

The three imperial women exchanged glances, eyes filled with joy.

“Thank you for bestowing the names, Senior!” they said in unison.

Afterward, Li Fan continued to inquire into more details regarding the Heaven and Earth Furnace.

Forging the furnace itself was not particularly difficult.

As long as resources were sufficient, producing tens of thousands of furnaces in a single day would not be a problem.

One simply needed to introduce a portion of Dao-One Insects into a newly forged, empty furnace, infuse it with nutrients, and wait ten days.

The Heaven and Earth Furnace would then continuously generate spiritual energy.

“The only potential risk,” Qing explained, “is that during self-replication, the Dao-One Insects may undergo mutation.”

“The probability of mutation is extremely low, and the direction of change unpredictable. But in any case, such mutations would cause the Heaven and Earth Furnace to malfunction.” ɽ𝒶ꞐȮ฿Ɛ𝐒

“Moreover, since the Dao-One Insects have been selectively bred to an extremely simple structure, any mutated variant would naturally surpass them in adaptability. Hence, the original strain would inevitably be replaced.”

“To ensure that the Dao-One Insects remain in their optimal spiritual energy–producing state, any sign of mutation within a furnace must be met with immediate and total extermination.”

“It is also advised to maintain multiple cultivated backups of the original Dao-One strain to prevent a large-scale mutation or extinction event.”

Indeed, there was no such thing as a perfect creation in this world.

Even after hundreds of generations of refinement, this flaw within the Dao-One Insects could not be fully eliminated.

However, compared to the immense benefits they brought, such flaws were nearly negligible.

At worst, the furnaces would need periodic replacement.

“In fact,” Li Fan thought to himself, “this can hardly be called a flaw at all.”

“If the furnaces are sealed through secret arts so that outsiders cannot open them, then after a certain period they will naturally fail. To use them again, one must seek new furnaces…”

“Is this not the perfect means of control?”

“Even if this is spread across countless small worlds, it would greatly reduce the risk of loss of control.”

In a flash, Li Fan deduced countless possible outcomes, his inner joy growing stronger.

Yet not a trace of it showed on his face.

Gathering several Heaven and Earth Furnaces into his sleeve, Li Fan turned his gaze toward the three imperial women.

A suffocating silence followed.

"Very good."

"I am very satisfied with your performance this time."

"Our Federation of All World has always been strict in its rewards and punishments. You have rendered great merit this time. How could such contributions go unrewarded?"

"From today onward, your Empire shall officially become a member of the Federation of All World."

As he spoke, an illusory projection of a Faceless Stone Statue appeared before the three women.

Guiding them to complete their oath before the statue, Li Fan then transmitted to them the secret art known as Divine Descent Body.

"With the protection of a demon god, it will be enough to handle all kinds of crises that may arise within your Empire."

The three women all possessed extraordinary talent. Under Li Fan’s supervision, in just a short moment, each of them successfully summoned their own respective Divine Demon.

Feeling the powerful aura emitted by these beings, the three could not help but feel pleasantly surprised.

"This is only the most basic of rewards. When I return and report our accomplishments, the Federation will issue further rewards."

"These include, but are not limited to, enhancements to your cultivation, and material support for your Empire."

"If the opportunity arises, you may even be permitted to visit the headquarters of the Federation."

Li Fan spoke lightly, painting an enticing vision before them.

"Also, since you were the ones who developed the Heaven and Earth Furnace within your small world, the Federation grants you the privilege to first implement and popularize it within your own realm. Furthermore, when other small worlds install their own Heaven and Earth Furnaces, you will receive a proportional share of the corresponding reward distribution."

"These material rewards will be settled every ten years, and delivered directly to your world."

"Although the percentage may not be large, it will be more than enough to upgrade and strengthen your small world."

This was an entirely unexpected fortune. The three imperial women were visibly overjoyed.

"Remember, our Federation never mistreats its own people."

"Anyone who contributes to the Federation shall receive a return a hundredfold, a thousandfold in value."

To further prove his words, Li Fan handed the three imperial women a storage ring.

When Qing peered into the contents of the ring and saw the vast quantity of resources within, her pupils contracted slightly.

She immediately bowed deeply to Li Fan in gratitude.

Li Fan merely waved his hand dismissively, as though it were nothing.

"Your performance this time exceeded my expectations."

"Next, I have another task for you."

From within his storage ring, Li Fan took out a Sky-Patrolling Arrow whose formation engravings had been erased, leaving only the dormant living core within.

"See if you can research this creature’s characteristics, and attempt to breed it on a large scale."

"If you can accomplish that, the Federation will greatly reward you."

Li Fan spoke in a deep tone, his expression and voice both revealing the importance he placed on this matter.

Qing carefully received the Sky-Patrolling Arrow, examined it for a moment, and showed a look of surprise.

However, she soon composed herself and said firmly, "I will not fail the senior’s trust."

After giving several additional instructions, Li Fan left behind a jade talisman for communication at any time, and quietly departed from the Empire’s small world.

Inside the Imperial Palace.

Hong frowned slightly and looked at Xiao Qing. "Qing, this thing seems somewhat familiar, does it not?"

Qing shook her head. "Indeed, it looks a bit like that thing from our sect back then. But we cannot be certain yet. We need to study it further."

After a moment of silence, Hong asked again, "And what do you think of this Federation of All Worlds?"

"Whether we like it or not, we are the fish and they are the knife. What can we do? We can only take one step at a time."

"Besides, from what we’ve seen so far, they don’t seem to be ruthless or evil people."

The Imperial Palace fell silent again.

After a brief pause, as if recalling something, Qing suddenly said, "By the way, the Demon Gods granted to us by that senior..."

"Do not use them unless it is absolutely necessary."

"I have a feeling that there is something strange about them."

Hong and the Imperial Princess both nodded silently.

…

Having already returned to the Xuanhuang Realm, Li Fan, through the divine sense of his Demon God incarnation, sensed the conversation among the three women.

Li Fan let out a cold sneer.

Those divine demons and gods were manifestations of Li Fan’s spiritual will. The moment he mastered [Divine Descent Body], they were deeply rooted within his sea of consciousness.

Every action, emotion, and thought of theirs was under his complete control.

How could they possibly “escape” simply by refusing to act?

“It is natural for them to have their own little schemes,” Li Fan said calmly. “As long as they can be used by me, that is enough. The path of the Exotic Beasts still possesses limitless potential.”

Li Fan did not care about the duplicity of the Empire and the others. No matter what they did, they could never escape the palm of his hand.

To test the effect of the [Heaven and Earth Furnace], Li Fan returned to the Spiritwood Realm and immediately used a spatial channel to arrive at the Beast Realm.

He placed one completed furnace on a mountain peak and set up a protective formation around it.

Then he left a divine sense to observe the changes brought by the Heaven and Earth Furnace.

The formation merely prevented beasts from damaging the furnace and did not affect the diffusion of spiritual energy.

Although most of them were low-level creatures that had not yet developed spiritual intelligence, their natural sensitivity to spiritual energy caused them to swarm toward the Heaven and Earth Furnace, greedily trying to absorb its pure aura.

However, without cultivation methods, they could not actively draw spiritual energy into their bodies. Most of the energy still dispersed into the surroundings.

After ten days, the once unremarkable small mountain had suddenly become full of vitality.

“At this rate,” Li Fan calculated, “to transform a small, spiritless world into one that meets the minimum requirements for cultivation would require about a hundred Heaven and Earth Furnaces continuously operating for a hundred years.”

“If there were ten thousand furnaces, it could be done in a single year.”

After obtaining this rough data, Li Fan immediately summoned the Treefolk Clan.

With the continuous advancement of the Spiritwood Realm and Lin Ling’s cultivation feedback, the strength of the Treefolk Matriarch had also risen rapidly.

She had now reached the late Soul Transformation stage, only one step away from Dao Integration.

Within the Treefolk Clan, Nascent Soul-level cultivators were also appearing one after another.

The overall power of the entire clan had undergone a qualitative leap compared to when Li Fan had first taken control of the Spiritwood Realm.

Therefore, the Treefolk revered Li Fan deeply.

The female clan leader knelt before Li Fan, bowing her head respectfully. “Greetings, Revered One.”

Li Fan placed a Heaven and Earth Furnace before her and explained in detail the method of its forging.

“From today onward, gather the strength of your entire clan and refine this item,” he commanded.

“Within three years, I want all the small worlds connected to the Spiritwood Realm to become suitable for cultivation.”

The Matriarch immediately accepted the order and departed.

Not long after, watching the Treefolk busily working, Li Fan nodded slightly.

The tireless Treefolk were indeed the perfect beings for such labor.

Moreover, as the progress of [Formation Refinement] continued to improve, the entire Spiritwood Realm was now under Li Fan’s absolute control.

With a single thought, he could decide life and death; there was no risk of anything going out of control.

A few days later, the idle Tianyang noticed the Treefolk’ activity and volunteered to take charge of the task.

He found the act of refining the Heaven and Earth Furnaces and then placing them across the various small worlds to be much like planting forests, and he found it immensely entertaining.

With Tianyang’s help, Li Fan no longer had anything to worry about.

After deducing the Final Dissociation Disc, which was specifically designed to protect and connect all Heaven and Earth Furnaces, Li Fan passed the corresponding formation to Tianyang and simply acted as a hands-off overseer thereafter.

Back in those years, Tianyang had already been able to refine his puppet body using the Earthfire Return-to-Origin Formation, and his talent in formation arts was already remarkable.

During this period, as his consciousness became increasingly clear, under Li Fan’s personal guidance, Tianyang quickly mastered this formation completely.

Li Fan then asked Tianyang to name the formation. With a simple and honest smile, Tianyang pondered for seven days and seven nights before finally coming up with a fitting name: “Heaven and Earth Myriad Spirits Formation.”

The Heaven and Earth Myriad Spirits Formation could use all deployed Heaven and Earth Furnaces as nodes, forming a spiritual power network that stretched across entire small worlds.

Once the formation took shape, even if one of the nodes were damaged, the network could automatically compensate for the missing spiritual energy through interconnection, preventing any reduction in the overall spiritual energy density.

Besides dispersing spiritual energy, this network also possessed functions such as surveillance, attack, and defense.

In Li Fan’s vision, the final form of the Heaven and Earth Myriad Spirits Formation would surpass even the Mysterious Net, becoming an ultimate creation capable of self-generation and evolution within the cultivation world itself.

“In fact, even now, although the scale is small, its essence is already quite close.”

“However, what it still needs is a derivation and coordination core, something like the Tianxuan Mirror.”

“Only the Tianxuan Mirror could support the envisioned scale of the Heaven and Earth Myriad Spirits Formation. Even my Final Dissociation Disc would not suffice.”

Li Fan’s thoughts surged endlessly, unable to calm down for a long time.

Suddenly, an inexplicable sense of unease disrupted his train of thought.

Li Fan’s expression changed slightly; with a flicker of his figure, he instantly exited the Spiritwood Realm.

Not long after he arrived in the Xuanhuang Realm, the voice of the Heavenly Doctor echoed within his mind.

“I finally found you.”

“I sensed that the seal of the Cloudwater Heavenly Palace has loosened. To prevent outsiders from interfering, go there and reinforce the seal.”

As soon as the Heavenly Doctor finished speaking, a restriction technique named ‘Hidden World, Concealed Void’ appeared within Li Fan’s mind.

The Heavenly Doctor seemed to be in a hurry; before Li Fan could respond, his voice faded again.

Expressionless on the surface but heavy-hearted within, Li Fan muttered to himself.

“Anchored at year eleven, the Cloudwater Heavenly Palace will open.”

“I nearly forgot about that.”

“But what does this task from the Heavenly Doctor mean? A test, or something else?”

That the Heavenly Doctor could directly lock onto and contact him did not surprise Li Fan.

After all, they had met face-to-face in this world, and Li Fan had even accepted the Record of Mending Heaven imparted by him.

Such was the price of directly engaging with the Heavenly Doctor.

Still, this lack of security left Li Fan somewhat displeased.

After a short moment of thought, Li Fan cupped his hands toward the heavens, then flew toward the Congyun Sea.

Arriving at the center of the Congyun Sea, where the Cloudwater Heavenly Palace resided, Li Fan observed the scene.

Though the Cloudwater Heavenly Palace had yet to officially manifest, faint anomalies were already appearing in the sky, attracting passing cultivators who stopped to watch.

Using the restriction imparted by the Heavenly Doctor, Li Fan quietly entered the inner realm.

Prepared to face the illusionary trial of Senior Brother Qin Tang, he was surprised to find himself directly standing before the main gate of the Cloudwater Heavenly Palace, without entering any illusion.

Not far away, the stone statue of Qin Tang stood silently, unchanged through the ages.

The entire Cloudwater Heavenly Palace was enveloped in silence, as though every lurking strangeness within it had fallen into slumber.

It was Li Fan’s first time witnessing the Cloudwater Heavenly Palace in its sealed state. Compared to its previous appearance, this time it looked no different from an ordinary sect where cultivators merely rested.

There was not the slightest trace of the eerie destruction and abomination that had once overrun it.

The conflicting sensations made Li Fan frown slightly.

“Will they only collectively riot when they appear within the Xuanhuang Realm?”

As he pondered, Li Fan stepped past Qin Tang’s stone statue and proceeded deeper into the Cloudwater Heavenly Palace.

The area he was heading toward was one he had never entered before—the residence of the Palace Master of Cloudwater Heavenly Palace.

That was where Hanhai once resided.

With Li Fan’s current insight, recalling the past conflicts he had witnessed within the Cloudwater Heavenly Palace, Hanhai at his peak was at most at the Dao Integration peak stage—he had never attained Longevity.

Moreover, he had already perished long ago, surviving only in a strange and unnatural form.

Therefore, Li Fan was not particularly concerned about encountering any danger on this trip.

What he cared about more was whether Heavenly Doctor might be observing his every move from some unseen corner.

A massive blue protective barrier enveloped the entire area.

The restriction that sealed the Cloudwater Heavenly Palace began here and spread throughout the entire complex.

After observing quietly for a moment, Li Fan noticed that from the blue barrier, waves of invisible shock ripples occasionally emanated.

It was precisely these ripples that caused the restriction to gradually weaken.

“This is…”

Li Fan’s expression showed a trace of surprise.

Having thoroughly studied the Mending Heaven Record, he quickly recognized that even in his deep slumber, Hanhai’s emotions had suffered tremendous disturbance.

This led to uncontrollable energy overflow, releasing shock waves outward.

It resembled a mortal’s “sleepwalking”—strictly speaking, a type of spiritual ailment even among cultivators.

“Could it be that Heavenly Doctor guided me here to relieve Hanhai’s suffering?”

“No, that seems unlikely. Perhaps it’s just a simple errand—to reinforce the sealing formation…”

“There must be a deeper meaning behind this.”

After a moment of contemplation, Li Fan made up his mind.

He split off an extremely fine strand of divine sense, almost completely blank—and passed it through the blue barrier into the sphere within.

Inside, a blue-and-white pearl floated in midair.

It resembled the Canghai Pearl but was distinctly different.

The sphere spun rapidly, and within the blue and white surface, a thin streak of blackness intertwined—painfully glaring to the eye.

Like a nightmare, the blackness clung to the pearl, impossible to dispel.

“So, Hanhai’s true body has already vanished, leaving behind only this bead…”

After searching the area and finding no other presences, Li Fan sighed softly.

“It seems that this trace of blackness is the source of Hanhai’s torment.”

After some hesitation, Li Fan finally allowed his strand of divine sense to enter it.

A moment later, his vision blurred—he felt the world spin violently.

It was as though he had entered an  Fallen Immortal Realm and attached himself to a completely new body.

However, he could not control it—he could only passively observe and experience what this body was undergoing.

“Venerable Heavenly Doctor has been gone for a long time. I wonder if this plan will truly succeed.”

Hanhai sat upright in the great hall of the sect.

At his feet, a turtle-snake Taiyi about the size of an ordinary tortoise spoke gloomily.

“Venerable Heavenly Doctor said before his departure that there was at least a ninety percent chance of success. We should have a little faith in Him.” 𝙍ÁΝȯꞖÈS

Unlike Taiyi’s frowning face, Hanhai appeared relaxed, smiling as he comforted him.

Taiyi shook his head slightly, retracting both his turtle and snake heads into his shell.

“I can live another hundred thousand years. What is there to fear? If things truly go wrong, I’ll just find a pond and sleep for a while. All disasters will pass eventually—what could possibly harm me?”

“Still, according to that brat Qin Tang, some other sects can’t sit still any longer.”

“They’ve even started spreading talk in secret, saying it might be better to surrender…”

Hanhai snorted coldly. “To speak of defeat before battle—such cowards will naturally be dealt with by Venerable Tian Jue Himself!”

Taiyi gave a bitter smile. “It’s not that we lost before the battle even began. It’s just that after fighting for so long, everyone is already exhausted, like lamps running out of oil. This decision is simply a last resort…”

“Honestly, I can’t blame them,” he continued. “If this war drags on any longer, there will be no hope left for anyone…”

Hanhai suddenly roared in anger, interrupting Taiyi. “Enough!”

“You think that way too?”

“Do you think our enemies are any better off than we are?”

“At this point, it’s all about who can hold out until the end. If we surrender now, then what meaning would the sacrifices of all our fallen comrades have?”

Taiyi sighed softly and fell silent.

Inside the grand hall, the air was as still as death.

After a long silence, perhaps to ease the tension between them, Taiyi spoke again. “Speaking of the Venerable Tian Jue, it seems I haven’t seen Him for quite some time…”

Just then, a sudden scream came from outside.

“Venerable…”

“No!”

“Run! The Venerable has gone mad!”

The screams were abrupt and chilling. Both Hanhai and Taiyi instantly turned pale.

Without a word, they turned into two streaks of blue and black light, rushing toward the source of the cries.

In the air, they witnessed a sight they would never forget.

Their most revered Venerable Tian Jue stood there with eyes closed, wielding the Heavenly Calamity Sword, mercilessly slaughtering the disciples of Cloudwater Heavenly Palace.

With the Venerable’s cultivation, no disciple stood a chance.

Black sword lights flashed across the sky, harvesting lives without mercy.

Hanhai’s eyes burned with fury as he roared, “Stop!”

A massive blue palm descended from the heavens, striking toward the Venerable.

Yet the Venerable Tian Jue did not even glance at him. The Heavenly Calamity Sword released a single sword light that tore the blue palm apart with ease.

The sword light did not weaken; it continued its deadly path straight toward Hanhai.

“Careful!”

Taiyi transformed, revealing his true form, and with his incredibly tough shell, blocked the black sword light.

Boom!

Amid the tremendous impact, Taiyi spat out a mouthful of blood.

Hanhai finally regained some clarity.

“You hold him off. I’ll cover the disciples’ retreat!”

Blue threads of light shot out from Hanhai, spreading across Cloudwater Heavenly Palace, attempting to save the disciples who were fleeing in panic.

However…

At that very moment, the Heavenly Calamity Sword erupted with countless black rays of light.

Those lights shot out faster than Hanhai’s rescue threads, intercepting them completely.

The black radiance pierced through each blue thread and dragged them back toward Hanhai.

Before Hanhai could react, those dark rays solidified like countless black needles, pinning him in midair!

“You’re not the Venerable Tian Jue!?”

Though his limbs were immobilized, Hanhai could still speak. His face twisted in horror.

“Who are you?” he shouted in anger and despair.

The one before him ignored his words.

Eyes still closed, the Venerable Tian Jue commanded the Heavenly Calamity Sword, continuing to harvest the lives of every last disciple of Cloudwater Heavenly Palace.

As the sect master, Hanhai could do nothing but watch helplessly as his disciples were slaughtered one by one.

“No… no…”

When no life remained in Cloudwater Heavenly Palace except for the two of them, even curses failed to leave Hanhai’s mouth.

His entire body trembled, and tears of blood streamed from his eyes.

“You… who… are… you…”

Hanhai’s eyes went blank as he muttered under his breath.

After a brief pause, as if struck by a realization, his body trembled violently.

“The Heavenly Doctor? You are the Heavenly Doctor!?”

At those words, the figure tormenting the disciples of Cloudwater Heavenly Palace paused slightly.

Then, a strange smile crept across his face.

“The Heavenly Doctor…”

“Hehehe, correct. I am the Heavenly Doctor.”

The moment those words were spoken, the world in Hanhai’s eyes changed completely.

The one who had appeared as the “Venerable Tian Jue” instantly transformed into the familiar visage of the Heavenly Doctor, his expression serene, his demeanor holy and benevolent—yet his actions were unspeakably horrifying.

“So it really is you!”

“Why, Heavenly Doctor!?”

Believing he had finally uncovered the truth, Hanhai roared in fury that shook the heavens.

“Why! Why!”

He demanded an answer again and again.

But the Heavenly Doctor ignored him completely. His expression remained calm from beginning to end.

Only the clouded pupils of his eyes held a faint glimmer of appreciation as if admiring a masterpiece—as he gazed at the “resurrected” disciples of Cloudwater Heavenly Palace.

The newly reborn disciples looked down in confusion at their faintly transparent bodies, then glanced around in bewilderment.

Gradually, realization dawned upon them about what had happened.

And when they heard Hanhai’s furious roar, they finally understood who was responsible for their fate.

“Heavenly Doctor!”

“Heavenly Doctor!”

One after another, their wrathful cries filled the Cloudwater Heavenly Palace, echoing like a chorus of vengeance.

The sound was enough to chill the soul.

Yet the Heavenly Doctor listened to it as though it were a divine symphony, his face showing an almost ecstatic intoxication.

This sight drove the people of Cloudwater Heavenly Palace to the brink of madness. They longed to tear him apart and devour his flesh.

But they remained trapped within his control, able only to scream helplessly, unable to resist in the slightest.

After what felt like an eternity, the Heavenly Doctor finally seemed satisfied with what he had heard. His expression suddenly changed.

As his cold snort echoed, endless darkness swallowed everyone within the Cloudwater Heavenly Palace.

…

The scene abruptly ended.

When light returned again, it was back to the earlier moment—inside the grand hall, when Hanhai was speaking with Taiyi.

“It seems this nightmarish memory is the very source of Hanhai’s torment.”

Li Fan thought to himself.

He replayed the memory several more times from Hanhai’s perspective. After confirming there was nothing unusual, Li Fan’s strand of divine sense attempted to leave. ṛàɴỌВΕš

However, to his surprise, he could not find a way out.

The scene before him had begun looping endlessly, becoming almost indistinguishable from real space-time.

If one could awaken from an illusion or a memory, how could one escape from something that had already become real?

All connections with the outside world were cut off. Li Fan tried countless methods to leave, but all failed.

Still, Li Fan remained calm.

After all, it was only a wisp of his divine sense that had entered this place.

For his true body, the loss of such a fragment would heal within less than a single breath.

By reason, since escape was impossible and there was no harm to his true self, this wisp could simply self-destruct and end it all.

Yet driven by instinctive will to survive, Li Fan’s divine fragment decided to try once more.

Perhaps there was still a way to break this cycle.

“Even as an outsider, I cannot escape this eternal nightmare. Then how could its true host, Hanhai, ever hope to?”

“But the cause of all this deserves careful thought. Is it that Hanhai’s own trauma is too deep for him to free himself, or perhaps…”

Though startled, Li Fan did not panic. He continued to experience the nightmare through Hanhai’s eyes.

Once again, he endured the hellish scene. As the Heavenly Doctor’s cold snort sounded and darkness descended, Li Fan focused all his attention on the void ahead.

The darkness lasted only a few breaths.

At first glance, it seemed to be nothing more than the absence of memory—a simple blank.

But Li Fan keenly sensed that this darkness had two distinct layers.

The first part was when Hanhai’s perception of the outside world was forcibly sealed.

The second came after—that was the interlude of the nightmare’s cycle.

Both appeared as absolute, lifeless blackness, so to the maddened Hanhai they were indistinguishable.

Only Li Fan, as an outsider, could faintly perceive the subtle difference.

Had he not been long accustomed to the tragedies of the world, with a heart like solid stone, unmoved even by the horrific fates of those in the Cloudwater Heavenly Palace—he might never have noticed that difference.

Now that he had found a point of entry, Li Fan’s divine wisp continued to wait within the nightmare’s cycle, attempting to pierce through the darkness and glimpse what lay beyond.

“It seems that the so-called Heavenly Doctor did not stop because he grew bored. That subtle change in his expression…”

“Someone arrived.”

Li Fan realized this suddenly.

With patience, he endured the loop hundreds of times. From faint flashes and shadows captured in each cycle, piece by piece, like assembling a puzzle, Li Fan finally reconstructed what had happened in that single instant obscured by darkness.

After the Heavenly Doctor subdued everyone in the Cloudwater Heavenly Palace, a figure swiftly descended from the distant sky.

The Heavenly Doctor’s eyes showed mockery. His form faded and vanished.

And the newcomer—was also in the appearance of the Heavenly Doctor.

Ahead and behind him stood two Heavenly Doctor.

Their appearances and auras were no different from what Li Fan had seen in this lifetime.

However, the one who had previously caused the boundless massacre at Cloudwater Heavenly Palace wore an expression of utter indifference throughout the entire process.

Deep in his eyes, there was even a trace of enjoyment.

His depravity was so extreme that even Li Fan felt ashamed in comparison.

The Heavenly Doctor who appeared afterward, however, could not conceal the rage and grief in his eyes.

The faint trembling of his body also clearly reflected his turmoil.

The Heavenly Doctor slightly opened his mouth, as if he wanted to say something.

But the reconstructed scene ended there.

Li Fan fell into deep thought.

“Someone disguised themselves as the Heavenly Doctor and slaughtered everyone in Cloudwater Heavenly Palace?”

“The true Heavenly Doctor arrived too late and could do nothing to reverse it?”

He recalled what the Heavenly Doctor had told Tian Yu and Tian Jue before: ‘What one sees is not necessarily the truth.’

He also remembered the Heavenly Doctor’s act of healing Tian Jue and sealing Cloudwater Heavenly Palace.

From this, Li Fan drew a conclusion.

“But if it was merely a simple case of framing and deception, that could have been explained away. Why was the misunderstanding never cleared up? Why did it only deepen over thousands of years of torment for the people of Cloudwater Heavenly Palace?”

Li Fan could not understand.

“Perhaps the answer to that question lies with Hanhai.”

After a moment of contemplation, Li Fan made his decision.

When the impostor Heavenly Doctor once again covered Hanhai’s senses with darkness within the nightmare cycle, Li Fan, like a ray of light, faintly illuminated the darkness.

At the same time, he repeatedly played back the reconstructed images, attempting to awaken Hanhai’s slumbering consciousness.

“Wake up! Wake up!”

“The murderer was not the Heavenly Doctor!”

“It was someone else! Someone impersonated him to sow discord!”

...

Ripples of divine sense echoed endlessly through the darkness.

Gradually, like the rise of a great tide, the surrounding space began to quake and distort.

“Silence! Silence!”

“Do not try to deceive me!”

“The Venerable Ones act on behalf of Heaven itself. How could anyone possibly impersonate them?”

“Their appearance and aura may be falsified, but the divine authority they hold over the Laws of Heaven cannot be forged!”

Li Fan’s persistent words seemed only to provoke Hanhai’s fury.

A massive blue face emerged within the spherical space surrounding him.

Hanhai glared at Li Fan, the well-intentioned man trying to awaken him—as if looking upon his greatest enemy, his eyes filled with venomous hatred.

“Curse you! Trying to poison my mind!”

“Even if it was not the Heavenly Doctor, it must have been one of the other Venerables!”

“They all deserve death!”

“And so do you!”

A thunderous roar echoed as streams of black light surged from Hanhai’s illusory azure face.

Then, tens of thousands of gigantic blue palms struck out at once, crushing Li Fan’s divine sense trapped within their midst.

...

“Hmph.”

In the real Cloudwater Heavenly Palace, Li Fan, whose divine sense projection had just been severed—let out a muffled groan.

However, such a minor wound was quickly repaired under the natural circulation of the Limitless Fullness and Emptiness Method.

“Authority of the Heavenly Law Realm, held by the Heavenly Venerable…”

Li Fan narrowed his eyes, recalling what Hanhai had said earlier in his fury.

“No wonder Hanhai and the others, driven mad by their tortured memories, have always believed they did not mistake the murderer.”

“So apart from appearance, what truly represents their identity is the authority of the Heavenly Dao.”

“Tian Jue should be the Dao of Slaughter.”

“Tian Yu should be the Dao of Teaching and Enlightenment.”

“Tian Yi, obviously, is the Dao of Healing.”

Li Fan could not help but recall the first time he had met Tian Yu.

The green ox pulled the carriage. The two guardians, the Silent Monster and the Chaotic Spirit, stood watch at the door.

Tian Yu, like a venerable teacher, instructed every cultivator who entered the hut in the arts of learning.

That was their true nature, one that even Tian Yu’s later transformation into something strange had not altered.

“Heavenly Law is solemn, to be revered and followed.”

“I have attained the Law, and now spread it among all beings.”

“The Heavenly Law cannot be defied.”

…

Li Fan remembered the faint sound of recitation he had once heard outside that hut.

“It seems the Heavenly Law Realm is the name of the small world where Heavenly Doctor and the others once resided.”

“Unlike the Xuanhuang Realm, where everyone seeks to overthrow Heaven, in the Heavenly Law Realm, the status of the Heavenly Dao seems supreme.”

“Tianjue, Tianyu, Tianyi—they are not merely powerful Longevity Immortal Cultivators, but more like representatives of the Heavenly Dao itself.”

“In the Xuanhuang Realm, cultivators stole the power of eternal life from the Ruomu Fruit. But in the Heavenly Law Realm, perhaps because the Ruomu does not exist, the only path to immortality is to become the one who holds authority over the Heavenly Dao.”

As the scattered clues connected, Li Fan began to grasp the truth.

Piece by piece, the hidden past of Heavenly Doctor was gradually revealed.

He also remembered the sword handle that Zhang Haobo and Guan Qingfeng had used to comprehend the Dao. After Zhang Haobo’s death, during the fall of the Xuanhuang Heavenly Dao, the message revealed in the collapsing firmament said that his Dao Foundation had been formed through the [Heavenly Calamity Sword Intent].

Yet, when the people of Cloudwater Heavenly Palace encountered Tian Jue, they all referred to the sword he wielded as [Heavenly Slaughter].

Li Fan had long suspected that this might be the same sword, transformed differently in another world.

Now his guess was confirmed.

“Heavenly Slaughter, like Tian Jue and Tian Yu, is likely another form of Heavenly Authority.”

“Tian Jue possessed two forms of authority. Perhaps that is why he was able to preserve his life and avoid turning into an aberration, though it left him completely insane.”

“Only Heavenly Doctor, who was away for some unknown reason, escaped disaster.”

“When he returned, everything was already too late. The Heavenly Law Realm had long become a dead land.”

Though several mysteries had been resolved, the unknowns had not decreased. Hidden within the fog, the truth only seemed more elusive.

Who exactly was the person disguised as Heavenly Doctor who committed the massacre?

According to Hanhai’s words, it was not merely someone changing their face.

He had truly seized the Heavenly Authority of the Heavenly Law Realm itself, which was why the people of Cloudwater Heavenly Palace regarded him as a Venerable One.

He could even switch freely between the forms of Heavenly Doctor and Tian Jue…

The strength of such a being was beyond imagination.

What puzzled Li Fan even more was why someone of such power bore such a grudge against the Heavenly Law Realm.

Not only had he slaughtered the entire sect, but he had also ensured that after its destruction, the realm itself would fall into endless cycles of mutual slaughter.

…

Outside Hanhai’s dwelling, Li Fan frowned deeply.

“So Heavenly Doctor sent me here to guide me toward the truth of what happened back then?”

“The dark resentment clinging to Hanhai has accumulated over thousands of years. With my current level of medical skill, I might not be able to purify it.”

“However, I can tell it has already been cleansed more than once. Clearly, over the years, Heavenly Doctor has not abandoned the people of Cloudwater Heavenly Palace.”

“Even though they have already become aberrations.”

“Hmm…”

As the saying goes, judge by actions, not by intentions. Because of this, Li Fan’s sense of wariness toward Heavenly Doctor decreased slightly.

“Well then, since I am already here, I might as well lend a hand. It will also serve as an answer to Heavenly Doctor.”

As a result, the frequency and strength of the shockwaves Hanhai released outward kept increasing.

"It seems that it truly is because he has long been tormented by nightmares, and because of his thirst for revenge, that his emotions are so unstable."

Like a compassionate physician who tends to the sick, Li Fan began to think about how to treat Hanhai’s condition.

Medicine shares similar principles across schools.

From ancient times to the present, there have been many people like Hanhai who are unable to free themselves from past hatred.

It did not take long for Li Fan to find a countermeasure.

When there was a brief lull in the erupting shockwaves, Li Fan’s strand of spirit once again rushed into the black storm on the surface of the sphere.

The nightmare scenes continued to repeat.

However, perhaps because Hanhai’s emotions were extremely unstable, the scenes Li Fan witnessed from a first-person perspective were all overlaid with a black-yellow filter.

That made the already terrifying slaughter scenes appear even more eerie and frightening.

Li Fan hid quietly and waited for the "plot" to unfold.

Soon, he reached the moment when Hanhai "discerned" the true identity of the killer.

Hanhai’s body trembled slightly, and an incredulous look appeared on his face. "Heavenly Doctor? You are Heavenly Doctor?"

The killer cooperated very well and gave a strange smile. "Heh heh heh, that’s right. I am Heavenly Doctor."

Hearing that answer, veins bulged across Hanhai’s body, and his eyes widened in fury.

Just as the anger in his mind was about to consume him, a chilling voice suddenly sounded in his heart.

It was wavering yet, like torrential rain, it instantly doused Hanhai’s boundless rage. "Do not be fooled by the other party."

"Look again, carefully. Who is he, really?"

"This person is utterly heartless, extremely cruel. Such an evildoer would not so easily admit his true identity."

"Be clearheaded. The duty of revenge rests entirely on you. There must not be the slightest mistake."

As the whispering continued, Hanhai could not help shivering.

"Not bad, not bad..."

"How could he admit it at my first question?"

"There must be something strange here..."

"Who are you. Who are you really!"

Hanhai murmured, and looked again at the killer before him.

What shocked him greatly was that, because of his suspicion, the opponent’s face and aura indeed changed once more.

No longer did he appear as the Heavenly Heavenly Doctor. Instead, he had become the stern, severe Venerable Tian Yu.

"No, how could Venerable Tian Yu possibly do such a thing?"

Hanhai shook his head wildly, as if trying to throw that horrible thought out of his mind.

As his doubts multiplied, the killer’s appearance kept shifting.

"Venerable Tian Yu? Venerable Tian Jue? Heavenly Doctor..."

The only constant was that the killer carried the authoritative aura of the Heavenly Law Realm.

The enemy was right within reach, yet he had no power to exact revenge. That was already tragic to the extreme.

Even more tragic was that he did not even know the true identity of his enemy.

He could not find a concrete target for his revenge.

The surrounding scene trembled more and more violently, and within the black-and-yellow filter, countless cracks began to appear.

At last, Hanhai could no longer endure the torment.

The entire scene shattered with a loud crash.

The outburst of overwhelming energy buried everything within this nightmare.

“It worked.”

That was the final thought of Li Fan’s remaining wisp of consciousness before it vanished.

Outside Hanhai’s dwelling, beyond the blue light sphere.

As Hanhai’s spirit temporarily collapsed, the shockwaves that occasionally erupted outward, destroying the sealing restrictions, finally came to a halt. 𝘳𝘈𐌽ȏꞖĚ𝙎

“Deep-seated hatred, now turned into confusion without knowing who the enemy truly is. It seems Hanhai should quiet down for a time.”

“However, as time passes, I imagine he will once again find a new target for revenge.”

“Hmm… most likely, it will still be the Heavenly Doctor.”

Over the span of several thousand years, the Heavenly Doctor had clearly treated Hanhai more than once. Otherwise, considering the torment he endured in his nightmare, it would have been impossible for him to retain any trace of sanity.

Yet each time, it all ended with him concluding that the Heavenly Doctor was the culprit.

“Perhaps it is because, deep within Hanhai’s subconscious, among all the Venerables of the Heavenly Law Realm in those years, only the Heavenly Doctor was capable of committing such an act.”

Li Fan pondered for a moment, confirming the cause of this phenomenon.

He could somewhat understand Hanhai’s way of thinking.

After all, the Record of Mending Heaven and the Heavenly Doctor's Immortal Scripture both described certain healing methods of the Heavenly Doctor that ran completely contrary to ordinary human morals.

Compared to the saying “fighting poison with poison,” his approach went far beyond that.

Everything was done with one ultimate goal: to cure the illness and achieve the objective. As for what methods were employed in the process…

They were never within the Heavenly Doctor’s scope of concern.

Take this treatment of Hanhai for example. The entire healing process could almost be summarized by two words: deception and comfort.

Although Hanhai would no longer suffer from the pain of hatred, he was now forever trapped in endless confusion.

Cured, yet not completely cured.

At the very least, the specific “symptom” Li Fan had originally aimed to treat was indeed resolved.

This was the Dao of the Heavenly Doctor, the principle that ran through it from beginning to end.

It conflicted somewhat with common morality.

Yet Li Fan applied it without the slightest psychological burden.

“Heavenly Doctor…”

Li Fan’s gaze flickered as he gradually calmed his thoughts.

After confirming that the treatment was effective and that Hanhai would not be attacking the seal again soon, Li Fan began the work of repairing the restriction.

The restriction of the Hidden World, Concealed Void was exceedingly intricate.

Regarding the Dao of restrictions, Li Fan had only dabbled in it slightly during his previous reincarnations.

However, once one method is understood, all methods can be connected. Formations and restrictions share many similarities.

Moreover, the Heavenly Doctor’s teachings had been extraordinarily detailed.

The entire process passed without major errors.

After half a month, the loosened seal was finally reinforced once again.

The Cloudwater Heavenly Palace fell back into complete stillness.

“For them, perhaps eternal slumber is the best possible ending.”

Li Fan sighed softly in his heart, then placed a pot of wine at the foot of Qin Tang’s stone statue.

After that, his figure flew away quietly.

Outside the Cloudwater Heavenly Palace, the strange phenomena that had appeared in the sky earlier had vanished.

Peace had returned to the world.

For the time being, Li Fan could not think of a way to contact the Heavenly Doctor.

Thus, he merely cupped his hands toward the heavens and bowed respectfully, signifying that his mission had been completed.

Afterward, Li Fan deliberately slowed his pace, leisurely returning to the entrance of the Spiritwood Realm.

Just as he expected, midway through, the voice of the Heavenly Doctor once again echoed in his mind.

"Well done."

Clearly, the Heavenly Doctor had already sensed that the seal of Cloudwater Heavenly Palace had been reinforced.

"With your help, I have indeed saved myself some trouble. If I had gone myself..."

The Heavenly Doctor chuckled softly but then stopped speaking.

Before the Heavenly Doctor could continue, Li Fan took the initiative to report everything that had happened within Cloudwater Heavenly Palace in full detail.

After a long silence, Li Fan could not help but ask, "Venerable One, back then, what really..."

It seemed that Li Fan’s respectful address of "Venerable One" stirred something deep within the Heavenly Doctor’s memory.

Li Fan’s expression stiffened slightly.

"As for what happened back then... that is mine alone to bear. Knowing too much will bring you no benefit."

"You are still too weak now. When you reach the peak of Dao Integration, perhaps then you will be qualified to know."

The Heavenly Doctor, for once, gave a rare explanation.

Li Fan hesitated but in the end only nodded slightly.

"By the way, how is your study of the Mending Heaven Record? Are there any parts you find difficult to comprehend?"

After a brief pause, the Heavenly Doctor asked again, as if intending to personally resolve Li Fan’s doubts.

Li Fan naturally would not let go of such a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity. He immediately presented the questions that had puzzled him during his self-study.

The Heavenly Doctor answered each one patiently, one by one.

As expected of the Heavenly Doctor, his understanding of the Dao of Medicine had already reached the level of transcendent perfection.

Often, just a few words from him would cause Li Fan to suddenly see the truth as if dawn had broken in his mind.

Moreover, from the Heavenly Doctor’s brief remarks, new insights would emerge—ideas not even recorded within the Mending Heaven Record.

Li Fan absorbed the teachings like a starving man devouring a feast.

But as always, beautiful moments were fleeting.

Before long, it seemed the Heavenly Doctor encountered some matter and abruptly ended the lesson.

"You must have been hiding within a small world earlier. That’s why I spent quite some effort without finding you."

Li Fan’s heart tightened, and he was about to reply when he heard the Heavenly Doctor continue, "Hmm, a wise choice. Before your cultivation reaches true completion, it is indeed safer to remain within a small world." ꞦАΝỒᛒËŞ

"Continue your cultivation. Remember, techniques are secondary. What truly matters is your contemplation of the operation of Heaven’s Dao and the essence of the world."

"No matter how powerful a cultivation art is, it ultimately belongs to someone else. Only what truly suits you is the most perfect path."

Hearing this, Li Fan felt as though struck by lightning. His heart and soul trembled violently.

"The path that truly suits oneself..."

His eyes turned vacant as he fell into endless thought.

"A gentleman conceals his edge until the right moment. The current Xuanhuang Realm is not yet your true stage. Wait a bit longer... it will not be long now," the Heavenly Doctor said, his tone deep and filled with hidden meaning.

Then, a golden light descended from the heavens.

It flew with incredible speed, arriving before Li Fan in the blink of an eye.

Li Fan came back to his senses and looked carefully. Floating before him was a single golden needle.

"Hehe, back then there was a saying that under my needle, none would escape the cycle of reincarnation."

"If I can leave behind a few of these, perhaps I can preserve a spark of my legacy."

The Heavenly Doctor’s calm voice slowly faded away.

“This needle is gifted to you for self-defense. As long as the needle remains, the person will not perish.”

Li Fan’s expression revealed joy. “Thank you, Venerable One!”

However, the Heavenly Doctor no longer responded.

Without losing decorum, Li Fan continued to bow respectfully toward the heavens above.

Then, gazing at the golden needle before him, his expression became complicated.

Eventually, he reached out, attempting to touch it.

Unlike a physical needle that should have been cold, Li Fan instead felt a surge of warm energy flowing from his palm into his body.

In an instant, a protective shell formed, enveloping his entire divine soul.

Li Fan felt as though his very soul were immersed in a warm spring, gentle and comfortable.

A sense of safety that he had never experienced before rose within his heart.

“What a treasure!”

Only this thought surfaced in Li Fan’s mind before he hurriedly made his way toward the Spiritwood Realm.

Upon returning to the Spiritwood Realm, Li Fan keenly sensed that the concentration of spiritual energy had slightly increased.

It seemed that the Treefolk Clan’s “forest cultivation” project had already begun to bear fruit.

Without disturbing them, Li Fan went directly to the place where the Faceless Stone Statue stood.

When his divine sense once again connected with the statue, images of the Federation of All Worlds and the followers of the True Immortal of Salvation and Mortal Compassion appeared in his mind.

Only then did Li Fan let out a slight breath of relief.

His mind and soul were filled with a genuine sense of security.

Although he had preliminarily confirmed that, toward cultivators of the Heavenly Law Realm, the Heavenly Doctor was indeed “benevolent,” Li Fan did not lower his guard.

He remained vigilant against the Heavenly Doctor’s ability to read minds.

Even if it was not a face-to-face encounter, even if it was merely a single golden needle, he remained cautious.

Having already suffered a great loss once before because of the Heavenly Doctor’s unseen perception, how could Li Fan now accept this needle without reservation before ruling out the possibility that it could sense his thoughts?

At the moment, the only card in Li Fan’s hand that could possibly counterbalance the Heavenly Doctor was the Faceless Stone Statue.

The true power of that Faceless True Immortal clearly surpassed even that of the Heavenly Doctor.

Under the interference of its statue, it should be enough to block the Heavenly Doctor’s perception.

Even though he knew this was, in a sense, a desperate act, Li Fan still chose to proceed.

After all, aside from the Xuantian King, no one had ever truly seen the Faceless True Immortal.

But the Heavenly Doctor was a tangible, existing opponent in the present.

“Although there are risks, without a doubt, the gains are tremendous.”

“Setting aside this golden needle, just the Heavenly Doctor’s guidance alone is worth ten years of cultivation.”

“Moreover, there was his final reminder.”

“The operation of Heavenly Dao, the essence of the world...”

“And the cultivation method truly suited for myself...”

Li Fan narrowed his eyes slightly, as a preliminary concept began to form in his heart.

However, he temporarily set those thoughts aside and turned his attention to studying the golden needle bestowed by the Heavenly Doctor.

Although it had been granted by another, within Li Fan’s body it felt as if it had always belonged to him.

Without any refining process, he could control it freely by will alone.

Such a method was something Li Fan had never even heard of.

With a mere thought, the golden needle appeared once again before him.

“It is not forged from any metallic substance...”

After repeatedly observing it with his divine sense, Li Fan first reached this conclusion.

“And furthermore...”

By comparing the recorded image stored within the Dao Deviation Stone with the golden needle before him, Li Fan made a new discovery.

“It seems that after coming into contact with my divine soul, it has undergone a unique transformation.”

Just like prescribing the right medicine for an illness, the golden needle gifted by the Heavenly Doctor changed form the moment it came into contact with Li Fan’s divine soul.

According to the shape of his soul, the needle’s energy formed a tight, enclosing layer of protection around it.

“No wonder it can be controlled without refinement. It feels as if it were custom-made for me, a treasure perfectly attuned to my divine soul.”

“Moreover...”

Li Fan narrowed his eyes and mobilized his soul power, striking outward from within against the golden needle’s protective barrier.

At the instant his divine soul impacted the layer, he felt the force being gently deflected, spreading outward like ripples across a pond.

The impact energy was evenly dispersed and easily neutralized.

If the inner protection was already this resilient, the strength of its outer layer could easily be imagined.

After a series of experiments, Li Fan concluded with just four words: “As solid as iron walls.”

“The needle remains unbroken, and the man survives...”

“What the Heavenly Doctor said was not exaggerated. As long as the soul remains intact, with his power, recreating a physical body would be a trivial matter.”

“To destroy the soul, one must first break through the golden needle’s protective layer.”

“In fact...”

A scene suddenly flashed through Li Fan’s mind.

At the instant of a fatal blow, just before the needle shattered, a golden light would soar into the sky, carrying his divine soul back to the Heavenly Doctor’s hand.

Li Fan was certain that the Heavenly Physician still retained partial control over the golden needle he had gifted.

Although this was done out of concern for “the only current successor of the Heavenly Law Realm,” it was not necessarily a good thing for Li Fan.

How could one rest easy while another holds power at one’s bedside?

With Li Fan’s temperament, it was impossible for him to allow something he could not fully control to wrap around his divine soul.

If his soul were ever frozen, preventing him from returning to his true self, that would truly be eternal damnation!

“Is there any way to enjoy the needle’s protection while ensuring absolute safety...”

Before the Faceless Stone Statue, Li Fan began to ponder.

At present, the trump cards he possessed that could restrain the Heavenly Doctor’s power were few in number—and all of them were uncontrollable variables. ɌâNó𝐛Ë𝙨

For instance, the Chaos, Hunger, and the Gray Mold.

A single misstep would lead to the destruction of the Xuanhuang World and mutual annihilation.

After much thought, Li Fan’s gaze finally settled on the golden vow power generated by the Faceless Stone Statue.

Previously, he had stored all the golden vow-power within the calamity body inside his dantian. Whenever the capacity neared its limit, the vow-power would automatically compress itself without Li Fan’s interference.

As a result, although the accumulated vow-power over this period had become incredibly vast, it still could not completely fill even a single Calamity body.

That Calamity body, shaped like Li Fan himself, now gleamed with sacred golden light.

The golden vow-power was a force that transcended the current level of energy Li Fan could comprehend. He had not yet found a proper method to utilize it.

All he could do was guide it slightly.

“Vow power... vow-power...”

“If I follow the will of my heart and urge it forward, could I perhaps draw upon its strength?”

With that sudden thought, Li Fan began his experiment.

The result was self-evident. It was as if they were two completely different species. The golden vow-power showed no response at all to Li Fan’s summons.

After several failed attempts, Li Fan had no choice but to change his approach.

He created another Calamity body and slowly guided the golden vow-power into it. At the same time, he urged the Calamity body to transform into a long rope-like form, resembling a conduit carrying the gradually flowing golden wish power.

This conduit coiled around the golden needle defense that enveloped Li Fan’s divine soul, slowly weaving it into an external layer of protection.

Throughout the process, Li Fan was exceedingly cautious.

Neither the Heavenly Doctor’s Golden Needle nor the Golden Vow-power were forces he could currently control.

He could only guide them, making them restrain each other. Only then did he feel somewhat at ease.

Indeed, doing this outside of his divine soul was extremely dangerous.

Even the slightest mistake could result in the annihilation of his divine soul.

But with the existence of [Truth] as his backup, Li Fan felt he had the qualification to take such a bold risk.

“If something truly goes wrong, the two forces will first notice each other as immense presences and instinctively ignore me, a mere ant. Such is their nature.”

“In fact, this is safer than facing either one of them alone.”

“This is what is called the Way of Balance.”

Li Fan looked at the Calamity body filled with golden vow-power, now appearing as golden cords intertwined with the golden needle protection, and nodded in satisfaction.

If the Heavenly Doctor’s Golden Needle were to erupt, it would certainly trigger the golden vow-power first.

And vice versa.

If Li Fan suffered a fatal blow from an external enemy, that attacker would face a dual counterattack from both the golden needle and the golden wish power.

To use a crude analogy, Li Fan was now like a man with two linked bombs tied to his body.

Any act capable of harming him could detonate the bombs entirely.

Li Fan believed that even a Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign would not come out unscathed if struck by both powers simultaneously.

In fact, at a critical moment, Li Fan could even trigger the explosions himself to achieve unexpected results.

“Leverage the situation and control the flow. This is the essence of my nature…”

When the two forces finally reached equilibrium, Li Fan quietly admired his creation, feeling a brief surge of pride.

However, he quickly sobered up.

“This is merely a temporary expedient born of necessity. If I can fully understand the Heavenly Doctor’s Golden Needle and form my own divine soul defense…”

“If the Heavenly Doctor could achieve this, then there is no reason I cannot.”

Li Fan carefully sensed the energy attributes of the golden needle surrounding his divine soul, secretly contemplating while cross-referencing the contents of The Heavenly Doctor Immortal Scripture and The Mending Heaven Record.

Time passed without him noticing.

Eventually, Li Fan was startled by a sudden image in his mind.

It was news from the followers of the True Immortal of Salvation and Mortal Compassion. The task he had assigned them, to find someone capable of reconstructing a cultivator’s former appearance from their skull—had finally yielded results.

Originally, Li Fan had thought it would be a simple matter. However, within the vast Xuanhuang Realm, apart from him, no one else had any such need.

Since the skill had no practical value, naturally no cultivator had ever studied it.

Only after Li Fan issued a bounty mission with sufficient rewards did some cultivators begin to attempt it.

“Tongyan Prefecture, Luo Suzhen.”

After grasping the name and information of the target cultivator, Li Fan thought for a while and decided to go personally.

The matter was of great importance to [Truth], and he could not take it lightly.

His figure flashed and vanished like a ghost.

Before long, Li Fan arrived at Luo Suzhen’s cave residence.

Like the eccentric cultivators Yin Shangren and Ximen Yu, Luo Suzhen also disliked living among others.

In a remote mountain within Tongyan Prefecture, Li Fan spent considerable effort before finally locating this place.

Even from outside the cave abode, he could faintly sense waves of sinister energy emanating from within.

There were also countless whispering sounds, softly rustling and echoing around his ears, like the wails of resentful spirits from ancient tales.

However, Li Fan knew clearly that within the Xuanhuang Realm, there were no so-called ghost cultivators.

After a cultivator’s fall, in most cases, their essence would return directly to the Dao.

Only under very rare circumstances could a trace of remnant soul remain.

Even retaining complete memories and clear consciousness from one’s lifetime was already difficult, let alone cultivating again in the form of a remnant soul.

Of course, those strange beings of the Cloudwater Heavenly Palace were exceptions, not within the realm of ordinary discussion.

Li Fan let out a cold snort, and instantly, the murmuring voices vanished without a trace.

Each was arranged in a lifelike position, giving the eerie illusion that they were still alive.

A dwarf cultivator, barely reaching Li Fan’s knee, was solemnly conversing with one of the skeletons.

“Third Brother, do not worry. I know you are dissatisfied with the new wife I found for you.”

“It’s alright, I’ve already chosen another for you. Also, persuade Fourth Brother. It was already shameful that he couldn’t find a Dao companion while alive. Does he plan to remain alone for eternity, even after death…”

He muttered on and on with a serious expression, as if the skeleton before him were truly alive.

Li Fan watched expressionlessly. He gave a light cough, pulling the dwarf cultivator back to his senses.

“Eh? Who are you?” The dwarf cultivator tilted his head up, squinting as if trying to discern Li Fan’s face.

But Li Fan had long since changed his appearance and concealed his aura, making it impossible for the dwarf to see through.

“You are the cultivator capable of reconstructing the living appearance of the deceased from their skulls?” Li Fan stated his purpose directly.

The dwarf cultivator blinked, then nodded repeatedly. “Yes, yes, that’s me.”

Rubbing his hands together, he continued, “I’ve been waiting for you for quite some time. I heard that as long as the reconstruction task is completed, the minimum reward is ten thousand contribution points?” ṛα₦ȱＢËꞩ

Li Fan smiled faintly and nodded. “Rest assured, you will be fully compensated.”

“But, are you truly confident?” Li Fan looked down at him, his tone deepening.

The invisible pressure emanating from Li Fan made the dwarf shudder involuntarily.

Soon, however, he slapped his chest with a loud pa pa pa, vowing earnestly, “I, Luo Suzhen, have dealt with the dead since childhood. In my eyes, they are not piles of bones, but living, breathing people! If even I cannot do it, then no one in this world can!”

Only then did Li Fan speak slowly. “Then let us begin.”

He set up a formation around the area, sealing off the entire cave abode.

Then, in midair, Li Fan projected the image of a skull—the very same one displayed at the center of the Divine Treasure Museum.

At first, Luo Suzhen seemed distracted, occasionally glancing at the skeletons scattered throughout his abode.

But as the skull gradually took shape, his attention was drawn entirely to it.

When the projection finally solidified, Luo Suzhen was completely entranced, stepping closer unconsciously, his expression filled with awe.

“So perfect…”

“How could there be such a flawless cranial structure in this world?” he murmured to himself.

“Perfect?” Li Fan frowned slightly.

Thinking Li Fan was doubting him, Luo Suzhen quickly became animated, gesturing excitedly.

“Isn’t it perfect? Look at the frontal bone, the parietal bone, and the occipital bone… marvelous! Their proportions and combinations fit together with absolute precision. It’s simply, simply…”

After holding his breath for a long while, he finally exclaimed eight words, “Naturally formed, flawless and divine.”

Li Fan narrowed his eyes slowly.

Without waiting for Li Fan’s urging, Luo Suzhen impatiently began to restore the skull’s appearance from before its death.

His method was rather strange. It was not through any secret art or mystical technique.

Instead, he nervously attempted to communicate directly with the skull.

Of course, it was only a projection and could not possibly respond to Luo Suzhen.

Yet Luo Suzhen seemed to truly receive some kind of reply, his expression growing more and more excited.

While Li Fan was still doubtful of this, he suddenly saw Luo Suzhen waving his right hand through the air, beginning to sketch the face that the skull once possessed.

So Li Fan patiently waited once more.

As the appearance gradually took shape, Li Fan’s expression grew increasingly solemn.

When the image finally appeared completely before him...

He struggled to control his facial expression, trying to hide the shock surging in his heart.

He stared at the image floating in the air for a long while.

In a low and heavy voice, Li Fan asked, “You... are certain you made no mistake?”

Even though he knew the question was meaningless, he still asked it.

As expected, Luo Suzhen reacted with strong emotion. “A mistake? You dare question my—”
