Before he could finish, Li Fan took a deep breath, his wide sleeve flicking out. He immediately swept Luo Suzhen together with everything inside the cave mansion into his Five Elements Cave Heaven, suppressing it all.

Then he erased every trace left behind.

“How could it be him?”

Hovering in the air for a long time, Li Fan still could not comprehend.

He could not face this truth.

“The first cultivator to be infected by the Immortal-Mortal Miasma. The first cultivator to be infected by the Immortal-Mortal Miasma...”

Li Fan muttered for a long while, then his figure flashed away, heading toward the Congyun Sea.

His destination, naturally, was where Daoist Yin was also conducting research on the Immortal-Mortal Miasma.

According to Li Fan’s spiritual sense, Daoist Yin had yet to reach a final conclusion in his research.

But Daoist Yin seemed to have sensed something, becoming hesitant and uneasy.

The frequency of his experiments had clearly slowed down.

It even seemed... as if he no longer wished to conduct the final verification.

With his speed pushed to the limit, Li Fan quickly arrived before Daoist Yin.

Daoist Yin was startled by Li Fan’s sudden appearance.

Just as he was about to speak, Li Fan raised his hand slightly to stop him.

“Daoist Yin, regarding the first cultivator who was infected by the Immortal-Mortal Miasma...”

“I have made a shocking discovery.”

Daoist Yin’s whole body trembled, his face filled with disbelief as he stared at Li Fan.

“This result is too inconceivable. It defies all reason. You must have had some premonition already, right?”

Daoist Yin was silent for a long while before nodding bitterly.

Li Fan took a deep breath and said in a deep voice, “Then, please begin the final verification.”

“I would also like you to help me confirm this.”

Daoist Yin stood still for a long time, then sighed dejectedly. Finally, he led Li Fan to the testing chamber.

Through the transparent outer wall, Li Fan could faintly see the white rib bone that Daoist Yin had been keeping.

Thick white miasma continuously sprayed from the surroundings, filling the entire space.

Daoist Yin formed hand seals repeatedly, his expression changing constantly.

Under his control, the mist slowly thinned.

Gradually, it seemed that something invisible within the air was being drawn into the white rib bone.

When the transparent chamber was finally cleared of mist, Daoist Yin’s face turned deathly pale as he fell to the ground.

“So it really is so. It really is so.”

He murmured weakly to himself.

Li Fan slowly spoke the final conclusion.

“The first cultivator infected by the Immortal-Mortal Miasma... was the very person who created it.”

"The first cultivator infected by the Immortal-Mortal Miasma was also the very person who created it."

...

Li Fan's voice echoed calmly.

Master Yin did not argue. He gripped his hair hard, as if the fact caused him great pain.

"How is that possible, how is that possible..." He kept muttering, bewildered and sorrowful.

After a long silence, Li Fan continued slowly, "The Immortal-Mortal Miasma was formed against the principle of heaven and earth."

"Whoever could create the Immortal-Mortal Miasma..."

"Could only be the Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign. In other words, what stands before us is the remaining bone of a newly established Longevity Immortal."

"The moment the Immortal-Mortal Miasma was born within him, under the rules set by the new method of the Immortal Ancestor, he thereby attained the Longevity Immortal realm. But at the same time..."

"Ordinary men can slay immortals. The power of the Immortal-Mortal Miasma is known to everyone in the Xuanhuang Realm. But I believe that if that Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign wanted to preserve his life, he could have done so. Yet he did not."

"If he had preserved himself, that would mean he would have again broken the rule he created. Although it would not necessarily lead to the failure of the counter-principle..."

Li Fan paused, as if thinking and deducing.

After a moment he spoke with force, "It very likely left a loophole. The Longevity Heavenly Sovereign could ignore the power of the Immortal-Mortal Miasma."

"To prevent that from happening, he let the Immortal-Mortal Miasma consume him. It is equivalent to burying himself with his own hands."

"What resulted was only this: Xuanhuang cultivators, regardless of their cultivation level, from Foundation Establishment up to Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign, all cannot escape the effect of the Immortal-Mortal Miasma."

Li Fan's expression was solemn. "But..."

"What significance does this have?"

"In merely a few thousand years, the Immortal-Mortal Miasma has become virtually extinct. With careful handling, cultivators can still slaughter mortals at will."

"Then why did this Longevity Heavenly Sovereign, for what purpose, sacrifice his life to create the Immortal-Mortal Miasma?"

Deep doubt showed on Li Fan's face.

This was not an act. It was genuine.

Master Yin was silent.

He waved his hand lightly, and the transparent wall in front of him vanished. He carefully picked up the white rib bone on the ground as if it were a rare treasure, and gently stroked it. Ꞧа𐌽ȪBĚ𝙨

"When I first saw this rib bone, the image of its owner in life seemed to appear before my eyes."

"What a perfectly handsome face it was. Even all the most flowery words in the world could not describe even a fraction of it."

"Yet such a perfect person died because he was infected by the Immortal-Mortal Miasma. At that time, I secretly vowed to find the culprit who created the Immortal-Mortal Miasma and caused this perfect person to fall, and then..."

Master Yin gave a bitter laugh. "I never imagined that after all these years of searching, the supposed killer had been right in front of me."

"And I did not know, I did not know at all."

Struck to the core, Master Yin coughed up a great deal of blood.

After wiping it away, he gripped the rib bone tightly, veins bulging in his hand.

Watching this, Li Fan suddenly recalled the first time he saw Master Yin.

He had been the same then, in shabby clothes.

He muttered constantly, "I will find you, I will find you..."

Now he had finally found the so-called killer.

But this result was not something he could easily accept.

To have pursued most of his life, and to find that the killer was the victim himself.

What an irony.

"No wonder each time, shortly after he discovered the truth, he would set himself on fire and die." Li Fan thought silently.

Li Fan also suddenly remembered that in a previous life Su Changyu had come to Yin Yin Island by chance and been taught the "Foundation Establishment Through Oneself."

Master Yin had acted as he did because Su Changyu tried to save the mortals on the island.

At that time, Master Yin had asked, "Why? Why would you, a cultivator, go to save those mortals?"

Now it seems he was not merely questioning Su Changyu.

He was bewildered by the actions of the Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign who created the Immortal-Mortal Miasma.

Not only Master Yin, Li Fan also could not understand such behavior.

Even if one concedes that someone in the world was noble enough to sacrifice his life to protect mortals...

At least the sacrifice must be effective for it to be meaningful.

From the current state of the Xuanhuang Realm, the mortals are only slightly better off. They are still slaughtered by cultivators at will and cannot protect themselves.

Just like the past cases of Kou Hong and Dao Xuanzhi.

Foundation Establishment cultivators can easily flatten a mortal city.

Compared with the time before the Immortal-Mortal Miasma was born, nothing seems to have changed.

If all he wanted was this...

Then it is not noble, it is foolish.

Li Fan believed that a cultivator who could go against the principle of heaven and earth could never be so simple-minded.

So what was his true purpose?

As Li Fan pondered, Master Yin staggered to his feet, placed the white rib bone against his chest, and carefully put it away.

Li Fan still voiced his question.

Master Yin smiled miserably, "You still do not understand? He did it not only for the mortals of the world, but also for the cultivators of the world."

"The cultivators of the world?" Li Fan's body trembled, as if he had realized something.

"After the Immortal Ancestor set the new method that reverses the principle of heaven and earth, all cultivators must practice according to the new method. In theory, from now on, no matter how brilliant or talented a cultivator may be, they can never escape the framework established by the Immortal Ancestor's method."

"They are destined to be forever suppressed by the Immortal Ancestor's rule. From a certain perspective, for Xuanhuang cultivators, the Immortal Ancestor method is invincible." Master Yin seemed a little unwell as he spoke in fits and starts.

A scene suddenly appeared in Li Fan's mind.

A white-robed figure sighed to the sky, "Before us, The path to immortality lies ahead, yet it cannot be trodden. for the Dharma-Transmitting Immortal Ancestor stands above."

"But he, at the cost of his life, created a possibility for Xuanhuang cultivators. A possibility that could threaten the Immortal Ancestor's method." Master Yin was stunned for a moment and then continued.

"Both are Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereigns, although his strength and combat power might be far weaker in combat power than the Immortal Ancestor, their realm is actually the same. Since the Immortal-Mortal Miasma could cause fatal harm to him, by the same logic..."

"The Immortal-Mortal Miasma can also severely injure or even kill the Immortal Ancestor." Master Yin's voice rose oddly, with a hint of excitement.

"Since the Great Catastrophe, the Immortal Ancestor has almost disappeared from the world. Even after reestablishing the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, he rarely appeared. Who can say there were not factors like this? Because he too feared it. Ha ha!"

Master Yin's demeanor became gradually deranged.

"He not only found a method for the cultivators of the world to kill the Immortal Ancestor, he also pointed the way to thoroughly destroy the Immortal Ancestor's order. After all, relying solely on the Immortal-Mortal Miasma to kill the Immortal Ancestor..."

"Although possible, the probability of success is extremely low."

"But the method he indicated to shatter the Immortal Ancestor order is absolutely workable." Master Yin, shaken by emotion, spat out another mouthful of blood.

"If the Immortal-Mortal Miasma can become a weak point of the Immortal Ancestor method, then why not create more weak points? As long as there are those who can attain the Longevity Immortal realm and are willing to sacrifice themselves..."

"The cracks in the Immortal Ancestor method will multiply. One day, it will be full of holes and collapse at a single poke."

Master Yin’s eyes widened in shock.

“As long as there is someone like him, willing to sacrifice themselves…”

Li Fan fell silent.

For all beings in the world to reach such enlightenment…

That was asking for the impossible.

One side offered eternal life and carefree freedom, while the other meant wagering one’s own existence for a vague, uncertain future.

Anyone sane would know which to choose.

But he was not like ordinary people.

Master Yin gave a bitter laugh. “In all the thousands of years of the Xuanhuang Realm, not a single cultivator besides him has ever done such a thing.”

“Damn it all! They all deserve to die!”

Li Fan tried to console him. “Fellow Daoist Yin, do not be so extreme.”

But Master Yin ignored him completely. His gaze toward Li Fan grew increasingly hostile. “What do you know?”

He pulled a pale white rib bone from his robes, eyes full of disdain. “I know that all cultivators in the world are afraid of death. How many of them only began cultivating in the first place because they feared dying?”

“But how can their lives even compare to his?”

“He… he…”

A faint line of blood seeped from Master Yin’s eyes. “He was the original Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign!”

The words struck Li Fan’s soul like thunder.

Even with his usual composure, he could not help blurting out, “What? He was the original a Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign? What do you mean by that?”

Li Fan quickly pressed on.

“What do I mean? Just what the words say. Before the ancient methods perished, he was the final cultivator to attain true Longevity through the power of heaven and earth itself—a True Ancient [Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign]!” Master Yin said slowly, word by word.

“Only the bone of an Ancient Heavenly Sovereign could carry such divine creation.”

As he spoke, Master Yin caressed the rib bone with an almost reverent obsession.

Then, suddenly, his expression shifted to one of cold darkness. He stared intently at Li Fan.

After a tense moment, Master Yin raised his head toward the heavens, his eyes filled with confusion and disbelief.

He murmured to himself, “Besides, he was not like those petty thieves. His longevity was something this world itself bestowed upon him.”

“He could have simply left this place behind…”

Li Fan did not interrupt him. He silently recorded every word that Master Yin muttered.

“Ancient-method longevity immortal… and not just ordinary Longevity either.”

“No wonder he was invincible, whether in the Beast-Taming Sect or the Heavenly Sword Sect.”

“But then… how exactly did he become an immortal of longevity?”

“Could it be that, back then, when he ascended in a single step, he did not merely ascended from mortal to Soul Transformation…”

“But transformed directly from mortal into Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign?”

Li Fan found the thought absurd.

Such progress was unprecedented in all history.

“If that were true, it would be too outrageous.”

“Even if heaven itself favored him, it could not have gone that far.”

“He was not merely heaven’s favored child—it was as though heaven treated him like its own father.”

“Could it be… that in a previous life, he saved the Xuanhuang Realm itself?”

As this thought formed, a strange notion surfaced in Li Fan’s mind.

He froze slightly.

“No… could it be possible?”

He quickly organized his thoughts, yet the suspicion in his heart only grew stronger.

Both were perfect beings.

Both bore concern for all living things in the Xuanhuang Realm.

The Xuantian King had mysteriously vanished.

Years later, another mortal appeared in the world.

He was favored by the Heavenly Dao itself, receiving absurd levels of grace and protection.

Piece by piece, it all connected—forming an answer.

Li Fan could not help but think, “Could it be…”

“Mr. Bai is the reincarnation of the Xuantian King?”

Indeed, the reconstructed skull he had seen bore an identical resemblance to Mr. Bai.

And the reason the world believed the first cultivator infected by the Immortal-Mortal Miasma bore the surname Su…

Was because…

Li Fan recalled what he had witnessed long ago within the Fallen Immortal Realm.

“Doggy was nothing but a defective creation cast aside. If not for Little Bai…”

The yellow-haired Lu Ya had been explaining this to Li Fan before being kicked sharply from behind.

He dusted himself off awkwardly.

Lu Ya hastily corrected himself. “If not for Mr. Bai personally healing him, Doggy would have died long ago.”

Indeed, the title Mr. Bai came from the orphans of Ningyuan City. Upon hearing others call him “Little Bai,” they respectfully changed it to “Mr. Bai.”

Perhaps even they did not know his true name.

And given Mr. Bai’s temperament, even if he realized their misunderstanding, he likely would not have corrected them.

As long as the children were happy.

After all, Mr. Bai was a pleasant name.

“Su Bai…”

“So that was his name.”

“With the ancient path of Longevity Immortal, he defied the very laws of heaven and attained Longevity Immortality anew.”

“I once believed no one in existence could achieve such a thing. I never imagined…”

Li Fan recalled a past conversation between Sun Qi and Sun Liancheng.

“The more one is favored by heaven and earth, the harder it is to defy their laws.”

“The backlash will be that much stronger.”

“To defy the heavens under such circumstances…”

Li Fan fell into deeper silence.

His thoughts churned endlessly until an odd sensation snapped him back to the present.

A strange energy began to surge from Master Yin’s body.

Li Fan could tell something was very wrong—Master Yin seemed on the verge of losing control.

Yet within that frenzy, he also appeared to glimpse countless secrets of the world, as if unraveling the past and future of the rib bone’s original owner.

“Why? Why?”

Master Yin clutched his head in agony. A vertical line appeared at the center of his body, slowly beginning to split.

Li Fan cautiously stepped back.

Master Yin rolled on the ground, writhing in pain. From beneath Yin Island, where countless of his corpses were stored, came a series of explosions.

The earth trembled with faint rumbling sounds.

After an unknown length of time, Master Yin suddenly leapt up, his face glowing with wild excitement.

“I understand now!”

The originally dim and broken look in Master Yin’s eyes suddenly turned into one of hope.

As if struck by revelation, he said, “I understand now!”

“The only dual Heavenly Sovereign of the Xuanhuang Realm, both ancient and new, a person of such supreme goodness and beauty…”

“He must also be a being of unmatched intelligence!”

Master Yin’s voice grew louder and louder. “So that’s how it is, so that’s how it is…”

“In those years, when he defied the laws of heaven and suffered the destruction caused by the Immortal-Mortal Miasma, he did not die instantly. His strength merely declined gradually.”

“That period of time would have been enough for him to set up countless contingencies! All the mysteries, all the confusion… perhaps the answers can be found within those very arrangements!”

“Yes, that must be it!”

Hearing this, Li Fan’s heart stirred. “Mr. Bai’s contingencies?”

The Fallen Immortal Realm must ultimately conceal the true goal that Mr. Bai wanted to convey.

Perhaps…

Li Fan remembered his 115th reincarnation, when Mr. Bai’s traces left in heaven and earth had been enough to grant him a limited resurrection.

Who could say that the real “Su Bai” might not have, through some means, truly been reborn thousands of years later?

…

As Li Fan pondered this, Master Yin in front of him became increasingly deranged.

“Yes! He is still waiting for me! I must go find him!”

The crack running through the center of his body—formed through cultivation of the Oneself as the Foundation Method—was becoming more and more visible.

Within Master Yin’s body, another figure seemed to stir restlessly, as though trying to crawl its way out.

In Li Fan’s ears, faint sounds of falling rain began to echo.

At first, it was subtle, like an illusion.

But soon, the rain grew heavier, turning into a torrential downpour flooding the land.

Within this phantasmal storm, even the stone floor of the laboratory softened and turned to mud.

Li Fan’s expression remained calm, but his body floated into the air, quietly retreating a few steps—just beyond the range of the mud.

From the soft, oozing ground, countless pale arms began to writhe and stretch out. Li Fan’s pupils shrank sharply.

Master Yin’s body began to spasm uncontrollably.

His voice grew broken and indistinct.

Moments later, the countless pale arms surged toward him like fish swimming through water.

The instant they touched his flesh, they forcibly pierced into it.

At the point of contact, the arms dissolved—and then burrowed deep into his body.

A faint pop, like a bursting bubble, sounded clearly.

Then, thousands more pale arms rushed toward him in a frenzy.

In an instant, Master Yin’s entire body seemed to boil violently, churning in grotesque waves.

Even the surrounding space began to twist and distort.

Watching the horrifying sight, Li Fan’s expression turned grim.

He had seen much and fought beings on par with Dao Integration experts, yet he had never encountered anything like this. Not once in all his cycles of reincarnation had he even heard of such a phenomenon. ꞦÂ₦O͍BЁꞩ

Li Fan closed his eyes. The nightmarish visions before him vanished instantly.

Everything became calm and still, as if nothing existed.

Even the sounds in his ears faded into complete silence.

His divine sense could perceive nothing at all.

When he opened his eyes again, the terrifying scene returned.

The “water” boiled even more violently, yet Master Yin, at the center of it all, now wore a serene expression.

Like a monk attaining enlightenment, the pain and confusion left his face completely.

Amid the surreal vision, only one thing remained unchanged—the rib belonging to Mr. Bai, hidden at Master Yin’s chest.

It stood out starkly, like a cord tethering him firmly to the real world as his form grew more and more ethereal.

Master Yin gazed at the rib reluctantly, then his expression hardened with resolve.

He flung it toward Li Fan.

As Li Fan caught it, the sound of the rain suddenly intensified, as if reaching a critical point—then everything fell silent.

In the absolute stillness, a blinding light erupted from Master Yin’s body.

That light tore open space itself like a blade.

Li Fan narrowed his eyes, trying to see what lay within the radiance.

But no matter how hard he tried, he could only discern that, besides Master Yin, there were many other figures within—floating in the air, shapeless, of varying sizes.

They all seemed to be staring at Master Yin, urging him toward something.

The light grew unbearably bright, engulfing Li Fan’s vision completely.

When the glow faded, Master Yin had vanished.

Li Fan stood in silence for a while before making his way to the underground chamber of Yin Island. He found that all the corpses once placed there had disappeared as well.

In this lifetime, Master Yin had not chosen to self-immolate.

Because of Li Fan’s few words, his attention had been diverted, steering him away from self-destruction.

Instead, he had…

“Chosen to return?”

The scene within the white light brought this phrase to Li Fan’s mind.

“Return my rain…”

There was something profoundly strange about Master Yin. Li Fan had once investigated the records of that incident when countless corpses rained from the heavens.

But aside from Master Yin’s case, not a single other clue existed.

“It is not an anomaly, yet every part of it feels wrong.”

“Even as a Foundation Establishment cultivator, he was nearly impossible for me to kill without using the ‘Chaos’ character technique.”

Li Fan recalled the scenes of his encounters with that person, his brows tightly furrowed.

“Could it be…”

A sudden thought arose in his heart.

In the Mending Heaven Record, there was a detailed explanation of the mechanisms by which the Heavenly Dao of a world operates.

It stated that just as cultivators could absorb spiritual energy to cultivate and advance their realms, the world itself could also devour and assimilate other worlds to strengthen and elevate its own existence.

The Heavenly Doctor called this the world’s “Feeding.”

Yet just as humans leave behind food residue after eating, a world too leaves behind undigested remnants after its “Feeding.”

These remnants could be incompatible laws from other worlds or foreign essences rejected by nature as harmful to the world’s growth.

These “specters” of old worlds could not merge with the new one.

They could only exist eternally within the cracks between worlds.

These “specters” were different from the “aberrations.”

Aberrations were born from the merging of worlds. Strictly speaking, they still belonged to the native world.

Though they might seem out of tune with the world’s laws, they were in fact gradually assimilating over time.

Given enough ages, perhaps even aberrations could completely merge with the native world.

But “specters”…

They were entities utterly rejected by Heaven and Earth.

Even if the world were destroyed and time reached its end, it would never reclaim them.

Linking this to the ghostly figures he had just witnessed, Li Fan thought to himself, “Could those have been the collective specters of worlds that the Xuanhuang Realm devoured during its conquests?”

“The specters of old worlds do not wish to remain trapped forever in the rifts between realms. They too long for a chance to rise again.”

“But as the defeated, they can only resort to secret, subtle schemes. Perhaps Master Yin was chosen by these specters through some ancient accident.”

“No wonder ordinary means cannot kill him, yet the rune of Chaos can destroy him…”

“Because it itself is like a fragment of a shattered world’s law.”

Li Fan continued analyzing based on the Mending Heaven Record.

“For some reason, Master Yin still retained the mark of the Xuanhuang Realm. His transformation was incomplete. He existed half as man, half as specter. But just now, he has fully embraced the realm of the specters.”

“As a being on the same level as the Heavenly Dao of Xuanhuang, it is natural that he could glimpse certain cosmic secrets.”

Given how deranged Master Yin had become, Li Fan found none of his actions strange anymore.

Even his obsession with Mr. Bai might have been influenced by those world specters.

“Hmph. Just a bunch of petty vermin. Not worth worrying about.”

Li Fan gave a cold snort, not taking them seriously.

It was not arrogance. The truth was that these specters could only pose a true threat to the Xuanhuang Realm when it was already gravely wounded, teetering on destruction.

Only when the realm was at its weakest could the specters even have the slightest chance to seize control.

But even then, if they somehow succeeded in reclaiming the Xuanhuang Realm, their end would still be ruin.

In essence, these specters were like a virus that only erupts when the body is at the brink of death.

By the time they emerge, everything is already beyond salvation.

“It is a pity about Master Yin, though. His comprehension surpassed even mine. I had hoped he could help me deduce the method for the Primordial Golden Core.”

Li Fan shook his head slightly.

He looked at the island before him. With a flicker in his eyes, all the monsters Master Yin had cultivated there were instantly annihilated.

However, the treasures stored in the underground chamber were collected and preserved within his Five Elements Cave Heaven.

The only surviving creature on the island, aside from Li Fan himself, was a strange little dog—its limbs were human hands and its belly was covered in wandering eyes.

Sensing Li Fan’s killing intent, the creature immediately scurried over, tongue lolling, trying its best to please him.

Li Fan smiled faintly and spared its life, sealing it into the Five Elements Cave Heaven as well.

Leaving Yin Yin Island, Li Fan pondered his gains on the journey back.

“As the only Heavenly Sovereign in the Xuanhuang Realm to have mastered both the Ancient and the New Paths, Mr. Bai’s strength is beyond question.”

“He may even be the reincarnation of the ancient King Xuantian himself…”

“No wonder Emperor Sanmo placed his remains at the very center of the Divine Treasure Museum. And no wonder the Eternal Will lingering in his skull exerts such powerful allure upon [Truth].”

“Eternal Will… it must contain the obsessions he held in life. But what was it? What was Mr. Bai’s obsession?”

“It couldn’t have been… saving the Xuanhuang Realm, could it?”

Li Fan could not help but think so.

Now that he knew the true value of the skull, he was already devising a way to obtain it.

“The Eternal Will cannot be carried into [Truth]. It can only be absorbed on the spot.”

“But fortunately, I do not need to take Mr. Bai’s skull itself. My goal is merely the Eternal Will attached to it.”

“As long as I get close enough for [Truth] to absorb it, that will suffice.”

“Of course, the whole process must be done without alerting Emperor Sanmo…”

“Best to find an excuse to draw him away from the Divine Treasure Museum.”

After much thought, his mind returned to the idea of working with Mo Rubin.

“Surely Emperor Sanmo must give at least some respect to a Dharma-Transmitter.”

Li Fan extended his senses. The number of cultivators practicing the Divine Descent Body had reached an astonishing level.

They had already become a major headache for the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

Mo Rubin must have learned of this by now.

Through the experiences of his believers, Li Fan sensed that several distinct factions were active within the Alliance’s investigation teams.

“It seems the time has come to make contact.”

Li Fan’s eyes narrowed. Through the divine demons and gods thought, he sent out waves of influence to guide the minds of his followers.

Returning to the Spiritwood Realm, Li Fan waited quietly for developments.

While he waited, he once again took out the Mending Heaven Record to study.

“The Mending Heaven Record truly is vast and profound.”

“In the past, I would never have been able to uncover Master Yin’s origins. Few in the entire Xuanhuang Realm could even know of the existence of world specters.”

“This is the importance of having a true teacher.”

Revisiting the Mending Heaven Record, new insights once again surfaced in Li Fan’s heart.

Truly, each reading brings new understanding.

Li Fan was deeply immersed in the study of the Record of Mending Heaven, completely absorbed and unable to pull himself away.

He did not know how long had passed when a faint tremor shook the entire Spiritwood Realm, startling him awake.

“This is…”

Li Fan turned his gaze toward the center of the Spiritwood Realm.

The colossal tree that had always stood tall and verdant, piercing straight into the heavens, was now manifesting a breathtaking phenomenon.

Its branches and leaves trembled slightly though there was no wind, wrapped in a faint, misty white radiance.

At the very top of the ancient tree, a column of light burst upward, piercing through the sky itself.

This was not an exaggeration of language. At that moment, a literal hole had appeared in the heavens of the Spiritwood Realm.

The void within that hole seemed to possess an immense suction force, drawing in the surrounding clouds in a great swirling motion.

Their faces showed no fear, only pure and heartfelt joy.

“World ascension?”

The Spiritwood Realm was now half a spiritual treasure under Li Fan’s control. With just a moment of sensing, he immediately understood what was happening.

The nourishment provided by Lin Ling’s feedback, the reconstruction performed by Shang Tianci using the Heavenly Scene Treasure Gourd and most importantly, the countless Heaven and Earth Furnaces ceaselessly releasing spiritual energy day and night…

The convergence of these forces had finally triggered the realm’s metamorphosis.

It was a rare event that might only occur once in several millennia, scarcely recorded even in cultivation classics.

Li Fan and everyone within the Spiritwood Realm held their breath, silently watching and comprehending the process.

Beyond the world, within the void, something seemed to be drawn in and poured into the Spiritwood Realm through the rift in the heavens.

A faint rumbling sound resonated throughout the land. On the surface, the Spiritwood Realm’s scenery seemed largely unchanged.

Yet as its master, Li Fan could sharply sense that the realm’s overall strength was rising at an astonishing speed.

The most visible transformation was within the great tree that sustained the entire world.

Originally, Li Fan could have destroyed it effortlessly with a single strike.

But now, from its roots to its branches and leaves, every part of the tree was growing more resilient.

By the end, it had become sturdy enough to withstand even Li Fan’s direct blow without being annihilated.

The vortex above gradually shrank and finally vanished.

The ascension of the Spiritwood Realm had reached its conclusion.

Although the realm’s visible size appeared unchanged, everyone who had witnessed the process felt an inexplicable expansion within their hearts.

The heavens seemed broader, the earth felt more vast.

Even the air itself had become fresher and more invigorating.

Vitality was invisible, yet its presence was now undeniable.

Among all who benefited from this ascension, none gained more than the Treefolk Matriarch.

She finally broke through her barrier, her strength now comparable to a Dao Integration cultivator of the Xuanhuang Realm.

Her treefolk features had almost completely faded, leaving her appearance nearly indistinguishable from that of a human cultivator.

Only the natural patterns upon her face revealed her true origin.

Clad in a flowing green gown, the Treefolk Matriarch gave her command, ordering all treefolk to continue their reverent prostration and to sing praises to Li Fan, the Lord of the Spiritwood Realm, for his boundless grace.

Not long after, Li Fan’s calm voice descended from the heavens.

“Spiritwood has ascended. You are reborn. From this moment forth, your fate shall no longer be confined to this single realm.”

“I shall grant you a name.”

“Lin Xin.”

Lin Xin’s face was filled with excitement as she led the Treefolk tribe to once again kneel and bow.

Shang Tianci, Tianyang, and the others all showed deep emotion on their faces.

After instructing everyone to continue forging the Heaven and Earth Furnace, Li Fan’s attention shifted to the Spiritwood World itself.

“In truth, if it had not already been captured by the Xuanhuang World, judging from the current scale and specifications of the Spiritwood World, it should already meet the minimum standards of a cultivation realm.”

Combining what was recorded in the Mending Heaven Record, Li Fan pondered quietly to himself.

“Before the Immortal Path was severed, a world’s ascension would leave a mark within the Ascension Channel. Cultivators within such a world, upon reaching a sufficient realm, could ascend to the heavens in broad daylight and become immortals. What a pity.”

“Now that the Immortal Path is cut off, and the Spiritwood World has become a vassal of the Xuanhuang World, its so-called ascension is merely that of a subordinate realm under Xuanhuang.”

Li Fan shook his head slightly. “The Xuanhuang World truly harms more than it helps.”

“However, if the Spiritwood Realm can still undergo ascension, then what about the Xuanhuang Realm itself?”

Li Fan furrowed his brow and pondered for a long time before reaching a conclusion. “In theory, the Xuanhuang Realm still holds the possibility of ascension.”

“That is to say… it could transform into an Immortal Realm.” His eyes gleamed with divine light.

“Yet, the gap between a cultivation realm and the true Immortal Realm is simply too vast. Even though the Xuanhuang Realm has devoured countless cultivation realms by now, it has merely expanded its territory a little more. It is still far from qualifying for ascension.”

“Perhaps…”

“If it were a hundred times larger than it is now, there might be a faint chance of reaching the Immortal Realm.”

“Still, even then, it might not deserve to be called an ‘Immortal Realm’. ‘Immortal Domain’ would be a more fitting term.”

Li Fan could not help but drift into contemplation.

It must be stated that all of this was merely Li Fan’s speculation, derived from fragments within the Mending Heaven Record describing the so-called Immortal Realm.

As for what the truth really was, even the author of the Mending Heaven Record, Heavenly Doctor, had never personally witnessed the Immortal Realm.

There was simply no way to verify it.

However, from what Li Fan knew of the Heavenly Doctor, he was exceedingly rigorous in his scholarship. If it were mere conjecture without solid evidence, he would never have written it into his book so easily.

“The Heavenly Law Realm’s Venerable, who enforces the laws on behalf of the heavens, might perhaps know some secrets left from before the severing of the Immortal Path.”

This observation of a world’s ascension once again sparked inspiration within Li Fan.

He began contemplating the fundamental nature of world operation, and what kind of ultimate cultivation art would best suit himself.

Li Fan was never one to act without benefit.

Though he had encountered countless techniques through many cycles of reincarnation, he still believed that the Sitting Immortal Art, derived from the Sitting Mountain Art, was the one most suited to him.

Yet, with his cultivation now at such a high level, his opponents were beings like the Heavenly Doctor, Ruomu, and the Senior Stone Tablet—ancient monsters of unimaginable depth.

Ordinary techniques could no longer offer him meaningful improvement.

How could he contend with them when his foundational method of cultivation lagged behind by more than a step?

The Heavenly Doctor’s words resurfaced in his mind.

“Remember, techniques are secondary. What truly matters is understanding the operation of Heaven’s Dao and the essence of the world itself.”

“No matter how powerful a technique may be, it ultimately belongs to another. Only the one that truly fits you is the most perfect cultivation art.”

Li Fan’s gaze flickered, his eyes distant and unfocused.

The Mending Heaven Record, the Sitting Immortal Art, the ascension of worlds—

A fierce storm seemed to rise within his mind. All his past experiences and insights were drawn into it.

After being tempered as though within a furnace, it suddenly exploded in a brilliant burst of enlightenment.

Within Li Fan’s consciousness, three radiant words took form—

Sitting Heaven Art.

Li Fan’s eyes gleamed with sharp light. “Good. This is the true path of my Dao. Investing in cultivators is but a minor way. To absorb the feedback born from the transformation and ascension of worlds—now that is the power that transcends all!”

For the first time in a long while, Li Fan’s heart surged with excitement. The more he thought, the more exhilarated he became. “Even the Immortal Ancestor himself defied the heavens, merging with the world’s laws to achieve transcendence thereafter.”

“It proves that the might of a world is indeed beyond what any cultivator can resist.”

“The Xuanhuang Realm has already been completely corroded by the Immortal Ancestor, full of wounds and fractures. Even if I wished to bring blessings to the heavens, it would be almost impossible.”

“It can hardly sustain itself. And I still wish to rely on its feedback for cultivation…”

Li Fan shook his head, temporarily cutting off that line of thought.

“However, the many small worlds captured by Xuanhuang—those are my perfect testing grounds.”

“Just like what happened to the Spiritwood Realm, with Shang Tianci transporting Xuanhuang’s miraculous landscapes into it, plus the addition of foreign resources and spiritual energy…”

“…”

“As expected, this is the cultivation art most suited to me. It even coincides perfectly with my plans throughout this entire life.”

“Truly, there are workings of fate beyond understanding—knowledge and action united, the heart naturally aligned with the heavens.”

Becoming increasingly convinced of the perfect compatibility between himself and the Sitting Heaven Art, Li Fan had now decided on the Dao path he would pursue in the future.

The only problem was how to evolve and advance the Sitting Immortal Art into the Sitting Heaven Art.

“Of course, I could once again use the Law Derivative Jade to obtain it, but…”

After pondering for a moment, Li Fan suppressed the temptation of such an effortless method.

“The Law Derivative Jade is, in essence, just a wondrous artifact of the heavens.”

“It most likely works through exhaustive deduction. It can indeed grant the fastest route to the desired cultivation art. However, that art would only be the most suitable for the fictional owner of the Law Derivative Jade’s deductions.”

“And not for the real me. Unless I were willing to bare every secret within my body and soul, allowing the Jade to see all without restraint.”

“Hmph…”

Naturally, Li Fan would never do such a thing.

“So if I wish to obtain a perfect Sitting Heaven Art, I must rely on myself.”

Li Fan came to this conclusion calmly.

To be honest, though his comprehension was decent, to deduce a heaven-defying cultivation art that used world transformations and ascension energy as nourishment… 𝐑₳𝐍𝘰BÈṦ

He was still far from qualified!

But Li Fan did not worry in the slightest about his ability to achieve it.

If he failed in one lifetime, then ten lifetimes. If ten lifetimes were not enough…

He could still learn from others.

The prodigies of the Xuanhuang Realm were as numerous as carp in the river. Whatever arts and divine powers they managed to deduce or conceive of—would all, in the end, belong solely to Li Fan.

As long as he returned to the anchor year, everything they exhausted themselves to imagine and create would become Li Fan’s private secret.

“To deduce the Sitting Heaven Art, I do not mind sharing the Sitting Immortal Art with others.”

“Of course, I must select those of the highest comprehension and most suitable disposition.”

“Conveniently, in my next life, I have already planned to truly hide behind the scenes and test my hypothesis…”

A faint plan had already taken shape in Li Fan’s mind.

“Yes, in this life, while assisting in the ascension of the Ten Thousand Worlds, I can also gather data.”

Integration and insight. Enlightenment and clarity.

These words perfectly captured Li Fan’s current state of mind.

“Cultivators bring feedback to their cultivation. Then, what kind of surprise will the world’s feedback bring to me...”

Li Fan could not help but secretly look forward to it in his heart.

His mind sank into fantasy, and he did not know how long had passed.

Suddenly, one of the thought-demons born from the Three Disasters and Hundred Tribulations Divine Clarity Method stirred with unease.

“Hm?”

Li Fan immediately located that divine demon.

The one it possessed was a Nascent Soul cultivator named Feng Qiran.

This man was always cautious and prudent. Ever since obtaining the secret art Divine Descent Body, he had never displayed it before others, choosing instead to cultivate quietly in seclusion.

But some things cannot be avoided merely by being cautious.

That day, Feng Qiran brushed past a young man in blue robes.

Moments later, to his horror, he realized he had lost control over his own body.

He could not even release his divine demon incarnation.

The blue-robed cultivator looked him over carefully, revealing a helpless and amused expression.

Then, without saying a word, a fine line appeared between them—deep as an abyss, yet bright as a mirror.

Under the dim and shifting light, it did not take long before the young cultivator transformed into an exact replica of Feng Qiran.

As the stunned Feng Qiran watched in disbelief, the blue-robed figure extended both hands toward him.

The thin line exploded with a thunderous sound, and the two merged into one.

At that moment, through the divine demon that Li Fan had left within him, Feng Qiran established a reverse connection to Li Fan.

There were no spoken words—only a dark and sinister force that followed the invisible link through the void and invaded Li Fan’s sea of consciousness.

But Li Fan had long since sensed something amiss. How could he not be prepared?

In an instant, countless divine demons appeared.

A chilling ghostly realm descended upon his consciousness, and five eerie blood moons rose in the sky. Li Fan’s face twisted into a feral grin as he stared down at Feng Qiran, who was now surrounded by innumerable demons.

“To dare invade my sea of consciousness...”

“You are courting death!”

“Jie jie jie...”

Li Fan burst into maniacal laughter and was about to strike.

He had already seen through the truth: the one before him, Feng Qiran, was none other than Mo Rubin, the Dharma King of the Xuantian Sect.

He did not know why Mo Rubin had assumed the identity of a young cultivator and gone out alone.

But since he had yet to reveal his true identity, it would not hurt to test this Xuantian Dharma King’s strength.

Holding nothing back, countless ghosts and deities roared, unleashing black beams of light toward Mo Rubin.

These were the materialized forms of consciousness attacks—Not only Li Fan’s own power, but also the borrowed and extracted divine sense of all cultivators who practiced the Divine Descent Body.

Combined with Li Fan’s own transcendent spiritual strength...

Li Fan believed that even a Longevity Heavenly Sovereign would suffer heavy injuries from this blow.

“Wait...”

As expected, before Mo Rubin could finish speaking, his divine sense avatar was consumed by the terrifying destructive force.

He could not even resist for an instant before being annihilated and expelled from Li Fan’s sea of consciousness.

Li Fan was quite satisfied with the result. Though it felt somewhat like an ambush, he had nonetheless repelled the intrusion of a Longevity Immortal-tier powerhouse head-on.

Sensing the fatigue transmitted from the cultivators hosting his myriad demons, Li Fan felt a hint of regret.

“Pity it has only one strike of power and cannot last.”

Without withdrawing his focus, Li Fan continued waiting for Mo Rubin’s return.

Just as he expected, it was only an avatar of consciousness that had been destroyed.

Mo Rubin had not given up on establishing contact with him.

That shadowy, unpredictable force once again traced the invisible thread through the void, returning to invade Li Fan’s sea of consciousness.

“Brother Xingwang, it’s me, Mo Rubin.”

Before his arrival, Mo Rubin hurriedly greeted first.

Li Fan only let out a cold snort. “If you want to get close to someone, at least make sure you recognize the right person first.”

With that, he once again struck at the Mo Rubin clone that had just taken form within his sea of consciousness.

Although he could not draw upon the divine sense power of other cultivators, relying solely on the myriad thought-born demons and gods, his attack was still formidable.

However, it was far weaker than the previous strike that had shattered Mo Rubin’s will. To hide this, Li Fan deliberately acted hesitant.

“Brother Xingwang, wait! Do not attack!” Mo Rubin easily dissolved the offensive.

Sensing Li Fan’s hesitation, he quickly continued, “I know your memory may be fragmented, but you should still have some recollection of the Xuantian Sect from back then, right?”

“The Xuantian Sect…” Li Fan’s assault slowed as if he were lost in thought.

“Wrong! There is no such thing as the Xuantian Sect! There is only the True Immortal of Salvation and Mortal Compassion!”

Suddenly, Li Fan’s expression shifted, his cold gaze locking directly on Mo Rubin.

Above the eerie, ghostly firmament, the image of a Faceless True Immortal Stone Statue slowly emerged.

Like a blazing sun, it dispelled the darkness and illuminated the world.

“The Xuantian Statue?!” Upon seeing the long-lost statue, Mo Rubin became even more certain of his deduction.

“How dare you, heretical fool, distort the teachings of the True Immortal of Salvation and Mortal Compassion!”

A hint of madness flashed in Li Fan’s eyes. His entire mental realm trembled violently, as if something within had been stirred.

The countless divine demons all turned toward Mo Rubin, their faces contorted with wrath.

“Brother Xingwang, calm down! Do not harm your own ally! This…”

“The statue of the True Immortal of Salvation and Mortal Compassion is, in truth, the Xuantian Statue!”

“You and I are of the same family!” Mo Rubin did his best to soothe Li Fan’s unstable state.

“Family?” Li Fan’s crazed look lessened somewhat.

“So you are also a follower of the True Immortal of Salvation and Mortal Compassion?” He eyed Mo Rubin suspiciously.

Mo Rubin hesitated, but seeing Li Fan’s madness threatening to return, he helplessly nodded. “Uh… something like that.”

“Hmph, then you should have said so earlier!” Li Fan finally withdrew his vigilance.

In an instant, the myriad demons, along with the blood-red moon above, all vanished.

Amidst a vast white expanse, only Mo Rubin and Li Fan stood facing each other.

“Why have I never seen you before? Could it be that the True Immortal left another lineage elsewhere?”

“Wait… no. Didn’t I come looking for you not long ago?”

“Who are you? No, who am I?”

Li Fan, who had seemed somewhat stable, suddenly showed signs of madness again.

Mo Rubin frowned slightly. “These symptoms… seem even worse than before. But the aura of this cultivation method is exactly the same. There is no mistake.” ŗ𝘈ꞐＯBÊS

“Brother Xingwang, whatever happened in the past does not matter. As long as our goals are the same, that is enough.” Mo Rubin tried to awaken his sanity.

Li Fan was momentarily stunned. “Our goal?”

Then he suddenly understood. “Indeed! The Heavenly Dao is dim, and the True Immortal’s lineage no longer shines upon the mortal world. I must set things right and let the name of the True Immortal of Salvation shine again upon humanity!”

As he spoke, the Faceless Stone Statue in the sky seemed to respond to Li Fan’s words, emitting a faint golden glow.

Upon seeing the golden light, Mo Rubin’s expression changed drastically.

He instinctively stepped back slightly.

Looking at Li Fan, whose expression seemed somewhat dazed, he hesitated for a moment, then spoke to draw his attention.

“Our great endeavor is not yet complete. How could we have the face to meet a True Immortal? Brother Xingwang, perhaps we should wait until the True Immortal’s lineage is truly restored before we report our merits,” Mo Rubin said in a low voice, his words carrying subtle meaning.

Li Fan, upon hearing this, was instantly filled with respect. “Brother, your enlightenment surpasses even mine?”

When Li Fan addressed him as “brother,” Mo Rubin did not correct him.

Back in the sect, Sun Xingwang had indeed always addressed him that way.

“So you haven’t completely lost your mind yet,” Mo Rubin thought silently.

Li Fan looked at Mo Rubin with a serious expression. “Yet what you say is not without reason. Without achieving some great accomplishment, we indeed have no face to frequently pay respects to a True Immortal.”

Muttering to himself, the influence of the Faceless Stone Statue in the sky gradually disappeared.

Mo Rubin finally exhaled slightly.

“Brother Xingwang, do you remember the other brothers and sisters in the sect?” Seeing Li Fan’s emotions stabilize, Mo Rubin asked.

“Hm?” Li Fan’s brow immediately furrowed.

He seemed to sink into deep memories.

“The others…”

Li Fan’s expression shifted repeatedly as he muttered a few words.

“Yu Zhen, Elder Cui, Brother Xuanyuan…”

“Xuanyuan? Xuanyuan, Xuanyuan…”

He then continued repeating the name Xuanyuan, and the calmness of his consciousness sea stirred into waves.

Seeing that he could not get any more information, Mo Rubin gave up.

“Enough, Brother Xingwang. Matters of the past can be discussed later. I want to ask you: the [Divine Descent Body] incidents in various states… that was your doing, wasn’t it?”

Li Fan said arrogantly, “Correct! Already, thirty-six thousand five hundred and thirteen cultivators are entirely under my control. Under the daily influence of my divine mind, they will soon become loyal followers of the True Immortal of Salvation and Mortal Compassion!”

“In such a short time, already thirty thousand under my sway! Unifying the world is only a matter of time!”

Mo Rubin shook his head slightly. “The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance is taking this matter seriously. I suspect it is your doing, Brother Xingwang, which is why I took it upon myself to remind you.”

“Stop, Brother Xingwang. Thirty thousand cultivators are already sufficient. If the situation worsens, it will inevitably draw the attention of other Dharma-Transmitter. By then, you may even risk exposure,” Mo Rubin advised.

Li Fan immediately refused. “Stop? Why should I? I hide in the shadows; no one can detect me. Divine Descent is like wild grass—burn it and it will not die, let the spring wind blow, and it grows again. Under the heavens, who can stop me?”

Li Fan’s tone was extremely arrogant.

Mo Rubin sighed. “It is not that the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance is powerless. The matter simply has not reached the required level yet.”

“If you continue…”

“Consider this: if I can locate your sea of consciousness through those cultivators’ bodies, other Dharma-Transmitter can certainly do the same.”

Although Li Fan was playing the part of a mad cultivator, he was not foolish.

He did not argue but fell into thought.

Then he looked at Mo Rubin, as if remembering something, and suddenly said, “So you have indeed taken over that Dharma-Transmitter’s body.”

Mo Rubin was slightly startled. “Brother Xingwang, have your memories returned?”

Li Fan’s expression was serious. He did not answer directly but urgently said to Mo Rubin, “The only way to find Brother Xuanyuan is through the sect’s greatest treasure, the Xuantian Treasure Mirror. You must find a way…”

Originally, seeing "Sun Xingwang" return to normal, Mo Rubin couldn't help but show a hint of joy on his face.

But what made him extremely uncomfortable was that Li Fan stopped speaking mid-sentence.

The other party's expression suddenly became utterly bewildered, his eyes empty and devoid of anything.

Only after a long while did a faint glimmer appear, and he instinctively looked around.

"You are…" Li Fan stared at Mo Rubin before him, asking with some confusion.

This stark contrast made Mo Rubin take a deep breath.

Although he knew that the technique Sun Xingwang practiced was extremely strange, the most peculiar among the Twelve Dharma Kings, its bizarreness to this extent still sent a chill through him.

"However, Brother Xingwang's thoughts align perfectly with mine."

"Hmm… as expected, he deliberately guided the Dharma Transmitter [Feng] to my resting place that day, intending for me to infiltrate the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance."

"So, it's Brother Bin."

"Why are we here?"

Li Fan surveyed his surroundings.

Mo Rubin let out a slight sigh, thinking to himself, "At least he still remembers me. That saves me from wasting more words."

He then briefly explained to Li Fan how he had taken the place of the Dharma Transmitter Feng, entered the upper echelons of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, and was plotting to seize the Xuantian Treasure Mirror.

"The Xuantian Treasure Mirror is the only immortal artifact refined with the utmost effort by the Xuantian King in the past. Although it has been used by the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance over the years, from my observations, the Alliance has not fully gained control over it. Instead, they have reached some sort of cooperative relationship."

"As long as we can regain control of the Xuantian Treasure Mirror, it’s highly likely we can use it to locate the Xuantian King."

Taking advantage of Li Fan’s moment of clarity, Mo Rubin explained concisely.

"In my current state, knowing this is useless. What do you need me to do?" Li Fan asked cooperatively, showing self-awareness.

Mo Rubin was greatly pleased and whispered, "In the current Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, the Dharma Transmitter lineage and the Mirror Holder lineage hold power separately, keeping each other in check. Additionally, there is the [Illusory True Sage] lineage, hidden in the shadows, acting as a balance."

Li Fan frowned slightly, "The upper echelons of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance are actually this complex? And what are these Mirror Holders and Illusory True Sages…"

"I’ve never heard of them before."

Mo Rubin nodded slightly, "I only learned of this after taking over the body of the Dharma Transmitter Feng. These three power-holding lineages rarely appear in public, so it’s normal for outsiders to be unaware of their details."

"The so-called Dharma Transmitters are the surviving cultivators from the group that followed the Immortal Ancestor in the past, spreading the New Method."

"As for the Mirror Holders, as the name suggests, they control the power of the Xuantian Treasure Mirror. Over the years, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance has never given up on their plan to fully possess the Xuantian Treasure Mirror. Using the methods left by the Immortal Ancestor, they have been gradually eroding and increasing their control over it."

"As for the most mysterious third lineage, the Illusory True Sages…"

"I’ve had little contact with them during this time. However, they seem to be connected to a creation called [Era] and the beast clan’s Emperor Sanmo. By leveraging supreme deductive power and some kind of illusory yet realistic force, they can turn the virtual into reality, summoning countless powerful cultivators to fight out of thin air…"

Mo Rubin shared the intelligence he had gathered so far with Li Fan.

After listening, Li Fan waved his hand impatiently, "What’s the plan?"

"It seems that even as a Dharma Transmitter, seizing the Xuantian Treasure Mirror is no easy task."

Mo Rubin nodded, not denying it, "However, my plan has already begun to show results."

"The Xuantian Treasure Mirror possesses its own intelligence. Since it is not easy to control, we will force it to cooperate with us willingly."

"Brother Xingwang, you previously managed to transmit the Xuantian Spirit-Sealing Formation diagram to the interior of the Immortal Alliance through some means. With my assistance, the lineage of the Dharma Transmitters is now stirring with excitement."

"They are attempting to use the power of the Xuantian Spirit-Sealing to fully control the Tianxuan Mirror, thereby completely crushing the lineage of the Mirror Holders..."

"But you and I both know that the Xuantian Spirit-Sealing Formation only forces the Xuantian Treasure Mirror to execute certain commands. To truly and completely control the Xuantian Treasure Mirror..."

"Hmph, I’m afraid no one in the world can do that except the Xuantian King!"

"However, being so tightly controlled, the Xuantian Treasure Mirror is naturally unwilling. As the constraints deepen step by step, we can try to make contact with it. We can cooperate with it in reverse, helping it resolve its crisis. The price will be its assistance in finding the Xuantian King."

"Of course, if it is unwilling..."

Mo Rubin’s eyes flickered: "Then we might as well take the Xuantian Spirit-Sealing a step further."

Li Fan interrupted Mo Rubin’s words: "The Xuantian Treasure Mirror’s attitude is unclear. I’m afraid it won’t be too enthusiastic about finding the Xuantian King and might even obstruct us..."

Mo Rubin smiled: "Brother Xingwang, you forget that the Xuantian Treasure Mirror was refined by the Xuantian King and has been imbued with the Way of Xuantian. It cannot speak falsehoods and must abide by its word."

Li Fan’s eyes narrowed slightly: "Is that so..."

His expression grew dazed, as if signs of memory loss were surfacing again.

Seeing this, Mo Rubin quickly changed the subject: "So, what Brother Xingwang needs to do now is to work with me from the inside and outside, gradually increasing my prestige."

"Gain the trust of most of the Dharma Transmitters, so we can continue to push forward the Xuantian Spirit-Sealing ."

"As for your Divine Descent Body, within the next half month, expand it as quickly as possible. Once panic is stirred, I will make my move. Then, you can cooperate with me and put on a show. At that time, destroy the vast majority of the Divine Descent Bodies, leaving only a portion as a backup."

Mo Rubin instructed.

Li Fan nodded repeatedly, immediately agreeing.

"By the way, your condition..." Mo Rubin’s eyes showed a hint of concern.

"No matter. For truly important matters, I have my own way of keeping records."

As he spoke, the Faceless True Immortal Statue appeared in the sky again.

Li Fan gazed at the statue, closing his eyes in deep thought.

A faint golden light reappeared, enveloping the statue entirely.

Then Li Fan opened his eyes and dispersed the statue.

"This is the only way."

Li Fan said faintly.

Mo Rubin seemed thoughtful but did not continue discussing the topic.

"Our plan is nearly foolproof. The only thing to worry about..."

Mo Rubin paused, then said: "Is that Dharma Transmitter [Jiang]."

His face displayed a rare expression of solemnity.

"If there is anyone in the current Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance who can truly shoulder the burden of reviving the Immortal Alliance, it is none other than this person."

"Dharma Transmitter Jiang..."

"He truly has some of the Xuantian King’s former demeanor."

Mo Rubin gave the other party an extremely high evaluation.

"Dharma Transmitter Jiang..." Li Fan’s heart stirred, but he did not press further.

Instead, he pretended to be completely unconcerned.

"With you in charge, I’m very confident. I just need to cooperate with you from the shadows."

Mo Rubin nodded: "That’s how it should be."

"This body, I’ll temporarily borrow and hide away. When I need to contact you in the future, I’ll use this method," Mo Rubin said finally.

Li Fan nodded in agreement.

Earlier, the two had discussed in detail the various matters they needed to coordinate on moving forward. However, Li Fan did not ask Mo Rubin to inquire about the secrets of the Immortal Alliance. As the saying goes, to take, one must first give. In Li Fan’s view, his connection with Mo Rubin was still in the development stage, far from the time for reaping rewards.

"Once I help him advance his position among the Dharma Transmitters of the Immortal Alliance, perhaps then I can make a small request," Li Fan thought to himself after Mo Rubin’s divine sense completely vanished from his sea of consciousness.

Over the next ten days, all the cultivators practicing the Divine Descent Body technique, under Li Fan’s subtle influence, began converging toward Luoyan Prefecture.

According to Mo Rubin’s plan, he would soon visit Luoyan Prefecture in his capacity as a Dharma Transmitter.

The entire Luoyan Prefecture, including all levels of the Immortal Alliance’s organizations, would undoubtedly treat this event with the highest level of importance.

Moreover, Mo Rubin would deliberately draw the attention of all the surveillance forces, creating a perfect environment for Li Fan to freely spread the Divine Descent Body technique in Luoyan Prefecture.

For an entire month, Li Fan aimed to bewitch as many cultivators as possible during this period.

Then, they would all erupt simultaneously.

Once the situation spiraled out of control, Mo Rubin would take the initiative to volunteer and take on the task of completely eliminating these "rebels."

With Li Fan, the mastermind, as an insider, resolving the matter perfectly would undoubtedly be easy.

That was the general plan.

Of course, in practice, various unexpected complications could arise. Mo Rubin had already prepared contingency plans for such scenarios.

It truly gave the impression of strategizing within a command tent, securing victory from a thousand miles away.

Of course, compared to Li Fan, Mo Rubin was still slightly inferior.

Soon, over thirty thousand Divine Descent Body cultivators, influenced by Li Fan’s suggestions, began heading toward Luoyan Prefecture.

To avoid arousing suspicion from the Immortal Alliance due to the sudden surge in population, Li Fan orchestrated their movements carefully. Some traveled via teleportation formation, while others flew through the air.

In batches, they arrived in Luoyan Prefecture over the course of ten days and went into hiding across various locations.

They began observing the surrounding cultivators, identifying suitable targets.

Although Luoyan Prefecture was not as prosperous as the central four prefectures of the Immortal Alliance, it was still a top-tier prefecture.

The Supreme Commander of the Immortal Alliance’s Garrison Hall, True Monarch Jicheng, hailed from Luoyan Prefecture.

After he rose to power, he provided significant support to his hometown.

Many disciples from prominent families in Luoyan Prefecture were sent to serve in the Immortal Alliance headquarters, and over the years, they funneled resources back to their homeland.

Through years of deep cultivation, the network of connections in Luoyan Prefecture had become intricate and unfathomable.

Only a figure of the Dharma Transmitter’s caliber could make the entire Luoyan Prefecture treat the matter with such caution and respect.

In Li Fan’s sea of consciousness, a map of Luoyan Prefecture slowly unfolded.

Red dots, representing the Divine Descent Body cultivators, were scattered across various parts of Luoyan Prefecture.

Sensing the information relayed by his subordinates, Li Fan nodded to himself: "A land blessed with spiritual energy and outstanding people. Even excluding the disciples of prominent families, the overall quality of cultivators here far surpasses that of remote places like the Congyun Sea."

"Hmm…"

"Everything is in place. Now we just wait for Mo Rubin’s side."

Li Fan first arranged for his subordinates to make contact with their chosen targets and build relationships.

Instead of acting immediately, the first step was to gradually gain the trust of the targets.

The conversations of thirty thousand people were all absorbed into Li Fan’s sea of consciousness.

Seated at the center, relying on his powerful divine sense and exceptional emotional intelligence, Li Fan was always able to provide the best response.

Moreover, these over thirty thousand Divine Descent Body cultivators were not all acting alone.

For those with lower abilities, Li Fan deliberately grouped them together. With their combined efforts, their persuasion efficiency was even higher than that of the cultivators working alone.

In just a few days, tens of thousands of “close friends” emerged within Luoyan Prefecture.

Li Fan gazed at the tens of thousands of different scenes floating before his eyes, his expression calm.

To him, making connections, conversing, and gaining trust were nothing more than a series of multiple-choice questions.

With Li Fan’s current experience and cunning, finding the optimal solution among countless choices was not a difficult task.

Moreover, choices made without emotion and with absolute rationality often fostered better relationships.

“When a connection is newly formed, the bond is at its most fervent. We must strike while the iron is hot…” he thought silently.

One day later than the agreed time, an unusual atmosphere seemed to envelop Luoyan Prefecture.

From the thirty thousand scenes, countless discussions flooded into Li Fan’s ears.

“Huh? Why haven’t I seen Young Master Cai recently? Has he found some new amusement?”

“Strange, I haven’t run into Brother Zhang for days either.”

“Damn it, I went to Luoyan Heavenly City today for business, and they stopped me. No reason given, just not allowed in! I spit on that!”

“Those guys from the Martial Arts Hall have been unusually active lately. But why do I feel like they’re just putting on a show?”

“Hiss…”

Combining these various unusual signs, the cultivators of Luoyan Prefecture quickly realized something.

A major figure had come to Luoyan Prefecture.

As for how significant this figure was or their true identity, they had no way of knowing.

However, the smarter ones had already decided to stay in seclusion within the Tianxuan Mirror for the time being and avoid going out.

Otherwise, they might inexplicably vanish for some unknown reason.

Luoyan Prefecture remained calm on the surface.

The cultivators were sensible enough not to cause trouble.

They merely gathered with friends, discussing privately.

At this moment, it was finally time for Li Fan to show his prowess.

Stirring the emotions of the target cultivators and eliciting their resonance was, in fact, quite simple.

The vast majority of these cultivators had no background and had reached their current level through their own efforts.

Most were at the Foundation Establishment stage, with a few at the Golden Core stage.

Nascent Soul cultivators were extremely rare, not even one in a thousand.

Li Fan’s bewitching voice echoed in their ears.

“Hmph, these families control Luoyan Prefecture. For us lowly cultivators, there’s probably no chance of rising up, ever.”

“Exactly. All the good opportunities are out of our reach. We don’t even have the right to know what’s happening…”

“Tch, what a life.”

“Relying solely on our own cultivation without resources, how far can we go? Without a cave-heaven, even a peerless genius would be stuck at the Nascent Soul stage. I see those family disciples, and they’re not necessarily better than me. Take that Young Master Cai, for example. He lacks nothing, yet he’s still only at the late Golden Core stage. What a complete waste! If it were me…”

…

Anger and resentment began to spread among the lower-tier cultivators.

Deep within the hearts of the cultivators in Luoyan Prefecture, feelings of dissatisfaction and despair had long been suppressed.

At this moment, under Li Fan’s deliberate guidance, these emotions were like a volcano on the verge of eruption, ready to burst forth at any moment.

At this critical juncture, Li Fan provided them with an outlet, a glimmer of hope.

A supreme secret technique that, even without cultivation, could thoroughly crush the lofty disciples of great clans beneath their feet!

“Beyond the myriad worlds, in the vast void, there exists a True Immortal of Salvation and Mortal Compassion who observes the suffering of all beings.”

“Though residing in a purgatory, suppressing endless gods and demons, this immortal still holds concern for the common people.”

“Thus, a secret technique was bestowed, granting equality to all and giving everyone a chance to strive for greatness…”

Amid murmurs and whispers, the mysterious veil of the Divine Descent Body technique was unveiled before the cultivators.

The cultivators were skeptical, but some, with the mindset of trying it out since there was nothing to lose, practiced it for a while.

No matter how unbelievable it seemed, the truth was undeniable.

The temptation of achieving a leap in strength in the blink of an eye, a level they might never have reached in their entire lives—was something few could resist.

Even those who suspected it might be a trap willingly swallowed this poison.

Because, in their eyes, gaining immense power meant they could do things they had previously only dreamed of but could never accomplish.

What they didn’t know, and could never have anticipated, was…

Once they practiced the Divine Descent Body technique and summoned their god-demon avatars, their thoughts and desires were no longer their own.

Under Li Fan’s subtle hints and guidance, these promising cultivators of Luoyan Prefecture, who each had their own ambitions, temporarily cast aside their personal desires.

They quietly left Luoyan Prefecture, heading toward remote regions they might never have considered visiting before.

It was as if something was waiting for them there.

When the Dharma Transmitter arrived in Luoyan Prefecture, security measures reached their peak.

However, under the Dharma Transmitter’s instructions to avoid excessive disturbance and maintain a low profile, all defensive measures were targeted and specific.

Thus, Luoyan Prefecture was not completely sealed off, and the departure of these cultivators faced no obstruction.

Although the simultaneous departure of so many cultivators in such a short time was indeed suspicious.

Under normal circumstances, it would undoubtedly have raised alarms within Luoyan Prefecture’s Immortal Alliance organization.

But at this moment, the Dharma Transmitter was present.

What could be more important than ensuring the proper reception of this esteemed figure?

If they failed to host the Dharma Transmitter properly and incurred their wrath, even the True Monarch Jicheng could not protect them. They would be forced to cut their losses to survive. ɽ𝐀₦Ȯ𝖇Еŝ

The centuries of effort in managing Luoyan Prefecture would vanish in an instant.

Such consequences were beyond what they could bear.

Therefore, hosting the Dharma Transmitter took precedence over all other matters in Luoyan Prefecture.

As a result, the investigation and handling of the mass exodus of cultivators were temporarily shelved.

By the time these cultivators had quietly completed their transfer and dispersion, the Dharma Transmitter, having had their fill of amusement, leisurely departed.

Before leaving, a group of black-clad cultivators, citing the need to strictly protect the Dharma Transmitter’s whereabouts and confidentiality, destroyed some records.

When the chaos in Luoyan Prefecture finally settled and normalcy was restored, the cultivators conducted inspections and found nothing amiss.

It seemed no different from the Luoyan Prefecture of old.

…

The cultivators of the Immortal Alliance in Luoyan Prefecture, now back on track, began to dream about how, having gained the favor of the Dharma Transmitter, they would rise to prominence and advance further in the future.

However, they were unaware that a terrifying catastrophe had already unwittingly slipped from their hands.

"It can begin."

Thirty days later, the cultivators spreading from Luoyan Prefecture, through their efforts, had increased the number of bewitched cultivators by an order of magnitude.

Feeling that the time was ripe, Mo Rubin contacted Li Fan through his divine-demon clone.

Li Fan, meanwhile, looked at the map of all the regions of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance before him.

Countless dense red dots on the map brought a faint smile to his face.

In his sea of consciousness, the eerie ghostly realm instantly emptied.

All the demonic gods vanished, leaving the space empty and radiant with sunlight.

At that moment, countless ancient demonic gods, fabricated by Li Fan’s imagination, descended upon the Xuanhuang Realm!

The cultivators practicing the Divine Descent Body technique had completely lost their ability to think.

They had become mere puppets of the powerful demonic gods, acting according to Li Fan’s will.

One by one, the demonic gods launched simultaneous assaults on the Heavenly Cities across the Immortal Alliance.

Even though the Heavenly Cities’ defensive arrays were rotated every three months, they were as good as nonexistent before Li Fan.

Countless demonic gods passed through the defensive formation with ease, as if they were nothing.

They infiltrated the interiors of the Heavenly Cities.

Compared to the Five Elders Association’s inland regions, the Heavenly Cities of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance had enjoyed prolonged peace.

Even during the wars between the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance and the Five Elders Association, conflicts were limited to a few border provinces. For the vast majority of cultivators, war was something they only glimpsed through the Tianxuan Mirror.

It was far removed from their actual lives.

They never imagined that an attack would one day befall them!

The moment the demonic gods breached the defenses and entered the Heavenly Cities, most of the Immortal Alliance cultivators chose to flee.

They did not confront the enemy head-on.

"The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance is your alliance, not mine."

This was the thought in the hearts of nearly all the fleeing cultivators.

Only a small minority, still filled with fervor, along with the Martial Hall cultivators responsible for complex security tasks, came to their senses and charged forward.

They clashed with the myriad demonic gods.

But these demonic gods were all controlled by Li Fan.

Although splitting his consciousness too many times prevented perfect control over each demonic god, the sheer power of the massive demonic god collective, formed by absorbing the divine thoughts of numerous cultivators, easily crushed these resisters.

After all…

At this moment, Li Fan was not fighting alone.

He was manipulating the spirits and wills of hundreds of thousands of cultivators.

Combined with Li Fan’s combat awareness, which far surpassed that of ordinary cultivators, the general defenses of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance quickly collapsed and fell one after another.

Instead, he split into one demonic god after another, forcibly entering the minds of the Immortal Alliance cultivators who had lost their ability to resist.

They became nourishment for the bodies practicing the Divine Descent Body technique.

In no time, these bodies, stripped of their autonomous consciousness, would involuntarily summon demonic god avatar again.

Fighting to nurture more fighting, continuously splitting.

In just half a day, the number of demonic god avatar under Li Fan’s control had reached a terrifying level.

"What a tremendous force…"

Li Fan, sensing the immense power he currently wielded, felt a fleeting moment of awe, even with his vast experience and resolute mindset.

Although the gap between a Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign and an ordinary cultivator was as vast as the heavens and the abyss, when the number of ants reached a certain scale, it was enough to bridge that divide!

For instance, at this moment, after clashing divine senses with Mo Rubin, the Ancient Immortal Dharma King of the Xuantian Sect, Li Fan was certain that with the divine senses of over a million cultivators at his command, he could easily crush this Dharma King.

Li Fan even had a feeling that if he continued to expand like this, after absorbing the majority of the cultivators in the Xuanhuang Realm…

He might be able to confront a Dharma-Transmitter head-on and remaining undefeated.

Once this inner desire took root, it was nearly impossible to suppress.

Especially as the million illusory gods and demons he controlled seemed to sense Li Fan’s thoughts, all emitting faint whispers, attempting to seduce him.

Under normal circumstances, almost no cultivator could resist the temptation of ascending to the heavens in a single step.

At that point, whether the instigator of it all would ascend to immortality or fall into annihilation along with the world…

No one could know.

But Li Fan was different.

Firstly, he was protected by the Xuanhuang Immortal Heart Mantra. Secondly, beyond these million gods and demons, he wielded other powers of equal magnitude.

Moreover, he possessed [Truth], a transcendent existence above all else.

How could Li Fan abandon the root for the branch, losing his mind to a mere million gods and demons?

Let alone a million, even if there were ten million gods and demons or the power of a True Immortal, it would be a fool’s dream to tempt him to abandon [Truth]!

It could be said that [Truth] was Li Fan’s greatest spiritual anchor, ensuring he would never be swayed by external temptations or forget his original heart.

Unless, one day, he encountered an existence even greater than [Truth]…

At this moment, Li Fan’s expression was as cold as eternal ice. The power of the Dao Deviation Stone was pushed to its limit as he strove to control each god and demon.

His thoughts split into a million, placing an immense burden on the mid-grade Dao Deviation Stone.

However, with the assistance of Li Fan’s own vast divine sense, he barely managed to maintain basic control.

"If the numbers increase further, I’ll only be able to let them act on instinct. Without my precise control, they’d just be mindless beasts, and their combat strength would drop significantly. But they’d still be sufficient for causing chaos." Ȑ₳ɴȪΒÊŚ

Within half a day, chaos erupted across the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance’s territory.

The grassroots forces were almost entirely paralyzed.
