Each divine thought avatar possessed combat strength equivalent to the weakest Soul Transformation cultivator.

Even in the central four states of the Immortal Alliance, the number of Soul Transformation cultivators was not large.

Faced with the overwhelming onslaught of countless gods and demons, they could only choose to temporarily avoid the storm.

Soul Transformation cultivators acted this way, and those at the Dao Integration level were no different.

After all, their lives were their own, and reaching the Dao Integration realm was no easy feat.

With such a ferocious enemy assault, whoever rushed forward first would surely face a siege.

What if they fell?

…

The objective environment of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance led to the cultivators sharing nearly identical thoughts.

This also caused the million gods and demons controlled by Li Fan to feel, for a moment, as if they were entering an unmanned realm, invincible and unstoppable.

It seemed as though they were about to completely bring down the flourishing Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

Meanwhile.

At the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance headquarters.

In a boundless space, where everything in sight was a vast expanse of white.

A bolt of lightning erupted from the center of the space, followed by projections of worlds appearing one after another, illuminating every corner of the space.

The scenes varied: some featured endless mountain ranges hidden beneath a sea of clouds, others displayed boundless bamboo forests brimming with vibrant green, or majestic imperial palaces exuding grandeur, and even dreamlike vistas with towering buildings amidst a sea of neon lights.

In the projection of each world, there seemed to be a blurry human face.

They appeared in this pale, white space.

"Jiang, tell us what's going on," a somewhat frivolous voice rang out.

It came from the world of the boundless bamboo forest.

Following this, beams of light and shadow emerged one after another in the center of these world projections.

They all depicted scenes of gods and demons wreaking havoc, with the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance suffering greatly.

"That's the situation. These divine consciousness constructs appeared extremely suspiciously, with no prior warning, and they erupted suddenly."

"Except for the core administrative area of Tiancheng, nearly all regions have fallen."

A solemn voice spoke slowly, briefing the gathered Dharma Transmitters on the current state of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

The voice came from the world of the imperial palace.

"Interesting. So many divine consciousness constructs... could they be the lingering regrets of the cultivators who perished in the Xuanhuang Realm over the years?"

"Useless trash. They can't even organize a decent counterattack!"

"I don't think it's that they can't, but that they don't want to. A bunch of ungrateful wolves..."

The Dharma Transmitters spoke one after another, their tones uniformly relaxed, showing no trace of concern over the fall of the Immortal Alliance.

"Jiang, what do you think?"

The Dharma Transmitters suddenly fell silent, their gazes collectively turning toward an unremarkable world.

There were no splendid buildings, no magnificent natural scenery.

Only a void.

A solitary figure sat in the midst of that void.

Jiang's gaze remained fixed on the countless scenes in the center, ignoring the inquiries of the other Dharma Transmitters.

Yet the other Dharma Transmitters seemed to hold great respect for Jiang, all patiently waiting without showing the slightest dissatisfaction.

After an unknown amount of time, Dharma Transmitter Jiang spoke, "Behind these divine consciousness constructs, there is only one person."

"Find him, and this matter will be resolved."

At these words, the other Dharma Transmitters all showed expressions of surprise.

"Such power... even an ordinary Longevity Immortal Realm cultivator couldn't achieve this, right? Which one stooped to such sneaky tactics?"

"Wait, now that you mention it, I seem to recall something. Long ago, there was a technique in the Xuanhuang Realm that behaved remarkably similar to this."

"Hm?"

...

Regardless of the other Dharma Transmitters' reactions, Jiang continued his analysis, "As you all have said, someone with such strength would not act without purpose. Releasing these millions of gods and demons..."

"It's likely just a smokescreen to conceal his true objective."

"True objective?" Jiang's reasoning gained the agreement of most of the Dharma Transmitters. They began to ponder.

Some, perhaps thinking of something, showed subtle expressions on their faces.

Their gazes swept over the others present.

Dharma-Transmitter Jiang, without glancing sideways, continued, "No need for mutual suspicion."

"At this level of strength, the things one might covet are only a few."

"Whether they choose to fish in troubled waters or seize by force, we only need to address the source to resolve it."

“Oh? So, Jiang, you’re planning to personally take action and capture this petty scoundrel?”

In the Neon Sea World, the voice of a seven- or eight-year-old child rang out, filled with admiration.

“Not planning. Already done.”

The cold, indifferent voice of Jiang, the Dharma-Transmitter, echoed continuously in this pale space.

Upon hearing this, the shocked expressions on the faces of the other Dharma-Transmitters were utterly unmasked.

“This…”

“Brother Jiang is actually taking action himself?”

“Interesting. It seems he’s really intrigued by this divine demonic thoughts.”

“Indeed. Speaking of which, this is the first time since the founding of the Immortal Alliance that Jiang has left his [Returning Ruins World], isn’t it?”

“Quick, keep an eye on the latest live feed. I can’t wait to see Brother Jiang show his might!”

Like a boiling pot, the pale space erupted instantly.

The normally calm and composed Dharma-Transmitters now all wore expressions of excitement and eager anticipation.

In one of the small worlds resembling a mortal city, Dharma-Transmitter Feng, also known as Mo Rubin, felt a shadow cast over his heart.

…

“Be careful.”

Li Fan was currently controlling a million demonic avatars.

At that moment, one of the demonic avatars issued a faint warning.

But Li Fan, who held control over the entire situation, did not ignore it.

Instead, his expression instantly turned extremely serious.

“This is…”

“Mo Rubin?”

“He didn’t show himself directly but sent a covert warning.”

In an instant, Li Fan deduced the possible reason for this anomaly.

“A great enemy is coming!”

While alarm bells rang in his heart, Li Fan felt no trace of panic.

Instead, he was faintly excited.

After all, the power he currently wielded could rival a Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign. If he were to dissipate quietly without causing a grand commotion, it would feel somewhat regrettable! ᚱἈΝo͍ᛒΕS̩

“Let me see who it is that can make even the Xuantian Sect’s Dharma King so nervous.”

With a single step, Li Fan arrived before the Faceless True Immortal statue in the Spiritwood Realm.

His Calamity body, brimming with golden Vow-power power, slowly emerged.

It was cloaked in a layer of golden ropes woven into a garment.

The Calamity body stretched, forming a protective shield that enveloped Li Fan’s true self.

“With this, I am practically invincible.”

“Even if I lose, I’m afraid the entire Xuanhuang Realm would have to be buried with me!”

Li Fan’s eyes narrowed slightly as he sat cross-legged.

He calmly awaited the enemy’s arrival.

“It should be someone like Mo Rubin, tracing back to my sea of consciousness through a demonic avatar.”

“With the support of a million cultivators, how could I fear him?”

“However…”

Li Fan thought for a moment, and his mind instantly connected to the towering ancient tree in the Spiritwood Realm.

Through ceaseless formation refinement day and night, Li Fan’s control over the Spiritwood Realm was nearly absolute.

At this moment, his mind merged with the ancient tree, as if he had become one with the heavens and earth.

His consciousness intertwined with the Spiritwood Realm’s heavens and earth.

In this moment, Li Fan was the Spiritwood Realm, and the Spiritwood Realm was Li Fan!

“With a million cultivators and an entire small cultivation world…”

“Hmph, unless a Dharma-Transmitter comes in person…”

Having made all these preparations, a cold glint flashed in Li Fan’s eyes.

He was ready to strike.

His divine sense, sharp as a burning flame, soon detected a faint disturbance.

Just as he had anticipated, a certain presence had taken over one of the demonic avatars.

Following the connections of the intent network, it traced back toward him.

Slowly approaching Li Fan's sea of consciousness.

On Li Fan's side, he had already summoned the full power of the remaining million demon gods.

He was only waiting for the opponent to reveal their form, ready to deliver a thunderous strike.

However, when the great enemy in his mind finally appeared in Li Fan's sea of consciousness...

Li Fan did not choose to act!

"You are..."

Li Fan narrowed his eyes, looking at the other party.

A frail and delicate-looking youth, with a trace of refined charm still lingering on his face.

The youth's eyes were full of innocence and curiosity, observing his surroundings.

Li Fan, who had always been cautious and prudent, still did not make a move.

He allowed the youth to look around the scenes in his sea of consciousness.

"This feeling..."

An indescribable strange sensation surged in Li Fan's heart.

Looking at this youth before him, it was as if he were looking at himself.

No...

It seemed that this youth was none other than himself!

A wave of dizziness struck his mind, and countless memories suddenly surfaced.

Originally a child of an ordinary mortal family, he had the fortune to meet the Immortal Ancestor. Receiving his teachings, he later voluntarily spread the new method...

These were the memories he had lost due to injury...

"So that's it, I am the Transmitter Jiang."

"Could it be that I still have secrets from myself?"

Thoughts like these suddenly arose in Li Fan's mind.

Li Fan gradually lowered his guard.

The ferocious appearances of the myriad demon gods also softened.

The youth strolled leisurely, as if wandering in his own home, casually moving through Li Fan's sea of consciousness.

"Interesting. Each demon god is formed from a strand of consciousness."

"It can even occupy the bodies of other cultivators, swallowing their divine consciousness to strengthen its own power."

The youth nodded in amazement.

"The secret method of the Xuantian Sect, passed down from the Immortal Realm, is indeed extraordinary," Li Fan said with some pride.

The youth was slightly stunned, then his eyes flickered.

He began to examine Li Fan even more closely.

"Not bad, the True Immortal Technique is truly formidable!" the youth exclaimed, clapping his hands after a moment.

"Unfortunately, to achieve the goal, it's still a bit lacking," the youth said with some regret.

Li Fan nodded slightly, "Indeed. I don't know what happened with Mo Rubin. We had agreed that as long as he represented the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance to resolve this matter, I would cooperate and sacrifice all these demon gods, letting him claim great merit..."

"But this guy hasn't shown up. Something must have gone wrong."

"As expected of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, its foundations are unfathomably deep."

Li Fan narrowed his eyes, nodding thoughtfully.

Hearing Li Fan's words, the youth's expression finally shifted slightly.

A trace of solemnity appeared in his eyes as he continued, "What should we do about this?"

"If the million demon gods continue to wreak havoc, there's a risk of losing control if this goes on. It might be better to contact him first and find out the reason."

Li Fan waved his hand, revealing a chilling smile, "Heh, no matter. Even if he is exposed and dies, it won't affect me."

"Look at the power we now control, how vast it is! Losing control? That's nothing! It's not worth mentioning!"

Li Fan's face was full of confidence, "If things truly spiral out of control and the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance can't handle it, that would be even better."

"Given the importance the Immortal Ancestor places on the Xuanhuang Realm, it might even force him to reveal himself."

"At that time, with the power of the divine consciousness of a million cultivators, combined with the integrated consciousness of the Spiritwood Realm, I might not be unable to confront him head-on!"

Hearing this, the youth opened his mouth and was completely stunned.

"The Immortal Ancestor has attained the Dao for many years, and his strength is unfathomably profound. It’s best not to underestimate him."

"Not to mention a million cultivators, even if all the cultivators in the Xuanhuang Realm were gathered together, they might not be able to defeat the Immortal Ancestor."

After his initial shock, the seemingly shy young man quickly regained his composure. Clearing his throat, he offered this well-meaning advice.

"Hmm…"

"There’s some truth to that. After all, he’s an existence that has dominated the entire Xuanhuang Realm for thousands of years…"

Seemingly persuaded by the young man, the arrogance on Li Fan’s face faded, replaced by a gradually solemn expression.

"But there’s no need to fear him excessively."

"If he really pushes me too far, at worst, I’ll trigger the Immortal Ruins’ [Hunger] Immortal, and we’ll all perish together!"

Unexpectedly, after only a brief moment of calm, Li Fan’s tone shifted, and he spoke coldly.

In the Xuanhuang Realm, very few cultivators knew of the existence of the Immortal Ruins.

And those who knew that a True Immortal had passed away within the Immortal Ruins were even rarer.

He wasn’t sure about the Five Elders Association, but among the Dharma-Transmitters of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, only he knew of this matter.

It was something the Immortal Ancestor had personally told him years ago.

And now…

Dharma-Transmitter Jiang stared at the unremarkable cultivator before him, his thoughts racing as he speculated about the man’s origins.

"Someone who knows such a secret must have come into contact with powers beyond the Longevity Immortal Realm."

"The Xuantian Secret Techniques, a legacy from the Immortal Realm. It must be a remnant of the Xuantian Sect, no doubt about it."

"I never imagined that after all this time, the Xuantian Sect still lingers like an unyielding ghost. And they might have even infiltrated the upper echelons of the Immortal Alliance…" ŘＡƝộBĘS̩

While pondering, Dharma-Transmitter Jiang subtly guided Li Fan: "Unless it’s absolutely necessary, it’s best not to choose mutual destruction."

"After all, reaching the current situation was no easy feat. Wouldn’t it be a pity to give it up so easily?"

Li Fan nodded in agreement: "Seven years of planning in this world—if I were to abandon it just like that, I’d truly be reluctant."

Dharma-Transmitter Jiang’s heart trembled again: "Seven years of planning?"

"Only seven years?"

"How is that possible?!"

"When did our Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance become so easily infiltrated?"

Dharma-Transmitter Jiang was inwardly furious, and he once again scrutinized the Xuantian Sect cultivator before him.

"Or perhaps, is he deliberately deceiving me?"

Dharma-Transmitter Jiang couldn’t help but wonder.

But after observing for a while, he silently shook his head, dismissing his own suspicions.

"All Things Are Like Me" was not a technique or divine ability. It was an unparalleled innate trait he was born with.

Any living being that came into contact with him face-to-face would perceive him as "themselves."

Suspicion, secrets, and defenses—emotions typically reserved for others—would not arise when facing Dharma-Transmitter Jiang.

If their lives were threatened, they would instinctively protect him as they would their own lives.

Over thousands of years in the Xuanhuang Realm, Dharma-Transmitter Jiang had never encountered a being immune to this trait.

Even the Immortal Ancestor from back then was no exception!

Otherwise, how could he, with his unremarkable strength and talent, have steadily held the position of the foremost Dharma-Transmitter?

This ability was indeed extraordinarily powerful; to him, there were no enemies in the world. If he wished, he could uncover the secrets of nearly anyone.

If there was any flaw, it was that it only reached the level of "Like Me."

Not "For Me."

Indeed, almost all beings would not harbor suspicion toward "themselves."

But if they began to doubt the authenticity of the "self" that Dharma-Transmitter Jiang portrayed, they would still attack him.

Back then, the Immortal Ancestor saw through him in this way.

Therefore, he could only slowly extract information through various indirect methods. If he directly asked questions that the "true self" considered common knowledge, he risked being exposed.

Although there was this limitation, over the years, relying on this heaven-defying ability, he remained invincible. The number of cultivators who could truly see through him could be counted on one hand.

Other Dharma Transmitters were aware of his ability. Even with precautions, they were fundamentally unable to resist it.

They could only respect him from a distance.

For the sake of maintaining the overall order of the Dharma Transmitter group, he also voluntarily exiled himself to a blank small world called the Returning Ruins. From there, he remotely controlled many affairs of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

The cultivator before him, though mysterious and unpredictable, clearly could not escape the influence of his innate ability.

"What he said should all be true."

Making this judgment, Dharma Transmitter Jiang did not feel relieved. Instead, his heart grew even heavier.

"Seven years, seven years…"

Dharma Transmitter Jiang’s mind quickly sifted through all the events, big and small, that had occurred in the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance over the past seven years, trying to identify the traitor named Mo Rubin.

But the other party had obviously changed their name, leaving no clues whatsoever.

"It seems we still need to find a way through this person."

As Dharma Transmitter Jiang’s thoughts raced, he responded, "Indeed, spending seven years is no big deal. But if we miss this opportunity, who knows how long we’ll have to wait to start over."

"Heh, no matter. With [Truth] in hand, as long as it’s been achieved once, it can be replicated countless times…" Li Fan was speaking confidently when his words suddenly stopped.

He stared at Dharma Transmitter Jiang, his expression seemingly unchanged.

But Dharma Transmitter Jiang keenly sensed that the surrounding atmosphere had shifted!

"Hmm? Where did I reveal a flaw?"

"With [Truth] in hand, he can replicate a plan that was once achieved countless times?"

"What is [Truth]?"

"Could it be an immortal artifact left behind by the Xuantian Sect?"

In an instant, countless thoughts flashed through Dharma Transmitter Jiang’s mind.

However, he also realized he might have exposed himself. No longer bothering to conceal it, he seized the last moments while his innate ability was still effective and tried asking, "What is [Truth]?"

"What is [Truth]?"

…

The question echoed repeatedly in Li Fan’s sea of consciousness.

A gaze devoid of any emotion locked onto Dharma Transmitter Jiang.

Then, the million gods and demons that had been wreaking havoc and destruction across the Xuanhuang Realm all returned in an instant.

Evil aura soared to the heavens, and the ghostly domain descended once more!

Dharma Transmitter Jiang’s expression changed slightly. He tried to sever the connection and retreat from this sea of consciousness.

But it was already too late.

The million gods and demons all let out earth-shattering roars directed at Dharma Transmitter Jiang.

The roars converged like a monstrous wave, crashing down with the momentum to destroy everything!

Amid the onslaught of the million gods and demons, a faint, inconspicuous ray of seven-colored divine light shot out.

It collided with Dharma Transmitter Jiang’s consciousness.

In the moment of contact, the Seven-colored Divine Light silently dissolved, injecting a trace of gray mold into Dharma Transmitter Jiang’s consciousness.

"If you want to pry into my secrets, you must be prepared to pay a steep price."

Not to mention the "Like Me" ability that catches first-time observers off guard, the actual combat strength of the Dharma-Transmitter Jiang was not as formidable as Li Fan had imagined.

At the very least, without even using his many hidden cards, Li Fan easily defeated him by relying solely on the collective divine consciousness of a million gods and demons!

"Even if he doesn't die, he's gravely injured!"

More crucially, there was the gray mold spot that Li Fan had sent into the opponent's divine consciousness!

Previously cultivated by Li Fan using the flesh of exotic beasts and sealed with the Seven-Colored Divine Light, this fragmented miniature mold spot was finally unleashed by Li Fan as a world-destroying weapon.

Indeed, Li Fan had genuinely fallen into the trap unknowingly before!

He had truly believed himself to be the Dharma-Transmitter.

Fortunately, he always spoke in vague, cryptic terms. So, during the process of being interrogated by the opponent, he did reveal many of his secrets.

He exposed the fact that he was in the Spiritwood Realm. However, the Spiritwood Realm was a name Li Fan had given to this small world, unknown to the outside world.

With countless small worlds in the Xuanhuang Realm, which one was the Spiritwood Realm?

The million gods and demons, though derived from the [Three Disasters and Hundred Tribulations Divine Clarity Method] calculated through the Law Derivative Jade, were merely a transformation in form.

Their fundamental prototype was the [Three Perils of Ghosts and Spirits in the Netherworld Record]. So, claiming they were a secret technique of Xuantian or an inheritance from the Immortal Realm was not wrong.

He revealed that Mo Rubin had infiltrated the upper echelons of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, but the opponent only knew the name Mo Rubin.

As for who Mo Rubin was...

With so many people in the Immortal Alliance headquarters, let them guess one by one.

He exposed that he knew of the existence of the [Hunger] Immortal within the Immortal Ruins and that he had the ability to drag the Xuanhuang Realm down with him...

This was not necessarily a bad thing. On the contrary, it served as an intangible deterrent.

The truly fatal revelation was that Li Fan had exposed the existence of [Truth].

This was also why, upon regaining clarity, Li Fan immediately released the gray mold spot, which had been sealed for a long time, as a counterattack.

As for why he didn’t immediately use [Truth]...

Li Fan carefully recalled the opponent's reaction at the time.

"There was more doubt than shock or surprise."

"He only knows I have [Truth] but doesn’t know its specific use."

"Of course, it’s not impossible that he might realize it soon after."

"The premise is that he can stay alive."

Li Fan pondered for a long time and decided to observe the situation quietly, watching how the Xuanhuang Realm would develop next.

After all, his mind was now united with the heavens and earth of the Spiritwood Realm. If a great enemy came knocking, he had ample time to calmly activate [Truth].

"As for those million thought gods and demons, they truly cannot be kept."

Facing this immensely powerful force, Li Fan did not hesitate and issued a recall command.

From the countless gods and demons in his sea of consciousness, silver threads flew out. These represented the will energy that dominated and controlled these gods and demons.

After Li Fan extracted them, what remained were mere empty shells.

Although they still possessed combat strength barely equivalent to the Soul Transformation level, they were mindless, acting purely on instinct, and no longer had Li Fan’s commands to expand or multiply.

For the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance to suppress them, though it would still require some effort, the cost would not be as great.

At the last moment, Li Fan informed Mo Rubin of his decision.

Then, he completely severed his connection with these gods and demons.

"Using the sea of consciousness of a million cultivators as a breeding ground, in such a short time, the strength of my divine consciousness has nearly doubled."

After retracting his consciousness energy, Li Fan examined it and couldn't help but sigh softly.

"Truly a supreme technique, but unfortunately, it cannot be used often."

"Next, let’s see how the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance will deal with the remaining gods and demons, as well as that deadly gray mold."

"I hope they can hold on for a few more years."

Li Fan settled in the Spiritwood Realm without moving, only closely monitoring the changes in the Xuanhuang Realm through the believers of the True Immortal of Salvation and Mortal Compassion.

At the headquarters of the Immortal Alliance, in the Realm of Returning Ruins.

The Dharma Transmitter Jiang, who had been defeated by Li Fan, reappeared in physical form.

At this moment, his appearance was vastly different from the youthful figure he once had.

His face was like cracked earth, covered with countless fissures.

His hair had turned completely gray.

Even more terrifying, parts of his flesh had become blurry and indistinct.

With a writhing motion, they simply vanished from the world.

Despite his utmost efforts to hold on, Dharma Transmitter Jiang was nearly riddled with holes.

Yet, he did not seek help from other Dharma Transmitters.

Because he knew that the gray mold causing all this was highly contagious.

If he had not made himself a cage, barely containing it with all the power within his body; if this were not the Realm of Returning Ruins, where there was nothing but him and absolute emptiness, leaving no path for the gray mold to spread...

The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, and even the entire Xuanhuang Realm, would likely have already been plunged into devastation.

As his life neared its end, for some reason, there was not a trace of fear on Dharma Transmitter Jiang’s face.

He remained extremely calm, analyzing: "The immortal seal script is very similar in structure to the [Chaos] character. They should share the same origin..."

"Could it be that the calamity back then was related to the Xuantian Sect? Impossible..."

Dharma Transmitter Jiang’s face was filled with too many doubts and questions.

Not long after, he was completely consumed by the gray mold.

All that remained was a large, writhing gray-yellow shadow, attempting to spread outward.

But the Realm of Returning Ruins contained only absolute emptiness.

Thus, the gray mold could only be trapped in this small world.

It lingered, unable to advance.

After an unknown amount of time.

A powerful fluctuation swept through the Realm of Returning Ruins at a steady pace.

The gray mold seemed to sense something, boiling like water and surging violently.

Then it rapidly expanded outward.

It was as if it formed a massive gray-yellow sheet, attempting to engulf the entire Realm of Returning Ruins.

But something strange happened.

Wherever the fluctuation passed, the gray mold, of unknown origin and faintly capable of destroying an entire cultivation world, something even Li Fan deeply feared, vanished inch by inch in an instant!

The Realm of Returning Ruins also returned to its previous state of pure emptiness.

No...

Besides the emptiness, there was something else in the Realm of Returning Ruins.

Without any warning, Dharma Transmitter Jiang, who should have already died, reappeared in the Realm of Returning Ruins!

He seemed unsurprised by his resurrection.

But as he looked around, a trace of astonishment appeared on his face: "This time’s [Return to Origin], it left no information at all?"

"What exactly did I encounter?"

"Even the information itself can be corrupted?"

As Dharma Transmitter Jiang murmured to himself, everything happening now, as well as all the events recorded in the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, surfaced in his mind.

"Failed to catch the culprit and was killed instead."

"Interesting."

The Dharma Transmitter Jiang paused for a moment in thought, but without hesitation, he left the Immortal Alliance headquarters and headed straight for the rampaging gods and demons in the world.

Even though he knew that what awaited him might still be death, he showed no trace of hesitation.

After all, as the First Dharma Transmitter, he had already "died" countless times.

Fortunately, thanks to the methods left by the Immortal Ancestor, as long as the Xuanhuang Realm remained intact and the Immortal Ancestor’s principles unchanged, he, who existed as an extension of the Immortal Ancestor, would never be destroyed.

His state was forever fixed at that initial moment in time, and as long as he wished, he could always [Return to Origin].

Not only him but also the entire Realm of Returning Ruins where he resided was the same.

This was a safeguard left by the Immortal Ancestor for the Xuanhuang Realm.

It allowed him to fearlessly face death while resolving various issues that might arise in the Xuanhuang Realm. Through repeated deaths, his experience and ability to handle situations continued to improve, making him increasingly adept at dealing with matters.

If he encountered something he truly could not handle, he would use his body as a vessel to bring it back to the Realm of Returning Ruins.

The power of [Return to Origin] in the Realm of Returning Ruins was something the Immortal Ancestor comprehended after nearly a thousand years of divine wandering beyond the heavens, upon re-establishing the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

The Immortal Ancestor once told him that even the dangers of True Immortal Seal Script could be neutralized invisibly through repeated [Return to Origin].

"No information was left behind. This has only happened twice before."

"It seems that behind this turmoil, it’s either another True Immortal Seal Script or…"

Dharma Transmitter Jiang glanced toward the eastern border of the Xuanhuang Realm.

With a cold snort, he continued on his way.

Encountering a rampaging god-demon, Dharma Transmitter Jiang immediately subdued it.

Then, he sent a wisp of divine consciousness into it.

Moments later, the ferocious god-demon exploded with a boom.

Dharma Transmitter Jiang frowned slightly, "Just an empty shell left? It escaped quickly."

Next, Dharma Transmitter Jiang tested more than a dozen other gods and demons.

All were the same.

"Clearly victorious, yet still so cautious…"

"What exactly is their purpose?"

This unknown adversary made Dharma Transmitter Jiang feel a rare sense of pressure, something he hadn’t experienced in a long time.

It was as if he saw a thick, dark cloud slowly approaching from the horizon.

It threatened to cover the entire sky of the Xuanhuang Realm.

"Forget it. First, let's deal with these anomalies before us."

"Wait for them to slip up again, then handle it accordingly."

"If there’s truly no other way…"

"Then I’ll have to seek help from the Immortal Ancestor."

With these thoughts, Dharma Transmitter Jiang crushed another demon god to pieces.

Next, instead of continuing to act personally, he returned to the Realm of Returning Ruins and issued an order from the Immortal Alliance headquarters to thoroughly eradicate the gods and demons plaguing various regions.

The gods and demons had spread like a plague, nearly paralyzing the Immortal Alliance’s grassroots defense forces.

To resolve this crisis quickly and thoroughly, a powerful and authoritative figure was needed to lead the effort.

As the First Dharma Transmitter, Jiang naturally would not take on the task himself.

After inquiring among the other Dharma Transmitters, only a few were willing to take on this arduous task.

Ultimately, after some deliberation, Dharma Transmitter Jiang decided to entrust the matter to Dharma Transmitter Feng.

Firstly, Feng had left a favorable impression on Jiang previously. Secondly, Jiang believed that this relatively young Dharma Transmitter needed more opportunities to gain experience.

"If the second Returning Ruins Realm is established, it might not be impossible to consider him as a successor, provided he passes the trial," Dharma Transmitter Jiang thought to himself.

Dharma Transmitter Feng, also known as Mo Rubin, the Dharma King of the Xuantian Sect, began issuing orders one by one upon receiving the command.

With the official orders from the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, those Soul Transformation and Dao Integration cultivators who had previously cowered and focused only on self-preservation were now forced to step forward and actively eliminate the rampaging demon gods.

Working in tandem with the black-robed cultivators from another era, they quickly began to eradicate the million demon and gods, who had lost their central control and were significantly weakened in combat strength.

As the saying goes, illness comes like a landslide, but recovery is like spinning silk.

From the sudden outbreak to the calamity affecting the entire Immortal Alliance, the demon and god disaster took only half a day.

Yet, it took the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance more than half a month to gradually eliminate these demon gods.

After all the demon god avatars were eradicated, the real problem emerged.

What to do with the cultivators who had been possessed by the demon gods and had lost their sanity?

With the demon god avatars destroyed, these cultivators had almost all become mindless idiots.

Logically, slaughtering all these cultivators would neatly resolve the disaster.

However, an order from the highest decision-making level of the Immortal Alliance strictly forbade anyone from harming these cultivators' lives without authorization.

Those who, out of vengeance, killed some of these cultivators faced severe punishment.

"Even if they are guilty, until their crimes are officially judged, they remain members of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance."

"Harming them is a violation of the Immortal Alliance's laws."

With such a clear statement, no cultivator would dare to defy the order and slaughter these now-defenseless, mindless cultivators.

Instead, following the orders, they were all escorted to the Immortal Alliance headquarters to await judgment.

This process lasted more than ten days.

The demon god disaster was finally completely quelled.

The surviving cultivators praised the benevolence of the Immortal Alliance.

As a reward for the cultivators who contributed to resolving the disaster, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance generously granted them substantial contribution points.

The rewards far exceeded those of ordinary missions, and the scope of the rewards surpassed everyone's expectations.

Even those who did not fight but merely provided information on the demon gods' locations received significant contribution points.

This caused those cultivators who had chosen to stand by and watch to beat their chests in regret.

The cultivators who received the rewards and suddenly became wealthy flocked to the Tianxuan Mirror to select the items they needed.

At this time, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance issued another announcement, stating that the cause of the demon god disaster had been identified.

The affected cultivators had mostly been unable to afford their desired cultivation techniques due to their high prices, leading to accumulated resentment.

Over time, this resentment allowed an evil ancient ferocious deity to bewitch them, turning them into its pawns.

To prevent such a tragedy from happening again, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, after deep reflection, decided that from this day forward, all cultivation techniques sold in the Tianxuan Mirror would be reduced by one-third in price.

The announcement caused an uproar.

A one-third price reduction was no small matter.

Especially for more expensive techniques, the saved contribution points were significant.

With their newfound wealth, the cultivators went into a frenzy.

No longer focusing on ordinary resources, they turned their attention to the countless cultivation techniques available.

Spiritwood Realm.

“Hm? Why hasn’t the gray mold spot exploded yet?” After waiting for nearly a month without hearing any news, Li Fan could not help but feel puzzled.

“There’s no reason for this.”

Thinking over everything carefully again, Li Fan concluded that the problem could only lie with that Dharma-Transmitter.

“As expected of one of the highest rulers of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, a being who has survived since the ancient great calamity.”

“Although still inferior to that ‘Hunger’ character above the Immortal Ruins, the destructive power of the gray mold spot should still exceed that of an ordinary Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign…”

“To be able to dissolve it so easily and quietly…”

“Hmm, perhaps the correct method of using the gray mold spot is to first let it secretly devour from various parts of the Xuanhuang Realm, and then make it erupt from multiple points at once.”

While Li Fan, who was well-versed in medicine, was silently pondering this, the only divine thought demon he had left behind, now possessed by Mo Rubin—finally sent a message, arriving late as always.

“Who? Where did this petty thief come from!” Li Fan pretended to have forgotten who the other party was.

Without another word, he prepared to attack.

However, without the support of countless divine demons, Li Fan’s current divine sense was clearly no match for Mo Rubin.

Mo Rubin defended himself while trying to awaken the memories of “Sun Xingwang.”

After acting for a while, as the empty sea of consciousness flickered, a Faceless Stone Statue slowly emerged, radiating a faint golden glow.

Li Fan gradually stopped attacking.

He stared at Mo Rubin for a while, his expression unreadable. “You finally came.”

“Hmph, brother, we almost never saw each other again.”

Li Fan’s tone grew sharp, eyes glaring. “Didn’t we agree that once the time came, you’d personally show up to handle the extermination of the divine demons? Why then did a cunning young man appear instead?”

“If it weren’t for the protection of the True Immortal of Salvation and Mortal Compassion at the crucial moment, I would’ve fallen for his trick and revealed every secret!”

“Or is this what you wanted all along? To borrow another’s blade to kill?”

A trace of killing intent surfaced on Li Fan’s face.

Mo Rubin’s expression tightened. “Brother Xingwang, don’t misunderstand! I never expected that the Dharma-Transmitter Jiang would take action personally!”

“The commotion you caused was simply too great. It nearly shook the Xuanhuang Realm itself.”

“I was honestly startled at that time.”

There was a hint of helplessness in Mo Rubin’s tone.

“Hm? So you’re saying this was my fault?”

Although the sea of consciousness had been bright a moment ago, after that line, Mo Rubin suddenly felt a chill.

To prevent the other from losing control, he quickly changed the subject. “By the way, Brother Xingwang, how did you manage to repel him? From his later behavior, it seems he returned empty-handed.”

Li Fan said impatiently, “I already told you. It was under the protection of the True Immortal of Salvation and Mortal Compassion! Otherwise, I might’ve truly believed that I was him and he was me!”

At that, Mo Rubin finally confirmed that “Sun Xingwang” had indeed escaped from the hands of Dharma-Transmitter Jiang.

After all, only the other Immortal Ancestors knew the true nature of Jiang.

Mo Rubin glanced, seemingly unintentionally, at the stone statue above that was gradually fading away, lost in thought.

“However, our ultimate objective has already been achieved. This time, I resolved the crisis of rampaging gods and demons. According to tradition, the major affairs of the Immortal Alliance will be handled by me for a period of time.”

“So it is time,” Mo Rubin said, “to once again pressure the Xuantian Treasure Mirror.”

Li Fan waved his hand lightly. “Same as always. You think of a plan. If you need my help, just say the word.”

Mo Rubin smiled. “Brother Xingwang, this time you do not need to take action again. Just wait patiently. When there is progress, I will contact you.”

“This meeting was mainly to confirm your situation. After all, that Dharma-Transmitter Jiang, is truly difficult to deal with. I have always avoided direct confrontation with him...” Mo Rubin’s tone carried a hint of gravity.

“Tell me in detail about this Dharma-Transmitter, so that next time I meet him, I won’t be caught off guard again,” Li Fan said, following the thread of conversation.

“Originally, on the day he made his move, I wanted to warn you. But at that time, the Dharma-Transmitter Assembly was in session, and sending even a simple warning was already the limit.”

“Dharma-Transmitter Jiang is the foremost among all Dharma-Transmitters. He possesses the supreme trait known as ‘All Things Are Like Me.’”

“That Returning Ruins Realm was left behind by the Immortal Ancestor, capable of infinitely returning to the Origin.”

“Besides Dharma-Transmitter Jiang, Dharma-Transmitting Immortal Jiang (another one) is also a very difficult opponent.”[1]

This time, Mo Rubin did not conceal anything. He explained everything he knew about the various Dharma-Transmitters in full detail.

“What must be noted is that, aside from Dharma-Transmitter Jiang who never hides anything, all other Dharma-Transmitters possess their own hidden secrets.”

“After all, having controlled the supreme power of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance for so many years, they command nearly limitless resources.”

“Who knows what strange things they have developed in secret. For example, that Sky-Patrolling Arrow from before was a complete design provided by Dharma-Transmitter Zhao.”

...

Through this conversation, Li Fan not only understood the reason why the Gray Mold plague had not erupted, but also, for the first time, obtained considerable intelligence regarding the Dharma-Transmitters who had always operated from behind the scenes.

Each Dharma-Transmitting Immortal was a true privileged class within the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance. Their annual contribution quotas were virtually unlimited, and their merit ranks reached the Forty-ninth derivative grade, the absolute highest level.

They only participated in the contribution and merit systems to maintain the appearance of fairness within the Alliance.

The Dharma-Transmitters existed dependent upon the Xuanhuang Realm and the Dao established by the Immortal Ancestor. Although they could no longer attain True Immortality, they still shared life with Heaven and Earth, remaining undying and ageless.

Moreover, it was said that even if they perished for some reason, they could, through a certain restorative backup method, once again descend into the world.

Of course, since the founding of the Immortal Alliance, no Dharma-Transmitter Immortal had ever been attacked or fallen, so Mo Rubin could not confirm whether this was true.

There were altogether eighteen seats among the Dharma-Transmitters, unchanged since the establishment of the Immortal Alliance and they would never change in the future.

They were the true upper echelon of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance. Any so-called regulations or decrees of the Alliance had no effect on them.

Only resolutions made within the Dharma-Transmitting Assembly itself could influence them.

They possessed privileges that ordinary cultivators could not even imagine.

For example: Conscription.

Within the territory of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, if a Dharma-Transmitter Immortal took interest in any cultivator, regardless of reason, they had the authority to summon that cultivator into their own small world.

Once chosen, the cultivator would vanish completely, as if evaporated from the human realm.

No records of them would remain anywhere.

For thousands of years, the Dharma-Transmitters had always acted in this way.

[1]:- These are two distinct individuals sharing similar surnames "Jiǎng" and "Jiāng" are homophones but different characters.

“Within the Dharma-Transmitter’s small world, cultivators can also enjoy the same agelessness. Even the Dharma-Transmitter Feng, whose body I currently occupy, though he is the least interested in gathering talents, still has over a thousand true geniuses within his small world.”

“One can only imagine how deep the foundations of the other Dharma-Transmitters must be.”

Mo Rubin sighed emotionally.

Hearing this, Li Fan could not help but picture a vivid scene.

The Xuanhuang Realm was like a great field. For thousands of years, its cultivators had grown like crops, generation after generation.

The ordinary ones were harvested, while the true essence among them was carefully preserved by those Dharma-Transmitters.

“No wonder the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance’s trump cards seem endless. Every lifetime brings me new surprises.”

“And this is only the lineage of the Dharma-Transmitters. The Immortal Alliance also has the Mirror Holders and the Illusory Truth Sages—two parallel branches…”

“Compared to them, even the Five Elders Association appears somewhat…”

Mo Rubin nodded in agreement. “If Xuantian King were to return, he would surely purge them all.”

Li Fan did not respond. Instead, he feigned confusion. “King Xuantian… King Xuantian… that name feels so familiar…”

Seeing Li Fan sink once again into a momentary daze, Mo Rubin could only shake his head helplessly.

“Fortunately, it’s only intermittent—it won’t affect the grand plan.”

With that thought, Mo Rubin patiently “awakened” Li Fan again, giving him instructions on what to do should further developments arise.

Only then did he leave Li Fan’s divine sense space.

After a long while, Li Fan finally dropped his act and returned to normal.

“Dharma-Transmitter Jiang must have perished along with that gray mold-like corruption. No wonder there’s been no attack—it seems I’ve escaped unscathed.”

“However, it seems that Jiang’s innate nature was transformed from a remnant immortal artifact of the Xuanhuang Realm. There’s no real method to guard against such a thing. Even if I knew beforehand, I couldn’t resist its influence…”

Even though Li Fan was protected by the Xuanhuang Immortal Heart Mantra, the Dharma-Transmitter Jiang’s innate nature seemed to alter his very essence and attributes, rather than simply confusing his mind or senses—since the Immortal Heart Mantra’s protection was never triggered at all.

“Before the great calamity of that era, all immortal artifacts in the Xuanhuang Realm vanished without a trace in an instant. I didn’t expect that some might have transformed into living beings.”

“How interesting…”

Since he had not truly been exposed, there was no need to reveal himself now.

This life’s plan had to continue as intended.

Still, Li Fan remained vigilant, his divine sense connected with the Spiritwood Realm at all times.

For all he knew, that Dharma-Transmitter Jiang might even deceive his own allies—perhaps this was all part of a diversionary scheme.

Li Fan decided to keep observing.

For now, there was only one thing to do: wait.

During his earlier discussion with Mo Rubin, he had mentioned whether it might be possible to further strengthen the Xuantian Nether-Lock Formation, in order to pressure the Xuantian Treasure Mirror even more.

Neither “Sun Xingwang” nor Mo Rubin were skilled in formations, and the formation masters of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance’s Formation Hall could not be fully trusted either.

Thus, they would need to rely on external tools.

Perhaps because he knew they would also need to repair the Floating Starry Sky Formation in the future, Mo Rubin thought for a moment, then agreed that Li Fan’s reasoning made sense.

After agreeing to return, he began searching to see if there were any rare treasures capable of deducing formations.

"If I can absorb the Nine-Discs-in-One Dissociation Disc, my ability to deduce formations will undergo another qualitative leap."

"At that time, even the Reversing of Life and Death Grand Formation might be easily deciphered by me. Perhaps then, I can uncover the true identity of that Life and Death Heavenly Sovereign."

…

Li Fan’s plan to remain seated in the Spiritwood Realm was abruptly brought to an end half a month later by an unexpected message from Lin Ling.

Although she was already a Dao Integration cultivator, her voice was filled with childlike panic. "M-Master, the Senior Stone Tablet… he’s gone!"

"The small pond also disappeared along with him!"

Li Fan’s heart trembled as he stood up sharply.

The Supreme Treasured Fishing Pond and the Senior Stone Tablet were both gone?

What was going on?

Feeling a surge of anxiety, Li Fan was about to rush toward the small mountain temple.

However, as he recalled some of Lin Ling’s earlier behavior, he suddenly halted his steps.

He transmitted his voice calmly. "Why panic? With the strength of the Senior Stone Tablet, who in the Xuanhuang Realm could possibly harm him?"

"Describe exactly what happened at the time."

"Yes, Master." Lin Ling, still flustered, began to recount the strange events that had occurred.

She said that ever since the Senior Stone Tablet sat by the fishing pond to comprehend the Dao, he had remained motionless, like a sculpture.

Out of respect and awe for him, both Lin Ling and the young Daoist child, Liuli, had always kept a good distance away.

But as time passed, their courage gradually grew.

They discovered that even when they got close, there was no reaction from the Senior Stone Tablet.

So they occasionally approached to observe this mysterious figure more closely.

At first, Lin Ling had been afraid, but after being pulled along by Liuli and seeing that nothing happened—she became increasingly bold.

"Big Sister Lin Ling, the closer you are to the Senior Stone Tablet, the greater the benefits," Liuli said, plopping down on the ground, gazing up greedily at him.

Lin Ling also felt that there was a peculiar Dao rhythm fluctuating around the Senior Stone Tablet.

It seemed to resonate with the world’s laws themselves, and within moments, many fragmented scenes appeared naturally in her mind.

Profound and mysterious, they touched upon the principles of heaven and earth.

Even for her, a cultivator with the power of Dao Integration, it was of immense benefit.

"I later realized that Senior Stone Tablet had reached the most crucial point in comprehending the Dao of Fishing. That was why the world’s laws resonated with him…"

"But at that time, I was too absorbed in the enlightenment’s benefits to notice."

"Not long ago, that Dao rhythm suddenly became turbulent. The feeling…"

"Was like calm waters suddenly being struck by a great storm!"

There was fear in Lin Ling’s voice.

"In the fishing pond, it felt as if something was forcefully pulling from below."

"Without any warning, the Senior Stone Tablet was dragged a step forward."

"His expression was strange—both delighted and terrified."

"It was as if an invisible line tied him to something within the pond. The two struggled fiercely, neither willing to let go."

"Then…"

Lin Ling paused, her face pale with dread. "All of a sudden, the Senior Stone Tablet was pulled straight into the pond and vanished before our eyes!"

"What was even more terrifying was that afterward, we discovered the Fishing Pond had lost all its function."

After hearing Lin Ling’s account, Li Fan’s wariness toward her lessened by more than half.

Such an unbelievable event...It did not seem like something she could have made up.

As he imagined the scene of the Senior Stone Tablet being “fished away,” even with Li Fan’s current state of mind, he could not help but feel a chill crawl up his spine.

When you gaze into the abyss, the abyss also gazes back at you.

When you are fishing, how can you be sure that you are not the one being fished?

“To connect the inside and outside of the High Wall... this so-called supreme treasure, the Fishing Pond, is far deeper than it appears.”

Li Fan pondered for a moment and decided he could not rely solely on Lin Ling’s words. He had to see it with his own eyes.

With that thought, Li Fan concealed his presence and quickly made his way toward Yongyun Prefecture.

When he arrived at the small temple, neither Zhong Shentong, Liuli, nor Lin Ling had yet recovered from the terror of witnessing the Senior Stone Tablet vanish before their eyes.

“Master, you are here.” Seeing Li Fan arrive, Lin Ling rushed forward as if she had finally found her anchor.

Zhong Shentong also gathered himself and offered a respectful bow.

Li Fan only nodded slightly, then strode toward where the Fishing Pond had once been.

The once-calm water now held only utter nothingness.

Like the Congyun annihilated by Ink Death, it was pitch black.

Even space itself no longer existed.

The faint aura of danger emanating from it made Li Fan frown slightly and quietly take a step back.

“The Fishing Pond truly is overbearing, forming a world of its own. After occupying a region of the Xuanhuang Realm, it expelled every other law that once existed here—or rather, directly compressed and obliterated them.”

“And with the Fishing Pond’s disappearance, the territory it had occupied is now revealed. It may take decades of the Xuanhuang Realm’s own recovery before this place returns to normal.”

While pondering, Li Fan carefully probed the area for any lingering traces of energy.

He had not expected to find much, yet to his surprise, he truly did discover something.

“This is...”

Li Fan’s eyes flickered, but he maintained an expression of disappointment, pretending he had found nothing.

Using the excuse that this place was dangerous, he brought Lin Ling and the others back to the Spiritwood Realm.

After settling them there, Li Fan quietly returned alone.

He closed his eyes and recalled the sensation he had experienced when merging with the Canghai Pearl—a perspective of heaven and earth, existing within a formless and boundless killing intent.

Points of light began to appear amid the darkness.

A resplendent scene unfolded before Li Fan’s inner vision.

Outside the void where the Fishing Pond had once been, countless fine threads stretched and intertwined, almost imperceptible to the naked eye.

The number of threads increased steadily, visibly growing with every passing moment.

It was as if an invisible loom was weaving something within the void.

This sight was almost identical to what Li Fan had once seen within the Root of Heaven and Earth, when the Five Elements Cave Heaven was first being created.

Heaven and earth were once again creating in their own way.

And the object being formed at this very moment...

“The Genesis Stone Tablet.” Li Fan’s eyes snapped open, gleaming with astonishment.

That embryonic form—it was unmistakably identical to the one carried on the back of the Senior Stone Tablet, the Genesis Stone Tablet said to record every event that had occurred in the Xuanhuang Realm since the dawn of creation.

As his heart trembled, Li Fan’s thoughts spun rapidly, and he immediately deduced why the Genesis Stone Tablet had reappeared here.

The Genesis Stone Tablet was the manifestation of the laws of the Xuanhuang Realm itself. In a sense, it was the very essence of the Xuanhuang Realm.

Naturally, the world itself could not be taken away by the unknown existence lurking in the depths of the Fishing Pond.

Thus, although the Senior Stone Tablet had vanished, the Genesis Stone Tablet he carried remained behind due to the world’s inertia.

“It seems that Senior has finally fulfilled his wish and regained his freedom.”

“I just wonder what lies on the other side of the Fishing Pond.”

Imagining what might exist beyond the Great High Wall, Li Fan fell into brief contemplation. Then he shook his head and refocused his attention on the ever-clearer outline of the Genesis Stone Tablet.

This tablet was undoubtedly the supreme treasure of the Xuanhuang Realm.

Once refined, countless secrets once hidden within the Xuanhuang Realm would be laid bare before him.

Perhaps he might even ascend in a single step and attain true immortality.

But such immortality would be bound deeply to the Xuanhuang Realm itself.

Moreover, Li Fan had witnessed the torment that the Senior Stone Tablet had endured; compared to that agony, even death seemed like a form of release.

More importantly, Li Fan feared that this object might have a mind-affecting influence, much like Ruomu or Mr. Bai of the Heavenly Dao.

If that happened, he might again fall into a state of “truly willing yet unwilling.”

And in the end, he would bear the weight of the tablet for all eternity.

“Judging from my experience fighting Mr. Bai of the Heavenly Dao, even a clone cannot escape the influence on one’s mind.”

“It seems I must find a suitable successor to inherit the Genesis Stone Tablet.”

“The candidate must possess a will strong enough not to go mad instantly, yet still be someone I can control.”

Figures of various cultivators flickered rapidly through Li Fan’s mind.

He knew that time was running short.

Heaven and earth were reweaving the Genesis Stone Tablet, like a tree forming its fruit.

The moment the tablet fully took shape would be the instant the fruit fell to the ground.

By then, it would return somewhere within the Xuanhuang Realm and become nearly impossible to find again.

“It shall be him.”

Li Fan finally settled on his target. Seven-colored divine light flared around him as he transformed into a rainbow streak and shot straight toward the Congyun Sea.

Not long after, he found the cultivator he sought—Sima Changkong, who carried the bloodline of his clan and recorded the history of the Xuanhuang Realm.

In this life, Sima Changkong had never met Li Fan, so he was startled by the sudden visit.

However, Li Fan had not come to seek his consent.

Without a word, he subdued Sima Changkong and swiftly returned with him to the small temple in Yongyun Prefecture.

On the way, he briefly explained the situation.

“Now, there is a chance for you to behold the entire history of the Xuanhuang Realm. Do you accept it?” Li Fan asked in a deep voice.

For Sima Changkong, who had devoted his family’s generations to recording the history of the Xuanhuang Realm, there was no reason to refuse.

All events within the Xuanhuang Realm would forever unfold unceasingly in his mind.

To Sima Changkong, this was not torment.

It was an almost ecstatic, perfect ability—something the Sima family had dreamed of for generations.

At least, before he truly absorbed the tablet, Sima Changkong believed so.

“To record the history of the Xuanhuang Realm, who but I is worthy?”

“Fellow Daoist, please grant me this chance!”

Taking a deep breath, Sima Changkong bowed respectfully to Li Fan.

Though he did not know how Li Fan had discovered his identity, if what he said was true, Sima Changkong was willing to give up everything for it.

“Good.”

Li Fan replied firmly.

“Wait for the right moment.”

Seven days later, just as the Genesis Stone Tablet was about to fully form, Li Fan let out a low shout and cast the divine ability “Extracting Thread” upon Sima Changkong.

Sima Changkong’s body began to split inch by inch, unraveling into countless threads that drifted away into the air.

The divine ability [Extracting Threads] was one Li Fan comprehended when he was transformed into a thread-like figure within the Root of Heaven and Earth. It traced all things back to their origin, returning to the primordial nothingness of creation itself.

In Li Fan’s vision, the horizontal and vertical threads weaving the Genesis Stone Tablet became increasingly dense. This signified that the supreme treasure of heaven and earth was about to be fully formed.

Li Fan guided the process, attempting to connect the silk threads drawn from Sima Changkong’s body with the Genesis Stone Tablet.

In truth, Li Fan was far from certain. This was the first time he had ever witnessed the true Genesis Stone Tablet in person. Still, to simply watch it vanish before his eyes would be too great a loss.

He decided to try.

To his surprise, as Sima Changkong’s body-thread neared the stone tablet, it was drawn in by a strange suction force.

The lines tightened instantly, spiraling into the weave of the tablet.

It was as if a ball of yarn had been completely unraveled in an instant. Sima Changkong’s body utterly dissipated.

The Stone Tablet flickered faintly, its surface now tainted by a trace of dust.

When the Tablet reappeared from the recreated heaven and earth, no grand phenomenon manifested. The ancient, bluish-gray stone looked unremarkable, floating quietly in midair.

Perhaps due to the pull of the silk thread once formed from Sima Changkong, the Genesis Stone Tablet did not drift elsewhere.

It remained suspended within the small mountain shrine. Li Fan’s attempt seemed to have succeeded.

Yet what puzzled him was that Sima Changkong did not reappear. He had vanished completely—or perhaps...

“Has he fused with the Genesis Stone Tablet?” Li Fan wondered.

Just as he was silently watching, new changes erupted upon the slate’s surface.

Blood-red characters suddenly spread across it, densely packed, before flowing like fresh blood into tiny streams.

The streams multiplied, merging into raging rivers of crimson that covered the entire slate.

A dazzling red light burst forth. When Li Fan looked again, the whole surface of the tablet flipped like a page, hovering above the stone itself.

“This is…” His pupils constricted sharply.

The changes continued.

Page after page of blood-red text kept turning, faster and faster. The slate grew thinner and thinner. Finally, when the transformation was complete—

A stone book emitting a faint golden-red light appeared before Li Fan.

Compared to the Genesis Stone Tablet, this Stone Book carried an even deeper aura of sanctity and ancient grandeur.

The vision slowly subsided, the light of the stone book retracting inward until it hovered silently in the air.

Yet Li Fan keenly sensed that it was gradually fading—not disappearing or moving, but concealing itself.

“It seems that from this moment on, the Bloodline Chronicle of the Sima Clan will no longer exist.”

“In its place stands this Genesis Chronicle.”

After observing for a long time, Li Fan felt a faint realization rise in his heart.

“It seems that with Sima Changkong’s current strength, he is still far from being a qualified vessel like Senior Stone Tablet. Yet by a twist of fate, the bloodline chronicle within his body has produced an unusual influence upon the Genesis Tablet.”

“Hmm. Perhaps this change was deliberately guided by the Heavenly Dao of the Xuanhuang Realm.”

Standing before the Genesis Chronicle for a long time, Li Fan pondered silently.

With the birth of the Genesis Chronicle, the void was filled. The pitch-black zone of annihilation returned to normal once again.

However, much like the former Fishing Pond, under ordinary circumstances cultivators could not perceive the Genesis Chronicle at all.

Only beings like Li Fan, who had witnessed its birth firsthand, or those with great fortune, could hope to catch even a glimpse of it.

Li Fan slowly approached the Genesis Chronicle, and the scene before his eyes abruptly shifted.

A blood-red river, vast as a waterfall, poured down from the heavens, filling his entire vision.

Within that long river, Li Fan vaguely saw countless swiftly changing images.

Just a single glance made his head spin, forcing him to avert his gaze.

“The Genesis Chronicle possesses its own protection, preventing living beings from peering into its contents.”

After resting for a while, Li Fan once again looked toward the blood-red river.

This time he only observed it from a macro view, without focusing on the details within.

As expected, the dizziness weakened considerably. In this round of exploration, Li Fan made a new discovery.

The blood-red river was continuously forming, endlessly stretching forward.

All that he saw were events presently occurring in the Xuanhuang Realm.

From his perception, Li Fan felt as if he were being swept along by the river, carried ever farther from its source.

He could barely make out his surroundings if he strained his eyes.

But to gaze far ahead, to glimpse the river’s end, required resisting the immense pressure that accumulated as he moved against the current.

Immersed in that crimson torrent, Li Fan soon felt a deep fatigue settle upon his spirit.

It was as though he had undergone a full reincarnation in mere moments, and a strange desire to rest quietly welled up within him.

Fortunately, the Xuanhuang Immortal Heart Mantra began circulating on its own, dissolving that weakness in his heart.

Li Fan immediately grew alert and withdrew from the blood-red river.

“Hm?”

Only then did he notice that at some point, a strand of white hair had appeared upon his head.

He instinctively glanced at the [Truth] panel.

Name: Li Fan

Realm: Nascent Soul (mid-stage)

Physical Age: 63/599

Mental Age: 1379/9999

……

“By my current temporal anchor, only thirteen years should have passed. My physical age ought to be thirty-two, yet it has already become sixty-three.”

“At least my mental age remains unchanged. The Xuanhuang Immortal Heart Mantra must have protected my spirit.”

“It seems the Genesis Chronicle truly cannot be gazed upon by mortals.”

Li Fan frowned slightly. “And it is not merely a matter of accelerated aging.”

“Since the dawn of the Xuanhuang Realm, all information has been recorded within it. That blood-red river is vast and violent beyond measure. To locate a specific piece of information within it, determining the correct temporal node alone would be an immense challenge.”

“Otherwise, one might perish of old age before even finding the desired answer.”

“Unless…”

“One possesses the Longevity Immortal Realm, sharing lifespan with Heaven and Earth itself. Or commands a group numerous and fearless of death, who could explore different nodes of the blood-red river. Each time they bring back fragments of useful information, piece by piece, history could eventually be reconstructed like a great puzzle.”

Li Fan sighed softly. “It is indeed wishful thinking. Artifacts capable of granting the Longevity Immortal Realm cannot possibly be obtained so easily.”

“Still, the Genesis Chronicle now fixed in this place is, to me, an immense blessing.”

Now, the greatest resource Li Fan possessed, aside from the experience, strength, and knowledge accumulated through countless reincarnations via [Truth], was the countless mortals existing within his small world.

Under the day-and-night refinement of the Heaven and Earth Furnace, all those mortals had become potential cultivators, cultivators who could serve Li Fan’s will.

He was now only one step away from establishing the true Federation of All Worlds. The only remaining obstacle was the scarcity of cultivation techniques caused by the principle that no two may cultivate the same law.

Before luring Law Derivative Jade into his hands, Li Fan had already devised a temporary substitute. That was none other than the Lingyuan Sect’s ancient art, “Vital Essence Technique of All Living Beings.”

The more people cultivated it, the faster the overall progress of the technique. Its collective cultivation speed was enough to offset the negative effects brought by the law of incompatibility.

When the Immortal Ancestor’s Dharma Manifestation descended upon the Nine Mountains Prefecture, he flattened the entire region with a single glance. As a result, the headquarters of the Lingyuan Sect was destroyed.

However, a few of its disciples who still knew the Vital Essence Technique of All Living Beings survived in hiding.

As the number of cultivators practicing the Vital Essence Technique dwindled, the technique’s collective enhancement could no longer counteract the drawbacks of incompatibility. Hence, those remaining disciples gradually abandoned it and adopted other cultivation arts.

The followers of the True Immortal of Salvation and Mortal Compassion spent much effort to locate one of those hidden believers.

“Even if ordinary mortals cannot last long within the Blood River, as long as cultivators from the small world throw their lives into it one after another,” Li Fan mused, “the hidden history will eventually be restored.”

His thoughts churned as his gaze once again fell upon the Book of Genesis Chronicle.

“Of course,” he said to himself, “forcing them to serve me through oppression alone won’t work. I’ll have to lure them with benefits…”

With that in mind, Li Fan formed a series of hand seals and reconstructed the protective formation that surrounded the small mountain shrine.

Previously, since the Treasured Fishing Pond could not be relocated, Li Fan had only placed a simple formation there.

Now, although the Genesis Chronicle also possessed self-concealing properties, its grade was ultimately lower than that of the Fishing Pond. There was even a chance that some old monsters of the Xuanhuang Realm could forcibly transfer it away if they discovered it.

Having already regarded it as his possession, Li Fan would not allow such a thing to happen.

A faint white light flickered from the Final Dissociation Disc within his mind, updating itself with the latest formation model. Li Fan immediately arranged it into place.

“Without new formation data to feed it, the Dissociation Disc’s rate of evolution has reached a bottleneck,” he thought. “Either I acquire completely new formations, or I wait for news from Mo Rubin and the nine Dissociation Discs that exist in this era.”

As the resources within his Cave Heaven were gradually consumed, the highest-level formation the Final Dissociation Disc could currently deduce was finally brought into the world.

Its formation complexity surpassed that of the current Xuanhuang Realm by two entire generations. Even the grand defensive formation of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance appeared like a child’s toy in comparison.

“This formation shall be called the [Finality Great Void Formation].”

Li Fan took a deep breath as he completed the arrangement.

“Finality” signified that the art of formations had been deduced to its ultimate limit. “Great Void” represented its nature.

By referencing the [Hidden World, Concealed Space] technique once taught by the Heavenly Doctor, and merging it with countless concealment formations, this Great Void Formation achieved a level of concealment perhaps unmatched within the Xuanhuang Realm.

Wherever the formation extended, it could almost be said to form a world of its own.

Even if a Dao Integration cultivator were to carefully investigate, they might still fail to notice anything unusual.

If a Longevity Immortal Realm expert merely swept their divine sense across the area without examining it closely, the result would likely be the same.

Besides its concealment function, the Finality Great Void Formation also possessed basic functions such as defense and counterattack. However, compared to its concealment capability, those aspects were slightly inferior, so there was no need to elaborate further.

“All believers of the True Immortal of Salvation and Mortal Compassion may face the River of Time directly. If they can bring back even the smallest fragment of time, they shall receive the gift of a True Immortal…”

In that instant, Li Fan had already composed a suitable explanation in his mind.

“The Empire and the Great Li Realm have both completed the construction of their Heaven and Earth Furnaces. Before long, we can begin the first trials of this plan.”

As the saying goes: those who labor with their minds govern others; those who labor with their strength are governed by others. With a better and more efficient method available, Li Fan naturally would not risk his life within the Blood River himself. Sending cultivators from the Federation of All Worlds to serve him was the proper path.

“Within the Blood River, the lost history shall be re-created. This shall be called Celestial Mending.”

Li Fan was quite pleased with himself for giving it such a grand and domineering name.

Even though the Celestial Mending site was protected by a supreme formation, Li Fan still felt uneasy.

He summoned Tianyang and ordered him to watch over the place before departing.

Of course, before leaving, he reminded Tianyang not to look upon the Blood Red River.

Perhaps only Tianyang would not be driven by curiosity to court death by trying.

Tianyang simply sat quietly on the ground, blankly guarding the Genesis Chronicle.

He showed no interest at all in that treasure which recorded the entire history of the Xuanhuang Realm.

…

In the Spiritwood Realm, the newly arrived Zhong Shentong and the young Daoist girl Liuli were utterly stunned by the magnificent scenery of the Federation of All Worlds’ headquarters.

Lin Ling, who had not returned for a long time, was also greatly surprised by how much the Spiritwood Realm had changed.

When the Treefolk Matriarch Lin Xin appeared before her in human form, Lin Ling’s expression shifted sharply, and a complex emotion flashed in her eyes.

All these subtle changes did not escape the notice of Li Fan, who was in complete harmony with the Spiritwood Realm’s will of heaven and earth.

“I was right after all. This little one has indeed developed other thoughts,” Li Fan said with a cold smile.

To call it rebellion was not entirely accurate. It was merely that she no longer wished to submit to him so easily.

After all, when Li Fan had first enlightened her and made her willingly acknowledge him as master, her mind had just awakened and she was still naive and ignorant, with no clear understanding of the world.

At that time, Li Fan’s strength was far weaker than hers, yet she had sincerely submitted.

But over the years, she had been in constant communion with the Ancient Earth Vein Tree, and her intelligence had grown rapidly.

Moreover, Li Fan had never displayed his true strength before her. In her eyes, he was merely a somewhat powerful Nascent Soul cultivator.

Having such little thoughts was only natural.

Li Fan had long been aware of this, which was why he did not rush to her when he first received her message.

However, Li Fan did not care what Lin Ling thought.

As long as she did not commit actual betrayal and continued to faithfully carry out his orders, everything was acceptable.

Otherwise…

Li Fan sneered inwardly as his figure flickered, descending into the central underground chamber.

“Still haven’t gotten any answers?”

His clone, Li Qing, replied with a serious expression. “We did get answers, but something feels strange.”

“This Technique of the Vital Essence of All Living Beings—I cannot cultivate it at all.”

“It’s not that it has no effect, but that I cannot even begin to enter the introductory stage,” the clone Li Qing emphasized.

“Unable to cultivate?”

The clone Li Qing had been refined using the essence blood of Su Yuqing, the Heavenly Dao incarnation of the realm beyond, and his Dao Foundation was established through the Heavenly Wonder Black Sword. It was impossible for him to lack the talent to comprehend a cultivation method.

It seemed the problem lay within the Vital Essence Technique of All Living Beings itself.

Li Fan’s gaze shifted toward the Lingyuan Sect disciple slumped weakly in the corner.

“How interesting. He clearly knows the contents of the technique, yet there is no trace of it within his divine soul. The only way to extract it is through interrogation. Could it be that the cultivation method is stored within the flesh itself?”

Li Fan swept his divine sense across the unconscious disciple, examining him carefully.

With his current understanding of the human body, it did not take long for him to find the clue.

Inside the body of the Lingyuan Sect disciple was a layer of branding etched directly into his flesh and blood, forming a unique mark. Though it seemed harmless to the body, Li Fan keenly sensed faint traces of the technique’s operation left upon it.

Even though the disciple had since switched to another cultivation method, the imprints left behind from years of practicing the Vital Essence Art had not faded in the slightest.

Before long, Li Fan withdrew his divine sense from what was now nothing more than a pool of flesh and blood.

It was not that he was ruthless or wished to silence the man.

Rather, when he had probed the imprint, it had triggered an inbuilt defense mechanism. The mark self-destructed, tearing the disciple’s body apart in the process.

Fortunately, Li Fan had already memorized the entire structure of the mark before that happened.

Though it was immensely complex, a single glance was enough for his Dao Deviation Stone to perfectly replicate it.

Narrowing his eyes, Li Fan lifted his hand as if it were a brush, and began to trace in the air.

The imprint of the Vital Essence Art gradually took form.

It resembled a human figure, composed of more than 128,000 distinct “components,” all interlocked together.

The moment the imprint was reconstituted, it seemed to possess its own sentience.

At first, it drifted uncertainly, sensing its surroundings, then slowly floated toward the pool of flesh on the ground.

Li Fan did not intervene. He simply watched.

When the humanoid imprint attached itself to the flesh and blood, the once lifeless mass began to squirm. Using the mark as a skeleton and the flesh as its covering, it rebuilt itself.

The process was eerie to witness, but what surprised Li Fan came afterward.

Although the imprint reshaped the body, it did not resurrect the disciple. The result was no more than a mindless puppet—a fusion of meat and bone. Its surface remained broken and incomplete.

It was a mere construct of flesh and tissue, and the first and only thing it did upon forming was to cross its legs and begin cultivating the Vital Essence Technique of All Living Beings.

Spiritual energy gradually gathered into its body. Soon, Li Fan sensed the distinctive flow of the cultivation method within it.

Like a machine of flesh and blood, it continued its practice tirelessly, even without a living will to drive it.

The mindless flesh puppet ignored both Li Fan and Li Qing. It simply followed its preset command, performing its task endlessly.

“No wonder that mysterious and unpredictable leader of the Lingyuan Sect was once able to find enough cultivators to practice the technique, allowing its accumulated growth to offset the backlash of the ‘the two paths cannot be cultivated together.’”

“So this was his secret—these mindless flesh puppets.”

A gleam of intrigue flashed in Li Fan’s eyes.

“To continue operating a cultivation method even after death, purely through the instinct of flesh... it must be thanks to that imprint. I’ve never heard of such a method before. It seems the Lingyuan Sect master had secrets of his own.”

“Pity. Even a being of his level, before the manifestation of a Immortal Ancestor’s Dharma Manifestation, was no different from an ant—unable to escape death.”

Of course, it could not be ruled out that the Sect Master of the Lingyuan Sect had not been in Nine Mountains Prefecture at the time, and by sheer luck, escaped the calamity.

They only needed to verify it now.
