Under Li Fan’s instruction, his clone, Li Qing, immediately sat cross-legged and began engraving the Lingyuan Technique imprint within his own body.

Meanwhile, the true body carefully sensed the subtle changes that occurred within as more and more imprints appeared.

Only when the imprints were fully reproduced and merged as one did Li Fan faintly perceive their effect upon the flesh.

To put it simply, it felt as though a seal had been stamped upon his physical body.

“Begin cultivating the Vital Essence Technique of All Living Beings ,” Li Fan said, his eyes narrowing slightly.

Li Qing gave a light nod and once again attempted to circulate the Vital Essence Technique.

This time, there was no obstruction, and he quickly entered the introductory stage of cultivation.

“Other than us, there is no one left in the entire Xuanhuang Realm who still cultivates this technique.”

“It seems that the Sect Master of the Lingyuan Sect truly is dead.”

Li Fan shook his head.

The reasoning was simple. The Sect Master himself might not have cultivated the Technique, but it must have been extremely useful to him. Otherwise, he would not have gone through the trouble of founding the Lingyuan Sect and spreading the technique across the lands.

If he were still alive, he would certainly have made a comeback. With a method that could control flesh puppets through the imprints, re-establishing power would not be difficult.

Yet so much time had passed since Nine Mountains Prefecture was destroyed, and still no new cultivators had taken up the Lingyuan Technique. Even those who had once practiced it had all abandoned it.

“No matter how many schemes one devises, before absolute power, all is meaningless.”

The Sect Master of the Lingyuan Sect had died in vain, but the inheritance he left behind now benefited Li Fan.

Although the Vital Essence Technique of All Living Beings surely held hidden secrets, Li Fan saw no harm in using it first and slowly unraveling its mysteries later.

“Go and create some flesh puppets, and begin circulating the Vital Essence Technique,” Li Fan instructed.

Li Qing accepted the order and departed.

“If everything goes smoothly, soon this small world will be able to produce a steady stream of cultivators.”

“I do not expect them to confront the Five Elders Association head-on. They only need to help me with Celestial Mending.”

“The Blood-red River of Time stretches endlessly, spanning countless ages. Yet most of history is meaningless; only a few key points truly matter.”

“When Xuantian King returned from the Immortal Realm and founded the Xuantian Sect, until the time of his mysterious disappearance.”

“During the final era of the Ten Great Immortal Sects, when the Immortal Ancestor rose to prominence, and Mr. Bai achieved the unprecedented title of Dual Heavenly Sovereign of both ancient and modern times.”

“...”

“First, let us uncover what truly happened during those two periods.”

Li Fan knew well that relying on the small world’s cultivators to obtain fragments of history from the Book of Genesis Chronicle was much like fishing in a pond.

It was full of randomness. What one obtained depended entirely on luck.

But if the number of attempts became large enough, valuable information would eventually be caught.

Li Qing’s efficiency was high.

Though cultivation techniques still had to take into account the influence of the Immortal-Mortal Miasma, given the urgency, he ultimately gathered materials from within the Xuanhuang Realm itself.

In just over ten days, a sufficient number of flesh puppets had been created.

As for the many Foundation Establishment cultivators who mysteriously vanished within the territory of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, their disappearance hardly caused any ripples at all.

In the Spiritwood Realm, within the "ancient sect" area demarcated by Li Fan.

Between the "Medicine King Sect" and the "Heavenly Mechanism Sect," on a vast and flat stone plaza, blood qi soared to the heavens.

Over five hundred blood and flesh puppets sat cross-legged, instinctively circulating the "Vital Essence Technique of All Living Beings."

"It's only because of your incredible speed, shuttling between states to capture some cultivators. Otherwise, if all these missing cultivators were concentrated in just one or two states, it would definitely alert the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance." Li Fan said with a smile.

He casually set up a formation on the plaza, concealing these blood and flesh puppets while also dispersing the thick stench of blood.

"That might not necessarily be the case. The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance's grassroots defense forces haven't recovered so quickly yet; many places are still essentially undefended. Moreover, I only captured the most low-level Foundation Establishment cultivators; the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance might not truly care." Li Qing shook his head.

"You're right. The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance is probably busy building the [Eternal Immortal Wall] and handling those million unconscious cultivators."

"During the demons and gods disaster, although the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance wasn't seriously injured, it did weaken their control over the grassroots somewhat. It won't be long before they hold another large-scale Immortal Alliance entry examination."

The original body and the clone exchanged words back and forth.

Like the sound of gears turning, ringing out from each blood and flesh puppet. They overlapped and resonated, ultimately forming a single crisp tone.

"Click, click..."

The original body and the clone exchanged a glance.

"Quite considerate; once it reaches the threshold, it even proactively reminds us."

"This Lingyuan Sect Master is quite the interesting fellow."

Li Fan could not help but appreciate him even more, deciding that in his next life, he must meet him in person.

"How is it?" Li Fan asked, looking toward the clone who was circulating the "Vital Essence Technique of All Living Beings."

In truth, he had already sensed through synchronized perception the increase in cultivation from the spiritual essence technique within the clone's body.

But he still mischievously asked anyway.

"Mm, although the growth is very slow, it's already barely cultivable."

"Next, as the number of people cultivating the technique continues to increase, the technique's operational efficiency will also gradually rise. Until it reaches a limit." Li Qing analyzed while continuing to cultivate.

"Mm, that's when we can promote it throughout the small world." Li Fan nodded.

Mass-produce heaven and earth furnaces to make the spiritual energy in the small world revive. Then, use the Xuanhuang Pure Heart Mantra, along with supporting medicinal materials to purge the immortal-mortal miasma from ordinary people's bodies. Even if the success rate isn't high, as long as the base number is large enough, there's no need to worry about the quantity of mass-produced cultivators. Finally, have them all cultivate the "Vital Essence Technique of All Living Beings" to batch-produce low-end cultivators.

During this process, if any with exceptional talent or outstanding qualities are discovered, they can be absorbed as formal members of the Federation of All Worlds. ṙÃＮóBƐṨ

Grant them true techniques.

As for the other cultivators with low utilization value, dispatch them one after another into the Blood-colored Long River.

...

A set of processes akin to an assembly line had basically been determined.

Although it sounded extremely simple, it was only after Li Fan had comprehensively encountered various opportunities in the reincarnation journey that he could create this system.

An ordinary cultivator would likely spend their entire life without even finding the method to create the [Heaven and Earth Furnace] that could infinitely produce spiritual energy.

The prototype was complete; next was the specific implementation. It was merely methodical work, so Li Fan left it entirely to the clone Li Qing to handle.

At the same time, he handed over the [Heaven and Earth Myriad Spirits Formation] that connected and controlled all the heaven and earth furnaces to Li Qing for safekeeping.

"There might be a risk of mutation with the Dao One Insects; this cannot be overlooked. Monitor them constantly; if there's any unusual movement, handle it immediately."

After speaking, Li Fan seemed to think of something and changed his mind.

"Mm, if there truly are mutated Dao One Insects, there's no need to exterminate them all. Leave some samples of each mutation; they might prove useful in the future." Li Fan instructed.

The clone naturally accepted the order.

After delegating the tasks, Li Fan finally had some temporary leisure.

At this moment, all the schemes had officially entered the accumulation phase, just waiting for the upcoming eruption after a long buildup.

Feeling somewhat bored with nothing to do, Li Fan flashed over to the hall housing the Faceless Stone Statue.

He pointed lightly at the air and released Yan Fangzhou, who had been trapped for so long.

Confined in a void with nothing around, constantly disturbed by the formation's interference on his mind, every day felt like a year.

From Li Fan's observation, this former proud son of heaven seemed truly insane now.

He showed no awareness of being released and regaining his freedom; even when Li Fan waved his hand in front of his eyes, there was no reaction at all.

Li Fan split off a strand of divine sense and entered Yan Fangzhou's sea of consciousness.

No instinctive defense mechanism appeared against the intrusion from outside.

Yan Fangzhou's past memories were fragmented as if sliced by a knife, completely shattered and disjointed.

Only occasionally did storms of thoughts filled with fear, helplessness, and pleas for mercy sweep through his sea of consciousness.

"Poor child, let me save you." Li Fan smiled faintly.

His divine sense swept through, crushing all of Yan Fangzhou's remaining stray thoughts.

Then, like painting on a blank canvas, he freely fabricated a completely new life for Yan Fangzhou.

Born in the Spiritwood Realm, he was sent to lurk in the Yan family of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance from a young age.

Later, during contact with the Spiritwood Realm, he was accidentally discovered by someone. To prevent his identity from being exposed, he fought while retreating, planning to lure the opponent into the Spiritwood Realm to silence them.

Although he succeeded, he himself suffered severe injuries and fell unconscious.

...

Mastering the [Cloudwater Illusion Dream Technique], Li Fan had rich experience in this and soon implanted these mixed true and false memories entirely into Yan Fangzhou's mind.

After an unknown amount of time, Yan Fangzhou slowly woke up.

His mind had been blank for so long; with a sudden sharp pain, scenes flooded in like a tide.

Looking at Li Fan's solemn face before him, Yan Fangzhou felt a surge of shame in his heart.

"Honored One, I..."

Li Fan waved his hand: "Everyone makes mistakes sometimes; it's good that you came back alive."

A warmth rose in Yan Fangzhou's heart.

"That cultivator who discovered your secret has already been dealt with."

"It's been a long time since you returned to the Spiritwood Realm; take this chance to wander around more."

"During the time you were unconscious, there were some changes in the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance. Think about how to cover up your disappearance." Li Fan instructed faintly, then his figure vanished.

Yan Fangzhou bowed in salute, then swept his divine sense over the Spiritwood Realm.

His expression instantly became somewhat dazed.

"This place... it's so different from before I left. What happened?"

Looking at the brand-new Spiritwood Realm, Yan Fangzhou felt both shocked and delighted.

"Fangzhou? You're awake?!" At that moment, an excited voice came from afar.

"Shang Tianci?" Yan Fangzhou narrowed his eyes.

This youth with exceptional talent was a fellow member of the Mountain River Pavilion with him.

He had schemed to abduct Shang Tianci back to the Spiritwood Realm and force him to join the Ten Thousand Realms United Association.

Yet Shang Tianci himself was unaware, believing he was an elder who had joined one step ahead of Yan Fangzhou.

Thinking of this, Yan Fangzhou snorted coldly in his heart.

"After all, my undercover identity is top secret, known only to the Honored One."

Yan Fangzhou could not help but feel a bit smug; a faint smile appeared on his face as he greeted Shang Tianci.

Shang Tianci tightly grasped Yan Fangzhou's hands and looked him up and down. At the same time, he kept muttering, "It's good that you're alright; it's good that you're alright."

To be honest, Shang Tianci still felt some guilt in his heart for luring Yan Fangzhou to the Spiritwood Realm and subjecting him to the torment of confinement.

However, due to Li Fan's intimidating power, Shang Tianci did not dare voice any opposition. He only hoped that Yan Fangzhou would soon see the situation clearly and return from his misguided path.

Now, it seemed that Li Fan's training of Yan Fangzhou had been quite successful.

"Before I came, the Honored One had given instructions: let bygones be bygones, and try not to mention the past anymore. From today onward, both Fangzhou and I are brothers in the Federation of All Worlds." Shang Tianci thought this to himself and exchanged a smile with Yan Fangzhou.

Everything was understood without words.

"The Federation is truly advancing by leaps and bounds; compared to it, the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance seems far too decadent."

Yan Fangzhou gazed at the Heaven and Earth Furnace not far away, which continuously released spiritual energy, and a flicker of unusual light passed through his eyes.

Shang Tianci also sighed, "Yes, in just a few years, the Spiritwood Realm has undergone such earth-shaking changes..."

"Perhaps, choosing to join the Federation that day was the most correct decision I have ever made in my life."

The two shared the same sentiment.

At the same time, a thought emerged in both their minds: "Why not persuade the other brothers from the Mountain River Pavilion to take the right path as well?"

"The Federation of All Worlds's counterattack on the Xuanhuang Realm is the trend of the times; we cannot let them waste their years in the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance for nothing."

"Moreover, the Federation is in a phase of rapid expansion right now. Joining now would make them founding elders in the future. If they wait another few years, they might beg to join and still have no chance."

...

The two brothers hit it off immediately and began to plot together.

Li Fan, who had taken in all their actions, merely smiled faintly. These prodigies from the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance in the Mountain River Pavilion still had some use to him.

Deriving the Primordial Golden Core and the subsequent techniques truly required prodigies.

"No need to achieve it all at once; as long as progress is made, it is a victory."

"Master..." As Li Fan thought this, Lin Ling's voice suddenly transmitted into his mind.

The voice carried some trepidation and hesitation.

"Heh, come to the secret chamber to see me."

Not long after, Lin Ling's figure appeared before Li Fan, and she slowly knelt down.

"Your heart seems somewhat restless and uneasy." Li Fan sat cross-legged with his eyes closed and said indifferently.

Lin Ling pursed her lips, wanting to speak but hesitating.

Both her thoughts and expressions were far richer than when she had first been born.

Li Fan chuckled lightly, "You are a being nurtured by heaven and earth; submitting to the strong is your nature. Back when you were ignorant and uncomprehending, acknowledging me as master did not bother you. But now, after experiencing the mortal world once, all sorts of dissatisfied and indignant thoughts have surged in your heart. Am I right?" ȒäNŎBËṢ

Lin Ling's body trembled; she hurriedly prostrated herself again and repeatedly said she did not dare.

In truth, only she knew the exact situation in her heart.

During her time outside the Spiritwood Realm, she had learned that the Earth Vein Ancient Tree senior was extremely dissatisfied with her acknowledging Li Fan as master.

Although it had not directly incited Lin Ling to rebel, it had transmitted many scenes from the ancient tree's memories.

This had caused Lin Ling's "mind" to grow rapidly.

It indeed made Lin Ling's thoughts fluctuate; she wanted to leave Li Fan's side and see the broader Xuanhuang Realm.

However, upon returning to the Spiritwood Realm this time and witnessing the many changes in the world with her own eyes, a sudden sense of warning against betraying Li Fan arose in her heart.

It seemed that...

If she truly betrayed him, great disaster would befall her.

As a creation of heaven and earth, her spiritual intuition was the most accurate. The warning lingered without fading; these past few days, Lin Ling had felt as if she were constantly surrounded by the watchful eyes of natural enemies, unable to sit or stand at ease.

Unable to endure it any longer, she had decided to confess everything to Li Fan.

Just as she was about to speak, she heard Li Fan chuckle lightly, "You foolish child..."

"Never mind; today, I will let you witness what true power really is."

Lin Ling froze, then abruptly looked up.

She only felt an overwhelmingly powerful aura erupting from her master. He was clearly only at the Nascent Soul realm, yet his pressure made even her, at the Dao Integration realm, feel utterly suppressed.

"Realm means nothing. If I kill you, it would be as simple as pinching an ant to death."

Li Fan's voice suddenly came from above Lin Ling's head.

Lin Ling only felt one of his hands gently pressing down on her head.

It was as if the throat of her fate had been gripped; her body stiffened, and she instantly could not move.

Lin Ling had a feeling that if Li Fan exerted just a little more force, she would perish in an instant!

Moreover, this was not achieved through the Wood Heart's control over her. It was true strength crushing her!

Lin Ling's heart was filled with utter shock; she could not fathom how the Golden Core cultivator from before had suddenly become so powerful.

"Could it be that Master has been disguising himself all along?"

With this thought emerging in her mind, Lin Ling felt a deeper chill.

Under the oppression of the life-and-death crisis, not a single rebellious notion remained in her heart.

After an unknown amount of time, Li Fan finally released his right hand and sat cross-legged in the void ahead once more.

Lin Ling immediately collapsed to the ground.

She then struggled to rise and kowtowed to Li Fan to beg forgiveness.

She detailed the entire process of how her rebellious intentions had arisen.

"Earth Vein Ancient Tree..." A cold glint flashed in Li Fan's eyes; he had already noted it in his heart.

"You seem to have more to say?"

Lin Ling's body trembled fiercely again at these words from Li Fan.

"Yes, Master. But this is only my guess; it may not be true."

"Speak freely."

Lin Ling hesitated for a moment, then finally gritted her teeth and said: "I suspect that Senior Stone Tablet was dragged away by the unknown entity in the Fishing Pond. It was very likely Liuli who secretly tipped it off!"

"Hm?" At these words, even Li Fan was somewhat surprised.

Lin Ling quietly explained: "At first, I was not entirely certain; I only thought that Liuli pulling me closer to the Fishing Pond was just to leech some benefits from Senior Stone Tablet."

"But on the day the anomaly occurred, at the instant Senior Stone Tablet was suddenly dragged forward, little Liuli's face surprisingly showed no fear or horror."

"It was as if she had known this scene would happen all along."

"Although she quickly reacted afterward and pretended to show a frightened expression, that instant change did not escape my observation."

"This Daoist child Liuli definitely has something suspicious about her!"

Lin Ling said firmly.

Hearing Lin Ling's solemn words, Li Fan's divine sense instantly locked onto Daoist girl Liuli, who was in the Spiritwood Realm.

She was standing before a heavenly furnace at that moment, her eyes wide with curiosity.

"Like the [Seven-Colored Jade Void Glimmering Light], it is also a world-level golden radiance. This little thing is truly not simple."

"It has an innocent and harmless appearance; even I almost overlooked it."

Li Fan could naturally discern whether Lin Ling was lying.

With a thought in his mind, it was as if a pair of invisible giant hands emerged in the Spiritwood Realm. In an instant, they captured Daoist girl Liuli and brought her before Li Fan.

Liuli only felt a blur before her eyes; the scenery changed abruptly.

Upon seeing Li Fan's face, a trace of panic flashed in her eyes. She wanted to say something; her lips moved up and down, yet no sound came out.

"From what Zhong Shentong said before, when you were just fished out of the fishing pool, you were still merely a transparent fruit like glazed glass."

Li Fan had no intention of questioning her. Instead, he formed seals with his hands repeatedly, setting up a formation around Liuli that resembled a pill cauldron.

Feeling the scorching heat transmitted from her surroundings, Daoist girl Liuli's face turned pale. She waved her fair and tender arms desperately, trying to explain something.

However, Li Fan paid no attention at all, as if he intended to refine Liuli on the spot and consume her directly.

The immense pressure from all around soon rendered Liuli unable to move. It was as if she were tightly bound by countless ropes; she stiffened and floated in the air.

Looking at Daoist girl Liuli, who seemed utterly powerless to resist, Li Fan narrowed his eyes slightly and continued to intensify the formation's output.

Within the pill cauldron formation, nine crimson fire dragons manifested their forms. They let out roars one after another and sprayed dazzling flames toward the bound Liuli in unison.

Behind Li Fan, Lin Ling watched this scene with a chill in her heart; her body trembled uncontrollably.

She had not expected her master to act without a word, without even half a sentence of interrogation, and simply roast Liuli outright!

With such decisive ruthlessness, if he truly wanted to kill her, there would be no hesitation at all.

At this point, Lin Ling dared not harbor the slightest disloyalty in her heart.

Yet within the formation's pill cauldron, Daoist girl Liuli did not dissipate into the flames as Lin Ling had imagined.

Suddenly, bursts of dark golden radiance erupted from her body, blocking the flames outside.

No matter how Li Fan urged the formation, he could not break through the protection of the dark golden light.

Li Fan let out a light hum and continued to draw in the surrounding spiritual energy, continuously generating molten fire to scorch Liuli.

He did not truly intend to suppress and kill Liuli; rather, he used this method of boiling a frog in warm water to force out her true form.

Inside the formation's furnace, the two forces continued to clash and stalemate.

Releasing the dark golden radiance to protect herself seemed to place a considerable burden on Liuli. Her eyes slowly closed, and her body gradually curled up, like an infant hugging its knees in a fetal position. She appeared to have fallen into a deep sleep. ꭆἈɴՕ𝖇ËS

But the dark golden light around her grew increasingly stable.

Beside Daoist girl Liuli, a six-petaled lotus flower took shape!

Once the glazed lotus flower formed, the flames spewed by the nine fire dragons could no longer threaten it in the slightest. They were easily repelled outside the glazed lotus flower. No matter how the flames raged, the glazed lotus flower remained unmoved and steadfast.

"This is..."

In the Xuanhuang Realm, there seemed to be no such thing. Even the [Heavenly Doctor Immortal Scripture] had no records of it.

It should be something produced from another cultivation world.

"A six-petaled one should merely be its juvenile state." Observing the glazed lotus flower in the flames carefully, Li Fan suddenly had a realization.

Having achieved his goal, Li Fan withdrew his divine ability.

The nine fire dragons vanished in an instant, but Daoist girl Liuli remained bound.

Li Fan narrowed his eyes slightly; his voice was like thunder, constantly echoing in this space: "Do you think that with this broken lotus flower protecting you, I cannot harm you?"

"That would be underestimating the cultivators of our Xuanhuang Realm a bit too much!"

With these words, Li Fan released a beam of seven-colored divine light.

Wrapped within the divine light was a small patch of gray mold spot.

Back then, the gray mold spot that had been split and cultivated amounted to two pieces in total; the larger one had been used previously against the Dharma-Transmitter Jiang.

Although the remaining one was a bit smaller, the gray mold spot's innate ability to erode worlds showed no weakening at all. The moment it appeared, even though it was still wrapped in the seven-colored divine light on the outside, it caused an extreme sense of crisis within the glazed lotus flower!

Liuli's body trembled uncontrollably; the six-petaled lotus flower protecting her also had its dark golden radiance constantly swirling.

In that fleeting change, it seemed as if another new petal was about to emerge.

The seven-colored divine light was on the verge of colliding with the glazed lotus flower; the gray mold spot was about to be released.

At that moment, a clear and cold female voice suddenly rang out in Li Fan's mind: "Hold on!"

The seven-colored divine light halted abruptly.

"I never expected that this world has also been affected by the [Nothingness (没)] Character Script..."

"The Nothingness (Mò) Character Script..." Li Fan's heart stirred, but his expression remained unchanged on the surface: "Please come out and meet, fellow Daoist!"

The clear and cold female voice no longer hid; the glazed lotus flower slowly bloomed, and a illusory dark golden figure appeared before Li Fan.

Even though her appearance was blurry and could not be clearly seen amid the golden light.

The aura emanating from her, akin to that of an emperor, still revealed her identity to a certain extent.

"Greetings, fellow Daoist of the Xuanhuang Realm!"

"Fellow Daoist, you infiltrated our Xuanhuang Realm with ill intentions." Li Fan's gaze scanned the golden figure up and down; for a moment, he could not quite gauge the opponent's strength.

Having lost her human body and existing only in an energy form. By common reasoning, she should be gravely injured and forced into this state out of necessity. Yet Li Fan sensed no weakness from this golden figure at all; instead, there was boundless vitality surging forth.

Tenacious and powerful.

The golden light spoke apologetically: "It was not that I deliberately concealed myself; it was truly beyond my control."

Before Li Fan could ask, she continued to explain: "Any cultivation world still surviving in the Sunken Star Sea holds extreme hostility toward outsiders. In my current state, if I were to reveal my identity directly, I fear I would not last long."

"Sunken Star Sea?" Li Fan tilted his head slightly, probing as he asked.

"It is the collective name for all star regions affected by the [Immortal Ruins]."

As if realizing something, the golden light quickly added: "Each cultivation world calls it by a different name..."

"I see. We cultivators of the Xuanhuang Realm call it the [Darkest Star Sea]." Li Fan interjected at the right moment.

"Darkest..." The golden light fell silent for a moment, then let out a slight sigh, "Indeed, the name is quite fitting."

"Fellow Daoist, what is your name and origin? Why did you appear in the Fishing Pond? Most importantly, was it you who caused the Fishing Pond to disappear?" Li Fan fired off one question after another; his tone and expression gradually turned cold.

"I caused the anomaly in the Fishing Pond? Fellow Daoist, you are overestimating me a bit."

The golden figure first mocked herself, then began her self-introduction: "My original name is Daoist Hundred Flowers, and I am the sect master of the Heavenly Lotus Sect in the Wansheng Realm..."

"But that was thousands of years ago."

There was a hint of gloom in Daoist Hundred Flowers's tone: "Back then, the [Nothingness] Character Script suddenly erupted and swept through the various realms. Although the Wansheng Realm resisted with all its might, it still could not stop its spread. In desperation, we had no choice but to abandon the realm and flee. We originally thought to find a safe place to take refuge, but unexpectedly..."

"Wherever we passed, it was all a scene of the end of the world."

The golden figure of Daoist Hundred Flowers flickered slightly, as if brushed by a light breeze, revealing the extreme unrest in her heart. Even after so much time had passed, recalling the scenes from back then still stirred great waves in her mind.

"The calamities that each realm encountered were not the same. In the star regions around our Wansheng Realm, those gray mold spots were like a surging sea, swallowing everything in the world. And in some worlds, twisted creations appeared and thoroughly destroyed themselves in endless mutual slaughter, like a blood-colored purgatory."

"If it were merely these, as long as we ran far enough, we might still find a glimmer of hope. But..."

"Within the Immortal Ruins, there are [True Immortals]." Li Fan said in a low and somber tone at this moment.

"Beyond the Sunken Star Sea, there is an invisible barrier blocking our escape. And within the Sunken Star Sea, there are True Immortals who borrowed the [Hunger] Character to comprehend the Dao, disregarding the life and death of all beings..."

"Hmm? Wait. You just said that there are True Immortals who borrowed the [Hunger] Character to comprehend the Dao? What does that mean?" Li Fan's gaze flashed as he asked aloud.

"Aren't True Immortals suppressed by the Hunger Character Script?" Li Fan voiced the doubt in his heart.

Daoist Hundred Flowers was stunned for a moment, then realized: "It seems that fellow Daoists from the Xuanhuang Realm know little about True Immortals and thus have some misunderstandings."

"According to the research of the surviving cultivators from our various cultivation realms back then, the cause of the disasters in our star sea, the [Hunger], [Chaos], [Nothingness], and other immortal seal characters, should all originate from the hand of a single True Immortal."

"This True Immortal possesses the supreme might to manifest the laws of the world into characters. With just a few strokes, he can easily destroy a entire region star and countless cultivation worlds."

"So, all the calamities we have suffered are the work of this True Immortal?" Li Fan's gaze flickered as he asked in a deep voice.

Unexpectedly, Daoist Hundred Flowers shook her head slightly in denial: "Did I not just say? If it were truly that True Immortal making a move, our star sea would have been instantly destroyed. The [Hunger] and [Chaos] Character Script that erupted in the calamities, although they also bring boundless world-ending disasters, are not even worthy to be mentioned in the same breath as the means of a True Immortal."

"Then it is..." Li Fan was slightly taken aback, and then he instantly thought of something.

"A counterfeit brush?"

"Exactly. Back then, after the surviving cultivators from the various realms compiled the records about True Immortals that had been passed down in each world, they all uniformly reached this conclusion. The immortal seal characters that caused the lower realms' calamities all came from the hand of the same person, or rather, the same immortal." Daoist Hundred Flowers said slowly, yet her tone held no hatred, only a profound sense of powerlessness.

Upon hearing this, Li Fan could not help but feel some doubt: "In our Xuanhuang Realm, after experiencing all sorts of calamities, we know very little about True Immortals. But for no reason at all, why would that immortal create such boundless slaughter?"

"Immortals do not engage in meaningless acts. Just like that Immortal in the Immortal Ruins, who sat withered for ten thousand years, comprehending the Dao of the [Hunger] character to its utmost extreme. All for the sake of taking one step further, achieving the realm of [Nameless True Immortal]." Daoist Hundred Flowers sighed endlessly.

"Nameless True Immortal? I have heard something about this. Unable to know their name and surname; all records have vanished..."

"Could it be that Immortals also have levels? Not all Immortals are the same?" Li Fan humbly sought guidance.

"Indeed. When the Immortal Path was not yet severed, we cultivators could also ascend to become Immortals. Receiving the baptism of Immortal spiritual energy and shedding our mortal bodies, we could formally become Immortals. Our strength would increase dramatically overnight, expanding by more than a hundredfold."

"But compared to [Nameless True Immortal], it is still worlds apart. Every Immortal is an ultimate seeker of the Dao. Once they fully master one kind of Dao path in the world, they become beings who transcend all things. All past traces are erased; no one in the world can know their name and surname. We can only refer to them by the Dao path they have mastered." ℝаƝɵ𝔟Ěś

"That Nameless True Immortal who inscribed the Dao with characters; we revere him as the [Inscription Dao Immortal]."

...

Listening to Daoist Hundred Flowers's explanation of the realms above Immortal, Li Fan could not help but feel his thoughts wandering in admiration.

All information about Immortals in the Xuanhuang Realm had long vanished into the river of history; even the Dharma-Transmitters knew very little.

Perhaps only the Five Elders Association, the remnants of the Ten Great Immortal Sects, still preserved some scant records.

Today, by a stroke of fortunate coincidence, encountering a survivor of the ancient Immortal calamity and learning the secrets of True Immortals was undoubtedly a significant opportunity.

Of course, Li Fan did not fully trust this Daoist Hundred Flowers.

He would simply listen for now.

...

Daoist Hundred Flowers continued: "The Inscription Dao Immortal has already transcended, but he may have left behind a few true inscriptions of the Dao."

"At that time, some unknown upheaval occurred in the Immortal Realm; the Immortal Path collapsed, and the Immortals scattered in escape. These true inscriptions were perhaps obtained by one of them."

"He copied and wrote down characters like hunger, chaos, and nothingness, plaguing the world. This must be related to the Dao path he cultivated."

"Chaos and nothingness destroyed countless cultivation worlds, while the hunger character was obtained by another Immortal. And perhaps because the hunger character aligned with this Immortal's Dao path, he sat cross-legged at the former Immortal Realm passage and began to comprehend it on the spot."

"Understand that ten thousand years of time may seem extremely long to us, but to an Immortal, it is merely the duration of a single seclusion."

"As for what consequences his comprehension of the hunger character would cause..."

"To us lower realm cultivators in his eyes, we are all mere ants. Why would he care?"

At this point, Daoist Hundred Flowers's words carried a hint of resentment and hatred.

After fully absorbing the other's words, Li Fan pondered slowly.

"These are all your speculations, right? Is there any substantial evidence?"

Daoist Hundred Flowers shook her head but remained utterly convinced: "Back then, our group of survivors who lived through the calamity were the peak powerhouses of various realms. Drawing from the remnants of records in each realm, what we deduced..."

"Even if it is not the absolute truth, it is not far off."

"Especially since those who copied the True Immortal's seal script and comprehended the hunger character were only at the Immortal realm. Although their strength absolutely crushes us cultivators, they have not reached the unfathomable level of Nameless True Immortal." There was a trace of pride in Daoist Hundred Flowers's tone.

Li Fan, however, recalled the 115th reincarnation, when that figure in the Immortal Ruins suddenly opened his eyes upon sensing his gaze. And through the clone's induction, transmitted the hunger character to the Xuanhuang Realm, thereby causing the world's destruction.

“At that time, I truly saw that Immortal open his eyes. It seems he is indeed still alive.”

“To extinguish Xuanhuang with a single glance using the ‘Hunger’ character, that is likely beyond the capability of an ordinary Immortal. To sit in meditation for ten thousand years and gain enlightenment in the Dao—he is probably not far from breaking through to the realm of the Nameless True Immortal.”

A sudden, invisible pressure rose in Li Fan’s heart.

If what the Daoist Hundred Flowers said was true, then one day this Immortal would awaken through self-enlightenment.

And if at that time he had not yet escaped from this Darkest Star Sea…

He would have to use the [Truth] directly.

In other words, the time he could remain in the Xuanhuang Realm was actually limited.

However, for now, there was no need to worry too much about this matter.

At least, from the several cycles he had experienced, even after anchoring for over seven hundred years, the Immortal of the Immortal Ruins showed no sign of awakening.

“Compared to the awakening of a True Immortal, what I should be more concerned about is whether, if I forcibly break through the pull of the Immortal Ruins, leave Xuanhuang, or even cross the High Wall, I might awaken that Immortal who is still in the process of enlightenment.”

With this thought, Li Fan asked, “Let us set aside the source of calamities in the cultivation world for now. What do you think about the invisible barrier that surrounds the Darkest Star Sea?”

The Daoist Hundred Flowers fell silent for a moment and gave an answer that surprised Li Fan.

“This invisible barrier actually has two possible origins.”

“The first possibility is that it was established by the existence outside the Darkest Star Sea to prevent the spread of calamities caused by True Immortal seal inscriptions.”

Li Fan nodded slightly. This was consistent with what Xuantian King had speculated years ago.

“As for the second possibility…”

Daoist Hundred Flowers’s tone suddenly deepened. “It is very likely that it was set up by the Immortal of the Immortal Ruins.”

“I have said before that the path to True Immortality pursued by each Immortal is unique. The Immortal who seeks enlightenment through the [Hunger] character, in order to prevent other Immortals from discovering it and affecting his Dao, placed measures in advance. Before his enlightenment, he sealed this star region, isolating its interior from the exterior.” 𝘙ᴀꞐ𝙤ＢÈś

The High Wall was laid by the Immortal of the Immortal Ruins?

Li Fan was first startled, then after thinking for a moment, he felt this was indeed a real possibility.

He inexplicably recalled Xuantian King’s conclusion years ago:

Only by breaking through to the True Immortal realm could one carry the Xuanhuang Realm across the High Wall.

“The True Immortal that Xuantian King mentioned, based on his statement that it could be reached quickly, should be an ordinary Immortal realm. Not the Nameless True Immortal realm.”

“Only by approaching or surpassing the strength of the Immortal when he set the High Wall can it be crossed. That makes perfect sense.”

“When the Immortal Realm collapsed, survivors scattered in flight. Yet the Immortal of the Immortal Ruins, at the very entrance of the Immortal World passage, obtained the Hunger Character and sat in meditation to comprehend the Dao. Such courage…”

“It must have been rare even among the Immortal Realm.”

“Thus, him casually erecting a High Wall that sealed the entire Darkest Star Sea is not necessarily impossible.”

As Li Fan pondered, he actually felt that the second possibility might be closer to the truth.

If that were really the case…

“Then escaping from the Darkest Star Sea would inevitably disturb the Immortal of the Immortal Ruins.”

This was undoubtedly even more dangerous and unreachable than confronting the Immortal Ancestor.

Yet, to live in freedom and longevity, just as he had begun his journey, he had already discovered that on the path ahead stood two formidable enemies he would have to face: the Dharma-Transmitting Immortal Ancestor and the Immortal of the Immortal Ruins…

How utterly despairing!

Most cultivators in the Darkest Star Sea would have their hearts collapse upon learning the truth, making further advancement almost impossible.

But Li Fan merely narrowed his eyes. In his heart, he did not feel the slightest discouragement.

Whether it was a Immortal Ancestor, or even the elusive Nameless True Immortal...

As long as they stood in the way of his Path To Immortality, Li Fan would surely crush them!

“On the path of immortality, I walk alone. If the world obstructs me, my will shall not bend.”

“With a single sword, I split the star seas and sun. Heaven mourns, earth laments, immortals and spirits tremble.”

Li Fan slowly chanted in his heart, his gaze sharp and resolute.

Not far away, the Daoist Hundred Flowers did not know what had occurred, only feeling that the aura of Li Fan before her had suddenly undergone a strange transformation.

It made her feel a vague sense of fear, as if a great calamity were approaching.

But the sensation vanished as quickly as it appeared, and upon closer inspection, it had disappeared completely.

It was as if it had been a mere illusion.

Yet the Daoist Hundred Flowers knew that, in her current Glazed Body state, illusions or hallucinations could not possibly manifest.

Therefore...

She fixed her gaze on the seemingly harmless yet upright Li Fan, a new layer of caution rising in her heart.

Immortals of the Immortal Ruins were still too far removed from his present situation. After a brief moment of thought, Li Fan suppressed these various thoughts for the time being.

He turned toward the Daoist Hundred Flowers, whose figure was concealed in golden light, and asked again: “The realm of Immortals is beyond our current comprehension. Compared to that, I am more curious about your experiences.”

“Aren't you a survivor of the calamity back then? Why, then, did you appear in the Fishing Pond?”

“And Daoist child Liuli, what is your relation to her?”

Li Fan’s gaze burned with intensity, and the surrounding array formations quietly strengthened their seals once more.

The Daoist Hundred Flowers cast a subtle glance around and sighed: “Your vigilance is truly exceptional.”

“In truth, the reason I was in the Fishing Pond was purely coincidental.”

“Just as I said before, I had no control over it.”

The Daoist Hundred Flowers slowly recounted: “On that day, we survivors from the various worlds gathered together, discussing methods to escape the fallen star seas.”

“Unexpectedly, an inexplicable fluctuation in the void appeared, locking onto me.”

“In an instant, I lost consciousness. When I awoke, I found myself already within the Fishing Pond.”

Li Fan smiled: “So, you were simply too unlucky, and that is why the Fishing Pond captured you?”

Daoist Hundred Flowers’ voice carried a hint of helplessness: “Yes and no. The Fishing Pond automatically collects treasures scattered across the starry void. The rarer the unclaimed treasure, the more likely it becomes a target for the Fishing Pond.”

“My cultivation had reached completion, and my body resembled a dark-glimmering Glazed Lotus. I was more like a magical treasure than a person.”

“It can only be said that it was fate, a tribulation I was destined to face.”

“In the Fishing Pond, I do not know how many years I sank. Then, by chance, I attached myself to a Glazed Wisdom Fruit similar in nature to me.”

“Absorbing a portion of its energy, I barely managed to maintain my consciousness within the Fishing Pond.”

“Later...”

“I sensed a force drawing the Glazed Wisdom Fruit, knowing that this might be my only chance to escape. So I went with the fruit and was fished out of the Fishing Pond.”

“Hehe, I simply hid well; you never noticed.”

Daoist of Hundred Flowers said calmly.

[TL Notes: The name Liuli (琉璃) literally means “glazed” or “colored glass” in Chinese, So Liuli is basically the Glazed Wisdom Fruit or Liuli Wisdom Fruit]

"Xuanhuang Realm..."

"It is indeed fraught with dangers everywhere. Back then, we survivors from various realms had conflicts with the Xuanhuang Realm. Now that I am here alone and returning to familiar ground, I must naturally be more cautious." Daoist Hundred Flowers explained.

"Oh? There was a conflict back then? What do you mean? When calamity descends, should not we cultivators unite in heart and mind to overcome the crisis together?" Li Fan pondered for a moment and understood the likely cause of the conflict.

A group of homeless people encountering the affluent cultivation world of the Xuanhuang Realm would surely breed all sorts of greed. At that time, it was still during the era when Xuantian King was alive; he would absolutely bar these people with ulterior motives from entering.

However, Li Fan pretended not to know and asked anyway.

Daoist Hundred Flowers's answer aligned closely with Li Fan's speculation: "That half-immortal was truly overbearing. He directly rejected our proposal to unite and face the calamity together. And he intended to drive us away on the spot."

"Heh, this naturally displeased some among us. So we exchanged a few moves..."

Daoist Hundred Flowers's figure flickered with golden light, indicating that the "exchange" she mentioned was far from a mere friendly spar.

"Worthily, a half-immortal who had been baptized by immortal spiritual qi. Even if his ascension was incomplete, his strength was enough to crush ordinary cultivators. We knew we were no match, so we had no choice but to retreat. And that half-immortal truly had some immortal demeanor; without holding grudges, he even gifted us quite a few supplies before we departed..." Daoist Hundred Flowers sighed with emotion.

He concealed his faint killing intent very well, yet it still did not escape the senses of Daoist Hundred Flowers's glazed body.

Daoist Hundred Flowers paused slightly in her speech, unsure where this sudden killing intent from the other party had come from.

"Could it be that the one before me has some deep connection to that half-immortal from back then?" Daoist Hundred Flowers was startled in her heart.

After some thought, Daoist Hundred Flowers took the initiative to change the topic, shifting from the old events of the past to the disappearance at the fishing pool: "After arriving in the Xuanhuang Realm, I continued to attach myself to Little Liuli. One reason is that I sensed the Xuanhuang Realm had become even more perilous than before; the second is that the Glazed Wisdom Fruit greatly benefits my cultivation..."

"Originally, the days passed quite peacefully, until fellow Daoist and that stone tablet cultivator arrived."

"If it were merely fishing for treasures from the Fishing Pond, that would be fine. But he insisted on comprehending the Dao of Fishing..."

At this point, Hundred Flowers Daoist glanced at Li Fan.

Back then, the Senior Stone Tablet's decision had much to do with Li Fan's instigation.

"This supreme treasure, the Fishing Pond, is clearly the work of a [Nameless True Immortal] who had already established his own Dao path. How could his Dao path tolerate others' intrusion?"

"If the Senior Stone Tablet wanted to comprehend the Dao of Fishing, he was bound to face backlash. As for where the Senior and this Fishing Pool have gone, I am afraid neither you nor I can fathom it." Daoist Hundred Flowers shook her head and sighed softly.

Li Fan remained silent.

Daoist Hundred Flowers's explanation had no flaws. If someone tried to comprehend the method of manifesting the illusory as real or reversing time and space through his [Truth], Li Fan would also pursue them relentlessly to the death.

But soon, Li Fan thought of something else and frowned slightly: "Since a True Immortal's Dao path does not tolerate others' intrusion, then why did that [Inscription Dao Immortal] leave behind several sets of True Immortal seal characters? And why did the Immortal Ruins Immortal's comprehension of the Dao over thousands of years not attract the Inscription Dao Immortal's attention?"

Hundred Flowers Daoist pondered for a moment, as if organizing her words: "Fellow Daoist, you are probably mistaken. The Dao comprehended by the Immortal Ruins Immortal has fundamentally nothing to do with the [Inscription Dao Immortal]'s Dao path."

"The Inscribing Dao Immortal Path allows one to inscribe the Dao as characters. Yet the Immortal Ruins Immortal comprehends the Dao through the [Hunger] character..."

"The path he pursues might be [Hunger] itself, or something related to [Hunger]. But it absolutely cannot be [Inscribing Dao]..."

"I wonder if my explanation makes sense to you, fellow Daoist?" The Hundred Flowers Daoist looked toward Li Fan.

Li Fan pondered for a moment and nodded slightly.

It was not that he was too dull to grasp such a simple point; rather, a sudden thought emerged in his mind, prompting him to confirm it further with the Hundred Flowers Daoist.

"I once saw chains binding the Immortal Ruins Immortal's body; I originally thought they were imposed by an outsider to suppress him."

"Now that I think about it, it is more likely that the immortal bound himself. As for the purpose, it might be to prevent himself from losing control due to comprehending the Dao of the [Hunger] character. No, immortals disregard mortal lives, so it is unlikely to be merely for the sake of avoiding harm to the innocent. More probably, he is still worried that losing control would affect his own path..."

"So that is how it is; the path he cultivates might be related to [resisting the instinct of hunger]."

Drawing analogies from his own experiences, Li Fan was adept at this; in an instant, he derived many possibilities.

Seeing Li Fan fall into contemplation, Daoist Hundred Flowers also remained silent.

After a long while, Li Fan spoke again: "Although fellow Daoist has explained much, there is no concrete evidence after all. One must guard against those who are not of our kin. For the sake of the Xuanhuang Realm's people, I am afraid I must trouble fellow Daoist..."

Li Fan's reaction seemed to be within the Daoist Hundred Flowers's expectations; she showed no agitation at all and instead said solemnly: "What if I am now also a cultivator of the Xuanhuang Realm?"

Li Fan was immediately stunned: "What do you mean by that, fellow Daoist?"

"I borrowed Liuli's body to reshape a glazed body. And Liuli took form in the Xuanhuang Realm, drawing upon the power of heaven and earth..."

"In a certain sense, I am now also nurtured by the Xuanhuang Realm's heaven and earth." The Daoist Hundred Flowers smiled faintly.

"If fellow Daoist does not believe me, you may return to the Xuanhuang Realm with me and sense the will of heaven and earth. With my level of strength, if I were an outsider, heaven and earth would instinctively generate aversion. Any cultivator in the mortal realm could discern it at a glance; it would be impossible to conceal."

To verify her words, Li Fan brought the Daoist Hundred Flowers back to the main Xuanhuang Realm.

In an instant, he shifted to the perspective of heaven and earth.

Indeed, Li Fan saw that heaven and earth harbored no malice toward the Daoist Hundred Flowers.

There was even a faint sense of affinity and solicitation within it.

Li Fan could not help but feel a strange sensation in his heart.

"What is fellow Daoist's current cultivation level?" he asked.

"Um, if we were in the Wansheng Realm, after my technique reached great completion and my body transformed into glazed form, the next step would be to accept the baptism of Heavenly Tribulation and ascend to Immortality."

"Although the Immortal Path is severed and I cannot ascend, with my realm stagnant, my strength has still been steadily increasing over these many years, especially after absorbing the Glazed Wisdom Fruit..."

"If divided by the Xuanhuang Realm's stages, it should be considered the Longevity Immortal Realm."

The tone of the Daoist Hundred Flowers carried a trace of uncertainty.

When Li Fan heard this, he frowned deeply. “You? The Longevity Immortal Realm?” His tone was full of doubt.

Although the other party’s strength was indeed hard to gauge, compared to the true Longevity experts of the Xuanhuang Realm, there was still an obvious gap.

At the very least, Li Fan did not feel any great threat coming from her.

“Fellow Daoist, are you perhaps trying to scare me just by throwing around the name of the Longevity Immortal Realm?” Li Fan’s expression turned slightly unfriendly.

The Daoist Hundred Flowers a bitter smile. “I’ve already fallen to such a state. How could I bother with such meaningless acts?”

“In truth, if I were still in the Wansheng Realm—or in any other cultivation world—I could indeed be called a being of the Longevity Immortal Realm.”

“However, in the Xuanhuang Realm…”

The Daoist Hundred Flowers looked up at the sky. A trace of reverence flashed in her eyes. “Thousands of years have passed, and the world has changed beyond recognition. This heaven and earth have become so vast.”

“And even back then, among the many cultivation realms, our Wansheng Realm was only of mid-tier scale.”

“Even among those of the Longevity Immortal Realm, there are still differences.” The Daoist Hundred Flowers spoke helplessly.

Li Fan suddenly understood.

In the past, the Xuanhuang Realm was already a colossal existence among the various cultivation realms.

After thousands of years of plundering and devouring, it had expanded countless times over.

Now, as possibly the only surviving cultivation realm within the Darkest Star Sea, Xuanhuang could no longer be measured by common sense.

And in such a vast world, the Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereigns who existed against the natural order and alongside the heavens themselves possessed terrifying power beyond imagination.

They could not be judged by ordinary logic.

“To be born in Xuanhuang is both fortune and misfortune,” Li Fan thought to himself.

He looked again at the Daoist Hundred Flowers and estimated her strength to be roughly equivalent to the stronger Dao Integration cultivators of the Xuanhuang Realm.

“No wonder you seem a bit weak,” Li Fan said bluntly.

“I once fought with a Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign. Against them, you probably wouldn’t last a few rounds.”

Her expression was hard to see, but from the faint fluctuations in her golden, radiant form, it was clear she was not in a good mood.

“Alright. Since what you said has been verified, let us return to the Spiritwood Realm first. The Xuanhuang Realm is constantly under the watch of the Heavenly Sovereigns. Although your strength is weaker, your cultivation is still at the Longevity level. If you remain here too long, there’s a chance you might be exposed.”

Saying this, Li Fan led the Daoist Hundred Flowers back into the Spiritwood Realm.

Daoist Hundred Flowers did not resist.

Not only were their strengths evenly matched, any conflict between them could attract the attention of even greater powers—but more importantly, Little Liuli was still in Li Fan’s hands. Alone as she was now, her future cultivation would still depend on the Glazed Wisdom Fruit.

“Fellow Daoist Hundred Flowers,” Li Fan asked gently after changing his appearance in the Spiritwood Realm, “those survivors from the other realms back then—do you have any means of contacting them now?”

“I know what you are worried about,” the Daoist Hundred Flowers replied coldly. “But you need not be concerned. After so many years, they are most likely long dead within the Immortal Ruins.”

“Oh? You’re that certain?” Li Fan asked with interest.

“The Xuanhuang Realm, so vast as it is, is already on the verge of falling into the Immortal Ruins. Those people, relying only on a few fragments of hastily joined land, how long do you think they could have lasted?” the Daoist Hundred Flowers said with conviction.

“That is why, aside from the Xuanhuang Realm, I have nowhere else to go. We are all in the same boat, Fellow Daoist. You really don’t need to be so wary of me.”

The Daoist Hundred Flowers’s tone was sincere, though her heart sighed at how the hearts of cultivators had grown so distrustful.

At their time, although deception and intrigue were inevitable, it had never reached the point where everyone had to guard against each other as though facing mortal enemies every single moment.

“Hehe, the human heart is treacherous. One must never lower their guard.” Li Fan appeared utterly accustomed to such matters.

“Words alone are no proof. Whether letting you leave or cooperating with you, I cannot rest easy...”

“Hm?” Daoist Hundred Flowers’s expression changed upon hearing this. She thought Li Fan was about to strike her down again. The golden light of her body flickered violently.

Yet Li Fan’s tone suddenly shifted. “Fellow Daoist, follow me. Once you bow before the Stone Statue, you and I shall become companions of the same path. From then on, our hearts will be united, and there will be no need for mutual suspicion.”

Daoist Hundred Flowers froze. “Stone statue?”

Her confusion turned to terror the instant she saw the Faceless Statue.

Golden radiance flashed unsteadily over her body, trembling like a frightened cub facing its natural predator.

Daoist Hundred Flowers stepped back in alarm and exclaimed, “A True Immortal statue? How could such a thing exist here?”

“You’ve been deceiving me all along?”

Daoist Hundred Flowers glared at Li Fan with both fear and resentment.

At that moment, Li Fan keenly sensed that faint streams of suction were emanating from the Faceless True Immortal Stone Statue.

It seemed intent on absorbing Daoist Hundred Flowers’s Glazed Golden Divine Body.

“Why panic, Fellow Daoist? This is the Faceless True Immortal of Salvation and Mortal Compassion. He differs greatly from the other Immortals you know.”

“Simply swear an oath with me, and I will ensure your safety.” Li Fan’s tone grew solemn.

At the same time, his mind linked with the statue. In an instant, countless scenes of the pious prayers of Mortal Compassion Immortal believers across the Xuanhuang Realm surfaced in his mind.

He himself seemed to be strengthened by some mysterious power.

Daoist Hundred Flowers screamed in horror and hastily retreated, her gaze filled with dread as she stared at Li Fan.

Li Fan’s heart stirred. He sensed faint golden threads peeling away from Daoist Baihua’s body.

The golden filaments floated through the air, drawn toward the faceless statue, before drifting slowly to Li Fan’s side.

“Golden Vow-power?”

After absorbing it, Li Fan realized that this energy was extremely similar to ordinary Golden Willpower, but far purer in essence.

His gaze returned to Daoist Hundred Flowers.

Under Li Fan’s pressure, Daoist Hundred Flowers had no choice but to recite the oath after him.

When the words ended, Li Fan’s spiritual connection immediately sensed Daoist Hundred Flowers’s presence.

But she was no longer a golden humanoid figure. Instead, she appeared as a lotus-shaped lamp.

“So this is your true form now?” Li Fan frowned and asked.

“Y-yes.” Daoist Hundred Flowers’s tone was now utterly subdued, stripped of her former pride.

“You are at least at the Longevity Immortal realm. Why are you so weak?” Li Fan asked with genuine puzzlement.

Upon hearing this, he felt a surge of grievance and sorrow emanating from her.

Daoist Hundred Flowers glanced nervously at the silent Faceless Stone Statue, hesitated, and said nothing.

“Speak freely.” Li Fan assured her.

“The True Immortal of Salvation and Mortal Compassion... even if not yet at the realm of the Nameless True Immortal, is not far from it. I am but a fallen Longevity Immortal. How could I possibly resist?” Daoist Hundred Flowers said weakly.

“Even so, it is only a stone statue. Is there truly need for such fear?”

Daoist Hundred Flowers, thinking Li Fan was testing her, hurriedly declared her loyalty. “You jest, Your Excellency. For a True Immortal, the range of their power is so vast that whether statue or true body makes no difference.”

“What difference is there between the stone statue and the true body?”

Hearing these words from the Daoist Hundred Flowers, Li Fan’s heart skipped a beat.

The Faceless True Immortal stone statue that had always stood silently seemed, in that instant, to move slightly.

It looked toward Li Fan with a faintly mocking, shadowed gaze.

However, when Li Fan looked again, all abnormalities vanished in an instant, and it once more appeared as an ordinary sculpture.

The information hidden in the Daoist Hundred Flowers’s words was far too terrifying. Li Fan was so shocked that he almost performed a direct Return to [Truth].

But the current Grand Preceptor Li was no longer that small Foundation Establishment cultivator who had once been cornered by the Heavenly Doctor through a clone connection and forced to use [Truth] in panic.

If he were still frightened into such an act by a single uncertain statement, that would truly be a joke.

Li Fan narrowed his eyes slightly, scenes from his experiences in this lifetime flashing rapidly through his mind.

The Faceless True Immortal Stone Statue had always been connected to the Faceless True Immortal who once saved King Xuantian, and the statue itself contained a portion of that immortal’s power. Li Fan had already confirmed this when he saw the images of believers praying in his mind.

Through the statue, one could contact the believers, bestow cultivation power out of thin air, and then draw in golden vow-power.

Given all that, to claim this was merely the function of a simple statue, without the continuing influence of the Faceless True Immortal’s power, would be absurd.

Back then, however, Li Fan had held a gambler’s hope.

He lacked the courage to face a True Immortal directly, yet he dared to exploit the residual power left behind by one.

“I still underestimated the might of a True Immortal. Wherever His power reaches, it is as though His true body has arrived.”

Li Fan had fallen into a conceptual trap, viewing an immortal’s capabilities from the perspective of an ordinary cultivator.

Originally, he believed that the True Immortal’s statue was like a formation that enhanced the perception of the Formless Killing Intent, allowing the immortal to sense events near it.

But now, that conclusion had been overturned.

This statue was no different from the personal descent of the True Immortal Himself.

Realizing this, even Li Fan, whose will was far firmer than most, felt an invisible and immense pressure.

After all, deceiving from afar and courting death right under the immortal’s gaze were two entirely different things.

Yet, after careful thought, Li Fan managed to endure this pressure and did not recklessly use [Truth].

There were three reasons.

First, even if the statue was as if the True Immortal were personally present, from the moment Li Fan unearthed it until now, he had never once exposed his secret of possessing the [Truth] ability. In the immortal’s eyes, he was merely a stronger-than-average Nascent Soul cultivator, using the name of the True Immortal of Salvation and Mortal Compassion to gain benefits. 𝖗𝖆Νȫ𐌱ЕＳ

Even those in the Longevity Immortal Realm might not catch the immortal’s attention, let alone him, Li Fan. Would a human ever wonder why one particular ant in the nest was slightly stronger than the others?

If that Faceless True Immortal could truly perceive everything happening here, then the fact that Li Fan was still alive and well was itself the best proof that the Immortal had not yet taken notice of him.

Secondly, the Faceless Stone Statue was not the first time it appeared in the Xuanhuang World. During the rule of the Xuantian Sect, such statues were almost spread throughout the entire Xuanhuang World. Later, when the Ten Great Immortal Sects rebelled and the Xuantian Sect was destroyed, countless statues were damaged, leaving only the final one collected by Mr. Bai.

Throughout this process, the Faceless True Immortal remained indifferent, showing no reaction or punishment. This indicates that he was actually unconcerned about the affairs of the Xuanhuang World. In other words, as long as no one revealed the power of an Immortal-level being, perhaps they were not even qualified to be “seen” by a True Immortal.

Therefore, although Li Fan’s current actions seemed loud and chaotic, in the eyes of a True Immortal, they were essentially nothing.

The final point was also the main reason why Li Fan decided not to return to the [Truth] for now, choosing instead to continue observing the situation.

That reason was the existence of the Immortal of the Immortal Ruins and the High Wall.

The Immortal of the Immortal Ruins had been sitting in seclusion within the ruins, comprehending the Dao for nearly ten thousand years.

During Li Fan’s 115th lifetime, when he used the Medicine King Cauldron to charge into the Immortal Ruins, it was enough to interrupt the Immortal’s enlightenment and cause him to open his eyes.

If there truly existed another being of equal power nearby in the Xuanhuang World, not far from the Immortal Ruins, how could that Immortal have remained in stable seclusion for such a long time?

The principle of “how can one sleep peacefully beside another’s bed” should not cease to apply even at the Immortal level. Li Fan did not believe otherwise.

Next came the matter of the High Wall.

Regardless of whether the High Wall was built by the Immortal of the Immortal Ruins or by some existence outside it, its filtering and blocking functions at the Immortal level had already been confirmed.

Anyone inside or outside the High Wall would have their perception affected to a certain degree. It would definitely not be the same as personally being there.

“If that Faceless True Immortal senses something abnormal and crosses the High Wall…”

“Wouldn’t it immediately alert the Immortal of the Immortal Ruins?”

“When two tigers meet, there must be a fight. I would have sufficient time to return to the [Truth].”

In an instant, after careful consideration, Li Fan had already made his decision.

“It looks extremely dangerous, but precisely because the difference in power between both sides is too vast, it is not as dangerous as it seems.”

“As long as the [Truth] ability is not exposed.”

“But then again, if I did not personally possess the [Truth], I would never have thought that there truly existed a treasure capable of turning reality into illusion and reversing everything.”

…

Gathering his thoughts, Li Fan looked at the terrified Daoist Hundred Flowers before him and smiled faintly.

“Fellow Daoist Hundred Flowers, you only know one part but not the other.”

“Mortal affairs and worldly matters are things a True Immortal would generally have no interest in observing.”

“As for the affairs of the Xuanhuang World, I naturally take it upon myself to relieve the True Immortal of such worries.”

As he spoke softly, a golden Calamity Body filled with vow power slowly floated out of his body.

He then lightly pointed a finger at the forehead of the Daoist Hundred Flowers.

At the moment the golden Calamity Body appeared, the Daoist Hundred Flowers’s figure trembled violently, as if the surface of a lake were being swept by a storm.

From her body, Li Fan could sense emotions such as “fear,” “greed,” and “awe.”

“As expected…” Li Fan thought inwardly, gently controlling the Calamity Body to inject a trace of golden vow power into her body.

As the golden vow power entered her, the Daoist Hundred Flowers could not suppress a soft moan.

Her previously indistinct face suddenly became clear, revealing a stunning beauty that could captivate nations.

However, her former air of nobility had vanished. Her eyes were hazy, her gaze fixed blankly on the fingertip of the golden Calamity Body pressed against her forehead.

Longing and desire surged forth, clear and unrestrained.

The scene spoke louder than words.

Even Li Fan’s heart rippled slightly.

He seemed to see a peerless peony blooming before him, surpassing all other flowers in the world, unfolding gracefully and displaying her beauty without restraint.

“Hmph.”

Facing Daoist Hundred Flower’s pleading eyes, Li Fan quickly steadied his mind and withdrew the Golden Calamity Body.

Under the Daoist’s empty, resentful gaze, Li Fan looked at her coldly as a warning.

Then he said calmly, “It seems the blessing of the True Immortal has been quite helpful to you.”

Daoist Hundred Flowers seemed to remain lost in the sensation of absorbing the golden willpower for a moment.

Her expression was slightly dazed, her golden body swaying rhythmically.

Only when the rhythm gradually faded did her consciousness slowly return to clarity.

“The Myriad Spirits Nectar… True Immortals may not care for it. But to me at this stage, it is indeed a most precious and unparalleled tonic,” Daoist Hundred Flowers sighed softly and replied truthfully.

“The Myriad Spirits Nectar…” Li Fan deliberately showed a thoughtful look.

“Does the Your Excellency perhaps know little about this item?” Daoist Hundred Flowers, whose true age was long beyond mortal reckoning, noticed his reaction instantly and took the initiative to ask.

Li Fan nodded slightly. “It was merely a reward once granted by a True Immortal. True Immortals seldom offer guidance. Everything depends on my own comprehension. Therefore, I did not intentionally deceive you earlier. I only know that immortals exist in this world, yet I truly understand little about their specific ways.”

As he spoke, Li Fan faintly sensed a trace of envy emanating from Daoist Hundred Flowers.

However, she quickly restrained herself and said calmly, “If that is so, allow me to clarify. The so-called Myriad Spirits Nectar is the embodiment of all intelligent beings’ yearning for the Dao that exists within Heaven and Earth.”

“To be born is to have desire; to pursue the Dao is to follow that desire; and until death, one never ceases…”

“This is the fate of all mortals.”

Li Fan pondered her words carefully, his mind faintly stirring with comprehension.

“Through pursuit of the Dao, the Nectar is born. It is the instinct of living beings, a grand law of nature governing Heaven and Earth. To True Immortals, what holds value is perhaps the purest trace of the Dao that exists within the desires of sentient beings.”

“But to us ordinary cultivators, this Myriad Spirits Nectar possesses the miraculous ability to transform decay into divinity.”

...

Li Fan listened closely, and realization dawned upon him.

All living beings pursue their desires. This is the eternal movement of Heaven and Earth’s Dao.

If all life in the world were without desire, then Heaven and Earth would fall into disorder. The world would stagnate in endless stillness.

What True Immortals seek is precisely that faint trace of the Dao generated from the desires of the mortal world.

The Myriad Spirits Nectar that Li Fan had named Golden Vow Power was, in essence, the raw material used to extract this trace of the Dao.

Once the Dao trace was extracted, the golden vow-power itself became useless to the Faceless True Immortal—thus it was abandoned.

As Li Fan reflected upon this, Daoist Hundred Flowers continued slowly, “My cultivation of the Glazed Body draws upon the wishes of all under Heaven—the mortal yearning for the beauty of blooming flowers. One might say it shares the same origin as the Myriad Spirits Nectar, perhaps even purer.”

“Not only for me—whenever something involves the desires of sentient beings, the Myriad Spirits Nectar holds infinite wondrous applications. In alchemy, artifact refinement, or talisman crafting, adding a little of it greatly increases the success rate.”

“When consumed during a breakthrough, it greatly reduces the chance of failure.”

“When absorbed during cultivation, it multiplies progress severalfold.”

“It is even said that it can create objects out of thin air, directly transforming into whatever is desired.”

“As long as desire drives it, the Myriad Spirits Nectar amplifies that power,” Daoist Hundred Flowers said, her voice full of admiration.

“Does it have any side effects?” Li Fan asked, unshaken by her glowing praise.

Daoist Hundred Flowers hesitated slightly, then replied with uncertainty, “I have heard that since the Myriad Spirits Nectar is linked to the desires of all beings, the more one uses it, the deeper the entanglement.” Ｒ𝓪Ɲ𝖔𝐁ÊS̩

“Perhaps, when one eventually seeks to ascend and become an Immortal, the path will become that much more difficult.”

“…”

The Daoist Hundred Flowers paused slightly and said, “However, now that the Immortal Path has long been severed, this side effect is practically nonexistent.”

Li Fan nodded slowly.

That made sense. If the Myriad Spirit Nectar were truly as miraculous as described, even if he himself could not use it, it would still be worth keeping. How could such a treasure be given to him so easily? Only a substance harmful to True Immortals being deliberately discarded would make sense.

Li Fan turned to the Daoist Hundred Flowers. “The Myriad Spirit Nectar is useless to True Immortals. The right to use it lies entirely with me. Daoist Hundred Flowers, rest assured. If you serve the True Immortal of Salvation and Mortal Compassion faithfully, you will certainly be well rewarded in the future.”

A faint look of joy appeared on the Daoist Hundred Flower’s face.

“Well then, since you have now paid respects to the True Immortal of Salvation and Mortal Compassion, from today onward, you are also a member of our Federation of All Worlds.”

“I shall first take you on a brief tour.”

After that, the Daoist Hundred Flowers followed Li Fan as they toured the Spiritwood Realm.

No one else within the realm noticed their presence.

The Daoist Hundred Flowers sighed with emotion. “Although this is but a small world, it is not much inferior to my homeland, Wansheng.”

Her gaze lingered on the many Heaven and Earth Furnaces scattered throughout the Spiritwood Realm.

Li Fan smiled. “To tell you the truth, Daoist, over ten years ago this place was nothing but a small and insignificant realm.”

“It was only through the many blessings bestowed by the True Immortal that the Spiritwood Realm has been renewed and flourished day by day.”

The Daoist Hundred Flowers nodded in agreement.

With her sharp insight, she could naturally tell that Li Fan spoke the truth.

The realm brimmed with vitality and youthful energy. It bore the signs of new life.

After returning to the secret chamber, Li Fan’s expression turned solemn again. “Ten thousand years ago, the Dao lineage of the True Immortal of Salvation was destroyed by the rulers of the Xuanhuang Realm.”

“I was fortunate enough to discover the stone statue of the True Immortal and receive his blessing. I swore to restore the True Immortal’s Dao lineage.”

“However, as the opposing forces are vast and powerful, I intend first to accumulate strength and then unite the various realms to set the order right again.”

Li Fan briefly recounted the sequence of events to the Daoist Hundred Flowers.

The Hundred Flowers Daoist nodded. “I am aware of the current state of the Xuanhuang Realm. That Immortal Ancestor is indeed terrifying and awe-inspiring. However…”

“If Your Excellency can obtain the aid of the True Immortal, then he is nothing to fear.”

Having personally experienced the Myriad Spirit Nectar, Daoist Hundred Flowers had strong faith in the True Immortal of Salvation and Mortal Compassion.

Li Fan, however, shook his head slightly. “The blessings of the True Immortal are unpredictable. Sometimes they descend without reason, again and again, yet sometimes they do not appear for years. To restore the True Immortal Dao lineage will be a long and arduous path. Still, Daoist Hundred Flowers, there is one matter I have long been puzzled by.”

“You said the True Immortal has already transcended and should not concern themselves with mundane affairs. Then why would they bestow gifts upon us?”

Li Fan fixed his gaze on the Daoist Hundred Flowers, trying to extract an answer from her.

The Daoist Hundred Flowers looked somewhat nervous. After a brief moment of thought, she offered her conjecture. “Perhaps it is not a blessing at all, but merely the residual power left behind after the True Immortal absorbs the traces of the Dao.”

“After all, too much time has passed. I no longer know what form the Immortals that still exist in this world have taken.”

“Not a blessing, but only residual power? How disheartening…” Li Fan murmured under his breath, though in his heart there was no trace of disappointment.

“Your Excellency, you need not lose heart. I can see that you can draw upon the image of the True Immortal. Compared to us insignificant ants, your standing in the eyes of the True Immortal must surely be different.” The Hundred Flowers Daoist comforted him.

“Oh?” Li Fan raised his head and looked toward the Daoist Hundred Flowers.

This person always had a way of saying things that startled people without meaning to.

“What do you mean by ‘different’?”

The Daoist Hundred Flowers slowly explained, “Perhaps, Your Excellency, you are the first to once again come into contact with the True Immortal’s stone statue—or maybe you are the first to cause the statue to revive.”

“In any case, I believe, Your Excellency, that you have also noticed—you possess a power unlike anyone else.”

“This may be the sign that the True Immortal views you with special regard.”

The Daoist Hundred Flowers spoke cautiously, searching for reasons to explain it.

Li Fan simply chuckled softly in response.

“All right, the will of the True Immortal is not something people like us can fathom.”

Li Fan declared this righteously, putting an end to their discussion about the True Immortal.

“I still don’t know what you are skilled in. Since you have joined my Federation of All Worlds, your talents shouldn’t be left unused.”

“Do not worry. Our Federation is still in the stage of concealment and development. I know your actual combat strength is not great, and I won’t make you go out and fight.” Li Fan asked gently, his tone considerate.

Seeing Li Fan’s smiling face, the Daoist Hundred Flowers suddenly felt an inexplicable sense of unease. Still, she forced herself to answer, “Now that I have transformed into a Glazed Body, there are two things I am most skilled at.”

“First, I can soothe and repair injuries to divine sense and soul. However, this requires consuming my own essence and can only be done occasionally.”

After worshiping before the True Immortal’s stone statue, the Daoist Hundred Flowers knew she had formed a link with it. Through that connection, Li Fan could sense her emotions.

Thus, she dared not hide anything and continued honestly, “The second is to stimulate and nurture spiritual plants and herbs. Not only can I make them more vital, but there is also a chance I can help them give birth to a spiritual essence.”
