“However, from what I have observed, the spiritual energy of this realm is all absorbed by the Central Spirit Tree, so spiritual plants are extremely scarce.”

Li Fan nodded. “Indeed, the Spiritwood Realm has become quite barren.”

The Daoist Hundred Flowers let out a breath of relief.

“But that is no problem. Our Federation has another base that can fully meet your needs.”

Li Fan smiled faintly.

The next moment, the Daoist Hundred Flowers’s vision blurred.

When she regained her sight, her body began trembling uncontrollably.

Before her stood an immense, heaven-piercing tree, even grander than the Spirit Tree of the Spiritwood Realm.

This colossal tree had not drained the world of all its nutrients. Instead, around its roots and even across its branches, countless miniature ecosystems had formed. 𝘳𝐀𝐍ồ฿ÊŚ

Endless grasses, spirit plants, and spirit herbs filled the area.

Dense and boundless, they stretched as far as the eye could see.

Even with her powerful divine sense, the Daoist Hundred Flowers could not perceive the end of it all in a single instant.

The pure and immense wood-element spiritual energy nearly suffocated her.

Never before had she witnessed such an astonishing sight. In her daze, she almost believed she had stepped into the legendary Immortal Realm.

“This… where is this place?”

After a long while, the Daoist Hundred Flowers finally managed to recover and asked, looking around in search of Li Fan’s figure.

“This is one of the Federation of All World’s secret bases the Spiritwood Cave-Heaven.”

“I believe the abundance of spiritual plants here should be more than enough for you to tend to.”

Li Fan’s voice echoed through the heavens like rolling thunder.

The Daoist Hundred Flowers opened her mouth, but in the end, said nothing.

The wood-attribute spiritual energy here was so dense that there was no need for her to tend to it at all. Any plant casually dug out would already be a top-grade material.

However, sensing the faint trace of threat in the other party’s tone, Daoist Hundred Flowers could only smile bitterly and say, “Enough, it’s more than enough.”

“Haha, that’s good. Although this Cave Heaven is indeed rather rich in resources, it has been abandoned for too long and is somewhat disorderly. I’ll have to trouble you to put more care into it. After all, this place will serve as the logistics base of the Federation in the future, and it must not be handled carelessly,” Li Fan said earnestly.

Daoist Hundred Flowers looked at the endless expanse of the Cave Heaven and nodded blankly.

“To properly manage this place, even with my current strength, it would take at least ten years,” Daoist Hundred Flowers sighed softly.

“This Excellency truly hides a blade behind his smile,” she thought.

Yet, with her true body bound by the True Immortal Stone Statue and her glazed body still under the other party’s control, she had no choice. As the saying went, a person is the fish, while another holds the knife. Daoist Hundred Flowers could only devote herself to the exhausting work.

Fortunately, she had always loved dealing with spiritual flora. This Cave Heaven had not been disturbed by cultivators for who knows how many years. Every spiritual plant here grew luxuriantly, each one full of vitality and spirit, evoking both admiration and pity.

As Daoist Hundred Flowers processed one area after another, her mood gradually improved.

She did not know how much time had passed before her movements were suddenly interrupted by a thunderous sound from the sky.

Daoist Hundred Flowers raised her head and saw a vast piece of land suddenly appear, floating halfway up the giant tree.

It was like a dark cloud, covering the entire sky.

Li Fan’s voice sounded again, “Oh, right. There are still many spiritual plants in another base. I have moved them all here for you so that you won’t have to travel back and forth.”

“If convenient, you may transplant all of them into this Cave Heaven.”

After saying that, Li Fan’s aura disappeared once more.

Daoist Hundred Flowers froze for a moment, then flew up into the sky. When she saw it clearly, she nearly lost her breath.

That floating continent was covered in mountains upon mountains of spiritual herbs, every inch of it overflowing with life force.

All of them were extremely ancient in age.

“There are formations dividing and categorizing everything. Every batch of plants has been cultivated for at least several thousand years. They’re of the highest grade imaginable…”

“This emissary… could it be that he has emptied out an entire ancient Immortal Sect?”

“These will be even more troublesome to handle.”

“The time needed for this project just increased by another five years,” Daoist Hundred Flowers muttered helplessly.

…

Li Fan, sensing Daoist Hundred Flower’s presence within his Wood-Attribute Cave Heaven, nodded slightly.

Although this Daoist Hundred Flowers appeared to have completely submitted, she was after all a long-lived cultivator who had been asleep for countless years.

Li Fan could not place his full trust in her.

Keeping her suppressed within his own Cave Heaven while also having her manage the disordered spiritual flora there truly served two purposes at once.

Ever since Li Fan had devoured the Five Elements Great Cave Heaven, his strength had improved once again.

The Five Elements Cave Heaven continued to expand slowly, and the Wood-Attribute Cave Heaven in particular had entered a state of wild, uncontrolled growth.

Daoist Hundred Flowers’s arrival was indeed perfectly timed.

As for the floating continent filled with spiritual plants that Li Fan had later transferred here, that was none other than the secret realm of the Medicine King Sect, the Longevity Valley.

Since it was destined to belong to him anyway, he might as well move it into the Wood-Attribute Cave Heaven and process everything together.

“The return of the Medicine King Cauldron is not far off.”

“The shortage of manpower within the Federation of All Worlds will soon be resolved.”

Li Fan’s gaze seemed to pierce through the barriers of the small world, reaching directly into the heavens of the Xuanhuang Realm.

The turmoil caused by Daoist Hundred Flower’s appearance gradually subsided.

A month later, Mo Rubin finally made secret contact with Li Fan.

“Brother Xingwang, that rare treasure capable of deducing formations has been found.”

“Divine sense communication is inconvenient, so let us meet here in person.”

“I will also hand over that strange treasure to you.”

“Hehe, lately I keep feeling as if someone is watching me, so I must stay cautious.”

After sending the location, Mo Rubin suddenly vanished without a trace.

Sensing the glowing mark of the map within his Sea of Consciousness, Li Fan remained silent.

“Is this a test, or a trap?”

Ever since he made the decision to ‘observe the situation temporarily and not yet return to the [Truth]’, Li Fan had felt a faint unease deep in his heart.

Yet, no matter how much he reflected upon himself, he could not find the true source of this anxiety.

“There should be no problem with temporarily delaying the return to [Truth]… but still…”

His spiritual intuition had always been exceptionally accurate. The feeling now was as though he were walking through a dense forest: his direction was correct, no beasts were attacking, yet the unseen crisis hidden in the shadows whispered that something was terribly wrong.

He knew that this unease likely originated from that Faceless True Immortal Stone Statue.

“Xuantian Divine Statue… Xuantian Dharma King…”

As Mo Rubin’s image flashed in his mind, Li Fan immediately reached a decision.

“Although he now regards me as one of his own, I still cannot afford to let my guard down.”

Li Fan recalled the scene where Mo Rubin devoured the Dharma-Transmitter Feng.

During this period, he had also made some preliminary analysis and speculation about Mo Rubin’s abilities.

Compared to Senior Sister Zhao’s ‘One Heart of All Beings’, Mo Rubin’s power was more like ‘Mirror and Assimilation’.

“As long as I can maintain my true heart and avoid being enticed by that illusory thread of the mirrored void, I should be able to delay the assimilation. I have the Seven-Colored Divine Light, and with the Immortal Heart Mantra protecting my body, even if I cannot win, escaping should not be too difficult.” ℝἁNоβË𝙨

“If things truly go wrong, I can still release Daoist Hundred Flowers to draw his attention. After all, she is at the Longevity Immortal Heavenly Sovereign realm, and should be able to hold him off for a short while.”

The lingering sense of unease, whose source he could not identify, caused Li Fan’s thoughts to become unusually complex and cautious.

After making all necessary preparations, Li Fan quietly arrived at the agreed location.

It was on the border of the Central Four Prefecture of the Immortal Alliance, within Tianchen Prefecture, at a seemingly ordinary mountain peak.

The stone mountain rose high, piercing into the clouds.

Hidden beneath the sea of clouds, halfway up the mountain, there was an inconspicuous stone cave.

At first, it was narrow, barely enough for a person to squeeze through. After walking several dozen steps, it suddenly opened up into a wide chamber.

Mo Rubin had already been waiting there for some time.

Outside the cave, there was no sign of any formation or restriction, yet from the outside, it was utterly impossible to sense the presence of a cultivator within.

Only after stepping into the stone cave and standing before Mo Rubin did Li Fan finally sense a faint trace of life.

“This place was one of Dharma-Transmitter Feng’s safe havens. It is a naturally formed hidden cave heaven. According to legend, such places can only be found by those with destiny. Meeting here will not bring us any danger.”

Mo Rubin had returned to his original appearance, sitting at a stone table as he calmly explained.

“What safe haven? I didn’t encounter any barrier or obstruction. I just walked right in as I pleased.”

Li Fan snorted coldly, speaking with clear disdain.

Mo Rubin smiled: “Brother Xingwang, there is something you do not know. The reason it was so easy for you just now is that I had already informed you of this hidden cave heaven’s location in advance. If you were to come alone, completely unaware…”

“Your divine sense would not detect it. Even if you saw it with your own eyes, you would instinctively ignore the entrance. You would search endlessly and never find it. The wonders of Heaven and Earth are such that, even with our strength, we cannot fully comprehend them.”

Li Fan ignored Mo Rubin’s sigh and said impatiently in a cold voice: “Enough. Stop talking about these useless things. Where is that mystical treasure capable of deducing formations?”

Mo Rubin shook his head, then casually tossed an object over.

Li Fan caught it and froze slightly.

It was not what he had expected. It was not one of the Dissociation Discs. Instead, it was a green cube he had never seen before.

“What is this thing…”

Li Fan lightly touched the cube. Instantly, it decomposed into tens of thousands of even smaller cubes.

Like living creatures, they gathered and dispersed in the air, forming orderly patterns.

Li Fan examined one of the small cubes carefully and discovered that it was composed of hundreds of combined formations.

“Formation Crown?” The name appeared unbidden in Li Fan’s mind.

He did not reveal that he recognized it. Instead, he looked up at Mo Rubin, waiting for an explanation.

“This is the Lifeless Formation Crown. It was recently discovered in Lancang Prefecture of the Immortal Alliance and submitted.”

“A Formation Crown, in simple terms, is the layering of hundreds or thousands of formations together. This Lifeless True Crown was derived from a single ordinary Formation Crown through continuous change and evolution.”

“It is said to have been left behind by a Soul Transformation-level formation master who perished due to a mysterious incident. After research by the Immortal Alliance, it was initially determined that the change occurred during the fusion of a Heavenly Wonder with rules from the Strange Realm, resulting in the transformation of the Formation Crown itself.” Mo Rubin explained in detail.

Li Fan immediately understood Mo Rubin’s meaning. Heavenly Wonders are embodiments of the laws of the Xuanhuang Realm, while the Strange are distortions or remnants of laws from worlds that have been consumed.

When the two merge, incredible changes can occur.

Li Fan had previously speculated about such possibilities while investigating the true origin of the Strange. Unfortunately, he had never encountered an actual example—until Mo Rubin casually presented it.

Indeed, the resource advantage accessible to a Dharma-Transmitter could not be replicated in a short time, even with multiple reincarnations or prescient insight.

Li Fan knew this item, but Sun Xingwang certainly did not.

Pretending to be overwhelmed, he interrupted Mo Rubin: “Alright, enough chanting. Just tell me how to use it.”

“The Lifeless Formation Crown is constantly evolving. One formation generates another, continuing infinitely. All you need to do is periodically inscribe the Xuantian Nether Lock Formation into it and let it naturally evolve. It is like beasts fighting; in the end, the one that survives must be the strongest.” Mo Rubin patiently explained.

“That sounds easy, though a little unreliable…” Li Fan muttered, examining the green Lifeless Formation Crown.

“There is no problem. Though somewhat uncontrollable, it will definitely achieve our goal. Inscribing the Xuantian Nether Lock Formation is time-consuming and labor-intensive. I am now at the Immortal Alliance headquarters, under the gaze of many, so it is inconvenient for me to act. I must leave it to you.” Mo Rubin said solemnly.

“Actually, there is another mystical treasure, even stronger than this Lifeless Formation Crown in deducing formations. It is called the Dissociation Disc. Unfortunately, it was divided into nine by Heaven’s envy. The time required to reunite the nine discs is far too long; we simply cannot wait. So we had to abandon it,” Mo Rubin said regretfully.

Li Fan’s eyes flickered. “There’s actually such a treasure! Even if we can’t use it for now, let’s collect it first. We can’t let it fall into someone else’s hands, or it might be used against us to unravel the Xuantian Nether Lock Formation.”

Mo Rubin pondered for a moment, then nodded. “Brother Xingwang is right. Such a powerful artifact must not be leaked. I’ll make arrangements once I return.”

Li Fan let out a low, sinister laugh.

“By the way, Brother Xingwang, apart from strengthening the Xuantian Nether Lock Formation, I have another matter I need your help with. It concerns the Xuantian Mirror. After much thought, I realized only you can handle it with confidence.” Mo Rubin suddenly said.

“Hmph, we’re brothers. Why speak so politely?” Li Fan replied with mild irritation, glaring at Mo Rubin.

Seeing that the matter was serious, Mo Rubin hesitated briefly, then placed an additional layer of restriction around them.

Only then did he speak in a low voice. “According to my latest investigation, during the years when the Xuantian Mirror has been under the control of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, it’s highly possible that it created a human incarnation. I need you to find this incarnation and destroy it completely, cutting off all paths of retreat.” A glint of killing intent flashed in Mo Rubin’s eyes.

Li Fan looked visibly shocked.

“The Xuantian Mirror created a human incarnation? How is that possible?”

“Don’t worry, Brother Xingwang. To avoid detection by the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, the incarnation’s strength will not be high. With your power, as long as you locate it, you will definitely be able to kill it.”

“I’ll also lend you an artifact to ensure success.” As he spoke, Mo Rubin took out a pitch-black metallic book.

“This is the Ink-Stained Evil Tome. It is especially effective against artifact spirits and divine tools. Once it locks onto the target, it releases countless streams of black light to contaminate and suppress it. With this treasure, Brother Xingwang, you will not fail.”

Li Fan snorted. “It’s only an incarnation. Even without this so-called Ink-Stained Evil Tome, I could still kill it.”

Yet despite his words, he still accepted the dark artifact, tucking it away.

Then he frowned slightly. “But where do I even start looking for the Xuantian Mirror’s incarnation? It must be well hidden. Will there be enough time?”

Mo Rubin replied confidently, “The Immortal Ancestor has long suspected that the Xuantian Mirror created an incarnation, and a secret investigation has been ongoing for some time. Until recently, there were no concrete results. But just a short while ago, the subordinates of Dharma-Transmitter Feng finally found decisive evidence. For now, only I know of this matter—it hasn’t yet been reported to the Five Elders Association.”

“Oh?” Li Fan’s eyes lit up with interest.

"The Tianxuan Treasure Mirror has always been managed by the Mirror Holder. If we're talking about dividing the human body, without the Mirror Holder acting as an inside man, it's fundamentally impossible. We've preliminarily confirmed that one of the Mirror Holders, [Cang], is that traitor!"

"Cang's daughter is the somewhat famous Scarlet Snow Immortal Sage in the Immortal Alliance. Several years ago, this woman inexplicably became pregnant and gave birth to a son. I suspect it might be related to the Xuantian Treasure Mirror!" Mo Rubing recounted. ŔâΝОＢÈS̈

[TL Notes: The previously named Fei Xue will be translated as Scarlet Snow Immortal Sage from now on]

“You mean, the son of that Scarlet Snow Immortal Sage is the incarnation of the Xuantian Mirror?” Li Fan narrowed his eyes.

The image of Shuo Feng suddenly surfaced in his mind.

“I can’t rule out that possibility. Back then, Scarlet Snow held a grand martial contest for marriage, making quite a spectacle. Then she abruptly became pregnant, shocking the entire world.”

“It was too conspicuous, as if deliberately staged to draw attention. Perhaps it was all a ruse, using Shuo Feng to conceal the true incarnation of the Xuantian Mirror.”

“In any case, that family is definitely connected to the Tianxuan Realm. Not long ago, we discovered that in Scarlet Snow’s data within the Mirror, there was a single entry, something that only the Xuantian Mirror itself has permission to alter—that changed without any record of modification.”

Mo Rubin’s eyes darkened as he finished his explanation.

“Immortal Sage Scarlet Snow... how strong is she?” Li Fan did not bother to ask for details and went straight to the point.

“Her strength is rather ordinary. However, she is skilled in artifact refinement. Cang dotes on her greatly, providing her with an unlimited supply of materials, which allowed her to master a remarkable level of refining arts. But in the end, it is still a minor path. Brother Xingwang, you excel in soul-based attacks. If you strike by surprise, she will definitely not be your match,” Mo Rubin said with confidence in Sun Xingwang’s abilities.

“I excel in soul-based attacks...” Li Fan was momentarily stunned, then suddenly understood.

“Indeed.”

Seeing this, Mo Rubin thought for a moment and then added, “If, at that time, Brother Xingwang, you find yourself uncertain, summon the divine-demonic avatar I am attached to.”

“At that moment, I can transmit part of my power. Together, she will have no chance of survival.”

As he spoke, Mo Rubin transmitted an internal investigation report regarding the Cang lineage within the Dharma-Transmitter Order.

Unlike other great powers with complex hierarchies, this lineage consisted only of three members: Cang, Feixue, and Shuo Feng, a single line of inheritance.

Yet the sheer amount of resources they possessed, as revealed in the report, was astonishing.

“The places where Scarlet Snow often appears have already been marked.”

“She is extremely fond of her son Shuo Feng, and every so often she summons him for a meeting. Most of the time, they meet in her private cave-dwelling outside the Immortal Alliance Heavenly City.”

“So it would be best to strike when they meet, capturing them both in one sweep,” Mo Rubin said solemnly.

Li Fan nodded in agreement.

“As long as we destroy the Xuantian Mirror’s clone and sever its retreat, then use a Spirit-Sealing Formation to suppress it, we can have a talk with the Xuantian Mirror.”

“Otherwise, that thing will still act arrogantly.” Mo Rubin’s tone carried some displeasure.

“Arrogant, huh.” Li Fan recalled that cold, mechanical voice he had once heard in the Tianxuan Realm.

The two continued discussing the details of their plan before Mo Rubin prepared to leave.

Just as he was about to step out of the hidden cave-dwelling, Li Fan suddenly spoke. “After thousands of years apart, we brothers finally meet again. Why not rejoin the sect of the True Immortal of Salvation and Mortal Compassion?”

As he spoke, the faint shadow of a Faceless Stone Statue slowly manifested in the air.

Mo Rubin glanced up at it, instinctively taking a half step back.

A trace of fear flickered in his eyes, but he said nothing.

He merely shook his head and drifted away into the distance.

“Brother Xingwang, before you leave, take a closer look around this cave-dwelling. You might find something worthwhile.”

His voice echoed faintly through the cavern as his figure vanished completely.

Li Fan stood in silence for a moment, then began examining the cave again.

In an unremarkable corner, he noticed a spiderweb that had somehow appeared without him realizing it.

Li Fan was certain that before Mo Rubin left, this hidden cave heaven did not have this spider web.

"It appeared suddenly; is this a hint for me..."

There was no spider as the weaver on the web; it seemed to have appeared out of thin air.

Under Li Fan's gaze, a butterfly flapped its wings and landed on the spider web.

The butterfly detected no danger at all; it even felt very comfortable and crawled back and forth on the web with its legs.

This spider web was also different from ordinary ones; it did not stick to the butterfly. Moreover, it was extremely sturdy, without even the slightest shake.

The butterfly played very happily on the web.

But it could not possibly live on the spider web forever; it still needed to find food and sustain its survival.

Thus, the butterfly flapped its wings again, wanting to take flight and leave.

Something happened that made Li Fan's pupils contract sharply.

It seemed as if sensing the butterfly's departure, the originally harmless spider web suddenly tightened.

An inexplicable suction force arose without reason, immediately pulling the butterfly back.

The unprepared butterfly, with its fragile body unable to withstand this immense pulling force, was instantly torn into countless fragments. They were absorbed and evenly scattered across the white spider web.

In the blink of an eye, they were absorbed by the web, fusing the bodily remains with the web itself, impossible to distinguish any longer.

And the spider web remained quietly in the corner, as if the previous anomaly had never occurred.

...

Having witnessed the entire process, Li Fan took a deep breath.

With such a straightforward hint, how could he not see where the source of the unease he had always overlooked and faintly felt in his heart truly came from. ȐᴀＮȯ𝐛ΕṨ

His previous deduction was actually not wrong.

Just like a butterfly that mistakenly entered the spider web, the Faceless True Immortal should have no interest in the weak Li Fan.

Whether borrowing the power of the stone statue to bluff or wandering around under the stone statue's watch.

None of it would attract the True Immortal's attention.

If he maintained this state from beginning to end, there would indeed be no problems.

But if he wanted to escape the control of the True Immortal's power, or suddenly displayed strength that even the True Immortal would find interesting...

The outcome would probably be like that butterfly: instantly counterattacked and torn into countless fragments!

In terms of Li Fan's situation, with Nascent Soul realm in this life and Dao Integration combat power, continuing to hop around by borrowing the Faceless True Immortal's stone statue posed no major issues.

But if he chose to return to [Truth] at any point, just like the spider web butterfly suddenly flapping its wings, it could immediately alert that Faceless True Immortal.

How fast would the True Immortal's reaction be? Could it affect or even halt the process of returning to [Truth]?

Li Fan had no way to speculate.

However, when the Immortal Ruins Immortal from the 115th life destroyed the Xuanhuang Realm with a single glance, under the influence of his power, after Li Fan returned to [Truth], the surrounding scenery did not immediately fade into illusion.

Instead, it presented a black domain; time outside the black domain was still flowing.

Perhaps this could indicate to some extent that when strength reaches or approaches the level of the Nameless True Immortal, it can exert a certain influence on the operation of returning to [Truth].

Most crucially, Li Fan had already been selected by the Faceless Stone Statue as a role akin to an "agent."

Even golden vow power would appear within his body...

One could say he was deeply entangled in the net, with myriad ties!

It was almost no different from standing before the True Immortal.

Perhaps the True Immortal would not glance at the ants underfoot, but when an ant on its body burst forth with light, it would inevitably draw the True Immortal's gaze!

"..."

After pondering for a long time, Li Fan could not help but break out in a cold sweat.

"Fortunately, the subtle spiritual sense in the void made me refrain from returning to [Truth] immediately before."

"Otherwise, facing the True Immortal head-on without any mental preparation..."

Even with Li Fan's current enlightenment, he had to admit it would be "more ill than good."

After a brief shock, Li Fan steadied his mind.

The unease that had always lingered in his heart slowly dissipated, and there was even less fear in his heart.

Because of the unknown, there was fear.

Once he knew the source of the threat, Li Fan instead calmed down.

"It is actually not as desperate as imagined. After all, it is not a direct confrontation with the True Immortal, but finding a way to successfully use [Truth] in the True Immortal's presence."

"This life has only just begun; there is still a very long time, enough for me to think it through."

"Back when I was building my foundation, I could safely return to [Truth] before the Heavenly Doctor; now with strength comparable to Dao Integration, how could I not use [Truth] right under the True Immortal's nose?"

Li Fan's thoughts gradually settled, the panic in his eyes vanished, leaving only a deep, unfathomable pool like an abyss.

At this moment, another change quietly occurred in the spider web within this hidden cave heaven.

Another butterfly danced gracefully and landed on the spider web.

Just like what happened before, it fell into the great net's peril without knowing.

But this time, when the butterfly was about to flap its wings and leave, something different happened!

Suddenly, a strong wind blew through, causing the spider web itself to shake violently.

Thus, that inexplicable suction force did not arise.

Taking advantage of this opportunity, the butterfly quickly flapped its wings and departed.

It vanished into the air.

Like a play, after performing these two scenes, the spider web, the butterfly, and the wind all disappeared in an instant.

Looking around, Li Fan found no traces of their existence in this hidden cave heaven.

"This illusion technique does have some profundity."

However, what Li Fan cared about was not how Mo Rubin displayed this scene, but the deeper meaning behind it.

"Whether it is the stone statue or the Myriad Spirits Nectar, Mo Rubin avoids them as if they were plagues."

"Added to this hint of his, it is clear he already knows the consequences of being trapped in the True Immortal's net."

"But from the current situation, he has already escaped from the True Immortal's net."

The image of a strong wind blowing through and the butterfly flapping away reappeared before Li Fan's eyes.

And he also vaguely perceived the place he had overlooked before.

The Faceless Stone Statue, as the totem of the Xuantian Sect, should have been absolutely common within the Xuantian Sect in the past.

But in the memories of the Xuantian Sect's Dharma King Ji Yuzhen, Li Fan had not seen even a shadow of the Faceless True Immortal's stone statue.

"Either there were no stone statues in the Xuantian Sect at that time."

"Or..."

"Some force directly severed the existence and influence of the stone statues."

Thinking of this, Li Fan could not help but narrow his eyes.

"The severing that occurred simultaneously to two Dharma Kings is absolutely no coincidence."

"It seems the event of the Xuantian Sect's destruction back then still hides more secrets. And Mo Rubin, who deeply realized the terror of the True Immortal's power, does not even dare to speak directly."

"He can only hint at it with this abstract method..."

Li Fan's heart grew even heavier.

"It seems that to break the situation in this life, I still need to seek help from Mo Rubin."

"First, cooperate with him to complete the coercion of the Tianxuan Mirror."

With this in mind, Li Fan drifted away.

Returning to the Spiritwood Realm, Li Fan began analyzing the information provided by Mo Rujin about the Mirror Holder [Cang]'s lineage.

The portion about Cang actually did not contain much.

It was only known that Cang was also a survivor after the great calamity. When the Immortal Ancestor reestablished the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance, besides the Dharma Transmitters responding one after another, this "one who understands the times is a wise man" Cang also ascended to heaven in one step due to surrendering at the first opportunity.

Of course, the internal analysis of the Dharma Transmitters on Cang indicated that there must be other factors for this person to become the Mirror Holder. He must have had extremely special reasons to be selected by the Immortal Ancestor.

Regarding Cang's daughter, Immortal Sage Scarlet Snow Xuan Sushang, the information became noticeably more abundant.

Xuan Sushang was born before Cang joined the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance. Her mother perished in a cultivators' conflict when she was very young, sacrificing herself to protect Cang.

The father and daughter depended on each other, so Cang doted on Xuan Sushang extremely.

Especially after Cang gradually gained great power, he was even more unstinting in his rewards to Xuan Sushang.

According to incomplete statistics, just in the central four prefectures of the Immortal Alliance, Xuan Sushang's cave abodes and territories numbered over two hundred, large and small.

It was said that Xuan Sushang's cultivation aptitude was actually average, but at her level, even if the aptitude was poor, it could be fully compensated with sufficient resources.

Especially under the new method framework.

Xuan Sushang smoothly cultivated all the way to the Dao Integration realm.

It was said that on the day she sacrificed and refined the Spirit of Heaven and Earth: Scarlet Snow, Cang dispatched a full five Dao Integration powerhouses to escort her and ensure no accidents occurred.

After Xuan Sushang advanced to Dao Integration, she finally gained a bit more freedom.

Previously, Cang did not allow her to leave the jurisdiction of the Immortal Alliance's central four prefecture. Moreover, wherever she went, he would send people to follow and watch her.

Thus, after liberation, Xuan Sushang spent nearly a hundred years touring the vast majority of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance's territories.

During this period, her specific whereabouts could only be roughly investigated.

After having enough fun, Xuan Sushang finally settled down. Perhaps due to interest, she began to immerse herself in studying the path of artifact refinement. The Immortal Alliance's Artifact Refinement Hall was fully open to her, allowing Xuan Sushang to learn the most advanced artifact refinement knowledge of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance.

Her artifact refinement level advanced by leaps and bounds, gaining great fame and becoming known throughout the world by successfully refining a set of peerless battle armor capable of withstanding the combined attack of five Dao Integration cultivators.

After that...

It seemed as if she had played enough; she gradually became low-key.

Aside from occasional interactions with a few friends like the chief of the Strategy Formation Hall, Lu Xichan, she basically did not appear in the public eye during other times. 𝘙ἁꞐỒᛒÊṥ

Until she suddenly issued the announcement of a martial arts bride selection tournament, once again shocking the world.

Then, with no one stepping up to challenge, it ended in farce with Xuan Sushang inexplicably becoming pregnant.

Xuan Sushang's son was Shuo Feng.

He appeared as if out of thin air, without a ten-month pregnancy or any information about his father.

Just as Cang's doting on Xuan Sushang was somewhat distorted, Xuan Sushang's discipline of Shuo Feng was nearly harsh.

According to the information, until Shuo Feng reached Nascent Soul, he had not stepped out of that cave abode in Tianquan Prefecture.

He could only glimpse the outside world through the Tianxuan Mirror.

This situation improved after Shuo Feng successfully reached Soul Transformation and strenuously resisted.

However, Shuo Feng still had to wear the Golden Light Battle Armor specially refined for him by Xuan Sushang whenever he went out.

According to the Dharma Transmitters' secret investigation, this Golden Light Battle Armor not only had perverse defensive capabilities, enough to withstand a combined strike from over ten Dao Integration cultivators.

It even defended the soul as solidly as a fortress.

After the Golden Light Battle Armor disintegrated due to damage, it could directly transfer Shuo Feng to a safe location.

...

"Every so often, Shuo Feng must report and pay respects to Scarlet Snow Immortal Sage."

"Although their meeting locations are not fixed and are notified in advance, the most likely ones can still be deduced..."

"The next time should be in twenty-three days."

Li Fan looked at the names and information of the five circled cave abodes and could not help but sigh slightly: "Even with my speed of earning contribution points, to buy even one such cave abode would probably take over a decade."

"This kid was born without knowing how many he has."

The image of Shuo Feng's face reappeared before Li Fan's eyes.

"At this point in time, he should not yet have the intention to completely recultivate; he is still at the Soul Transformation realm."

"I do not know what stimulus he received to make such an impulsive decision."

"Actually, the safest method is to wait like a hunter at the Heavenly Sword Sect's Sword Tomb and capture him without anyone noticing."

"Unfortunately, time is a bit short. Moreover, I have to capture Xuan Sushang together..."

Blue light constantly flickered from the Dao Deviation Stone in his mind; Li Fan integrated the various forces he controlled and began deducing.

"If it is just to trap and capture alive, it should not be a big problem."

"Even I alone am barely sufficient, not to mention with Tianyang, Hundred Flowers, and the others assisting."

"Hmm... but I should still pull Mo Rubin along."

The various moves, divine abilities used by Xuan Sushang and Shuo Feng during cultivation and sparring in the Tianxuan Mirror, as well as the general information on their cultivation techniques, all appeared before Li Fan's eyes.

Comparing the strengths of both sides, countless possible future scenes flashed in Li Fan's mind.

"As the direct descendants of the Mirror Holder, they should be well aware that the information in the Tianxuan Mirror is by no means secret. I believe their true combat power is absolutely not limited to what is on the surface."

"Fortunately, I have many trump cards as well."

...

After a day and night's deduction, Li Fan was nearly confident about this ambush.

Next, it was a matter of waiting for the arrival of the best opportunity to strike.

While waiting, Li Fan took out the Lifeless Formation Crown and the Ink-Stained Evil Tome gifted by Mo Rubin to study them.

The Lifeless Formation Crown was like a living thing; under a rough scan of divine sense, the internal formations were like countless ferocious beasts slaughtering each other, mutually devouring and evolving.

The efficiency naturally could not compare to the Nine Discs United Dissociation Disc, but it also gave Li Fan a bit of new inspiration.

If Mo Rubin failed to obtain the Dissociation Disc, perhaps he could split the Final Dissociation Disc back into two and let them confront each other.

It might deduce new techniques even more efficiently.

Li Fan tried feeding the Lifeless Formation Crown to the Dissociation Disc, but unfortunately, the Dissociation Disc was not interested in it at all. It did not even bother to look.

On the contrary, sensing the aura of the Final Dissociation Disc, the countless formations composing the Lifeless Formation Crown instantly became restless.

Li Fan shook his head slightly and directly suppressed and sealed this treasure.

"It barely counts as a good item, but unfortunately, it is useless to me. The advanced version of the Xuantian Spirit-Sealing Formation has long been deduced; wanting a formation deduction treasure is just an excuse."

"It's just a pity that this thing is too conspicuous. It's impossible to sell it for something else."

Li Fan sighed, then turned his gaze to the Ink-Stained Evil Tome.

The moment he took it out and placed it in front of him, the Dao Deviation Stone and the Dissociation Disc in his sea of consciousness both transmitted feelings of disgust and a trace of fear at the same time.

"As expected, it has some tricks."

Li Fan stared straight at this pitch-black metal booklet.

It was unknown what material it was forged from, but it emitted a dark black light.

This black light seemed to have vitality, constantly wandering over its surface.

Unlike the ink color on the Ink Death that Li Fan had seen before, which was purely destructive, the ink of this Ink-Stained Evil Tome carried a thick stench that made one's heart feel nauseous and uncomfortable.

"It's like the garbage produced in the process of the world's operation. It is not tolerated by the world..."

Li Fan said thoughtfully.

He took out the standard Nascent Soul Mirror treasure called the Green Bamboo Ring from the Immortal Alliance for testing. When Li Fan manipulated the Ink-Stained Evil Tome to release countless black lights that enveloped it.

It was like a sheet of white paper splashed with ink.

The originally brilliant green light of the Green Bamboo Ring instantly dimmed, and the aura on it suddenly fell silent.

Even though the black light came from his own hand, Li Fan still frowned slightly and moved a little farther away.

After putting away the Ink-Stained Evil Tome, it took a full half day for the black color lingering on the Green Bamboo Ring to gradually dissipate.

A slight discomfort came from the ancient tree in the Spiritwood Realm.

"The ink-dyed black light does not disappear into thin air. It requires the world to spend a certain amount of time to purify it. If the quantity is too large and exceeds the limit it can handle, even the world can be completely polluted."

"Although it cannot achieve world-destroying effects, it can make the world filled with foul odors and unsuitable for cultivators to live in."

Li Fan nodded slowly.

He picked up the Green Bamboo Ring that had been soaked in the black light for a long time. It had already lost all its functions as a treasure. With just the power of his physical body, he gently squeezed it, and the Green Bamboo Ring shattered inch by inch, scattering all over the ground.

"As expected, it has a special effect against treasures."

"Now, the effect of Xuan Sushang's protective battle armor will also be greatly reduced. Mo Rubin is indeed thoughtful..."

Li Fan put away the Ink-Stained Evil Tome and secretly praised in his heart.

Time flew by, and the predicted time for Shuo Feng and Xuan Sushang to meet was getting closer.

Without Li Fan sending anyone to monitor, Mo Rubin had already sent over intelligence on the possible locations of the cave mansions.

There were five locations, two of which had been ruled out as possibilities.

Because preparations had already begun at the remaining three cave abodes.

The Xuan family had a noble status and was accustomed to a life of luxury. Whenever they went somewhere, although there was no need for special instructions, the subordinate cultivators had to arrange everything in advance to avoid displeasing the master.

Since the three cave abodes had not yet been finally decided, preparations were made for all of them.

In any case, for the Xuan family, the resources spent were just a drop in the bucket.

And as long-term members of the Immortal Alliance's upper echelons, they probably never imagined that someone would dare to attack the Xuan family.

The so-called confidentiality measures were only done symbolically, almost nonexistent.

"It's not their fault. Perhaps even Xuan Sushang herself scorns the so-called security."

Li Fan smiled, a flash of murderous intent in his eyes.

He summoned Tianyang, Lin Ling, and Daoist Hundred Flowers, and told them the target of this operation.

"You only need to cooperate with me."

Li Fan passed a set of formation to them and asked them to familiarize and practice it during the waiting period.

"With the four of us joining hands to cast this formation, it is enough to seal an entire area."

"No entry or exit. Complete isolation inside and outside, unable to communicate."

"The person locked by the formation will also suffer oppression equivalent to the total of our soul power, and their strength will be greatly reduced."

"This operation is not highly dangerous. It requires a quick battle and quick decision."

Li Fan said simply.

"This formation of the superior emmisary is indeed extraordinary. Even in the remnants of our various realms back then, it would be hard to find one comparable." After the initial practice ended and testing the formation's power, Daoist Hundred Flowers could not help but exclaim in admiration.

A trace of fear also flashed in Lin Ling's eyes.

Only Tianyang remained dazed and indifferent.

Li Fan just smiled in response.

How could they know that this seemingly overwhelmingly powerful formation was custom-made by the Final Dissociation Disc during these ten-plus days of waiting, based on intelligence about Xuan Sushang and Shuo Feng.

Everything was ready, and Li Fan also contacted Mo Rubin.

The divine demon clone he occupied also arrived outside Tianquan Prefecture to rendezvous with them.

As for the three Dao Integration beings following Li Fan, Mo Rubin only paused slightly on Daoist Hundred Flowers for a moment, then closed his eyes with an indifferent expression.

"If they meet in the Immortal Alliance's Heavenly City, it would really be a bit tricky."

"But because they disdain the cave abode in the city as too crude and are accustomed to living in natural cave mansions outside the city..."

"Heh, indulging in luxury and dissipation, they have already paved their own path to death."

Mo Rubin transmitted secretly, his tone unmasked with disdain and killing intent.

"The Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance is all like this."

"The Dharma-Transmitter you occupy is even more so."

Li Fan replied with a strange laugh.

"It seems it's time to give the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance a wake-up call." Mo Rubin snorted coldly.

In the final two days, based on the changes in the cultivators outside the three cave mansions, they finally locked onto the target.

In a sea of a thousand miles of bamboo.

Li Fan and the others lurked in the air, looking at the green below that stretched to the horizon, each with different expressions.

Daoist Hundred Flowers perhaps thought of her already destroyed homeland, a trace of gloom flashing in her eyes.

Lin Ling, on the other hand, looked around, trying to find if there were any spirit manifestations like herself in this bamboo sea.

Mo Rubin and Li Fan continued their cold mockery: "They really know how to enjoy."

"This place is perfect for their burial."

During the ambush waiting for Xuan Sushang's arrival, a small interlude occurred.

A voice of pious prayer suddenly appeared in Li Fan's mind.

Mo Rubin seemed to sense something and glanced at Li Fan, frowning slightly.

"It's fine." Li Fan made a knowing expression, signaling Mo Rubin to relax.

At the same time, he checked the scene in his mind.

It was Dao Xuanzi, whom he had not seen for a long time and who was now a member of the Federation of All Worlds in this world.

Previously, Li Fan had revealed the general location of the Canghai Pearl to them. After years of waiting and searching, they had finally found the Canghai Pearl.

Using the method of re-establishing the Dao, he rebuilt the foundation base with Earthly Wonder.

The intense wave of faith just now was Dao Xuanzi's heartfelt gratitude to the True Immortal of Salvation and Mortal Compassionate after successfully building his foundation.

Li Fan noticed that the golden vow power that appeared out of thin air in the Calamity Body had some subtle differences compared to what he had harvested before.

From the currently known information, the golden vow power, also known as the Myriad Spirits Nector, is the remnant of the traces of the Great Dao sought by the Faceless True Immortal.

As the saying goes, born with desires, pursuing the Dao unceasingly until death.

The golden vow power, absorbed by Li Fan's Calamity Body before was merely pure energy, without any belief of "pursuing the Dao" within it.

But the golden vow power generated from Dao Xuanzi's feedback at this moment actually made Li Fan sense an extremely subtle desire to seek the Dao.

Even after being filtered by the stone statue and having most of it intercepted, the remaining residue stood out like a bright moon in the sky among all the golden vow power. As a result, Li Fan clearly detected it the instant it was generated.

"Those who seek the Dao with utmost sincerity obtain immortality. As expected from the guy who fought his brother to the death for a cultivation technique and chased him all the way into the Immortal Forbidden Land."

"He appears so carefree on the surface, yet his heart's pursuit of the Dao is so resolute."

The desire to pursue the Dao in the golden vow power only existed for a moment before vanishing in an instant.

Li Fan felt as if he had lost some supreme treasure, and his heart suddenly felt empty.

"Having obtained the Canghai Pearl, Dao Xuanzi's future in this life is promising. And even though Kou Hong knows the information about the other Earthly Wonder, the [Hundred Thousand Great Mountains Cauldron], he is not in a hurry to go there. Instead, he patiently accompanies Dao Xuanzi until he successfully rebuilds his foundation. These two brothers do have some genuine affection."

"Perhaps I can take better care of them in the future..."

The small interlude ended, and Li Fan's attention returned to the bamboo sea in Tianquan Prefecture before him.

Silently, Lin Ling and the other two had already infiltrated the bamboo sea under the cover of Li Fan and Mo Rubin, setting up the ambush formation inside.

They only needed to wait for Xuan Sushang to take the bait.

With the great enemy approaching, among the group, only Lin Ling appeared somewhat tense. Tianyang was wooden, and Daoist Hundred Flowers was, after all, a longevity Immortal cultivator who had survived the ancient great calamity and was well-versed in the world. As for Li Fan and Mo Rubin, they already regarded this Scarlet Snow Immortal Sage as something in their pocket.

Time passed slowly, and not long after...

Two streaks of rainbow light arrived one after the other, breaking through the air and landing outside the bamboo sea.

The bamboo sea's protective formation activated, and two rows of eighteen female cultivators in red long skirts emerged in sequence to greet them.

But those two figures did not even glance at them, heading straight into the bamboo cave mansion.

"Hm? Lu Xichan? Why did she come along too?" Mo Rubin was somewhat surprised but not panicked.

However, he still looked at Li Fan, seeking his opinion: "Do we have a grasp on this?"

As he spoke, he transmitted the general information about Lu Xichan.

Lu Xichan was a disciple of the previous generation's chief formation master of the Formation Hall, Lu Xia.

Her life resume seemed ordinary and smooth sailing, succeeding her master.

But in the entire process of power inheritance, to achieve complete calm without any waves was enough to demonstrate Lu Xichan's extraordinary abilities. R𝙖𐌽ŐꞖЁⱾ

Li Fan narrowed his eyes slightly and nodded: "Nothing to fear. Capturing one Dao Integration is a grab, capturing two Dao Integration is also a grab; no difference."

"However, Lu Xichan is, after all, the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance's chief formation master. Using this capture formation derived from the [Lifeless Formation Crown] you provided, there might be a risk of it being broken. If reinforcements arrive then, it would be troublesome."

"I hope this [Lifeless Formation Crown] is reliable."

Li Fan suddenly changed his tone.

Of course, this was just to deceive Mo Rubin. The ambush formation set up in the bamboo sea at this moment was, in terms of complexity and layers, above the Tianxuan Spirit Locking and Xuantian Spirit Sealing Formations, leading by at least one generation.

Although Lu Xichan's formation dao level was top-tier in the Formation Hall, she absolutely had no chance of breaking the formation in a short time.

This could be seen from the fact that she had already entered the formation yet remained oblivious to the hidden dangers within, as if nothing was amiss.

The reason for saying this was merely to conceal the origin of this ambush grand formation.

Mo Rubin did not suspect anything and pondered for a moment before saying: "Even if she breaks the formation, it will take time. We just need to fight quickly and decisively, capturing her before she finds the formation's flaw."

As he spoke, in front of the cultivator that Mo Rujun possessed, a gray line-like mirror surface seemed to appear out of thin air.

Gloomy light flashed, and in just a moment, another cultivator identical in appearance appeared.

Then the mirror surface continued to emerge: two became four, four became eight, and only then did it stop.

From beginning to end, there was not the slightest fluctuation of aura.

Lin Ling and the other two, seeing this scene, were all dumbfounded.

And Li Fan sensed the eight people in front of him; each one was a living cultivator, and he could not distinguish any difference.

"When the battle starts, I will use these bodies to provide as much assistance as possible."

"But it cannot last long..."

Mo Rubin transmitted.

After Xuan Sushang and Lu Xichan entered the bamboo sea, they rested in one of the bamboo buildings within. To avoid alerting the enemy, Li Fan and the others did not spy. They only ensured that the two were inside, waiting for Shuo Feng's arrival.

And Shuo Feng considerately did not keep everyone waiting long.

As scarlet snowflakes slowly drifted down in the bamboo sea, Shuo Feng's figure gradually became clear from blurry.

He glanced at the nearby bamboo building, his face full of resentment.

But ultimately, he did not dare show it in front of his mother. He took a deep breath, and his expression returned to calm as water.

He slowly walked to the front of the bamboo building.

"Mother..." Shuo Feng slowly said.

"Hehehe, Feng'er is home. Come in quickly; your Aunt Lu is here too." Xuan Sushang's voice, carrying a hint of laughter, came from the bamboo building.

It did not sound like a mother's, but rather like that of a fifteen- or sixteen-year-old girl.

Shuo Feng pushed open the door of the bamboo building and entered.

The gazes of Xuan Sushang and Lu Xichan both focused on Shuo Feng in an instant.

At this moment...

A stern shout like thunder resounded through this bamboo sea.

"Brother Shuo, rest assured; your little brother will definitely help you persuade your honored mother and return your freedom!"

As soon as Li Fan said this, not only did Shuo Feng, Xuan Sushang, and the others pause slightly.

Even Mo Rubin, Lin Ling, and the rest were momentarily confused.

"Act!" Fortunately, Li Fan's transmission came quickly.

Lin Ling and the other two swiftly took their positions, and the grand formation laid by the four Dao Integration beings was instantly complete.

Mo Rubin also did not hold back; the eight identical bodies exploded with a boom.

From each body flew out a blurry black figure.

Then the shadows expanded, enveloping the entire bamboo sea in an instant.

"Hehe, Feng'er has some prospects now..." At first, after a brief daze, Xuan Sushang still maintained a faint smile.

She thought it was Shuo Feng gathering a group of fair-weather friends to rebel.

After all, he had done such things before.

But as the formation unfolded and the shadows blotted out the sky, Xuan Sushang's expression soon changed drastically. She realized that the might of this ambush was not something Shuo Feng could orchestrate.

"Feng'er, be careful!"

Xuan Sushang flashed to Shuo Feng's side, her expression grave.

Meanwhile, Lu Xichan immediately tried to contact the outside world, only to find she could not connect at all.

"You petty thieves, the Immortal Ancestor stands before you; why do you not kneel!"

A quadruple voice boomed like thunder in their ears.

In the dim sky, it seemed as if the Dharma-Transmitting Ancestor's dharma manifestation truly appeared.

Staring down imposingly without anger.

Boom!

A massive invisible pressure suddenly descended, turning the bamboo building to dust in an instant.

Xuan Sushang and the other two were momentarily locked in place by this pressure, unable to move!

Before they could struggle, they saw five blood moons suddenly appear in the shadowed sky.

"Extracting Threads!"

An emotionless, icy voice rang out from the canopy of heaven.

Myriad threads descended from the blood moons.

Like countless tentacles, they silently and swiftly approached, wrapping around them.

The threads seemed formless, but the moment they touched their bodies, a wave of weakness surged from the depths of their hearts.

"Xichan!" Crimson battle armor suddenly manifested around Xuan Sushang and Shuo Feng.

But it could not block these invisible threads.

Lu Xichan's situation was even worse; silver symbols representing formation kept appearing around her, only to dissipate without a trace moments later.

Cold sweat beaded on Lu Xichan's forehead; shock filled her eyes at first, then turned to undisguisable terror.

The battlefield was chaotic; perhaps those not versed in formation did not know what was happening to her.

But Lu Xichan knew full well: every time she set up an formation, an inexplicable force from the surroundings instantly shattered it!

The arrays did not even fully form before they were broken!

It was as if the enemy already knew exactly what formation she intended to deploy; the speed of the disruption was utterly inconceivable!

At first, Lu Xichan thought a traitor in the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance's Formation Hall had leaked all her mastered arrays.

But soon, as she pulled out her most secret formation, she faced the same outcome: sudden destruction!

Thus, the terror in Lu Xichan's heart spread uncontrollably.

She seemed to return to the first time she met her master.

The profound formation skills her master displayed left her in awe, entranced, obsessed; her once-proud talent seemed utterly worthless before him.

And now, the one breaking her formations displayed formation skills far surpassing even her master's!

That was a realm she could not even imagine!

"Who on earth is it?"

As the chief of the Ten Thousand Immortal Alliance's Formation Hall, her pride shattered; Lu Xichan felt countless faces of her master appear in the surrounding shadows.

"Xichan, you have disappointed your master too much!"

"From now on, do not tell others you are my disciple; I cannot afford the shame!"

"Lu Xichan, I die with eyes unclosed!"

...

"No, Master, it is not like that..." Caught in the illusion, Lu Xi Chan trembled.

She completely lost the will to resist for the moment.

The thick shadows around her fully enveloped her, and then she vanished into the bamboo sea.

Seeing this, Xuan Sushang's face paled in horror. But facing the dharma manifestation overhead and the assault of countless threads, she was already struggling to cope.

"Brother Xing Wang, I have temporarily sealed Lu Xichan. However, just now..." Mo Rubin's somewhat puzzled voice came through.

"Heh, it just happened to strike her mental weakness. Who would have thought the renowned chief of the Formation Hall would be such a coward terrified of her master..." Li Fan responded with a sinister cackle.

"I see." With the battle not yet over, Mo Rubin did not dwell on it.

"My remaining power is rapidly fading. I fear it will not suffice to seal Xuan Sushang and Shuo Feng..."

"No matter; they are already doomed."

As the two briefly communicated, their assault remained lethal.

Under the formation led by the three, even with battle armor protection, Xuan Sushang was like a leaf in the wind, in dire straits.

Crimson light guarded her mind, yet it was constantly oppressed by the gaze cast down from the Immortal Ancestor's dharma manifestation in the sky.

She had already reached her limit.

At this point, Xuan Sushang realized the shadow overhead was not truly the Immortal Ancestor's image.

It was merely the optimal manifestation derived to intimidate her mind at the first moment.

After all, helping the Tianxuan Mirror create a human clone violated the system established by the Immortal Ancestor.

To say Xuan Sushang felt no fear would be impossible.

Though not the true dharma manifestation, the pressure it brought her was undiminished.

And the surrounding shadows, filled with eerie laughter, only multiplied her illusions, making it hard for her to hold on.

The gray threads that had been wrapping around her since the battle began accumulated more and more.

Her thoughts and movements grew sluggish because of them.

"Just who is it?"

Before losing consciousness, countless unresolved questions flashed through Xuan Sushang's mind.

With the two Dao Integration cultivators subdued, the rest of the battle held no suspense.

Shuo Feng's incarnation, at Soul Transformation strength, could not intervene from the start.

Under the mental oppression of the four Dao Integration cultivators' combined formation, he had long since fainted.

After collecting all the other cultivators in the Bamboo Sea Cave mansion into Cave-Heaven for suppression, Li Fan gazed at the two unconscious Dao Integration female cultivators ahead.

Both possessed beauty that could topple empires; Lu Xichan exuded noble elegance, while Xuan Sushang seemed like a young woman, still retaining a trace of innocence.

"Brother Xingwang, my power is about to dissipate; I leave this place to you."

The boundless shadows enveloping the bamboo sea converged, finally forming a blurry figure.

He looked at Li Fan and slowly said: "If there is news of the Xuantian Treasure Mirror clone, contact me as soon as possible."

"The body I occupied has been thoroughly destroyed; next time we meet, remember to bring another one."

"Still in the last hidden Cave-heaven."

The voice faded along with the shadows.

"This battle went so smoothly; Mo Rubin's sky-obscuring shadow technique deserves great credit."

"Even if not enemies, I still felt an indistinct pressure. For a moment, I even glimpsed the forms of the Heavenly Doctor and the Immortal Ruins Immortal in the darkness..."

"The Xuantian Sect... is indeed extraordinary."

The thought flashed by; Li Fan's attention returned to Xuan Sushang and the other.

"Superior Emmisary, shall we withdraw now?" Daoist Hundred Flowers asked cautiously.

Li Fan pondered for a moment, then shook his head: "You three go to this bamboo sea and guard the entrance."

"I will interrogate them here for news of the Xuantian Mirror clone."

The three acknowledged and departed.

Li Fan then took out two [True Temptation Fruits].

"Only these two left; looks like it is time to ask the Five Elders Association for more."

Li Fan's eyes narrowed slightly as he slowly wove an intricate lie.

Once the Truth Temptation Fruits emitted bursts of brilliant light, Li Fan fed the two fruits to them.

The True Temptation Fruit transformed into strands of silvery-white light, pouring into the bodies of the two Dao Integration cultivators.

Originally, Li Fan had assumed it would go as smoothly as before when using the True Temptation Fruit, but to his surprise, just as the silver-white light was about to invade their seas of consciousness, it suddenly stalled.

It was as if it had encountered some kind of barrier—the power of the True Temptation Fruit was entirely blocked outside their divine souls.

The True Temptation Fruit dissipated in the air, yet it failed to alter the cognition of Xuan Sushang and Lu Xichan.

The silver light merely clung tightly around their divine souls.

"This is..."

Li Fan's expression shifted as he observed closely, realizing that it wasn't the power of the Heavenly Sovereign that had failed.

Rather, their divine souls were protected by a special layer of defense, resisting the influence that twisted cognition.

"As expected, the high-level members of the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance have a unique divine soul defense mechanism."

His first attempt at inducement having failed, Li Fan did not give up.

Nor did he intend to ask Mo Rubin about this divine soul defense mechanism.

"Xuan Sushang is tied to the secret of the Tianxuan Mirror's incarnation, so it seems I'll have to use you for the experiment." Li Fan's gaze turned to Lu Xichan, who lay in deep slumber.

For safety's sake, in addition to Mo Rubin's shadow seal, Li Fan set up multiple formations around the two women.

This ensured that even if something unexpected happened during the experiment and they awoke inexplicably, they wouldn't be able to contact the outside world or escape in a short time.

Then, he separated a strand of his divine sense, slowly extending it toward and approaching Lu Xichan's divine soul.

It had to be said that Lu Xichan's divine soul strength was somewhat unworthy of her title as the chief of the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance's Formation Hall.

In the Cloudwater Heavenly Palace, Li Fan had once treated Hanhai and come into close contact with the other's divine soul.

As fellow Dao Integration powerhouses, Lu Xichan was far weaker than the former palace lord of the Cloudwater Heavenly Palace.

Li Fan felt no threat at all, observing with calm composure.

Outside the divine soul, there seemed to be patterns engraved in dark golden lines.

They flickered in and out of visibility, like chains that bound the divine soul while also forming a layer of armor-like protection.

But during his observation, Li Fan keenly noticed that these dark golden patterns, beyond protection, likely had a self-destruct function.

"If the dark golden patterns' protection is forcibly breached, these chains now nearly fused with the divine soul—would shatter inch by inch in an instant..."

"The outcome would be only one: soul scattering and perishing!"

After figuring out the function of the dark golden patterns, Li Fan suddenly felt it was quite tricky.

Fortunately, after a moment of contemplation, he found a similar case in the Mending Heaven Record.

It told of two cultivators who brought their son to the Heavenly Doctor for treatment.

These two had formed a Dao companion pair since the Qi Refining stage. They supported each other, advancing together, and finally reached the Spirit Transformation realm side by side.

They were also blessed with a precious son—a case of double happiness.

But what caught the two cultivators off guard was that their son, even at over ten years old, still could not speak.

He appeared dazed and foolish, with weak reactions to the outside world. Only when his parents called him would he respond accordingly.

After an examination, the Heavenly Doctor informed them of the cause.

Their son's divine soul was actually undamaged or incomplete—in fact, it was far stronger than that of ordinary cultivators.

However, the massive divine soul did not match his frail body, leading to an overflow of divine soul power that formed a cage-like, twisted cocoon.

Over a long period of mutation, it eventually wrapped tightly around his original divine soul, making it difficult to connect with the outside world.

The solution was actually quite simple.

One only needed to prune away these "overgrown branches" of the divine soul.

But to truly resolve the issue was far from as easy as it sounded.

These overgrown branches were, in fact, part of the original divine soul.

To clear them without damaging the core divine soul or triggering a fierce backlash from the soul as a whole...

The Heavenly Doctor provided the optimal solution.

That was for a close kin's divine soul to touch and wash over these overgrown branches.

Using their own divine soul as scissors to prune them all away.

Throughout the process, the souls of the one being saved and the one performing the act would fuse together.

But precisely because they were close kin, there would be no resistance from beginning to end.

It would be akin to simply living together for a long span of years.

The only cost was that the performer's divine soul would suffer severe damage.

A drop of several realms was inevitable.

When the Heavenly Doctor explained the solution to the couple, their reactions clearly differed.

Interestingly, in the 'Mending Heaven Record,' it did not specify who was willing and who was reluctant.

After an extremely heated argument, the outcome was that the couple ultimately chose not to save their child.

And to spare him further suffering, they personally killed the child.

Afterward, this immortal couple gradually grew apart in appearance but distant in spirit.

Later, during a pursuit by enemies, they fled separately and both perished violently.

...

"This divine sense restriction seems extremely similar to the overgrown branches in this case."

"Coexisting with the divine soul, nearly one and the same. Extremely sensitive to external forces—if the main body is destroyed, it drags the core divine soul down with it."

"But precisely because it's interwoven with the divine soul, it's less guarded against divine soul power itself."

"So, the method to remove the divine soul restriction is similarly straightforward."

Li Fan already had a plan in mind.

Moments later, a continuous stream of divine soul power quietly poured into Lu Xichan's divine soul.

Facing the dark golden pattern's protection—like a majestic dam, it surged forward like raging tidal waves, crashing head-on.

Since this restriction was designed to handle fluctuations in divine soul power, such soul impacts were commonplace and did not trigger a counterattack.

But in the constant scouring process, Li Fan's output of divine soul power was quickly depleted.

Soon, however, Li Fan, operating the [Limitless Fullness and Emptiness Method], replenished his divine soul power and sent it forth again.

Even seaside rocks erode slowly under years of ocean waves.

The same applied to this dark golden pattern restriction.

With eyes closed, Li Fan steadily output his divine soul power. Before long, a section of the dark golden pattern began to fade and vanish.

The power of the True Temptation Fruit, which had lingered outside Lu Xichan's divine soul, now mingled with Li Fan's divine soul power and poured in through this breach in a vast torrent.

Colliding with Lu Xichan's divine soul!

If it had been just Li Fan's divine soul alone, the intrusion of a stranger would inevitably alert and provoke Lu Xichan, even in her slumber.

But at this moment, the True Temptation Fruit contained the elaborate lie Li Fan had woven.

That her master from back then had not truly fallen but faked death, escaping like a cicada shedding its shell, and transformed into Li Fan!

In Lu Xichan's memories of the first half of her life, there was almost only the figure of her master, Lu Xia.

The rest consisted of endless knowledge of array formations.

Therefore, when Li Fan, incarnated as Lu Xichan's master, collided his divine soul with Lu Xichan's own, it did not provoke much resistance.

On the contrary, Li Fan sensed emotions full of fear from Lu Xichan.

Countless scenes flashed in Lu Xichan's divine soul, true and false, false and true.

Lu Xia's face and Li Fan's face constantly shifted, with the speed increasing faster and faster.

In the end, only Li Fan's face remained, firmly engraved deep in Lu Xichan's divine soul.

As the silver light power of the True Temptation Fruit completely dissolved.

Lu Xichan's body also slowly returned to calm after a bout of intense convulsions.

Even with the characteristic of the [Limitless Fullness and Emptiness Method] to infinitely regenerate the divine soul, he was somewhat overwhelmed for the moment.

Fortunately, the matter had been handled successfully.

In the just-concluded fusion of divine souls, Li Fan had glimpsed many secrets in Lu Xichan's memories.

For example, Lu Xichan's master, Lu Xia, had actually never been entirely satisfied with Lu Xichan.

Until his death, he had held no hope for whether Lu Xichan could inherit his unparalleled array formation arts in the future.

When he accepted Lu Xichan as a disciple back then, including passing on to her the position of chief of the Strategy Formation Hall.

There were certain special factors involved.

Although Lu Xia never explicitly stated it until his death, Lu Xichan herself speculated that she might be her master Lu Xia's daughter.

However, she ultimately lacked the courage to verify this guess.

And with Lu Xia's corpse turning to ashes and smoke, whether this guess was true or not could no longer be verified.

Lu Xichan had many more secrets.

For instance, due to growing up under her master's high-pressure tutelage in her early years, her psyche had always been under immense stress.

In the process of finding ways to alleviate the pressure, she discovered a rather effective method.

And the reason she often came to Xuan Suchang was precisely because of this.

...

Thinking of this, Li Fan's expression showed a slight peculiar change: "So, Lu Xuejing's masochistic constitution was actually inherited from her mother."

"It truly is..."

Li Fan shook his head slightly.

And speaking of Lu Xichan's daughter, Lu Xuejing, she was also related to Xuan Suchang.

During one session of relieving pressure, Lu Xichan discovered that Xuan Suchang had somehow become pregnant.

While Lu Xichan was filled with shock, she naturally could not accept it.

Under coercion, Xuan Suchang had no choice but to confess the truth.

"The [Method of Living Beings] transmitted by the Tianxuan Mirror?"

Li Fan narrowed his eyes slightly and glanced at Xuan Suchang beside him.

Lu Xichan, entangled with Xuan Suchang, also used the [Method of Living Beings] to conceive and give birth to a daughter.

"It seems the human incarnation of the Tianxuan Mirror is indeed related to the Mirror Holder [Cang]."

Li Fan closed his eyes and slowly digested the large amount of information he had obtained at once.

At the same time, he recovered his depleted divine soul.

Once the recovery was nearly complete, Li Fan proceeded as before and invaded Xuan Suchang's divine soul.

Xuan Suchang was worthy of being a direct descendant of the Mirror Holder Cang; whether in terms of divine soul power or restrictive defenses, she was considerably stronger than Lu Xichan.

But unfortunately, it was only a quantitative change, without any qualitative difference.

Li Fan's persistent, steady grinding effort, combined with the infusion of Lu Xichan's divine soul aura and the assistance of the True Temptation Fruit.

Once the defenses were breached in an instant, her cognition became even easier to distort.

Thus, in addition to being Lu Xichan's master, Li Fan gained another identity.

Another incarnation of the Tianxuan Mirror.

As early as when the Immortal Ancestor re-established the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance, the Tianxuan Mirror had prepared ahead and created a human clone for itself.

However, unfortunately, the Immortal Ancestor harbored suspicions toward the Tianxuan Mirror and discovered this clone.

He suppressed the clone.

From then on, the Tianxuan Mirror lost contact with the clone.

In desperation, the Tianxuan Mirror had no choice but to restart the plan to create a clone.

In the end, it reached a cooperation with the Mirror Holder Cang.

But what they did not know was that Lu Xichan’s master, the former chief of the Strategy Formation Hall of the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance, Lu Xia, had coincidentally discovered the seal of the Immortal Ancestor earlier.

By a stroke of chance, he rescued the originally suppressed clone.

At that time, having been suppressed for too long, the Tianxuan Mirror clone was already on the verge of collapse, so Lu Xia took the initiative to use his own life to save it.

Although it survived, having been suppressed for too long and now in a new body, the clone had already lost the authority of the Tianxuan Mirror.

It was no different from a true human.

Originally intending to continue living on as the human Lu Xia from then on, he unexpectedly found that, being in the headquarters of the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance after all, and still having an inseparable connection with the Tianxuan Mirror, his characteristics as the Tianxuan Mirror were still detected by certain people.

To preserve his life, he had no choice but to fake his death and flee.

Originally thinking he could live freely and unrestrained like this, he never expected that a new Tianxuan Mirror clone would be born by a twist of fate.

What was more fatal was that immortal treasures have spirits; there can only be one in the world.

There would not be a second Tianxuan Mirror in the world, nor would there be two Tianxuan Mirror human clones at the same time.

Although it had arisen due to various erroneous coincidences, this mistake was now being corrected.

He sensed that he was continuously weakening.

It would probably not be long before he completely dissipated between heaven and earth.

And the only way to survive was to find and kill the second Tianxuan Mirror clone!

...

This was the colossal lie Li Fan had fabricated, drawing in both Dao Integration female cultivators as well as the Tianxuan Mirror clone.

Admittedly, upon careful thought, it had many loopholes.

But as long as he extracted information about the Tianxuan Mirror's human clone from Xuan Suchang's mouth afterward, even if everything was exposed, it would no longer matter.

"It's just a pity that all information about the Tianxuan Mirror seems to be encrypted as if by some force."

"The divine soul cannot browse it. Otherwise, there would be no need to go to the trouble of fabricating such a lie."

Li Fan pondered inwardly.

Not long after the cognitive transformation ended, Xuan Suchang and Lu Xichan slowly awoke.

The two women's reactions upon seeing Li Fan were also quite different.

Lu Xichan's body trembled; she subconsciously lowered her head and blurted out in a low voice: "Master..."

While Xuan Suchang's expression was complex, she remained silent.

Because when this former Chief Formation master and Tianxuan Mirror human clone came to the door, he had coincidentally caught her and Lu Xichan in the act.

Although Li Fan had said nothing at the time, the two women were utterly ashamed.

...

In the deathly silence, it was still Li Fan who spoke first: "I have already given you a chance."

"I am still the second clone; who exactly do you choose to help?"

With a flash of killing intent in his eyes, Li Fan said slowly: "If not for Xichan's sake, I would have long since searched your souls. Do you think those little tricks in your divine souls can stop me?"

Lu Xichan did not dare to retort; she did not even dare to breathe loudly.

While Xuan Suchang, after perceiving her own situation, had a changing expression and ultimately made a decision.

Xuan Sushang took a deep breath, looked directly at Li Fan, and said slowly: "I am willing to help Senior resolve the crisis, but..."

Li Fan waved his hand, interrupting her: "No matter. Just tell me about the information on the second clone, and I will handle it myself."

"Hmph, the dispute between us is not something you human juniors are qualified to intervene in."

She was, after all, a dignified Dao Integration Immortal Sage, yet Li Fan addressed her as a junior. But Xuan Sushang did not get angry. Compared to the ancient Tianxuan Mirror, she was indeed countless generations below. Such an address was entirely appropriate.

On the contrary, Li Fan only needed her to provide intelligence without actually requiring her to act, which also relieved Xuan Sushang.

After a moment of contemplation, she immediately transmitted the relevant information to Li Fan via divine sense.

A moment later.

"Father, please forgive me." Xuan Sushang said silently in her heart after doing all this.

Li Fan, who had learned the location of the Tianxuan Mirror's human clone, did not act hastily.

Lu Xichan sensed Li Fan's gaze and grew increasingly uneasy.

"Master..." Seeing that Li Fan had not spoken for a long time, she finally mustered her courage and tentatively asked.

"Xichan, you have truly disappointed me as your master." Li Fan's voice entered her ears, causing Lu Xichan's body to tremble slightly.

"I officially passed the position of Chief of the Strategy Formation Hall to you two hundred and eighty-six years ago. After all these years, your level in formations is still the same..."

"Master, I..." Lu Xichan felt a surge of grievance upon hearing this.

When she first took over as Chief of the Strategy Formation Hall, she only received support from a handful of elders. The majority chose to observe, and many even sought to replace her. It was a time of constant peril and caution. Fortunately, after years of maneuvering and balancing, she finally secured her position.

As the Chief of the Ten Thousand Immortals Alliance's Strategy Formation Hall, the duties were extremely demanding. Not only did she have to handle the miscellaneous reports and summaries from the halls in various provinces, but she also had to participate in the monthly meetings to discuss Alliance operations with other departments.

Over the past two hundred years, aside from the earlier incident where the defensive grand formation was leaked, the Strategy Formation Hall had no major mishaps and had even established many merits.

This was inseparable from her tireless efforts.
